COLOMBO (News 1st) – The State Labourers’ union has decided to refrain from participating in the functions of the Labour Tribunals as an act of protest.
President of the State Labourers’ Union Iresh Chinthaka stated that the strike has been in effect from midnight yesterday. (July 30)
The union has chosen to strike as two of their officers from the Nuwara Eliya and the Kalmunei Labour Commissions have been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption.
SSP Priyantha Chandrasiri stated that the two suspects had been arrested for accepting a bribe from a doctor from Nanu Oya. The bribe was a payment for the testimony of the two officers in a case being heard at the Labour Tribunal of Nuwara Eliya.
The arrested officers of the Nuwara Eliya Labour Commission and the Kalmunei Labour Commission had accepted bribes of Rs. 1000 and Rs. 8000 respectively.

heading: Ban on extra classes for A/L from midnight today
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – All seminars and extra classes in relation to the GCE A/L examination are to be prohibited from midnight, tonight. (July 31)
The Commissioner of Examinations, Sanath B Pujitha stated that strict legal action will be taken against all those who violate this ban.
The examination will start on the 6th of August and end on the 1st of September. This year 321,469 students are set to sit for the examinations across 2267 exam centers.

heading: Suspects of Welikada prison riot further remanded
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – IP Neyomal Rangajeewa and the Former Commissioner of Prisons Emil Ranjan Lamahewa have been further remanded until the 7th of next month.
The order was issued when the suspects were produced before Colombo additional magistrate Priyantha Liyanage.
The suspects, Neyomal Rangajeewa and Emil Ranjan Lamahewa have been remanded in connection to the deaths of 27 inmates of the Welikada Prison during the 2012 Welikada Prison riots.

heading: PCOI term extended to investigate SriLankan
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – The term of the Presidential Commission of Inquiry appointed to investigate irregularities at Sri Lankan Airlines, Mihin Lanka, and Sri Lankan Catering has been extended by 5 months.
The Secretary to the Commission Ariyadasa Cooray said that its’ term was due to end tomorrow (August 2).
A gazette notification has been issued extending its term up to the 31st of December 2018, on the orders of the President. Ariyadasa Cooray stated that the hearing of evidence at the commission is due to take place today.
President Maithripala Sirisena appointed the commission to investigate irregularities at Sri Lankan Airlines, Mihin Lanka and Sri Lankan Catering on the 14th of February this year.
Retired Supreme Court Judge – Anil Gunarathne has been appointed as the Chairman of the Commission, while the other members are, Court of Appeal Judge – E.A.G.R. Amarasekara, Retired Supreme Court Judge – Piyasena Ranasinghe, Retired Auditor General – M.D.A. Harrol and Director General of the Sri Lanka Accounting and Auditing Standards Monitoring Board – W.J.K. Geeganage.

heading: University protests receive outside funding
content:
Colombo (News1st) – Minister of Higher Education Wijeyadasa Rajapaksa claims that University Students are being funded by external parties to carry out political activities and create political crises.
Addressing a media briefing in Colomb Yesterday Minister Rajapaksa claimed that people do not think of education when they think about Sri Lanka’s university system, instead, they think of protests and demonstrations. The Minister claimed that most of the students’ organisations spent a majority of their time over the past 2 years on the road due to the issued that had about SAITM.
Rajapaksa stated that they will strictly implement the law with regards to ragging and explained that even tribes in Africa do not engage in harmful behaviour of this nature. He added that there are gangs that have formed in the Universities and that they operate safehouses for their activities.
The Minister of Higher Education noted that students are being funded by external parties and that the ministry would reveal everything as soon as they gather enough proof.  Min. Wijeyadasa claimed that there is no point in students setting up huts and engaging in fasts without informing the ministry of what they required, he believes that this shows that they want to create an issue and not actually resolve issues that they face.
The Inter University Students’ Federation (IUSF) also convened a media briefing yesterday to counter the views expressed by the Minister of Higher Education. Convenor of the IUSF Lahiru Weerasekara speaking at the occasion noted that everything that was expressed by the Minister of Higher Education was opinions and decisions reached with the vice-chancellors of the university who are puppets for the administration. The IUSF also challenged the Minister to reveal details of their alleged backers.

heading: Vehicle duty increased
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – The duty on vehicles with an engine capacity below 1000cc has been increased. The duty on non-hybrid vehicles with an engine capacity lower than 1000cc will be Rs 1.5 million.
The duty on a hybrid vehicle with an engine capacity lower than 1000cc will be Rs 1.25 million.
The increased duty will not be applicable for vehicles imported based on letters of credit(LC) established on or before August 1st 2018 and cleared from Sri Lanka Customs on or before the 31st January 2019.

heading: Excise tax on cigarettes increased by Rs. 3.80
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The Ministry of Finance has increased the excise tax imposed on cigarettes by Rs. 3.80 with effect from midnight yesterday (July 31).

heading: Commonweal Secretary-general to visit
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – Commonwealth Secretary-General Patricia Scotland Queens Counsel will arrive in the island for a 4-day official visit today (August 01).
A spokesperson for the Foreign Affairs Ministry stated that this would be her first visit to Sri Lanka since she had assumed Office of Secretary-General in April in the year 2016.
The Commonwealth Secretary-General will meet with Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, Minister of Foreign Affairs Tilak Marapana and other key ministers during the course of the day.
The main objective of the Secretary-General’s meetings would be to explore greater cooperation and collaboration in the implementation of the agreed outcomes at the 2018 Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting in London including promoting the Intra-Commonwealth trade.

heading: Rope of swing throttles child to death
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – An unfortunate incident of a child losing his life was reported in Mulangawil, Kilinochchi.
Gajendran Thuwaragan the eldest of four siblings had gone to play with his sister after returning home from school yesterday (July 31) when the rope of the swing he was playing on had wrapped around his neck result in death.
“My son went to play, when I went to see him his eyes had gone up, I took him to the hospital right away. He was playing after he came home from school” said the Gajendran’s mother.

heading: Thunderstorms predicted across the island
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – A spokesperson for the Meteorology Department stated that showers and possibly thunderstorms will occur in the Western, Central, Sabaragamuwa and North-western provinces and in the Galle and Matara districts.
He added light showers may occur in Anuradhapura and Vavuniya districts while showers or thunderstorms will be scattered across the Uva province, Batticaloa and Ampara districts after 2.00 p.m.
Strong winds up to 40-50 kmph can be expected in the Hambantota, Monaragala, Ampara Matale, Polonnaruwa, Anuradhapura, Puttalam and Mannar districts.
50 mm rainfall is predicted across the Central and Sabaragamuwa provinces, Kaluthara, Galle and Matara districts.

heading: Your Tuesday Morning Brief
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st)
1. A Chinese national; an employee of the China State Engineering Corporation has been arrested on the suspicion of attempting to bribe an official of the Mahaweli Authority’s Agunkuolapelessa Regional office with a sum of Rs. 20,000.
2. Rs. 10 billion loan has been granted by the Peoples Bank to the Executive President of CML Walkers Jehan Amaratunga. He also serves as a director of Peoples Bank which raises concerns of impropriety and conflicts of interest.
3. JVP Leader Anura Kumara Dissanayake accused Prime Minister Ranil Wickremasinghe of being directly involved in the bond scam, which resulted in the largest case of corruption in Sri Lanka’s history.
4. Thusitha Halloluwa, Chief of Staff to the Finance and Media Minister evades a complaint lodged by journalist Ushantha Warnakumara regarding the threats made by the former to the latter.
5. All support seminars and extra classes in relation to the G.C.E A/L examination will be restricted with effect from midnight today. (July 31)
INTERNATIONAL 
1. Jailed, former Pakistani Prime Minister Nawaz Shariff taken to hospital in Islamabad for a possible heart condition.
2. China making a move to loosen restrictions imposed on foreign investments enabled more foreign companies to perform trade and also as a mode of domestic upliftment took to reform the farming industry.
SPORTS 
1. Former Director of Conservation of the Department of Archaeology, Gamini Wijesuriya denies rumors of UNESCO recommendation to remove constructions at the Galle International Cricket Stadium.

heading: 3 arrested for possession of Kush
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – Three people have been arrested by the Police Special Task Force in Colombo for the possession of the drug Kush which is a strain of Cannabis Indica.
A spokesperson for the Police STF stated that the arrest had been made on a tip-off that was received at noon yesterday. (July 30)
Eight grams of Kush that was found in the possession of the suspects has been sent to the Police Narcotics Bureau for investigation purposes.
The spokesperson added that the suspects were arrested in Horton Place and Welikada. This drug is predominantly used by the upper echelon of society.

heading: Water cut at 9 am in Biyagama North
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – A water cut is scheduled for 9 am today (July 31) which will be in effect in Biyagama north and surrounding suburbs.
A spokesperson for the National Water Supply and Drainage Board said that the interruption will be in effect for 15 hours.
The water cut will be in effect to allow mandatory maintenance work on the distribution system which supplies water to the Biyagama Free Trade Zone.
The Grama Niladhari divisions of Siyambalapewatta, Alubowila, Delgoda, Akurumulla, Kanduboda, Ulahitiwala, Walgama, Yabaraluwa, Malwana, Dompe, Naamaluwa, Dekatana, Narampala and Galwalaboda will be affected due to the interruption in water supply.

heading: Bribery attempt goes wrong for Chinese national
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – A Chinese national has been arrested by Police on suspicion of attempting to bribe an official. The arrest was made based on a complaint lodged by an official of the Mahaweli Authority’s Angunakolapelessa Regional Office.
According to the Police Media Spokesperson’s office, the Chinese national an employee of the China State Construction Engineering Corporation had arrived at the Regional Office to extend the gunpowder license for the ‘B Section’ of the Galwala Project. The Police received a telephone call claiming the Chinese national had attempted to pay a bribe of Rs. 20,000 to the Mahaweli Office Manager to get the task done.
China State Construction Engineering Corporation supplies rocks for the Matara – Hambantota Expressway.
The Chinese national was produced in court after being questioned by Police. The Angunakolapelessa Magistrates Court ordered the suspect to be remanded until tomorrow (July 31) and to be produced before the Colombo Chief Magistrates Court.
The Chinese Connection
In the Chinese mainland, Lu Wei, the Former Deputy Head of Publicity Department of the Communist Party, was prosecuted today (July 30) on charges of bribery. According to foreign media reports, the 58-year-old took advantage of various posts to seek benefits for others and accepted a large number of bribes.
This scenario follows a recent execution of two former vice-mayors in eastern China, who were convicted of bribery. The Supreme People’s Court published a statement on its website, saying Xu Maiyong and Jiang Renjie had been sentenced to death and were executed in Beijing.
Xu was convicted of bribery, embezzlement and abuse of power during his time as vice-mayor of the wealthy resort city of Hangzhou, west of Shanghai. Jiang was sentenced to death by the Intermediate People’s Court of Nanjing city in April 2008.

heading: State bank prepares to dole out Rs 10bn loan
content:
Colombo (News1st) – The Deshaya newspaper reports that a Director of a State Bank who also holds positions at several affiliated financial institutions, has obtained a loan of 10 billion rupees from the State Bank for his private institutions.
According to the report the loan is said to be the largest loan ever granted since the inception of this State Bank 65 years ago. The report adds that the loan facility has been approved at multiple stages and had also received the approval of the bank’s board of directors and loans committee.
When the Deshaya newspaper had made inquiries from the Chairman of the State Bank, he had confirmed the report of the loan adding that the loan had gone through the proper channels. The state bank chairman was also questioned on whether there was no conflict of interests, given the connections between the director and the group of companies that had been granted the loan, however, he had said that he could not respond.
Inquiries made by News 1st revealed that the loan of 10 billion rupees had been made to CML Walkers, a construction contractor by the state-owned People’s Bank. Responding to inquiries made by News 1st, the Chairman of the Large Scale Loan Board at People’s Bank, Dr. Aminda Methsila noted that the Bank had already loaned about 50 billion rupees to this company as at 2014.
He noted that the company had repaid this loan. Dr. Methsila added that accordingly, loans could be issued to the company in question, with a credit limit of 50 billion rupees.
According to the 106/2017 Annual Report of CML Walkers, Jehan Amaratunge is the Executive Vice President of the Group. He is also a member of the Board of Directors of People’s Bank and has served in that position since 2010.
The Chairman of the Bank at the time of Amaratunge’s appointment was Gamini Senarath.
The company CML Walkers has been awarded contracts for the construction of many government projects including roads and bridges – among these is the contract for the construction of a section of stage 2 of the Central Expressway.
Is it fair for an individual who serves as a director of a state bank to obtain a 10 billion rupee loan from that bank to benefit his private businesses? Is it legal?
This state bank holds the money of the people of this country? Is it not their duty to properly manage this money and ensure that the people reap the benefits?
Was the proper procedure followed when approving the loan of 10 billion rupees from a state bank?
News 1st is keeping watch.
More information on this will be divulged in the near future.

heading: Halolluwa 'no show' for police investigation
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – Thusitha Halloluwa is a Chief of Staff at a Ministry, and also a director of a key Government office. Halloluwa was summoned to the Kadawatha Police today (July 30) in connection to allegedly threatening a journalist. However, he did not arrive at the police station for the investigation.
Journalist Ushantha Warnakumara had lodged a complaint at the Kadawatha Police, claiming that Thusitha Halloluwa threatened him when he raised questions regarding a multi-million rupee deal.
Speaking to the media, journalist Warnakumara said that though he arrived at police for the preliminary investigation at 2 pm, the “relevant person” (Halloluwa) did not arrive.
“This threat can be considered as a threat to the media. He used his personal mobile phone to threaten me. I have the relevant recordings and I have produced them for the legal actions.” said Journalist Ushantha Warnakumara.

heading: Anura slams both sides of the isle on Corruption
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – MP Anura Kumara Dissanayake, leader of the JVP stats that former President Mahinda Rajapaksa is yet to reject the claim that he recieved US$ 7.6 Million (Rs. 1.1 Billion) from a Chinese company.
“Last week all the details, about the number of cheques, how they were transferred to the banks and who transferred them were revealed in Parliament. It wouldn’t have mattered to us if a Chinese company gave this money to Mahinda of Medamulana. But instead, it was given to President Mahinda.”, he added.
The JVP leader also spoke about the companies in question.
“One constructed a port, another an airport, another built Norochcholai and the other built the South Container Terminal of the Colombo Port. So isn’t this a good reason enough for us to assume that these were constructed solely for the purpose of getting money? Or else what other interests does China have to pay money to a Sri Lankan President?” Anura Kumara questioned.
The Parliamentarian then set his sights on  Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, saying that no one can hide the fact that “Ranil Wickremesinghe is involved in the bond scam”.
He also recalled questioning the PM in parliament on the bond scam, few weeks after the incident. “He denied, saying nothing like that happened, which instantly proved that it did. So the man (Arjuna Mahendran) scooted off to Singapore. It was Ranil who protected him after the theft and it was Ranil who helped him flee the country as well. So does this not make him the person behind the theft? What other proof do you need? This kind of evidence is not detrimental to a case. There is something called circumstantial evidence based on which the court can make a decision. Which is why I say Ranil is directly involved in this deal..”
It is well known that the bond scam caused monumental losses to Sri Lanka. It is the largest incident of defrauding state funds in the political history of the country. Through parliament, civil society, the Committee on Public Enterprises and the report of the Presidential Commission of Inquiry, the manner in which this crime was carried out and the perpetrators, were exposed.
While this is the major topic of conversation on the political stage, on whose interference is the recovery of these funds and the punishment of the perpetrators being delayed continuously?
The people do not want to listen to stories anymore – they want the perpetrators to be punished.
The people are watching.

heading: Midnight train strike called off
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – The train strike that was scheduled to be launched at midnight (July 30) has been called off.
President of the Railway Station Masters Association Janaka Fernando stated that the strike was called off following discussions with Minister (Dr.) Sarath Amunugama.
The train strike was organized by the railway supervisors, controllers and drivers to protest against salary anomalies.

heading: Over 60 acres destroyed by Imbulpe wild fire
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – The fire that erupted on the Parawiyangala mountain in Imbulpe, Balangoda is continuing to spread according to the Divisional Secretary of Imbulpe.
He said that attempts to control the fire since last night (July 29) have been unsuccessful and that over 60 acres had already been destroyed by the fire.
The Divisional secretary said that six suspects have been arrested on charges of beginning the fire.
The Parawiyangala mountain in Imbulpe is known as “Adara Kanda” among the university students of Sri Lanka.

heading: Chilaw-Colombo bus strike continues
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – The strike action launched by private bus employees of buses plying along the Chilaw – Colombo route continued for a 4th day today. (July 30)
Our correspondent in the area noted that other bus operators have also joined this strike action. Both regular and AC buses operating on the Puttlam – Colombo route, as well as buses operating on the Anamaduwa – Colombo and Negombo – Chilawroute have joined the strike action.
The strike was launched on the 26th of this month after a driver on a Chilaw – Colombo bus was assaulted in Colombo. The driver was hospitalised due to the nature of his injuries.
The bus operators are engaged in a strike calling on the police to take action. However, the police noted that an investigation has been launched into the incident by a number of police stations including the Chilaw, and Madampe police stations.

heading: One dead following an altercation in Kiribathgoda
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – One person was stabbed to death during a musical show in Dingidiyawatta Kiribathgoda.
According to a spokesperson for the police, an altercation between two groups had resulted in the murder this morning. (July 30)
The Victim was a 22-year-old resident of Kadawatha.
The spokesperson added that one suspect has been arrested in connection to the incident.

heading: 2 heroin smugglers sentenced to death
content:
Colombo (News1st) : 2 suspects convicted of Heroin smuggling charges were sentenced to death today (July 30th) by the Colombo High Court.
The verdict was delivered by Colombo High Court Judge Gihan Kulatunge.
The two suspects were residents of Maligakanda. They were arrested by the Police Narcotics Bureau on the 23rd of January 2013 in Horton Place, Colombo with 60g of Heroin.

heading: Don't fly kites around airports - CAA
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – Its kite season in Sri Lanka and this has created some new issued for the Civil Aviation Authority (CAA) of Sri Lanka. The CAA issuing a media release has called on the general public to take precautions when flying Kites in and around airfields
The CAA warns that flying kites within 5km of an airfield is illegal and is a punishable offence.
The release added, the public must not send anything above 300 feet in the air as it may pose a safety hazard for oncoming aircraft as such objects can easily be ingested by aircraft engines or become entangled in aircraft propellers, resulting in engine failures.

heading: Ingiriya Police OIC interdicted
content:
Colombo (News1st) : The OIC of the Ingiriya police has been interdicted with immediate effect based on the instructions of the Inspector general of Police (IGP).
Police Media Spokesperson SP Ruwan Gunasekara noted that the order was issued in consultation with the National Police Commission.
The three police officers who were placed in remand custody on charges of illegally arresting 2 individuals have also been interdicted. The three police officers face charges of illegally arresting an army soldier and a disabled individual in Ingiriya.
Investigations into the incident are being spearheaded by the Superintendent of Police in charge of the Panadura police division.

heading: Protesters block Sooriyawewa Divisional Sec.
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – A group staged a demonstration obstructing the entrance to the Sooriyawewa divisional secretary in Hambanthota this morning. (July 30)
The protest was staged by area residents who had not received compensation for the lands that they had given up during the expansion of the “100-foot road” in Sooriyawewa, Hambantota. It has been 45 days since demonstrations began. The protestors demand that compensation be provided to them as soon as possible.
One demonstrator said: “We held constant demonstrations. And everytime we did, they came and made false promises. They only deceived us without giving us proper answers.”
The Assistant Superintendent of Police for Hambantota who arrived at the location notified the protesters to move from the road. The protestors were obstructing the Sooriyawewa – Embilipitiya road during the demonstration.
Police later took measures to disperse the protestors.

heading: STF recovers 35kg of Kerala Ganja
content:
Colombo (News1st) – Nine persons were arrested for the possession of Kerala Ganja, following islandwide raids conducted by the Police Special Task Force.
The suspects had been arrested from the Weyangoda, Puliyankulama, Wellawatte and Borelesgamuwa areas.
The STF had recovered a total of 35kg of Kerala Ganja through the raids. The 9 suspects are due to be produced before the court today.

heading: CEB and PUCSL Chairpersons summoned before COPE
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – The chairpersons of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) and the Public Utilities Commission (PUCSL) has been summoned before COPE for a discussion set to take place on the 7th of August.
President of COPE, MP Sunil Handunetti stated that they are being summoned to discuss steps followed in purchasing power from private power plants and in setting the price for each unit of electricity.

heading: Tourist-friendly threewheelers to be initiated
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – The first tourist friendly three-wheeler service is due to be initiated in the country today. (July 30)
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe will be launching the programme at 5.30 this evening at Galle Face Green. 150 individuals who successfully completed the training programme for tourist-friendly drivers will be presented with certificates at the event.
A document will be displayed on these three-wheelers making it easier for tourist to identify them and obtain their services.

heading: Railway strike from midnight today
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – The Railway station masters association says that they will be launching a strike action from midnight today (July 30).
Chairman of the Association Janaka Fernando said that strike was launched against the failure of Government to implement solutions to salary anomalies which had been approved by cabinet.
He added that Railway supervisors, controllers, and drivers will be joining their strike action.

heading: Public representatives weigh in on fate of Mattala
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – What steps will the government take in the future, regarding the Mattala International Airport?
Minister of Agriculture Mahinda Amaraweera had on an occasion stated that there is no proposal whatsoever to sell the Mattala airport. While Minister Amaraweera maintains that a decision has not been taken, leaders of the government he represents seem to have different ideas.
Both PM Ranil Wickremesinghe and subject minister Nimal Siripala de Silva had openly stated previously that they are in talks with India on the Mattala airport while Minister Eran Wickramaratne on the 19th of this month stated that the agreement for the Mattala airport would be a 40-year agreement.
India’s State Minister of Civil Aviation Services, recently said in the Lok Sabha that the Indian Aviation Authority had not taken a decision regarding investing in Mattala. Given this contradiction, is there any truth to the statements that have been made by members of our country’s government from time to time?
Chairman of the National Local Government Federation, Udeni Athukorala believes that this is a rouse by the present Government. Athukorala noted that Minister Nimal Siripala had already drawn up the plan to give Mattala over to India and had requested the Indian High Commission to issue a statement that they are not interested in it.
Former Minister Chandima Weerakody stated that Sri Lanka is creating an international crisis in the country by offering the Hambantota Port to China and offsetting it by providing the Mattala Airport to India. Weraakody accused the UNP of taking steps to sell off national assets to keep foreign loyalists happy.

heading: Ven. Rathana thero takes aim at Austin Fernando
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – MP Venerable Athuraliye Rathana Thera, expressed highly critical views during an event held at the Vihara Maha Devi Park in Colombo on Saturday (July 28).
A number of politicians and civil society activists had been invited to participate in the 30th-anniversary celebrations of the Sri Lanka Women’s Development Services Cooperative Society Limited or Women’s Co-Op.
Addressing those gathered the Thero stated that he earlier held a position which stated that he was a “Senior Advisor to the President”. He went onto note that since the current administration does not heed any of his advice he had relinquished this position.
Ven. Rathana thero also accused former Presidential Secretary Austin Fernando of being a thug adding that the country has to be saved from people of this nature.
However, in an interview with News 1st on the day he left the Mahinda Rajapaksa government in 2014, the venerable Thero had expressed these views.
“The way I see it, if talks are to be held with anyone in this government, then it can only be Basil Rajapaksa because he has a great deal of power in this country. I have worked with him in a very friendly manner. Getting close to him is like getting close to the President. So in the future, I will continue to grow the cordial relations between us”

heading: SLPP split over which Rajapaksa to support
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – Former Southern Provincial Councilor Ajith Prasanna published a post on his Facebook page today, (July 29) stating that he has withdrawn from the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna and will function as an independent politician.
Attorney – at- Law Ajith Prasanna stated that Basil Rajapaksa had arrived in Benthara on two occasions but had not invited him to attend the events. He noted that he was never consulted when the SLPP picked the Chairman and Deputy Chairman for the Benthara PS.
He noted that when he attempted to raise these issued with Basil Rajapaksa, he simply dismissed it. Prasanna noted that these were a few of the issued that he had to face within the SLPP due to Basil Rajapaksa.
The former Southern Provincial Councillor believes that he was treated this way because he had openly supported and worked for Gotabaya Rajapaksa’s presidential bid. He noted that there is a movement brewing from within the party to oppose a Gotabaya presidential bid adding that Basil Rajapaksa is also vying for the presidential nomination.
Ajith Prasanna notes that there is a clear division in the SLPP, one faction supports Gotabaya Rajapaksa while the other supports Chamal Rajapaksa and Basil Rajapaksa.

heading: Prime Minister explains Gamperaliya to the public
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – Addressing an event in Batticaloa on Sunday (July 29th), Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe emphasised the importance and significance of the government’s “Gamperaliya” project.
According to the PM, Gamperaliya is not one single massive development project, it is instead a collection to around 15,000 minor projects. He noted that the projects are being selected by a committee appointed by the Ministry of Finance.
Once a project has been identified the Secretary to the Ministry of National Policies and Economic Affairs, which is directly under the PM, informs the necessary District and Divisional secretaries to implement the project. PM Ranil Wickremesinghe explained at a team of Ministers, which includes the likes of Sagala Rathnayake, Eran Wickramaratne, J.C. Alawathuwala and Niroshan Perera, are then tasked with reviewing these projects and ensuring that the projects are being implemented in a timely manner.
The premier went onto note that several parliamentarians could also be used from time to time to monitor the progress of such projects.

heading: Mobile signals to be blocked at AL exam centers
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – A decision has been taken to block mobile phone signals surrounding G.C.E. advanced level examination centers.
Commissioner of Examinations Sanath.B.Pujitha said signals will be blocked at identified exam centers islandwide.
The Commissioner noted that the Telecommunication Regulatory Commission (TRCSL) and the Signal Corps of the Sri Lanka Army will be providing the technical assistance for this initiative.

heading: SriLankan Airlines gets a new A321 NEO aircraft
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – An Airbus A321 NEO aircraft has been added to the fleet of Sri Lankan Airlines.
A spokesperson for the Sri Lankan Airlines said the aircraft arrived in the country today and that the plane was ordered during the previous government.
The Airbus A321 NEO landed today from Hamburg and it is manufactured in Germany, Sri Lankan Airlines stated, that the Airbus A321 NEO is scheduled to be deployed for passenger services after 2 more days, mainly for short distance travel.
Currently considered to be one of the latest aircraft in the world the Airbus A321 NEO has a high rate of fuel and cost efficiency according to the spokesperson for the Sri Lankan Airlines. The Airbus A321 NEO aircraft is valued at 129 million US Dollars. Meanwhile, orders of four A 350 aircraft placed by the previous government were canceled by the current government.

heading: Peradeniya Uni. students refuse to budge
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – A group of 50 students continuing to remain at the premises of the Peradeniya University despite steps being taken by the University Administration to close down the University for two months.
The students have been informed to vacate the university premises on several occasions, however, despite repeated requests, the students continue to remain at the premises.
The president of the University’s engineering faculty student union vowed to continue to remain at the premises and carry forward their struggle which has entered its 34th day.
What is the objective of this struggle? It is to allow a group of engineering faculty students to sit for the upcoming exam, they had been disqualified from sitting for the exam as they failed to meet the 80% attendance required.
Vice Chancellor of the University of Peradeniya Professor Upul B Dissanayake said that since this is an academic issue, it would be beyond the traditional and legal framework for the vice-chancellor to intervene in it. He added that they are looking into steps that can be taken to remove the students who are remaining on the premises illegally.

heading: Special inquiry into sudden railway strike
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – Railway authorities state that an inquiry will be held regarding the conduct of certain railway employees who resort to trade union actions without any prior notice being given.
The general manager of the department S.M. Abeyawickrama said that trade unions will be questioned on the matter tomorrow (July 30). He added that it is regrettable that commuters are being inconvenienced over issues that could be resolved through dialogue.
Railway station masters, supervisors, controllers and drivers staged a two-hour island wide strike on the 26th of this month. A property located in Maradana led to an issue which resulted in the strike action which was launched without prior notice.
A tense situation erupted at the Fort railway station during the strike action.

heading: Tuition classes for AL exam to end on the 31st
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – Tuition classes, lectures, and seminars for the G.C.E. Advanced Level Examination cannot be conducted after midnight of the 31st this month.
Commissioner of Examinations Sanath.B.Pujitha said, that stern legal action will be taken against individuals who violate this order.
The G.C.E. Advanced Level Examination will begin on the 6th of August and end on the 1st of September. A total of 321,469 school and private applicants are facing this year’s examination.
Meanwhile, tuition classes and seminars pertaining to the grade 5 scholarship examination will be banned after midnight on the 1st of August. A total of 355,326 applicants are facing this years grade 5 scholarship examination which begins on the 5th of August.

heading: New start for Welikada prison intelligence unit
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – The Department of Prisons has decided to employ officers from two other prisons as officers of the Intelligence Unit at the Welikada Prison.
According to a senior official at the Department, this decision was made after the Intelligence Unit at the Welikada Prison was dissolved.
The new team for the Intelligence Unit comprises of officers from the Colombo Magazine Prison and the Colombo Remand Prison.

heading: Two suspects of ATM robbery interrogated
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – The police have identified the vehicle used by the suspects who robbed over 10 million rupees in Naragala Bulathsinghala. The money was to be deposited at ATMs by a private firm.
A security official who was part of the team transporting the money has been arrested on charges of aiding and abetting the robbery. It was revealed that the security officer was not in possession of his firearm that he should have been carrying at the time. The driver of the van that was transporting the money was also arrested.
According to the Police both suspects are being questioned under detention orders.
Three police teams have been deployed to arrest the suspects and the Police special task force has also been deployed to investigate the crime.

heading: 44% public sec. employees lack computer literacy
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – A new study has revealed that 44% of government and semi-government employees lack computer literacy.
Director General of the department of census and statistics Dr. A.J. Satharasinghe said that there are 1.1 million government and semi-government employees in the country.
He added that it was revealed that 62% of them are unable to use an email account.

heading: State Minister's driver enters wrong house
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – A person who attempted to enter the residence of Parliamentarian Arundika Fernando under the influence of alcohol has been arrested.
According to a spokesperson for the police, the arrested suspect aged 42 has been identified as the driver of State Minister V. Radhakrishnan.
Further investigations into the incident are underway.

heading: Tipper accident at Ampara claims two lives
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – An accident along the Ampara Kalmunai main road claimed the lives of two people and left one child injured.
According to a spokesperson of the police, a tipper transporting sand had collided head-on with a van. Two people who had sustained serious injuries died upon admission to the Ampara hospital.
The deceased, the driver of the van and his wife, have been identified as residents of  Haththissa Mahan-Boga.
The driver of the tipper has been arrested.

heading: More revelations of LTL power scam
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – Yesterday News 1st exposed a series of suspicious transactions carried out by the company that operates the Lakdhanavi Power Station in Kerawalapitiya.
More details have come to light regarding these matters. The verite research findings on which we based our reporting also reveals that there prevails an issue in ascertaining the true owner of the Lakdhanavi Limited because of the complications surrounding the other entities and factions that claim ownership.
At a time when no payment had been made to the CEB for the massive risk undertaken by the Government of Sri Lanka, 39.75 % of the dividends had been paid to Lakdhanavi Limited which only owns 4.8 % of the shares. When the numbers are compared it is clear that while the Government had placed a guarantee for a 22.7 Billion Rupee loan, other partners had conveniently made profits in billions.
When the agreement was being prepared to purchase electricity from Lakdhanavi Limited, the Ceylon Electricity Board had acted in a manner that raised serious doubts.
In the agreement, articles that directly provide a benefit to the company in question had been agreed upon without any hesitation, while the articles that bring a profit to the CEB have been disregarded in a manner that raises a red flag.
According to the report, Lakdhanavi Limited had only infused a capital of 02 % while owning only 05 % of shares but has still made massive profits. However, it had acted in an immoral manner disregarding the Government of Sri Lanka which took a massive risk and infused 98 % of the Capital.
Issues surrounding LTL Holdings and its subsidiaries have been directed to the attention of the responsible authorities on previous occasions. The matters exposed in the COPE Reports of the 08th Parliament are astounding as well.
According to COPE, though the CEB held 63 % of shares of LTL Holding, the CEB had limited control over the operations of the company. It was in 2016 that COPE warned that when LTL and its subsidiaries enjoy massive dividends, the percentage given to the CEB could drop drastically.
According to the Auditor General’s Deratment, the CEB should have recieved Rs. 7,184mn as dividends in 2016. However, the books in the CEB only record a figure of 6952 Million Rupees as dividends. Can this be expected from a Government that was elected to power to simply oppose corruption?
What would be the response of individuals like – Power and Energy Ministry Secretary Dr. Suren Batagoda and CEB Chairman B.Ganegala, who served as a head of LTL Holdings with, Aruna Kumarasinghe, U.D.Jaywardena, MJMN Marikkar, Ravindra Pitigalage and others?
The people are watching.

heading: 3 Police officers arrested in Ingiriya
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – Three Police Officers of the Ingiriya Police have been arrested for unlawfully arresting two individuals. According to a spokesperson for the Police, the arrested Police officers had unlawfully arrested an Army soldier and a disabled individual in Ingiriya last night. (July 28)
The two young men who were illegally arrested were released after area residents gathered at the police station and engaged in a protest demanding their release.
One of the victims was admitted to the Ingiriya hospital.
“They asked for my NIC, I said I hadn’t brought it but that my house was close by. They didn’t listen to any of that. Then they told me and my friend that they were taking us to the Ingiriya police. They asked us not to turn off anywhere or speed or they would shoot us. They brought us to the police station and took away the keys to the motorcycle. They beat me and my friend. They asked whether I was from the army, I said yes. They asked me to bring the leave sheet and I said it was in my purse. They hit me again. They threw us into a cell and said they would let us go if we told the truth. At that time the villagers came here. There was no entry against us, they did not record any statement from us”   stated the arrested soldier.
The wounded soldier was transferred to the Horana Hospital for further treatment. Police Media Spokesperson SP Ruwan Gunasekara confirmed that the three police officers had been under the influence of alcohol during the incident.
The suspects are a Sub-Inspector, Sergeant and Constable attached to the Ingiriya Police. The media spokesperson noted that the suspects have been interdicted and that the law will be strictly enforced against them.
Since the incident had occurred within the premises of the Ingiriya Police Station, the Officer in Charge is also being investigated.

heading: Gohagoda garbage mountain keeps growing
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – Minister of Megapolis and Western Development, Patali Champika Ranawaka, was questioned by journalists regarding the Gohagoda garbage mountain located bordering the Mahaweli river in Kandy.
The Minister replied that the Colombo Municipal Council is segregating the garbage in order to ensure the beauty of the city of Colombo. He also explained that there are two methods in which power could be generated from garbage and the same should take place in Kandy as well.
The Minister explained that he is not responsible for ensuring the proper disposal of garbage, even in Colombo.
However, four years ago on the 20th of April 2014, the Minister had a very controversial opinion on the garbage issue. Addressing the media the Minister had stated that the main issues are in Colombo, Kotte, Kolonnawa, Dehiwala, Mount-Lavinia and Moratuwa and that there are large garbage mountains in Moratuwa, Gohagoda and Gampola.
He had also stated that the waste is disposed into the Mahaweli river and that the same water is obtained for drinking purposes and that it should be controlled.
So who which authority permitted the dumping of garbage at the Gohagoda garbage mountain? If this results in the loss of life, who will take the responsibility for that?
Attempts taken by News1st to contact the Chairman of the Haris-Pattuwa Pradeshiya Sabha for a comment on the matter proved futile.

heading: Minister Thevarapperuma Stranded in Yala
content:
Recently the vehicle of Deputy Minister of Wildlife Palitha Thevarapperuma had to be recalled to Colombo while the Deputy Minister was engaged in a visit to the Yala National Park.
Deputy Minister Palitha Thewarapperuma stated that he was stranded in the Yala National Park as the Ministry had recalled the vehicle back. Adding to this he noted that the Ministry has a duty to notify or ask him whether the vehicle can be taken back. An order had been given to return the key before 4:00 PM and the secretary had been reprimanded according to Deputy Minister Thevarapperuma. He was ambiguous as to whether the vehicle was recalled on the request of Minister Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka.
Minister for Sustainable Development, Wildlife and Regional Development Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka, commented on the incident today stating that there are two security details assigned for his protection; 14 from the police and 04 from the STF. He stated that the STF does not travel in the police vehicle and therefore the Ministry has two vehicles. Elaborating he went on to state that when the Police vehicle is not functioning they use the Defender SUV and that the Deputy Minister had requested for it on two occasions, which he had refused.
Minister Sarath Fonseka noted that the Police had informed of the malfunctioning of the brakes in the vehicle and he did not approve of it to be used. However, the Minister stated that when he was informed that the Defender SUV had been taken out, he had requested the Ministry Secretary to inform the vehicle to be returned to the Police.

heading: Government is misleading the people - Namal
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – The Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna Bala Mandala for the Katana Electorate was established today under the auspices of UPFA MPs Prasanna Ranatunga and Namal Rajapaksa.
Addressing the occasion, UPFA member of parliament Namal Rajapaksa stated that the people who looted the Central Bank are taxing the people to cover their losses.
Namal went on to say that Ranil Wickremesinghe spoke highly in Parliament of providing laptops to students, but at present, neither the tech laboratories made by Mahinda or the laptops promised by him have been given.
“They started off with the Hambantota Port. I witnessed recently them saying the Sooriyawewa Grounds will be sold off. In Parliament, Nimal Siripala says there are investors for Mattala. India denies. It seems the government of good governance is deciding for India as well. The people are being misled by them” continued UPFA parliamentarian.

heading: MR's absence in Embilitpiya causes ruckus
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – The absence of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa cause a quite a ruckus in Embilipitiya on Saturday (July 28th).
The unveiling of the Buddha Statue at the Heendalukhinna Wanawasala Naga Viharaya in Embilipitiya was to take place today under the auspices of Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa. However, moments before the event commenced, the Chief Incumbent announced to the crowd that Former President Rajapaksa had taken ill and will not be attending, but Chamal Rajapaksa would be attending the event.
At that moment the organizers of the event and several others had voiced their objection. Two youth had climbed to the top of a tree as a mark of protest.
When Chamal Rajapaksa had arrived at the location of the event he had tried to convince the people of the village that the former president had found it unable to be present because he had just returned from Singapore after medication and that he is currently in Tangalle. However, the villagers continued to protest.
In order to control the situation, Chamal Rajapaksa had contacted Mahinda Rajapaksa over the phone and provided an opportunity to one of the youth to speak with the Former President. The unveiling of the Buddha Statue never took place and Chamal Rajapaksa also left the premises shortly afterward.

heading: Good Governance should Advertise More!
content:
Colombo (News 1st) – Addressing an event to declare open a new building constructed for Trainee Nurses at the Kamburugamuwa Hospital, Minister of Health, Dr. Rajitha Senaratne commented on the Government of Good Governance.
He stated that if the previous government constructed anything or did something with a positive impact, the outcome was having nothing but cut-outs in the whole area. He noted that if the Rajapaksa Government did what he did, cut-outs would be raised from Kankasanthurai to Dondra Head, carrying a large image of Mahinda Rajapakse and a small image of him.
Minister Rajitha Senaratne stated that the Government of Governance does not spend on promotions and that it is a weakness. He added to this stating that recently he suggested to the Prime Minister that spending more money on advertisements would help them win the next election.

heading: Gov. has not approved development within reserves
content:
Colombo (News 1st) – Kabir Hashim, the Minister of Highways & Road Development commented on the issues surrounding the Knuckles Mountain Range after an event in Kegalle today (28 July).
He stated that he is not aware of any cabinet paper regarding the Knuckles Mountain Range being produced before the parliament. He stated that a cabinet paper was produced to restructure the loss-making state plantations to proceed as Public-Private Partnerships which was for local investors to commence projects, but noted that it never sought approval for projects in the Knuckles reserve. The Minister noted that they would never provide approvals for such projects as well.
In order to state with certainty that approvals have not been granted to local or foreign investors to engage in development activities in the forest reserve, one must have a thorough understanding of the boundaries of the said reserve. Therefore News1st spoke to officials of the Forest Department.
A letter was addressed to the Department on the 22nd of June, were received a response on the 24th of July. In its response, the Department stated that the respective units have failed to provide the required information and sought more time to respond to our queries.
The logic of the Minister confirming that the area within the forest reserve will not be given for investors is questionable when the Forest Department itself does not know the boundaries under them!

heading: Water cut for Colombo from 9pm
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – A spokesperson for the National Water Supply and Drainage Board says that the water supply to several areas in Colombo will be interrupted for 9 hours from 9 PM tonight to 6 AM tomorrow. (July 29)
The water cut is due to an urgent repair on the main pipeline supplying water from the Ambatale Water Treatment Plant to Dehiwala.
Accordingly, the water supply will be interrupted in the areas of Wellawatte, Dehiwala, Mount Lavinia, Ratmalana, Kalubowila, Nedimala and Nugegoda.
The Water Board noted, in addition to these areas, water will be supplied at low-pressure to areas in Colombo 5, Royal Park, Lake Garden, Bandaranayakapura, Rajagiriya, and Mulleriyawa.

heading: 2 dead following train accident in Jaffna
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – Two youths died after being run over by a train at a level crossing in the Colombuthurai area in Nedumkulam, Jaffna.
Police said the incident occurred earlier this afternoon when the motorcycle, which the two youths were on, had attempted to cross the level crossing despite signals indicating an oncoming train.
Police added the train was an express train plying from Colombo to Kankasanthurai. The bodies of the victims are currently placed at the Jaffna Teaching Hospital.
The victims have been identified as residents of the Ariyalai, Jaffna.

heading: Hotlines introduced to locate missing 10 year old
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – The search for the 10-year old that went missing in the Balangoda area continues. Police have now introduced hotlines so that the general public can share information they have on the missing child.
A spokesperson for the Police Media Division stated that information could be provided by calling the OIC of Balangoda Police on 071 859 1388 and via the hotlines 045 22 87 222 and 045 22 87 422.
Operations in search of the missing child entered it’s 9th day today. Five special police teams have been assigned to carry out search operations to locate the child, based on instructions issued by Senior DIG in-charge of the Province.
Sahan Kumara Dharmasiri, a resident of Samanalawatta, Balangoda has been missing since last Friday.

heading: CIABOC can't file legal cases on PCOI evidence
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – Director General of the Commission to investigate allegations of bribery or corruption, President’s Counsel – Sarath Jayamanne says that the Bribery Commission is not capable of taking legal actions, based on reports of the Presidential Commissions.
He further stated that the bribery commission does not have the power to file cases based solely on the evidence recorded at the Presidential Commissions and that in order to take legal actions the Bribery Commission will have to summon the people who had already provided evidence at the Presidential Commission and record evidence from them, once again.
Jayamanne noted that amendments are being made to the current regulations and if Parliament approves it, the bribery commission would be able to take action based on evidence recorded at Presidential Commissions.
President’s Counsel, Sarath Jayamanne made this statement addressing the Global Expert Group Meeting on the Jakarta Principles held in Colombo.

heading: Iranian national arrested with false passport
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – An Iranian national who attempted to enter Sri lanka with a false brazilian passport was arrested this morning. (July 28)
A spokesperson for the police stated that the 31-year-old had also attemptd to travel to the United Kingdom using the same passport
The Department of criminal investigation – Katunayake Unit has launched further investigations into the matter.

heading: Gas leak erupts fire at chemical lab
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – A fire erupted this morning (July 28)  at a Chemical Laboratory located at a construction site of the Wattala – Kerawalapitiya expressway.
The Fire Service Department at the Colombo Municipal Council said, three fire engines were dispatched, adding that the fire has now been contained.
According to the Colombo Municipal Council, the fire had erupted at around 9:30 this morning as a result of a gas leak.

heading: Rumble in the rail-yard over Trace expert city
content:
Colombo (News 1st) – Railway employees staged a protest yesterday after their attempts to take over the ownership of a plot of land located in Maradana, upon which the Trace Expert city has been built, failed.
The plot of land in question which was owned by the railway department was taken under the preview of the Urban Development authority (UDA) in the year 2011. It was later leased out in 2015 for the construction of what is considered the largest technological city in the country Trace Expert City.
Trace Expert City was built on 7 acres of the 10-acre plot of land owned by the Urban Development Authority. The debate, however, is on the car park of Trace Expert City.
The detailed designing of the railway project funded by the Asian Development Bank, to be initiated in Colombo and its suburbs is currently underway. A request was made for this particular plot of land to be used as the site for the construction of the Colombo Railway control Centre and the Chief operations center.
A group of employees of the Railway department had attempted to separate the plot of land using a fence last evening.
Dr. Jagath Munasinghe, Chairman of the Urban Development Authority(UDA) stated that they proposed a better-suited location to construct the Railway control Centre rather than the plot of land used for the car park of Trace Expert city. However, during this negotiation, the employees had started opposing the deal and launched a Trade Union Action in order to gain ownership of the land.
However, when inquired, a senior official of the Railway project being implemented in Colombo and its suburbs said that cabinet approval has been granted for the construction of Colombo Railway control Centre and the Chief operations center. He added that the construction of the fence yesterday was done after all relevant stakeholders were informed.
According to the State Minister of National Policies and Economic affairs, Dr. Harsha De Silva none of the stakeholders had been informed of the decision. He noted that the Prime Minister and Minister Nimal Siripala weren’t aware that the plot of land in the plan was in the middle of the IT park. He went on to state that there should be a separate discussion on this as there is ambiguity on the awareness of the cabinet.
Dr. Harsha further states that, as the feasibility study is not due for some time and the loan is to be passed in 2019, the discussion should not be rushed and that they reasonably request for this to be done after discussions with minister Nimal Siripala and all other interested parties and after they are properly informed.

heading: Search to find drowned boys at Kalu Ganga
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – Officers of the Police Marine Division has been deployed to search for two boys that were reported missing while bathing in the Kalu Ganga in Wagawaththa, Horana.
The two boys aged 26 and 28 years that had drowned yesterday morning (July 28) when bathing were identified as residents of the Passara and Udupusallawa areas.

heading: Students remain at Pera Uni forcibly
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – A senior officer attached to the administration of the University of Peradeniya said a group of 50 students continue to forcibly remain in the university premises despite the fact the university was closed for two months.
He said the students were informed on several occasions to vacate the premises and their parents have also been informed of the present situation.
It is reported that legal action will be instituted against all the students who continue to remain in the university premises disregarding the orders given by the administration.

heading: The electricity mafia strikes again!
content:
Colombo (News1st) :  A study done by Verite Research has exposed that the Government of Sri Lanka had taken a massive risk and made investments using public funds in the electricity sector, with no benefit. This transaction dates back to 2006. A firm by the name West Coast (Pvt) Ltd had been formed for the construction of the 300 MW Kerawalapitiya Combined Cycle Power Plant. Initially, it had been decided that the main shareholder of this company should be Lakdhanavi Ltd.
A majority share of Lakdhanavi Ltd is owned by Lanka Transformers Limited (LTL is a company in which the Ceylon Electricity Board holds a majority share). However, it is the government that had given a guarantee to secure a 22.7 Billion Rupee loan facility from HSBC for this project.
The government had also intervened to secure more funding for the project – 2.9 Billion Rupees from the National Savings Bank and another 2.9 Billion Rupees from the Employees Provident Fund.
According to the Foreign Loans Act of Sri Lanka, if a guarantee is given by the Government of Sri Lanka relating to a foreign loan for a project, the state should have 50 percent stake in the project. The study has revealed, that the 50 percent share of West Coast (Pvt) Ltd had been temporarily vested with the government on 14 separate occasions to fulfill the aforementioned criteria.
As of March 2011, the Government owned the 50 percent shares of West Coast (Pvt) Ltd, while 18.2 percent was owned by Lanka Electricity Company Private Limited which is owned by the CEB, another 27.1 percent was owned by the EPF and the other 4.8 percent was owned by Lakdhanavi Ltd.
A startling factor in this expose, is that for the guarantee, no dividends were paid to the Government of Sri Lanka.However, dividends had been paid to Lakdhanavi Ltd, LECO, and the EPF.
The method of payment is an astounding factor in this misappropriation of funds;
Accordingly, Lakdhanavi Ltd which owns only 4.8 percent of shares had been paid a dividend of 39.75 percent. The EPF which owns 27.1 percent of shares was paid a dividend of 20.04 percent. LECO which owned 18.2 percent of shares was paid a dividend of 20.4 percent.
Adding to this, an agreement had been reached for the 50 percent shares owned by the Government to be vested with Lakdhanavi Ltd once the entire loan amount is paid off.
The research study also revealed that the Ceylon Electricity Board does not own 48.5 percent of shares in West Coast (Pvt.) Ltd.
Left Centre Convenor Chameera Perera states with regards to the energy sector revelations, this scam is far greater than the Central Bank Treasury Bond Scam and that a Presidential Commission should conduct independent inquiries regarding these massive scams.

heading: Over 279,000 people affected by dry weather
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – The Disaster Management Centre says, nine districts have been affected due to the prevailing dry weather conditions.
Assistant Director at the Centre, Pradeep Kodippili said more than 279,000 people have been affected as a result. Kodippili further noted that the necessary steps have been taken to distribute water, to areas where there is a lack of drinking water.

heading: The ticking time bomb in Gohagoda
content:
Colombo (News1st) : Environmentalists warn that the Gohagoda garbage dump could become the site of another tragedy, far worse than the one which occurred in Meetotamulla. News1st reported on the Gohagoda garbage dump on a number of occasions in the aftermath of the Meetotamulla tragedy. However, the dump site increases with each passing day.
The garbage dump which is located just 50 meters away from the Mahaweli river, which is a drinking water source for many, has given rise to many environmental issues. The garbage dump has been in operation for 30 years and is now over 200m in height. Solid waste from gullies and toilets are also dumped at this garbage site.
Water sources around the area have started to dry up due to the effects of the garbage dump. Earlier 21 families were removed from the area due to a possible threat of a section of the mountain collapsing.
A compost producing unit was set up adjacent to the garbage mountain with the aim of minimize the amount of garbage however, the unit is not functioning at present.
Convenor of the Central Province Environmental Collective, Amith Senanayake speaking to News1st stated that the Kandy Municipal Council continues to dump garbage at the site in clear violation of laws which state that dumping garbage this close to the Mahaweli river is prohibited. He warned that if the practice continues, the area will suffer a tragedy worse that suffered by Mettoamulla.
Mayor of Kandy Kesara Senanayake speaking to News1st stated that the Kandy MC will need the support of the central Government to resolve an issue of this magnitude. He, however, assured us that they are taking steps to avoid a tragedy.
Senior Professor Athula Senaratne of the Peradeniya University’s Geology department noted that they observed Methane gas emissions from the dump site recently and investigated the risks of landslides. The professor noted that both he and the University are saddened by the response of the relevant authorities to their findings.

heading: Vehicle used by ATM robbers identified
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – The police have identified the vehicle used by the suspects who robbed over 10 million rupees in Naragala Bulathsinghala.
Over 10 million rupees taken to be deposited at ATMs by a private firm was robbed yesterday (July 28)
Police media spokesperson SP Ruwan Gunasekara said the suspects had attacked the people carrying the money with chillie powder and had made away with the money. According to police five suspects were involved in the robbery.
A security official who was part of the team transporting the money has been arrested on charges of aiding and abetting the robbery. It was revealed that the security officer was not in possession of his firearm that he should have been carrying at the time.
Three police teams have been deployed to arrest the suspects and the Police special task force has also been deployed to investigate the crime.

heading: 3 Police officers arrested at Ingiriya
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – Three Police Officers of the Ingiriya Police have been arrested for unlawfully arresting two individuals. According to a spokesperson for the Police, the arrested Police officers had unlawfully arrested an Army soldier and a disabled individual in Ingiriya last night. (July 28)
A high ranking police officer in charge of the area noted that the Sub Inspector of Police who was present at the time of the arrest had been under the influence of alcohol.
The others that were arrested were a Sergeant and a Constable attached to the Ingiriya Police. Further investigations have been launched by the Horana Police into the matter.

heading: South Africa wins 1st ODI by 5 wickets
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – South Africa won the 1st ODI against Sri Lanka a short while ago beating the hosts by 5 wickets. The game was worked off at the Rangiri Dambulla international cricket stadium.
Sri Lanka who won the toss and elected to bat first were all out for 193 runs in 34.3 overs.
Kagiso Rabada and Tabraiz Shamzi got 4 wickets each. In reply, South Africa scored 196/5 in 31 overs.

heading: Search for missing child enters 8th day
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – The search for the 10-year-old boy that was reported missing from the Samanalawatte area in Balangoda continued for an 8th consecutive day today based on information provided by the Police Intelligence Unit.
5 police teams have been deployed to find the missing child based on the instructions of the Senior DIG in charge of the area, however, the police is yet to uncover any leads about the whereabouts of the missing child.
10-year-old Sahan Kumara Dharmasiri has been missing since last Friday (July 20).

heading: Taisei Corp. indicted by Japan for bid-rigging
content:
Colombo (News1st): Two Japanese”super general contractors” admitted in court to bid-rigging for contracts in a $81 billion project to build a super-fast maglev train line that will connect Tokyo and central Japan. Japanese Authorities have indicted four Corporations including Taisei Corporation.
Taisei corporation incidentally in involved in the present administration’s Central Expressway project, Phase 3.
The four contractors in question had colluded to maximize their profits after learning that operator Central Japan Railway Co. was aiming to drastically reduce construction costs. The four companies had been gathering information about sections of the maglev line work since 2008 when the government instructed JR Tokai to flesh out details of the massive project.
The four constructors tried to divvy up the contracts for Shinagawa and Nagoya stations so that they all had an equal share. After the February 2015 agreement to collude on bid-rigging, Taisei and Kajima intentionally proposed higher bids than Obayashi and Shimizu with the aim of letting those two companies win construction contracts for the Shinagawa Station portion of the project.
Earlier, Taisei corp was charged with bid rigging by the Japan fair trade commission and allegations were also leveled against Taisei for a sinkhole that appeared in the Fukuoka city.

heading: Negombo Prison drug ring busted
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – Details have emerged of a large-scale drug ring that operated close to the Negombo prison.
According to the Police, inmates at the prison had operated the drug ring through mobile phones. The Police were able to uncover 52 grams of Heroin based on information gleaned from the telephone conversations of inmates. 2 suspects have been arrested in connection to the drug ring.
A senior officer of the Police Narcotics Bureau stated that similar drug operations are been carried out centering several prisons across the island. He further noted that special investigations have been launched to suppress these drug rings and to arrest persons connected to them.

heading: UNP does not need a common candidate
content:
Colombo (News1st) : UNP Galle district Parliamentarian Wijeyapala Hettiarachchi says that members of the UNP are disgusted by the term “common candidate”
Addressing a media briefing in Galle today, Hettiarachchi noted that the UNP must field their own candidate for the upcoming presidential election adding that the party would have no objections if that candidate decides to work with other parties and become a common candidate.
The MP noted that he had doubts about how the UNP voter base would react if the UNP opts to field a common candidate from outside the party. He went on to note that either Ranil Wickremesinghe or Sajith Premadasa should contest the upcoming Presidential election as their names have been etched into the hearts of all UNPers.

heading: Over 48,000 arrested for possession of drugs
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – 48,129 people have been arrested so far this in connection to the possession of drugs. A high ranking officer at the Police Narcotics Bureau said, 22 foreign nationals are also among the arrested suspects.
The foreign nationals are from countries such as India, Pakistan, Nepal, Maldives, Bolivia, and Germany. 19,441 people have been arrested for the possession of Heroin and a total of 173 kilograms and 319 grams of Heroin has been seized.
A spokesperson for the Police Narcotics Bureau stated that 28,688 people have been arrested with Cannabis and a total of more than 2,975 kilograms of Cannabis has been taken into custody.

heading: Chilaw-Colombo bus employees launch strike
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – Private bus employees operating on the Chilaw – Colombo route launched a strike action opposing an assault carried out on a bus driver.
Chairman of Chillaw Passenger Transport Services Pvt. Ltd Chaminda Hansa said several long-distance bus employees had assaulted the driver in Colombo at around 11 pm yesterday (July 26). The driver has been admitted to the Chilaw base hospital.
Chaminda Hansa adds that conflicts between long distance and short distance bus employees have existed for a long period of time adding that the National Transportation Commision has not yet introduced proper regulations to resolve their concerns.
Chairman of the National Transportation Commision, M.A.P. Hemachandra noted that he was unaware of such an assault but noted that special bus stops have been introduced for long distance buses adding that the system is working smoothly.

heading: Peradeniya University closed down for two months
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – The administration of the Peradeniya University has decided to close down the University for a period of two months, with immediate effect. Students have been instructed to vacate the hostel and the university premises before 6pm. (July 27).
A spokesperson for the University administration stated that the decision was reached taking into consideration the security of students following an unruly situation that had arisen at the Engineering faculty.
Engineering students at the Peradeniya University have been staging a protest for the past 32 days and had also forcefully stormed the administrative building of the University. They demand that four students who have failed to fulfil the required percentage of attendance be allowed to sit for the examination.
The engineering students also engaged in a protest march yesterday, from Galaha Junction to Kandy.

heading: Kidney medicine to arrive next week
content:
(COLOMBO News 1st) – Earlier this week, News 1st on multiple occasions had reported that kidney patients around the county are facing issues due to the lack of three types of medicine used in the dialysis process.
As a solution to the prevalent shortage,  issuing a statement a spokesperson for the Health Ministry stated that necessary measures are been taken to provide kidney patients with the necessary drugs within the course of next week.

heading: WATCH LIVE : Lunar eclipse tonight
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – A lunar eclipse, the longest of the 21st Century, is set to occur tonight as the moon moves into the shadow of the earth.
From start to finish, the entire celestial event will last for 06 hours and 13 minutes.
A lunar eclipse occurs when the Sun, the Earth and the Moon are perfectly aligned – the Earth in the middle prevents sunlight from reaching the moon. The celestial event will be visible to Sri Lanka and many other countries.
For Sri Lankans, this lunar eclipse can be witnessed from 10:45 PM to 3:48 AM tomorrow.

heading: Colombo power cuts rescheduled for Saturday
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) –  The Ministry of Power and Renewable Energy states that the power cut scheduled for today, to several areas in Colombo from 9 AM to 3 PM, has been canceled and rescheduled for tomorrow from 09.00 am to 03.00 pm.
Earlier, Media Spokesperson of the Ministry, Sulakshana Jayawardena had stated that the power supply will be suspended in the areas of Colombo 03, 04, 05, 07 and Colombo 08 due to a system upgrade.
Jayawardena further added that the power supply to certain areas could be suspended again, on the 31st of this month.

heading: Welikada prison separates 6 inmates
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – The Prisons Department has taken steps to separate around 6 suspects who have been linked to organised crime and large-scale drug rackets.
A high ranking officer at the Department said that special attention has been focused on these 6 suspects who are currently incarcerated at the Welikada prison. According to the officer, only those with special permission could enter the area where they are being held at.
A spokesperson for the Police further stated that information has come to light that certain inmates continue to operate drug rings while in prison using the latest technological gadgets. The Police intelligence unit is currently conducting investigations into these reports.

heading: India has no interest in the Mattala Airport
content:
Colombo (News1st) : The Civil Aviation Ministry of India has announced that there is no proposal under consideration for the Airports Authority of India (AAI) to buy a controlling stake in Sri Lanka’s Mattala Rajapaksa International Airport.
The Indian Minister of State for Civil Aviation Jayant Sinha had made this statement to the Indian Parliament on Thursday (July 26th), in response to a question raised by BJP member Poonam Mahajan.
Jayant Sinha also refuted claims that the AAI was planning on building a flying school and a maintenance, repair and overhaul unit at the Mattala airport.
Convenor of the Voice against Corruption Wasantha Samarasinghe voiced his concerns about the Government’s plans for the Mattala airport. He believes that the Government is planning on selling the Mattala airport to a private firm and not to a AAI as claimed by Minister of Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation Nimal Siripala de Silva.

heading: Your Friday Morning Brief
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st)
1. Power disruptions scheduled for today (27 July) in Colombo 3, 4, 5, 7 & 8 have been rescheduled for tomorrow from 09.00 am to 03.00 pm.
2. Intelligence unit of the Welikada prison has been dissolved with immediate effect on the orders of Minister of Justice Thalatha Athukorala.
3. Minister Sarath Fonseka opposes former Sri Lankan cricket captain Kumar Sangakkara as a common candidate for the 2020 elections.
4. President Maithripala Sirisena states MPs and Ministers involved in the drug trade will be punished in accordance with the law.
5. Presidential Commission of Inquiry (PCoI) disclosed that the procurement of security equipment for the BIA by Sri Lankan Airlines was marred with serious irregularities.
INTERNATIONAL
1. Former cricketer Imran Khan claimed victory in Pakistan’s Election that ended on Wednesday (July 25) amidst accusations of vote rigging that was directed to him by the rival parties.
2. Uganda’s constitutional courts on Thursday (July 26) approved removing the presidential age limit of 75 years, a ruling that would potentially allow President Yoweri Museveni to extend his three-decade rule.
SPORTS 
1. Cabinet paper presented by the Minister of Sports on the matter of Sri Lankan Cricket being an under competent authority was criticized by Prof Prathibha Mahanama as misleading the Cabinet and the President.

heading: Tri-forces deployed to protect the environment
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st): The Central Cultural Fund’s program to develop and promote the Jathika Namal Uyana commenced today (July 26) under the auspices of President Maithripala Sirisena.
The Jathika Namal Uyana was vested in the custody of the Central Cultural Fund as per a request made by Venerable Wanawasi Rahula Thero, the custodian of the premises. The new Information Centre at the Jathika Namal Uyana and the J.R.Jayawardena Memorial Meditation Centre were declared open today as well.
Speaking at the event Venerable Wanawasi Rahula Thero said not only those who are engaged in logging, but those who are in Parliament, the MPs and Ministers involved in bringing down drugs must be sent to the gallows and not the innocent people. He requested the Government not to spare the loggers and timber racketeers and bring forward a law which could impose capital punishment on anyone that causes harm to the environment.
President Maithripala Sirisena speaking at the event said certain politicians need to be held responsible for the destruction of natural resources around the country over the past 5 decades. He said the politicians have used their power to generate money together with their henchmen and cause serious harm to the environment.
The President noted that he has deployed the Army, Navy and Air Force for the protection of the environment. He explained that the Air Force Commander sends satellite images of the forest density to him once every two weeks while the Navy carries out surveillance on the ocean area to ascertain if timber and other resources are being taken away from the country.

heading: I will not support a common candidate - SF
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st): Addressing a gathering in Kelaniya, Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka said, he will not support a common candidate.
Responding to a question raised by a journalist on a possible presidential run by former Sri Lankan Cricket captain Kumar Sangakkara, Fonseka noted that although he is an excellent cricketer, he does not believe that Sangakkara would make a good politician. He noted that it took him 7 to 8 years to understand the workings of politics.
The Field Marshal stated that he believes the candidate put forward by the UNP should be the leader or someone he selects that has done the groundwork to establish himself as a natural leader. While reaffirming that he would only support the UNP leader or someone he selects,  Fonseka noted that there is no point in supporting an imported candidate.
