heading: SLPP loose Opposition Leader position in CMC
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st): Who is the true opposition in the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC). This was the hot topic that created a tense situation at the CMC on Thursday (July 26th).
The UNP secured power in the CMC with a total of 60 seats at the recent election. The SLPP came in second with 23 seats. The UPFA won 12 seats, the United Progressive Alliance won 10 seats, the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna obtained 6 seats while other political and independent parties won 8 seats.
UPFA councilor M.F.M.H. Manzil l submitted a document with signatures of 28 councilors claiming he is suitable for the post of opposition leader. A tense situation arose when the representatives of Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna opposed this move.
Speaking to the media following the CMC session, Mazil confidently stated that has the support of a majority in the opposition and that he was accepted as the Leader of the Opposition by the Mayor. He also noted that the SLPP had requested for 2 more days to bring in a document which shows that they have the majority in the opposition while noting that the have the signatures of only 23 members Mazil stated that he is the Opposition leader until they are capable of doing this.
CMC Councilor Dr. Pradeep Kariyawasam (SLPP) questioned how Min. Mano Ganesan’s team in the CMC claim to be in the Opposition when they clearly attend the Mayor’s group meetings.
CMC Councilor M.M. Sharabdeen (UNP) stated that the Colombo Municipal Council ordinance does not mention anything about an opposition leader post it is only a position that’s held by tradition. He added that 23 representing the Flower Bud party were elected but they failed to appoint a leader for the past six months.
Mayor of Colombo Rosy Senanayake said a final decision on this issue will be reached on Tuesday (July 31).

heading: Land dispute leads to 2 hour railway strike
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – Railway station masters, supervisors, controllers and drivers launched a two-hour strike from 2pm to 4pm on Thursday afternoon (July 26).
A property located in Maradana had led to an issue which resulted in the strike action. The land in question is located at Bay 6, Colombo 10 and at present a private firm is using this land for business purposes. The issue had arisen with regard to the area used by the firm as the car park.
Secretary of the Railway Drivers Union, Indika Dodangoda said as per the order of the Railway Superintendent, the Railway Security Division and the respective personnel were engaged in certain construction activities. He said at that moment, State Minister Harsha De Silva had threatened them to suspend the construction and they resorted to this action to oppose that move.
Indika Dodangoda state that Min. Harsha De Silva intervened in this as per the request made by the private firm.
When State Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs Dr. Harsha De Silva was questioned regarding this he stated that the IT firm in question provides employment to 1,200 people and that he was informed that a group had arrived there and were trying to erect a fence for a construction.
He said they were told that a $ 15 Million project called the Operation Head Quarters and Train Control Centre, passed by Cabinet is to be constructed here and it has been approved by Cabinet.
When around 80 Cabinet Papers are presented, there is an issue as to how these papers are being discussed, said the State Minister adding that he was told by the Prime Minister to have a meeting with Minister Nimal Siripala and reach a decision by Wednesday.
The State Minister stated that there are another 05 acres of land located close to the land in question, adding that the proposed building could be erected on that land.
“This is the only IT park in Colombo and it was launched bythe previous government and is being carried forward by the present government, do not destroy it,” said the Dr. Harsha De Silva.
Commuters were severely inconvenienced at the Fort Railway Station due to this sudden strike action. Commuters were also inconvenienced at the Maradana Railway Station as well.

heading: New Audit Act empowers the people - Mayadunne
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st): Former Auditor General of Sri Lanka Sarath Chandrasiri Mayadunne says the State Audit Sector has the strength to pursue audit acts via the new act.
Speaking to News1st on the new National Audit Act, Mayadunne noted that section 4 of the new act empowers the general public to inform the Auditor General whenever they face issues relating to Government Services. He added that if there is sufficient evidence the act compels the Auditor General to look into it and report it to the Parliament as well as share his findings with the people through the Audit Department’s website.
The former Auditor General also noted that the Cabinet of Minister as well as Parliamentarians are bound to give the necessary strength, support, and backing to the Audit department or they too could face legal ramifications because of it.

heading: Bail for prison officer who attacked a PS chairman
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st): The prison officer, who was arrested in connection to assaulting the Chairman of the Divulapitiya Pradeshiya Sabha and the Chairman of a Gramodya Mandalaya was released on bail by the Minuwangoda Acting Magistrate today (July 22).
The order was issued to release the officer on two sureties of Rs. 100,000 each. The incident in question occurred on the 22nd of this month and the suspect had caused damaged to property of the Pradeshiya sabah as well.
A protest was held in Divulapitiya this morning demanding the arrest of the suspect. The case will be taken up again on the 07th of August.

heading: BIA operating with sub-par security equipment
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – It was revealed at the Presidential Commission of Inquiry (PCoI) today (July 26) that the procurement of security equipment for the BIA by SriLankan airlines, was marred with serious irregularities.
In 2014, SriLankan Airlines had called for tenders to procure three X-Ray machines and the recommendation was to select the Rapiscan X-ray system. However, that tender had been canceled by then Head Of Group Security for SriLankan Airlines, SriLankan Catering and Mihin Lanka Retired Major General P. Chandrawansa and a second tender had been called for.
This time, the evaluation committee did not comprise of any representation of the Civil Aviation Authority.
Director – Aviation Security at the Civil Aviation Authority P.A.Jayakantha testifying today said as per the National Civil Aviation Security Programme all screening equipment procured must be ones that have been certified by the Department for Transport UK and the Transportation Security Administration of USA.
Accordingly, in 2014, Sri Lankan Airlines had requested certification from the CAA for 02 Explosives Trace Detectors or ETDs. The CAA had identified that the equipment did not meet the national requirement as that the equipment were from a list known as the “Grandfather List “.
When a manufacturer submits a unit to obtain standard approval, the TSA and DFT first check the technology and include the unit to the approval list. Thereafter it is subject to a 24-month long field test and if it fails, it is added to the Grandfather list, basically meaning, it should not be purchased. However, procuring equipment in the Approval List is a risk that has to be borne by the purchaser.
The CAA has confirmed that the ETDs were from procured from the Grandfather lists. What is even more startling is that these two ETDs lifespan end in February next year.
When SriLankan airlines had submitted applications for certification, the CAA had only issues permits for one year which lapsed in February this year following the commitment made by Retired Major General P. Chandrawansa that SriLankan airlines adheres to the standards.
Yet, even as of today, SriLankan Airlines had not made a single application for re-certification and it is operating with equipment rejected by the entire aviation industry.
When asked if this situation poses a security threat, the CAA noted, as a result, they are continuously monitoring the ETDs.
It was also revealed, that Retired Major General P. Chandrawansa has used the security personnel at SriLankan Airlines and vehicles for campaigning in the Kolonnawa Electorate for Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa.

heading: Intelligence Unit of Welikada Prison dissolved
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st): The Intelligence Unit of the Welikada Prison has been dissolved with immediate effect.
The Ministry of Justice said the decision was taken by Minister Thalatha Athukorala following an investigation carried out into fraud and corruption which had occurred in the recent past.

heading: Colombo to experience power cuts tomorrow
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st): The Ministry of Power and Renewable Energy says many areas in Colombo will experience power cuts tomorrow (July 27) from 09 AM to 03 PM due to essential upgrade to the transmission system.

Areas in Colombo 03, 04, 05, 07 and 08 will experience interruptions to the supply of power.

In addition, the respective areas would also experience intermittent power cuts until the 31st due to the upgrade of the transmission system.

heading: Lunar eclipse tonight
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – A lunar eclipse, the longest of the 21st Century, is set to occur tonight as the moon moves into the shadow of the earth.
From start to finish, the entire celestial event will last for 06 hours and 13 minutes.
A lunar eclipse occurs when the Sun, the Earth and the Moon are perfectly aligned – the Earth in the middle prevents sunlight from reaching the moon. The celestial event will be visible to Sri Lanka and many other countries.
For Sri Lankans, this lunar eclipse can be witnessed from 10:45 PM to 3:48 AM tomorrow.

heading: Agarwood smuggler arrested in Kadawatha
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st): A suspect who was in possession of Agarwood (wallapatta) which is a protected flora in Sri Lanka, was arrested in the 9th mile post area in Kadawatha today (July 26th).
10.884kg of Agarwood which was in the possession of the suspect has been taken into Police custody.
The 37 year old suspect who is a resident of Ragama was placed in remand custody till the 26th of next month after being produced before the Mahara magistrate.

heading: Government to purchase 120,000 tonnes of paddy
content:
Colombo (News1st): The Paddy Marketing Board has announced that they will begin purchasing paddy for the yala season from the 4th of August.
Chairman of the board, Upali Mohotti addressing a media briefing today noted that they expect to purchase up to 120,000 metric tonnes of paddy during this yala season. Mohotti noted that the Cabinet of Ministers has already granted approval to allocate the necessary funds to the Paddy Marketing Board.
Meanwhile subject minister Mahinda Amarawewera revealed that a special program has been drawn up to purchase paddy directly this season.
The Department of Agriculture believes that farmers will be able to reap a total harvest of 1.4mn metric tonnes of paddy this season.

heading: 39-year-old clubbed to death in Nagoda
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – Police have commenced investigations into the murder of an individual in the Nagoda area in Kalutara.
The victim, a 39-year-old resident of Nagoda, had been murdered in his home with the use of a blunt weapon believed to be a pole.
According to the police team investigating the murder, the chief suspect is believed to have fled the area. The police believe that the murder took place as a result of a property dispute.

heading: Lunar eclipse to be witnessed during the day
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – Residents of Sri Lanka will be able to witness a rare complete lunar eclipse which is expected to be the longest lunar eclipse of the century.
According to the Arthur C. Clarke center, the lunar eclipse is expected to begin at 10.44 pm and continue till Saturday morning.
Sri Lankans will be able to witness another lunar eclipse of this nature in the year 2025.

heading: New twist in the NPC ministerial power struggle
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st): The Supreme Court ordered today (July 26) to postpone the hearing of the petition filed by Chief Minister of the Northern Province C.V. Vigneshwaran, appealing for the cancellation of the Interim Injunction issued by the Court of Appeal, suspending the implementation of the gazette notification issued in August 2017 which removed B. Daniswaran from his Ministerial portfolio in the Northern Province.
The petition is to be taken up once again on the 5th of September. The petition was taken up today (July 26th) before a bench consisting of Supreme Court Justices Buwaneka Aluvihare, Priyantha Jayawardena and Justice Prasanna Jayawardena.
In his petition, Chief Minister of the Northern Province, C.V. Vigneshwaran, has pointed out that the Interim Injunction issued on the 29th of last month is not legal. Chief Minister Vigneshwaran has filed the petition claiming that the Court of Appeal has no power to suspend a gazette notification issued by the Chief Minister.

heading: Reconciliation efforts of SL Army praised
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – Commanding General of the United States Army Pacific Command (USARPAC), General Robert B. Brown, met with President Maithripala Sirisena on Tuesday (July 24th).
During the meeting with the President, General Brown had assured he would explore possibilities for Sri Lanka’s contribution to Humanitarian Responses & Disaster Management (HRDM) in the region and how best the US Army could assist Sri Lanka in the implementation of such relief programmes.
Discussions agreed that the Sri Lanka Army with its past battlefield gains would be capable of sharing their experiences with global partners in resolving such armed conflicts and restoration of normalcy within a short span of time as proved well in the Sri Lankan context. General Brown also praised the Sri Lanka Army for its contribution to the ongoing reconciliation efforts and nation-building tasks.
General Robert Brown during the interactive meeting recognized and spoke high of the Sri Lanka Army’s excellent de-mining roles and its technical professionalism which has gained popularity across the world as one of the best de-mining groups.

heading: Search continues for missing 10 year old
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – Operations are underway for the 7th consecutive day in search of a 10-year-old boy who was reported missing from Samanalawatta area in Balangoda.
Sahan Kumara Darmasiri, a grade 5 student of the Samanalawatte Vidyalaya was reported missing on the 20th of this month when he left in search of his father who had gone to cut firewood. The father had later arrived at his house without having met the child.
Although the Police had initiated an investigation to find the missing child, they have not been able to obtain any leads.

heading: Uva and Eastern provinces to experience heavy rain
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – The Department of Meteorology says, showers or thundershowers could be expected in the Uva and Eastern provinces and in Polonnaruwa, Mullaitivu and Vavuniya districts after 2.00 pm today (July 26th).
Issuing a weather advisory, the Department notes, fairly heavy falls of about 50 MM could be expected at some places in the Uva and Eastern provinces.
Several spells of showers are also expected in the Central, Sabaragamuwa and Western provinces and light showers are expected in Kurunegala, Galle and Matara districts.

heading: Kidney patients face shortage of medication
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – Kidney patients in several areas are facing difficulties due to a shortage of  3 types of medicine used in the Kidney dialysis process or in the purification of their blood.
Director of Non-Communicable Disease Control at the Ministry of Health Dr. Lal Panapitya noted that the drugs in question are being imported by one company and that the shortage has been caused by a delayed shipment.
Dr. Panapitiya noted that they are taking steps to rectify the issue through the state pharmaceutical corporation.
When News 1st spoke to the Managing Director of the State Pharmaceutical Corporation Dr. Mohamed Hashim Mohamed Rumie, he noted that the company in question had agreed to deliver the shipment by air.

heading: No gunshot injuries in Mannar grave skeletons
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – Experts conducting excavations of the Mannar mass grave have identified that most of the skeletal remains discovered in the grave had suffered heavy blows by sharp weapons. The experts have concluded that none of the skeletal remains displayed signs of gun shot injuries.
Around 55 skeletons and several bone fragments were discovered during the excavation.
Excavations on the site began in March this year, based on a court order by the Mannar Magistrates Court, when bone fragments were discovered during the excavation of land for the Sathosa complex in Mannar.
The excavations are being carried out by a team of Judicial Medical Officers led by the JMO of the Mannar hospital, Specialist Doctor Chaminda Rajapakse. Professor Raj Somadeva has also joined the team to carry out a forensic archeological inquiry.
According to the excavation team, 6 of the skeleton that were discovered belonged to children while a number of skeletons were that of old women and men.
Professor Somadeva speaking to News1st noted that the skeletons had been disposed in an arbitrary manner adding that who ever did it seemed to have been in a rush to dispose them. He went onto note that they are conduction investigations to ascertain when the skeletons were buried.

heading: Police intensifies crack down on drugs
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – 7 individuals linked to a heroin racket were arrested following STF raids in Katharagama and Colombo.
According to the Police STF, 3 suspects were arrested during raids carried out in Kataragama, last night while, the remaining 4 suspects were arrested in the areas of Grandpass, Thotalanga and Mattakkuliya.
Meanwhile, another five suspects involved in drug rackets were arrested by the Police yesterday. The suspects were arrested from the Grandpass, Moragahahena, Keselwatte and Horana areas.
A total of 177 grams of Heroin was seized during the raids.

heading: "Key to development is the attitude on science"
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – Amongst the two categories prevalent in most developing countries of the world, certain nations successfully keep moving on an upward line, while certain others move towards a downward trend. The basic difference behind this situation is the attitude that the people of a particular nation display towards the growth of Science and Technology.
Minister Sarath Amunugama expressing the above views at the awards ceremony of the National Science Foundation (NFS) tried to convey the importance of absorbing modern technology to solve the current issues of the country.
The award ceremony organized as an annual affair by the National Service Foundation aims to promote top performers of in the science field. The event held at BMICH recognized several prominent personalities under the categories of NSF research, Technology, the World Academy of Sciences and Support Scheme for Supervision.
Among the awardees of the occasion were, Prof. J.J. Wijetunga, Prof. Ranil S. Dissanayake and K.M.S. Bandara. They won awards in the fields of research and technology. While Prof Rangika Halwatura of the University of Moratuwa was recognized as the Young Scientist of the function held this year.

heading: Your Thursday morning brief
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) 
1. President conveys his expectations to make Sri Lanka the number one country in the world, in the fight against corruption at the Global Expert Group meeting held on Jakarta Principles.
2. The President yesterday (July 25) suspended political appointments and promotions granted to over 1000 persons in the education sector.
3. JVP MP Vijitha Herath stated that moves are afoot to privatise state enterprises.
4. PCOI discloses that Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and Minister Kabir Hashim approved the appointment of Suren Ratwatte as CEO of SriLankan Airlines, whilst avoiding the normal evaluation procedure.
5. The money trail of the MIG deal has led investigators to 5 different bank accounts in Dubai – Cabinet Spokesperson Minister Rajitha Senaratne.
INTERNATIONAL 
1. North Korea continues to produce fissile material for nuclear bombs in spite of its pledge to denuclearize, U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said on Wednesday (July 25).
2. Wildfires scorched parts of California on Wednesday (July 25) as the state grapples with several major blazes this summer. The fast-burning Cranston fire in Hemet prompted evacuations and authorities said one person was in custody on suspicion of starting the blaze.
SPORTS 
1. Serena Williams has accused anti-doping authorities of “discrimination” because of the frequency with which she has been selected for random drug tests.

heading: JVP warns of more privatisation of SOEs
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) –  Speaking at a media briefing convened by the People’s Liberation Front (JVP), the Propaganda Secretary of the JVP, MP Vijitha Herath spoke about the agreement signed with Asian Development Bank in 2016.
Herath noted that because of this deal, the Government hopes to release the funds of the EPF and the Provident fund of the private sector into the share market. He also noted that the Government plans to release stakes of the Airport and Ports as well.
Documents are being prepared to convert the Katunayake Airport into a private company, said MP Herath adding that they are preparing to obtain a Rs.48 Billion loan from the ADB with the promise that SOEs will be privatized as well.

heading: Sri Lanka and the fight against corruption
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – President Maithripala Sirisena says his expectation is to make Sri Lanka the number one country in the world, in the fight against corruption. President Sirisena expressed these views during his address as the Chief Guest of the Global Expert Group Meeting on the Jakarta Principles in Colombo this morning (July 25).
The Jakarta principles which aims to strengthen the effectiveness and the independence of anti-corruption authorities around the world were adopted in 2012. The three day Global Expert Group Meeting on the Jakarta Principles is currently underway in Colombo with the participation of anti-corruption authorities of 30 countries.
A group including the Head of the UN Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC), Candice Weisch and Program Manager of UNDP’s Global Anti-corruption Initiative Anga Timilsina took part in the meeting.
President Sirisena also stated that there are many shortcomings in laws and regulations around the world when taking action against corruption. For example, many individuals and criminals from our country who are connected to serious fraud and corruption are in hiding overseas, said the President.
The President also noted that when steps are taken to fight corruption, those engaged in corrupt activities band together inorder to fight against those cleaning up the system.
Fmr. Chief Commissioner of the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission Abu Kassim bin Mohamed, and President’s Counsel Sarath Jayamanne, the Director General of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption also spoke during the meeting held today.

heading: Recovering money lost in MIG deal
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – Cabinet Spokesperson Minister (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne expressed his views on the statement made by former President Mahinda Rajapaksa on the latter’s absence during the debate in Parliament on the exposé carried by the New York Times. The Minister also responded to the former President’s challenge over the failure to secure the return of former Central Bank Governor, Arjuna Mahendranran.
While noting that the New York Times matter and Arjuna Mahendran are two separate issued Dr. Senaratne noted that there is no difference in the crimes committed by Arjuna Mahendran and Udayanga Weeratunege. He went onto note that a red notice was issued for the arrest of Weeratunge well before Mahendran, but this does not ensure that these individuals can be repatriated expeditiously.
When questioned were raised about the status of Udayanga Weeratunge, the co-cabinet spokesperson responded by stating that the former President had promised to bring him back to the country and questioned why he is not doing so.
The Minister elaborated on the money trail left by the MIG deal as well. He noted that they have already identified 5 bank accounts in Dubai connected to the Rajapaksa family, a secretary, a chairman, and another MP. He noted that they have identified where the money went to in Singapore as well as in Hong Kong.
The Co-cabinet spokesperson noted that one bank account in Dubai contained $1,086mn. Senaratne also revealed that the bank account of the MP he spoke about earlier had over $500mn, while the joint account operated by the chairman and secretary that he spoke about had nearly $1,800mn.
When questioned about Nandana Lokuwithana and his connections to the Rajapaksa family, the minister stated clearly that Lokuwithana was not connected to the money that he was talking about. However, he did accept that Lokuwithana was involved with members of the Rajapaksa family in the contentious Dubai Marriot Hotel deal adding that it was a minister in the current government that offered him to run a tyre factory in Horana.

heading: Irregularities in appointment of SriLankan CEO
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – The appointments of Captain Suren Ratwatte as CEO of SriLankan Airlines and Siva Ramachandran as CCO of the airlines have become a matter of concern to the Presidential Commission of Inquiry.
In 2015 when the post of CEO for SriLankan Airlines was advertised 59 people both local and foreign had applied and 11 of them were shortlisted. And among them was Siva Ramachandran, who was then based in the UK.
Interestingly, SriLankan Airlines had conducted three other in-person interviews for three others namely Manoj De Vaas Gunawardena, W.Kumarasiri and Suren Ratwatte.
In August 2015, after the interviews, Rakhita Jayawardena, the Protem Chief Executive Officer and Director at SriLankan Airlines and had informed the board that Suren Ratwatte was the best suited for the post and he offered a 03 Million Rupee taxable monthly pay and a 10 Million Rupees taxable performance bonus.
It must be noted there was no board decision on appointing Suren Ratwatte as CEO, however, he was given the appointment on 22nd of September 2015 with a 06 month probation period. Ratwatte’s 06 month probation period was to end on the 15th of April 2016, however, the Ministry of Public Enterprise Development had proposed Ratwatte be given another 06-month extension to his service.
Surprisingly, when his probation drew to a close, no performance evaluation was done because the Prime Minister and Kabir Hashim requested that Suren Ratwatte be confirmed as CEO as soon as possible.
Earlier this year News 1st reported with facts that the view of some members of the Board of Directors was that Suren Ratwatte’s service was not efficient and it needed to be suspended. News 1st also reported that SriLankan Airlines, which proposed a performance bonus of 10 Million rupees to Suren Ratwatte, suffered a loss of 28.2 Billion Rupees during the financial year 2016/2017.
Suren Ratwatte’s pre-mature retirement is in effect from the 31st of July 2018 and in today’s evidence, it was revealed that new Chairman Ranjith Fernando had accepted his resignation and offered to pay 03 Months pay as well as additional 02 months pay for cooperating with the company’s restructuring plan. In addition, he is to be given air tickets for his family to travel to Australia.
In a letter to the Chairman of the Airline on his resignation, Suren Ratwatte requested for a payment equivalent to six months salary says the income tax will be the responsibility of SriLankan Airlines. He had noted all Final Payments must be remitted in Australian Dollars to his offshore accounts.
The Presidential Commission of Inquiry must be appreciated for focusing on those who have brought this airline to the brink of bankruptcy and raising serious matters of concern.
It has been revealed that Siva Ramachandran was appointed as the Chief Commercial Office of SriLankan Airlines with no board approval.
The evidence revealed today that the Chairman of the Airlines had believed the appointment had Cabinet approval, simply because Advisor to the Prime Minister R. Paskaralingam had reported that the Cabinet Committee on Economic Management had found no fault with the selection process. This is revealed in a letter sent by Prime Minister’s Secretary Saman Ekanayake to the Ministry of Finance.
It is now clear that the appointments of Suren Ratwatte and Siva Ramachandran were a departure of due process just as it was with the case with the Central Bank Treasury Bond Scam.

heading: Tear gas used to disperse unruly student protest
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – Police took steps today (July 25) to disperse an unruly crowd of protesting Higher National Diploma (HND) students in Colombo.
The Inter HND Students Federation commenced a protest march from Campbell Park in Punchi Borella demanding among other things, that the Mahapola scholarship be increased from Rs. 1,500 to Rs. 5,000 and that steps be taken to address the shortage of lecturers.
The procession made its way through Maradana and Pettah before reaching the Presidential Secretariat, it was during this time that the Police took steps to close the Lotus Road. When the demonstrators attempted to breach the barricades, police took steps to disperse the crowd and several students were injured in the ensuing chaos.
We do not question the right of students to protest to safeguard their right to education. However, we must question whether such problems can be resolved by breaking into the office of the Head of State.
Are students able to enter high security zones and act in a manner that threatens the security in the area?
We must also not forget that there exists a group on whose direction such actions are carried out, while they sit back and watch. The end result of this is that when the law is enforced, the victims will be a handful of innocent parents and students.
Can a civilized society approve of such unruly behavior in an urban center which seriously hampers the day to day life of the inhabitants of the city?
For the attention of the people.

heading: Tippers carrying earth for S. Expressway arrested
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) -Nine tippers that were transporting earth in the Weerskatiya area in violation of their permits have been taken into Police custody.
According to the Weerakatiya Police the tippers were taken into custody while travelling along the Weerakatiya – Ranna main road last evening.
The tippers had been transporting earth for construction activities on the Southern Expressway. The vehicles are due to be produced before the Walasmulla magistrates court today.

heading: Islandwide wild elephant survey in September
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – The Wild Life Department is planning on carrying out an island-wide survey of wild elephants from the 23rd to the 25th of September.
According to a spokesperson at the department, circuit bungalows of the department would be closed down and tourists would not be able to make any reservations within these days due to the survey.
Wildlife sanctuaries located island-wide would also be shut down during this period.

heading: Suspect in Kotakethana double murder acquitted
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – Ashoka Chandani Kumara alias “Batti” who was believed to have been connected to the  murder of a 57-year-old woman and her 17-year-old daughter in Kotakethana, Ratnapura was acquitted of all charges today (July 25).
Colombo High Court Judge, Vikum Kaluarachchi ordered for her release, after concluding that there was insufficient evidence against her following the investigations conducted.
However, the Colombo High Courts decided to continue hearing the case filed against the first defendant, Lokugam Hewage Dharshana alias “Raju” who is “Batti’s” husband.
The Attorney General had filed the case against the couple over the brutal murders of Nayana Nilmini and Kavindi Chathurangani Sellahewa in Kotakethana, Ratnapura on the 31st of January 2012.

heading: SLPA is the most corrupt state body in Sri Lanka
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – Two books authored by the Secretary to the Ministry of Petroleum Resources Development, Upali Marasinghe was launched at the Sri Lanka Development Administration Authority today. (July 25)
Addressing the function, the Minister of Petroleum Resources Development Arjuna Ranatunga stated that the Ports authority (SLPA) is this country’s most corrupt institution and highlighted the need for stern action to combat this.
While noting that 99% of the employees at the SLPA are honest workers, the Minister noted that those in power coerce them to engage in illicit activities. He added that they have identified trade union leaders as the biggest thieves in the authority and vowed to take action against such corrupt officials.

heading: British MP Ian Paisley suspended for 30 days
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) -Members of the UK House of Commons have voted to suspend Democratic Unionists (DUP). MP Ian Paisley for 30 sitting days. It follows his failure to declare two family holidays paid for by the Sri Lankan Government.
He will be absent from Parliament for some key Brexit votes and has also been suspended by the DUP “pending further investigation into his conduct”. Speaker of the House John Bercow called it “a regrettable state of affairs”.
Bercow will now formally inform the chief electoral officer of the decision and she has ten working days to set up a petition which, if signed by 10% of North Antrim constituents, will lead to a by-election and Paisley having to stand down.
Sir Kevin Barron, chair of the Standards Committee, said that they had concluded Mr. Paisley was guilty of “serious misconduct and his actions were of a nature to bring the House of Commons into disrepute”.

heading: State officials are as corrupt as Politicians
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – The Global Expert Group meeting on the Jakarta principles was held in Colombo under the auspices of President Maithripala Sirisena today. (July 25)
The event was organized by the Commission to Investigate Bribery or Corruption. Addressing the event the President stated that there is a need to remove the obstacles in the process of fighting crime and corruption.
The Head of state also added that it’s not easy to fight bribery, crime and corruption as criminals irrespective of their political parties band together and work against the people who are fighting against crime.
He added that often the media highlights only the politicians as corrupt, but state officials are also involved in it. He also said that in certain instances state officials have been far ahead in bribery and corruption than the politicians.\
More to follow

heading: Bus accident injures 18 in Punewa
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st) – An accident involving a CTB bus that occurred along the A9 road in close proximity to the Punewa navy base has left 18 people injured.
According to the Police Spokesperson, the injured which included 5 women were admitted to the Vavuniya hospital.
The accident was reported to be a result of the driver falling asleep at the wheel.

heading: Your Wednesday morning brief
content:
COLOMBO (News 1st)
1. TNA member of parliament S. Yogeswaran claimed that an agreement is currently underway to provide 6250 hectares land area to several Chinese companies
2. Decisions to write off non-consumption loans granted up to Rs. 100,00 for women in drought-affected districts by registered Finance companies were put forward by the Cabinet of Ministers.
3. Editor of the Voice for Justice, Sudarman Radaliyagoda stated that the current plight faced by the Independent Television Network is merely a precursor to sell the network off to a powerful Minister of the government.
4. Wimal Weerawansa claimed that the real motive behind handing over operations of the Mattala Airport to India is debatable because India had always cited Sri Lanka as a strategic location for their planes and with the opportunity granted could steer the country in a direction of their interest.
5. State Minister of Finance, Eran Wickramaratne stated that he does not agree with the policy of investing more in infrastructure development as at present since allocating more resources on human capital development would be beneficial for the future of the country.
INTERNATIONAL
1. Guards at a U.S. detention center for immigrants in California had brutally used pepper spray, beatings and scalding hot showers last year to punish eight Central American men who went on a hunger strike, two of the men and their attorneys said on Tuesday (July 24).
2. Chilean President Sebastian Pinera pledged to deepen commercial and economic ties across the ‘whole Asia-Pacific’ world by way of the Pacific Alliance and other trade blocs on Tuesday (July 24).
SPORTS 
1. Former Sri Lankan cricketer Charith Senanayake has been appointed as the Manager of the Sri Lankan cricket team with effect from the period of 25th July to the 30th September 2018, up until the conclusion of the Asian Cup.

heading: Parliament adjourned after 19th Amendment second reading ...
content:
Parliament has been adjourned to Tuesday April 21 following the second reading of the bill on the 19th Amendment to the Constitution on Monday morning.
Our Parliament correspondent noted that the debate on the 19th Amendment Bill, will commence on Tuesday.
Meanwhile, a tense situation arose in Parliament on Monday morning when a group of opposition MPs voiced protest.
Our Parliament Correspondent noted that tensions flared shortly after media reports regarding the former president and former defence secretary being summoned to Bribery Commission were brought to the attention of the Chair.
Several opposition and government MPs had made arguments for and against the summoning of the former president to the Bribery Commission.
Several Opposition MPs contended that the former president, cannot be summoned to the Bribery Commission, constitutionally. The Prime Minister and the Speaker were called upon to intervene to stop the former president being summoned.
A deputy minister however noted that since the government has pledged to ensure the independence of these commissions, there will be no political interference. Tensions flared thereafter.
The government had agreed to grant a two day debate on the matter. Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe pointed out to the house that only MPs privileges can be brought up in Parliament and noted that neither the former president or the former defence secretary are members of parliament. The Speaker noted that attention would be drawn to the matter.
Several opposition MPs had then entered the well of parliament. The Speaker adjourned the house and informed the Sergeant-at-Arms to take the mace out of the chamber.

heading: Police find body of youth who jumped off Diyaluma Falls
content:
The body of the  nineteen-year-old youth who drowned after jumping from the top of the Diyaluma Falls in Koslanda was found on Monday morning.
The body of a 17-year-old girl who drowned along with the youth was found on Saturday night.  Police stated that the 17 year old girl is a resident of Haputale.

heading: Sangakkara scores unbeaten century for Surrey
content:
Kumar Sangakkara has scored an unbeaten century in his maiden first class appearance for Surrey in the English County Cricket Season.
Batting against Glamorgan at the Sofia Gardens in Cardiff, Sangakkara was unbeaten on 112, at stumps on Day 1.
Surrey were on 363 runs for the loss of 3 wickets at stumps, batting in their first innings.

heading: Pollard sellotapes his mouth after warning from umpire
content:
Mumbai Indians all-rounder Kieron Pollard on Sunday put on a sellotape on his mouth after the umpires rapped him for his on-field altercation with fellow West Indian and Royal Challengers Bangalore batsman Chris Gayle during an IPL match.
The 27 year old Trinidadian had quite a few things to say to his compatriot as Bangalore began their chase of a mammoth 210 run target versus Mumbai Indians.
Pollard was asked to maintain proper distance and control the chatter.
Pollard’s response was to promptly put some tape on his mouth therefore he literally taped up his mouth to show that he would do absolutely no talking and sledging.

heading: New stamp issued for Vesak
content:
A stamp has been issued in line with the National Vesak ceremony. The launch of the stamp and the first day cover was held at the auditorium of the Ministry of Buddha Sasana and was launched through the Department of Posts.
A group of dignitaries including MPs and ministers participated in the launch ceremony.

heading: International Power Boat Association gives special licenc...
content:
Seven Sri Lankans have been granted special licenses by the International Power Boat Association. Accordingly, they will be given the oppurtunity to particiapte in future international power boating competitions.
A training camp organised by the International Power Boat Association and the Lanka Power boat Association was held in Bentota.
The training camp was inaugurated on the April 9 under the auspices of the Chief trainer of the International Power Boat Association John Puddyfoot.
The players were educated on the theoretical and practical aspects of the game.
Seven Sri Lankans were allowed to participate in Power Boat competitions while special license was granted after the training camp.
The license grants the opportunity to organise power boat competitions, to judge tournaments, participate in tournaments as well as train other players.
Sri Lanka received membership of the International Power Boat Association three years ago. However, power boat tournaments could not be held due to the lack of licences.

heading: DMC says several acres washed away by Haldamulla landslide
content:
The Disaster Management Centre (DMC) said that a landslide occurred in an area spanning five acres in Nikapotha area in Haldamulla.
Assistant Director of the Badulla DMC, E.L.A.M Udaya Kumara claims that the area of the landslide is a rubber estate and that as of now no damage to property or loss of life has been reported.
The head of the National Building research organisation R.M.S Bandara said that they are looking into the facts relating to this landslide.

heading: Mother, daughter brutally murdered in Nuwara-Eliya
content:
A mother aged 52, and her thirty-two- year-old daughter were found brutally murdered in the Pudalu Oya area in Nuwara Eliya at 3 a.m. on Monday morning.
The police say they were murdered with the use of a sharp weapon. Further investigations are underway.

heading: Tense situation arises over death of woman in Bambalapiti...
content:
A woman’s body was found inside a storage room at a school in Colombo 4 on Sunday April 19. The Police Media Spokesperson noted that the woman was a janitor at the school and that the police suspect foul play.
Her body was discovered after investigations were launched when she did not return home from work on Sunday.
The police added that the woman had sustained injuries on her face. The victim is a forty-four-year-old resident of Kirulapone.
A tense situation has arisen when a group who is alleged to be residents around the victim’s home tried to enter the school premises.

heading: SL women languishing in Kuwaiti camp cry out for help
content:
Around 270 Sri lankan women who were subjected to various forms of assault, while being employed in Kuwait, are currently being held at a camp.
The group also includes those who did not receive due salaries at their workplaces.The women charge that once they sought the refuge at the Sri Lanka Embassy in Kuwait after being subjected to assault, the embassy directed them to the camp known as Dilip.
Speaking to New1st the employees noted that they are greatly inconvenienced due to the lack of proper facilities at the camp.
When contacted, Chairman of the Foreign Employment Bureau Nandapala Wickramasuriya ,  said that necessary steps will be taken after inquiring into the matter.

heading: Price increase observed in crude oil imported by CPC in F...
content:
The price of crude oil imported by the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation has increased in the month of February.
A barrel of crude oil which was imported at 55 dollars and 47 cents in January had increased to 69 dollars and 52 cents in February.
According to the Central Bank of Sri Lanka as the prices of crude oil was reduced in the World Market, crude oil imported by CEYPETCO has also reduced since last September.
A barrel of crude oil imported for almost 111 dollars and 21 cents in August last year, has since reduced to 55 dollars and 47 cents in January, a reduction of 55 dollars and 74 cents.
Ceypetco, taking advantage of the situation, reduced the prices of petrol by 33 rupees, diesel by 16 rupees, kerosene by 16 rupees and several other fuel prices on the 22nd of January.
However , CBSL reports that Ceypetco sold a barrel of crude oil in February after adding 14 dollars and 5 cents to it’s imported price as there was a possibility of a crude oil price increase in the World Market during the last few weeks.
Today, the price of a barrel of crude oil, which was sold at 47 dollars in the World Market in January, has increased to almost 60 dollars per barrel.

heading: CID arrests Wildlife Dept clerk in charge of list of R...
content:
The clerk in charge of list of registered elephants of the Department of Wildlife has been arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department.
When contacted, Police Spokesperson ASP Ruwan Gunasekara said that the CID was carrying out an investigation on a scam where wild elephant calves are being captured and sold to various parties.
He went on to note that the reason for this investigation was that false information that has been recorded in the record books of the Wild life Department where the lists of registered tamed elephants were recorded.
ASP Gunasekera added that she will be remanded until  April 21. She was produced before the Colombo Magistrate.

heading: Hanguranketha man encounters wild elephant
content:
An individual was killed in the Hanguranketha area after being attacked by a wild elephant.
The victim W.A. Wimaladasa was a 56-year-old father of three.
He was attacked by a wild elephant at around 10.30 p.m Saturday night when he had gone to the field to protect the rice harvest.
The residents of Lamasuriya Lihiniyagala area in Hanguranketha charge that such incidents have been taking place due to improper supply of electricity for the fence.

heading: Sri Jayawardenepura – Kotte MC Opposition Leader sa...
content:
Opposition Leader of the Sri Jayawardenepura – Kotte Municipal Council, Sugath Appuhamy, alleges that plans are afoot to demolish the council building.
The building housing the Sri Jayewardenepura Kotte Municipal Council, was built in 1930 and has immense historical value.
While a proposal on the demolition of the building has been tabled in the council, it has been adopted. Although the opposition voted against the proposal, all ruling party members had supported it.
It was revealed at this media briefing that plans have been made to construct the new municipal council building on a plot of land in the Welikada area.
Sugath Appuhamy noted that a sum of Rs.12 million  has so far been paid for consultancy charges for the new council building.
We made inquiries from the Mayor of Sri Jayewardenepura Kotte, regarding the allegations levelled by the opposition. Mayor of Sri Jayewardenepura Kotte Janaka Ranawaka said that these accusations are blatant lies. Speaking further he said:
 I will definitely take legal action against this. Municipal councils cannot sell off lands. Not even a single provincial council can sell off their lands. A proposal has been approved to initiate a project on land owned by the Kotte Municipal council. We plan to conduct it, with the Urban Development Authority. We cannot do what we want with it. No land is being sold as per those allegations.

heading: Polonnaruwa youth attempts to set world record with 40 tr...
content:
A youth from Polonnaruwa is attempting to establish a world record by getting 40 tractors to be driven over his chest. K. L. Piyumal has excelled at Karate and boxing since childhood.
Piyumal has been mentored by A. G. Senakabandara to reach  international standards in his skills.
He conducted a practice session on Sunday where 40 agriculture tractors were driven over his chest in a time period of 45 minutes, in order to establish a world record. He only took 19 minutes and 59 seconds for this feat.
News1st extends good wishes to Piyumal and hopes that he will succeed in setting a  record and enter our country’s name in the Book of World Records.

heading: Arrests made after tense situation at Elpitiya New Year c...
content:
A tense situation arose during a New Year celebration in Mapolagama, Elpitiya.
The Police Media Spokesperson’s office noted that thus far, two persons have been arrested in connection to the incident.
This New Year Celebration which was organised by a society in Mapolagama, Elpitiya took place at a sports ground at the Kahaduwa Junction.
It was during the New Year Celebration that a tense situation arose between two parties. It is learnt that a group who left the ground at 7.30 p.m. returned to the grounds and assaulted the other party.
Police state that a house and a store located in close proximity to the area was damaged as a result. Meanwhile, a group of residents staged a protest blocking the Elpitiya – Mapolagama road expressing their anger over the incident.
The Ambalangoda ASP who arrived at the scene promised that he will look in to the matter and serve justice. The Police Media Spokespersons office stated that two suspects were arrested subsequent to the protest.
The police confiscated a motorcycle allegedly used by the suspects.

heading: Update: Parliament adjourned till April 27 (Watch video)
content:
The Parliament was adjourned on Tuesday April 21st till April 27.
The debate on the 19th Amendment to the Parliament was scheduled to be taken up on Tuesday, April 21.
Parliament had to be adjourned on two occasions due to heated arguments.
While the President too arrived at the Parliament complex today, several rounds of talks were held on the 19th amendment to the constitution.
When the house reconvened following the first adjournment, attention was drawn to the 19th amendment to the constitution.

heading: Opposition parliamentarians end protest – say respo...
content:
The protest launched by a group of opposition parliamentarians has ended.
They noted that they have received a favourable response in line with summoning the former president Mahinda Rajapaksa as the Speaker informed Parliament that the Bribery Commission will go to Mahinda Rajapaksa to take a statement: not summon him.

heading: Death in Bambalapitiya school – relatives of victim...
content:
Relatives of the woman who was found dead at a  school in Bambalapitiya, have refused to accept the body of the deceased as the post-mortem examination report had contained an open verdict.
When News1st contacted the Police Media Spokesperson ASP Ruwan Gunasekara in this regard, he said that the post-mortem was held on Monday.

heading: Visitors not allowed to enter BIA: Administrative Manager
content:
The entry of visitors into the Bandaranaike International Airport has been temporarily halted.
The administrative manager of the airport  said that due to a technical difficulty, the entry of visitors has been temporarily halted.
Outgoing flights however, have not been halted.
Meanwhile, former minister Basil Rajapaksa, is expected to arrive to the country on Tuesday afternoon.
During an interview with News1st, the airport administrative manager said that the former minister is expected to arrive at 1.45 from Dubai Tuesday.

heading: Breaking: Large crowd gathers opposite the Parliament
content:
Heavy traffic has been reported along the Parliament Road owing to a protest.
According to our correspondent , a large crowd has gathered opposite the Parliament to engage in the protest.

heading: Boy accused of theft kept chained in police station in An...
content:
In shocking visuals from Andhra Pradesh, a boy is seen inside a police station, wiping his tears, his left leg chained to a window.
Sources say the 13-year-old boy, accused of stealing a chain, was kept in the police station for five days.
The police claim that the boy, a rag-picker, is a repeat offender, but they cannot clearly explain why a child was “arrested” and brought to a police station in the first place.
Police said that the child was kept in chains only for a short while, because the lone constable on duty wanted to go for lunch and wanted to make sure he did not run away.
The police officer denied that the boy had been detained for days. He claimed that the teen was caught yesterday and a stolen chain was found on him.
Late last night, the boy was taken to a magistrate, who reportedly asked for him to be produced again today.
After outrage over the visuals of the child in chains, the state police have started an investigation into alleged violations by their own men.
Last month, the police in neighbouring Telangana were accused of chaining a 23-year-old boy to a wooden log, allegedly for stealing Rs. 300 from a shop.
Source: NDTV

heading: General amnesty – 18,000 army absentees report to s...
content:
The army states that 18,000 army absentees had reported to their relevant stations by  Monday, on account of the general amnesty that has been put in place.
Acting army spokesperson brigadier Jayanath Jayaweera stated that the general amnesty period had been extended until April 25 .
Brigadier Jayanath Jayaweera stated that a general amnesty was declared for army absentees to report to their relevant stations in order to obtain ‘honourable discharge’. Their amnesty was declared on  April 2 and has been extended until April 28.
He also stated that, as of last eventing, 18,0000 absentees have reported to their stations. He went on to state:
We invite all other army absentees to do so.

heading: French lawmakers want Google to give up its secret search...
content:
The country’s senate voted last week to require search companies to hand over access to their search algorithms to ensure that rivals are treated fairly. The search companies would also have to post links to three competitor search engines on their search results pages.
Though the law would apply to all search engines, it is clearly aimed at Google (GOOGL, Tech30) — the company has a 90% share of the search market in France.
“We’re transparent about what ranks well on Google, including when we make changes, but by definition, not everyone can come at the top of the rankings,” said Google spokeswoman Caroline Matthews. “Revealing our algorithms – our intellectual property – would lead to the gaming of our results, which would be a bad experience for users.”
The bill is unlikely to become law, because the government of President François Hollande is opposed to it. It was introduced as an amendment to a bill designed to grow the French economy that reportedly will go up for a wider vote in France’s National Assembly later this month. A preliminary version of the amendment was declared unconstitutional, before it was tweaked.
The vote came just a day after the European Union filed serious antitrust charges against Google. The search company faces a fine of up to $6 billion — more than a quarter’s worth of profits. It also could have to change the way it displays search results in the EU.
It’s just the latest in a string of unfavorable rulings for Google in Europe.
Last year, the European Parliament voted in favor of a nonbinding resolution to break up the company. Parliaments in Spain, France and Germany passed laws that allow publishers to charge Google when snippets of their stories land in Google News — and the news service shut down in Spain as a result. And Google lost its battle over the “right to be forgotten,” a European law that requires the company to remove certain unwanted, inappropriate links from search results if requested.
Google is particularly protective of its search algorithm — the secret sauce that helped propel the company to search dominance over the past decade. If the bill passes and Google opts not to share its algorithm, it might consider ceasing operations in France. Google’s search engine would still be available in France, but its servers would be located in another country.
It would be an extreme measure that the company has so far reserved for China. In 2010, Google removed its servers and business from mainland China, placing them in Hong Kong instead. That allowed Google to provide the Chinese with search results without the onus of censoring the results according to Chinese law (the Chinese government now censors the results themselves).
Source : CNN

heading: Protest launched by parliamentarians continue
content:
The protest launched by the group of UPFA parliamentarians in Parliament on Monday is said to be continuing.
The protest was launched based on an incident where former president Mahinda Rajapaksa was summoned before the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption.
Over 40 parliamentarians are said to be still remaining in the parliament chambers. The parliamentarians say they will not end the protest till the summoning has been withdrawn.
The parliamentarians launched the protest in the form of a fast following the adjournment of parliamentary proceedings on Monday. The move garnered the support of many parliamentarians.

heading: Preparations underway as debate on 19th Amendment draws near
content:
The governing party says that the 19th Amendment to the constitution will be taken up for debate on Tuesday April 21.
Thereby, parliamentary proceedings were confined to one hour on the morning of  April 20,laying the groundwork for the debate on Tuesday.
Meanwhile, the SLFP further notes that discussion on making reforms to the electoral system as included in the 20th Amendment to the constitution will be taken up for discussion.
The SLFP had made preparations to put forth 20 recommendations on a mixed electoral system incorporating the past the post and proportional representation systems.
Media Spokesperson of the Party, Dilan Perera said that the preferential voting system will be made void with the enactment of the new electoral system. H also stated that the preferential voting system should be abolished. One hundred and sixty (160) members have been recommended to parliament on an electorate basis and 65 through proportional representation. When voting under the preferential voting system, recommendations have been put forth to vote the MPs to Parliament at the electorate level and national level.
The meeting saw the participation of the representatives of a number of parties including the JVP, JHU and TNA.
JHU Chairman Ven. Athuraliye Rathana Thero stated:
Five percent representation for minor parties has an impact on us and other parties including the JVP. Amendments should be made to the electoral system, without the change in composition between the representatives of the main parties and minor parties.
JVP Propoganda Secretary Vijitha Herath noted that the proportional system is a more democratised system and that they are not at crossroads to abolish the electoral system.
TNA MP M. Sumanthiran stated that they are planning on putting forth a few proposals of their recommendations to the government, by appointing a committee with the ones who are gathered here. He said:
We request them to halt the pending electoral reform.
Deputy Minister Foreign Affairs Ajith P. Perera noted that the elections commissioner, prime minister and the President may take certain decisions within the coming hours. These discussions will show the that the 20th Amendment to the constitution, as tabled by the Sri Lanka Freedom Party and the demarcation of boundary lines for electorates will take time. This cannot be done within three or six months as they say. Therefore, they are looking to see if there is an alternative in the meantime.
SLFP MP Dilan Perera noted that a golden opportunity has dawned in the Parliament to amend the electoral system as well as introduce the reduce the executive powers.  He said:
The SLFP will achieve what Ranil Wickremesinghe could not achieve. Therefore, the SLFP is of the view that these two changes must be made. If that is the case then both these matters can be addressed at once.

heading: Galewala statue of Lord Buddha goes missing – inves...
content:
The golden Standing Buddha statue at the Thambawa Purana Raja Maha Viharaya in Galewela has been stolen by an unidentified group.
The office of the Police Media Spokesperson stated that the chief incumbent of the Viharaya had lodged a complaint in this regard.
The suspects in the theft of the Standing Buddha statue of pure gold weighing 5 kilogrammes, have not been identified as yet. They remain at large.
The Galewela police are carrying out further investigations into the incident.

heading: Ratnapura, Kandy, Badulla, among areas under Landslide th...
content:
The National Building Research Organisation has stated that there exists a risk of landslides in the next 24 hours, due to the inclement weather that is being experienced.
Director of the Landslides Unit of the NBRO, R.M.S Bandara said that the Ratnapura, Kandy, Badulla, Kalutara, Matara and Galle districts face a threat from landslides.
He noted that this announcement which was made at 6.00 p.m. on Monday will be effective until 6.00 p.m. Tuesday.
Meanwhile, the Met Department has stated that showers or thundershowers may occur in many parts of the country on Tuesday.
Meteorologist, Malith Fernando said that temporary strong winds are expected in the areas expecting showers.

heading: Death of worker at Bambalapitiya school – details r...
content:
The post-mortem examination into the body that was discovered at a storage facility in a leading school in Colombo 4 was carried out on Monday April 20.
Police stated that extensive investigations are being conducted with the use of the information that was gathered from her phone records and other evidence that has been collected.
The victim was a forty-four-year-old mother of two, who was a janitor. The relatives had gone looking for the victim as she was missing after she left to work on Saturday morning. They stated that there were bruises  on her face when the body was found on the evening of Sunday April 19.
The relatives state that the deceased had worked in the school for over 14 years and had handed over the letter of resignation with plans to go abroad. However, the school had asked her to work until they found a replacement for her.
A relative of the deceased noted that after they opened the door they rang her phone and thereafter opened the room inside the main room.
She said:
That is when we saw her body. There were also signs of her being hit by a chair and stripped. The relatives were also concerned about how the door was closed and locked from outside. The security guard was the only person who has the keys. This incident has occurred when she had left to come home.
Meanwhile, investigations continued for the second day today at the premises.  The Police Canine Unit has been called in.

heading: Committee has acquitted the main accused in CBSL scam: An...
content:
Anti-corruption organisations allege that the Committee appointed to investigate the treasury bond scam, has acquitted the main accused, Central Bank Governor, Arjuna Mahendran.
They point out that it is evident the committee was appointed with the intention of acquitting the accused.
Investigative Business Journalist Faraz Shauketaly noted that the investigations carried out by this three-member committee has no weight at all. What is of concern is that Arjuna Mahendran has already admitted to a wrong-doing but the committee investigating this incident says that he hasn’t. He said:
The Prime Minister has made this a joke. If he is serious about having an investigation he should call for a parliamentary select committee at the very least.
Convener Voice Against Corruption Wasantha Samarasinghe noted that they are loyal to Ranil Wickremesinghe but that issue at hand is that the committee appointed by him has asked for information from Perpetual Capital. He said:
This is like getting the story from the rogue’s mother. This government has acquitted the accused in the biggest scam carried out in the 100 days. Now even the old rogues will think that they too can be acquitted. This is where the country is going.
Convener of the Anti Corruption Front Nishantha Sri Warnasinghe stated that they do not accept the investigation committee and the report given by them which says Arjuna Mahendran is acquitted in this case. He stated that an independent investigation committee has to be appointed, and that they have thus requested the President to conduct an investigation and enforce the law against the persons involved.
He said that they also hope to call for a debate when this report is presented to the parliament. The JHU too hopes to discuss this with other parties including the SLFP and take the necessary steps.
Leader of the Democratic Party Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka noted that the committee appointed comprises of several selfish persons. He said:
The Governor is not directly responsible – if people in other positions need to take responsibility then why pay a wage to the Governor and give him all the facilities by using taxpayers money. It does not serve any purpose for the country. There are people in this government who are trying to take the country back to where Percy Mahendra took it.

heading: Windows 10 to be launched in a few months
content:
It was just last month that Microsoft had confirmed that they would be releasing Windows 10 in the summer of 2015, but no specific dates were mentioned, meaning that we could be treated to the new platform at the start or towards the end.
However according to AMD’s president and CEO Lisa Su, it seems that she has confirmed that Windows 10 will be launching in late July.
Su made these claims during AMD’s latest earnings call last week. She was quoted as saying, “With the Windows 10 launch at the end of July, we are watching sort of the impact of that on the back-to-school season, and expect that it might have a bit of a delay to the normal back-to-school season inventory build-up.”
Of course AMD could simply be making a guess of their own and just giving a placeholder date, but given that this is an earnings call in which investors are involved, not to mention since AMD does make Windows-based computers, we suppose that they would be in the know with regards to Microsoft’s plans for releasing the platform.
At this point in time, Microsoft’s Windows 10 operating system is still in its technical preview stage and it still feels like Microsoft has a lot of things left to do. However Microsoft’s next Build conference will be held later this month where presumably we will be getting more information with regards to its launch, so do check back with us then for the details.

heading: Ven Maduluwave Sobitha Thera requests all parties to work...
content:
Venerable Maduluwawe Sobitha Thera has requested all parties to work towards passing the 19th Amendment to the Constitution.
A group comprising of religious leaders and civil activists gathered opposite Fort Railway Station requesting the passage of the 19th Amendment to the Constitution.
Ven. Maduluwawe Sobitha Thera stated:
No matter what party, ethnicity or religion you are in, this would be a victory of the people so please do not miss the chance.
The thero  also requested all MPs to please use their vote to pass the bill for the 19th Amendment to the constitution and re-establish democracy.

heading: CID to probe assets of former presidential chief of staff...
content:
The Colombo Chief Magistrate, Gihan Pilapitiya, has permitted the CID to investigate bank accounts and other assets that belong to the former president’s Chief of Staff, Gamini Senarath.
The Chief Magistrate has also permitted the CID to obtain statements from Gamini Senarath and nine other members of his family regarding the issue.
The officials of the CID’s Financial Division Special Unit requested for permission to investigate the bank accounts of Gamini Senarath and family as they have received various complaints that state that they have allegedly obtained various assets illegally.
Thus, the CID received permission from the magistrate to investigate and receive information about 80 bank accounts under their names.
The complaints against Senarath were made by Nishantha Sri Warnasinghe of the Jathika Hela Urumaya, on behalf of the Anti-Corruption Front.

heading: Seventeen convicts executed across Pakistan in one day
content:
Seventeen (17) individuals were sent for execution on Tuesday, 21st April, across Pakistan. The mass execution was marked as the highest number of executions in the country since the moratorium on death sentences was lifted.
It was reported that Central Jail Gujranwala, convicts Inayatullah, Zafar Iqbal and Mohammed Latif were hanged for his conviction of killing seven people of the same family in Wazirabad.
In Faisalabad, Mohammed Hussain and Nizamuddin were also executed for the killing three people in 1998 while Mohommed Azam who was convicted of murdering seven people of a family in 2004, was also executed. The trend followed as convicts Luqman and Saleem in Sialkot Jail, were sent to the gallows for the gang-rape of a minor in Qila Kalarwala in 1999.

heading: Update : Basil Rajapaksa arrested
content:
Former Minister of Economic Development Basil Rajapaksa was arrested by the Colombo Financial Crimes Division a short while ago. This was confirmed to News1st by Attorney at law U.R, de Silva, Counsel appearing on behalf of Basil Rajapaksa.
He went onto note that the B report is being compiled by the police adding that the former minister is due to be produced before the Kaduwela Magistrate along with two other persons.
Basil Rajapaksa appeared before the Financial Crimes Division on Wednesday (April 22nd) morning to provide a statement.
According to sources the former minister was questioned from around 11 am to 5 pm.
Basil Rajapaksa left the country soon after the presidential elections held in January and returned to the country on Tuesday (April 21st).
Meanwhile speaking to News1st, Police Media Spokesperson ASP Ruwan Gunasekara confirmed that Former Minister Basil Rajapaksa was charged under the ‘Public Property Act’, for the misuse of funds at the Divi Neguma dept during the last regime.
He said that Former Economic Development Ministry Secretary Dr. Nihal Jayatilaka and former Director General of the Divineguma Department, R.R.K. Ranawaka, also been arrested on the same charges.
ASP Gunasekara also noted that under the “public property act’ the decision on whether it is bailable or non-bailable offence is at the discretion of the magistrate.
meanwhile the Colombo magistrate has issued an interim injunction preventing protests from taking place outside the bribery commission.
However MP Basil Rajapaksa has been brought out of the Financial Crimes Investigations Department in Colombo.
Former Minister Basil Rajapaksa who was brought out of the the Police Financial Crimes Investigations Division after being arrested, arrived at the Kauduwela magistrate court a short while ago.

heading: AB de Villiers reveals his softer side (Watch video)
content:
Protease batsman who glorified his side at the recently concluded World Cup and is creating waves of cheer in the Indian Premier League has already won the hearts of many around the world.
In a candid video posted by Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB), South African batsman AB de Villiers reveals his softer side and where and how he proposed to his girlfriend Danielle.
The video is a part of Royal Challengers Bangalore’s promotional venture with the famous comedian Danish Sait, called the RCB Insider.

heading: Opposition calls for removal of CBSL Governor
content:
Opposition Leader Nimal Siripala de Silva has today called for the immediate removal of the Governor of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka.
He went on to add that PM Ranil Wickremesinghe has attempted to acquit the Governor of any wrong-doings. He stated that the president has appointed a commission to investigate the issue but PM Ranil Wikremesinghe has appointed a team compromising of junior lawyers affiliated to the UNP.
He further added that the commission appointed by the PM is looking to protect the Governor of CBSL and that the opposition calls for the president to not accept the report.
Deputy Minister of Policy Planning and Economic affairs, Dr Harsha de Silva stated that all preparations were made to submit the report in Parliament. He went on to add that due to the unrest that occurred in the parliament, the said report could not be submitted.
He further added that the CBSL was not directly involve in the decision to increase acceptance of bids from one million to 10 billion rupees. He also stated that questions have been raised about how Perpetual Treasuries was able to obtain a loan of billions of rupees from Bank of Ceylon and that this should be further investigated.

heading: Bribery Commission summons MP Duminda Silva
content:
Parliamentarian Duminda Silva was summoned to the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption on Wednesday April 22.
MP Duminda Silva arrived at the Commission in the morning.
MP Silva stated that he was summoned to make declarations on his assets and liabilities.

heading: Fruits of farmers’ labour fed to elephants in Digam...
content:
Farmers who make a living by selling their goods at Dambulla Economic Centre have been forced to discard their produce due to the lack of proper buyers.
According to our reporter in the area, large stocks of vegetables arrived in the Dambulla Economic Centre  during the new year season. However a majority of them had to be discarded due to the lack of vendors and consumers.
Thus, due to lack of proper procedure and state interference, stocks of vegetables at the Dambulla Economic Centre have now been provided as food to the wild elephants in Digampatha area by Dambulla Municipal Council.

heading: Frustrated man shoots his uncooperative computer
content:
Police in Colorado have cited a 37-year-old man for carrying his computer into an alley then shooting it eight times with a handgun after what authorities said had been a long battle with the uncooperative machine.
Lucas Hinch was cited for discharging a firearm within city limits after officers responded to a “shots fired” call early on Monday evening, the Colorado Springs police department said.
“Investigation revealed a resident was fed up with fighting his computer for the last several months,” a police statement entitled “Man Kills His Computer” said.
“He took the computer into the back alley and fired eight shots into the computer with a handgun, effectively disabling it.”
The Colorado Springs Gazette quoted police as saying Hinch had been good-natured about the citation, telling officers he had not realised he was breaking the law.
A judge will decide what penalty the citation carries.
Source : Guardian

heading: Fresh airstrikes reported in Yemen
content:
Air-strikes were reported today, April 22 four hours after the alleged end of the four week air campaign against the Houthi rebels.
Deputy Governor of Aden had stated that an air raid had targeted the rebel tanks and their allied forces in the southern port city. The headquarters of a brigade loyal to the president in the central city of Taiz that was overrun by Houthi rebels also fell target to the air-strike.
After its month long campaign “Decisive Storm” hat ended midnight on Tuesday the Saudi-led Coalition stated that its new campaign looks to protect civilians and prevent rebel fighting.
Brigadier-General Ahmed al-Asiri, the coalition’s spokesperson had said that the military goals set, regarding Yemen were achieved and the new operation would look to combat terrorism. However, he went on to add that the coalition had not ruled out future air strikes and they would continue to impose the naval blockade on Yemen

heading: Bayern Munich stun Porto in UEFA quarter finals
content:
The drama in the UEFA champions league continued as Germany’s Bayern Munich showed skill beyond FC Porto’s capabilities in the champions league Quarter Finals.
Bayern was 2 – nil behind Porto after their last game in Dragao Stadium,Portugal.
However, the home team was level in 22 minutes after Thiago Alcántara  headered one in from  close range to the bottom left corner from a cross from Juan Bernat and was Followed by Boateng scoring another header off Badstuber’s pass.
Lewondowski and Thomas Muller extended the lead by scoring 2 goals each within 10 mintue. Lewondowski continued the trend by throwing a right footed shot from the center of the box to the bottom left corner.
Bayern ended the first half with a five goal lead. Porto tried to scrape a win with Jackson Martínez scoring one header in to the net, but Bayern showed its strength by cementing the win with  Xabi Alonso scoring from a free kick with a right footed shot to the bottom left corner.
This win takes Bayern Munich on to the Champions league Semi-Finals on a, 6-1 (7-4 Aggregate), win.

heading: 100 people rescued in Australian storms
content:
Nearly 100 people have been rescued from floodwaters in Sydney and New South Wales as powerful storms continue to lash Australia’s east coast.
Three elderly people were found dead on Tuesday in Dungog, north of Sydney, where homes have been washed away by flooding. Some 200,000 homes across the state are still without power on Wednesday.
Australia’s weather agency has warned of more heavy rain and high winds before conditions begin to ease.
The Bureau of Meteorology (BoM) has said that gusts of 100km/h (62mph) are still possible along the coast and that thunderstorms could lead to flash flooding for parts of the Sydney area and Illawarra district.
Source:BBC
