heading: Stocks were cast aside before the New Year – allege...
content:
Large stocks of vegetables have been found being disposed at the Dambulla Economic Centre.
Farmers have stated that over the past few days prior to the Sinhala and Hindu New Year, their harvests have been cast aside. According to the farmers, the inability to clear stocks, hurt their income specially after paying taxes and transportation fees.
Traders have stated that the lack of sales is due to the inadequate knowledge of farmers.
U.R Dayanandasiri, Chairman of the Trade Union at the Dambulla Economic Centre said that there are crops fetching higher prices being grown all across the country. He further added that this trend will continue every year and will lead to excess stock.
He further added that farmers are not aware of the market situation and will continue cultivating excess crops.  He finally added that if the authorities do not take action, discussions will have to be held between the traders and farmers and that the excess stock is now the food for animals.

heading: Min. Pramitha Bandara predicts political change in the ne...
content:
Central Provincial Minister Pramitha Bandara Tennakoon says that a political change will take place in the near future.
He says that Chandrika  Bandaranaike became an icon because of the SLFP. Mahinda Rajapaksa became an icon, a hero, because of the SLFP and it was the same with President Maithripala Sirisena.
The Minister went on to note that if it was not for the SLFP, Mahinda Rajapaksa will be plain Mahinda Rajapaksa.
Speaking further, he says that its their responsibility to protect the SLFP, the party that moulded, provided strength and made them grow.

heading: Bangladesh seal Pakistan whitewash in Mirpur
content:
Opening batsman Soumya Sarkar hit a maiden one-day century as Bangladesh thrashed woeful Pakistan by eight wickets in Dhaka on Wednesday to sweep the one-day series 3-0.
The 22-year-old left-hander smashed an unbeaten 127 as the fired-up hosts surpassed Pakistan’s modest 250 all out in the 40th over at the Sher-e-Bangla stadium.
Pakistan captain Azhar Ali’s 100 made no difference to his team’s fortunes after Bangladesh had won the first match by 79 runs and the second by seven wickets.
It was the first series whitewash by the Tigers against an Asian Test-playing nation, and followed their appearance in the quarter-finals of the recent World Cup in Australia and New Zealand.
Bangladesh captain Mashrafe Mortaza said he was delighted at the way the team had shaped up in the past few months and hoped to continue the good work in future.
“This is a good team we have and I am really happy the way we are playing,” he said. “Soumya (Sarkar) was brilliant today but our work is not done yet. We will now focus on the remaining matches.”
The two teams will play a Twenty20 international on Friday before starting a two-Test series from April 28.
The win was never in doubt after Sarkar, who hit 13 boundaries and six sixes in his 110-ball innings, put on 145 for the first wicket with Tamim Iqbal.
Tamim, who had slammed centuries in the first two matches, missed a third consecutive hundred when he was leg-before to Junaid Khan for 64.
The left-arm seamer also bowled Mohammad Mahmudullah in his next over, but Mushfiqur Rahim (49 not out) ensured victory with an unbroken stand of 97 for the third wicket with Sarkar.
Pakistan were left to rue a dramatic collapse when they lost eight wickets for 47 runs after Azhar’s century had lifted them to a comfortable 203 for two in the 39th over.
Shakib Al Hasan, Mortaza, Arafat Sunny and Rubel Hossain claimed two wickets each as Bangladesh clawed their way back after wayward bowling earlier in the innings.
Azhar led from the front to become the first Pakistani captain in five years to score an one-day century following Shahid Afridi’s 124 against Bangladesh in 2010.
Nasir Hossain provided the breakthrough when he had the left-handed Aslam caught by wicket-keeper Rahim.
Senior all-rounder Mohammad Hafeez was bowled by Sunny for four to extend his batting misery in a series in which he compiled just eight runs in three matches.
Haris Sohail (52) added 98 with Azhar for the third wicket before the rot set in.
Azhar was bowled by Shakib and Mortaza dismissed Haris to launch Bangladesh’s comeback.
Source: NDTV

heading: Late former minister Reggie Ranatunga commemorated
content:
The late former minister Reggie Ranatunga was commemorated at his memorial in Udugampola, Gampaha today, Wednesday April 22.
Minister Arjuna Ranatunga stated that the late Minister Reggie Ranatunga is an inspiration to those in parliament today and that his immense services should be taken as examples by politicians of today.
Late Reggie Ranatunga entered politics in 1962 and was elected to parliament in 1989. He held several deputy ministerial positions and also served as the Chief Government Whip in Parliament.

heading: Bandaragama police officer’s killing – wife u...
content:
The wife and a relative of SI R.W. Palihawadana were arrested today in connection to his murder.
Following a call made by the deceased individual’s wife in early April, police found his body with inch long gashes to the neck.
SI Palihawadana who attached to the Bandaragama Police was killed on April 6.

heading: Irrigation Dept says farmers will benefit from ‘con...
content:
The Department of Irrigation says that they have been able to release water for farmers to cultivate during the Yala season, as a result of the continuous rains.  The department pointed out that the continuous rains experienced across the country and that water released to farmers is sufficient to cultivate 285 000 hectares of land during the Yala Season.
They went on to state that last year, as a result of the drought, medium and large scale cultivations could not be harvested at 100% but this year such a situation would not arise.
When News1st contacted Director of the Water Management Unit at the Department of Irrigation Janaki Meegatenna in this regard, she said that the supply of water for cultivations commenced in March, and that it is continuing.

heading: Strong winds reported in several areas; Moratuwa, Ratnapu...
content:
The Disaster Management Centre stated that strong winds blowing across the country have caused damages to houses in a number of areas.
Assistant Director of the DMC, Pradeep Kodippili noted that it is reported that houses in the Lunawa area in Moratuwa, and the Parakaduwa area in Ratnapura were damaged as a result of strong winds.
He further stated that officers from the DMC have been deployed to assess the damage caused to houses in those areas.

heading: Fire breaks out at Orugodawatte crude oil storage facility
content:
A fire broke out in an oil tank at the crude oil storage facility in Orugodawatte last night, April 24.
Chairman of the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation, Ranjith Wickremasinghe said that the fire broke out after the oil tank was struck by lightning.
He added that steps were taken to douse the fire within a short time.

heading: No confidence motion against Ekanayake forwarded to AG: R...
content:
Opposition Leader of the Central Provincial Council Ranjith Aluwihare charges that the No-Confidence Motion against the Chief Minister of the Central Province has been forwarded by the Secretary of the Council to the Attorney General.
Aluwihare claims that the motion was forwarded to the Attorney General after the Chief Minister exerted pressure on the Secretary of the Council.
Meanwhile, Chief Minister of the Central Province, Sarath Ekanayake said that he hoped to obtain a legal response to the No Confidence Motion that was forwarded against him.

heading: The Rajapaksas are not thieves – says former presid...
content:
Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa visited his brother, Basil Rajapaksa, at the National Hospital, Colombo on Friday.
Former Minister Basil Rajapaksa, who was remanded until May 5, continues to remain at the Merchant Ward of the National Hospital in Colombo.
After visiting Basil Rajapaksa, the former president said that he has to say and make it clear that the Rajapaksas are not thieves.He went on to say that these are political decisions and added that he see this as an act of revenge.

heading: Details of ‘100 day program’ revealed (Watch ...
content:
Secretary to the President,P.B. Abeykoon, at a media briefing today stated that certain tasks promised under the hundred day program will take longer due to the procdure that has to be followed. He added that these matters must be first presented to the parliment before it can taken care of. He also added that tasks pertaining to two bills are 90 percent complete and that 45 out of hundred activities have been fulfilled. He further added that there has been a 51% completion rate and that funds have been allocated.
Adviser to the President Tilak Ranaviraja and others were also present for this media briefing.

heading: Rajitha Senaratne expresses views on the 19th Amendment (...
content:
Minister Rajitha Senaratne stated on Thursday, while taking part in the Satana political debate programme, that he does not support the sections of the 19th Amendment to the Constitution that cites the imprisonment of journalists under criminal charges.
He stated that when the 19th Amendment to the Constitution was put forward, sections citing that journalist can be imprisoned under criminal charges were included. He went on to add that Section 28 of the bill reads that under election law or a referendum, in the event that guidelines issued by the elections commissioner during an election or a referendum are not complied with, legal action can be taken on criminal charges, even against privately-owned media institutions to which the maximum punishment is a prison sentence of three years or a fine not exceeding Rs.100,000.
He further confirmed that any business or other undertaking vested in the government and a company registered or deemed to be registered under the Companies Act, No 7 of 2007, in which the government, a public corporation or any local authority holds more than 40% of the shares, thereby that an owner of a private radio station or television service or newspaper or publication can be charged for a wrong-doing
Executive Director for the Campaign for Free and Fair Election,Keerthi Tennakoon, had stated that the supreme court had made its stance clear regarding matters in relation to media. He went on to add that Article 14 of the constitution refers to the right of expression which will collide with the 19th amendment.
MP, Dinesh Gunawardene had stated that there is no definite stance on the 19th Amendment to the constitution and that the government is trying to bring in amendments in violation to the decisions given by the Supreme Court.

heading: Arrest of Basil used by PM as a warning to Sajith Premada...
content:
State minister of Housing and Samurdhi Dilan Perera says that Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe used the arrest of MP Basil Rajapaksa as a warning for Minister Sajith Premadasa.
Addressing a media briefing held on Friday April 24 the state minister noted that MP Basil Rajapaksa was arrested based on charges that he created a Rs.10,000 aid scheme for samurdhi beneficiaries to build their homes. He noted that MP Basil was only able to give away Rs.2,500 of this money.
The state minister also revealed that after taking office, Minister Sajith Premadasa took steps to set up a low-interest loan scheme for non samurdhi beneficiaries utilizing funds of samurdhi beneficiaries. Dilan Perera stated that even though the Min. Premadasa may have created the scheme with good intentions, it contradicted the Samurdhi act and therefore requested President Maithripala Sirisena to make it legal.
Referring once again to the arrest of MP Basil Rajapaksa, Dilan Perera noted that no allegations were leveled that the parliamentarian skimmed money for himself. As a result of this the State Minister opines that the arrest of Basil Rajapaksa was used by the Prime Minister to send a clear message to Sajith Premadasa.

heading: Samurdhi and the agriculture officers demand that promise...
content:
A demonstration was staged in Battaramulla on Friday, charging that none of the promises made to Samurdhi beneficiaries and officials were fulfilled.
A number of trade unions including the All Ceylon Samurdhi Development and the Agriculture Officers Association engaged in the demonstration.
The group which marched from the Samurdhi Ministry to the Sethsiripaya in Battaramulla met with Secretary to the Ministry and accepted a petition with the intention of handing it over to the minister.
Jagath Kumara ,Chairman of All Ceylon Samurdhi Development and Agricultural Officers Associataion, stated that Sajith Premadasa had told the country the EPF and gratuity subsidies will increase by 200%. However, he added that no such increment was seen.
Arundika Fernando of the SLFP stated that the previous government toppled as it interfered with the Samurdhi beneficiaries. He said that legal action has to be taken against Sajith Premadasa
MP Namal Rajapaksa of the UPFA went on to state that the Samurdhi Bank should not be destroyed by being used as a political tool.
The protest has caused much inconvenience to the public arriving at the Divi Neguma Bank due to officials engaging in the protest.
However, convening a media briefing on Thursday, the All Ceylon United Samurdhi Development Officers Association stated that they condemn this protest led only by one political party. Lalith D. Priyantha, Chief Secreatary of the All Ceylon United Samurdhi Development Officers Association stated that a circular has been issued to alter the office allowance for field officers to Rs 500 from Rs 300.
Anura Bandara Ariyaratne, Chairman of All Ceylon United Samurdhi Development Officers Association had stated that the Divi Neguma officers want to solve these problems but it is not advisable to join the followers of the Trade Union
Organiser, J.M Shantha Bandara however went on to add that Jagath Kumara who left the Samurdhi Beneficiaries is facing a problem of building stability and that the beneficiaries must understand this.

heading: Sajith Premadasa condemns protests on Samurdhi are organi...
content:
Speaking at an event in Hambantota, Minister of Housing and Samurdhi, Sajith Premadasa shared his views regarding the protest that took place on April 24 in Battaramulla, Colombo.
Minister Sajith stated that these protests are being organised by politicians who allegedly took money from the country for personal use and it was them that robbed the Samurdhi beneficiaries.
He went on to add that even though the poorest of people who have been provided with concessions through good governance, individuals staging the protest are looking to cause unnecessary unrest. He further added that with the new governance, money is making its way to all communities and it is being shared amongst the common people.

heading: CBSL Governor’s return challenged (Watch video)
content:
Anti-Corruption activists on Friday charged the Governor of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka, regarding his return to work even before Parliament has made a decision on the controversial CBSL Treasury Bond Issue.
Nishantha Sri Warnasinghe, Convenor of the Anti-Corruption Front, had stated that the president must intervene to resolve this matter. He went on to add that the Governor Arjuna Mahendran’s return to work is a decision that can be determined only by the Parliment and that the governor should respectfully step down to make provisions for an independent and proper investigation to be carried out.
Convener of the Voice Against Corruption, Wasantha Samarasinghe added that it is PM Ranil Wickremesinghe, who is pushing for the return of Arjuna Mahendran as the governor of CBSL. He went on to add that a request has been made to the president to intervene and conduct a proper investigation.
UPFA MP, Bandula Gunawardena stated that the Prime Minister has appointed three of his associates to the committee and that committee now says that the Governor of the Central Bank was not directly involved in the issue. He added that the Committee also says that there were discrepancies in the entire process and the governor has returned before these details had a chance to be presented to Parliament. He also added that this would prove to be a major blow to the entire monetary and financial market of the country, as well as to the Stock Exchange.
Professor G.L.Peiris of the UPFA stated that there is a lack of interest regarding the investigation of a large scale fraud. He went on to add that there has been no punishments meted out to those who committed such crimes and it is questionable if this is due to an impartial procedure or a political procedure.

heading: Meeting between president and former president cannot tak...
content:
Parliamentarian Kumara Welgama says that the meeting between the President and the former president cannot take place due to issues that have arisen. During the past few days discussions took place to conduct this meeting as two groups of members from the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP).
UPFA MP Kumara Welgama noted that the time arranged by the SLFP, 25th at 7 p.m, is not the right time for the meeting as government officials are being questioned and some are being remanded. The MP went on to say that if continued in this manner, the officers working now will have to face the issues no matter which government comes into power. The MP also noted that the reception the Rajapaksa’s are receiving is also an issue as personal vengeance is not conductive during an attempt to reach an agreement.
UPFA Parliamentarian Dilan Perera ,questioned if it is correct or not to form the SLFP perspective to refrain from holding discussion because the actions of a judge is challenged as the court has issued an order and the individual has been remanded as per the order. The parliamentarian went on to say that in the future if a person is arrested or taken to court for the right reason, the allegations, if there are any, should be faced.

heading: All party activities must be carried out on common platfo...
content:
President Maithripala Sirisena made a statement at an SLFP representatives convention held in Galle on Saturday, April 26.
He stated that  he will undertake the responsibility to re-instate SLFP’s lost victory following the elections held on January 8  and that he has made all efforts in this concern ever since he accepted the post of SLFP Chairman.
He went on to say that in the past three months, all government related tasks as well as steps to strengthen the SLFP were undertaken with great commitment and in carrying out amendments to the party’s constitution, opportunity was opened for the former presidents, prime ministers and party seniors to work together.
He further noted that all party activities must be carried out on one common platform devoid of party separatism.

heading: UEFA champions league semi final match-ups decided today
content:
The semi-final match ups of the UEFA champions league was decided today, April 24  by a draw.
Bayern Munich was drawn with FC Barcelona for the first semi-final on May 5. Barcelona has managed to win 4 out of 7 championships prior to this and the Germany’s BayernMunich have seen wins in five out of 10 appearances in the Champions league final.
Both teams look to steal the trophy as Barcelona took down Paris-Saint Germain on an aggregate of 5-1 and Bayern Munich stunned Porto with a 6 goals to 1 on aggregate win, last week.
Real Madrid who stumped Rivals Atletico Madrid 1-0,by scoring during injury time ,in the second leg, will see Italian giants Juventus on the 6th of May. Real Madrid has seen its names on 10 champions trophy’s including last year where they took down Atletico for 4-1. The star studded squad has been well versed when coming to snatching the trophy with 10 wins from 13 games after appearing in the finals.
The hype for the finals are building up as the potential for an El Classico grows and it will be the first time that the two Spanish rivals will be meeting under these circumstances.
However, Bayern Munich will be gearing up with the destructive force of players like Schweinsteiger,Gotze and veteran goalkeeper Manuel Neuer, are also favorites going in.
Juventus who has two UEFA cup trophies under its belt will have an uphill struggle but has proven itself against big opponents before.

heading: President hands over appointment letters to SLFP’s ...
content:
President Maithripala Sirisena has handed over appointment letters to five new electorate organisers of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP).
North Western Province Chief Minister Dayasiri Jayasekara was appointed as Sri Lanka Freedom Party organiser for Bingiriya electorate while Western Provincial Council Minister Nimal Lanza was appointed as the organiser for the Wattala Electorate.
In addition, the Mayor of Ampara, Indika Nalin Jayawickrama, has been appointed as the organiser of Ampara South, while Sabaragamuwa Provincial Councilor Udayakantha Gunetileka and Chairman of the Warakapola Provincial Council Keerthisiri Wijethunge were appointed as co-organisers for the Dedigama Electorate.

heading: MP Dullas Alahapperuma apologizes over the National Flag ...
content:
UPFA MP Dullas Alahapperuma apologized on Friday for the use a flag similar to the National Flag at the demonstration on Thursday opposite the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption.
He made this apology speaking at a press conference at the Parliamentary Complex.
Speaking to media he said that he was disappointed over the incident and apologized for it adding that such an incident should not have taken place. He went on to say that in the future they will not steer or support such form of protests.
Speaking further he said that if anyone’s sentiments were affected he deeply apologizes to them.

heading: Ranjith Aluwihare comments on non-confidence motion again...
content: Central Province Opposition leader Ranjith Aluwihare on Thursday commented on the non-confidence motion that has been signed by 19 members of the provincial council against the Chief Minister of the Province Sarath Ekanayake.

heading: Preparations begin for the Sirasa Vesak Zone (Video)
content:
Preparations are under way for the Sirasa – John Keells Vesak Zone commemorating the three stages of Lord Buddha’s life. The Sirasa – John Keells Vesak Zone will take place in line with the Vesak Full Moon Poya Day.
The Kap erecting ceremony marking the commencement of this endeavor took place at the Head Office of the Capital Maharaja Organisation down Baybrook Place, Colombo 2 this morning.
The Maha Sangha who were present for the event chanted Pirith to bless the endeavor which followed with the Kap erecting ceremony for the Sirasa – John Keells Vesak Zone.
A group including senior officials of The Capital Maharaja Organisation Limited were present for the occasion.

The Sirasa – John Keells Vesak Zone which will see the sacred of relics of Lord Buddha and the Maha Rahath Threros at an exposition will take place for three days, May 3 – 5.
Devotees visiting the Sirasa John Keells Vesak Zone will be able to pay homage to the relics without any difficulty with preparations also being made in association with the John Keells Group for the Amisa Pooja As well.

heading: Notices issued to 27 protesters including former minister...
content:
Twenty seven (27) individuals who protested opposite the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption on Thursday have been issued with notices. According to the police, former ministers and parliamentarians are among the individuals who were issued with notices.
The said individuals include MPs Dullas Alahapperuma, Gamini Lokuge, Bandula Gunawardena, Sarath Weerasekara, S.M. Chandrasena, Weerakumara Disanayake and Uditha Lokubandara. Provincial Councillors Prasanna Ranatunge, Upali Kodikara, and Rogger Seneviratne are also among those who were issued with notices.
Furthermore, nine Buddhist monks are also included in the group of 27 individuals. The Colombo Magistrate issued a court order previously banning any protest from taking place opposite the Commission. However, the said individuals ignored the court order and continued with the protest.

heading: Sachin Tendulkar: Interesting facts about the birthday boy
content:
A big day for Indian cricket fans as Master Blaster Sachin Tendulkar turned 42 on Friday. Sachin may have retired from cricket in November 2013 but Indian fans haven’t clearly moved on.
He continues to be an inspiration for sports persons across the world! Here’s a look at 10 lesser known off the field facts about the birthday boy.

Sachin used to sleep with his cricket gear during his junior days. Contrary to what you’d imagine, he was a big bully in school!
 14-year old Sachin became the youngest player to be included in Mumbai’s Ranji Team
Sachin Tendulkar wore pad gifted to him by Sunil Gavaskar during his debut Test vs Pakistan
When Sachin won the man-of-match award for his first Test ton in 1990, he was given a champagne bottle. However, he could not pop it open as he was below 18 years. He went on to open it on his daughter, Sara’s first birthday in 1998.
A music lover, Sachin loves listening to Kishore Kumar and the rock band Dire Straits.
Sachin Tendulkar’s first car was a Maruti-800. He’s still very fond of cars and is so possessive of his Ferrari that he would not allow his wife Anjali to drive it!
The first brand that Sachin endorsed was health drink ‘Boost’. He even featured in many TV adverts alongside Kapil Dev starting 1990.
Sachin is ambidextrous. He bats with his right hand, but writes with his left. He shares this trait with other personalities such as Tom Cruise, Jimi Hendrix, Rafael Nadal and Einstein.
Tendulkar is the first sportsperson without an aviation background to be awarded the honorary rank of Group Captain by the Indian Air Force.
Sachin’s wife would never eat or drink while Sachin was batting! Talk about lady luck!

Source: NDTV

heading: Tesla’s site and Twitter hacked
content:
Seems like it’s going to be a rough Saturday for Tesla’s IT department: they’ve just had both their website and Twitter account hijacked.
Tesla CEO Elon Musk’s personal Twitter account was seemingly hacked briefly around this 3.50 p.m.
The first signs of the hijacking popped up around 1:52 p.m. pacific, when a tweet from the account declared that it was now under the control of its attackers, and the account’s name was changed from “Tesla Motors” to “#RIPPRGANG”.
A few minutes later, the account began promising free Teslas to those who followed certain accounts or to those who called a certain phone number. A quick search suggests that the number belongs to a computer repair shop in Illinois, and was presumably tweeted out to flood the number’s owner with calls. We’ve censored the number in the above screenshot for obvious reasons.
At nearly the same time, Tesla’s website was edited to declare that it’d been hacked by the same attackers. As of 2:15 p.m., the site had been taken offline — but in the hours since, it’s returned with the hijacked page multiple times. Its Twitter account, meanwhile, still seems to be hijacked.

heading: Home Affairs Ministry says Rs.8 billion arrears given to ...
content:
The Ministry of Home Affairs stated that arrears valued at Rs.8 billion  due for various development projects carried out in the past has been distributed to district secretaries.
Ministry Secretary, S.D.A.B. Boralessa said that the funds will be distributed on behalf of projects that have already been completed.
In addition to this, Rs.23,000 million will also be distributed on behalf of projects that have commenced by now.
He added that further action will be taken in future for distribution of such funds and that these funds will later be allocated after a complete assessment on the respective projects.

heading: Accident on Dambulla – Habarana Road claims a life
content:
One person was skilled and fourteen people suffered injuries as a van collided with a lorry on the Dambulla – Habarana main road in the Palwehera area.
The injured had been admitted to the Dambulla Hospital for treatment. A 46 year old who resides in the Madatugama area was killed in the accident.
According to reports, the accident occurred when they were returning from a funeral.

heading: Nepal earthquake: Search for survivors continues
content:
Many countries and international charities have offered aid to Nepal to deal with the disaster.
Seventeen people have been killed on Mount Everest by avalanches – the mountain’s worst-ever disaster.
Officials fear that the death toll could rise as the desperate search for survivors continues.
The 7.8 magnitude quake struck an area of central Nepal between the capital, Kathmandu, and the city of Pokhara on Saturday morning.
The latest home ministry figures say 1,805 people were killed and 4,718 people were injured.
There were also victims in India, Bangladesh, in the Chinese region of Tibet and on Mount Everest, where avalanches were triggered.
Little information has emerged from the epicentre, where extensive damage has been reported, and there are fears the death toll could rise yet further.
According to the Nepal Presidential Media Unit reports it is stated that about 120 students are been educated in Nepal and none of them have sustained injuries.
It is the worst earthquake to strike Nepal since one in 1934 which killed some 8,500 people.

heading: SLA general amnesty ends – thousands of personnel f...
content:
Twenty five thousand six hundred (25,600) army personnel who fled the Army have formally resigned from the forces during the period of general amnesty.
Army spokesperson Brigadier Jayanath Jayaweera stated that the amnesty period ended on the evening of Saturday, April 25.
He went on note that strict legal action will be taken against army deserters who failed to formally resign during the general amnesty period.

heading: BREAKING NEWS: Another earthquake hits Nepal
content:
A powerful, magnitude 6.7 aftershock shook the Kathmandu area of Nepal on Sunday, a day after the massive earthquake devastated the region with more than 1,900 deaths and destroyed homes and infrastructure.
The U.S. Geological Survey says the aftershock registered at a very shallow depth of 10 kilometers (6 miles) and that damage was very likely within a radius of 50 kilometers (31 miles). The epicenter was Kodari, around 80 km east of Kathmandu.
The ground rumbled as the tremor sent people yelling and running for open ground.

heading: Sri Lankan relief workers leave for Nepal
content:
The first air craft carrying relief items and a team of relief workers to assist in aid work in the earthquake hit regions in Nepal left the Katunayake International Airport on the morning of Sunday, April 26.
Army Spokesperson, Brigadier Jayanath Jayaweera stated that that the team of relief workers includes 44 army personnel and four consultant doctors.
Meanwhile, medical equipment, essential electrical items and bottled drinking water is among relief items being taken by air to Nepal. The Sri Lanka Air Force aircraft is due to reach Nepal later.
Brigadier Jayaweera added that two other aircraft carrying 156 relief workers including 14 army personnel are due to leave the airport. Meanwhile, the Sri Lankan Ambassador in Nepal, W.M. Seneviratne noted that the Kathmandu International Airport has been closed for air traffic and added that however, discussions have been made regarding the arrival of Sri Lankan flights carrying relief aid.
More than 1,000 people have been killed in Nepal’s deadliest earthquake for more than 80 years. The 7.8 magnitude quake struck an area of central Nepal between the capital, Kathmandu, and the city of Pokhara. There were also victims in India, Bangladesh, Tibet and on Mount Everest, where avalanches were triggered.
The government has declared a state of emergency in the affected areas, and help has been offered by countries around the world.

heading: Two individuals arrested in Colpetty for allegedly transp...
content:
Two individuals have been arrested near 13th Lane, Colpetty while they were allegedly transporting a stock of Heroin. Police say the raid took place based on a tip-off which was received by the Walana Eradication Unit.
According to the police, 2.4 grams of Heroin were found in the suspects’ possession. Police went on to note that the suspects were 27 and 33 year old residents from the Mount Lavinia and Badowita area respectively.
The Hybrid vehicle used by them for allegedly transporting these drugs has been taken into police custody.

heading: Uma Oya Project Cabinet Sub Committee Report to be comple...
content:
The Ministry of Mahaweli Development and Environment stated that the report compiled by the cabinet sub committee on the Uma Oya Project will be completed by next week.
Secretary, Nihal Rupasinghe noted that the committee will convene in  Parliament on April 28.
Further, he added that the Cabinet Sub-committee appointed to look into the Uma Oya Project is currently in the process of studying the environmental analysis report.
The Committee headed by Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake includes the Chief Minister of Uva Province and three other ministers.
A cabinet decision will be made on the construction of the Uma Oya Multi-Purpose Development Project following the submission of the sub-committee report.

heading: President instructs that immediate relief be provided; ov...
content:
President Maithripala Sirisena has expressed his and the government’s consolation to the people who fell victim to the devastating earthquake that struck Nepal on Saturday. Issuing a communique earlier Saturday evening, the President’s Media Division says that the Head of State had instructed the respective divisions to provide every possible relief that could be given from the Sri Lankan Government to the people in Nepal.
The communique reads that a special discussion on providing relief to the quake affected Nepal took place on Saturday evening at the Presidential Secretariat presided by the Secretary to the President. It goes on to say that a group of 26 specialist doctors attached to the Sri Lanka Army and four specialist doctors from the Ministry of Health will leave for Nepal at dawn on Sunday.
The communique goes on to say that a consignment of medicine and dry rations will also be sent to Nepal, along with the team of medical personnel. It also says that another medical team of 180 personnel from the Sri Lanka Army are on standby to be sent to Nepal, if the need arises.
At the discussion that took place on Saturday, it was decided that a group of Sri Lankan students in Nepal can return to the country, if they wish to do so, aboard the same C130 Sri Lanka Air Force plane that will carry the medical team to Nepal on Sunday.

heading: MPs violated pledge made to Parliament by using a distort...
content:
Speaking on displaying of an altered flag similar to the national flag during a protest held on Thursday, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said that the MPs have violated the pledge made to  Parliament, by using a distorted flag that is similar to the national flag.
The Prime Minister went on to say that anyone can take actions against the MPs and Provincial Councillors, no matter their designation. The PM made this statement while attending an event to present laptops to students who obtained 9 A passes at the GCE Ordinary Level Examination from the Uva Province. The event took place at the Postal Department auditorium in Badulla.
Later in the day, the Prime Minister also attended an event to commemorate Former Chief Minister of the Uva Province, Percy Samaraweera. Speaking at the commemoration, the PM spoke on the overnight protest held in the Parliament. He stated that a ring belonging to an MP was lost during the protest. When the PM questioned the worth of the ring, a member in the audience claimed that it was worth Rs. 2.7 million to which the PM reacted by asking if the MP has declared it in his assets.

heading: Min. John Amaratunga says local government authorities wi...
content:
Minister of Public Order and Christian Affairs, John Amaratunga says that all local government authorities will be dissolved on  May 15.
There are 335 local government authorities in Sri Lanka which includes 23 Municipal Councils, 41 Urban Councils and 271 Pradeshiya Sabhas. The tenure of a majority of these local government authorities are already over.
Minister John Amaratunga also said that a government officer will be appointed to continue with the operations and added that there need not be politics for it, only facilities without financial fraud.

heading: NCPA initiates special police team to protect children
content:
The National Child Protection Authority says that a special police team is to be initiated to ensure the protection of children.
Chairperson of the NCPA, Natasha Balendra said that the authority is currently holding talks with the police and the Attorney General’s Department in this regard.
Balendra said that police officers enrolled into this team would receive special training to ensure the protection of children. Speaking to News1st, the Chairperson of the NCPA said that police officers in the country are not trained to deal with children’s affairs, and that the initiation of a special unit would solve this problem.

heading: First round of Iran nuclear deal talks end on negative note
content:
The first round of talks on pushing forward the final Iran nuclear deal ended after three days of discussions in Vienna on Friday, but disputes between the United States and Iran are still unsolved.
At the top of the agenda for the talks was the timing of sanctions relief, but the U.S. and Iran continue to hold different or even opposite opinions on the procedures for sanctions relief.
The latest round of nuclear talks kicked off with a bilateral meeting between Iran and the European Union on Wednesday.
On April 2, Iran and P5+1 countries, namely the United States, Britain, France, Russia, China and Germany, reached a framework deal in which Iran agreed to reduce its nuclear program, and in return, the P5+1 agreed to lift certain sanctions imposed on Tehran.
Iran and P5+1 have set June 30 as the deadline for a final deal.

heading: Police begin investigations following complaints over alt...
content:
A group of lawyers including Attorney-at-Law Shiraz Noordeen filed a complaint at the Cinnamon Gardens Police over the use of a flag similar to the national flag. In their complaint, the lawyers cited that the minority has been neglected in the act of distorting the national flag. They added that the plegdes made by the public representatives too had been disgraced.
Speaking to the media, Attorney-at-Law Shiraz Noordeen stated that the complaint was made as citizens of the country and not on the requirement of any organisation or political need. He added that under section 120 of the Penal Code, it is an offence, where an arrest can be made without a warrant.
When News 1st made inquiries from the Police Media Spokesperson on the measures which will be taken over the complaint, he said that apart from the complaint that was made to the Cinnamon Gardens Police on Saturday, senior DIG of the Western Province has also been vested with carrying out the investigations into the complaint. ASP Ruwan Gunasekara noted that investigations will take place over both complaints.

heading: Renowned actor Daya Alwis passes away
content:
Renowned actor Daya Alwis, who was being treated in Sri Jayawardenapura Hospital, after sustaining injuries following a motor accident, has passed away.
Hospital Director Dr. Susitha Senarathna said that Daya Alwis was admitted to hospital ten days ago.
Daya Alwis was born in 1944 in the village of Payagala and studied at the Kaluthara College.
He commenced life as an artist when he travelled to India to study music and worked as a sound mixer for on stage events.
In 1966 Daya Alwis produced his first ever film.
Due to his love for acting and drama he went looking for better horizons in 1966 where he took part in Colomba Sanniya as well as Wasantha Obeysekara’s Walmathwuwo.
After the launch of his career he took part in Madol Duwa, Sarungalaya, Pooja, Maya and several other movies, while being nominated for the National Awards.
He also took part in several televison dramas such as Bodima, and Wedha Hamine.

heading: Indrajith Cooray sets new Sri Lankan Marathon Record
content:
Anurudha Indrajith Cooray has finished 14th in the London Marathon in two hours , 13 minutes and 47 seconds.
In the process he has broken the Sri Lankan marathon record, previously held by SLB Rosa set in 1975.

heading: Update: Devastating earthquake hits Nepal; India affected...
content:
Massive tremors lasting well over a minute were felt across northern India after a 7.5 magnitude earthquake hit Nepal on Saturday morning.
Tremors were felt across eastern and northern parts of India, said JL Gautam, Head Operations Seismology of Indian Meteorological Department (IMD). “Earthquake of magnitude 7.5 occurred today at 11.41 AM between latitude 28.1 North and Longitude 84.6 East. The epicentre was located in Nepal,” an IMD statement said.
In Delhi and parts of the National Capital Region, people were seen running out of their houses after buildings shook for well over a minute. However, there are no reports of any damage in Delhi.
Tremors were also felt in Patna, Lucknow, Kolkata, Jaipur, Chandigarh and other cities.
Nearly half an hour after the first tremors, aftershocks were felt again around 12:20 pm across North India. The quake has caused damage in various parts of Nepal’s capital Kathmandu. There are reports of buildings coming down in the Nepal capital.
Foreign media reports say that over 1800 people have been killed.

 

 
Following footage of the post-quake aftermath has been uploaded into YouTube by the Associated Press:

heading: SL nurses, relief workers ready to leave for Nepal –...
content:
Sri Lankan students receiving education in Nepal have been severely affected by the recent earthquake. The group includes one hundred and twenty (120) medical students studying at the Manipal University in Nepal
The students noted that they were greatly inconvenienced due to tremors that were felt on Saturday and Sunday.
They also noted that they spent two nights at the sports ground opposite the university.
Meanwhile, nurses trade unions say that around 200 nurses have volunteered to go to Nepal in order to provide relief service to those affected by the earthquake in Nepal.
Issuing a release, the prime minister’s office noted that the most essential service in Nepal at present is medical, accordingly the release requests the services of doctors and nurses.
The release further reads that those who wish to volunteer to provide relief services may contact the PM’s office. Chairman of the Government Nursing Officers Association, Saman Ratnapriya said that 100 nurses are ready to leave for Nepal at any given time.
Meanwhile,  Media Spokesperson of the Government Medical Officers Association Dr Naveen de Soysa said that measures have been taken to release the necessary numbers of doctors to be sent to Nepal for relief services.
Yet another Air Force plane carrying medical supplies to those affected in Nepal is due to leave the country on Monday.
The Presidential Media Unit noted that these measures were taken under special instructions of the president with the coordination of the commanders of the tri-forces. The plane is to carry 4000 kilogrammes of medicine, food and drinking water.
Meanwhile, a special discussion was held at the Presidential Secretariat on Sunday afternoon to discuss further relief that can be provided to those affected in Nepal.
The Presidential Media Unit noted that the discussion was attended by ministers, ministerial secretaries, commanders of the three forces and senior police officials.
Accordingly, it was decided that a  24-hour coordination centre be set up under the management of the Disaster Management Centre.
The Presidential Media Unit further noted several more air force  planes will leave for Nepal carrying essential items in the next few days.

heading: News1st and MTV/MBC launch ‘Sri Lanka for Nepal’
content:
The News1st and MTV/MBC media network have initiated a relief programme for the people of Nepal, who have been stricken by a major earthquake and its aftershocks.
You could contribute by donating items as drinking water, milk powder, blankets and new clothes to be given to those affected.
Your donations will be most welcome and can be dropped off at No 330, T.B. Jayah Mawatha (Harrison’s Complex along Darley Road).

heading: As Japan’s population ages, robots seen as workforc...
content:
A crowd gathers near the entrance of Tokyo’s upscale Mitsukoshi Department Store, which traces its roots to a kimono shop in the late 17th century.
Fitting with the store’s history, the new greeter wears a traditional Japanese kimono while delivering information to the growing crowd, whose expressions vary from amusement to bewilderment.
It’s hard to imagine the store’s founders in the late 1600’s could have imagined this kind of employee.
That’s because the greeter is not a human — it’s a robot.
Aiko Chihira is an android manufactured by Toshiba, designed to look and move like a real person. It was put on temporary display at the department store.
Toshiba says Chihira has 43 motors allowing it to move, speak in sign language and even sing.
The regular greeter, Ayako Seiryu, says she’s not worried about a robot replacing her — even one made to resemble a real 32-year-old woman.
“Communication is important,” she says. “My strength is I can actually talk to people.”
Chihira can’t have a conversation yet, acknowledges Hitoshi Tokuda, Toshiba spokesperson. But he says the technology is evolving quickly and someday, robots like Chihira could replace humans for certain jobs.
A growing number of Japanese businesses are testing out robots as a possible solution to the country’s shrinking workforce.
They’re appearing in stores, banks and soon even hotels. Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi UFJ is trying out “Nao,” a customer service robot that answers basic questions and is designed to speak 19 languages. The robotic polygot could prove useful serving foreign customers during the 2020 Tokyo Olympics.
By then, the bank hopes to have even more robots on staff.
“Pepper” is a humanoid robot that “chats” with customers. A humanoid has human-like characteristics such as arms, legs and a head — but is designed to look like a robot. Pepper first began appearing in Tokyo stores last year.
Manufacturer Softbank hopes it’ll eventually be a “family robot,” like a sleeker version of Rosie on “The Jetsons.”
Meet Pepper — the world’s first emo robot
A hotel scheduled to open at Huis Ten Bosch theme park in Nagasaki this summer plans to have 10 robot staff members and aims to increase that to more than 90% of hotel services operated by robots.
Today’s novelty could be tomorrow’s necessity. Japan has an aging population that has prompted serious talks about how to incorporate robots into the nation’s shrinking workforce.
One group that seems willing to embrace robots are Japan’s senior citizens.
A survey by nursing home operator Orix Living found more seniors would feel comfortable being cared for by a robot than a foreign nurse.
In a nation with a dwindling population, waning workforce, and deep resistance to immigration, it seems robots will only play a larger role in Japan’s future.
By Will Ripley
-CNN

heading: Draft bill on 19A to be debated in Parliament
content:
The draft bill on the 19th amendment to the Constitution is to be debated in Parliament on Monday April 27.
For more details, News1st contacted Deputy Speaker Chandima Weerakkody. The deputy speaker stated that after the said bill is debated on Monday and Tuesday, the members will be voting for it on Tuesday afternoon.
The deputy speaker added that the bill will be passed, as per the constitution, if it gains a two third majority.
Meanwhile, the National Movement for a Just Society, has decided to engage in a Satyagraha with the aim of passing the 19th Amendment to the Constitution.
Chairman Venerable Maduluwawe Sobitha Thero said that they will gather near the N. M. Perera Statue down Cotta Road in Borella at 10 a.m. on Monday morning.
The group is subsequently scheduled to walk to the Independence Square and commence a Satyagraha.

heading: Another complaint lodged over display of a flag similar ...
content:
Another complaint was lodged with the police on Sunday, over the incident pertaining to the use of a flag similar in appearance, to the national flag.
A group including Western Provincial Councillor Mujibur Rahman, lodged the complaint  with the Cinnamon Gardens Police on Sunday.
Western Provincial Councilor Mujibur Rahman said ” We submitted the allegation that these persons had damaged the reputation of our country by saying that they did not know. This is an astounding story. If they come and put up Prabhakaran’s photograph at a demonstration tomorrow, will they be allowed to go if they say they did not know? Will this continue?”
Meanwhile, the Secretary of the Ministry of Home Affairs, S.D.A.B. Boralessa says attention has been drawn towards introducing a standard decorative flag which safeguards the pride of the national flag.
He added that once the new decorative flag is introduced, the national flag should only be hoisted at state or national events.

heading: MP Vidura Wickremenayake expresses disappointment over cu...
content:
UPFA MP Vidura Wickramanayake says that the current government has become an institution that generates jokes.
He made this statement at an event held in Horana on Sunday.
A ceremony to commence construction of a Buddha Statue on the Galpallewaththa Hill in Koralagama, Horana took place on Sunday morning.
This event was held under the auspices of the Mahanayaka of the Kalyana Saamgri Dharmarama Maha Sangha Council Most Ven. Iththanapane Dhammalankara Thera.
UPFA MP Vidura Wickramanayake expressed the following views:
” I wonder if Parliament, which is the place where we gather to enact the laws of the country, has become a place where jokes are generated instead. Unfortunately, we have a lot of spokespersons, but they only speak without working. Everything is distorted. They are sleeping in parliament and holding protests at every junction. The majority has become the minority and the minority has become the majority. These are unbelievable distortions. I think we are creating a society that is slowly becoming a joke.”

heading: Opposition makes observations on ’19A and dangerous...
content:
The opposition states that certain dangerous clauses that are harmful to media freedom, have been included in the Bill on the 19th Amendment to the Constitution.
Leader of the Mahajana Eksath Peramuna parliamentarian Dinesh Gunawardena while speaking on the Satana political debate programme stressed that this section of the amendment to the constitution should be removed.

According to the Committee Stage Amendments to the 19th Amendment to the Constitution which were introduced recently, journalists can be imprisoned under criminal charges.
Clause 28 of the bill reads that under election law or a referendum, in the event that guidelines issues by the Elections Commissioner during an election or a referendum are not complied with, legal action can be taken on criminal charges, even against privately-owned media institutions.
The maximum punishment is a prison sentence of three years or a fine not exceeding 100,000 rupees.
Politicians, Intellectuals and the General Public too, are expressing various views on this matter.

heading: President Sirisena expresses condolences to earthquake vi...
content:
Soon after hearing about the disaster in Nepal, President Maithripala Sirisena spoke to the Minister of Finance in Nepal to express his condolences.
The President had instructed the commanders of the tri-forces to take steps to promptly deploy relief for earthquake hit Nepal.
Meanwhile, the Prime Minister’s office requested doctors, nurses and paramedics who are willing to volunteer their services to the victims of the Nepal earthquake, to contact the PMO.
India, China, UK and France have commenced rescue operations in Nepal.
According to foreign media, certain towns and cities have been left in darkness as power lines and phone lines have been destroyed owing to the earthquake.
Furthermore, the Tribhuvan International Airport in Katmandu, Nepal has been closed for all commercial flights. Only flights  carrying relief are allowed into its runways.
It has also been reported that water shortages have been experienced in relief camps providing shelter to thousands of evacuees and homeless.
We contacted Professer Ravee Puyel from a university in Nepal to find out more about the latest situation.
Managing Director of Islingon College Ravi Phuyal said:
”Since yesterday afternoon we have been experiencing multiple quakes. The big one was yesterday afternoon and next big one was today, just an hour ago; which was similar to yesterday’s. Yesterday was something around 7.6 and today we experienced something around 6.5. In between that, when we go out, we’ve been experiencing (seen) more than 100 shops that has been affected and people are in a state of ‘what to do and what not to do.’ The mostly affected place was Kathmandu valley, the capital city. The government has declared, 26 cities as major affected areas. the major destruction that has happen is on to the historic monuments that we have. Kathmandu, Vasudhur and Patan, these three cities with historic monuments have been massively destroyed. On the other part, people are having lack on the daily supplies. The hospitals here are packed with people from all over.”
According to The Indian Express, experts have warned that that there is a risk of future earthquakes of similar magnitude that could strike Nepal. Thus, certain areas in Nepal are on alert.

heading: President speaks of his objectives for SLFP and the 19th ...
content:
President Maithripala Sirisena says that passing the 19th Amendment and steering the Sri Lanka Freedom Party towards victory is his main objective.
The president made this statement at the Sri Lanka Freedom Party representatives conference for the Galle District on Saturday evening.
The President also added that all senior members must work together on one common platform.
Meanwhile, the President on Sunday morning, presented the draft of the 19th Amendment which will be presented in Parliament on Monday morning, to the Mahanayaka of the Malwathu Chapter Most Ven. Thibbatuwave Sri Sumangala Thero.
Thereafter, the President called on the Anunayaka of the Malwathu Sect Ven. Niyangoda Vijithasiri Thera and presented the draft of the 19th Amendment to the Constitution.
Later, the President called on the Chief Incumbent of the Sri Rajopawanarama Viharaya ,Ven. Keppetiyagoda Siriwimala Thera.

heading: National Youth Bak Festival held under auspices of PM Wic...
content:
The National Youth Bak Festival took place in Matara on Sunday under the auspices of Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.
The festival was called the Sun Festival of Reconciliation.
The Prime Minister’s Chief of Staff, Sagala Ratnayake, was also present at the occasion.
The Prime Minister speaking at the event, said that there should be work with a good revenue and income. There should be more jobs in the country. All of this cannot be done in 100 days. Vocational training should also take place alongside education. This would lead to a good wage.
He went onto say that the public income should be increased within the next five years. Most of all, he stated that he is looking forward is to create one million jobs in the next five years.

heading: Chanting of Pirith to commence at Yatihalagala Temple bef...
content:
The traditional Pirith chanting ceremony will commence on Sunday night at the historic Yatihalagala Temple initiating the Sirasa John Keels Vesak Kalapaya.
All preparations have been made to commence the Sirasa John Keells Vesak Kalapaya on May 3, 4 and 5  at the environs of the MTV/MBC city office on Braybrooke Street, Colombo 2.
The Sacred Hair Relic of the Lord Buddha and the relics of 14 Maharahath Theros, will be brought to the Sirasa Vesak Kalapaya from the Yatihalagala Raja Maha Viharaya on May 29.

heading: Rescue efforts in Nepal intensify
content:
Rescue efforts in Nepal have intensified after more than 2,300 people were killed in the worst earthquake there in more than 80 years.
Just as rescue efforts stepped up today a powerful aftershock was felt in Nepal, India and Bangladesh, and more avalanches were reported near Everest.
The US Geological Survey said the quake measuring a magnitude of 6.7 struck near the town of Kodari.
This tragic incident occurred at around 11.41 GMT on Saturday.
The magnitude-7.9 quake struck near the capital of Kathmandu and has so far claimed the lives of more than 2200 people with countless others still believed to be missing.

heading: Meet Britain’s richest man
content:
According to 2015 Sunday Times Rich List. Warner Music owner Len Blavatnik has been named Britain’s richest man with a £13.17bn fortune.
He takes the top spot from brothers Sri and Gopi Hinduja, now worth £13bn.
The total wealth of the richest 1,000 individuals and families in Britain has more than doubled in the last 10 years to £547bn, the survey reported.
The Queen, who topped the first list in 1989, has dropped out of the top 300 for the first time.
There are now 117 billionaires on the list, up from 104 in 2014, with 80 of them living in London.
Mr Blavatnik, a Ukrainian whose investments range from metals and oil to music publishing and digital media, has a £41m home in London and has donated £75m to Oxford University to found the Blavatnik School of Government.
-BBC

heading: Nepal earthquake death toll rises to 2200
content:
Rescuers dug with their bare hands and bodies piled up in Nepal on Sunday after an earthquake devastated the heavily crowded Kathmandu Valley, killing more than 2,200 people, and triggered a deadly avalanche on Mount Everest.
A big aftershock between Kathmandu and Everest unleashed more avalanches in the Himalayas. In the capital, hospital workers stretchered patients out onto the street to treat them as it was too dangerous to keep them indoors.
The tremor, measured at 6.7, was the most powerful since Saturday’s 7.9 quake – itself the strongest since Nepal’s worst earthquake disaster of 1934 that killed 8,500 people.
The aftershock rocked buildings in the Indian capital New Delhi and halted the city metro.
In Everest’s worst disaster, the bodies of 17 climbers were recovered from the mountain on Sunday after being caught in avalanches. A plane carrying the first 15 injured climbers landed in Kathmandu at around noon local time.
-Reuters

heading: News 1st, MTV and MBC to reach out to the people of Nepal...
content:
News1st and the MTV/MBC media network have come forward to initiate a relief programme for the people of Nepal, who have been stricken by  a major earthquake and its aftershocks.
Director of Public Relations at MTV/MBC Priyantha Wijeysinghe, elaborated on the initiative during the main news bulletin at 7 p.m. on Sirasa TV.
He said that they have witnessed the tragedy the people of Nepal are currently experiencing. He went on to state that it is an emotional time for all. He said that thousands have lost their lives owing to this earthquake while many have been rendered homeless and destitute.
Priyantha Wijeysinghe also noted that as a Buddhist country we consider Nepal as the birthplace of Lord Buddha. While the people of Nepal are facing much hardships at this juncture we cannot help but remember the catastrophic Tsunami incident which took place in 2004. He stated:
When we face such hardships many countries came to help us in order to get our country back on its feet.
Speaking further, he noted that The Capital Maharaja Organisation together with News 1st have organised a relief effort under the title  Sri Lanka for Nepal  adding that this relief effort came about at the last moment therefore they have partnered with several government institutions and diplomatic offices and are currently carrying out discussions to identify what items the Nepalese people urgently need at this movement.
Priyantha Wijeysinghe pointed out that they are ready to fly these items as as soon as possible with the assistance of Sri Lankan government officials.
Priyantha Wijeysinghe added:
Tomorrow we will inform you of the items we need. Be prepared. Do not bring these items to our head office: instead you have to bring these items to No 330, T.B. Jayah Mawatha. This is the very location that we collected goods during the Tsunami tragedy. No 330, Harrison’s Complex along Darley Road.”

heading: Min. Bathiudeen should not be given nominations from the ...
content:
A resolution has been adopted, that Minister Rishad Bathiudeen should not be given a nomination on the UNP ticket, to contest the upcoming parliamentary elections from the Wanni district.
The resolution was adopted at the UNP Mannar Branch Committee meeting held on Sunday April 26th.

heading: JHU to view politicians who do not support 19th Amendment...
content:
The Jathika Hela Ururmaya (JHU) says that politicians who will not render their support the 19th Amendment to the Constitution will be seen as traitors to the nation.
They made this statement at a media briefing convened in Colombo on Sunday April 26..
JHU General Secretary Patali Champika Ranawaka said that they believe that it is everyones responsibility to pass the 19th Amendment which will enable a more democratic form of presidency and which was presented after the supreme court arrived at a decision.
Speaking further, he said that many of them have protested saying that they will abolish the executive presidency and will do anything to put a halt to this. But history had continuously shown the route they have taken.
He went on to say that if there are many persons who are attempting to hinder this giving various excuses then history will regard them as traitors to the country.

heading: Motorcyclists Union stages protest in Kandy
content:
A group calling themselves the motorcyclists union, held a protest in Kandy on Sunday against the ban on full face helmet.
The protesters arrived in Kandy in a procession on the Gannoruwa Road.
They say that moves to enforce the full face helmet ban pose a threat to their safety and security.

heading: Baltimore protests turn violent; police officers injured
content:
Up to 5,000 law enforcement officials will be requested from the mid-Atlantic region to help quell the violence in Baltimore, Col. William Pallozzi of the Maryland State Police said at a press conference late Monday.
Chaos and violence erupted on the streets of Baltimore late Monday as protesters clashed with police, several of whom were injured.
Maryland Gov. Larry Hogan declared a state of emergency and activated the National Guard. The mayor of Baltimore said every possible resource was being deployed to “gain control of this situation.”
“What we see tonight that is going on in our city is very disturbing,” Mayor Stephanie Rawlings-Blake told reporters. “Too many people have spent generations building up this city for it to be destroyed by thugs who — in a very senseless way — are trying to tear down what so many have fought for.”
She announced that the city will impose a mandatory curfew from 10 p.m. to 5 a.m. daily, effective for one week starting Tuesday. The mayor also promised to hold those responsible for the violence accountable.
More than two dozen people have already been arrested, according to Col. Darryl D. DeSousa with the Baltimore Police Department.
He said that 15 officers were injured. Two remain hospitalized, and the others have been released. Most were hurt by flying debris in the violence that DeSousa described as “unprecedented.”
Video showed police in riot gear taking cover behind an armored vehicle, as protesters pelted them with rocks.
At one point, it looked like officers used tear gas. The Baltimore Police Department said it had heard reports of protesters setting small items on fire, and footage showed a cruiser in flames.
Video also showed people looting local stores, and an area CVS pharmacy was set on fire after it was ransacked. Thick dark smoke filled the streets.
There were no immediate reports of injuries among the rioters.
“It is so frustrating that people think that this makes sense — to destroy our community,” said Rawlings-Blake. “People who live there, that are already hurting, are going to be the ones that pay.”
Earlier in the day, the Baltimore Police Department said it had received a “credible threat” that gangs were teaming up to “take out” officers.
It did not say where the information came from, nor did it say whether the threat was tied to the recent death of Freddie Gray. Gray died in police custody under circumstances that remain unclear.
His death has sparked ongoing protests in Baltimore and raised long-simmering tensions between police and residents.
Groups of violent criminals are continuing to throw rocks, bricks, and other items at police officers.
— Baltimore Police (@BaltimorePolice) April 28, 2015


We are deploying resources throughout the city to ensure residents are safe. Despite our efforts, criminals continue to assault officers.
— Baltimore Police (@BaltimorePolice) April 28, 2015


Source: CNN

heading: Public support powers Sri Lanka for Nepal humanitarian pr...
content:
Relief items are pouring in from the public to the News 1st, Sirasa Shakthi – Sri Lanka for Nepal Humanitarian programme, as aid to those affected by the earthquake in Nepal which has killed thousands.

heading: Railway Control Room reveals cause of Kilinochchi train a...
content:
The Railway Control Room says that the van which was collided with a train in Ariviel Nagar in Kilinochchi on Monday had travelled across the level crossing, ignoring the signals.
Four persons were killed while two others were injured when the van collided with a train.
The Railway Control Room points out that the van in question had attempted to move across the level crossing while the railway signals were on.
The train plying from Kilinochchi to Vavuniya had collided with the van.Three of the deceased have been identified as members of the same family.

heading: Facebook launches video calling in Messenger app
content:
Facebook Inc introduced free video calling in its Messenger phone app on Monday as the company seeks to transform its mobile messaging service into a full-featured platform with the same reach as its 1.4 billion user social network.
Messenger, with more than 600 million users, now has a video icon at the top right corner of its screen. Earlier this year, Messenger launched voice and video calling between computers.
Messenger competes with Microsoft Corp’s Skype, Apple Inc’s FaceTime and Google Inc’s Hangouts, all of which allow video calls between mobile devices or computers.
At Facebook’s annual developer conference in March, Chief Executive Mark Zuckerburg said the social network would introduce myriad features within Messenger. For example, users can also send money to friends within the app. Facebook also unveiled a platform that enables developers to easily create apps that function within Messenger.
“Adding (video calling) to Messenger instead of the main Facebook app maybe ties in to Messenger’s mission where it’s a real core person-to-person app,” said Brian Blau, research director at Gartner Inc, a U.S. technology research and advisory firm. “Now they’re really enticing people with more features.”
Video calling is available on devices using Apple’s iOS and Google’s Android mobile operating systems in Belgium, Canada, Croatia, Denmark, France, Greece, Ireland, Laos, Lithuania, Mexico, Nigeria, Norway, Oman, Poland, Portugal, the United Kingdom, the United States and Uruguay. Facebook said additional regions will be added in the next few months.
Source: Reuters

heading: ‘Sri Lanka for Nepal’ receives heart-warming ...
content:
Favourable responses keep flowing in for Sri Lanka for Nepal, a relief project for those affected by the earthquake in Nepal.
News1st, Sirasa and Shakthi  have taken the initiative to step forward and provide relief for the families of the thousands killed and injured in the earthquake that struck Nepal.
The Ministry of Disaster Management, the Disaster Management Centre, the security forces and the Police Environment Unit have joined with News1st in this endeavour to help Nepal at this time of great need.
The Ministry of Foreign Affairs will be assisting in the coordination of the project as the country joins hands together in support.
Those who came in to drop off relief items, all of which will be sent to Nepal, spoke of how the entire world helped Sri Lanka in our time of need, following the devastating 2004 tsunami. They went on to state that  it is our responsibility to help people in need.
They also took time to thank and commend News1st and MTV/MBC for aiding and providing the Sri Lankan public with an avenue of sending much-needed supplies to tragedy-hit Nepal.
Items that are required are collected at The Harrisons Building, 330, TB Jayah Mawatha, Colombo 10.
As a result of the ruined roads in post-quake Nepal and as the Katmandu Airport is only open for relief services, we at News1st and MTV/MBC can only accept items on the list of essential items provided by the Nepalese authorities.
Donations required are blankets, warm clothing, drinking water, milk powder, canned fish, dry rations, first-aid kits, tents, baby products and women’s sanitary items.

heading: Debate on 19th Amendment taken up in Parliament
content:
The debate for the 19th Amendment to the Constitution was taken up in Parliament on Monday, April 27.
Commencing the debate, President Maithripala Sirisena requested all Members of Parliament to render support for the adoption of the amendment.
President Maithripala Sirisena stated that, considering the results of the presidential election, Mahinda Rajapaksa got 5.8 million votes and he achieved 6.2 million votes. Therefore, if taken into consideration, the 12 million votes received by the two main candidates, it is clear that the people are in agreement for this amendment. He said that it therefore brings to mind, a moment of joy, to state that they aren’t considering themselves as SLFP, UNP or any other fraternal political parties: but as one. He went on to note that there is time until Tuesday, April 28 noon to resolve the problems presented by both parties.
Minister of Justice Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe stated that they have accepted the Supreme Court’s decision and that they have decided to remove articles 42,43 and 44 which confer powers on the Prime Minister. The political parties have agreed to this.
Opposition Leader Nimal Siripala de Silva noted that they are totally in agreement with the establishment of  independent commissions. But this constitution does not mention the provisions for removing a Prime Minister. He said that what was stated before was that there would be no MPs in the constitutional council; thus they proposed five MPs be appointed.
JVP Propaganda Secretary MP Vijitha Herath stated that they are not in agreement with the entirety of the 19th Amendment which includes  consulting the Bar Association in the establishment of the Judicial Commission, but that they are in agreement with the primary intentions.

heading: Dwelling on mistakes of the past is ‘useless’...
content:
Phase 1 of the Eastern Terminal at the Colombo South Port, was declared open on Monday, April 27, under the auspices of Minister Arjuna Ranatunga.
The terminal which is administered by the Sri Lanka Ports Authority, extends for 1200 metres as a 400 metre section has been completed. The project, undertaken at a cost of Rs.80 million, was marked with the arrival of a traditional cargo vessel from China.
Minister Ports and Shipping Arjuna Ranatunga stated that in the recent past questions arose whether development of the country is needed or the development of an institution is required. He stated that large scale corruption has  occurred through these moves and thus  wasting time talking about the past is useless, and instead it is more important to continue into the future.

heading: Opposition Leader expresses appreciation to President Sir...
content:
It was stated in Parliament on Monday, April 27 that controversial clauses providing for the arrest of journalists on criminal charges, would be removed from the 19th Amendment to the Constitution.
Opposition Leader Nimal Siripala de Silva voiced his appreciation for the decision that was taken by the President.
Over the past several days, News 1st reported on the fact that amendments made to the bill on the 19th Amendment include provisions that allow for the arrest of journalists on criminal charges.
Clause 28 stated that, in the event of an election or a referendum, action can be taken on criminal grounds against private media institutions, in the event of non-compliance with guidelines issued by the Elections Commissioner. The punishment mentioned in the amendment was a prison term of not more than three years and a fine not exceeding Rs.100,000.
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe stated that an amendment was brought through clause 28 of the bill on the 19th Amendment which included that punishment on private telecasters, broadcasters and newspapers, in the event of failure to implement decisions of the Elections Commissioner.
Discussions were thus held with private media institutions, the President, Justice Minister, Media Minister and himself regarding the matter and they have thus decided to withdraw the clause.
Opposition Leader Nimal Siripala de Silva stated that the initial draft bill that was presented did not contain any provisions on meting out punishment to media institutions. He said that, therefore, they had separately sought the intervention of President Maithirpala Sirisena. He stated that they were thankful to him for withdrawing this provision.

heading: Relieved Lee Chong Wei handed backdated doping ban
content:
Malaysia’s favorite badminton star and former world number one, Lee Chong Wei, was left a relieved man on Monday following the handing of a backdated eight month ban for using “Dexamethasone”, an anti-inflammatory, a substance which is banned by the Badminton World Federation. The backdated eight month ban means that the former world number one will be able to take part in the 2016 Rio Olympics.
Lee Chong Wei’s test results came out as positive for the use of Dexamethasone during last year’s world championships. Even though Dexamethasone does not enhance performance, it is on the list of banned substances.
Lee, who has won 55 titles, at one point faced a two-year suspense but will be able to compete again on Friday after he voluntarily stood down last year after he was first told of the test results. The former world #1 as not played since losing last year’s World Championship final and witnessed his world rankings tumble all the way to 30th in the world
The Badminton World Federation (BWF) issued a statement saying that the panel, which consists of three members, is convinced this is not a case of doping with intent to cheat and further added that Lee had been negligent but the backdated sanction was “correct and fair”.
The BWF said that the banned anti-inflammatory drug, Dexamethasone, was found on the casing of gelatin capsules of a food supplement that Lee was taking.
Speaking at a news conference in Kuala Lumpur, Lee Chong Wei said that he is “relieved” with the backdated sanction and added that he will review back and might even be mentally stronger in the competitions to come.
The lengthy absence from the court which also led to his ranking tumbling down to 30th in the world could drop even further as his world championship final defeat to China’s Chen Long has been disqualified by the BWF and the silver medal has been rescinded.
Lee was allowed to keep the two Asian Games bronze medals he won in Incheon, South Korea, in September as he was not aware of his failed test during the time.
Lee will be free to take part in the May 10-17 Sudirman Cup, one of the first events with qualifying points for the Rio Games as the qualifying campaign for Rio begins on the 4th of May.
The former world #1 is also likely to take part in the Southeast Asian Games in June, prior to the World Championship in Jakarta in August.
Despite the unfortunate turn of events Lee has faced, he has remained as Malaysia’s favorite as he was nominated last week for the country’s 2014 sportsman of the year award.

heading: Religious observances begin prior to Sirasa – John ...
content:
The Malwathu Maha Viharaya and Asgiri Maha Viharaya  of the Siam chapter were informed about the Sirasa – John Keells Vesak Kalapaya   on Monday, April 27.

heading: Jonty Rhodes explains why he named his baby daughter, India
content:
Jonty Rhodes seems to have made a life-long connection with India after he named his newborn daughter ‘India Jeanne Rhodes’.
The legendary South African fielder enjoys as much fan following as Indian cricketers after joining Mumbai Indians as its fielding coach.
Now, by naming his daughter India, he has only taken his love for his ‘second-home’ a notch higher.
Speaking to mid-day after a Mumbai Indians training session at the Wankhede Stadium on Friday, Rhodes (45) explained why he chose to name his daughter India.
“I have spent a lot of time here. What I love about India is that it’s a rich mix of culture, heritage and tradition. It is a very spiritual country, very forward-thinking nation. I really like that combination. You have to have a good balance of life.
“With the name like India, she will have the best of both worlds and that sort of balance,” an excited Rhodes said, before he took off on his Royal Enfield Bullet bike.
The former South African legendary fielder’s wife Melanie gave birth to a baby girl at Surya Mother and Child Care Hospital in Santacruz on Thursday.
Rhodes said his wife had no issues with naming their daughter after a country.
-NDTV

The train plying from Kilinochchi to Vavuniya had reportedly collided with the van a short while ago.

heading: Google launches Person Finder Tool to aid Nepal rescue ef...
content:

At this time, around 1,300 records have been collected and that number will likely continue to grow throughout the day.
