Source:NDTV

heading: Shah Rukh Khan’s son AbRam makes cheerleading debut...
content:
Bollywood actor Shah Rukh Khan brought his youngest son AbRam out in public, among thousands of spectators, for the first time at the IPL match between the Kolkata Knight Riders, which he co-owns with Juhi Chawla and Jay Mehta and the Mumbai Indians in Kolkaa.
Dressed in the Knight Riders’ jersey, AbRam looked adorable as gazed at the crowd from the safety of his father’s arms. The two-year-old certainly proved to be a lucky charm for the Knight Riders who beat Mumbai Indians by 7 wickets in the opening game of the IPL at Eden Gardens.
A relieved SRK later wrote on Twitter

SRK’s elder son Aryan and his daughter Suhana were also spotted in the stands, taking a keen interest in the match. But it was their little brother who was the focus of everyone’s attention this time.
AbRam has already made his official debut on Twitter last year when his famous father tweeted a photo of them together as an Eid gift to fans who had been clamouring to see his third-born. His doting father occasionally shares pictures of him on the microblogging site. He’s also made a Bollywood debut of sorts and was spotted in the end credits of 2014 blockbuster Happy New Year and on the sets of SRK’s next film Fan.

 
Source: NDTV

heading: Bhutanese PM Tshering Tobgay arrives
content:
Bhutanese Prime Minister Tshering Tobgay arrived in the country on Thursday morning on a three-day state visit.
The aim of the visit is to further strengthen bilateral ties between Sri Lanka and Bhutan. The Premier of Bhutan arrived at the Katunayake International Airport at 10.45 a.m.
The Ministry of External Affairs noted that the Bhutanese premier is due to hold high level discussions with President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.
The Bhutanese premier is also due to tour the cities of Anuradhapura and Polonnaruwa as well as visit the Peradeniya Botanical Gardens.
The Ministry of External Affairs noted that Prime Minister Tshering Tobgay and President Maithripala Sirisena will hold discussions on Friday.
The Ministry added that several agreements will also be signed during these discussions.

heading: Group of Sri Lankans stranded in Yemen arrive at BIA
content:
29 Sri Lankans who were trapped in Yemen due to the current crisis in the country  have arrived in the island.
The flight carrying the Sri lankans arrived at the Bandaranaike International Airport at 8.15 Wednesday evening.
The group had been evacuated from Yemen to Djibouti through the intervention of the Chinese government on the 7th of April prior to arriving in Sri Lanka on Wednesday (April 8th). Our correspondent stated that the group arrived aboard Qatar Airways flight QR 656.
Meanwhile,  Deputy General Manager of the Foreign Employment Bureau, Mangala Randeniya said that another group of Sri lankans who are trapped in Yemen amidst clashes will be brought back to the country on Friday, April 10th.
Deputy General Manager Mangala Randeniya noted that the Chinese government and all the Sri lankan embassies located around the region where clashes are taking place helped to repatriate the Sri Lankan migrant workers in Yemen.

heading: Teams deployed to investigate Bandaragama police officer ...
content:
Five police teams have been assigned to investigate the murder of a sub inspector of the Bandaragama Police.
Police Media Spokesperson ASP Ruwan Gunasekera said that investigations are being conducted by several units under the supervision of Senior DIG of the Western Province Pujitha Jayasundera.
The sub Inspector was found killed, with his throat slit, at his residence in Panadura recently.

heading: MS Dhoni Adds ‘India’s Fastest Bike’ to...
content:
Indian ODI and T20 cricket team captain MS Dhoni’s love and passion for biking is known to everyone. In fact, he has also been associated with the Bike Festival of India since its first edition.
As far as his collection goes, he owns a bunch of exclusive bikes like the Confederate Hellcat X132, Ducati 1098, Kawasaki Ninja ZX14R, Harley Davidson Fatboy, and Yamaha YZF600 Thundercat among others – shows just how big a biking enthusiast he really is.
Anyway, the latest addition to Captain Cool’s garage is the newly launched Kawasaki Ninja H2, which, currently, is India’s fastest bike.
The excitement of owning this mean machine was quite obvious in Dhoni’s Instagram post, where he shared a picture of the bike saying – “Finally the wait is over but another couple of months before I can take her on her first ride.”
As mentioned before, he also owns another superbike from the Kawasaki stable – the Ninja ZX14R – which too was the ‘world’s fastest and most powerful motorcycle’ at one point.
Interestingly, the bike goes past the 100Km/h mark in mere 2.5 seconds, which makes it the country’s fastest bike.
Source: NDTV

heading: Grama Seva officer arrested for allegedly distilling illi...
content:
A grama sevaka officer has been arrested in the Agunakolapelassa area with a stock of moonshine.
Police stated that the officer was attached to the Guruwanahigeara area in the Hungama Police Division. It was reported that the stock of moonshine had been found inside the grama sevaka officer’s room.
The suspect is due to be presented before court on Friday. The arrested grama sevaka officer is a 54-year-old individual.
The police noted that the suspect had been in the practice of distilling moonshine.

heading: South Carolina Officer Charged With Murder in black man...
content:
A South Carolina Officer Michael Slager has been charged with murder after a video emerged of him shooting a victim multiple times in the back following a scuffle.
The video, shows the officer firing eight times as the man, Walter L. Scott, 50 year old, fled.
The North Charleston mayor announced the state charges at a news conference held on Tuesday evening.
Saturday’s shooting, which began as a traffic stop over a faulty brake light, occurred as Americans grapple with issues of trust between law enforcement and minority communities after a series of deaths of unarmed black men at the hands of police.
In the Charleston case, authorities said the victim was shot after the officer already hit him with a stun gun.
BBC reports that this incident has been widely condemned and that the US Department of Justice and the FBI are investigating into the matter.

heading: Chinese GP will be challenging – Lewis Hamilton (Wa...
Liverpool advance to FA Cup semi final
content:
Philippe Coutinho thumped home a second-half winner as Liverpool broke the resistance of Championship Blackburn Rovers to reach the FA Cup semi-finals with a gritty 1-0 replay victory on Wednesday (April 8).
Brendan Rodgers’s side, who came into the game after back-to-back Premier League defeats that all but ended their hopes of a top-four finish, will face Aston Villa in the last four at Wembley.
They came out on top at Ewood Park having dominated possession but struggled to break down the hosts who got men behind the ball and restricted Liverpool to very few sights of goal.
The breakthrough came in the 70th minute when Coutinho exchanged passes with Jordan Henderson from a corner, drove into the box and drilled the ball low into the bottom corner.

heading: SLFP to support 19th Amendment if electoral reforms are t...
content:
The Sri Lanka Freedom Party states that the party will only support the 19th Amendment to the constitution if electoral reforms are also tabled in Parliament.
The decision was reached at a meeting presided by Chairman of the SLFP, President Maithripala Sirisena.
Speaking in Parliament on Thursday, Speaker Chamal Rajapaksa announced that the Supreme Court has determined that the 19th Amendment is consistent with the Constitution but that  certain sections require a referendum.
The 19th Constitutional Amendment Draft Bill was presented to Parliament by Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe on  March 24. Later, 19 petitions were filed with regard to the new amendment. Five of them were filed for the amendment while 14 petitions were filed against it.
Among the petitioners were – Gomin Dayasiri, Ivan Perera,Udaya Gammanpila, Darshan Weerasekara, Venrable, Bengamuwe Nalaka Thero, Swarnapali Wanigasekaera, Venrable Matara Ananda Sagara Thero, Somaweera Chandrasiiri, Nishantha Sri Warnasinghe, MTV Channel Private Limited, MBC Networks Private limited, and Sisira Jayakody.
On Wednesday, 1st of April, A panel of Supreme Court Judges led by Chief Justice K. Sri Pavan began to consider the petitions. The other Supreme Court judges who sat on the panel were justices Chandra Ekanayake and Priyasad Depp.
On  April 6, the Supreme Court concluded considering petitions filed in connection with the 19th Constitutional Amendment.

According to Speaker, Chamal Rajapaksa, the sections of the 19th Amendment to the constitution which require a referendum are as follows;
(i) 42(3) which states that “The Prime Minister shall be the head of the Cabinet of Ministers”.
(ii) 43(1) – The Prime Minister shall determine the number of ministers of the cabinet of ministers, and the Ministries and the assignment of subjects and functions to such Ministers.
(iii) 43 (3) The Prime Minister may at any time change the assignment of subjects and functions and recommend to the President changes in the composition of the Cabinet of Ministers. Such changes shall not affect the continuity of the Cabinet of Ministers and the continuity of its responsibility to Parliament.
(iv) 44 (2) The Prime Minister shall determine the subjects and functions which are to be assigned to Ministers appointed under paragraph (1) of this Article, and the Ministries, if any, which are to be in charge of, such Ministers.
(v) 44 (3) The Prime Minister may at any time change any assignment made under paragraph (2)
(vi) 44(5) At the request of the Prime Minister, any Minister of the Cabinet of Ministers may by Notification published in the Gazette, delegate to any Minister who is not a member of the Cabinet of Ministers, any power or duty pertaining to any subject or function assigned to such Cabinet Minister, or any power or duty conferred or imposed on him or her by any written law, and it shall be lawful for such other Minister to exercise and perform any power or duty delegated notwithstanding anything to the contrary in the written law by which that power or duty is conferred or imposed on such Minister of the Cabinet of Ministers.
And Clause 26 104 B (5)(c) Clause 26
104 B (5)(c) –
Where the Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation, the Sri Lanka Rupavahini Corporation or the Independent Television Network or any other broadcasting or telecasting enterprise owned or controlled by the State or the enterprise of every private broadcasting or telecasting operator, as the case may be, contravenes any guidelines issued by the Commission under sub-paragraph (a), the Commission may appoint a Competent Authority by name or by office, who shall, with effect from the date of such appointment, take over the management of such Broadcasting Corporation, Rupavahini Corporation or Independent Television Network, or other broadcasting or telecasting enterprise owned or controlled by the State or the enterprise of such private broadcasting or telecasting operator, as the case may be, insofar as such management relates to all political broadcasts or any other broadcast, which in the opinion of the Commission impinge on the election, until the conclusion of the election, and the Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation, the Sri Lanka Rupavahini Corporation and the Independent Television Network or other broadcasting or telecasting enterprise owned or controlled by the State or the enterprise of such private broadcasting or telecasting operator, shall not, during such period, discharge any function connected with, or relating to, such management which is taken over by the Competent Authority.

heading: Financial Crimes Division questions Sasheendra Rajapaksa ...
content:
The Former Chief Minister of the Uva Province, Shasheendra Rajapaksa, was summoned to the Police Financial Crimes Division on Friday to inquire over two luxury buses which have been purchased by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. It is alleged that the buses have been used for other purposes.
The former chief minister, who was was questioned for almost two hours, stated that he was questioned if the bus was used for official purposes and not regarding any financial crime as mentioned.
The Police Media Spokesperson ASP Ruwan Gunasekera said that the Financial Crimes Division recorded a statement over a complaint that had been made.
He went on to say that the two buses, which were provided to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs recently, were to be used during the Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting and a complaint was made stating that these two buses were used for other purposes apart from  those assigned.
ASP Ruwan Gunasekera further noted that once the investigations are concluded, documents will be produced to the Attorney General and legal action will be taken.

heading: Police seek public help over Wele Suda’s assets (Wa...
content:
Police Media spokesperson ASP Ruwan Gunesekera said that the accounts of the accomplices of Wela Suda, who was arrested on charges of drug peddling, are being probed at present.
Court, on a prior occasion, banned MP Duminda Silva from travelling abroad after his finances were investigated, based on a confession made by Wele Suda.
Police Media Spokesperson also urged the public to direct any information over the assets of Wele Suda to the Criminal Investigation Department (CID).

heading: Sri Lankans stranded in Yemen scheduled to arrive today
content:
Several more Sri Lankan expatriates among the 45 who were stranded in Yemen will arrive in the country on Friday evening.
The Ministry of External Affairs notes that the group of Sri Lankan nationals are being flown to Beijing, China. The sixteen Sri Lankans are scheduled to be brought to Sri Lanka aboard a Qatar bound airplane.
The Kenyan mission had also rendered their assistance in evacuating the stranded Sri Lankan nationals.
The Ministry of Foreign Affairs is currently taking measures to gather information on missing Sri Lankan nationals in the worn-torn parts of Yemen.

heading: JUST IN : Provide the post of Opposition Leader to ITAK ;...
content:
The Ilangai Tamil Arasu Kachchi party (ITAK) has handed over a letter to the speaker of Parliament requesting that the position of opposition leader be awarded to ITAK. The letter was signed by MP R. Sampanthan the leader of the ITAK parliamentary group and K Thurairajasingham the General Secretary of ITAK.
In the letter ITAK notes that at the conclusion of the April 2010 general election contestants from four political parties, namely UPFA, UNP, ITAK and DNA, entered parliament.
ITAK notes that following the 2015 Presidential election the Leader of the UNP became the Prime Minister of the country while Maithripala Sirisena who entered parliament from the UPFA was elected as the President of the country and currently acts as a cabinet minister as well. The party goes on to note that over 20 UPFA parliamentarians occupy ministerial portfolios in the current administration.
Sampanthan and Rhurairajasingham note that this dis-entitles members from both the UNP and UPFA occupying the position of opposition leader, they note that this is the legal position as well as one that accords with parliamentary traditions.
As result of this the ITAK has requested the speaker of parliament to award the position of opposition leader to ITAk which has 14 seats in the opposition.

heading: Bhutan’s PM calls on President Sirisena (Video)
Bandaragama, Homagama, Watawala accidents claim three lives
content:
Three persons have been killed and four others injured in separate motor accidents that took place in the country.
One person was killed in a head-on collision involving a three-wheeler travelling from Bandaragama to Panadura and a SLTB bus travelling in the opposite direction.
The passenger of the three-wheeler was killed in the accident that took place at around 8 on Friday morning. The victim is a 35-year-old resident of the Halthota area in Bandaragama.
The driver of the bus and the assistant have been arrested over the accident.Another accident took place when a three-wheeler drove into a safety fence on the Jambugasmulla bridge in Kiriwathkaduwa, Homagama.
Our correspondent stated that four persons had been travelling in the three-wheeler at the time. One  person was killed in the incident.
Two of the injured have been admitted to the National Hospital and another injured individual has been admitted to the Kalubowila Teaching Hospital.
The victim of the accident was identified as Corporal Lalith Dhammika attached to the Panagoda Army Camp.
Meanwhile, a railway inspector attached to the Watawala Railway Station was killed after he was knocked down by a train on Thursday.
Our correspondent stated that the body of the individual was found around one kilometre from the Watawala train station. A search was conducted after he did not return home from work.
The deceased was identified as 49-year-old Namal Ratnayake, a resident of Watawala.

heading: Yet to receive Rs.142m from UPFA for buses used during Pr...
content:
The Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) says that payments on the use of SLTB buses for the meetings of the UPFA Presidential Candidate during the recent Presidential Election are yet to be made.
SLTB says that a sum of Rs.142 million is to be made in payments for the use of SLTB buses during the recent presidential election.
Minister of Internal Transport Ranjith Maddumabandara stated that SLTB has Rs. 150 million to pay in salary arrears and if SLTB receives the money owed from the previous president’s election campaign, the salary arrears will be paid off without any issue.
Chairman of SLTB Ramal Siriwardena noted that only Rs. 50 million was given for the buses provided and Rs.142 million is still to be paid. The chairman also added that the period given in the letter of demand has expired and that legal action will be executed after the Sinhala and Tamil New Year.

heading: President Sirisena and Bhutan PM hold bilateral discussio...
content:
The Prime Minister of Bhutan who is on an official visit to Sri Lanka, called on President Maithripala Sirisena on Thursday for bilateral discussions.
During these discussions,  President Sirisena and Prime Minister of Bhutan, Tsherin Tobgay, agreed to improve relations between the two countries, on educational and agriculture activities.
A communique issued by the President’s Media Unit noted that the agreement was arrived at during bilateral talks between the two leaders on Friday, April 10.
During the bilateral discussions which were held at the Presidential Secretariat, the two leaders also discussed the implementation of direct flights between Bhutan and Sri lanka.
President Sirisena also noted that Sri Lanka and Bhutan are connected through the ideologies of Buddhism, and that this was a factor in building friendly ties between the two nations.The President also thanked the Bhutanese Premier for the support rendered by Bhutan towards Sri Lanka in the international arena.
Accordingly, it has also been agreed to conduct bilateral discussions between the two countries which were highlighted in an MoU being signed between the Foreign Secretaries of the two nations.
A sapling of the Jaya Sri Maha Bodhi is to be presented to the Prime Minister of Bhutan on Saturday,  April 11 at the premises of the Jaya Sri Maha Bodhi, signifying the Buddhist relationships between Sri Lanka and Bhutan.

heading: The ‘Voice of Cricket’ ends his innings at 84...
content:
A giant figure in cricket, both on and off the field, Former Australia captain Richie Benaud who is also known as the ‘voice of cricket’, died peacefully in his sleep in a Sydney hospice late on Thursday at the age of 84 after battling skin cancer.
Benaud’s employer, Channel Nine’s CEO David Gyngell stated that the passing of Benaud is a loss not only of a national treasure, but a lovely man. The CEO of Channel Nine added that Benaud, who began as an outstanding player of cricket, went on to be an incomparable commentator and through it all, as a wonderful human being.
The fight against skin cancer was revealed by the man himself in November as his public appearances became increasingly rare in the recent past.
The celebrated commentator began his career as a leg-spinning all-rounder and also led the Australian side to three successive Ashes victories in the 1950s and 1960s. He played 63 tests for the kangaroos and was also the first player to score 2,000 test runs and take 200 test wickets.
Benaud was also a former newspaper journalist, and he began to carve out a 40-year career behind the microphone as a commentator. Benaud’s measured style and distinctive voice marked him as one of the game’s finest analysts. the ‘Voice of Cricket’ was known as “Richie” to cricket fans around the world and he also played an important role in the revolution of World Series Cricket.
With the news of his passing, tributes kept pouring in from former players, celebrities and politicians alike.

heading: Son confesses to killing Kotakethana woman
content:
Police say the son of the woman who was killed in the Kotakethana area in Kahawatta has confessed to the killing.
According to Police Media Spokesperson , ASP Ruwan Gunasekera, the eighteen-year-old suspect who was arrested on Thursday, is due to be produced before the Pellmadulla Magistrate on Friday.

heading: In Andhra Pradesh Shootings, an Account That Counters Pol...
content:
As controversy rages over the deaths of alleged sandalwood smugglers in Andhra Pradesh, a man from Tamil Nadu’s Dharmapuri district has alleged that the Andhra Pradesh police arrested seven men from his village who were on their way to Tirupati in a bus.
Seven of the 20 who were shot dead by the police in the forests in Chittoor on Tuesday belonged to Dharmapuri.
The man from Dharmapuri claims that he missed the bus at Kannamangalam – which the seven men were travelling in – as he went to buy liquor on Monday.
He boarded a different bus. But he alleges that when he called Sivakumar, one of the seven men in the other bus, he was told that they were at the Nagari police station.
He claims that a policeman later answered the phone when he called again and said, “It’s only a minor enquiry”. Repeated calls on that number later went unanswered.
The claim follows a similar account offered by the headman of a small village in Tamil Nadu who said some of the victims were headed to Tirupati in search of jobs when they were pulled off the bus by policemen from Andhra Pradesh.
The shooting of the 20 men has provoked furious protests from human rights activists and a demand from Tamil Nadu for an independent inquiry. The Centre, too, has sought a report from the Andhra Pradesh government over the incident.
Some of the bodies have burn marks; others show bullet injuries in the chest and head, challenging the police claim that they opened fire in self-defence.
A police task force said that early on Tuesday morning, it was attacked with knives and axes in the Chittoor forests in the biggest operation in recent years to catch illegal sandalwood traders.
Top officers have so far not divulged how many policemen and forest officials were involved in the encounter. Activists allege that the fact that none were injured suggests that the police was not ambushed.
Logs of the rare red sandalwood or red sanders that the police claim to have collected from the victims have government markings, according to Congress leader Chintah Mohan.
This, he said, proves that wood had not been illicitly felled. “This area doesn’t even have red sanders trees,” Mr Mohan said.
Source: NDTV

heading: Dept of Railways says special services in effect for fest...
content:
The Department of Railways says that a special train service will be in effect for the festive season.
General Manager of the Department, Vijaya Amarathunaga noted that this train service will be effected to Matara, Anuradhapura, Galle and Mahawa.
In the meantime, the Lanka Private Bus Owners Association will also operate a special bus service from today for the convenience of those who are leaving for their hometowns for the New Year.
Accordingly 2,000 private buses will be deployed for the convenience of the commuters.
The Lanka Private Bus Owners Association has accorded facilities to reserve buses to cater to the needs of persons travelling in groups and reservations for groups could be done by logging on to www.lankaprivatebus.com or by contacting them over the phone.

heading: CID to investigate Bandaragama police officer killing
content:
Investigations into the murder of a sub inspector attached to the Bandaragama Police have been handed over to the Criminal Investigations Department .
According to the a high-ranking official in charge of the Western Province, five more  teams have been deployed to carryout investigations.
The sub inspector attached to the Bandaragama Police was murdered with a sharp weapon at his residence in Panadura.

heading: JUST IN: Financial Fraud Investigation Division questions...
content:
Former Cheif Minister of the Uva province Shasheendra Rajapaksa is currently being questioned by the Financial Fraud Investigation Division.
Police Media Spokesperson ASP Ruwan Gunasekara said that the former chief minister is been questioned over two luxury buses purchased by the Ministry of External Affairs being used for personal use.

heading: President attends Polonnaruwa school event; assures techn...
content:
President Maithripala Sirisena says that the government is committed towards assuring an opportunity for children to move ahead with new technology.
The President made this statement while attending an event to vest a newly- constructed, fully-equipped Computer Unit at Royal College, Polonnaruwa to its students.
The computer unit which was constructed at a cost of  Rs.7 million rupees was vested to Royal College, Polonnaruwa.
Subsequent to vesting the computer unit to the school’s students, President Sirisena engaged in an inspection tour and held cordial discussion with the students.
Meanwhile, Bhutanese Prime Minister Tshering Tobgay who arrived in the country on a three-day visit is scheduled to meet with President Maithripala Sirisena today.
The Presidential Media Unit said that President Sirisena and the Bhutanese Prime Minister will meet at the Presidential Secretariat.
During this meeting President Sirisena and Prime Minister Tobgay will hold bilateral discussions where several agreements will be signed.
Bhutanese Prime Minister Tshering Tobgay arrived in the country for three-ay official visit.
The Ministry of External Affairs said that, during his visit, the Bhutanese Premier will meet with President Maithripala Sirisena, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and several other high-ranking government officials.

heading: Mahinda Rajapaksa asked me to take over the party: Presid...
content:
President Maithripala Sirisena made a statement at the SLFP Representatives Conference at the Maliyadeva Girls School in Kurunegala. He stated in his capacity as President of the SLFP on Thursday April 9, that it is his intention to take the party forward, with unity among all.
SLFP patron and former President Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga. SLFP MPs from the Kurunegala District, were present at the occasion.
SLFP General Secretary Anura Priyadarshana Yapa noted that they will need the support of all to give the people a SLFP Alliance Government.  He stated that ‘therefore sacrifices will be made and reach consensus and make adjustments.’
President Maithripala Sirisena stated that Mahinda Rajapaksa asked him to asked him to take over the party and questioned whether the office bearers would be changed. He said that nobody was changed and that in fact promotions were given to them since they all have love for the party and the country.
He stated that decisions will be made in the Executive Council since it is a broader entity and thus all the people should be brought together to make the  SLFP victorious.

heading: MP Tiran Alles records statement at special investigation...
content:
Several UPFA MPs accompanied MP Tiran Alles upon his arrival at the Special Investigations Division at Police Headquarters on the afternoon of Thursday April 9 to provide a statement.
MP Tiran Alles noted, on his way to the premises, that he has no clue why he was asked to come. With responsibility, Tiran Alles named Minister Champika Ranawaka as the person who is behind the Anti-Corruption Front filed and the protests against him. Champika Ranawaka has said that Tiran Alles had intervened with the JHU not knowing who Patali Champika Ranawaka was. MP Tiran Alles also stated that he will take this every place possible to continue the fight.
Attorney-at-Law Udaya Gammanpila stated that ASP Ruwan Gunasekera has brought disrepute to the their profession by the statement released to fulfill political achievements, which has never happened in the history of the Police Department.
Convener Anti Corruption Front Nishantha Sri Warnasinghe noted:
What is required is a proper investigation into the complaint we have filed as the Anti Corruption Front. It was the Anti Corruption Front that received this file. Once we received the file, we studied it, we made inquiries into it through a panel of lawyers, and then we submitted it to the Criminal Investigations Department. We did this as the Anti Corruption Front. Minister Patali Champika Ranawaka was not involved in this in any way. However, as a member of the Anti Corruption Front’s convening board, I was the one who signed the file and I am responsible for that. What we said as the Anti Corruption Front is, that we had received this file and that upon further scrutiny, it became evident to us that there was some irregularity or financial fraud that had occurred here. All we requested is that an investigation be carried out. If an accusation has been levelled against him, then what he should do is ask for an investigation into the accusation.
…
MP Bandula Gunawardena stated that MPs who appear on behalf of the rights of people cannot even continue their work. An oppressive programme never before witnessed in this country has commenced. Various forces from within the United National Party , the JVP and those in the government who obtained various positions are producing statements to bring in persons to the CID and various other persons without conducting any investigation on those corrupt individuals …”

heading: Disney’s Monkey Kingdom launched in Colombo
content:
The Minister of Tourism and several other officials attended the launch of the new film Monkey Kingdom in Colombo, today.
The film revolves around a troop  of  wild toque macaque monkeys set in the sacred city of Polonnaruwa.
Rohantha Athukorala, Chairman Sri Lanka Tourism Promotion Bureau  had stated that, through this venture, Sri Lanka would introduced to a market that has 61 million film goers, across America.
Disney, working together with directors Mark Linfield and Alastair Fothergill, has the documentary boasting big names from the film industry. Prior collaborations between Disney and the two directors have produced blockbusters such as Earth, which grossed more than $100 million at the box office.
Monkey Kingdom comes as a part of a series of Nature Documentaries produced by Disney Nature promoting wildlife.The feature-length documentary is set to be released in US cinemas on April 17.

heading: Ven Udugama Sri Buddharakkhitha Thero’s remains to ...
content:
The mortal remains of the late Chief Prelate of the Asgiri Chapter of the Siam Sect Most Venerable Udugama Sri Buddharakkhitha Thero is to be brought to the country later Wednesday April 8.
The final rites of the Chief Prelate will be observed with full state honours in Kandy on Sunday April 12.
The Most Ven. Udugama Sri Buddharakkhitha Thero passed away during the early hours on April 8  while receiving treatment at a hospital in Singapore. The mortal remains of the Chief Prelate will be taken to the Asgiri Maha Viharaya in Kandy on Thursday morning. Preparations have been made for the public to pay their respects to the late Chief Prelate on either side of the Colombo – Kandy road. Thereafter, the body of Ven. Udugama Sri Buddharakkhitha Thero will lie at the Asgiri Maha Viharaya until April 12.
The Working Committee of the Sangha Council at the Asgiriya Maha Viharaya convened under the patronage of the Anunayake Most Venerable Galagama Sri Atthadhassi Thero on Wednesday morning to discuss matters relating to the final rites and future course of action.
The discussion which was held at the Asgiri Viharaya saw the attendance of a group of officials including the Diyawadana Nilame, Kandy District Secretary and the Commissioner of Buddhist Affairs of the Kandy District.
Minister of Buddha Sasana Karu Jayasuriya noted that the late Most Venerable Udugama Sri Buddharakkhitha Thero is considered as a superior Sangha mentor for his impeccable service to the Buddha Sasana and society.
Born on March 17, 1930 under the name Jayasundera Mudiyanselage Amarasinhe, in Udugama, Dambadeniya, Kurunegala, he was ordained as Udugama Sri Buddharakkhitha Thero in 1945. After the demise of Most Venerable Palipana Sri Chandananda Maha Nayake Thero, on  December 13, 1999, Udugama Sri Buddharakkhitha Thero was elevated to the position of Chief Prelate.
He helped the Buddha Sasana by pioneering the construction of the Pallekele International Buddhist Centre and administrating several Viharayas and Ashrams. He also engaged in much social work, regardless of his health. A good example of such selfless action is when he arrived at Adam’s Peak recently.
The Most Ven. Udugama Sri Buddharakkhitha Thero is known for guiding state Administration towards the path of righteousness through the practices of the Dhamma.

heading: Bill on Treasury Bill Debt Ceiling defeated in Parliament
content:
Deputy Minister, Dr. Harsha de Silva says that  Parliament has not approved the proposed increase to the Treasury Bill Debt Ceiling.
The bill presented by the government to increase the Treasury Bill Debt Ceiling by Rs. 400 billion, was defeated in Parliament on Tuesday April 7.
Deputy Minister Dr. Harsha de Silva, said in Parliament on Tuesday that as a result of using government revenue for debt repayments and interest payments, funds for day to day expenses were insufficient. The government proposed to increase the debt ceiling on treasury bills, to obtain short-term, low- interest funding. The bill was defeated in Parliament on Tuesday. with a majority of 21 votes.
Various views were expressed at present regarding the absence of the Prime Minister, the Subject Minister and the Opposition Leader, when the vote was called. Minister Finance Ravi Karunanayake noted that they hope to reduce the loans instead of paying high interest.
It had also been proven that there are 52 in Mahinda’s group; like Wimal Weerawansa who is trying to defeat Maithripala Sirisena. Since the Prime Minister was not present at the time, Nimal Siripala said a vote will not be called.
State Minister Children’s Affairs Rosy Senanayake stated that when Maithripala Sirisena took charge of the country, there were numerous issues that needed to be resolved quickly and the  bill on treasury bills was issued to vacate fraud in order to make up for their sins and wastage.
Leader National Unity Front Azad Sally noted that a bill was brought forward to increase treasury bills by 400 million. He stated that 70 people voted for it. Collectively there should be more than 100 votes surprisingly it has dropped to 31, he stated.
SLFP General Secretary MP Anura Priyadarshana Yapa stated that the argument over Arjuna Mahendran is not concluded. Neither the Prime Minister or the Finance Minister were present on Tuesday (April 7 . MP’s have a problem with pledging support when persons are taken forcefully based on whether the UNP or JVP have called them corrupt.

heading: PM Wickremesinghe targets one million jobs in five years
content:
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe, speaking at an interactive dialogue held on Wednesday April 8  titled The Prime Minister Speaks organised by the American Chamber of Commerce in Sri Lanka, noted that the Attorney General’s Department is compiling a list of violations, related to the Colombo Port City Project, which will be submitted to the company in the near future.
Prominent members of AMCHAM Sri Lanka, along with a distinguished cross section of the business community, were also present at the event this afternoon. The event was moderated by Director of English News at News1st, Shameer Rasooldeen.
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe noted that there they have identified a number of economic goals targeting the younger generation such as creating one million jobs in five years. The Prime Minister noted that the key to achieving this goal is to create a highly competitive market economy.
Responding to questions raised on the Port City Project, PM Wickremesinghe noted that a task force headed by Mr. Ajitha de Costa has been appointed to formulate a list of all violations and after the task force submits its final report, appropriate action would be taken based on it.
Guests also questioned Deputy Minister of Policy Planning and Economic Affairs, Dr. Harsha de Silva, on the defeat of the bill to increase the Government’s Treasury Bill Debt Ceiling, in Parliament. He stated that this was not a loss for the Government. He added that rumours that the government did not have money to pay salaries of state sector workers were baseless lies.
State Minister of Defence Ruwan Wijewardene, was questioned on whether the government would be canceling contracts relating to the Akuregoda Defence Headquarters project. He noted that the project is under investigation since there have been allegations of malpractices with regard to the project. The State Minister noted that while the  cabinet approved 20 billion for the project the estimates suggest that a cost of around 42 billion would be incurred.

heading: Wisden praises Sangakkara as Leading Cricketer of the Year
content:
Veteran Sri Lankan batsman Kumar Sangakkara has been named the Wisden 2015 “Leading cricketer of the year”.
Sangakkara was chosen by the magazine for his magnificent show of talent last year as he bagged a record 2868 runs, the most any batsman has scored in a year.
Wisden editor Lawrence Booth stated that Sangakkara’s man-of-the-match performance as Sri Lanka beat India in last year’s ICC World T20 final, and four successive hundreds at the recently concluded World Cup confirmed that the magazine had chosen the right man as the “Leading Cricketer of the Year”.
Sri Lanka’s one day international captain Angelo Mathews was also named as one of the five Cricketers of the Year along with Moeen Ali, Gary Ballance, Adam Lyth and Jeetan Patel.

Ben Emmerson QC is a barrister at Matrix Chambers and expert in international human rights law while Amal Clooney who has represented high-profile clients such as Julian Assange, Former Prime Minister of Ukraine Yulia Tymoshenko and served as senior advisor to Kofi Annan when he was the UN Envoy on Syria.
Amal Clooney is the wife of Hollywood superstar George Clooney.
Mohammad Nasheed was convicted on the 13th of March for the crime of “terrorism” and was sentenced to 13 years in prison. According to the Maldivian Democratic Party Nasheed’s crime was allegedly ordering the brief detention of a judge back in 2012, which he denies.

heading: Flights scrapped as French air traffic controllers strike
content:
Flights across Europe have been cancelled following a strike by French air-traffic controllers. The SNCTA ,the nations largest Union had called a two day strike, today, Wednesday, April 8  over workers restructuring and retirement arrangements.
The strike had forced many airlines to re-route or ground their aircraft and flights are taking further steps to avoid french airspace
The country’s national carrier Air France was forced to cancel hundreds of short and medium haul flights. There have been announcements of a future strike between April 10 – 15.

content:

heading: Killing of infant in Karuwalagaswewa – investigatio...
content:
Extensive investigations  have  been launched to  find out the brokers through whom the mother of the six-month-old infant, who died after being attacked in the Karuwalagaswewa area in Chilaw, had gone abroad.

The Transport Authority has taken steps to provide special transport services for passengers who wish to travel to their home towns in view of the festive season.

heading: Venerable Udugama Sri Buddharakkitha Thero laid to rest
content:
The late Chief Prelate of the Asgiri Chapter of the Siam Sect Most Venerable Udugama Sri Buddharakkitha Thero, who rendered a tremendous service to the Sasana for over seven decades and etched his mark in the history of Sri Lanka, was laid to rest on Sunday.
The funeral of the late Chief Prelate took place  at the Police grounds in Kandy on Sunday evening, under full state honors.
The public were given an  opportunity to pay their last respects to the late mortal remains of the late Chief Prelate until 12 noon on Sunday.
The procession carrying the mortal remains of the late Chief Prelate left the Asgiri Maha Viharaya to the Police Grounds at 1 on Sunday afternoon.
The Diyawadane Nilame of the Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic Pradeep Nilanga Dela and the Basnayake Nilames of the four Main Devalayas travelling in front of the procession.
While crowds in their numbers accompanied the procession carrying the mortal remains of the late chief prelate, floral tributes flowed down on the procession from the air.
The procession reached the Asgiri Police Grounds at 02.30 on Sunday afternoon and the final rites on to the mortal remains of the late chief prelate began.
The late Chief Prelate of the Asgiri Chapter of the Siam Sect Most Venerable Udugama Sri Buddharakkitha Thero is one who had received honour locally and internationally.
The late chief prelate was 85 years old when he breathed his last at a hospital in Singapore on Wednesday morning.
Born on  March 17, 1930 in Udugama, Dambadeniya in Kurunegala he ordained as Udugama Sri Buddharakkitha Thero 15 years later and commenced a monumental service to the Sasana.
Udugama Sri Baddharakkitha Thero who was elevated to the Working Committee of the Asgiri Maha Vihara in 1966 , first took up duties to perform the Theva activities of the Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic in 1968.
In 1998, he was elevated to the position of Maha Nayake of the Asgiri Chapter of the Siam Sect.
After the passing of the then Chief Prelate Most Venerable Palipala Sri Chandananda Thero, Udugama Sri Buddharakkitha Thero was made the Chief Prelate of the Asgiri Chapter of the Siam Sect on the 31st of December 1999.
Anunayake of Malwathu Chapter of the Siam Sect Venerable Niyangoda Vijithasiri Thera expressed the following views:
“… The life that the most venerable led as a Buddhist monk can be commended in many ways. Since the very moment he obtain the Upasampadawa at the Asgiri Maha Viharaya , he was fortunate to do all the work with greater commitment….”
President Maithripala Sirisena said:
“… As the Government of Sri Lanka and the people of this country we are extremely saddened at this moment. The service the most venerable rendered towards the Sasana and the society is immeasurable. He not only blessed the country but also blessed the whole world. The character of the late Chief Prelate sets a fine example to the new generation of Buddhist monks…”
Thereafter, the late Chief Prelate was laid to rest amidst the tears of hundreds of thousands of people present at the funeral.

heading: SLFP MPs removed from Central Working Committee vow to ta...
content:
The Sri Lanka Freedom Party MPs who were removed from the party Central Working Committee say that they will seek legal action over the decision meted out against them.
Central Working Committee membership of SLFP MPs T.B.Ekanayake,  S.M.Chandrasena, Salinda Dissanayake and Bandula Gunawardena were removed.
The party chairperson had informed the MPs of this decision in the letter.
UPFA MP S.M. Chandrasena stated:

“… I received a letter through registered post yesterday. It noted that we were removed from the Sri Lanka Freedom Party Central Working Committee. No reasons were mentioned in the letter. The letter that was sent bearing the signature of Party Chairman, President Maithripala Sirisena. There was no indication of what wrong we had committed. We hope take this matter to court and seek a relief. We have a right to do that …”
Speaking to the media on Sunday Ampara District Organiser of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party , Eastern Provincial Councillor Wimalaweera Dissanayake said that he will step down from his position as a mark of protest against the decision that was made.

heading: Talks between US President and Cuban President described ...
content:
US President Barack Obama has said his meeting with Cuban President Raul Castro will help both countries “turn the page” after decades of hostility.
He described the meeting on the fringes of the Summit of the Americas in Panama as “candid and fruitful”. Mr Obama said that the former foes would continue to have differences but could advance mutual interests.
The meeting was the first formal talks between the two countries’ leaders in more than half a century. “What we have both concluded is that we can disagree with a spirit of respect and civility,” said President Obama. “Over time, it is possible for us to turn the page and develop a new relationship between our two countries.”
His remarks came at the end of a regional summit which has been dominated by the historic thaw between US-Cuba relations.
 
-BBC

Late Richie Benaud’s family declines Australia stat...
content:
Richie Benaud’s widow Daphne has rejected Australian PM Tony Abbott’s proposal for a state funeral.
Benaud said to have died peacefully in his sleep this week at the age of 84, after a storied career as one of cricket’s greatest players, captains and commentators.
Mr Abbott said on Friday Benaud’s death was “the greatest loss for cricket since the loss of Don Bradman” and as such it was appropriate he be offered a state funeral.
However, his widow Daphne phoned the PM’s office on Saturday to “kindly decline” the offer, Mr Abbott said.
The former Test captain and renowned commentator, who died on Friday aged 84, wanted a quiet and private funeral.
He will be remembered in a private funeral attended only by his immediate family, Australian media reported.
The celebrated commentator began his career as a leg-spinning all-rounder and also led the Australian side to three successive Ashes victories in the 1950s and 1960s. He played 63 tests for the kangaroos and was also the first player to score 2,000 test runs and take 200 test wickets.

According to the police, the suspect was arrested based on a tip-off received from a doctor working in the hospital while the suspect was examining patients.
The suspect stated that he was a 25-year-old resident of the Medirigiriya. False documents and certificates under the suspect’s name at the time of the arrest have been confiscated. Extensive investigations have been launched.

heading: Young activist Malala Yousafzai gets her own asteroid
content:
Malala Yousafzai the teenage activist who campaigned for girls’ education in Pakistan, and was shot by the Taliban now has an asteroid named in her honor.
The more than two mile wide asteroid officially now known as “316201 Malala” orbits the sun every five and a half years in the asteroid belt between Mars and Jupiter. Amy Mainzer, the NASA astronomer who discovered the rock, was the one who named it after Yousafzai.
Malala, the youngest and the co-recipient of the 2014 Nobel Peace Prize, was shot in the head in an assassination attempt by the Pakistani Taliban on a school bus in 2012.
She was targeted for her campaign against the extremist group’s crackdown on girls’ education, following years of blogging and interviews.
After emergency medical treatment in  UK, she became a worldwide hit after speaking in front of the UN and elsewhere about the right to education.

heading: SLC National Select Committee Chairman speaks to Sports1s...
content:
Chairman of the Sri Lanka Cricket National Select Committee Kapila Wijegunawardene says that the responsibility of the committee is not merely limited to selecting the players.
He made this view in an exclusive interview with Sports1st on Saturday. A Product of S. Thomas’ College, Mount Lavinia, Kapila Wijegunawardene played for Sri Lanka from 1988 to 1992.
A right-arm pacer, Kapila Wijegunawardene, also played for SSC and has played in two Test Matches and 26 ODIs for the country.
Kapila Wijegunawardene elaborated on the responsibility of the National Select Committee.
Wijegunawardene adds that influence and criticism is ‘a normal thing’ faced by a Selection Committee.

heading: Drug control Board concerned over new substance among sch...
content:

Chairperson, Dr Nilanga Samarasinghe said that the police have been informed in this regard. He went on to state that a programme is underway to eliminate the use of drugs by these students.

A 45 year old suspect has been arrested in connection to the crime. He will be produced before the Fort Magistrate on Sunday, April 12.

heading: Final rites of Asgiri Chief Prelate to be held today
content:
The final rites of the Chief Prelate of the Asgiri Chapter, Most Venerable Udugama Sri Buddharakkitha Thero  are to be carried out with full state honours at the Kandy Police grounds on the afternoon of Sunday, April 12.
The body of the most Venerable Thero, who passed away at a hospital in Singapore last Wednesday, is currently placed in the Upali Pravara Memorial Hall at the Asgiriya Maha Viharaya for the general public to pay their last respects.
According to our correspondent, large crowds have gathered in Kandy since dawn to pay their last respects to the remains of the most Venerable Thero.
The government has declared Sunday, April 12,  a national day of mourning.
As a mark of respect, the Presidential Secretariat has requested groceries and government companies to hoist yellow flags.
The body of the Most Ven. Thero’s body will be taken in a vehicle at 1.00 p.m from the Asgiri Maha Viharaya to the police grounds and in the process a 17 gun-salute will be performed.
There will also be 500 Army personnel, 250 Navy personnel and 250 soldiers from the Air Force. An armed force of 1000 personnel will be marching on either sides of the funeral motorcade .
There will be a floral tribute  by air at 5.00 p.m. and before the funeral pyre takes place there will be another 17 gun salute.
The Chief Prelate of the Asgiri Chapter, Most Venerable Udugama Sri Buddharakkitha Thero was born on March 17 ,1930 in Udugama became the Mahanayaka in the Asgiri sector on December 13th, 1999 and passed away aged 85 years.

heading: Ratnapura, Gampola, Kotadeniyawa accidents claim several ...
content:
According to police reports, seven individuals have died in road accidents reported from several areas in the country. The accidents had occurred in Ratnapura, Gampola, Kotadeniyawa, Deniyaya, Kosgama and Balangoda areas.
An eighteen-year-old died in an accident that occurred when a three-wheeler and motorcycle collided on a road located near a girls school in Ratnapura. The individual was a resident of Dharmapala mawatha in Ratnapura.
Meanwhile, a 42-year-old died in another accident which occurred on the Galle – Colombo road. A woman travelling in a three wheeler that collided onto a bus was admitted to the Balapitiya Hospital with injuries.
A 21-year-old died and three others were injured in an accident involving a lorry and three-wheeler, that occurred on the Gampola – Nawalapitya road in the Mariyawatta area last on the evening of Saturday April 11. The deceased was a resident of Athagala in Gampola.
An individual was killed  and another injured on the Meerigama – Diwulapitiya road in the Kitulwala area. The injured has been admitted to hospital.
The police said that a lorry and motorcycle have also met with an accident. An individual died in an accident on the Deniyaya – Galdola road. Police stated that the lorry and motorcyle were in a head collision on the night of   April 11..
Meanwhile, a 23-year-old died in an accident between a lorry and three wheeler on the Ratnapura – Colombo road. Four others who sustained injuries are receiving treatment at the Avissawella Hospital.

heading: Police on the look out for drunk drivers
content:
According to the police, a special programme will be in place to arrest drunk drivers.
Police Media Spokesperson ASP Ruwan Gunasekara said, each city in the country will be centered and a special team will be assigned to look into process.
He further added that in lieu of the festive season, police officers dressed in civil attire will be in each of these cities to ensure the safety of the people.

heading: All Ceylon Hindu Congress issues communique over expectat...
content:
Issuing a communique, the All Ceylon Hindu Congress points out that the Tamil people who paved the way for good governance are frustrated over their expectations ahead of the new year.
Leader of the All Ceylon Hindu Congress Kandiah Neelakandan. in a communique notes that the aspirations of the people to be resettled in their own lands have merely become a dream.

heading: SLBFE searches for information on Sri Lankans stranded in...
content:
The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment is searching for information on any other Sri Lankans who are trapped in Yemen
As Yemen transformed into a conflict zone within a span of a month. Forty three Sri Lankan nationals who were caught in the midst of the the fighting were moved to Djibouti by a Chinese flagged vessel.
The last sixteen persons from that group arrived in Sri Lanka on Friday night. News 1st, which directed the country’s attention to the plight of the Sri Lankans trapped in Yemen, continues to search for any available information of any other Sri Lankan who is trapped in the conflict-ridden Yemen.
It was unearthed that another group of Sri Lankans are stranded in Yemen.Acting Director of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs Sathya Rodrigo said that the group had refused to provide the required documents that will assist in their return to Sri Lanka.

heading: Kahawatta murder suspect placed in remand custody
content:
The suspect arrested over the murder of a woman in Kotakethana, Kahawatta was ordered to be placed under remand custody until April 24.
The decision was taken by Acting Magistrate of Pelmadulla Chamath Suraweera. The 18-year-old son of the murdered woman was produced before the acting magistrate of Pelmadulla on Saturday as the 48 hour time period granted by court to the Colombo Crimes Division to detain and interrogate the suspect was over.
Police ordered the magistrate to direct the suspect to a Physicist and a report be submitted  to the Judicial Medical Officer.
In keeping with the confession made by the suspect to the Police, the Sri Lanka Navy searched the canal in Kotaketahana hoping to find the weapon used for the murder.
Although the Police and the Sri Lanka Navy searched the canal for almost four hours this morning , they were unable to find the murder weapon.
Chandrani Swarnalatha , a mother of three whose murder on April 5, had not led to any accused, was laid to rest two days ago.
When News1st visited the area on Friday, the locals said that they cannot entire believe that statement made that the murdered woman’s own son had killed her.
Sociologists are of the view that this village with many unanswered questions should not be allowed to be isolate – urging that it is a serious social requirement.

heading: Prominent figures gather to pay last respects to late Asg...
content:
The funeral of the late Chief Prelate of the Asgiri Chapter of the Siam Sect Most Venerable Udugama Sri Buddharakkitha Thero will take place on Sunday April 12.
The mortal remains of the late Chief Prelate are currently lying at the Upali Pravara Memorial Hall at Asgiri Viharaya for the public to pay their respects.
Crowds in their numbers continue to arrive to pay their last respects to the late Chief Prelate of the Asgiri Chapter.
The Prime Minister of Bhutan Tshering Tobgay also visited the Agiri Viharaya to pay his respect to the late Udugama Sri Buddharakkitha Thero.
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe also paid his last respect to the late Chief Prelate on Saturday.
Meanwhile, the Commander of the Sri Lanka Army and several other top brass of the three armed forces were also present to pay their respect to the late Most Venerable Chief Prelate. The Inspector General of Police was among those present today to pay last respects to the late Chief Prelate.
Politicians too were present at the Asgiri Viharaya today to pay their final respects. Leader of the Janasetha Permauna , Venerable Battaramulle Seelarathana Thero was also present today to pay his final respects to the mortal remains of the late Chief Prelate.
Western Provincial Councillor Susara Dinal also paid his respect to the late Chief Prelate today. UPFA Western Provincial Councillor Susara Dinal said that they arrived here to pay the respects to the mortal remains of the late Chief Prelate.
He added:
 We also express the condolences of the Chairman of the Capital Maharaja Organisation Limited, the Board of Directors and the entire staff of the Organisation.
He went on to note that they hope the the late Chief Prelate who rendered an immense service to the nation and the Sambuddha Sasana will rest in peace.
Speaking further the Provincial Councillor said
As an Organisation we have informed the clergy that we will render our assistance in carrying forward the programmes of the late the Chief Prelate.
The funeral of the late Chief Prelate of the Asgiri Chapter of the Siam Sect will take place at the Police Grounds in Kandy on Sunday afternoon.

heading: Just in : Several parliamentarians removed from SLFP Cent...
content:
Parliamentarians T.B. Ekanayake, Bandula Gunawardena, Salinda Dissanayake and S.M.Chandrasena have been removed from the SLFP Central Working Committee.
Speaking to News1st, the parliamentarians said that they had been informed of the removal of their membership from the SLFP Central Working Committee by the Chairman of the party, in a letter.
They add that however  that they are still members of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party.

heading: Assistance from Singapore sought to file legal action aga...
content:
The Anti-Corruption Front says that it hopes to seek the assistance of Singapore in order to investigate the Treasury Bonds issued by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka that had led to much controversy.
The Anti-Corruption Front says that the Committee appointed by the Prime Minister to investigate the treasury bonds of the Central Bank that were issued on  February 27, is yet to release its report.
Convener of the Anti Corruption Front Wasantha Samarasinghe said that Arjuna Mahendran has committed this act while being a citizen of Singapore adding that according to Singaporean law that is a wrong doing.
He went on to note that they request that an investigation under the laws of immigration and emigration be conducted.

heading: Damana residents allege that timber smugglers have cut do...
content:
Residents of Damana which is within close proximity to the Malayadi Reserve says that timber smugglers have cut down around 40 teak trees in the reserve.
Residents add that even though the reserve is of no use to the villagers it has become a source of great importance to Timber smugglers.
The residents of Ambalanoya and Neeththa had planted the teak trees in the Malayadi reserve, around 15 years back. The villagers raise allegations that the timber smugglers are taking use of the trees in the reserve.
The very recent incident was reported on Friday.
On information received that  timber smugglers are in the reserve, the police  together with the Grama Sevaka officers of Madawalalanda and Ambalanoya, raided the reserve after consulting the Damana Divisional Secretariat.
Police were able to seize teak logs, a motorcycle and a saw that was used to cut down the trees. However,  the suspects had escaped. Police stated that investigations are underway to arrest the suspects.

heading: Programme held under auspices of President to raise aware...
content:
A programme to raise awareness among the public on food safety in Sri Lanka took place on Friday in Colombo under the auspices of President Maithripala Sirisena.
The meeting was organised by the World Health Organisation’s Sri Lankan Office in lieu of World Health Day.
The programme was named ‘From farm to plate’ and raised awareness of correct food patterns and also food preservation.
Minister of Health Dr.Rajitha Senaratne and several Ministers and MPs were present at this event.

heading: Man crashes Virat Kohli’s shoot : What happens next...
content:
Cricketer Virat Kohli is not known for exhibiting patience. but this time a man in Bangalore was risking the odds when he decided to interrupt the 26 year old cricketer during an ad-shoot.
The video was posted on 8th April by Kohli’s IPL team, the Royal Challengers, and has got more than 200,000 views by now.
The intruder tells Kohli that they haven’t met before this encounter because ‘two superstars can’t be in one room.’
He then tries to coach Kohli on his dialogues. When the director senses that Kohli is losing his cool, he leads the man to the exit door.
We have witnessed Kohli’s outbursts many a times, there was that infamous spat with Gautam Gambhir in the 2013 Indian premier League. Recently, he abused a journalist for writing about him and girlfriend Anushka Sharma. He, once, argued aggressively with the on-field officials even after the third umpire ruled against him during a match against Zimbabwe.

 
Source: NDTV

heading: Special traffic plan in Kandy for funeral of late Asgiri ...
content:
Police say that a special traffic plan will be implemented in Kandy on Sunday due to the funeral of the late chief prelate of the Asgriya Chapter of the Siam sect the Most Ven. Udugama Shri Budharakkitha thero.
Issuing a communique, Police Headquarters said that the special traffic plan will be implemented from 1 p.. to 2.30 p.m. on Sunday April 12.
The final procession carrying the mortal remains of the the late chief prelate will depart from the Asgiriya Temple at 1 p.m. on Sunday and is scheduled to reach the Asgiriya Police grounds at 2.30 p.m.
The communique notes that roads leading up to Gamini Dissanayake Mawatha, Kandey Veediya, D.S. Senanayake road, Clock tower Junction, Thilak Rathnayake Mawatha, and the police grounds in Asgiriya will be closed for traffic.

heading: Bhutan PM visits the Jaya Sri Maha Bodhiya
content:
Bhutan Prime Minister Tshering Tobgay who arrived in the country for a three-day official tour, visited the Jaya Sri Maha Bodhiya in Anuradhapura on Saturday, April 11.
The Prime Minister called on the Chief Incumbent of the Atamasthanaya Venerable Pallegama Srinivasa thero  and obtained his blessings.
The visiting Bhutan PM also paid homage to the Jaya Sri Maha Bodi . He was also gifted a sapling of the sacred tree, following a request made by him.
Meanwhile Prime Minister Tshering Tobgay called on the Chief Prelate of the Malwathu Chapter Most Ven. Thibbatuwawe Sri Sumangala Thero and thereafter paid homage to the Sacred Temple of the Tooth Relic.

heading: MP Bandula Gunawardena removed from SLFP Central Working ...
content:
Parliamentarian Bandula Gunawardena has been removed from the SLFP Central Working Committee.
Speaking to News1st, Parliamentarian Bandula Gunawardena said that he had been informed of the removal of his membership from the SLFP Central Working Committee.
He said that however , is still a member of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party.

heading: Godzilla named tourism ambassador for Tokyo
content:
Godzilla which is popular for its violent and terrorising role has been appointed a special resident and tourism ambassador for Tokyo’s Shinjuku ward.
The fire-breathing, building stomping Godzilla was welcomed to Tokyo on Thursday, this time as a sign of prosperity rather than destruction.
The official announcement was made on Thursday at the unveiling of a life-sized (171-foot) Godzilla head that sits atop the eighth floor balcony of the Godzilla-themed Hotel Gracery in Shinjuku. The building also houses an office of Toho, the studio responsible for making the original Godzilla film in 1954.

heading: Student hit by train in Hikkaduwa
content:
A school student was killed after she was knocked down by a train in Hikkaduwa.
Police say that the incident had occurred at 9 a.m. Saturday.
The victim was knocked down by a train plying from Maradana to Matara, when she was walking along the tracks with a friend.
The deceased was fourteen-year-old, and a resident of Meetiyagoda.

heading: Liquor stores to remain closed from Sunday
content:
The Excise department has issued an order to close down all liquor outlets and bars on Sunday, April 12.
The final rites of Chief Prelate of the Asgiri Chapter Most Venerable Udugama Sri Buddarakitha thero will be conducted on Sunday and as a result of this, Sunday has been named a national day of mourning. The excise department stated that they issued the order after taking this into consideration.
Furthermore, Excise Superintendent Prabath Jayawickrama added that all liquor shops and bars will remain closed on April 13 and  14 due to the Sinhala and Tamil New Year.

heading: More Sri Lankan migrant workers return from Yemen (watch ...
content:
Another group of Sri Lankan migrant workers who were stranded in war torn Yemen arrived in the country on Friday (April 10th)
The group which consisted of 16 individuals arrived at the Katunayake Bandaranaike International Airport at around 8pm on board a Qatar airways flight from Doha.
According to the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment 52 Sri Lankan migrant workers who were employed in Yemen have been repatriated.
Speaking to News1st one of the migrant workers stated that clashes in Yemen are intensifying adding that they found it difficult to escape the country. Recollecting how the group got out of Yemen, he stated that the group first made their way to the Port of Hodeida with great difficulty and boarded a Chinese naval vessel which brought them to Djibouti.
Another migrant workers who arrived on Friday thanked News1st for revealing their plight to the general public and calling on officials to expedite their return.
