heading: Marquez tops second MotoGP practice in Texas
content:
Marc Marquez set the fastest time of the second free practice on Friday (April 10) ahead of Sunday’s (April 12) MotoGP race at the Circuit of the Americas in Austin, USA.
Spain’s Marquez clocked a time of two minutes 04.835 seconds riding a Honda. Also riding a Honda, Brit Cal Crutchlow took second spot with a time of two minutes 05.162 seconds. Andrea Iannone of Italy claimed third place in the classifications with two minutes 05.190 seconds on his Ducati bike.
Aleix Espargaro took fourth spot riding a Suzuki and Ducati’s Andrea Dovizioso finished with the fifth fastest lap. Valentino Rossi rounded out the top six riding Yamaha.
Marquez said afterwards that is was good to experience diverse weather conditions throughout the days practice in Austin.
Earlier in the day a stray dog halted the first practice session after the animal ran onto the rain soaked track in front of riders. The dog was caught and the session, which had already started late due to delays in getting marshals into position, resumed after a 20-minute delay.
Defending champion Marquez heads into the second leg of the MotoGP championship in 5th place, following a disappointing race in Qatar. Valentino Rossi who is a 6 time world champion currently leads the standings with 46 points

heading: General amnesty period for ‘absent military personn...
content:
The general amnesty period facilitating absentees of the military to receive their discharge from the Army will end on Thursday, April 16.
Acting Military Spokesperson Brigadier Jayanath Jayaweera said that 10,200 army deserters have now arrived at their respective regimental centres
Speaking further, he said that accordingly these regiment centres acted swiftly to grant these military personnel their letters of discharge from the Army.
Brigadier Jayanath Jayaweera went on to note that as for those military personnel who do not report to their respective regiment centres, the Army will be compelled to take legal action against them, where they will be listed as a wanted Army deserter. He added that it must be noted that following the conclusion of this amnesty period, this law will come into effect.

heading: Leaders of cold war era foes shake hands
content:
U.S. President Barack Obama and Cuban President Raul Castro greeted each other on Friday (April 10) at a summit in Panama. The handshake between the two leaders shows a symbolically charged gesture as the pair seek to restore ties between two Cold War foes.
A White House official confirmed the two men shook hands and spoke briefly.
The summit is historic because it is the first time that a Cuban head of state attends the Summit of the Americas and is being held as the U.S. and Cuba seek to restore diplomatic ties.
Apart from a couple of brief, informal encounters, the leaders of the United States and Cuba have not had any significant meetings since the Castro brothers toppled U.S.-backed dictator Fulgencio Batista and then steered their Caribbean country into a close alliance with the Soviet Union.
On the sidelines of the Summit of the Americas, Cuban President Raul Castro also held bilateral talks with the head of the U.S. Chamber of Commerce and with U.N. Secretary-General Ban Ki-Moon.
Cuban television showed images of Castro and Cuban officials meeting with Chamber of Commerce CEO Thomas Donohue and a delegation of U.S. business officials. The two, who met previously in May of 2014, met in Panama City, Panama, where Castro is attending the seventh Summit of the Americas.
Castro also met with Ban where the two reportedly discussed disarmament, peace and social development issues.

heading: National and international leaders express condolences ov...
content:
Local and international leaders have expressed their condolences over the passing of the Chief Prelate of the Asgiri Chapter of the Siam Sect, the Most Venerable Aggmaha Panditha Udugama Sri Buddharakkitha Thero.
Issuing a statement,  the US Embassy in Sri Lanka has extended its heartfelt condolences on the passing of the Chief Prelate.
The statement adds that Sri Lankans and Americans who knew him, respected the late Mahanayake’s ceaseless efforts to improve the lives of all Sri Lankans, through his exemplary life and the teachings of the Buddha he expounded.
Meanwhile, the Chinese Embassy in Sri Lanka also extended its condolences following the passing of the chief prelate. The Chinese Embassy stated that the Chief Prelate of the Asgiri Chapter of the Siam Sect Most Venerable Aggmaha Panditha Udugama Sri Buddharakkitha Thero, made great contributions not only to Buddhism but to the world.
Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, in his condolence message, states that the late chief prelate not only strengthened national independence but also provided his blessings to eradicate terrorism from the country.
The Chairman of the Maha Bodhi Society of Sri Lanka Venerable Balagala Upatissa Thero in his message of condolence commended the service rendered to society and the Sasana by the Late Chief Prelate of the Asgiri Chapter.
Crowds continue to arrive to pay their last respects to the late Chief Prelate of the Agiri Chapter. The mortal remains which lay at the Asgiri Maha Viharaya in Kandy were moved to the Pravara Upali Hall of the Temple this morning.
The funeral will take place at the Police Grounds in Kandy on Sunday.

heading: News1st visits Kotakethana as son confesses to killing mo...
content:
On Friday, April 11, court permitted the Colombo Crimes Division to detain and interrogate the suspect connected to the murder of a woman in Kotakethana , Kahawatta.
Permission was granted after the suspect was produced before the Pelmadulla District Magistrate on Friday. The Colombo Crimes Division requested court to grant permission to detain the suspect for 48 hours and question him.
Magistrate Dinesh Lakmal who inquired into the request, thereafter approved it.
Mother of three, Chandrani Swarnalatha who was killed on April 5  was laid to rest on Friday, leaving many questions unanswered. At present the suspect connected to the homicide is in police custody. The suspect is the 18-year-old son of the victim.
According to Police media Spokesperson ASP Ruwan Gunasekara, the suspect had confessed to the police that he had committed the murder as the victim (his mother) refused to provide money to him to buy a gift for his girlfriend.
News 1st on Friday visited house of Chandrani Swarnalatha, in Kotakethana , Kahawatte. When News 1st reached the house there was no one except for a police security detail. A Police Post and a Police Special Task Force Camp is located in close proximity to the crime scene.
When News 1st visited the location, relatives of the victim said that they cannot believe the statements made that the son had committed the crime.
The Sri Lanka Navy began search operations in a nearby canal for the murder weapon. The suspect had allegedly tossed the weapon into the canal. However they are yet to find the murder weapon.

heading: Kittampahuwa, Wellampitiya residents say attempt to fill ...
content:
Residents voiced their concerns, and protested over an attempt to illegally fill a marshy land in Kittampahuwa, Wellampitiya. News 1st directed this plight to the respective authorities.
Chairman of the Central Environmental Authority, Professor Lal Dharmasiri noted that he will look into the matter and bring this issue to the attention of relevant government officials. The Central Environmental Authority, as stated, fulfilled this promise.
People in the area asked whether the officials can’t see this ? Thereafter, they had contacted News1st to share their plight on this action which they alleged, is being carried out by government officials and political forces. Further, even though they reached the police and the environmental authority they had not got any response from them.
However, they stated that their attempts resulted in death threats, if they invite the media and hold protests.
Our News1st reporter noted that this is a fair request made by the people for when the rains pour  their houses  will be filled with water. Therefore, it was pointed out that the officials need to find an immediate solution to this problem. A stream which flows through Wellampitiya, Brandiyawaththa and Wennawaththe ends up on three and a half acre area of marshy land. Also, it is discovered that filling of land on this three and a half acre marshy land was done without obtaining any approval.
Director General CEA K.S. Muthukudaarachchi noted that this has been occurring for a couple of weeks but it is the first time the Central Environment authority was informed about this.  He stated that no farm land can be filled without prior permission obtained from the Commissioner of Agarian Services. Further, he stated that he will gather all relevant institutions and address the issue before the New Year Season.
The residents of the area noted that they would like to thank Sirasa. They said
If this place gets flooded our children would not have any place to live.
They went on to state that they would have no other option but to start living on the road. Thus they extended their heartfelt thanks and appreciation for helping them in their effort to point out these unfair and illegal acts.

heading: Concern grows as vegetables pile up at the Dambulla Econo...
content:
With the dawn of the New Year, a mountain of vegetables are being piled at the Dambulla Economic Centre.
The Dambulla Economic Centre has been receiving Hundreds and thousands of kilogrammes of vegetables within the past two days with the approach of the  Sinhala and Tamil New Year.
Chairman of the Trade Union of Dambulla Dedicated Economic Centre U.R. Daya Nandasiri stated that even though there was a good price for vegetables last week, farmers did not bring in their produce as they thought they would be able to obtain a higher price during the new year season, as they did last year. He went on to say that there was an excess at the Dambulla market because crops that were supposed to come in last week came over the past couple of days.
When questioned on the reason behind the low sales this season, the Chairman stated that problems faced in transportation was a main reason as they make a seven-hour journey from Colombo to Dambulla on roads which are in a dilapidated state. He added that the only solution in order to clear the excess vegetables was to provide these vegetables as food for elephants living in the Digampathaha – Sigiriya Reserve.

heading: Malala Yousafzai pleads for Nigeria’s abducted girls
content:
Nobel Peace Prize winner Malala Yousafzai has called for more action to free schoolgirls abducted by militant Islamists in Nigeria 12 months ago.
She has criticised Nigerian authorities and world leaders for failing to do enough to secure their release.
On April 14, 2014, Islamists with Boko Haram kidnapped the girls, prompting an international campaign for their safe return, which used the hashtag #BringBackOurGirls.
On Monday, UNICEF announced a new campaign for the 800,000 children who have been displaced in northeast Nigeria, using the hashtag #BringBackOurChildhood.
Yousafzai, who rose to international fame after being shot by the Taliban for standing for girls’ rights to education, made the comments on the first anniversary of the schoolgirls’ abduction.
Ms Yousafzai said  “We cannot imagine the full extent of the horrors you have endured. But please know this: we will never forget you”
She went onto note ” Like you, I was a target of militants who did not want girls to go to school. Gunmen shot me and two of my friends on a school bus. All three of us survived and are back in school. Now we speak out on behalf of all girls about the right to get a proper education. Our campaign will continue until you and all girls and boys around the world are able to access a free, safe and quality secondary education.”
“I look forward to the day I can hug each one of you, pray with you, and celebrate your freedom with your families,” Ms Yousafzai said.
Malala’s letter, which she said was “a message of solidarity love and hope”, comes as events, including marches, prayers and vigils, were being held to mark the girls’ 12 months in captivity.

heading: Karapitiya man alleges that police robbed his money ̵...
content:
A complaint has been lodged at the Karapitiya Hospital police post citing that a police officer and several others believed to be ex-police officers had allegedly robbed Rs.900,000 from a businessman, aged 40, who is a resident of Meetiyagoda in Galle.
This individual, who was in the profession of lending money on interest, had been stopped by the police four days ago while returning home in the Aluthwala area in Mahagangoda.
The victim in question stated that several police officers grabbed him from behind and asked him where he was going and how much money he had on him. He had responded by saying that he had over Rs.900,000 in possession. According to the businessman, the police had then accused him of gambling, assaulted him, taken his money and once he fell unconscious taken him to a hospital.
Police Media Spokesperson ASP Ruwan Gunasekera noted that the businessman was a suspect who was arrested for illegal gambling on April 9. He was released on bail on the following day under the orders of presenting in front of the Balapitiya Magistrate. Afterwards he had admitted himself into the Karapitiya hospital and had made the complaint. The police are currently conducting investigation into verifying these claims.

heading: Persons arrested in Gannoruwa party office clash released...
Avissawella accident claims a life
content:
An individual was killed in a road accident in the Boralugoda area in Kosgama, Avissawella.
According to the police, the accident occurred when a van travelling towards Colombo collided with a motorcycle.
One of the two persons on the motorcycle was pronounced dead upon hospitialisation, while the other who sustained injuries has been admitted to the Avissawella Hospital.
Police further said that the driver of the van has been arrested.

heading: Arrest made at BIA over alleged drug smuggling
content:
An individual who arrived from Chennai, India has been arrested at the Katunayake International Airport. It is alleged that the individual attempted to smuggle eight kilogrammes of drugs  into the country.
According to the police, the individual who is a forty-year-old from Kalmunai was apprehended by the Narcotics Bureau at the Airport. The suspect has now been released on bail. He is scheduled to be produced before the Negombo Magistrate on April 22.

heading: CAA Special Investigation Unit raids Pettah food outlets ...
content:
The Consumer Affairs Authority is continuing to carry out raids to nab deceitful traders and remove food items that do not meet the proper standards, during this festive season.
An inspection team headed by the Consumer Affairs Authority’s Special Investigation Unit OIC Pradeep Kalutaraarachchi visited several food outlets in Pettah on Monday April 13. The move   was based on the objective of inspecting wholesale outlets located down Bodhiraja Mawatha. It was reported that many stocks of potatoes, onions and fruits for sale at several locations were not suitable for consumption.
He stated that they witnessed the manner in which substandard quality potatoes, onions and fruits which were sold along the sidewalk were thrown away and were later washed and resold by minor vendors in the area.
As a result the Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) noted that they hope to create a more secure and safe market environment to protect lives and well being of consumers in the country.
Officer in Charge Special Raid Unit CAA Pradeep Kalutaraachchi noted that these onions and potatoes which are of sub standard quality and which are unsuitable for consumption are been cleaned and washed and put for sale back again by these vendors. Thus these spoilt items are only being purchased by consumers. Even fruits such as apples and oranges are being sold by displaying the good fruits in the front row. However, the others at the back are spoilt.
He went on to note that such vendors engaging in illegal activities have been apprehended.

heading: Game Of Thrones becomes the world’s most-pirated show
content:
Game Of Thrones is already the world’s most pirated show.
The very night before Game Of Thrones Season 5 was set to premiere, the first four episodes of the season have been leaked simultaneously. Rumours of this leak started circulating on the afternoon of the 11th (Saturday) by 6 p.m. the files started appearing across myriad torrent trackers. In just a few hours since, over 50,000 people have grabbed the first episode.
Like each season before it, Season 5 of Thrones will consist of just 10 episodes along with this, nearly half of the season has leaked before the first episode even got a chance to officially premiere. Pretty harsh words are being thrown at HBO HQ right now since almost half of the entire season has been leaked.
How can HBO respond? Do they ride it out and hope subscribers are willing to wade through spoilers for the next four weeks? Do they release all of the leaked episodes in one blast in order to get everyone on the same page?
HBO has not yet replied to a request for comment.

heading: Over 100 apprehended; police on the lookout for drunk dri...
content:
One hundred and forty seven (147) drivers were nabbed during countrywide patrols for driving under the influence. This accounts for drivers under the influence apprehended in the past 24 hours that ended on Monday April 13 at 6 a.m.
Police Media Spokesperson ASP Ruwan Gunasekera said that the majority of those arrested were three-wheeler drivers. He also added that operations to nab or apprehend drivers under the influence of alcohol will continue during the festive season.
During patrols on Sunday, police apprehended 175 drivers who were under the influence of alcohol.

heading: Siberia’s wildfires kill 15 people as thousands fle...
content:
According to Russian media reports, wildfires have killed at least 15 people and injured about 400 in the Khakassia region of southern Siberia. The fires were fuelled by high winds and dry weather, destroyed 1,200 houses in 30 towns and villages. Firefighters have now managed to extinguish the flames, the Rossiya 24 TV news channel reports.
They were helped by water-bombing aircraft. Five cases of alleged criminal negligence have been opened. At least 5,000 people have fled to emergency accommodation.
Authorities in the Khakassia republic – part of the Russian Federation – have decided to ban alcohol sales while the state of emergency continues in the region.
There are suspicions that farmers burning grass in their fields were to blame.

heading: Excise Dept on the lookout for ‘open bars’
content:
The Commissioner General of the Excise Department has been requested to conduct a thorough investigation into the sale of alcohol at a bar in Chilaw during the festive season.
Prabath Jayawickrama, Media Spokesperson for the Excise Authority, reiterated that all bars across the country are to be closed on Monday and Tuesday in lieu of the New year.
Jayawickrama said that legal action would be taken against establishments that violate these regulations.
Minister of Education Akila Viraj Kariyawasam, meanwhile, urged the youth of the country to celebrate the New Year without indulging in alcohol.

heading: UPDATE: Preparations underway for Aluth Avurudu – a...
content:
As the Sun moves from Pisces to Aries,  the Sinhala and Tamil New Year will dawn on us on Tuesday, April 14.
The zodiac shift is considered a great ceremony for the Sri Lankan agrarian societies with the promise of crops. The main tradition of this ceremony is to appreciate  the Sun God who provides the rich resources of rice and other food items.
The Sinhala and Tamil New Year New Year will dawn at 1. 47 on Tuesday afternoon.
The inauspicious time or Nonagathaya will take place from  7.23 Tuesday morning to 08.11.
Astrologers state that it is wise to take the first meal at 7.23 a.m. and stop working in order to take part in religious activities.
The auspicious time to kindle the hearth is at 2.05 p.m.
It has been deemed auspicious to dress in red attire, turn eastwards and kindle the hearth to prepare red milk rice mixed with cane sugar, accompanied by a sweet meat.
It has also been deemed auspicious to conduct transactions at 02.42 p.m., Tuesday, April 14.  This is also the auspicious time to consume food, facing the East and in red attire.
The auspicious time for the anointing of the head with oils, is 09.06 a.m. on Wednesday, April 15; while the auspicious colour for attire is light green and the auspicious direction, North.
According to Mahinda Kumara Dalupotha however, there is an issue as to how people can comply with age-old traditions but they cannot be followed. The water that comes through the pipes can be stopped before the inauspicious time. After the Nonagathaya, you can have a small clay pot and place a white cloth under it and collect the water from the tap or the pipe. Subsequently, based on the religious following , you cannot engage in religious activities. If you are a Buddhist you can visit the temple and pour the water to the Bo tree. If you are a Hindu, you can also visit the Kovil and do the same. The clay pot that was used to mark the end of the old year can be cleaned with clay and used once again to welcome the New Year with new intentions.
Deputy General Manager of the Sri Lanka Transport Board, Raja Gunatilleke says that buses will be dispatched from the Pettah Central Bus Stand based on the requirement during the festive season.
When News 1st visited the Private Bus Stand in Bastian Mawatha , it was evident that facilities had been provided in a manner where there will be no congestion to the passengers travelling in buses. However, it was reported on Monday morning that there were fewer buses being deployed to the areas of Nuwara Eliya and Matale. Our correspondents reported that there were insufficient buses for shot-distance travel.

heading: Fire breaks out at Katunayake FTZ garment factory
content:
A fire has been reported inside a garment factory at the Katunayake  Free Trade Zone.
The Police Media Spokesperson’s office said  the fire, which started at 8:30 on Monday morning, is currently being controlled by fire-fighters.
The cause of the fire is yet to be determined.

heading: Former US Secretary of State Hillary Clinton Announces 20...
content:
Former US Secretary of State Hillary Clinton has formally entered the 2016 race for the White House in a bid to become the first woman US president.
She launched her campaign website on Sunday, telling Americans she wanted to be their “champion”.
Mrs Clinton ran for the Democratic presidential nomination in 2008 but lost to Barack Obama.
The overwhelming Democratic favourite, she had been expected to declare her candidacy for months.
In a video on her website, Mrs Clinton declared: “I am running for president”.
“Americans have fought their way back from tough economic times,” she said, “but the deck is still stacked in favour of those at the top.
“Everyday Americans need a champion and I want to be that champion,” she added.
The video features a number of Americans talking about their hopes and aspirations.
It ends with Mrs Clinton saying: “So I’m hitting the road to earn your vote because it’s your time and I hope you’ll join me on this journey”.
Mrs Clinton’s team said would spend the next few weeks building up grassroots support in the early Democratic primary states; she tweeted that she is on her way to Iowa.
She is expected to hold her first rally, officially kicking off her campaign, in mid-May.
 
-BBC

heading: Twenty arrested in political party supporters’ clas...
content:
Four individuals have been injured in a clash between supporters of a political party in the Gannoruwa area in Kandy.
Police Media Spokesperson ASP Ruwan Gunasekara said twenty individuals have been arrested in connection to the incident.
The conflict reportedly arose due to an issue surrounding a rented building.

heading: Ceylon Today and Mawbima newspapers honoured at Goa Fest ...
content:
Ceylon Today  and Mawbima, two mainstream local newspapers in Sri Lanka were honoured at the Goa Fest 2015 Award Ceremony in India.
Ceylon Today and Mawbima were awarded three gold medals and a silver medal  for innovation in the print media category.
Goa Fest 2015 is  an advertising festival in the Asia-Pacific region. Entries from agencies in Sri Lanka, Pakistan, Bangladesh and Nepal are received every year.

heading: NTC to monitor transport charges during the festive season
content:
The National Transport Commission states that legal action will be taken against those who charge passengers who are travelling to their respective homes in view of the new year holiday over and beyond the requisite transport charge.
Chairman of the Commission D.S. Jayaweera stated that measures will be initiated to impose punishment under the prevailing laws.
A special transport service will be in effect on Monday April 13 as well, in view of the holiday season, to ease travel requirements of passengers.
Deputy General Manager of the Sri Lanka Transport Board, Raja Gunathilake stated that steps have been taken to fulfill this requirement by utilising buses from the Colombo Pettah bus terminal.

heading: Five-year-old girl raises $25,000 to help ailing brother
content:
A Toronto girl’s lemonade stand fundraiser to help find a cure for her brother’s neurological disability has inspired a U.S. family dealing with the same illness.
Na’ama Uzan, the five year old, has raised approximately $25,000 to support a cure for Angelman Syndrome, a rare development and neurological disability.
The girl’s older brother, Nadav Uzan, suffers from Angelman Syndrome. The disability makes it difficult for the seven year old to walk or speak, and he has frequent seizures.
Last spring, Na’ama Uzan opened up a lemonade stand to raise money for the Foundation for Angelman Syndrome Therapeutics. Her stand, which also sells muffins, has raised the impressive sum in a short time.
Uzan’s efforts has inspired others to also raise money to find a cure for the disability. Thousands of kilometres away in California, David Low and his partner have raised more than $20,000 after their son was diagnosed with Angelman Syndrome six months ago.
That $20,000 will be used to set up a research grant in Uzan’s name.
 
-CTV News

heading: Interpol officers to be given special travel permits to v...
content:
The  Ministry of Public Order states that a decision has been reached to introduce a special travel permit for the International Criminal Police Organisation (Interpol) officers.
Minister of Public Order John Amaratunga stated that this will be issued to interpol officers who need to visit Sri Lanka to conduct investigations.
The Minister added that the Interpol’s assistance will be sought to carry out further investigations into alleged financial frauds committed by former MPs.

heading: National oil-anointing ceremony held in Polonnaruwa (Watc...
content:
The national oil-anointing ceremony which was held in Polonnaruwa at the Kanduruwela Jayanthi Viharaya was celebrated under the auspices of President Maithripala Sirisena.
Subsequent to the ceremony, the President went on to have cordial discussions with the locals who were present.
The anointing of oil for the Sinhala and Hindu New Year was marked at the auspicious time of 9.06 on the morning April 15.

heading: EU takes on Google over anti-competitive behaviour
content:
The European Union is expected to take action against internet giant, Google over alleged anti-competitive behaviour.
Margrethe Vestager is expected to draft her intentions following a five year investigation in to the company by the EU. However Google had reassured its employees on Tuesday, April 14 that it expects to counter the said allegations with a strong defence.
The commission set out to act based on complaints, stating that Google, which accounts for 90% of EU based web searches, favours its own products in search engine results.
The case is expected to be most contentious antitrust cases since the EU took on another renowned tech giant, Microsoft, 10 years ago.

heading: FC Barcelona to take on Paris-Saint Germain in Champions ...
content:
Spanish Leaders FC Barcelona is scheduled to take on Paris-Saint Germain in the first leg of the quarter final in the champions league, today April 15 at 12:15 a.m. local time (6.45 GMT).
Barcelona star forward Messi who had a slow year last season, has scored 45 goals in 44 games and is looking to be at the top of his game going in. Barcelona who is currently on the top of their home league, The Liga BBVA, is one of the strongest squads on paper with both experience and talent spreading through the squad.
PSG also tops their local league ,France Ligue 1, and is expected to be a formidable opponent for Luis Enrique and his men. However the French team will have an uphill struggle, with key players Zlatan Ibrahimovic,Marco Verratti and David Luiz missing from the line-up.

heading: SLFP-appointed committee to scrutinise electoral reforms ...
content:
The committee appointed by the Sri Lanka Freedom Party to look into the electoral reforms will convene on Thursday, April 16.
At the Sri Lanka Freedom Party meeting presided by President Maithripala Sirisena recently, it was decided that a proposal for a change in the electoral system with the 19th Amendment to the constitution needs to be introduced.
The President who accepted this proposal appointed a five-member committee.
The committee comprises of Dilan Perera, Professor G.L. Peiris , Nimal Siripala de Silva, Anura Priyadarshana Yapa and Mahinda Samarasinghe.
Speaking to News1st, Oppositon Leader Nimal Siripala de Silva said that the committee has drawn its attention towards changing the current election system and bringing in the electorate system.
The proposal made to increase the number of MPs to 250 from the current number of 225, has also been taken in to consideration.
The Sri Lanka Freedom Party says that it has discussed this matter with the United People’s Freedom Alliance as well.

heading: Houthi rebels condemn UN’s arms embargo
content:
The U.N Security Council was condemned on Tuesday by the Houthi rebels after the council imposed an arms embargo on the rebels and their allies.
The Houthis’ military advancements were forced to face airstrikes by a Saudi-led Coalition since March 26.
The Houthi’s Supreme Revolutionary Committee called on the people of Yemen to rally on Thursday, April 16 to protest the Security Council’s resolution.
The Security Council’s resolution demanded that the rebels withdraw from the areas seized by them, including the capital Sanaa and to return to negotiations regarding the democratic transition, that began in 2011 when Abdrabbuh Mansour Hadi and followers forced Mr Saleh to hand over his powers following massive protests.

heading: Thirteen hospitalised following acid attack in Attanagalla
content:
Ten persons were victims of an acid attack in the Rukmale area in Atthanagalle, after an altercation that took place during a game of Elle escalated.
Police Media Spokesperson, ASP Ruwan Gunasekara said that ten of the injured had acid thrown on them and were admitted to the Wathupitiwala Hospital. Three others have been injured in the fracas.
The incident had occurred after a dispute arose between two groups during a game of Elle on Tuesday.
According to ASP Gunasekera, six suspects have been identified, while two of them have been arrested.

heading: Real Madrid and Atletico Madrid in a goal-less draw
content:
Rivals Real Madrid and Atletico Madrid faced off yesterday, 14th April. The Champions League quarter-final first leg ended in a goalless draw.
Gareth Bale, Mario Suarez and James Rodiguez were all thwarted by Atletico Goalkeeper Jan Oblak’s exemplary performance.
The side will clash again at the Bernabeu on  April 22. Real aim to be the first team to win European cups back to back since AC Milan in 1989 and 1990. However. Atletico will not make the task easy, being unbeaten against Real in seven games.

heading: Hundreds of migrants missing after boat from Libya capsizes
content:
Nearly 400 migrants fleeing Libya are feared to have drowned after their boat capsized in the Mediterranean, survivors told an aid organisation.
The Italian Coast Guard had rescued 144 people and launched an air and sea search operation in hopes of rescuing the rest. The European Union says that more than 7,000 migrants have been rescued from the Mediterranean since Friday.
Survivors say the latest tragedy happened after the boat, carrying about 550 migrants in total, overturned a day after leaving Libya.
Nine bodies have already been recovered, but no more survivors have been found since then.
The deaths, if confirmed, would add to the skyrocketing numbers of migrants lost at sea: The International Organisation for Migration estimates that up to 3,072 migrants are believed to have died in the Mediterranean in 2014, compared to an estimate of 700 in 2013.

heading: Narcotics high on list of causes for Weligama accidents
Airplane skids off Japan runaway
content:
Twenty three persons were  injured when a South Korean airplane lost control and skidded off the runaway when landing, at midnight Tuesday, April 14  in Hiroshima, Japan.
Japanese officials have started investigations regarding the crash-landing of the A320 aircraft belonging to Asiana Airlines but have not been able to confirm the the cause.

heading: An Open Air Zoo to be declared open in Pinnawala
content:
Sri Lanka’s first Open Air Zoological Gardens is scheduled to be declared open on Friday, April 17 adjacent to the Pinnawala Elephant Orphanage.
The Open Air Zoo which spans 44 acres, was constructed targeting the promotion of the tourism industry. A worthy fact is the allocation of the Zoo for animals endemic to the country.
Animals such as leopards, bears, deer and crocodiles will be conserved and an opportunity is afforded to observe their movements.
The expenditure incurred on the Pinnawala Open Air Zoo is Rs.862 million rupees.

heading: West Indies struggle at home in encounter with England
content:
The second day of the test match between England and West Indies kicked off today at the Sir Vivian Richards Stadium, Antigua.
The home team struggled but managed to limit the tourists to 399. The West Indians put 155 for four wickets on the board for the fall of four wickets at the end of play with Jermaine Blackwood on 30 and Shivnarine Chanderpaul on 29 at the crease.
West Indies struggled with the England bowlers, who had early breakthroughs with four out of five managing to take a wicket each.

heading: A long wait the promised special transport service –...
content:
Commuters raise allegations that train travel did not function according to the proper time table on Wednesday April 15.
News1st cameras captured how a number of commuters were faced with hardships  at train stations on Wednesday morning.
Such a situation arose at Ganemlla and Gampaha train stations. People who were caught in this hassle stated that they checked the times of departure from the web, which was listed as 9.31. They said:
 But after arrival at the station we weren’t given tickets as the train will be delayed. Further,  a specific time was not be given as to when the train will arrive.
Meanwhile,  at the Ragama Railway Station several passengers stated that there was no special train service,  only the train that operated on schedule. If the special train was in place there would have been less congestion, they stated.

heading: Accident Service records 419 festive season accidents on ...
content:
According to the Health Unit it is reported that the number of accidents reported during the Sinhala and Tamil New Year, has increased by 15 % in comparison to the same period last year – 2014.
The officer-in-charge of the Nurses Training Unit at the Colombo National Hospital Pushpa Ramyani stated that during Monday and Tuesday alone, 419 patients were admitted to the Accident Unit of the Hospital.
Ramyani added that this figure included 92 road accidents, 112 domestic accidents, 112 cases of fainting and three persons who sustained injuries from fireworks.

heading: CEA to adopt systematic programme to manage solid waste
content:
The Central Environmental Authority has taken measures to adopt a systematic programme to dispose and manage solid waste.
Chairman of the Authority Lal Dharmapriya said that the responsibility of carrying out a research in this regard has been handed over to University of Kelaniya. Further, he added that many issues have cropped out due to the non management of solid waste and at present the CEA has added that at present the CEA has handed over 115 compost containers to Pradeshiya Sabhas.
The Chairman concluded saying that hope come up with a proper programme of waste management once the research is concluded.

heading: US Lottery boss charged with draw fixing
content:
The former security boss of a lottery in the US has been charged with fraud after allegedly hacking the computer that picks the winning numbers.
Eddie Raymond Tipton was the Security Director for the Multi-State Lottery Association when he was arrested in January by the Iowa Division of Criminal Investigations.
Prosecutors said he had been caught on CCTV buying the winning ticket. The $14.3m (£9.5m) prize was never claimed. Mr. Tipton denies the charges.
Citing court papers filed by prosecutors in the case, it is noted that the culprit may have inserted a thumb drive into a highly locked-down computer that’s supposed to generate the random numbers used to determine lottery winners.
The offline computer is housed in a glass room and in theory can only be accessed by two people at the same time. It is also constantly monitored by a video camera.
It is alleged Mr Tipton used his position as Security Director to change the video camera settings and record only one second in every minute. This would have given him enough time to enter the room and plug a thumb drive into the computer.
On that drive, according to the prosecution, was a rootkit: a stealthy computer program designed to do a specific task and, in this case, then erase itself.
That task was to predetermine the winning lottery numbers for the draw that Mr Tipton was to later buy the winning ticket

heading: IGP says legal action will be initiated over complaints f...
content:
Inspector General of Police N.K. Ilangakoon says measures will be taken to look into the complaints filed at the Financial Crimes Investigation Unit.
The IGP went on to state that steps will be taken to arrest and take legal action against those persons who have committed financial fraud.
He further noted that measures will be taken to present the suspects to court following the investigations even though extensive investigations are underway in relation to the complaints lodged at the Financial Crime Investigation Division
Several ministers and state officials have been called in for questioning based on complaints lodged at the Financial Crime Investigation Division

heading: Mortal Kombat X released for PS4, Xbox One and Steam
content:
Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment announced on Wednesday that Mortal Kombat X, the latest entry in the legendary fighting game franchise from NetherRealm Studios, is now available for the PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and Steam on Windows PC. The PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360 versions will be available in the near future.
Mortal Kombat X introduces a cinematic story filled with amazing graphics and all-new gameplay features to deliver the most brutal combat experience ever. The competition is taken to another level with over-the-top fighting game action and a roster made up of legendary characters including Scorpion, Sub-Zero and Raiden and a new generation of fighters including Cassie Cage, Jacqui Briggs and Takeda Takahashi.
Now, each character has three distinct variations for players to diversify their special abilities and add choice and customization as they play as their favorite combatant. Players will have the freedom to conquer their opponents in a way that fits their play style best before finishing the match with dramatic, over-the-top Fatalities.

heading: All-girl quintuplets born in four minutes at Texas hospital
content:
A Texas hospital said that a Houston woman gave birth to five girls in four minutes by cesarean section last week and all are doing well.
The Woman’s Hospital of Texas said on Tuesday in a statement that the five girls were born on April 8 at 28 weeks and two days. All were within the appropriate weight for that gestational age and currently require only a modest support for their breathing,
Danielle Busby and her husband, Adam Busby, named the girls Olivia Marie, Ava Lane, Hazel Grace, Parker Kate and Riley Paige. They have a big sister named Blayke.
One girl weighed 2 pounds 6 ounces at birth, three weighed 2 pounds 4 ounces and one weighed 2 pounds, Adam Busby said on their blog.
The hospital said the Busby girls are the first all-female quintuplets documented in the United States.
There were more than five-dozen quintuplets or higher order births in 2013 in the United States, according to the National Center for Health Statistics, the latest statistics available.
 
-Reuters

heading: Asia Cup to switch to T20 format
content:
The Asia Cup is set to undergo a radical change and will be a Twenty20 competition in 2016 for the first time, outgoing Asian Cricket Council chief executive Syed Ashraful Haq has revealed.
He said the 2016 Asia Cup would be held early next year as a prelude to the ICC World Twenty20, with the latter to be hosted by India from March 11 to April 3.
It would then revert to a 50-over tournament in 2018 ahead of the 2019 World Cup in England and be played as a Twenty20 competition again in 2020.
The ACC is to be wound down by June 30 and its operations absorbed by the International Cricket Council, prompting fears the Asia Cup tournament could be disbanded.
Also two Associate teams set to feature from 2016 as Asia Cup moves to mirror format of following World Cup.

heading: Ex-NFL player Aaron Hernandez found guilty of murder
content:
Ex-NFL star Aaron Hernandez has been found guilty of first-degree murder of his friend, another American footballer.
The former New England Patriots tight end was accused of the execution-style killing of 27 year old Odin Lloyd in 2013.
Hernandez was sentenced to life in prison without parole. He was arrested in 2013 and charged with killing Odin Lloyd, a semi-pro player who was dating the sister of
Hernandez’s fiancee.
Prosecutors said Hernandez, then 23, planned and carried out the murder for reasons that were never made clear to the jury.
Hernandez’s mother, Terri, and his fiancee, Shayanna Jenkins, gasped and sobbed as the verdict was read aloud in court.

heading: Polgahawela, Gampaha, Mirigama trains cancelled – a...
content:
Eight train services were disrupted on Thursday morning due to the non-attendance of railway employees who were expected to return to work with the conclusion of the Sinhala and Tamil New Year vacations.
The Railway Department said that thereby three services operating from Colombo Fort to Polgahawela, Gampaha and Mirigama respectively were cancelled.
In addition to this, train services from Polgahawela to Colombo and the train from Rambukkana to Colombo Fort was also cancelled on Thursday morning.
Meanwhile, the train plying from Aluthgama to Colombo and from Chilaw to Colombo was also cancelled on Thursday morning due to the absence of railway workers who failed to report to work.
The Railway Department added that guards and locomotive drivers who were on vacation in line with the Sinhala and Tamil New Year are now returning  to work and that railway services could be restored by Thursday afternoon.
However, long distance train services were operating in accordance with the designated railway time table.

heading: Epidemiology Unit observes drop in number of Dengue patients
content:
The Department of Epidemiology says that there has been reduction in the number of dengue patients.
Speaking to News1st, Director of the Epidemiology Department Dr. Paba Palihawadana stated that an increase in the number of Dengue patients had been reported in January and February.
However, the Department also noted that there may be a rise in Dengue cases, with the onset of the inter-monsoonal rains.
Dr. Palihawadana also stated that the breeding of Dengue mosquitoes can be prevented by keeping the surroundings clean.
Dr. Palihawadana pointed out that there are still many Dengue breeding spots in our surroundings such as the environment we live in, schools, work places and construction sites.
Dr. Palihawadana warned:
And also notice  those places that have not been cleaned, so that the dengue mosquitoes will not breed.  Schools play an important role in this.
She claimed that the public is not giving much attention to these Dengue breeding areas and are not taking the necessary measures for a cleanup.

heading: A year after South Korea’s ferry disaster
content:
Many lives were lost exactly a year ago. Today South Korea marks the first anniversary of the Sewol ferry disaster, which left more than 300 people dead.
More than 250 school students were among those who were killed when the ship overloaded and illegally redesigned sank off Jindo island.

Many family members are still pushing for answers about what went wrong and why so many lives were lost.
This disaster triggered nationwide grief and outrage and was severely criticized for safety standards and rescue efforts.
Several memorial ceremonies are being held across the country to mark the lives lost and victimized. Meanwhile two ceremonies are planned in Ansan city, where the students who were on a school trip came from.

heading: NASA’s New Horizons spacecraft captures first colou...
content:
NASA’s New Horizons spacecraft has sent back its first colour image of Pluto.
Pluto is the underdog hero of our solar system. Once considered a full-on planet, it was downgraded to a dwarf planet, but it has remained an object of fascination for scientists and to the space-loving public.
The picture which was sent back to the space agency from the New Horizons spacecraft, will be flying past the dwarf planet in July. Pluto appears as just two small dots in this image and it is those tiny dots that NASA now has to target the ship towards.The planet was considered the ninth planet in our solar system ,the furthest from the sun until 2006 when it was reclassified.
Alan Stern, the principal investigator on the New Horizons mission, said: “It sounds like science fiction but it is not.” Scientists want to learn more about the atmosphere of Pluto because it is mainly nitrogen like Earth’s.

heading: Canadian PM Harper returns 900 year old Khajuraho temple ...
content:
A 900-year-old piece of sculpture from Khajuraho temple, which had somehow reached Canada, was returned by Canadian Prime Minister Stephen Harper to PM Narendra Modi in Ottawa yesterday.
The sculpture, known as ‘Parrot Lady’, was handed over by Canandian PM Harper to PM Modi in accordance with the 1970 UNESCO Convention.
The handing over took place in the Canadian Parliament Library which PM Modi visited after his talks with PM Harper.
External Affairs Ministry spokesman Syed Akbaruddin tweeted:

The stone sculpture, meant to be in UNESCO-protected Khajuraho, depicts a dancer with a parrot on her back.
The valuable antique piece surfaced in Canada in 2011 when it was found in possession of a person who did not have proper documents and it was seized, according to reports.
The Canadian authorities then contacted their Indian counterparts, following which discussions started on returning it.
Source: NDTV

heading: Renowned musician Nimal Mendis passes away
content:
Renowned composer and musician Nimal Mendis has passed away. The veteran musician passed away Thursday morning, at the age of 81.
Mendis revolutionised the local music industry and composed several songs for popular Sri Lankan films, which are still popular over the generations.
Nimal Mendis was also one of a handful of Sri Lankan musicians to appear on the BBC Television programme Top of the Pops.

heading: NDDCB to initiate drug prevention committees in schools
content:
The National Dangerous Drugs Control Board has decided to set up drug prevention committees at school level.
Chairman of the Board, Dr. Nilanga Samarasinghe, stated that 100 committees have already been appointed at present.
According to this move, 100 schools will be chosen from Madampitiiya, Kolonnawa, Thotalanga, Peliyagoda, Kelaniya, Slave Island and Mount Lavinia. This will be done with the guidance of the school prefects.
Programmes will initially be carried out at these schools to raise awareness on dangerous drugs. Additionally, the  National Dangerous Drugs Control Board also stated that they have more programmes in the pipeline . These programmes will, in collaboration with the ministry of education, train student leaders and educate them about ways to prevent the intake of such drugs before the end of the term.
This matter has been taken up for discussion with Minister Akila Wiraj Kariyawasam. Circulars will be distributed among schools after the beginning of the term, to form students committees for the prevention of drugs.

heading: Date extended for army ‘absentees’ to receive...
content:
The time period granted for army deserters to receive their official discharge payments has been extended until April 25
Army Spokesperson Brigadier Jayanath Jayaweera, said that the time period for army deserters was scheduled to end today, April 16.
However, this extension has been announced, taking into consideration those who failed to report to their regiments. He stated:
We would like to announce that this will be a great opportunity for army personnel who are absent without official leave to report to their respective regiments.
Army Spokesperson Brigadier Jayanath Jayaweera said that during this period, 13,600 army personnel had been granted documentation to officially resign from their positions.
The  Army Spokesperson also assured  army personnel that no arrests will be made during this amnesty period. It was also requested that these army personnel bring  a copy of their bank details when arriving at these regiments.

heading: A private funeral for cricket legend Richie Benaud
content:
A private funeral and commemoration service was held today for the former Australian captain and legendary cricket commentator Richie Benaud. The Service was led by former team mate and Anglican lay-preacher Brian Booth and was attended by only his immidiate family and former players Shane Warne and Ian Chappell.
A former leg-spin bowler, Benaud played in 63 Tests in which he played 28 as captain – before retiring in 1964 to pursue a career in journalism and broadcasting. His final commentary in came in England during the 2005 Ashes series, but he continued to work for Channel Nine in Australia until 2013.

heading: Remember the ‘Success Kid’ who won social med...
content:
A wonderful thing is happening on the Internet. Netizens are coming together to help the family that gave them one of their favorite memes – ‘the success kid’.
Justin Griner, the father of the fist-clenching Sammy is in need of a kidney transplant. So his wife, Laney Robertson Griner, set up a GoFundMe page on April 8, asking people to help cover her husband’s medical expenses.
In a major win for the World Wide Web and humanity, the Griners have managed to collect way beyond their target of $75,000 in just a week.
Not only this, netizens are also sending their best wishes to the family, with many offering to undergo required tests to see if their kidneys are a match with Justin.

Back in August 2007, a picture of then 11-month-old Sammy’s victory face went viral, prompting the famous ‘I hate sandcastles’ meme. And thus, Sammy Griner came to be known the world over as ‘the success kid’.
Source: NDTV

heading: Will it be Preity Zinta’s last IPL?
content:
Preity Zinta, Kings XI Punjab co-owner has made policy decisions for the team, was seen at player auctions and has been the team’s leading cheer-leader throughout.
Now, the dimpled beauty has set her brains to be back with a bang in filmdom.
The Bollywood actress has been the team’s most visible face ever since IPL was launched in 2008. The eighth edition of IPL could well be her last. “IPL doesn’t need me anymore”, Preity has said in a recent interview.
The other co-owners, including her former boyfriend Ness Wadia, has very much lived in Preity’s shadows.
According to reports that Preity will judge the popular dance reality show Nach Baliye, the actress plans to take time off cricket. team is doing well.
”Things have fallen into place. Now doing this (Nach Baliye) or movie sounds exciting to me because I’ve been away from them for sometime. I’ve come back with a fresh perspective and I’m in a different space. I never thought that I would” says Preity Zinta.
However she has been a successful woman in terms of an owner of a cricket team.
She has been free from betting and fixing scandals unlike other team owners linked with Bollywood.
A producer, writer, entrepreneur and a dance lover, Preity, who considers herself “in good space right now”, promises to feature in more movies this year.
The 40 year old, who was last appeared in Ishkq in Paris, is now busy filming her upcoming film Bhaiyyaji uperhitt  and Nach Baliye 7, which she is co-judging with author Chetan Bhagat and choreographer Marzi Pestonji.

heading: Complaints over fraud and corruption stalled: Shiral Lakt...
content:
Views were expressed on Sirasa TV’s  Dawasa political programme on April 14, that there is a sound legal framework in the country to take action against persons who misuse state wealth and property.
Speaking on the programme Attorney-at-Law Shiral Lakthilake pointed out that all complaints over fraud and corruption have been stalled.
The highlight of the programme was the Money Laundering Act of Sri Lanka.
Speaking further, Coordinating Secretary to President Shiral Lakthilaka noted that the ball is now in the court of the AG and the IGP. They need to announce to the public that they have the substantial information.
However, during the recent past a number of complaints over the amassing of wealth through illegal means and financial fraud were filed with the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption and the Police Financial Fraud Investigation Division.
Yet, Only Former Minister Sarana Gunawardena was placed under custody.
With only four days left of the new government’s 100 Days, the passports of many individuals have only been temporarily impounded.
According to the Prevention of Money Laundering Act , any citizen of the country has the opportunity to file a complaint to the police over any instance of an individual amassing wealth and property through illegal means.
Under this act, the accused needs to prove before the High Court that the allegations made against him or her are baseless.
News 1st inquired from the Police Media Spokesperson as to why there is a delay in apprehending suspects if there is a sound and strong legal framework?
Police Media Spokesperson ASP Ruwan Gunasekera said that the documents pertaining to several investigations have been provided to the Attorney-General and he is analysing them at present. ASP Gunasekera went onto note that they are conducting investigations to provide any additional information and also seek advice on arresting suspects.

heading: SL’s indigenous community observes oil-anointing cu...
content:
The custom of anointing oil was observed across the island today at the auspicious time of 09.06 this morning. (April 15)
The custom of anointing oil took place at the Kelaniya Raja Viharaya on Wednesday, with the anointing of two tuskers.
The Anu-Nayake’s of the Malwathu and Asgiri Chapers anointed oil on the devotees at the Natha Devalaya at the Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic in Kandy.
Similarly the Anointing of oil took place at Hunupitiya Gangarama Temple under the auspices of Venerable Dr. Kirinde Assaji Thero and the Maha Sangha.
The custom was also followed at the Kotte Raja Maha Viharaya took place today under the aupices of the Maha Sangha and was attended by a group including Deputy Minister Dr.Harsha De Silva were present.
The anointing of oil at the Bellanvila Raja Maha Viharaya took place under the patronage of the Chief Incumbent of the Temple, Venerable Bellanvila Vimalarathana Thero.
A similar event took place at the Nigrodarama Temple in Hatton. The event, which drew a large crowd, included religious leaders from all faiths.
Sri Lanka’s indigenous community too observed the custom of anointing oil for the New Year at the Kota Bakiniya area in Dambana under the auspices of the leader of the community Uruvarige Vanniyalaththo.
Incidentally, being the only custom followed by the indigenous community for the New Year, clothing and other items used by the deceased members of the community are placed at a location known as ‘Hethma’ and the community visits this location whilst anointing oil on the items.

heading: USA’s First Lady launches interactive map ‘Le...
content:
The first lady of US Michelle Obama has launched an interactive online map to encourage people to join their local “Let’s Move” programs. This was launched in side line with her latest garden challenge at the White House on Wednesday April 15.
Mrs. Obama hopes to get people across the country involved in their local chapters of the program.
However, the interactive map highlights several “sub-initiatives”, such as reading and childcare programs, launched in collaboration with governments, businesses and non-profit organizations across the U.S.
Mrs. Obama got down in the dirt with the children in planting spinach, broccoli, lettuce, radish and bok choy in the White House Kitchen Garden.
The “Let’s Move” campaign is in its fifth year.

heading: Ralapanawa bridge remains inaccessible as residents fail ...
content:
A bridge which was constructed on the Nawagaththegama – Ralapanawa road in Puttalam twenty two years ago, was washed away by flood waters in December. Locals have deemed the bridge inaccessible in its current state.
The residents in the area stated that they did address the matter to the relevant officials, but no steps were taken to solve the problem.
The  people thus affected have complained regarding various issues the rundown bridge has caused. The bridge which was constructed under Janasaviya Trust fund is a daily endeavor for nearly 150 families residing in Ralapanawa village.
They went on to  add that the absence of electricity has made it impossible to cross the bridge during the night. Their  request to the authorities is to reconstruct the bridge.

heading: Prisoners receive opportunity to enjoy Sinhala-Tamil New ...
content:
In line with the New Year season the Department of Prisons granted special permission to visit 17,000 inmates who are housed at 29 prisons across the country.
Usually prisons do not allow visitors to provide food to the inmates. However Commissioner General of Prisons Rohana Pushpakumara speaking to News1st stated that special permission was granted on Monday and Tuesday (April 14th) to provide home cooked meals to the inmate.
The Commissioner General went on to note that the grace period was provided with the aim of allowing people to realise that the phrase “Prisoners are human beings” is true.

heading: Brothers killed in Padiyathalawa as Kadupahara and Kehelu...
content:
The Office of the Police Media Spokesperson says that two persons were killed in a re-ignited conflict between two villages in Padiyathalawa. It was reported that there had been tensions between the villagers of Kadupahara and Kehelulla in the Padiyathalawa Police Division.
Six persons had arrived in a lorry  from the village of  Kadupahara village at around 10.30 on Monday night and had consumed alcohol which later resulted in an escalated verbal argument.
An eyewitness stated that the group of persons who ran through the forest injured three individuals from Kehelulla village and had fled the area in a lorry. Further, he stated that he witnessed the lorry travelling in full speed when he was in the garden. After the lorry had knocked down one of the individuals, he was admitted to the Mahiyangana Hospital at the same time. Thereafter, there was a loud noise, after which it was discovered that a person was knocked to the ground.
The victims were brothers from the same family. One of the victims, aged 28, was a father of one.
Police Media Spokesperson ASP Ruwan Gunasekara noted that this altercation took place at around 10.30 on the night of Monday, April 13. Police stated:
After the fight one person purposely knocked down three persons in his lorry. This is still considered a homicide. We arrested the driver on charges of manslaughter. We are attempting to arrest another suspect in relation to this incident.
The driver who was arrested in connection to the incident was presented before the Dehiaththakandiya Magistrate. He was remanded until April 28.

heading: Special transport services for those returning to Colombo
content:
The National Transportation Commission (NTC) says that a special bus service will be in effect from Wednesday (April 15th) for the convenience of those who are returning to Colombo from their respective villages.
Chairman of the NTC, D.S. Jayaweera additional buses will also be deployed on the expressway for those returning from the Galle and Matara areas.

heading: Will rising crude oil prices impact Sri Lanka? (watch video)
content:
Crude oil prices in the World Market have been on the rise over the past week. Despite the increase in the price of Oil, the Price of a Barrel of Crude oil in the US Market stood at 59 US Dollars.
During the end of January this year, the price of a barrel of crude oil was at between 45 US Dollars and 47 US Dollars.
However, over the past two weeks the price has seen a gradual increase.
News 1st contact the Ministry of Power and Energy to inquire whether the price increase in the world market would have an effect on Petrol and Diesel prices here at home.
Secretary to the Ministry of Power and Energy Dr. Suren Batagoda stated that this would not directly impact the prices of fuel here at home. He remarked that the ministry does not hope to increase fuel prices in the domestic market simply because prices in the Global market rise.
News 1st also inquired as to whether Sri Lanka would benefit from the agreements that Iran reached with world powers recently, as Sri Lanka is one of Iran’s Leading Oil Importers.
Reacting to this, Dr. Batagoda stated that tensions between Iran and USA have eased to a certain extent and expressed optimism about the possibility of being able to import oil from Iran once more.

HTC announces HTC One M9+ and two other smartphones relea...
content:
HTC has announced three new smartphones in the Indian market. The first is the very new HTC One M9+ that was revealed very recently.
The M9+ is the bigger brother of the M9 and has a larger 5.2-inch Quad HD display, fingerprint sensor on the front, and 20 megapixel rear camera with Duo Camera feature. It also runs on the new 64-bit MediaTek Helio X10 processor with an octa-core Cortex-A53 CPU clocked at 2.2GHz and has a 2,840mAh battery. Other than that the two phones are similar.
The E9+ will be the cheaper variant of the M9+. It has a larger 5.5-inch Quad HD display, 3GB RAM, 20 megapixel camera on the back but without the Duo Camera, UltraPixel front camera, and BoomSound speakers with Dolby Audio. It has 16GB internal storage as opposed to the 32GB on the M9+ and the Xelio X10 processor is clocked at 2.0GHz instead of 2.2GHz. The battery is 2,800mAh. Another difference between the two is that while the M9+ is made entirely out of metal, the E9+ has plastic on the back but a metal frame around the side.
The Desire 326G has a 4.5-inch HD display, quad-core processor (unspecified), 1GB RAM, 8GB memory with microSD support, 8 megapixel rear camera, 2 megapixel front camera, and 2,000mAh battery. The Desire 326G will have dual SIM support.
The HTC M9+ is priced at Indian Rupees of 52,500. The price of the other two phones hasn’t been announced yet. The M9+ comes with HTC’s Uh-Oh Protection in India. All three will be available starting next month.

heading: Galle Fort in its final stage of preservation
content:
Ministry of Arts and Culture Development said that steps have been taken to protect the ancient forts of Sri Lanka.
The Ministry of Arts Culture Development Secretary, A.D.S Malkanthi said that accruing from this, the Galle Fort which is a world heritage site is in the final stages of its preservation.
Malkanthi added that the preservation of the Jaffna Fort will also commence in the future.

heading: Several new faces in the SLFP central working committee
content:
Following the removal of four senior members from the central working committee of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP), a debate arose on who will be named as their replacements.
The SLFP announced on Tuesday (April 14th) that Minister Arjuna Ranatunga and Chairman of the Kotikawatte – Mulleriyawa Pradeshiya Sabha Prasanna Solangarachchi have been named to the central working committe.
The Media Unit of the Ministry of Ports and Shipping issuing a communique today confirmed that Minister Arjuna Ranatunga has been appointed to the Central Working Committee of the SLFP.
Meanwhile Solnagarachchi speaking to News1st also confirmed his appointment and went on to state that if there is anyone within the party who wants to claim this appointment, on the basis that he/she is more talented and deserving, he would humbly step aside.
MPs T.B.Ekanayake, S.M.Chandrasena, Salinda Dissanayake and Bandula Gunawardena were removed from the SLFP Central Working Committee recently.
The MPs recived the letters in this regard over the past 2 days and S.M.Chandrasena said he hope seek the assistance of court with regard to his dismissal.
Members of the Homagama Pradeshiya Sabha staged a demonstration recently against the decision made to remove MP Bandula Gunawardena from the committee.
When contacted, MP T.B.Ekayanake said that he has received work that the President may revoke the decision that was notified to them via a letter.

heading: Chess grandmaster kicked out from tournament
content:
Georgian national chess champion grandmaster Gaioz Nigalidze was kicked out of a tournament in Dubai after it was discovered he was using a smartphone in the bathroom during a game.
Nigalidze’s opponent, Armenian champion Tigran Petrosian, complained to the officials that Nigalidze was visiting the bathroom a little too regularly. Nigalidze always used the same cubicle for extended periods of time. After investigation, the officials found a smartphone buried in the trash bin.
Eventhough Gaioz refused that the smartphone is his, there were pretty clear clues that the device belonged to him. The smartphone was logged into his Facebook account, and it had a chess running, showing his position on the chess board.
The two players were in the sixth round of the Dubai Open when the incident occurred. The prize for winning the tournament is $12,000.
Gaioz’s case will be reviewed by the International Chess Federation’ Anti-Cheating Commission, which was formed last year. If he’s found guilty he will could face a three-year ban from chess competitions.

heading: Dushmantha Chameera and Tharindu Kaushal to feature in S...
content:
Paceman Dushmantha Chameera and off-spinner Tharindu Kaushal have been named in the Sri Lanka A team’s one-day and four-day squads for the upcoming series against the Pakistan A team, at home.
Chameera and Kaushal had both played in Sri Lanka’s quarter-final against South Africa in Sydney, and Kaushal had earlier made his Test debut in December.
Others named in both squads include batsmen Kusal Perera, Kithuruwan Vithanage, Dhananjaya de Silva and Ashan Priyanjan, seamers Kasun Madushanka, Lahiru Gamage and Nisala Tharaka, and allrounder Asela Gunaratne.
Milinda Siriwardana and Malinda Pushpakumara, who were respectively top-scorer and top wicket-taker in the Premier League tournament, both get call-ups.
Sri Lanka A play three one-dayers and three four-day matches against Pakistan A, beginning with a one-dayer in Matara on April 26.

heading: Get ready for dimensional clicks at first-ever selfie museum
content:
The Art in Island in the Philippines’s capital Manila uses three dimensional replicas of paintings and is rightly dubbed the planet’s “first-ever selfie museum”.
The museum not only encourages its visitors in selfie-taking in the premises, they are also invited to touch, play with, and climb on the paintings and sculptures, The Creators Project reported.
“Here, art paintings are not complete if you are not with them … If you don’t take pictures with them,” Blyth Cambaya, the museum’s corporate secretary, was quoted as saying by Mashable.
Tourists visiting the museum seem to be liking the experience as museums around the world generally do not allow visitors to be part of them, depriving them of the delight of sharing their experience of being in the museum.
“You have to be very serious in other museums. But in this museum, you can really just let your goofy side out,” US tourist Jenna Eliel was quoted as saying.
 
-Zee News

heading: News1st takes a closer look at beggars and ‘their c...
content:
Children being used for begging by women has become a common occurrence during the festive season.
As suspicion has arisen over the manner in which these women behave with children, News1st launched investigations into these happenings – children being carried around by women, who, at most times are not their mothers.
You may have encountered several instances in which men and women with children were seen scavenging the busy streets of Colombo. Are they using these children as tools for begging for an actual cause, or has this now become a business? News1st inspected several streets of the city of Colombo in search of beggars with children by their side.
What we observed was that  children in the hands of these beggars seemed to be in a trance.Thus doubts arise whether these children are in their senses or whether they have been drugged.
News1st inquired from a woman opposite the Fort Railway Station about the child who was with her. Her response was one of anger, aggressiveness and tension rather than one that provoked sympathy and kindness.
We immediately contacted the emergency hotline of the National Child Protection Authority to inform them of this beggar. The individual on the phone said that the Pettah Police Division would be informed of the matter immediately.
News1st informed the NCPA of this beggar with the child at 12.36 p.m. Twenty minutes later at 12.56, there was still no official arriving at the location and the   woman had already left the area with the child.
Still on location, we contacted the Child Protection Authority once again, as no official arrived even by then. The News1st journalist Lakmal Kirindigala identified himself to the NCPA – that he is from News1st – and asked at what time the NCPA informed the police of the incident. The NCPA said that the police unit of the NCPA were informed within five minutes.
Meanwhile, we came across another beggar with a child telling passers-by that they are in need of money for treatment for an illness of the child.
However, when our team inspected the documents and subsequently questioned the woman about it, she said that the treatment is being provided for free and they are compelled to beg for money as her husband had abandoned them and that she has two children who have to go to school.
While News1st made inquiries from the Ministry of Children’s Affairs. We were told by a senior official at the Ministry that as the State Minister is abroad, immediate steps would be taken upon her arrival.

heading: PSG hopes falter with loss at home
content:
FC Barcelona managed to outdo Paris-Saint German to walk away with a 2 goal lead in their last game on Wenesday (15th April). Barcelona players and fans alike will be looking for a win heading in to their home game at Camp Nou in the Champions League Quarter Finals, next week.
The Spanish club got head start when Neymar (Barcelona),who was assisted by Lionel Messi with a through ball, took a right footed shot from the center of the box to the bottom right corner . The Spaniards continued to dominate with Suarez sinking 2 goals into the net in the 66th and 78th minute of the game. However the team was not without damage as veteran Xavi had to be called in for Iniesta due to injury.
PSG managed to lighten the lead with Barcelona Defender Jeremey Matheiu’s unfortunate contribution – which saw him deflect a 20-yard Gregory van der Wiel drive, past his own keeper. Barcelona, who finished 3-1 in their favor at the end of play look to dominate heading in to the second leg.
PSG, who came in to the game without their star Zlatan Ibramovich, also lost captain Thiago Silva because of an injury, early in the game.
The champions league had been subject to dramatic games this year in its quarter final stretch as FC Porto at home,managed to take down German giants Bayern Munich for 3-1 earlier this week.

heading: BASL clarifies stance on 19th Amendment
content:
The Bar Association of Sri Lanka on Friday, April 17, clarified its stance on the 19th Amendment stating that there are five key issues to be addressed.
1. The re-establishment of the Constitutional Council.
2. The re-establishment of the Independent Commissions, including the National Police Commission and the Elections Commission.
3. The recognition of the Right to Information as a Fundamental Right
4. The establishment of a transparent and accepted procedure in the appointment of Judges to the Supreme Court and the Court of Appeal
5. The abrogation of the 18th Amendment to the Constitution
The BASL went on further to add that the above provisions are crucial at this juncture and it had been their unwavering position that the Independence of the Judiciary, the independence of the public service including the police force, Good Governance and Zero-Tolerance towards corruption are essential in a democratic society committed to upholding the Rule of Law

heading: ‘Amazingly Intact’ WWII Aircraft carrier foun...
content:
Experts have discovered a World War II US aircraft carrier that is “amazingly intact” despite languishing on the bottom of the Pacific for more than 60 years.
The ship is upright, listing only slightly and may even have an plane inside
The former USS Independence is resting in 2,600 feet (800 meters) of water off California’s Farallon Islands with its hull and flight deck very well preserved and clearly visible, scientists with the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) said on Thursday.
There also appears to be a plane in the hangar bay of the vessel, the lead ship of its class of light aircraft carriers that were vital during the American naval offensive in the Pacific.
“After 64 years on the seafloor, Independence sits on the bottom as if ready to launch its planes,” said James Delgado, chief scientist on the mission and maritime heritage director for NOAA’s Office of National Marine Sanctuaries.
“This ship fought a long, hard war in the Pacific and after the war was subjected to two atomic blasts that ripped through the ship.
“It is a reminder of the industrial might and skill of the ‘greatest generation’ that sent not only this ship, but their loved ones to war
The carrier is one of an estimated 300 wrecks in the waters off San Francisco and the deepest known shipwreck in the sanctuary, the NOAA said.
Independence operated in the central and western Pacific from November 1943 to August 1945 and later was one of more than 90 vessels assembled as a target fleet for atomic bomb tests in 1946 in the Marshall Islands.
Damaged by shock waves, heat and radiation, Independence survived the tests and returned to the United States.
It was moored in San Francisco until age caught up with her and she was towed out to sea for scuttling in January 1951.
Independence was found as part of a two-year NOAA mission to locate historic shipwrecks in the Gulf of the Farallones National Marine Sanctuary and nearby waters.
Experts last month used an autonomous underwater vehicle, Echo Ranger, made by Boeing, to survey the Independence.
There are no plans at the moment to try and get inside the vessel, Delgado said.
Source: NDTV

heading: Australian government to resettle asylum-seekers
content:
The Australian government has taken steps to resettle asylum seekers,  among them some believed to be Sri Lankans, in Cambodia, as part of its latest programme to crack- down on prospective immigrants.
Issuing a statement the Australian government said that swift measures are being taken, to send the batch of asylum seekers on board a flight.
The first such flight carrying the asylum seekers, is scheduled to arrive in the capital city of Cambodia; Phnom Penh on Monday.
