heading: India cricket team needs two coaches, says Dean Jones; So...
content:
Dean Jones has made an out-of-the-box “two-coach” proposal to India’s cricket bosses who sit down later this month to choose Duncan Fletcher’s replacement.
The Zimbabwean, who replaced Gary Kirsten after the 2011 World Cup, ended his tumultuous assignment with BCCI after India bowed out in the semifinals of the World Cup Down Under.
Jones pointed out India have some great options in Sourav Ganguly (for shorter formats like T20s and ODIs) and Rahul Dravid (Tests). The Aussie said Ravi Shastri should be appointed as the high-performance manager, who will oversee everything.
India’s tryst with foreign coaches has been mixed. Generally, low-profile men have done well in a team where players, across generations, are high on ego. Personality clashes are therefore not uncommon.
Fletcher was a great survivor. After India lost eight Test matches overseas, experts like Sunil Gavaskar wanted the former England coach sacked. But Fletcher completed his full tenure largely due to the support he got from captain Mahendra Singh Dhoni.
Fletcher managed to retain his job after India’s horrible show in England last year. Ravi Shastri’s appointment as Team Director somewhat clipped Fletcher’s wings. The decision to appoint Shastri was reportedly taken without keeping Dhoni in the loop. The captain was merely conveyed the BCCI decision over a late-night call.
Jones suggests India should retain Shastri as a high-performance manager. Australia have a similar position under which a coach (Darren Lehman) works. Shastri was India’s director till the recently-concluded World Cup. The new BCCI management may not be willing to retain Shastri in this role and then have a Ganguly and Dravid under him. The equations just don’t work.
Ganguly and Dravid have their hands full with media assignments. Dravid, the Rajasthan Royals mentor, is happy doing short coaching stints and handle his media assignments at the same time. He can balance that much better and would not like to wear a cap of thorns. Invited by Fletcher, he had a short stint with Team India at the start of the England series.
Ganguly is keen to seek a future in cricket administration. He is the joint secretary of the Cricket Association of Bengal and hosts a popular reality show on TV. Ganguly remains one of the most sought after TV experts. And Ganguly will certainly not work under Shastri. At best, short assignments as team director may suit him.
Jones’ Australian model sounds nice. “India have enough coaches. No need for a foreigner. Two coaches under Ravi will be great. There is way too much cricket and players hate to see the same face every time,” professed Jones.
India already have two captains – Dhoni for shorter formats and Virat Kohli for Tests. The two-coaches theory looks good on paper but it is impossible to see Shastri, Ganguly, Dravid and Anil Kumble (Jones mentioned him too) working together as coaches.
Source: NDTV

heading: A bouquet to Muralitharan on his birthday (Video)
content:
Muttiah Muralitharan born on  April 17, 1972 was rated the greatest Test match bowler ever by Wisden Cricketers’ Almanack in 2002. He retired from Test cricket in 2010, registering his 800th and final wicket on  July 22, 2010 from his final ball in his last Test match.
Averaging over six wickets per Test, Muralitharan is one of the most successful bowlers in the game. Muralitharan held the number one spot in the International Cricket Council’s player rankings for Test bowlers for a record period of 1,711 days spanning 214 Test matches.
Muralitharan’s career was beset by controversy over his bowling action for much of his international career. Due to an unusual hyper-extension of his congenitally bent arm during delivery, his bowling action was called into question on a number of occasions by umpires and sections of the cricket community. After bio-mechanical analysis under simulated playing conditions, Muralitharan’s action was cleared by the International Cricket Council, first in 1996 and again in 1999.
In February 2009, after becoming cricket’s highest wicket-taker in both forms of the game, Muttiah Muralitharan hinted that he might retire at the conclusion of the 2011 World Cup.
He stated
 I think I am fit in my body and mind, I am enjoying my cricket and want to play more. But after the next World Cup, I will have nothing left to achieve in the game. The World Cup should mark the end of my career.
Muralitharan announced his retirement from Test cricket after the first Test against India at Galle which commenced on  July 18, 2010.
During that match he captured eight wickets and became the first to reach the milestone of taking 800 Test wickets by dismissing Pragyan Ojha.
As he celebrates his 43rd birthday today it is apt to look at some legendary records created by him  – records which cannot be broken.
Most wickets including all formats
 
Most wickets in Test matches
 
Most balls bowled in ODI

Most balls bowled in Test
Most 5 wicket haul in Test

heading: Sri Lanka’s first Open Air Zoo declared open
content:
Sri Lanka’s first Open Air Zoo was declared open in Pinnawala on Friday.
The Open Air Zoo has been planned in line with international standards.
The Open Air Zoo built in an expanse of 44 acres adjacent to the world famous elephant orphanage in Pinnawala consists of two zones – ‘Sri Lankan’ and ‘World’.
The ‘Sri Lankan’ zone will have native animals of Sri Lanka such as deer, leopards and crocodiles. The zoo will have a special open section displaying the free-roaming Sri Lankan leopard.
The ‘World’ zone will house non-native animal species.
The Minister said the public will be afforded an opportunity to visit the open air zoo free of charge from from April 17 – 30.

heading: Type ‘Find My Phone’ in Google to locate your...
content:
Google on Thursday(16) announced users can now simply type ‘Find My Phone’ in its search box to find their lost or missing Android smartphone.
Google made the announcement on a Google+ post, users would have to simply type ‘find my phone’ in the Google search bar when logged in with the same Google account as registered on their smartphone.
In the search results, they can see the handset last used and Google Maps showing the location of the handset. Users have to have the latest version of the Google app (aka Google Search app) installed on their smartphone for the ‘find my phone’ command to work.
“If the pesky phone is hiding nearby, Google can ring it for you – or you can see it on the map if you, say, forgot it at the bar. Just make sure you’ve got the latest version of the Google app!” says the post.
An option to ring the smartphone will also be shown, clicking on which will ring the smartphone on full volume for five minutes. Users can stop the ringing by pressing the handset’s power button. We tried both the ring and ‘find my phone’ features, and found the lost smartphone’s GPS also needs to be active, otherwise the new feature will not locate the handset.
Google last month rolled out an update to Android Device Manager that was meant to help users find their lost device via an Android Wear device.
The feature can either work with voice command “Ok Google. Start. Find my phone” or by selecting the ‘Find my phone’ option from the start menu. If your device is mapped with Android Device Manager, it will start ringing at full volume till the time your Android Wear device/ smartwatch is in range (Bluetooth range).
The Android Device Manager was introduced in 2013 and essentially allowed locating, resetting and deleting data for Android devices from Web.
Source: NDTV

heading: More cancer patients recorded this year: NCCU
content:
The National Cancer Control Unit states that there has been a spike in the number of cancer patients in the country.
Speaking to Newsfirst, Head of the NCCP Dr. Ishani Fernando stated that the number of cancer patients increases by 300 to 400 each year. The Head of the NCCP said:
Around 25,000 patients have been reported in the past year, at the nine units that treat cancer patients in the country. But all these 25,000 patients were not reported in the last year.
The amount of cancer patients in Sri Lanka last year was 18 – 19,000, and in 2008 it was 16,511.
Therefore, usually there seems to be an increase of 300 to 400 patients every year. Also, around 54% of the patients are females and around 46% are males.
It has been founded that the most common cancers in both genders is breast cancer and around 2% of males have this as well. The second highest is throat cancer and the third is womb cancer.

heading: Team bowled out for 31, still wins match
content:
Most teams would consider a match to be in the bag after bowling the opposition out for 31. Incredibly, Galle Cricket Club recovered from the dismal first-innings total to win by four runs and save themselves from being relegated from Sri Lanka’s first class competition.
Sent in to bat by Sri Lanka Air Force Sports Club in a crucial match to decide which team would drop out of the Premier Championship at the weekend, Galle were toppled for 31 in 15.1 overs thanks largely to the bowling of Asiri Karunaratne, who claimed 5-21.
In a team boasting eight debutants, it was 16-year-old Navindu Nirmal who top-scored for Galle with seven. Air Force then scored 215 to lead by 184 with a comfortable victory in sight, but there was where the game turned.
Galle cruised past 184 for the loss of just two wickets, scoring 295 courtesy of a century from former Sri Lanka U-19 Charith Asalanka to set the Air Force team 112 to win. The task proved too much and Air Force were bowled out for 107, handing Galle the unlikeliest of four-run victories.
It was the lowest winning first-innings score in a first-class match since 1924, when Gloucestershire were dismissed for 31 against Middlesex. The lowest of all time was in 1827, when England were skittled for 27 against Sussex.

heading: Food Security Minister to investigate irregularities in p...

The Minister said that a Deputy General Manager had also been suspended as a result. Speaking on the issue, the Minister said:
Information has come to light regarding a number of corrupt activities and as of now, the services of an Acting Deputy General Manager has been suspended.
He further added that store-keepers in certain areas have been appointed illegally by representatives of farmers and thus these farmer representatives have been instructed to buy paddy directly from the farmers.
But now under the guise of farmer organisations, these representatives charge Rs. 1.50 from farmers for a kilogramme of paddy, as well as charge Rs.4000 as rental fees.
He went on to state that police are involved, and are carrying out investigations. He said:
Several officers have been transferred or suspended. And we intend on taking remedial measures in the future.

heading: ICC Board to investigate “apparent govt interferenc...
content:
The ICC Board has considered the implications of the appointment of an Interim Committee of Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) by the Government of Sri Lanka and whether this may be a breach of the ICC’s constitution which requires free and fair elections for office-bearers within Member Boards.
After considerable discussion, and without making a final decision on the matter, the ICC Board supported a recommendation of the ICC Governance Review Committee that it should write to the Sports Minister of Sri Lanka seeking a full and proper explanation of its intervention that prima facie puts SLC in breach of the ICC’s constitution.
The Board further decided that, pending the satisfactory resolution of this matter, the next financial distribution due from the ICC to SLC will not be advanced to SLC and will, instead, be held in an escrow account.
Notwithstanding the Board’s decision, Mr Nuski Mohamed – a nominee of the Interim Committee – was given the opportunity to provide information about the status of the Interim Committee, following which he was invited to attend the ICC Board meeting as an observer on behalf of the interests of cricket in Sri Lanka. Unfortunately, Mr Mohamed declined to attend the meeting on these terms and as a result there was no representative from Sri Lanka at the meeting.
The recent media comments of the Sri Lankan Sports Minister suggesting that the ICC was ‘colluding’ with former SLC officials were also noted and the ICC Board expressed its disappointment over the inaccurate nature of these comments. Moving forward, the ICC hopes to progress the matter constructively with the Government of Sri Lanka for the good of all cricketing interests in Sri Lanka.
The ICC Board consists of the nominated representatives of each of the ten full members plus three elected associate member representatives. The meeting is chaired by Mr Narayanaswami Srinivasan. Also present is the ICC Chief Executive.

heading: Spotlight turns to Kalpitiya Beach Resort PLC – an ...
content:
Kalpitiya Beach Resort PLC has convened an Extraordinary General Meeting to be held on May 8 to appraise shareholders on the current position of the company and an alternate course of action with regard to the Citrus Kalpitiya Hotel Development Project.
This follows a directive from the Securities and Exchange Commission which was issued on March 20.  In the directive issued on March 20 this year, the SEC noted that Kalpitiya Beach Resort PLC had raised 283.5 million rupees from the public in November 2011, with the funds intended to finance the construction of Citrus Kalpitiya as stated in the prospectus. The directive, was triggered by what was termed by the SEC as an “inordinate delay” in the construction of the hotel.
The SEC points out that in a previous disclosure, the company had also stated the construction of the resort would commence from December 2011, with commercial operations commencing in early 2015. The directive from the SEC expressed “grave concern” over the company’s failure to complete construction within the time-frame specified in its prospectus. The SEC directed the company to pass a resolution specifying an alternative course of action with regard to funds collected through the IPO on or before the 10th of May 2015.
It is against this backdrop that the Company issued notice yesterday of an EGM to be held on  May 8, 2015.
In the proposed resolution, the shareholders could agree to consider courses of action including –
1. Await the new government’s vision and intent to implement the development plans for Kalpitiya with clear time lines so that the company may review the appropriate time to commence the project.
2. Continue to explore possible investor interest that would negate externalities, so that the company would not be dependent on Kalpitiya destination development as promised in the past by the government.
3. Consider partners who would create unique marketable products that will further ensure occupancy as a standalone hotel such as a golf course and theme parks.
4. To explore the feasibility of an alternative location, within Sri Lanka and the Maldives as an alternate destination to Kalpitiya for a tourism project.
A google search for Kalpitiya Beach Resort PLC, would lead you to the website of Citrus Leisure, also a public quoted company. Under the hotels tab, you would find links to Citrus Hikkaduwa and Citrus Waskaduwa, the other two hotels operated by the company, while there is also a non functional link to Citrus Kalpitiya.
Data for Kalpitiya Beach Resort PLC on the website of the Colombo Stock Exchange shows that while the stock price reached an all time high of 24 rupees, at the close of trading today, the stock price was Rs.3  and 90 cents.
In spite of the fact that the SEC notes in its letter that construction was to begin in December 2011, three and a half years later, the satellite image of the area from Google Earth, shows the current state of the property.
Our reporter confirmed that no construction has taken place at the said location.
Investigative Business Journalist Faraz Shauketaly noted that 283 million rupees were raised in 2011 at the time of the IPO which was money that came from small time retail investors resulting in the share price to reach its peak of 24 rupees. Four years later, the company now announces that they plan to look for new investors and or a new location, maybe in the Maldives. This is not what the investors paid for, they invested their money for a project in Kalpitiya. They are now faced with a scenario where the share price is worth only 3 rupees 90. It is now upto the SEC led by Mr. Karunaratne to ensure that the officers of this company are held accountable fully and that the small time investors are taken care of.
When News 1st contacted Prema Cooray, the Chairman of Citrus Leisure PLC, he noted that the Board of Directors had deferred its decision on the Citrus Kalpitiya Project, as Kalpitiya is yet to be developed as a tourist destination.

heading: Column: Getting high – immersed in the beauty of th...
content:
This week we traveled to the Hills and took a walk to the ‘ends of the earth’ and stopped by our very own little England to stay cool and experience an environment that tourist have being enjoying for a very long time and is very much apart of our beautiful little island nation. The ‘hill country’ has an average annual temperature and in Nuwara Eliya it is a chilly 15.9°C and has nearly 2,000 mm of rain every year.
The April escape to the Hills is an annual pilgrimage now, by one and all, for racing, camping, flower shows and a flight from the heat of the coast. The hotels are all full including the quaint English style lodges and anyone with a spare room to let.
The city was founded by Sir Samuel Baker, the discoverer of Lake Albert the explorer of the Nile in 1846. Nuwara Eliya’s climate lent itself to becoming the prime sanctuary of the British civil servants and planters in Ceylon back in the magnificent colonial era where Ceylon was the toast of Asia.
Nuwara Eliya or ‘Little England’ then was a country retreat where the British could immerse themselves in their pastimes like fox hunting, deer hunting, elephant hunting, polo, golf and cricket. Although the town was founded in the 19th century by the British, the whole district is today visited by local travelers, specially during April, the season of flowers, pony races, go cart races and the auto rally.
Many of the buildings retain features from the colonial period such as the Queen’s Cottage, General’s House, Grand Hotel, Hill Club, Town Post Office and even new hotels are often built and furnished in the colonial style. His Worship the present Mayor, Mr. D.G. Mahinda Kumara the youngest elected mayor told us building regulations will be strictly adhered to and the old world charm protected. Not only a politician but also a knowledgeable, experienced hotelier, and an eco-tourism promoter Mr. Mahinda has lots of ideas to make the city a protected and leading travel destination in the country and hopes to have the full co operation of the government and supportive departments assist him achieve this through funding and planned eco organizing in this fertile region.

“GO OUTDOORS”
I was much honored to meet the mayor at his picturesque hotel ‘The Alpine’ across the racetrack when the organizers of “GO OUTDOORS” the pioneering and innovative motorhome, caravan, camper trailer and camping    gear outfit invited us to inspect their gear by the scenic shores of Lake Gregory.  Tapping into the travelling DNA of all Sri Lankans these young gentlemen led by  Mr. Hemaka de Alwis is planning to implement the provisioning of safe,  environmentally friendly, caravan and camping sites in key points around the  island.
Pointing out that families who travelled together in caravans are interact  with  nature unlike whilst staying in a hotel improving social interactions since kids  will  more often stay off the phones and a healthy appreciation for the environment  is  developed.
The travelling motorhome or caravan is a popular mobile alternative  for  families and friends choosing more independence in the very fast evolving  tourism  sector of post war, safe to travel environmentally diverse Sri Lanka.

The Grand Hotel
To touch on more ancient history relevant to this region the ‘Ramayana’ the Indian mythical epic tells us how Ravana the King of Lanka robbed Rama of his wife Sita, who he was smitten by and brought her back to Lanka. The people of Sri Lanka believe that Ravana had his capital in Nuwara-Eliya or the “City by the glade”. He is believed to have kept Sita captive in ‘Sita Eliya’. Today a Hindu temple is situated in  the same location and the famous and very beautiful Haggala Botanical Gardens is very close by. The story tells that the  monkey army of Rama came to save Sita. Ravana punished  Hanuman the leader of the monkey force by setting fire to his  tail. It is then said that Hanuman burnt all of Nuwara-Eliya with his burning tail. Legend has it that the black fertile soil, which forms the top layer here, consists of the ashes of the city of Ravana burnt to the ground by Hanuman.
The modern history of Nuwara-Eliya begins in 1818 when the British Surgeon Dr.John Davy relating thus said, “I was walking in the middle of a forest and I saw beautiful white shining, diamond shaped waterfalls. I came to the top of a mountain and the people who came with me said that it is the highest land of this country” Dr.John Davy goes on to say that Nuwara Eliya has many trees, elephants, wild animals  and Gemstones. Legend has it that the elephants were hunted for  sport in such huge numbers that the mausoleums of these  famous hunters are hit by lightening annually for the sin  committed by evidence of some of the cracked graves stones split  open by lighting.
Sir Edward Barnes the Governor of Ceylon from 1824-1831 constructed modern roads into Nuwara-Eliya and built his holiday home spending a princely 8000 Pounds at the time. He named it “Barnes Hall” and today it is known as the very luxurious ‘Grand Hotel’ with a 154 rooms, coffee shop with Thai and Indian dining.

Jetwing St.Andrews 
The history of the St Andrews Hotel not far away, is as interesting as it follows the history of true pioneering hotelier families to date, in succession, beginning in 1875. Known as the ‘Scots club’ and the proximity to the golf course may account for the naming of the club as the St Andrews. In 1918 the now ‘hotel’ was bought by a syndicate headed by Mr. Arthur Ephraums to include the two story wing in the west and behind the main block a large dining room, kitchen and servants quarters together with a bar and billiards rooms. In 1919 the now refurbished hotel opened for business with a young cousin of the owners a Mr. De Zilwa as manager.
The depression years of the 1925 to 1932 affected the hotel adversely and it was closed  with an appointed caretaker. In 1933 Julius & Creasy held the mortgage and the hotel was offered to Mr. and Mrs. De Zilwa. Excerpts of this early saga can be read in the interesting writings of Mr. David De Zilwa and Percy De Zilwa in much detail. The De Zilwa’s went on to create a very successful hotel occupancy in the 1930’s with all guests on an all inclusive rate with a ‘full on’ menu and by the 1950’s an attractive bed and breakfast tariff were bringing in more and more clients to the hotel. The ‘Zilwan Jazz band’ comprised of the De Zilwa family was in great demand and many a celebrity is know to have stayed at the hotel. The startling political changes of post independence era saw the Tamil laborers originally recruited from India by the British, stateless. Their applications for citizenship were too numerous for the local ‘Kachcheri’ or government office so the government took over 16 rooms and more space at the hotel to attend to applications. It was said that the estate families became citizens of Ceylon at the St Andrews. The 1970’s saw a period of change for the De Zilwa family with the elderly De Zilwa’s deciding to follow their children to Australia as soon as buyer for the hotel could be found and in 1976 a buyer was found – Mr. ‘Gem’ Milhuisen a hotel owner and agent for Vingressor, a Swedish travel company to cater for tourists. During 1977 to 1978 St Andrews was substantially upgraded into its present form seen today. In 1986 ‘Gem’ Milhuisen went into partnership with Mr. Herbert Cooray also a hotel owner and director of the Jetwing group of hotels and St Andrews was added to the Jetwing group. The St Andrews today is a modern hotel in the hills with an average occupancy of 70% throughout the year with a 190-200USD average room rate.

heading: Tribute to a veteran musician – Nimal Mendis passes...
content:
Renowned composer and musician Nimal Mendis has passed away. The veteran musician passed away on Thursday, April 16  at the age of 81. His body will lie at a private funeral parlour in Colombo from Friday morning.
The final rites will be observed on Saturday, April 18  at the Jawatte Public Cemetery.
Mendis who pursued a career in music as a pianist, was instrumental in advancing the music industry in Sri Lanka, as he introduced a jazz blues inspired music trend to the industry. He revolutionised the local music industry, and composed several songs for popular Sri Lankan films, which are still popular over the generations.
Nimal Mendis was also one of a handful of Sri Lankan musicians to appear on the BBC Television programme   Top of the Pops. The late veteran musician was adjudged the winner of the OCIS award in 1979 for the music in the film Ahasen Polawata  and also won the Sarasavi Award for the music in the film Ganga Addara in 1980. He also clinched the Presidential award in 1983 for his extra – ordinary service to the music industry. He was not only  celebrated in his motherland: he was recognized for his work internationally as well.
Kiss – kiss a song for which the music was composed by the late Nimal Mendis, was included in one of the albums of Mary Marshal.

heading: Fmr Minister Rohitha Abeygunawardena removed from SLFP Ce...
content:
Former Minister Rohitha Abeygunawardena has been removed from the SLFP Central Working Committee.
The official letter informing Abeygunawardena of his  removal from the party’s Central Working Committee had been received by him on Thursday morning.
The letter, signed by President, says that the membership was terminated as the former minister did not comply with the decisions taken by the Central Working Committee.
The membership of MPs Bandula Gunawardena, T.B. Ekanayake, S.M. Chandrasena and Salinda Dissanayake was terminated on a prior occasion.

heading: Microsoft’s Satya Nadella tops US chief executive p...
content:
With a pay package of $84.3 million a year, technology giant Microsoft’s Indian-origin chief Satya Nadella has emerged as the top paid CEO in the US, according to a list by Equilar.
The Equilar 100 CEO Pay Study, an analysis of CEO salaries at the 100 largest public US companies as measured by revenue, was last year topped by Oracle’s Larry Ellison, who has been now pushed to the second position.
Another Indian-origin CEO, Indra Nooyi of PepsiCo, is ranked 19th with a pay package of $19.08 million.
Mr Ellison ($67.3 million) is followed by Qualcomm’s Steven Mollenkopf at the third place on the list with $60.7 million.
Legendary investor Warren Buffett of Berkshire Hathaway is ranked last at the 100th position.
Others among the top ten are Robert Iger (Walt Disney), Larry Merlo (CVS Health), K Rupert Murdoch (Twenty-First Century Fox), W James McNerney, Jr (Boeing). James Gorman (Morgan Stanley), David Cote (Honeywell International) and Kenneth Chenault (American Express).
Equilar said that the median pay for 100 CEOs was $14.3 million in the past year a rise of 5%, while base salaries ranged from $7.1 million for Rupert Murdoch at 21st Century Fox to nil for Richard Fairbank at Capital One.
Source: NDTV

content:
JVP seniors say the situation that has cropped up around former Leader Somawansa Amarasinghe, will be resolved before May Day.
The JVP, a party which was established with the intention of representing the oppressed, has seen leaders depart periodically when the party has faced several issues.
The current crisis has arisen following the departure of one of the senior members of the party, former Leader Somawansa Amarasinghe.
JVP Politburo Member MP Sunil Handunnetti, speaking on the current issue, said that Comrade Somawansa had suddenly made a personal decision and personally convened a media briefing and made a statement adding that none of them in the JVP will make that decision.
He went on to note that they held discussions with Comrade Somawansa; as in the past, Comrade Somawansa will work with the party and with them rendering his fullest support.
However, speaking to News1st, Somawansa Amarasinghe noted that he would definitely be forming another political party.

heading: BASL convenes media briefing to elaborate stance on 19th ...
content:
The Bar Association of Sri Lanka convened a media briefing in Colombo on Saturday April 18 to elaborate on their stance on the 19th Amendment to the constitution.
At this instance the Bar Association of Sri Lanka urges:
1. The re-establishment of the Constitutional Council
2. The re-establishment of the independent commissions, including the National Police Commission and the Elections Commission
3. The recognition of the Right to Information as a Fundamental Right
4. The establishment of a transparent and accepted procedure in the appointment of Judges to the Supreme Court and the Court of Appeal
5. The abrogation of the 18th amendment to the Constitution
The Bar Association of Sri Lanka sees the provisions in the proposed 19th Amendment on the above matters as being crucial at this juncture.
President of BASL Geoffrey Alagaratnam says that he wishes to point out that whatever amendments that are subsequently brought in those other areas, will actually be effective, practiced and truly lived only if the foundation for good governance and rule of law are in place for which the institutions they have referred to are essential.
Speaking further, he notes that these institutions give life to and breathe life to the other provisions to the constitutions. Without these independent institutions the constitution ceases to be a living document, becomes irrelevant to the people, and undermines democracy, which could lead, also to anarchy.
Secretary of BASL Attorney at-Law Ajith Pathirana points out that the Executive Committee of the BASL discussed this matter, came to a decision and presented facts regarding the amendment to the constitution to the Supreme Court. The BASL has also presented these facts to the government regarding this matter.
Meanwhile, Deputy President of BASL Attorney at-Law Saliya Pieris says that he believes they have received a golden opportunity, where the Parliament can safeguard the rule of law and table the required provisions to ensure the independence of the judiciary.
He went onto note that the Supreme Court has issued its determination regarding the existing provisions in the bill of the 19th Amendment to the constitution saying that there need not be a public referendum, instead it could be passed with a two thirds majority in Parliament.

heading: Shah Rukh Khan honoured for outstanding contribution at A...
content:
Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan has been honoured with the prestigious ‘Outstanding Contribution to Cinema Award’ at the annual Asian Awards held at London’s Grosvenor House Hotel.
Incidentally, this is the first time in that the actor picked up this award, from the function that has reached it’s fifth year.
Shah Rukh said he felt “humbled and honoured” to receive the award.
Shah Rukh, who has a large fan following in London, joined a long list of international stars at the award function and even interacted with a few lucky fans.

heading: World’s first woman PM late Sirimavo Bandaranaike c...
content:
An event to commemorate the 99th birth anniversary of the world’s first woman prime minister, the late Sirimavo Bandaranaike, was held in Colombo on Friday April 17.
The late Sirimavo Bandaranaike was born on April 17, 1916.
Sirimavo Bandaranaike, who entered the political fray following the assassination of her husband, late Prime Minister S.W.R.D. Bandaranaike, gained fame and respect globally, as a leader who adhered to the policy of Non-Alignment.
Throughout her terms in office, Sirimavo Bandaranaike focussed on strengthening the domestic economy.
A leader who forged ahead amid criticism, Sirimavo Bandaranaike served the nation as Prime Minister on three occasions.
She was serving as Prime Minister at the time of her passing.
The event to commemorate the Late Prime Minister’s 99th birth anniversary, was held at the BMICH on Friday and was organised by the S.W.R.D. Bandaranaike Memorial Foundation.
MP Sudharshani Fernandopulle was the Chief Guest at the event.

heading: News1st exposes a darker side of Galle Face Green (Watch ...
content:
The Galle Face Green holds a significant position in terms of places of leisure and recreation. This land area of approximately five acres, was used as a horse track by British Governor Henry Ward in the year 1859.
News1st, today, exposes the goings-on at the Galle Face Green.
Even though the Galle Face Green is maintained by the Sri Lanka Ports Authority, the land area has not been legally handed over to them.
A part of the land area was also maintained by the Urban Development Authority. When inquiries were made, the Colombo Municipal Council said that they have no legal obligation to the Colombo Galle Face Green.
In this backdrop, a question arises as to what account the money that was collected when parking a vehicle at the car park of the Galle Face Green until April 12 was deposited to.
However, now, the car park can be used free of charge by the public. Meanwhile a disturbing and  unsatisfactory situation has been observed at the food stalls at  Galle Face Green.
The food stalls do not seem to be regularly inspected for standards of hygiene and for the safety of the consumers. The food stalls at the Galle Face Green were inspected by the Public Health Inspectors Unit of the CMC on Saturday.
A public health inspector noted out that sanitation in this area is not up to a satisfactory standard and that they have requested those handling the food to wear uniforms. He also stated that they have also been asked to use proper sanitary equipment when handling food.

heading: Police officer arrested in Jathika Namal Uyana shooting
content:
A police officer has been arrested in connection with a shooting that took place at the Jathika Namal Uyana.
Police Media Spokesperson ASP Ruwan Gunasekara said that the shooting had occurred following a dispute the police officer had with the Venerable Wanawasi Rahula Thero, who resides at the Jathika Namal Uyana.
The Police Media Spokesperson said that during the dispute, the police officer had fired shots into the air, adding that there were no injuries reported.

heading: Body of an infant found in Peliyagoda
content:
A body of an infant has been found at the 4th milepost in Kalupalama, Peliyagoda.
The Police Media Unit said that information with regard to this finding was received on Saturday morning via the hotline number 119.
Police have begun investigations to ascertain the cause of the death. A magisterial inquest is scheduled to be conducted into the discovery.

heading: Suicide bomb blast kills 33 people in Afghanistan
content:
A suicide bomb blast in Afghanistan’s eastern city of Jalalabad killed 33 people and injured more than 100 outside a bank where government workers collect salaries on Saturday, April 18.
Police have yet to determine if the attacker had worn the explosives or had placed them in a car. They were also investigating if there was a second explosion after people rushed to the scene to help. Further the police noted a third blast that shook Jalalabad was a controlled detonation after experts discovered another bomb close to the scene of the first explosion.
Taliban insurgents denied responsibility, although they have claimed earlier killings in a wave of attacks coinciding with the sharp drawdown of foreign troops. For the first time since the hardline Islamist Taliban movement was ousted from power in 2001, Afghan forces are fighting with little support from NATO troops.
NATO, which at its peak had 130,000 soldiers in Afghanistan, has only a few thousand left, involved mainly in training and special operations.
Source: Reuters

Authorities say nearly 300 dual citizenship applications ...
content:
The Department of Immigration and Emigration said that it has received nearly 300 applications for dual citizenship.
Media Spokesperson of the Department, Lakshan de Soyza said that steps are being taken to issue the relevant documents to the applicants as early as possible.
Meanwhile, Minister of Public Order, John Amaratunga said that investigations have commenced into instances where nearly 2000 individuals were granted dual citizenship during an era where the granting of dual citizenship was halted.
The Minister added that the ministry will look into the legality of the dual citizenship  granted during that time period.

heading: Pensioners to get new electronic identity cards
content:
A programme has been launched to introduce Electronic Identity Cards to pensioners since the identification card currently in use was initiated in the 1960s.
The new identification card has been introduced with the help of new technology. With the use of this card, pensioners will be able to carry out transactions such as receiving their pension, among others.
Director General of the Department of Pensions, Sunil Hettiarachchi stated that in the future, utility payments such as electricity bills and insurance covers could be paid using the new electronic ID.

heading: Education Ministry says administrative members elected to...

The Ministry of Higher Education says that administrative members have been appointed to ten universities.
They went on to note that administrative officers have been appointed to the   University of Sri Jayawardenapura, Rajarata University, Colombo University, Kelaniya University, Moratuwa, Sabaragamuwa, Uva Welassa, North-Eastern University, University of Aesthetics and the Open University.

Minister Mahinda Amaraweera noted that the  employees will be getting their jobs back in the upcoming week. He went on to note that these employees have been protesting for almost a month to get their jobs back.

heading: Financial Fraud Investigation Unit takes up 52 complaints
content:
Police say that the Financial Fraud Investigation Unit has commenced investigations into 52 complaints that they have received.
Police Media Spokesperson, ASP Ruwan Gunasekara noted that the facts regarding these cases were presented to court.
He further noted that investigations are based on violating acts such as the Public Property Act and the Money Laundering Act, whereas, most of the investigations were pertaining to large scale financial fraud and that these investigations are of a complex nature.

heading: Measures underway to initiate a fixed price for tea
content:

Secretary to the Ministry of Plantation Industries Anura Jayawickrama said that the process will be initiated at a ceremony which will be held today.

heading: Bangladesh claim massive win over Pakistan
content:
Bangladesh scored their highest ODI total against Pakistan on Friday (April 17th) during match in Mirpur, Bangladesh.
Bangladesh won the toss and decided to bat first and went on to score a massive 329 runs for the loss of 6 wickets in their allotted 50 overs.
The first two Bangladeshi wickets fell within 67 runs however Tamim Iqbal and Mushfiqur Rahim put on 178 runs for the third wicket, guiding the hosts to their massive score.
Tamim Iqbal scored his 5th ODI Century with 132 runs while his comrade Mushfiqur Rahim went on to score his 3rd ODI century.
Pakistan’s Wahab Riyaz bagged four wickets at the end of his 10 over spell conceding 59 runs.
Pakistan got off to a disastrous start loosing the first wicket of Sarfraz Ahmed within 24 runs.
Skipper Azhar Ali scored his 5th ODI half century during his 72 run knock, however he did not receive the support of any other batsman and the unpredictable Pakistani team was bundled out for 250 runs in 45.2 overs. Bangladesh went on to record a 79 run win.

Police stated that the accident occurred when a motor-cyclist had knocked down a pedestrian. The victim was a resident of Moratuwa. The motor-cyclist has been arrested.

heading: Bosnian chefs aim to break Guinness World Record for bigg...
content:
Bosnian chefs hope to break a Guinness World Record for the biggest chicken stew in the world by cooking up the meal for 14,000 people.
Some 100 cooks and volunteers used 1,000 kilogrammes (2,205 pounds) of chicken meat and about 300 kilogrammes of vegetables to prepare the traditional dish, known as Bey’s soup, in the center of Sarajevo Friday.
It took eight hours to cook in an enormous, meter-high pot. Judges are sending details of the event to Guinness officials for verification.
Part of the dish was served to hundreds of residents who gathered to watch the spectacle. Organizers said the rest will be distributed to soup kitchens, which tend to thousands of people in the country where close to a fifth of population lives below the poverty line.

content:
President Maithripala Sirisena had made a pledge to party leaders on Sunday that Parliament will only be dissolved when the 20th Amendment to the Constitution including electoral reforms are adopted.

heading: Couple jumps off Diyaluma Falls
content:
The body of a seventeen-year-old girl who jumped off the Diyaluma Falls was discovered a short while ago.
According to the police, the victim reportedly jumped off the Falls  along with her boyfriend due to personal reasons.
Further investigations into this incident are underway.

heading: President reiterates govt’s commitment to strengthe...
content:
President Maithripala Sirisena has re-iterated the government’s commitment to strengthen the private sector. The President made this statement at an event held in Colombo on Sunday morning.
The President presented awards at this ceremony to 18 vegetable and dairy farmers, selected from across the country. Speaking at the event, the President said that they will provide all the empowerment, support and privileges that are required.

heading: No governor is ever single-handedly responsible for anyth...
content:
The committee investigating the alleged treasury bond scam at the Central Bank of Sri Lanka, has concluded that there is no evidence to the effect that the CBSL Governor Arjuna Mahendran, was directly involved in the process of accepting bids for the issue.
However, the Committee has also noted serious lapses on the part of Bank of Ceylon, through whom Perpetual Treasuries, had routed an unusually large amount of bids for the 30 year bond.
Issuing a statement on Sunday, the Ministry of Policy Planning and Economic Affairs noted that the Committee has made far reaching recommendations to ensure transparency and better governance at the Central Bank.
The three-member committee, comprising of Attorneys at Law Gamini Pitipana, Mahesh Kalugampitiya and Chandimal Mendis, had reportedly interviewed a large number of individuals including the governor, officials from the Central Bank, primary dealers and Perpetual Treasuries Limited.
The statement reads that the committee observed several deficiencies at the CBSL’s Public Debt Department, which handles all matters relating to servicing the domestic and foreign debt of the government.
In its nineteen-page report, the committee noted that since the PDD is dealing with the most sensitive information of the government, a proper supervisory and monitoring mechanism has to be immediately implemented.
However, the committee found that Arjuna Mahendran had no direct role in deciding to accept bids over and above the one billion rupees stipulated in the 30 year bond tender and accept up to 10 billion rupees.
The PDD had projected the government’s funding requirement at 13.55 billion rupees, as at the 2nd of March, 2015.
The committee has observed that even though the minutes of the relevant monetary board meeting specifies to issue a 30 year bond, the Monetary board, of which the Governor is Chairman had not decided on the amount.
The committee noted that while this exercise is vested with the PDD, the decision to accept the excess amount has been taken by the Tender Board Committee of which the Governor of the Central Bank is not a member.
Thereby, the committee has concluded that there is no direct evidence to the effect that Arjuna Mahendran had direct participation in the activities of the PDD and the Tender Board Committee.
However, noting serious lapses on the part of Bank of Ceylon, through which Perpetual Treasuries Limited had routed an unusually large amount of bids, the Committee has observed that the bidding pattern of Perpetual Treasuries warrants further investigation.
The Committee has also noted that the Bank of Ceylon should carry out a forensic audit and seek explanations from its Chief Dealer and others on ad hoc decisions risking a large amount of BOC funds, involved in the 30 year bond transaction.
The statement issued by the Ministry of Policy Planning and Economic Affairs, raises several questions.
1. If the CBSL Governor is not responsible for increasing the requirement to Rs. 10 Billion, then who at the Tender Board Committee should be held accountable?
2. If it was not the Governor who informed Perpetual Treasuries of the increased requirement, then who was it?
Leader  of the Democratic Left Front Vasudeva Nanayakkara says that he may not be solely responsible but he is responsible in principle, adding that he is the governor of the Central Bank and his son-in-law was with whom the loot has been shared.
Meanwhile, Investigative Business Journalist Faraz Shauketaly notes that no governor is ever single-handedly responsible for anything at the Central Bank, and they really don’t need a committee to tell them that. He went onto say that Arjuna Mahendran as Governor has admitted to a failure and it is this failure that resulted in the interest rates going up, very unusually.
Speaking exclusively to News1st on  March 16, CBSL Governor Arjuna Mahendran said that he takes responsibility for not informing primary dealers regarding the increased requirement.

heading: Boat carrying hundreds of migrants capsizes in the Medite...
content:
The Italian Coast Guard says that hundreds of people are feared to have drowned after a boat carrying up to 700 migrants capsized in the Mediterranean Sea.
A major rescue operation is under way after the vessel carrying “between 500 and 700 migrants” capsized at midnight local time, south of the Italian island of Lampedusa.
So far, 28 people have been rescued.
Earlier this week, four hundred people were feared to have drowned when their vessel capsized north of Libya.
 
-BBC

heading: UAE launches space centre to oversee Mars mission
content:
The United Arab Emirates (UAE) on Saturday launched a space centre to oversee the country’s preparation for the Mars exploration mission.
According to UAE’s official WAM news agency UAE’s Vice President and Prime Minister, Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum, issued a resolution establishing the Mohammed bin Rashid Space Centre (MBRSC).
According to the resolution, the MBRSC is mandated to develop research, projects and studies on space, in a way that will support UAE’s drive for advancing this sector and for building national capabilities related to the space knowledge and science.
The UAE government’s focus on becoming a space hub are part of the country’s preparation strategy for when oil reserves run out, reports Xinhua.

heading: WP Education Ministry says classes will be held before an...
content:
A programme has been implemented by the Western Provincial Council to have extra classes after school for students who are weak in their studies.
The Secretary of the Western Province Ministry of Education Daya Senarath noted that the classes will be held before and after school hours. The extra classes will be for students who are weak in Math, Science and English.
Teachers from the schools are be assigned for these classes.
He further noted that the programme will be implemented in a select number of schools. This step is being taken after the programme received positive feedback from students and parents.

heading: Triplets born in Batticaloa
content:
It is reported that triplets have been born at the Batticaloa Teaching Hospital. The parents are from  the Thannamunei and Kiran areas.
According to Dr. Thirikkumar in Batticaloa, the infants are of good health and no complications have been noted.
The doctor further stated this is the first time that such an incident has occurred in the hospital.

heading: Teen killed in Boraluwela accident
content:
One person has died in an accident at the Boraluwela junction on the Puttalam – Kurunegala route after a lorry collided with a motorcycle.
The deceased was a nineteen-year-old resident of  Puttalam. The lorry driver who sustained injuries has been hospitalised.

heading: SLBFE to take measures to bring back SLs overstaying in I...
content:
The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment says that they are planning to resort to legal measures against Sri Lankans who remain in Israel even after the expiration of their service contracts.
Chairman Nandapala Wickramasooriya said that they will even go to the extent of issuing international warrants to bring these individuals back to Sri Lanka.

heading: Newborn found in Teldeniya
content:
A new-born infant was found on the main road near the Ambakota Temple in Teldeniya on the morning of Sunday, April 19.
According to the police, the infant is currently at the Kandy Teaching Hospital. Investigations are underway to identify the parents of the infant.

heading: Bribery Commission to investigate irregularities in paddy...
content:
Minister of Food Protection Gamini Jayawickrama said that a complaint will be lodged with the Bribery Commission regarding irregularities that have taken place within the Paddy Sales Department.
He further noted that according to the investigative report,  complaints will be lodged in the coming week by a panel of lawyers that has been appointed.

heading: Draft Bill on 19th Amendment to be presented to Parliament
content:
Deputy Speaker of Parliament Chandima Weerakkody has said that the Draft Bill  on the 19th Amendment to the Constitution will be presented to Parliament on Monday, April 20.
He stated that a final decision regarding the bill will be taken on Monday morning, following the meeting of party leaders, which is due to take place on Sunday April 19 at the Presidential Secretariat The meeting will be headed by President Mathripala Sirisena.
Meanwhile, the Jathika Hela Urumaya says that they, as a party, have not arrived at a decision as yet with regard to the Draft Bill on the 19th Amendment to the Constitution.
Media Spokesperson of the Party, Nishantha Sri Warnasinghe, stated that they will arrive at a decision after garnering a better understanding of the situation at the   party leaders’ meeting.
He also said that the current stance of the Jathika Hela Urumaya is that the draft bill of the 19th Amendment to the Constitution must be presented along with the amendment to the electoral system.

heading: Views expressed on govt, good governance and promises
content:
Several politicians made statements at various events held across the country.
At a media briefing in Payagala UPFA MP Rohitha Abeygunawardene noted that development is not taking place in villages. This government has brought in a change but not to the rural areas, they could visit the villages and witness what has really occurred.
At a public rally at Wickremasinghepura, Deputy Minister of Justice Sujeewa Serasinghe stated that John Kerry is due to arrive in the country on April 2.
The deputy minister stated:
He will support us in the investigations carried out on large scale theft and fraud. Everything will be changed on a positive note.
At a media briefing in Godagama, Opposition Leader Western Province Manju Sri Arangala noted that they divided the parties in our country and hooked all the parliamentarians on money and power.
He stated that Mahinda Rajapaksa is ‘paying’ for he broke the parties previously. But now we can see that President Sirisena has taken power into his hands and is taking direct decisions that will control his party properly.
At a media briefing held in Gampaha, UNP MP Ajith Manapperuma stated that the rebellious political parties cannot survive now because good governance is the only thing that would be there when the 19th Amendment was enacted.
Deputy Minister of Policy Planning and Economic Affairs Dr. Harsha de Silva noted that the 100-day programme contained three main promises. Firstly, we wanted to provide relief to reduce the high cost of living. Secondly,we promised to strength the democracy of the country. We expect to present it and approve it in  parliament next Monday (April 20) and Tuesday (April 21) – according to the Supreme Court order. Thirdly, we promised to end corruption and violence. There are certain criticisms against us. We agree with that. But we do not tie people to trees. We expect to punish the wrong-doers in an independent court as soon as possible.
At a media briefing in Colombo Leader of the Janasetha Peramuna Ven. Battaramulle Seelarathana Thero invited JVP’s Somawansa Amarasinghe to join his party and engage in politics for the future.

heading: Power and Energy Minister speaks on gas deposits that hav...
content:
The Ministry of Power and Energy has said that steps will be taken within the next five years to develop and make use of gas deposits that have been discovered thus far.
Secretary of the Ministry, B.M.S. Batagoda noted that steps will be taken to call for tenders for this purpose. He further noted that the plan is to make Sri Lanka an energy-rich country in ten years to come.

heading: Crowds gather as Sirasa Wasantha Udanaya adds colour to P...
content:
The Sirasa Wasantha Udanaya 2015, organised in line with the New Year celebrations, was held at the Rajarata Navodya Stadium in Polonnaruwa on Saturday.
The Sirasa Wasantha Udanaya 2015 Bak Festival, was declared open on Saturday morning under the auspices of the Chief Minister of the North Central Province, Peshala Jayaratne.
The festival was jointly organised by Sirasa TV, the North Central Provincial Council, the Thamankaduwa Pradeshiya Sabha, the Polonnaruwa District Secretariat and the Polonnaruwa Police.
Colour was added to the event with numerous cultural performances. Large crowds flocked to participate in the traditional Bak Festival sports and several other competitions.
The Bak Festival which was organised with the intention of having a meaningful Sinhala-Tamil New Year promoting unity among communities, received immense support from the people.

content:
A state event was held in Morawaka on Saturday to inaugurate the Rs.80 fixed price on a kilogramme of tea leaves.
The event was held under the auspices of the Minister of Plantation Industries, Lakshman Kiriella.
The event was held at the Kalubowitiyana Tea Factory in Morawaka.
Speaking at the event, Minister Lakshman Kiriella said that they have started to fulfill the promises made to the tea plantation workers and have planned to provide this relief to all the small scale tea plantations in the coming weeks.
The minister went on to note that they have provided relief to ninety eight hundred thousand plantation workers with Minister Kabir Hasheem presiding and have proven that the UNP government keeps its promises.

heading: Opportunity for all to broaden the spirit of goodwill ...
content:
Opposition leader Nimal Siripala De Silva in his New year message notes that the theme of this New Year is that it provides an opportunity for everyone to broaden the spirit of goodwill.
He pointed that those principles of co-existence cannot be allowed to be broken down due to any political or other reason.
The opposition leader further noted in his New Year message that no one can encourage any attempts to use a sense of lawlessness to weaken the freedom of having a different opinion in a just society.

heading: Financial Fraud Investigation Division questions former C...
content:
Former Chief Executive Officer of CSN,  Nishantha Ranatunga was summoned before the Police Financial Fraud Investigation Division on Wednesday, April 15.
Nishantha Ranatunga who was summoned to the division to provide a statement, was questioned for over one and a half hours.
Former CEO of CSN Nishantha Ranatunga said that a complaint was made by the National Movement for a Just Society and Ananda Wijepala, a Director of the Anti-Corruption Secretariat.
He went on to note that they wanted to confirm the ownership of CSN and also know as to whether any tax concessions were provided.

heading: A News1st Exclusive: It is a great achievement for Sri La...
content:
Sri Lankan batting phenomenon Kumar Sangakkara bagged an award at the Asian Awards held in London, England on Friday.
Sangakkara won the award for Outstanding Contribution to Sport at the fifth edition of the Asian Awards, which also saw former One Direction band member Zayn Malik and Bollywood star Shah Rukh Khan pick up awards.
The 37-year-old Sangakkara is the second Sri Lankan to win the award after Muttiah Muralitharan, who won it in 2011.
Award winner Kumar Sangakkara speaking to News1st said that it was a great night at the Asian Awards. He went on to say that he was humbled and privileged to have been chosen to win the contribution for sports and to be recognized by the Asian community for his achievements and also to be among such a large group of Asian people who have conquered, in various ways, in their respective fields  both locally and internationally, and made lasting changes.
Speaking further, he said that it has been an interesting journey for him over the last 15 years. Last year, India’s MS Dhoni was the recipient of the Outstanding Contribution to Sport award, while Sachin Tendulkar won it in the inaugural edition of the awards in 2010.
The Asian Awards celebrate the highest achievements from across the international Asian community, and this year’s edition will support Prince Charles’ charity The British Asian Trust.

heading: PM’s New Year message highlights unity, brotherhood...
content:
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe in his  New Year message notes that the Sinhala and Tamil New Year is a national festival which embellishes national unity, brotherhood, equality, pleasure and prosperity of which traditions are embedded in the culture of Sri Lankans whose lives are mostly based on an agricultural economy since the distant past.
The message went on to note that the country is marching towards a new political culture for the progress of the entire nation where ethnic, religious and political differences have no value adding that it is unique that, in this year people are able to celebrate the New Year without any pressure, fear or suppression.

heading: Passengers returning in the new year meet with disappoint...
content:
News 1st on Wednesday inquired into the passenger transport facilities being provided to the public returning from their hometowns after the new year.
Our first stop was to investigate the train transport made available to the commuters. Long distance and short distance train travel was hampered on Wednesday morning.
A similar situation was witnessed at the Gampaha, Ganemulla and Kalutara North train stations. Commuters, in large numbers, are expected to make their way back to the cities after their new year holidays.
It was also reported that a sufficient amount of buses were not in operation for those returning after the new year. Our provincial correspondents reported that there was a delay in long distance and short distance bus services on Wednesday.
There was also a heavy traffic congestion reported on the access point in Matara on the Expressway.

heading: Health authorities observe more accidents during the new ...
content:
It has been revealed that the number of accidents related to fireworks has reduced while there has been a spike in road accidents, during the Sinhala and Tamil New Year.
Information published by the National Hospital reveals that there is a 15% increase in accidents this year, compared to the last year. The number of accidents reported during the past three days stands at 700.
A  nine percent increase in accidents have been reported when compared to last year. The highest number of  accidents are reported to be accidents caused indoor.
The Health Unit states that there is a 29%  increase in road accidents this year which stands at 156 ,when compared to last year.
Indoor accidents have seen a 40% increase.
The Health unit states that 129 accidents have been caused due to falling and that number has seen a 23% reduction when compared to the past year.
The Health Unit also states that attention has been drawn to further reduce the accidents caused during the festive season.

heading: Special train and bus services in place for commuters tra...
content:
The National Transport Commission says that special bus and train services have been allocated for passengers who wish to travel from their villages to Colombo.
Chairman of the National Transport Commission D.S. Jayaweera stated that 3000 buses and 1500 SLTB buses are being utilised for this purpose.
He further added that  buses have also been allocated on the expressway for passengers traveling from Galle and Matara. Thus it is expected that commuters will not have to pay extra for transportation and will be able to travel without much congestion.
These services will be in operation till Sunday April 19. He noted that if there are reports of illegal charges, action will be taken against such persons.
Meanwhile, Railway Superintendent L.A.R. Ratnayaka says that special train services are available for passengers travelling back to Colombo. Accordingly, special trains will leave from Badulla, Galle, Matara and other areas. Apart from this, extra compartments will also be added to normal trains. The department has taken measures to extend this special service if necessary.

heading: “Doctor” who entered Dambulla hospital remand...
content:
A quack doctor who attempted to enter the operating theatre of the Dambulla Base Hospital was arrested by police on Sunday.
This ‘doctor’ had entered the hospital with a stethoscope in hand.
A senior doctor at the hospital had felt suspicious over his presence and had questioned him. He was  later handed him over to the Hospital Police Post.
Police also seized a fake U.S. doctor’s identification card in the possession of the suspect. The suspect,  a resident from Medirigiriya, was produced before the Dambulla Magistrate on Sunday. He was later remanded.

heading: Ninety percent of NLB funds used for former presidentR...
content:
The President of the National Lotteries Board (NLB), Shyamila Perera says that Rs.375 million from the promotional funds of the board from last year had been used for the propaganda campaign of the former president.
The President of the National Lotteries Board went on to say that the NLB had spent Rs. 67 million on a video wall which was used across the country. The President of NLB added that there were more expenses for musical shows, dansalas, and the marathon of the Carlton Network. She also noted that the money utilised on political purposes were 90% of 400 million rupees which were allocated for promotions of the Lottery Board.

heading: Final rites of Most Ven Udugama Sri Buddharakkitha Thero ...
content:
The mortal remains of the Chief Prelate of the Asgiri Chapter of the Siam Sect Most Ven. Udugama Sri Buddharakkhitha Thero were brought to the Asgiri Viharaya in Kandy on Thursday,  April 9.
The mortal remains of the late Chief Prelate which were brought to the country from Singapore the previous night, were placed at a private funeral parlour in Colombo before being taken to Kandy on Thursday morning.
The cortege departed from Borella via Peliyagoda, along the Kandy road and reached the Kiribathgoda town by 7 a.m.  The devotees who were mourning the demise of the Chief Prelate gathered on either side of the road to pay their respects.
The procession then reached the Kegalle Town passing Kadawatha, Nittambuwa and Warakapola via Pasyala.
Devotees including the Chief Minister of the Sabaragamuwa Province lined the streets to pay their respects to the late Most Venerable Udugama Sri Buddharakkhitha Thero as the cortege went on to pass Mawanella and Pilimathalawa, reaching the Kandy town by 11 a.m.
The final rites will be observed on Sunday  April 12.

heading: Negligence that snatches lives away: Mother killed in Rag...
content:
A recent analysis has shown that most accidents occur as a result of rush and negligence. It has also been reported that several of these incidents are related to train accidents.
Commuters who are in a rush to reach their destinations often forget their own personal safety. Travelling on the train tracks and boarding a moving train are both punishable offences.
Saturday morning, in an attempt to reach their destination , a woman lost her life leaving her two children without a mother.
Thirty five (35) year old Vithanage Niluka arrived at the railway station on Saturday morning with her husband and two children to undertake a journey ahead of the new year.
The mother and her two children were stuck in between the train and platform when they attempted to board a moving train.
A passenger who attempted to rescue them also suffered serious injuries to his legs. The mother and one of the children who suffered injuries were rushed to the Ragama Teaching Hospital.
However, the mother who was in a rush to board the train, breathed her last upon admission to the hospital. The seven- year-old child who met with this tragedy suffered  minor injuries and was fortunate to live another day.
However, this act of attempting to reach a destination quickly resulted in a child losing his mother.
Another train accident was reported from Hikkaduwa on Saturday morning. A 14 year old girl on her way to a tuition class was killed when she was knocked down by an express train travelling from Maradana to Matara.
She was a resident from Meetiyagoda, Kalupe.

heading: Several Sri Lankan nationals in Yemen escape to Djibouti
content:
Forty four (44) Sri Lankan nationals have reached Djibouti via a Chinese vessel – escaping from the conflict-ridden areas in Yemen.
The family relatives speaking to News 1st said that they were told that the group reached the nation of Djibouti around 6 in the morning. Twenty five (25) Chinese nationals were also rescued from the Yemen and were transported to Djibouti.
When News 1st contacted one of the relatives of the Sri Lankan nationals.

heading: Police action criticised: Impounding Alles’ passpor...
content:
The manner in which the police functioned with regard to MP Tiran Alles, was subject to criticism in Parliament on Wednesday.
Parliamentarian Tiran Alles was barred from leaving the country by the Fort Magistrate’s Court on Tuesday in connection with alleged fraud in companies purportedly set up to reconstruct houses for tsunami-affected people.
MP Dinesh Gunawardena stated  that the police impounded the diplomatic passport of parliamentarian Tiran Alles without prior notification or questioning. He further added that the police had not lodged a formal complaint against the MP in courts.
Fellow Parlimetarian Susil Premajayantha added that it is justifiable to question an individual; however the police did not adhere to the laws and regulations that have been placed in regard to such instances.
Parliamentarian Tiran Alles was unaware of his passport being impounded until such a decision was announced.
If this was not announced through the media and if he was travelling abroad, he would only find out about this at the airport,  said MP Wimal Weerawansa. He went on to add that such actions must be taken within the confines of the law.
Speaker of Parliament, Chamal Rajapaksa stated that party leaders and ministers will meet to hold discussions regarding the rights of fellow parliamentarians and the proper execution of court decisions.

heading: President Sirisena meets Pakistani counterpart (Video)
content:
President Maithripala Sirisena called on the President of Pakistan Mamnoon Hussain at the country’s presidential palace on Monday, April 6.
News1st’s, Rinaz Mohommed, who is in Pakistan, noted that discussions were held on how to further strengthen relations between the two nations.
At the meeting the President of Pakistan had noted that the visit of the President of Sri Lanka is a historic occasion.
Subsequently, President Sirisena attended a dinner hosted by the President of Pakistan.

heading: Puttalam child beaten to death – arrests made
content:
Two arrests have been made over an incident where a child was beaten to death in Karuwalagaswewa, Puttalam.
The father of the victim and another relative were arrested by the police. According to ASP Ruwan Gunasekara, the Police Media Spokesperson, the post-mortem examination has revealed the cause of death as assault.
Investigations have revealed that the father and aunt of the victim had carried out the assault. They are to be produced before courts today.
Police went on to say that the victim’s mother has gone overseas to serve as a domestic aide a month ago , leaving the child in the custody of her husband and sister.

heading: Parliament will be dissolved if 19th Amendment to the Con...
content:
The United National Party says that the Parliament will be dissolved if the 19th Amendment to the Constitution is not passed in Parliament by the end of this week.
However, Minister Mahinda Amaraweera pointed out that the dissolution of the Parliament is beyond the capacity of the Prime Minister.
Chairman of the National Movement for a Just Society Venerable Maduluwawe Sobitha Thero said that they request Hela Urumaya to think further.
Speaking on Constitution Ven. Maduluwawe Sobitha Thero said:
Late J.R. Jayewardene drafted a constitution that was tailor-made for J.R. Jayewardene. That is exactly what Mahinda Rajapaksa did. He introduced the 18th Amendment to the Constitution, to be re-elected to rule, as much as he could.
Ven. Maduluwawe Sobitha Thero went on to say that it is not about drafting several constitutions. He said:
We must come together to draft a Constitution that will suit the country as a whole.
UPFA Minister Mahinda Amaraweera stated that Ranil Wickremesinghe said that the Parliament will be dissolved on  April 22.Speaking further he said:
 I don’t think it will be dissolved now. He can’t carry out the task of dissolving it. It should be dissolved by the President.
Minister Akila Viraj Kariyawasam stated that a gazette notification has been issued with the agreement of the current President, the Prime Minister and Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunge.
He noted that relevant steps will be taken in this regard within this week.
He went on to say that they will take steps to pass the 19th Amendment to the Constitution within this week. He also stated that if anyone opposes this, it clearly indicates that within the very next day, they will dissolve the Parliament and call for a general election to receive the public’s mandate.
Leader of the Democratic Left Front MP Vasudeva Nanayakkara pointed out that as per discussions they had so far, what could be understood is that the SLFP which has now merged with the government will not vote in favour of the government’s constitutional amendment.

heading: President Sirisena makes statement on 19th Amendment at P...
content:
At an event held in Polonnaruwa, President Maithripala Sirisena made a statement on the 19th Amendment.
An event was held at the Pulasthi College in Polonnaruwa to distribute sports equipment for sports clubs. The President announced on Thursday April 8  that the 19th Amendment to the constitution will be presented to Parliament on April 20 and that parliament will be dissolved once the amendment is adopted.
Sports equipment was distributed at the event to 64 schools and 330 sports clubs .
President Maithripala Sirisena noted that all the confrontations will come to an end with the next general election thereby fulfilling the promise made by reducing the powers of the President. All the party leaders discussed the matter yesterday and decided to bring the 19th Amendment to Parliament on the 20th of this month. After bringing it to the Parliament, the Parliament will be dissolved and a general election will be held.

heading: Obama nominates Atul Keshap as Ambassador to Sri Lanka an...
content:
US President Barack Obama has nominated Atul Keshap, a former Indian-American official at its Embassy in New Delhi, as the next US Ambassador to Sri Lanka and Maldives.
Obama on Thursday announced the nomination of Atul Keshap, a career foreign service official, as the next US Ambassador to Sri Lanka and Maldives.
Keshap is currently serving as the Deputy Assistant Secretary of State in South and Central Asian Affairs Bureau of the State Department. As his current role, Keshap had worked closely with Assistant Secretary of State Nisha Desai Biswal to coordinate US policy toward India, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Nepal, Maldives, and Bhutan.
From 2010 to 2012, he was the Director for India, Nepal, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Bhutan and Maldives in the Bureau of South and Central Asian Affairs.
Keshap, a graduate of University of Virginia, studied economics, international relations, diplomacy, and religious studies, as well as French.

heading: Former PM Vajpayee to Receive Bharat Ratna at Home Today
content:
Former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee and one of the most-respected politicians across parties will be conferred the Bharat Ratna, the country’s highest civilian award, today.
President Pranab Mukherjee and Prime Minister Narendra Modi will be among a host of VVIPs who are expected to be present at Mr Vajpayee’s Delhi residence where he will be honoured.
The announcement of the award for Mr Vajpayee, the first Prime Minister from outside the Congress party to serve a full five-year term, came on December 24, a day before he turned 90.
He was Prime Minister from 1998 to 2004, and has been seriously ill for the last few years.
Among his boldest initiatives was his historic bus journey to Lahore in 1999 when he signed the landmark Lahore Declaration with Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif with both sides pledging to push for peace and security.
The Bharat Ratna announced earlier for noted educationist and freedom fighter Madan Mohan Malviya will be given posthumously to his family members on March 30 at Rashtrapati Bhavan.
An educationist with a vision, Mr Malviya was behind the establishment of the Banaras Hindu University.
Mr Malviya is also remembered for his stellar role in the Independence movement.
The recommendation for the Bharat Ratna is made by the Prime Minister to the President.
In 2013, when the UPA government had announced the Bharat Ratna for former cricketer Sachin Tendulkar and scientist CNR Rao, the BJP had criticized the Congress for ignoring Mr Vajpayee’s contribution to the nation.
Since its inception, 43 people including former Prime Ministers Jawaharlal Nehru, Lal Bhadur Shastri, Indira Gandhi and Rajiv Gandhi have received the prestigious award.
Source: NDTV

heading: Politicians should take full responsibility for drug traf...
content:
Minister of Public Order, John Amaratunga says politicians should take full responsibility for the drug trafficking that is taking place in the country.
The minister made this statement at the opening ceremony of a new police station for the Katana area. IGP  N.K. Illangakoon, and Deputy Minister for Higher Education and Research, Dr. Sudarshini Fernandopulle were among those present at the ceremony.
Speaking on the occasion, the minister said:
A number of containers containing drugs were brought into the country and we will now see who provided protection for this, or for whose needs this took place. But a question has arisen as to how many more of these containers are arriving in the country.
Therefore, this has to be stopped, and those who are guilty of this must definitely be sent to the gallows.
