heading: General election to be held immediately after implementat...
content:
Minister Navin Dissanayake says that a General Election will be held immediately after the 19th amendment to the Constitution is implemented.
The Minister made this statement while addressing an event held in Nuwara Eliya on Monday (March 23rd)
Minister of Tourism and Sports Navin Dissanayake said that elections will be held for sports associations and that he had been instructed by the Attorney General not to allow officials who have served for four years or more to contest. The Minister went on to note that he would follow these instructions to the letter.

heading: Angelina Jolie has ovaries and fallopian tubes removed
content:
Actress Angelina Jolie has had her ovaries and fallopian tubes removed as a preventative measure against cancer.

Writing in the New York Times, Jolie said she had the surgery last week as she carries a gene that gave her a 50% risk 
of developing ovarian cancer.

Two years ago, Jolie, whose mother died from cancer, had a double mastectomy.

"It is not easy to make these decisions," she said. "But it is possible to take control and tackle head-on any health issue."

Jolie, who is married to Hollywood actor Brad Pitt, elected to have her ovaries and fallopian tubes 
removed after a check-up two weeks ago.

In the article, titled Angelina Jolie Pitt: Diary of a Surgery, she said a blood test revealed "a number"
 of elevated inflammatory markers that could be a sign of early cancer, and was told to see a surgeon immediately.

"I went through what I imagine thousands of other women have felt. 
I told myself to stay calm, to be strong, and that I had no reason to think
 I wouldn't live to see my children grow up and to meet my grandchildren," Jolie wrote.

"I called my husband in France, who was on a plane within hours. 
The beautiful thing about such moments in life is that there is so much clarity. You know what you live for and what matters. 
It is polarizing, and it is peaceful."

Further tests revealed Jolie was free of a tumour, but elected to have her ovaries removed after consulting doctors.
Her mother, grandmother and aunt all died of the disease.

Angelina Jolie carries a 'faulty' gene, called BRCA1, which sharply increases her risk of developing
breast cancer and ovarian cancer.

Her doctors estimated she had an 87% risk of breast cancer and a 50% risk of ovarian cancer in her lifetime 
unless she underwent surgery

In 2013, the award-winning actress had both breasts removed to cut her risk of breast cancer

And now two years later, she has had both ovaries and fallopian tubes removed

heading: Airbus A320 crashes into French Alps
content:
International media reports that an Airbus A320 plane operated by the Germanwings budget airline had crashed in Southern France while en-route from Barcelona to Dusseldorf.
A local newspaper in France citing aviation officials stated that the place was carrying 142 passengers, 2 pilots and 4 cabin crew at the time of the crash.
Germanwings said it was aware of reports that one of its planes had crashed in the French Alps stating that they have not received confirmation of the crash
According to the AFP,Debris from the plane has reportedly been found near a French village.

heading: Lankans arrested at BIA for alleged smuggling
content:
Two Sri Lankans, a male and a female, who had allegedly attempted to smuggle foreign currency worth Rs.4.5 million  from the Bandaranaike International Airport in Katunayake have been arrested by the Customs.
Customs Media Spokesperson and Legal Director, Leslie Gamini said that the suspects were residents from Kadawatha. He added that they had concealed the cash in their hand luggage while attempting to travel to Bangkok.

heading: Indo – Lanka fisheries talks to commence
content:
Indo – Lanka fisheries talks which were halted for close to a year will commence in Chennai, India on Tuesday, March 24.
The Ministry of Fisheries said that ten representatives from fisheries assignations in Sri Lanka will be representing the country at the discussion.
State Minister of Fisheries Dilip Wedaarachchi said that six officials from the Ministry of Fisheries and the Department of Fisheries will attend the discussion, as observers. The discussions will be held in India on the  March 24 and 25.
The discussions are mainly aimed at providing a solution to the fisheries problems faced in the north and issues faced by Indian fishermen.
The last discussion between representatives of the two countries was held in May last year.

heading: Thirty six killed in Peru bus crash
content:
At least 36 people have died in a multiple pile-up in Peru.
Around 70 people are also reported to be injured after a bus drifted into the opposite lane.
The bus, operated by the Murga Serrano line, was hit by three vehicles coming in the opposite direction – two buses and a truck.
The vehicle was carrying a delegation from the Christian organisation the Worldwide Missionary Movement, it is reported.
The accident took place before dawn on the Pan American Highway near Huarmey, about 200 miles (320km) north of the capital, Lima.
 
-BBC

heading: Today marks World TB day – 4,000 undetected
content:
Today marks World Tuberculosis Day.
This year Sri Lanka’s World Tuberculosis Day theme is 4,000 undetected – reach, treat, cure everyone.
Sri Lanka expects to reduce the number of TB patients to one per million by 2050.
A total of 9,473 TB patients were detected from Sri Lanka last year and 24.7 percent of them are from the Colombo district, 11.3 percent from the Gampaha district and 7.1 percent from the Kandy district.
The Western Province recorded 42.7 percent of the total number of TB patients. One out of ten newly identified TB patients live within the CMC.

heading: Sri Lanka – China FTA will help long term developme...
content:
Chinese government officials have stated that a substantive agreement will be reached in the third round of talks with regard to the Free trade agreement (FTA) between China and Sri Lanka and will be one of main factors with regard to promoting bilateral business relations.
These views were expressed at a meeting at the Chinese Ministry of Commerce in Beijing on Monday, which was attended by News 1st’s Cathrina Chang.
The Director of the Department of International trade and economic affairs at the Chinese Commerce Ministry, Zen Zhiyang noted that the FTA is of utmost importance to economic relations in South Asia at large and is an important platform to promote investment. He added that there still remain some concerns with regard to “key products” prior to the finalising of the FTA.
The officials also went on to note that there remain factors which may influence the speedy implementation of the FTA which are beyond their control. Chinese officials also say this includes the change in government in Sri Lanka and the adjustment in some of the competent authorities within the Sri Lankan government.
The Chinese Commerce Ministry also noted that they have been made aware of some political remarks made by certain Sri Lankan government representatives and noted that it had influence on certain projects.
However, they noted that China wishes to emphasise that all major cooperation projects with Chinese companies and Sri Lanka, are based on win-win treatment and cooperation. They also highlighted that all projects are run by businesses themselves.
The Commerce Ministry of China added that co-operation between the two sides is not aimed to serve unilateral interests but is based on equality and mutual benefit and targets Sri Lanka’s long term development and the people’s well being.

heading: Qatar’s Emir Sheikh Tamim Bin Hamad Al-Thani to ar...
content:
Emir of Qatar, Emir Sheikh Tamim Bin Hamad Al-Thani will arrive in Sri Lanka for an official tour on Tuesday, March 24.
Deputy Minister of External Affairs, Ajith P. Perera said that the Emir Sheikh Tamim Bin Hamad Al Thani will arrive in Sri Lanka for a four- hour visit.
During his visit, he will meet President Maithripala Sirisena, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and Minister of External Affairs Mangala Samaraweera.
Police Media Spokesperson, ASP Ruwan Gunasekara said that a special traffic plan will be implemented in lieu of the Emir Sheikh’s visit.
Traffic will therefore be restricted on Baseline road, Orugodawatta, Borella, D.S. traffic lights, the road in front of Nelum Pokuna, Liberty Roundabout in Kollpitya, the Galle Face roundabout and the N.S.A roundabout from the road that enters into the Colombo Katunayake expressway from 1:30 p.m. to 2:30 p.m.

heading: Rathgama PS Chairman shot dead
content:
Chairman of the Rathgama Pradeshiya Sabha, Manoj Pushpakumara has been shot dead.
Police said that he was shot at around 11.50 on Monday night inside a hotel in the town of Hikkaduwa.
Two others who were with the Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman at the time of the shooting were injured and are receiving treatment at the Karapitiya Teaching Hospital.
Police stated that the body of the Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman is currently lying at the Karapitiya Teaching Hospital.

heading: Brother of S.B. Dissanayake under arrest (Watch Video)
content:
Three persons including Ranjith Dissanayake, Coordinating secretary to and brother of S.B. Dissanayake was arrested on Monday.
They were arrested on charges of threatening a group of UNP supporters on Sunday evening.
The suspects have been released on bail after being produced before the Walapane Magistrate.
The brother of Minister S.B. Dissanayake, Ranjith Dissanayake had threatened the residents after arriving at a house in Akiriya in Hanguranketha on Sunday.
The owner of the house  says that he was threatened because he had organised an UNP rally in the area.
Our correspondent stated that UNP Central Provincial Councillor Jayalath Dissanayake, another sibling of Minister S. B. Dissanayake, was to preside at that particular public rally.
Meanwhile residents of Rikillagaskada protested against the failure to arrest Ranjith Dissanayake.
UNP Central Provincial Councillor Jayalath Dissanayake also visited the scene of the demonstration. The protesters continued their occupation citing their mistrust of a mere statement that the suspect would be arrested.

heading: Former SL Ambassador Weeratunga accused of arms-trafficki...
content:
Deputy Minister Ajith P. Perera says the President of Ukraine, Petro Poroshenko, has made a complaint to the Foreign Ministry, that Udayanga Weeratunga, had engaged in arms deals while serving as the Sri Lankan Ambassador to Russia.
The Deputy Minister noted that the Ukrainian President claims in his complaint that Weeratunga had supplied weapons to Pro-Russian rebels in Ukraine, while serving as Ambassador.
Weeratunga, served as Ambassador to Russia since 2006, until he was recalled by the new government.
Deputy Minister Ajith Perera speaking to News1st stated that an investigation is underway into the conduct of the former ambassador. The minister also revealed that Weeratunga had been close to the Rajapaksa family.
The Pro-Russian rebels, whom Udayanga Weeratunga is accused of supplying weapons to, are fighting for a separate state in regions of Eastern Ukraine, including Donetsk.
Foreign media reports indicate that close to 6,000 people have already lost their lives to the conflict.
Incidentally,  the same pro-Russian rebels who have been accused of downing Malaysia Airlines Flight MH 17, on July 17, last year. All 298 people on board were killed.
Meanwhile, the family of Noel Ranaweera, an employee of the Sri Lankan Embassy in Russia, who passed away on the 11th of July 11 last year during Udayanga Weeratunga’s tenure as Ambassador, have raised suspicions regarding the circumstances of his death.
The death certificate cites the cause of death as blunt force trauma to the chest caused by being hit by a vehicle.The deceased, Noel Ranaweera, served as a translator at the Sri Lankan Embassy in Russia.
According to his family, Ranaweera had been working in Ukraine, prior to receiving the posting at the Embassy in Russia, due to his close ties with Udayanga Weeratunga.
The sister of the victim speaking to News1st noted that the Ambassador had operated a joint account with the victim, she added that the account has now been deactivated.

heading: A chain of cruel happenings – but dog beats death
content:
A stray dog was hit by a car, clubbed in the head and left for dead in a ditch in Washington state.
Days later, the one-year-old bully breed mix showed up sickly and covered in dirt at a nearby farm. The dog that defied death is recovering with the help of good samaritans and veterinarians at the Washington State University.
A month ago the dog went through some devastating events like getting struck by a car. Thereafter things got worse as someone cracked her in the head with a hammer and placed her in a box in a farm field but the dog somehow survived and was discovered at a nearby farm with a dislocated jaw, leg injuries and a caved-in sinus cavity.
The wounds helped the veterinarians to discover his injuries including the hammer blow.
Considering all the trauma the dog has been through she still remains gentle and loving. She is named Theia. It is a miracle that this little animal was able to survive these cruel happenings.
Theia is receiving care at WSU Veterinary Teaching Hospital in Pullman
Mellado said she has been deluged with calls from people seeking to help. Theia is staying with Mellado’s family until they find her a permanent home.

heading: Mass evacuation due to Central London fire (Video)
content:
Around 2000 people were evacuated from work places and nearby buildings in Central London on Wednesday, April 1, when a cable fire occurred under the pavement in the area. London Fire Brigade said that smoke was seen emerging from underneath the pavement and through manholes in Holborn making them raise the alarm and evacuate people from the area.
The area affected by the #Holborn power cut… pic.twitter.com/KRyIEfATJT
— Mike Wooldridge (@mdw1989) April 1, 2015

On the same day by 8 pm, in London, firefighters said that they had the fire under control but continued to monitor the scene. On the following day, April 2, London Fire Brigade said that firefighters and officers are still active at the scene in Kingsway as the fire was under control but not fully extinguished.
 

Here’s another #HolbornFire #kingsway. They’ve pushed everyone back – all offices evacuated now pic.twitter.com/4t0tl3CUnO
— Martin Dyan (@MartinDyan) April 1, 2015


A number of workplaces, museums and other buildings were still kept closed, which resulted in a mass evacuation and widespread power outages.
London Fire Brigade Assistant Commissioner, Peter Cowup, stated that the incident has been difficult to tackle as the the service tunnel is hard to reach although firefighters have been applying water through access points all-night. The Assistant Commissioner also added that despite the hardships, the fire is contained and steady progress is being made.

heading: Foreign Affairs Ministry seeks help to bring back Sri Lan...
content:
The Ministry of Foreign Affairs says that it has sought the assistance of the Indian and Indonesian governments to help in the repatriation of Sri Lankan expatriates in Yemen who have been caught amidst the country’s ongoing crisis.
The Indian Government has pledged to retrieve the Lankans along with the third batch of Indian expatriates being repatriated from Yemen, while the Indonesian Government has requested the use of Sri Lankan trajectories for their aircraft in return for their assistance in rescuing stranded Lankans.
The Ministry noted that favourable responses have been received in this regard.
The news comes after relatives of the Sri Lankan immigrants stranded in Yemen called upon and requested the Minister of Foreign Affairs on Wednesday to implement a proper programme to retract the Sri Lankans.
Foreign media reports cite that clashes between Iran – backed Houthi rebels and Saudi Arabia forces have intensified, with cross border fighting for over a week.
Foreign Media also reports on swift measures taken by the governments of India and China, to retract Indian and Chinese nationals stranded in Yemen .

heading: Google to “no longer recognise security certificate...
content:
Google has announced that its web browser Chrome and other products will no longer recognise security certificates issued by the China Internet Network Information Center (CNNIC), the government agency that oversees China’s domain name registry.
It is a significant fact because CNNIC administers security certificates for the .cn country code, as well as Chinese-language domain names, which are open to businesses registered within China.
Unless one of the sites is on a white-list of legitimate domains CNNIC provides to Google, Chrome users will see a pop-up warning them about its security even though they could chose between ignoring the content or proceeding to the site.
The ban comes two weeks after Google noticed unauthorized digital certificates for several Google domains that were issued through MCS Holdings, an intermediate certificate authority contracted by the CNNIC. The ban will be implemented in the future update of Google.
The CNNIC explained to Google that instead of keeping the security certificate’s private key safely tucked away in a proper hardware security module, MCS Holdings installed it in a man-in-the-middle proxy, leaving it extremely vulnerable to interception.

heading: BREAKING NEWS : Tissa Karaliyadda says he resigned owing ...
content:
Tissa Karaliyadda who resigned from the Position of Deputy Minister of Buddha Sasana and Democratic Governance
said that the influence of one United National Party Minister resulted in his resignation.
Speaking to News1st over the phone, Tissa Karaliyadda said that he will make a revelation of this in the future.
MP Tissa Karaliyadda stated that several government ministers threatened him while he was a part of the Government. He noted that there were UNP ministers who attempted to take away perks granted to him by the President.
The parliamentarian added that as a result of this he was forced to take a decision to step away from the Government and that such activities cannot take place within a national Government.

heading: Meet Little Foot – the 3.7 million-year-old human a...
content:
Scientists have said a sophisticated new dating technique shows that Little Foot, an important fossil of an early human forerunner unearthed in the 1990s in South Africa, is roughly 3.7 million years old.
“The age of Little Foot has been highly debated,” said geologist Darryl Granger of Purdue University in Indiana, whose research appears in the journal Nature.
The study found Little Foot, a member of the species Australopithecus prometheus, lived at roughly the same time as Australopithecus afarensis, the species whose most famous fossil, known as Lucy, comes from Ethiopia.
Both species blended ape-like and human-like traits but with different features.
The researchers analysed 11 rock samples from around the nearly complete Little Foot fossil skeleton from the Sterkfontein Caves to gauge its age.
The findings may have important implications about the evolutionary relationships among humankind’s ancient relatives.
Our species, Homo sapiens, appeared roughly 200,000 years ago. Earlier members of the human genus, Homo, date back more than 2 million years. Our genus was predated by other species on the human family tree including various representatives of the genus Australopithecus.
Members of Lucy’s species were contemporaries of Little Foot, although Lucy herself lived about 500,000 years later.
Like Lucy, Little Foot was female. The species was much bigger and taller than Lucy’s, with gorilla-like facial features but fully upright and very strong with powerful hands for climbing, according to paleoanthropologists Ron Clarke and Kathy Kuman of the University of the Witwatersrand in Johannesburg.

 
 
Source: TheTelegraph

heading: Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka says govt staging media char...
content:
Speaking at a rally held in Pelmadulla, the Democratic Party leader Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka says that the new government is also inclusive of the corrupt.
He stated that the government is staging media charades by catching a handful of thieves, tapping a few sharks but not catching the “large whales” on top. Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka also stated that this situation is a result of 75% of the ministers who were appointed recently being involved in corruption.
Speaking on the price reductions, the leader of the Democratic Party said that the reduced prices of the essential goods were not reduced for the benefit of the economy but with other intentions. He further stated that it is the money of the country that it being circled around and therefore it does not benefit the economy.
Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka also said that the current economic plan is not a proper one as the compensation provided for the poor comes from a small sum of the increased taxes on Hybrid cars and construction workers.

heading: Russian trawler sinks – 54 confirmed dead
content:
A Russian freezer trawler with 132 people aboard has sunk off the Kamchatka peninsula with 54 sailors so far confirmed dead and 15 missing.
According to a maritime rescue centre in Russia’s Far East, Sixty-three people have been rescued, many suffering from hypothermia.
The Dalniy Vostok went down in the Sea of Okhotsk, 330 km (205 miles) west of Krutogorovsky settlement, at around 06:30.
Drifting ice may have torn a hole in the vessel, the BBC reported, citing Russian emergency services.
BBC reports that seventy-eight of the crew were Russian, with the remainder coming from countries including Latvia, Ukraine, Myanmar and Vanuatu.

heading: Promise made by govt has to be fulfilled: Somawansa Amara...
content:
Secretary of International Affairs of the JVP Somawansa Amarasinghe says that the promise made by the government has to be fulfilled on time.
Speaking at a programme held in Kantale, Somawansa Amarasinghe noted that elections should be held, because that promise has been made and the parliament should be dissolved on time. He went onto note that one should act straight when dealing with people.
Speaking further, he said that President is the one who must dissolve parliament on the correct date. He pointed out:
 If he does not do it accordingly we will make sure to point it out that he didn’t. And the people will decide that it’s time for him to leave.

heading: Justice Minister says 19th Amendment will be adopted R...
content:
Party Leaders have agreed to take up the draft 19th Amendment to the Constitution for debate in Parliament on  April 8.
Minister of Justice Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe noted that the bill would be debated on for three days from April 8  – 10.
The Minister of Justice stated that even though the opposition leader voiced his agreement, there are some in the opposition who say the amendment should be accompanied by electoral reforms.
However, the Minister added that, following several rounds of talks, they have come to an understanding that even if electoral reforms are introduced, since it will take a long time, the 19th Amendment will be adopted for the time-being; and to consider the upcoming election as the final election to be held under the preferential voting system and to introduce a more suitable electoral system in the future.

heading: Completed 78% of the projects in 67 days: Finance Ministe...
content:
Minister of Finance Ravi Karunanayake says that despite the government’s economic plan being heavily criticized by some, the people have expressed a positive response to it.
The Finance Minister speaking on the 100-day programme said:
It’s 67 days today since the rule of the new government. And within these 67 days of the 100-day programme we have managed complete 78% of the projects.
The minister made this statement while attending an inauguration ceremony of a programme to provide one million jobs. A website which will help find information on jobs, was also launched by the minister.

heading: Kim Jong-un seeks ‘pleasure troupe’ women
content:
Kim Jong-un, the North Korean leader, has ordered the creation of a new “pleasure troupe” of young women to entertain him.
Kim ordered the group of women that was hand-picked by authorities loyal to his father and predecessor, Kim Jong-il, to be disbanded shortly after his death in December 2011, according to South Korea’s Chosun Ilbo newspaper.
He has now decided, however, to resurrect a source of entertainment that has become a tradition for North Korean leaders.
“After he came to power, Kim trusted no-one and ordered thorough investigations into every official in the regime, from the highest to the lowest”, Toshimitsu Shigemura, a professor at Tokyo’s Waseda University and an authority on North Korean affairs, told.
With that process now completed, as well as the conclusion of the three-year official mourning period after the death of Kim Jong-il, the new North Korean dictator is free to select a new generation of female companions.
The women who were employed as entertainers were given pay-offs of $4,000 – a huge sum in impoverished North Korea – and home appliances. Women who were employed as maids and cleaners at Kim Jong-il’s palaces received about half that amount.

 
 
Source: The Telegraph

heading: Newly-elected BASL President PC Geoffrey Alagaratnam atte...
content:
An awareness programme titled Legal Process Outsourcing in Sri Lanka: Realising a Vision Through Education organided by the Vezarto LPO Academy in collaboration with the Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL) was held in Colombo on Wednesday,  April 1, at the BASL auditorium.
The programme which saw a lecture delivered by Prof. Rafael Dean Brown, a Juris Doctor from the Philippines was attended by the newly-elected President of the Bar Association of Sri Lanka, President’s Counsel Geoffrey Alagaratnam, judges, lawyers as well as law students. This is incidentally the first event President’s Counsel Geoffrey Alagaratnam attended in his capacity as the President of the BASL.
Speaking at the programme, the President of BASL stated that long before the 1972 constitution, Sri Lankan lawyers were feared in Singapore, Malaysia and India. He added that they were accepted as a smart generation of people in a “beautiful country called Sri Lanka”.
President’s Counsel Geoffrey Alagaratnam further stated that the lawyers have to re-think and go back considering where we are today, saying not to go back to the past but to develop further.

heading: Colombo Fire Dept rescues woman in Athurugiriya
content:
The Colombo Fire Department rescued a woman who fell into a well in Rukmalgama, Athurugiriya.
The Fire Department said that the incident was reported on Thursday morning and several teams had been deployed to rescue the child.
The girl’s husband had initially attempted to rescue her with a ladder but owing to injuries she had sustained to her head and arm, the Colombo Fire Department had to intervene.
The twenty-girl-year-old woman has been admitted to the Homagama hospital.

heading: MP Tissa Karaliyadda resigns
content:
Deputy Minister of Buddha Sasana and Democratic Governance MP Tissa Karaliyadda has said that he has resigned from his deputy ministerial portfolio.
He said that he has informed President Maithripala Sirisena and the Parliamentary Secretary in writing about this move.
He said he resigned from his position as there was no end to political victimisation.

heading: Results of South Korea fishing industry exam to be released
content:
The results of the enrollment examination to employ persons to the fishing industry in South Korea will be released on Thursday, April 2.
The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment said that the results could be obtained via their website www.slbfe.lk. 2,104 candidates out of 2,220 applicants sat for the examination.
Over 50% of those who pass the examination, which was held on March 28, will be deployed to South Korea for employment.
The Foreign Employment Bureau said that applicants who possess experience and other professional qualifications in the fishing industry will be considered as a special qualification during the interview following the examination.

heading: Hiltop Christ – the Redeemer statue lit in blue for...
content:
The hilltop Christ the Redeemer Statue in Rio de Janeiro was lit blue on Wednesday April 1, ahead of World Autism Awareness Day on Thursday April 2nd.
The event was organised by the Archdiocese of Rio de Janeiro and the Blue World Foundation, along with the participation of families of affected by autism.
The movement also aimed to make a splash across social media platforms by launching the hashtag #acendaumaluzazul, or #lightitupblue, along with a music video drawing attention to the syndrome, entitled “Blue Selfie”.
The World Health Organisation (WHO) changed the classification of autism 15 years ago, from a disease to a disorder.
According to WHO, the disorder is characterised by difficulties in social interaction, communication and a restricted and repetitive repertoire of interests and activities, across a wide spectrum of manifestations and severity.
The United Nations (UN) declared the theme for the 2015 International Day for Autism Awareness “Employment: The Autism Advantage” in light of the estimate that 80 percent of adults with autism are unemployed.
According to the UN, employers often overlook heightened abilities in pattern recognition and logical reasoning, and attention to detail, often shown by people on the autism spectrum.
Source -Reuters

heading: Update: Germanwings plane crash: Co-pilot deliberately cr...
content:

The German co-pilot Andreas Loubitz kept the pilot of the plane locked out, as he began to descend the plane intentionally as the pilot fought to re-enter.

heading: China vows to deepen maritime security ties with Pakistan
content:
China today pledged to deepen anti-terrorism, maritime security and military technology cooperation with Pakistan to further strengthen their all weather strategic ties.



The “pledge” was made by Vice Chairman of China’s Central Military Commission General Fan Changlong during his meeting with the Pakistan Navy Chief Muhammad Zakaullah here, state-run Xinhua news agency reported.
Fan said China hopes to enhance coordination and cooperation with Pakistan on regional security affairs.
“China is willing to deepen cooperation with Pakistan in anti-terrorism, maritime security and military technology,” Fan said.
China will work with Pakistan to push forward the construction of the the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor within the framework of China’s “Belt and Road” initiatives and build a community of shared destiny, Fan said.
Zakaullah said Pakistan will work with China to deepen pragmatic cooperation between the two armed forces, especially the navies, to push their cooperation to a new height.
Earlier, the Pakistan Naval Chief, who is on the first official visit to China after assuming the office, said that Pakistan Navy and PLA Navy are strengthening their existing maritime cooperation keeping in view the changing regional international scenarios.
Zakaullah yesterday met with Commander of the PLA (Navy) Admiral Wu Shengli and said that the navies of Pakistan and China have been cooperating for decades.
He said that military cooperation between the two countries is extensive and it covers equipment, personnel exchanges and joint exercises.
 
 



PTI

heading: Min. Rosy Senanayake forges ahead with nutrition programm...
content:
Minister of Children’s Affairs, Rosy Senanayake, said that the objective of public representatives elected through the people’s votes should be to assist in making the lives of the people better.
Another phase of distributing nutritious food packs to expectant mothers took place in Gampaha on Wednesday.
Former President Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga and Hema Premadasa were also among those present for the event.
Minister of Children’s Affairs, Rosy Senanayake stated that the Rs.20,000  nutrition programme is one which directly benefits the people under the government’s 100-day initiative.

heading: Formula 1: Fernando Alonso denies speculation on pre-seas...
content:
McLaren-Honda Formula 1 team’s driver Fernando Alonso spoke out on the pre-season testing accident at the Malaysian Grand Prix press conference on Thursday, March 26.
The double world champion has been cleared to race in the Malaysian Grand Prix after missing the season opener Australian Grand Prix following the pre-season testing accident.
Speaking at the press conference, the Spaniard dismissed reports of being unconscious and stated that he was well aware of the situation and conscious after the accident. Alonso also denied McLaren’s early report which said that the wind played a factor in the crash, causing him to go off course.
Alonso, who recalled the accident in full stated that it was caused by a steering problem which McLaren’s data failed to pick up. The spaniard went on to say that he remember the accident and he remembered everything the following day.
Explaining the incident, the double world champion said that he had a steering problem in turn three where the steering locked into the right and hit the wall and said that he braked at the last moment and downshifted from fifth to third but nothing has been recorded in the data.
He went on to dismiss the reports of him waking up believing its 1995, driving go-karts and dreaming of becoming a Formula 1 driver. Alonso said that it was a normal concussion and the unconsciousness was due to medication and said it didn’t last for more than two hours. He also said that he was able to turn off the radio and the car’s master switch before the marshals arrived at the location.
When asked about McLaren’s initial report which said that wind blew the car off course, Alonso replied saying that not even a hurricane could move the car at that speed. Alonso went on to say that he trusts the team and every component of the car has been checked and every doubtful part has been replaced. He stated that both him and the team should be fine as the season progress.
Fernando Alonso has won the Formula 1 World Drivers Championship twice and is considered as the best driver on the current formula one grid.

heading: Bilateral agreements reached during President’s Chi...
content:

According to this agreement, technical assistance is to be provided to conduct tests in areas where kidney diseases have spread and also to purify underground water sources.
An MoU reached between the Chinese Ministry of Commerce and the Sri Lanka Ministry of Justice will see a capability study being conducted on the renovation of the Supreme Court Complex.
Another agreement to provide training on Chinese Technology to 2000 young scientists, provide Sri Lanka with a Bio Technology Laboratory as well as provide administrative and management training to state officials was reached between Sri Lanka and China.

heading: Geologic history of flowing water on Mars 4 billion-years...
content:
Brown University researchers combined images from NASA’s CTX instrument with mineralogical data from NASA’s CRISM orbiting spectrometer to create a geologic history of flowing water on the surface of Mars nearly 4 billion years ago.
They completed a new analysis of an ancient Martian lake system in Jezero Crater , near the planet’s equator.
The study found that the onslaught of water that filled the crater was one of at least two separate periods of water activity in the region surrounding Jezero.
The ancient lake at Jezero crater was first identified in 2005 by Caleb Fassett, a former Brown graduate student now a professor at Mount Holyoke College.
Fassett identified two channels on the northern and western sides of the crater that appear to have supplied it with water.
That water eventually overtopped the crater wall on the southern side and flowed out through a third large channel.
It’s not clear how long the system was active, but seems to have dried out around 3.5 to 3.8 billion years ago.
The map showed that each of the fan deposits has its own distinct mineral signature that matches the signature of the watershed from which it was sourced.
The minerals’ formation and their transportation seem to have been separated by a fair amount of time.
Mapping of the watershed showed a younger layer of rock that sits on top of the hydrated minerals.
The crater’s inlet channels cut through that layer of younger rock. That meant the water that carved the channels must have flowed well after the mineral layer had formed.
That finding could shed light on the water story for early Mars. It’s clear that Mars was once much wetter than it is now, but it’s not clear that the Martian climate was warm enough to sustain liquid water at the surface for long periods.
Some researchers have suggested that if the early Martian climate was cold, chemical alteration on Mars may have been driven largely by water percolating in the warmer subsurface crust. That period of subsurface activity was followed some time later by pulses of water on the surface, potentially sourced by either snowmelt or rainfall, during transient periods of warm temperatures.
That second round of events was largely responsible for the mechanical erosion on the Martian surface.
The study is published in the Journal of Geophysical Research: Planets.

heading: Zayn Malik quits One Direction
Two-year-old Indian sets National Archery Record
content:
According to the India Book of Records, a two-year-old groomed from birth to be an archery champion after the tragic death of her older siblings set a new national record on Tuesday March 24.
Dolly Shivani Cherukuri was conceived through surrogacy after the death of her brother, an international archer and coach, in a road accident in 2010. The couple’s eldest daughter had died in 2004.
On Tuesday, March 24, nine days before her third birthday,she became the youngest Indian to score 200 points over five and seven-metre distances according to Biswaroop Roy Chowdhury of the India Book of Records.
“She has become the youngest in the country to achieve the feat,” Mr Chowdhury said by telephone from the southern state of Andhra Pradesh, where the successful record attempt was made.
“It’s a record which will be difficult to break.”
Dolly’s parents said they had arrows specially made for her out of carbon when she was first learning the sport to ensure she could carry them.
Her father Cherukuri Satyanarayana, who runs an archery academy says that when they came to know that the baby was on her way they decided to mould her as an archer.
“The preparations started when she was in the womb itself,” he said.
Pictures showed the toddler posing for photographers with her golden medal and certificate after she fired 72 arrows in all in 24 attempts over the 5-metre and 7-metre distances.

India boasts a strong record of success in archery.
-NDTV

The issuance of Treasury Bonds by the CBSL in February was subjected to much criticism by experts in the field of economics and also by professionals.

heading: Debate held over position of Chief Justice
content:
A debate on whether the removal of President’s Counsel Mohan Peiris from the position of Chief Justice was legal or not was held at the University of Colombo on Friday.
A group including the President of the Bar Association of Sri Lanka, Attorney-at-Law Upul Jayasuriya and Attorneys-at-Law Gomin Dayasiri and Saliya Peiris were in attendance.
The debate organised by the Moot Court and Debating Society of the Faculty of Law at the University of Colombo.
President of BASL, Attorney-at-Law Upul Jayasuriya said;
A motion was tabled under article 78/2 of the standing orders with a motion urging the removal of a judge, here in this instance the Chief Justice, Dr. Bandaranaike. The removal of a judge should be confined to Article 78 Sub Article 7 of the Standing Orders. But unfortunately there was no mention of the 78/7 in the motion. Now having done so they realised that, to say the least, they made a mistake, a terrible mistake. I wont say its a complicated constitutional process, but I must say the words as referred to in the laws, the Standing Orders and the Constitution should be followed to the letter. You are removing the Chief Justice of a country. So what was conveyed by the Speaker to the President is important, because this has not been in the public domain. There’s not a word in this communication addressed to the President to remove the judge. In these circumstances she has not been removed. That’s the position that the BAR took, that’s the position that we have finally indicated.
Attorney-at-Law Gomin Dayasiri expressed these views:
I think its quite fashionable these days for chief justices to be booted. Because every chief justice nowadays seems to be getting booted. Maybe I am the only unique person in that sense, I supported the removal of Shirani Bandaranaike and opposed the appointment of Mohan Peiris. Mohan Peiris was a Legal Adviser to the government, was attached to the Defense Ministry. How can you possibly accept justice in such a case? You make political appointments, whether it is Shirani Bandaranayake from Chandrika Bandaranaike’s regime or Mohan Peiris from the Rajapaksa regime, it is wrong.
Attorney-at-Law Saliya Pieris shared these views:
In the eyes of the law Mr. Mohan Peiris was never Chief Justice of this country. So if he was not Chief Justice of this country, there is no need for him to be impeached. Because to try to have him impeached would be to recognise that he was Chief Justice. And that would be doing injustice to the constitution. Even to move to impeach him would be to recognize that he is valid. He is the Chief Justice of Sri Lanka. So in the eyes of the law, in the eyes of the constitution, his appointment was an absolute nullity.

heading: More than 20 percent of youth are unemployed:Census and ...
content:
Department of Census and Statistics revealed that more than 20 percent of the youth are unemployed.
Their latest report states that a 20.6 percent of the youth between the ages of 15 and 24 are currently unemployed.
The Central Bank of Sri Lanka released its  Sri Lanka Labour Force -Statistics Quarterly Bulletin for last year.
According to  statistics, 4.2 percent of the population are unemployed.However, 24.5 percent of the women between the ages of 15 and 24 and 18.2 percent of the males in the same criteria are unemployed.
According to the report, this category is mostly represented by Advanced Level students and students who are currently involved in higher education.

heading: Singapore citizens queue to pay respects to Lee Kuan Yew
content:
Mourners on Saturday queued to pay their last respects  to former Prime Minister Lee Kuan Yew on the final day of his lying in state at Parliament House.
Some 250,000 people have already visited to pay respects to Lee, who died on Monday aged 91.
Thousands of people have queued to honour the former leader since his coffin was taken by gun carriage to Parliament House on Wednesday morning.
It has been a sight rarely seen in Singapore – where public gatherings are tightly controlled – over the last few days thousands of people have stood in lines stretching over a few kilometres from Parliament House, over the river, across the financial district, into Chinatown.
Lee, modern Singapore’s founding father, died on Monday aged 91.
A state funeral will be held tomorrow, with foreign dignitaries from around the world expected to attend.
India has declared it a national day of mourning, with flags flown at half-mast and no official entertainment.
Those attending the funeral include UK House of Commons leader William Hague; Indonesian President Joko Widodo; Malaysia’s King Abdul Halim; India’s Prime Minister Narendra Modi; Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe; South Korea’s President Park Geun-hye and Australian Prime Minister Tony Abbott.
The US will be represented by former President Bill Clinton and former Secretary of State Henry Kissinger, while China has sent Vice-President Li Yuanchao.

heading: There is a dark side that has not yet been fully exposed:...
content:
Making a statement on corruption, Minister of Power and Energy Patali Champika Ranawaka says that there still remains a dark side that has not yet fully been exposed.
He made this statement during the 2015 annual sessions of the Institute of Town Planners, Sri Lanka under the theme Planning Sri Lanka’s National Space beyond the 100 day programme.
Minister Patali Champika Ranawaka said that there is a dark side that has not yet been fully exposed. Just as he mentioned elsewhere out of many corrupt deals, scandals and misappropriations that has happened within the last few years, specially the last five years, were masterminded by a few corrupt professionals and technocrats.
He added:
 They have made use of the opportunities, came along with these massive development projects, side by side with the corrupt politicians to accumulate wealth in their accounts. All those instances, the professionals rather than directing their knowledge and skills for the betterment of the country and its people, have employed their intellectual capacities, some of them actually, to rob, exploit and under hand dealings of public funds.

heading: Priyantha Sirisena’s last rites to be held on Monday

Priyantha Sirisena who was hospitalised with serious injuries which he sustained during an assault, died early Saturday morning.
He was forty-three-years-old and a father of three at the time of his death.
Priyantha Sirisena who was born on December 12,1972 was a past student of the Laksha Uyana Junior School in Polonnaruwa, Udupila High School in Gampaha, Galahitiyaawa Central College in Gampaha and Thopawewa High School in Polonnaruwa.

heading: Nigeria votes in presidential poll
content:
Nigerians are going to the polls to elect a president, with incumbent Goodluck Jonathan facing a strong challenge from Muhammadu Buhari.
It is said to be the most closely fought election since independence.
The election was delayed by six weeks to allow the army to recapture territory from militant Islamist group Boko Haram.
The two main presidential candidates have pledged to prevent violence during the election and its aftermath.
Despite reports of delays in some areas, election body spokesman Kayode Idowu told the AFP news agency that polling stations have opened and that “accreditation has started”.
Voters need to register first using biometric cards with their fingerprints before they can cast their vote later.
President Jonathan himself needed more than 20 minutes to register in his home village of Otuoke, although his spokesman says his accreditation is now complete.
Gen Buhari registered in his hometown Daura, praised the accreditation system.
 
 
Source:BBC

heading: Foreign Affairs DM speaks of Port City and SL’s for...
content:

heading: UPDATE: Industry and Commerce Ministry denies allegations...
content:
A Sathosa warehouse in Kelaniya was sealed after raw rice suspected to be unsuitable for consumption was found in storage.
Biyagama public health inspectors who raided the storage facility following a tip-off, said they found 10,700 metric tonnes of imported raw rice.
They noted that some of the rice had already been distributed but that samples of the rice in storage were taken to determine if it met safety standards.
A report in this regard is expected to be presented to a court magistrate.
UPDATE:
A communique issued by the Ministry of Industry and Commerce states that reports on the discovered 10,700 metric tonnes of rice which are unfit for consumption, are false and misleading.
The communique notes that two tonnes of rice had been stored separately at the storage facility and that this stock had been earmarked for disposal.
The statement reads that the stocks should have been disposed of following the survey, adding that it had been stored as the Board of Survey has not been appointed.

heading: ICC announces team of the ICC Cricket World Cup 2015
content:
The International Cricket Council (ICC) today announced the team of the ICC Cricket World Cup 2015 with Brendon McCullum as its captain.
McCullum was chosen as the captain following his aggressive, innovative and inspirational leadership during the 44-day tournament that was the cornerstone of his team’s progression to the final where it lost to Australia by seven wickets.
In doing so, McCullum also scored 328 runs in nine matches with four half-centuries at a strike-rate of 188.50.
The team was chosen by a select group of experts* who were given the task of picking a balanced side on the basis of performances in the tournament. Statistics were used but were not the sole basis for selections.
In addition to McCullum, the side includes four New Zealanders – Corey Anderson, Trent Boult, Martin Guptill, Daniel Vettori – three Australians in Glenn Maxwell, Steven Smith and Mitchell Starc, two South Africans, AB de Villiers and Morne Morkel, with Sri Lanka’s Kumar Sangakkara as wicketkeeper-batsman.
Zimbabwe’s Brendan Taylor, who finished with 433 runs in six matches, was named as the 12th man.
Team of the ICC Cricket World Cup 2015 in batting order:
Brendon McCullum (New Zealand (captain)
Martin Guptill (New Zealand)
Kumar Sangakkara (Sri Lanka) (wicketkeeper)
Steven Smith (Australia)
AB de Villiers (South Africa)
Glenn Maxwell (Australia)
Corey Anderson (New Zealand)
Daniel Vettori (New Zealand)
Mitchell Starc (Australia)
Trent Boult (New Zealand)
Morne Morkel (South Africa)
Brendan Taylor (Zimbabwe) (12th man)
ICC General Manager – Cricket, Geoff Allardice, chairman of the panel, said: “The panel had an extremely difficult choice of selecting a 12-member squad at the back of an outstanding tournament, highlighted by some eye-catching individual performances including two double-centuries, 38 centuries, two hat-tricks and 28 four-wicket hauls.
“There were a number of other players that were discussed as possible selections in the team. These included batsmen Mahmudullah (Bangladesh) and Shaiman Anwar (UAE), fast bowlers Umesh Yadav, Mohammed Shami (both India), Wahab Riaz (Pakistan) and spinners Imran Tahir (South Africa) and R.Ashwin (India).
“But there were so many brilliant individual performances during the tournament that it was not possible to fit them into the team. The panel eventually came up with this side, which, in their view, was the most balanced outfit that is capable of beating any side on any given day.”
Source: ICC

heading: Air Canada plane skids off runway during landing
content:
Officials said that an Air Canada jet came off the runway during its landing early Sunday at an airport in the eastern city of Halifax.
A spokesman for Halifax Stanfield International Airport in Nova Scotia, where the plane landed said ”It was a hard landing, and the aircraft left the runway,”
No major injuries have been reported from the incident, and all of those on board were able to get off the plane. But Air Canada said in a statement that 23 people had been taken to the hospital for observation and treatment of non-life-threatening injuries.
The aircraft, an Airbus A320, was damaged, Spurway said, without giving further details. “It is off the runway now,” he said.
Air Canada Flight 624 left Toronto late Saturday for Halifax. Air Canada said the passenger list indicates the plane had 133 passengers and five crew members on board.
Heavy snow was reported at the time of the landing, but Spurway said it was unclear if that had played a role in the accident.
Air Canada said it would cooperate fully with authorities’ investigation into what happened.
-CNN

heading: Diplomatic talks underway to evacuate SL expatriates in Y...
content:
Inquiries made by News1st have revealed that diplomatic talks are still underway to secure the evacuation of Sri Lankan expatriates trapped in the Yemeni Capital Sanaa, amid heightening tensions in the country.
A joint force led by Saudi Arabia, carried out air strikes for a fourth continuous day on Sunday March 29, against Iran backed Shia Houthi rebels in Yemen.
Foreign media reports say that the airstrikes have targeted Houthi positions and military infrastructure in and around the cities of Aden and Sanaa.
Reports indicates that at least 120 Sri Lankans are in the capital Sanaa and surrounding areas. News1st made inquiries from the Foreign Employment Bureau, regarding steps that have been taken to evacuate Sri Lankan nationals from Yemen.
Deputy General Manager of Foreign Employment Bureau Mangala Randeniya said that all preparations have been made to relocate all Sri Lankans working in Yemen, to Saudi Arabia, unharmed and are engaging in the task of rescuing them in coordination with the Embassy in Oman and the Yemeni authorities.
Although News 1st made several attempts to contact officials at the Sri Lankan Embassy in Oman to make further inquiries, our attempts were not successful.
We also contacted the Sri Lankan Embassy in Riyad, Saudi Arabia.
Head of Chancery in Riyadh U.L. Nihaz noted that Oman has not informed them. Speaking further he added:
It cannot happen without us knowing either. We are also looking into the situation. We too are waiting for instructions. Oman hasn’t said anything. We need to look into it too.
Inquiries revealed that there is no diplomatic process underway to evacuate the Sri Lankan workers in Yemen.
As of this evening however, the stance of the Foreign Employment Bureau had changed.
Deputy General Manager of Foreign Employment Bureau Mangala Randeniya said that Acting Sri Lankan Ambassador in Oman has held talks with the Pakistani and Indian Embassies in Oman. He went onto note that discussions revealed that since all of these people are secure, there is no immediate need to evacuate them to another country.

heading: Thousands line to bid farewell to late Lee Kuan Yew
content:
Tens of thousands lined the streets of Singapore on Sunday, to bid farewell to the city state’s founding father, Lee Kuan Yew.
Lee  Kuan Yew passed away at the age of 91, following a prolonged illness. The state funeral was attended by world leaders including Japan’s Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, India’s Narendra Modi, Indonesia’s Joko Widodo and former U.S. President Bill Clinton.
Local media reports one million people have visited tribute sites this week. More than half a million people specifically 12% of Singaporean citizens  visited the Parliament House to see Lee’s coffin, while at least 850,000 others went to community sites to pay tribute.
Lee’s body is to be cremated in a private family ceremony later today.
The massive turnout at the state funeral, at tribute sites throughout the week and along the route of the funeral procession, was truly a reflection of the Singaporean people’s adoration, for a man who lived and breathed Singapore, throughout his lifetime..

heading: High-tech bracelet changes design with the touch of a button
content:
Hungarian start-up Liber 8 has introduced a piece of wearable jewellery that needs no charging, the company says, and allows the user to change its patterns thanks to an integrated e-ink display.
International relations manager of Liber8 Reka Kovacs said. “This is the bracelet of the future. It’s an e-ink, high fashion, high-tech bracelet with a full e-ink display and you can change the pattern on it whenever you want to. So imagine having one luxury bracelet with literally endless designs on its surface,”
Liber 8 put their bracelet called ‘Tago Arc’ up for crowd funding in February and within 24 hours they had already reached their target of 40,000 USD.
By the end of their campaign, which finished last week, they surpassed their funding goal by collecting 104,000 USD.
The team at LIBER8 believe they have created the next level of customisable jewellery, while coming up with a new philosophy for the future development of similar products.
Kovacs said. “You go in the app, you choose your design that you want to display on the bracelet, you click on it, you buy it or you download it depending on the setting of that particular design, then you touch your smart phone to your bracelet, you click picture transfer and with the picture energy gets transferred on to the bracelet as well, you wait ten seconds and you have the new design on the bracelet,”
The ‘Tago Arc’ design uses an e-ink display like the ones used in e-book readers and an NFC chip which changes the design on the bracelet.
The wearable industry has been developing over the past five to ten years to produce consumer electronics such as smart watches and glasses.
The company is working to build a community of designers and artists who will create patterns for the app.
Customers can also take their own images, upload and modify them in the app to fit into the black and white bracelet image.
LIBER8 are also looking for large design houses to make patterns to match the new season’s looks.
-Reuters

content:

The accident occurred when a bowser plying from Ratnapura to Colombo collided head-on with a three-wheeler transporting a group returning from a pilgrimage from Adam’s Peak.

heading: Sebastian Vettel wins F1’s Malaysia Grand Prix
content:
Four-time Formula 1 World Champion Sebastian Vettel of Ferrari claimed his first win since Brazil 2013 after winning the Malaysian Grand Prix on Sunday, March 29.
The race win also ended a 34-race drought for Ferrari which extends back to the Spanish GP in May 2013.
Vettel, who started the race 2nd on the grid after qualifying just 0.074 seconds behind the defending World Champion Lewis Hamilton, Finished the race a massive 10.2 seconds ahead of the Brit. The two Ferrari drivers proved Ferrari’s improvement over the winter by finishing the race 1st and 4th. Fellow Ferrari driver Kimi Raikkonen drove an impressive race as the Finn climbed from 11th position to finish an impressive 4th.
The defending Formula 1 world championship team’s drivers Lewis Hamilton, who is also the defending drivers champion, and Nico Rosberg finished 2nd and 3rd between the two Ferraris.
The two Williams-Martini cars driven by Valtteri Bottas and Felipe Massa finished 5th and 6th, continuing the team’s consistency.
Formula 1 moves to China for the next race which will take place on the 12th of April at 11:30 AM Sri Lankan Time

heading: Cricket World Cup: Australian bowlers rip through Kiwis b...
content:
The Final encounter of the ICC Cricket World Cup got underway at the MCG, Australia as the two powerhouses New-Zealand and Australia began their battle to claim bragging rights as Cricket World Champions.
New Zealand won the toss and elected to bat first, bringing the two hard-hitting Kiwi openers Brendon McCullum and Martin Guptill to the crease, looking to set a challenging target for the kangaroos but, Mitchell Starc had other plans for New Zealand.
Starc, who opened the bowling struck in the very first over, taking the wicket of the kiwi danger-man McCullum who had scored naught.
New Zealand was left one wicket down for just one run as Kane Williamson walked in to occupy Martin Guptill. However Martin Guptill was bowled by Glenn Maxwell. Guptill had done all the hardwork to withstand the early storm and reach the stage where Clarke introduced his fifth bowler in Maxwell and then threw it away in just two balls.
A fourth wicket partnership of 111 between Grant Elliot and Ross Taylor led New Zealand post 183 losing all their battalions sparing five overs.
Thanks to the efforts of Grant Elliot who went onto score 83,  Ross Taylor chipped in with 40 runs.
James Faulkner and Mitchell Johnson picked three wickets a piece.

However, the Indian government has taken measures to evacuate Indian Nationals living in Sanaa and Aden due to the crisis.
The Ministry of Foreign affairs noted that measures have been taken to evacuate Sri Lankan’s living in Yemen with the assistance of India and talks are being held on a diplomatic level.

heading: PM ‘broke promises’ when he appointed Arjuna ...

 ”Now they have gone into a national government with the thieves.”

heading: Views expressed on position of Opposition Leader (Watch V...

He added that over 58 MPs have already placed their signatures expressing their consent.
”

The Opposition Leader speaking on the leadership of the party said:
After Maithripala Sirisena was appointed President he took over the party. He did not voluntarily take over the party. In fact the party was handed over to him by Mahinda Rajapaksa. So, as seniors of the SLFP tell me what Anura Priyadarshana Yapa and I  are entrusted with? Are we supposed to go behind people or to remain safeguarding the party?
Speaking further ,he noted that they are here to safeguard the party, not to gain political leverage or to hold positions.

heading: Anjelina Jolie makes first post-surgery appearance
content:
Angelina Jolie has made her first public appearance since revealing she had undergone a preventative surgery to remove her ovaries.
She took the stage on Saturday at the 28th Annual Kids’ Choice Awards and delivered a message of hope to anyone who’s ever felt out of place.
She was named Favourite Villain for her role as the title character in dark fantasy film Maleficent. The 39 year old,  was accompanied by two of her children,  Shiloh and Zahara.
Jolie said “When I was little, like Maleficent, I was told that I was different. And I felt out of place, too loud, too full of fire, never good at sitting still, never good at fitting in,”
“And, then one day I realised something, something that I hope you all realize: Different is good,” she said, prompting enthusiastic screams from the young crowd.
It came less than a week after the Oscar-winning actress revealed she had her ovaries and fallopian tubes removed after doctors detected possible signs of cancer.
She also had a double mastectomy in 2013 after it was found she had the faulty BRCA1 gene, which sharply increased the chance of her developing breast and ovarian cancer.
Jolie’s mother, Marcheline Bertrand, died in 2007 after fighting cancer for 10 years. Her grandmother and aunt also died of cancer.

heading: Central PC Chairman Mahinda Abeykoon sentenced (Watch Video)
content:
Chairman of the Central Provincial Council Mahinda Abeykoon, was sentenced to two and a half years  rigorous imprisonment on Monday, March 30.
Abeykoon has been found guilty of violating election laws.
The sentence was handed down by Kandy High Court Judge Menaka Wijeysundera, on Monday March 30.  A case had been filed against Mahinda Abeykoon and fourteen others, in connection with violating election laws, in the Hewaheta area in Galaha, in the run up to the 2001 General Election.
Eleven of the defendants had been acquitted during the course of the trial. When the case was taken up on Monday, Mahinda Abeykoon was found guilty on three charges.
He will serve six months in prison for the first charge and one year in prison each, for the second and third charges.

When I went to meet the Director of the Commission to see what was happening, I was told that she was at a meeting.  I was here for half an hour. You all know that I arrived here at 10 in the morning. She didn’t even answer the phone. Now what is this? We are unable to contact the Director General of the Bribery Commission to raise questions on the status of the written request…

heading: Former President speaks of his security detail (Watch Video)
content:
Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa visited the Abayarama Temple again on Wednesday March 25, where he met with several local government representatives from the Sabaragamuwa Province.
The former president commented  on his security detail to the media who were also present at the Abayarama Temple.
Former president Mahinda Rajapaksa said that Sarath Fonseka has 110 in his security detail adding that the people whom he has, do not even have vehicles.
Meanwhile, Cabinet Spokesperson Minister Rajitha Senaratne on Tuesday, March 24 said:
”His Secretary Lalith Weeratunge signed to obtain it. He has two high security cars, one dummy car, one Defender, one Toyota land cruiser and one cab. Altogether there are six vehicles. He has two bullet proof cars. The former lady president was given only one but it was returned saying that it cannot be used. ”
He further noted that in addition to that, 108 army personnel and 105 police personnel have been appointed for his security detail adding that two double cabs, eight motorbikes, two buses and one Land cruiser were granted for their transportation.

heading: Opposing 19th Amendment is opposition to people’s m...
content:
The Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) says that opposing the 19th Amendment is an opposition to the people’s mandate.
These views were expressed by the Party’s General Secretary Tilvin Silva at a media briefing convened on Wednesday March 25.
General Secretary of JVP Tilvin Silva speaking on the Executive Presidency noted:
If the Executive Presidency cannot be abolished completely, we must still agree to a change in the autocratic nature of the Executive Presidency by reducing a large portion of its powers. ”
He went on to note that it is the objective of Nimal Siripala’s clan to continue with their majority in parliament for as long as possible, even if it means avoiding the passing of the 19th Amendment or at least delaying it and through that avoiding or delaying the upcoming election.
Speaking further, he said that the 19th Amendment and the Electoral System must be reformed together.

heading: Tense situation erupts between Narahenpita residents and ...
content:
A tense situation broke out between a group of police officers and locals in the Udyanapura area in Narahenpita as the police officers attempted to raid an illicit liquor brewery in the area.
The locals in the area charged that the police officers had begun attacking them, making false allegations.
A resident who was a victim of the brawl stated that a group who arrived in a three-wheeler handcuffed him and attempted to take him away. The victim  alleged that when he tried to negotiate with the group, telling them that he had not done anything wrong but was beaten with the handcuffs as the cuffs did not clip.
The victim further alleged that his friends were also attacked after he ran away, following the beating.
Another  resident recalls the incident stating that she saw everyone in a brawl as her son came in running to see if she was alright. She further alleged that her son too was beaten and taken away. She stated that they had told the police not  to hit anyone and to “just take them away.”
Yet another resident in the area alleged that the police officers were drunk and said that they beat up two women and the men with poles. She noted that the woman was bleeding and that the police officer fell off his bike.
When News1st contacted Police Media Spokesperson ASP Ruwan Gunasekara over the incident, he stated that the local residents had obstructed the duties of the police officers while arresting a suspect in the area, and had attempted to free the suspect.
ASP Ruwan Gunasekara further stated that three police officers, a lady sub-inspector and two police constables, were injured in the incident and added that the two police constables are currently receiving in-house treatment at the National Hospital. He further noted that one of the suspects who obstructed the duties has been arrested and will be produced before court on Wednesday.

heading: President Sirisena leaves for China
content:
President Maithripala Sirisena left for China on Wednesday afternoon, commencing a four-day state visit, on the invitation of the President of China, Xi Jinping.
The President, along with many other world leaders, is scheduled to attend the Boao Forum for Asia Annual Conference 2015, which will be held in Boao, in the Hainan Province from March 26 – 29 where President Sirisena will address the summit on March 28.
President Sirisena is to speak to the international community on Sri Lanka’s development and economic programme.
According to the President’s Media Division, during his stay in China, President Maithripala Sirisena is expected to hold bilateral discussions with his Chinese counterpart as well as the Prime Minister and senior government officials.
President Sirisena is to also hold bilateral discussions with the Executive Committee Chairman of the China National People’s Congress.

heading: Germanwings plane crash: Flight recorders severely damaged
content:
Rescuers resumed the difficult task of searching for the 150 victims of a deadly plane crash in the French Alps, as the search for clues was dealt a setback Wednesday afternoon.
Investigators said they had so far been unable to retrieve any data from the plane’s cockpit voice recorder, and the inquiry has been hampered further, an official said, by the discovery that the second black box, which was found on Wednesday, was severely damaged, and its memory card dislodged and missing.
The plane, an Airbus A320 operated by the budget carrier Germanwings, was en route to Düsseldorf, Germany, from Barcelona, Spain, on Tuesday morning when it lost altitude rapidly and slammed into the French Alps, killing all 144 passengers and six crew members on board.
Footage of the site showed a remote and craggy landscape dominated by imposing mountains. The French newspaper Le Monde noted that the impact of the crash was so severe that the plane had been reduced to “confetti,” creating a serious challenge for search teams and investigators.
He said that the plane’s cockpit voice recorder, the first black box that was recovered, was damaged, but that investigators expected to be able to recover the conversations stored on its memory chip.
But as of early afternoon, a senior official involved in the investigation said analysts had so far been unsuccessful in retrieving any information from the cockpit voice recorder.
The official said that workers on the scene had found the casing of the second black box, the flight data recorder, which investigators had hoped would provide significant information about the flight, including its speed, altitude and direction. But he said that the crash had severely damaged the box, and that the vital memory chip inside it had been dislodged.
-New York Times

heading: Three petitions filed against 19th Amendment to Constitut...
content:
Three petitions have been filed at the Supreme court against the 19th Amendment to the Constitution.
The petition filed by Attorney at law, Gomin Dayasiri, Udhaya Prabath Gammanpila and L.P.I. Perera points out that the 19th Amendment to the constitution should be approved through a referendum.
The petition filed by Councillor Udhaya Gammanpila notes that he does not agree with the clause from 1 to 54 of the 19th Amendment to the  onstitution and adds that the 19th Amendment to the Constitution should not only be approved by a 2/3 majority in parliament but also be passed following a referendum.
The petition filed by Aattorney-at-Law Gomin Dayasiri says the 70th, 33rd and the 14th clauses contravenes the constitution.
He had requested the court to announce that the powers vested in the president has been decreased in the 19th amendment.
He has also requested court to issue a verdict removing powers to  dissolve parliament in one year after the parliamentary elections.

heading: Colombo premises to be inspected as Dengue Eradication Ca...
content:
Seventeen 17,000 premises are to be inspected within the Colombo Municipality in line with the countrywide Dengue Eradication Campaign due to commence on Thursday.
Chief Medical Officer at the Colombo Municipal Council, Dr. Ruwan Wijemuni, stated that there is a high likelihood for an increase in the spread of Dengue with the onset of the forthcoming monsoon season.
Meanwhile, the Ministry of Health says that so far, 11,095 dengue patients have been reported this year. The Epidemiology Unit at the Health Ministry noted that the majority of patients, 3,221 to be precise, were from the Colombo District while 1,424 patients were reported from the Gampaha District and 538 from the Kalutara District
The Epidemiology Unit noted that there has been an increase in Dengue Patients was seen from the districts of Ratnapura, Ampara and Kilinochchi.

heading: China’s interest rates are lower than SL bond rates...
content:
The Deputy Director General of the Global Corporation Department of the China Development Bank says that China’s interest rates are lower than bond rates of Sri Lanka.
He made this statement subsequent to a question raised in relation to allegations made with regard to China providing loans at high interest rates for several development projects in Sri Lanka.
Deputy Director General of Global Corporation Department of the China Development Bank Jin Tao also says that they started issuing loans to Sri Lanka in 2009. He also noted that the loans issued by the Sri Lanka government are based on the agreement risk and as per the need of the Sri Lankan government.
He noted that the decisions strictly follows the loan procedures of Sri Lanka including the approval of the cabinet and the Attorney General.

heading: Investigations continue into shooting of Rathgama PS Chai...
content:
Police say investigations are continuing to arrest the suspects in connection to the murder of the Chairman of the Rathgama PS Manoj Pushpakumara Mendis.
Police Media Spokesperson ASP Ruwan Gunasekara stated that a special investigation has begun into the incident, headed by an Assistant Superintendent of Police.
Police added that a name of a gunman was mentioned in the statement recorded by an individual who was injured in the incident. Police stated that they are carrying out investigations to arrest this suspect.
The shooting which took place at around 11.45 p.m. on Monday in a hotel in Hikkaduwa. Initial investigations revealed that four suspects were involved in the shooting.

heading: Former minister Basil Rajapaksa to be brought back to the...
content:
Police says that Former Minister Basil Rajapaksa is to be brought back to the country to obtain a statement over alleged irregularities said to have taken place at the Divi Neguma Department.
Police Media Spokesperson ASP Ruwan Gunasekera said that the Financial Fraud Division has sought the advice of the Attorney General in this regard. The ASP added that a statement is to be recorded from Basil Rajapaksa over the use of Divi Neguma Department funds for the recently concluded Presidential election, irregularities in providing the Divi Neguma Gativity and several other matters.
In his statement to the police, the former director general had stated that funds from the department were provided under the instructions of the former minister. The police noted that as a result of this issue, a statement will be obtained from Basil Rajapaksa.

heading: President Sirisena to visit China (UPDATE)
content:
China prepares for the arrival of President Maithripala Sirisena at the Beijing International Airport as President Sirisena prepares to leave the Island Wednesday afternoon for an official visit to China. Presidential Media Director Dharmasri Bandara Ekanayake stated that the President will remain in China for three days.
President Sirisena is scheduled to hold bilateral discussions with the Chinese premier Li Keqiang later this afternoon following his arrival. The official welcoming ceremony for President Sirisena is due to be held tomorrow under the auspices of the Chinese President Xi Jinping.
President Sirisena is also due to preside at a lunch hosted by the President of China on Thursday. According to the Presidential Media unit, Foreign Minister Mangala Samaraweera, Ministers Champika Ranawaka, Ravi Karunanayake, Rajitha Senaratne, Jagath Pushpakumara and Wijeydasa Rajapakshe and Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka are also due to arrive in China.

heading: Full-face helmets to be banned from April
content:
The ban on full face helmets is to be implemented on April 2.
Police Media Spokesperson ASP Ruwan Gunasekara made this announcement at a media briefing held in Colombo on Wednesday.
The ban was initially supposed to come in to to effect on   March 21.  However, the prohibition order was suspended in order to gain public opinion on the matter.
ASP Ruwan Gunasekara added that the suspension will be annulled on  April 2, thereby prohibiting the use of full-face helmets.

heading: UDA Secretary stated Colombo – Fort land lawfully b...
content:
Addressing the press briefing on cabinet decisions on Tuesday, Minister 
Dr. Rajitha Senaratne expressed views on the Colombo - Fort land issue. 

Cabinet Spokesman, Minister Dr. Rajitha Senaratne said that the land was
 already allocated for the Sirasa Media Organisation.
Speaking on the issue, Dr. Rajitha Senaratne said:
During the previous regime, especially the former Secretary to the Ministry of 
Defence, forcefully claimed the ownership of the said land and carried out 
urban development activities on it, as a means of expressing anger over the 
Sirasa Media Organisation that reported unbiased news, 
and brought to light the former regime's shortcomings and corruption.
He went on to note that new government came into power to free the clutches
 of such individuals who forcibly take the law into their hands. 

He added that Sirasa was the only media institution that stood for them when
 they were powerless. Power was disrupted across the country when they were 
to arrive at the premises of this media institution. 
We will respect their legal rights and give them what they legally own. 
I contacted the UDA Secretary in this regard. He informed me of the 
decisions made in this regard and also stated that the land lawfully belongs to 
Sirasa.

heading: Special Police Division to be set up to combat crimes aga...
content:
NCPA Chairperson Natasha Balendra says that they have taken steps to obtain permission from the IGP to set up a special police division  within the the Police Headquarters to combat crimes against children
The chairperson added that measures will be taken to appoint an official with experience who has a rank above Senior Superintendent of Police to head the new division on issues concerning children.
NCPA Chairperson Natasha Balendra also added that they intend to request from the IGP to set up a unit in every police station to deal with matters concerning children. A request was made to not transfer the officials working at this unit.

heading: Cabinet puts forward recommendations to repair houses dam...
content:
A recommendation has been put forth by the cabinet to repair 600 houses which were damaged due to the Uma Oya Project.

At the media briefing on cabinet decisions on Tuesday, Cabinet Spokesperson, Minister Rajitha Senaratne elaborated on the matter:

There has been physical progress of 47 percent on that project. Since 2014 there has been a water leak. Sixteen secondary project activities 
were suspended on the 16th of February: except for the crucial activities in order to prevent the water leak. Six hundred houses which were damaged 
will be rebuilt while the National Water Supply and Drainage Board is looking into providing a proper supply of drinking water to the families 
who were affected. 

Minister Rajitha Senaratne went on to say that President Maithripala Sirisena presented the cabinet paper to take action with the consideration of
 the suggestions made by the Central Environment Authority and its panel. A sub committee of ministers was appointed on Monday consisting of the 
subject minister and ministers who represent the area.
