heading: JVP to decide on participation under National Executive C...
content:
The Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna or JVP says that the party will arrive at a 
final decision regarding their participation under the National Executive 
Council based on discussions due to be held with civil organisations that 
came together to defeat the regime of Mahinda Rajapaksa.

Issuing a communique, the party said that they are drawing fine conclusions 
based on the recent political line ups and developments. The communique 
also added that the National Executive Council meeting scheduled for Tuesday,
 had been cancelled without prior notice.
The JVP states that this an associated government formed under the guise of a 
national government.
The Communique goes onto state that the party can no longer expect good 
governance as promised during the run upto the election, because now the 
government consists of individuals charged with corruption from the former 
regime.

It added that the JVP, being a political party that focussed mainly on the latest 
political developments had intended to bring up this situation at the 
National Executive Council Meeting that was initially scheduled for Tuesday,
 but later cancelled. 
The Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna says that the National Executive Council 
must convene immediately to take up the issue.

heading: This is an amendment intended solely to make the PM the H...
content:
The JHU has labelled the draft 19th Amendment to the constitution as a 
constitutional conspiracy to claim power, undertaken by a group who 
cannot win elections.

JHU General Secretary, Patali Champika Ranawaka elaborated that this 
document does not state anywhere that the executive presidency
would be abolished. But they have left out the important part on enacting 
electoral reforms and have only included the proposals on the
executive presidency and the independent commissions. 

He added that on Monday, the Prime Minister presented another amendment.
This states that the President is the Head of State only and the Head of the
 Executive and Commander in Chief of the Armed Forces.
It states clearly that he is not the Head of Government. 
The clause citing the Prime Minister as the Head of the Cabinet has also 
not been removed. In addition to that, Section 4 states that the President
 must always act on the advise of the Prime Minister. 

He went on to note that this is an amendment intended solely to make the 
Prime Minister the Head of Government.  It is an attempt to come into power through a constitutional conspiracy by 
people who cannot win power through elections.

heading: Views expressed over 19th Amendment to Constitution
content:
The draft 19th Amendment to the Constitution, was presented to Parliament 
by Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe on Tuesday. 

Views were expressed in Parliament  regarding the 19th Amendment to the 
Constitution. 

Opposition Leader, Nimal Siripala de Silva stated:

A 2/3rd majority is needed in order to pass this bill. What we can see is that 
there are contradictions in certain clauses. 
We are uncertain if this bill will be approved through a public referendum if not
 this responsibility should be shouldered by the government 
because you stated that you would draft this bill in a manner that would gain 
support from the people.  Just like you presented this bill as an emergency bill 
please fulfill President Maithripala Sirisena's promise on electoral reforms. 
An electoral system that is a combination of the first past the post system and 
a mixed electoral system. Please table this in Parliament immediately. 
The Sri Lanka Freedom Party has come to a firm decision that this bill will be 
passed together.

Prime Minister, Ranil Wickremesinghe said:

We have agreed that this bill will be passed through a public referendum. 
The Attorney General has informed us that certain amendments need to be 
clearly defined and should be presented in court. 
Certain amendments need to be presented in court prior to tabling it in 
parliament. However, what we can see is that several petitions 
have been put forth in court. Therefore, the final decision with regard to the 
amendments will rest in the hands of the Supreme Court.

Venerable Athuraliye Rathana Thero said:

We presented this bill in a manner that does not hinder a public referendum. 
We faced numerous challenges which included the powers of the Executive 
Presidency which posed a threat to democracy, and had control of the judiciary
 as well as included dissolving parliament in a arbitrary manner. 
But  the powers of the President and the Executive Presidency have been 
clearly defined in the 8th paragraph.
The cabinet even made a decision yesterday. You cannot arrive at decisions
 in such a manner. There needs be discussions between our parties. 
Amendments to the constitution have been presented without such discussions.

heading: Today is World Autism Awareness Day
content:
Today is World Autism Awareness Day.
The Ministry of Health says that one out of 93 children in Sri Lanka are diagnosed with autism.
Honorary Consultant Pediatrician and Senior Lecturer at the Faculty of Medicine of the University of Kelaniya, Dr. Samanmali Sumanasena said that there has been a growth in autism among children over the past decade.
Dr. Sumanasena added that by subjecting children who have been diagnosed with autism for treatment, its effects could be minimised to a greater extent.

heading: Govt cannot delay taking action against “treasury b...
content:
MP Vasudeva Nanayakkara, the Leader of the Democratic Left Front, says that the Prime Minister as the appointing authority, must take responsibility for the alleged treasury bond scam, and make a statement himself.
Speaking to News1st, Nanayakkara reiterated that the government cannot delay taking action on the matter, as the country’s reputation is at stake.
MP Vasudeva Nanayakkara went onto note that the Prime Minister who hand- picked Arjuna Mahendran has to take responsibility and cannot just brush over it and say that this is a technical matter.
Speaking further, he added that he would go to the extent of saying that PM must make a statement about this and his relationship to Arjuna Mahendran, to hand-pick him to be the Governor of the Central Bank.

heading: Even elephant calves were not allowed to roam free : Pres...
content:
President Maithripala Sirisena says that even elephant calves were not given the opportunity to live freely during the previous regime.
The President expressed these views during an event held to mark the 47th anniversary of the State Timber Coorporation.
During the event individuals who had completed 30 years of service at the State Timber Coorporation and other retired officers were felicitated.
The President stated that during the previous regime deforestation received state patronage, adding that ruthless businessman ripped apart the natural resources in the Sri Lanka’s rain-forest.
He went onto note that forest in the north and eastern provinces escaped this for sometime due to the war.

heading: Ranil Wickremesinghe to become first PM to address AMCHAM...
content:
The meeting titled The Prime Minister Speaks where Ranil Wickeremesinghe will be participating is due to take place in order to address the American Chamber of Commerce in Sri Lanka at a luncheon meeting on April 8.
The Prime Minister’s address will be followed by an interactive discussion with the participants on key issues of concern to the business community.
It is also the first time a Prime Minister will be addressing the AmCham Membership in its twenty-two-year history.
Executive Director AmCham Radika Obeyesekere stated that the business community seeks clarity on the government’s vision for both private and public sector in the country as a whole.
The Executive Director stated:
The Business Chambers such as ourselves, need a clear mandate in relation to the message we take out to the international community looking to invest in Sri Lanka which will benefit in attracting foreign direct investments.

heading: Justice Minister Rajapakshe says 219 persons remain in re...
content:
Justice Minister Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe revealed on Wednesday that 219 people arrested under the Prevention of Terrorism Act, are still being held in remand custody.
The Minister was speaking at a discussion held at the Ministry on Wednesday, on the day to day life of the people of the North and East.
The discussion was held at the Justice Ministry, with the participation of multi-faith religious leaders.
The Justice Ministry says that the discussion was organised on the instructions of the President, in order to promote reconciliation and reach suitable solutions to problems faced by people living in the North and East.
Minister Rajapakshe, speaking at the event, said that there are 60 inmates in remand custody into whom investigations are ongoing.  He stated that there are 25 who are being held on detention orders under the Prevention of Terrorism Act, into whom investigation are ongoing.
He added that there are 54 who have been charged, produced in court, sentenced and are now serving out their sentences.
Meanwhile, Ven. Maduluwawe Sobitha Thera said that he believes that these allegations are levelled from all over Sri Lanka and are not unique to the North and East.
Archbishop of Colombo, His Eminence Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith speaking at the discussion said:
 I wish to know, at this instance, whether there is no system in place to expedite their trials via court and issue verdicts? Isn’t there a violation of human rights taking place for each day that they are detained?
Speaking further, the  Minister of Justice noted that a special high court has been established in Anuradhapura to expedite the trials and that is already happening. The Minister added that there are also cases which have been filed at the Colombo High Court.

heading: Dani Alves shows skills beyond football
content:
Barcelona right back Dani Alves chose to sing and showcase his singing skills as he broke in to song in Portuguese when reporters questioned him regarding his future in FC barcelona and his possible move to French club Paris-Saint Germain.
The defender has been a key player in the Barcelona defence since his move to the club in 2008 from Sevilla FC. The current squad is currently brimming with exceptional players like forwards Messi, Neymar and the more recent addition Luis Suarez and is backed with the likes of Xavi and Iniesta in the midfield and with veteran Barcelona players like Mascherano and Jordi Alba bringing up the rear.
The team currently stands at No 1 in the Liga BBVA and is scheduled to play RC Celta De Vigo on April 5.

heading: UPFA MPs express concern over functioning of Bribery Comm...
content:
A group of UPFA MPs lodged a complaint with the Chairman of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption on Wednesday, April 1, against the Director General of the Commission.
UPFA MP Mohan Priyadarshana stated that the current Director of the Bribery Commission was appointed on the Prime Minister’s recommendation. It was stated that she obtained payment for legal advice from the Telecommunications Regulatory Commission while working at the Attorney General’s Department – which cannot be done because, according to a establishment code, it is stated that a civil servant cannot obtain money this way
UPFA MP Manusha Nanayakkara stated that they suspect whether the inquiries are taking place correctly as certain complaints are investigated immediately: while others take years.

heading: Supreme Court commences hearing of petitions on draft 19t...
content:
The hearing of petitions filed over the draft 19th Amendment to the Constitution, commenced at the Supreme Court on Wednesday.
The petitions are being taken up before a three-member bench, comprising of Chief Justice K. Sripavan and Justice Chandra Ekanayake and Priyasad Depp.
Eighteen petitions have been filed at the Supreme Court over the 19th Amendment.The hearing commenced at 10 o’clock on Wednesday morning and continued until 5:30 p.m.
A section of the petitioners argue that the 19th Amendment to the Constitution can be adopted with a two-thirds majority in Parliament.
Another group of petitioners argue that passage of the amendment would also require a public referendum. The matter will also be considered by the Supreme Court on Thursday.
JVP Councillor of Western PC K.D. Lal Kantha said:
What is needed is to take the limitless powers vested in the President and transfer them to the Parliament headed by the Prime Minister and the Cabinet, without holding a referendum. If we hold a referendum, it will take a long time. It is clear that if it takes that long, this will not be done.
Senior Lawyer Gomin Dayasri added that the argument that he presented is that a referendum must be held.
Meanwhile, the stances of various political parties on the proposed 19th Amendment, were highlighted at several media briefings held on Wednesday.
SLFP General Secretary MP Anura Priyadarshana Yapa said that they are in favour of several key points and at the same time they are unable to agree with some of the contents.
JHU National Organiser Nishantha Sri Warnasinghe noted that they cannot allow constitutional conspiracies. He went onto note that any amendment that is introduced should be introduced with consensus.

heading: World’s oldest person dies
content:
The world’s oldest living person, Japan’s Misao Okawa, has died from heart failure at the age of 117.
She died in a nursing home in Osaka, the city she was born in 5 March 1898. She is survived by three children, four grandchildren and six great-grandchildren.
Ms Okawa was recognised in 2013 as the world’s oldest living person, as well as the world’s oldest living woman, by Guinness World Records.
While celebrating her birthday earlier this month, Ms Okawa said that 117 years did not seem such a long time.
She also said the key to a long life was getting at least eight hours of sleep a night and eating sushi – her favourite food.
She said she particularly enjoyed mackerel on vinegar-steamed rice.Her birthday celebration was shown on national television in Japan.
Born to a kimono-maker, Mrs Okawa married her husband Yukio in 1919. They lived in Kobe where he ran a business.
When he died in 1931. she moved back to Osaka. She lived across three centuries, seeing four emperors of Japan, six British monarchs, and 20 US presidents.
-BBC

heading: Moneragala parents up in arms over removal of teachers of...
content:
A protest was staged in Kumbukkana, Moneragala on Wednesday, April 1, over  the termination of a group of volunteer teachers who were serving at the Welassa Subhagya College.
This school has been established for children with visual, hearing impairments and those with special needs. There are 55 students present in the school and education is provided until O/L.
As four volunteer teachers were removed from this school, parents rallied demanding that they be  reinstated. During the demonstration, former minister Sumedha G. Jayasena arrived at the scene.

heading: Real Madrid look to cement their defence with Porto’...
content:
Real Madrid on  March 31, confirmed their purchase of Porto’s Right back, Danillo Luiz da Silva. The promising young Brazillian was added to squad of Real Madrid for 23 million pounds.
The 23-year-old, will be expected to perform in par with a a star studded team which boasts names like Cristiano Ronaldo, Gareth Bale and Karim Benzema and will be an  interesting addition to look for in in the teams future.
Real Madrid currently stands behind their rivals FC Barcelona in the Liga BBVA.

heading: President Sirisena presented with auspicious times for th...
content:
The tradition of presenting the auspicious times for the Sinhala Tamil New Year to the President, took place at the President’s House on Wednesday.
In keeping with the ritual of drummers going from house to house to proclaim the auspicious times, a drummer, presented the list of auspicious times to President Maithripala Sirisena on Wednesday, April 1, which includes the time of the dawn of the new year, the punya kalaya, the time to commence the cooking of food, lighting the stove and cooking food.
The list includes the time of the dawn of the New Year, the punya kalaya, the time to commence the cooking of food, lighting the stove and consuming food.

heading: Min. Rajitha Senaratne reveals a Rs 30bn discrepancy in r...
content:
Minister Rajitha Senaratne revealed at a media briefing on Wednesday that the Colombo Outer Ring Road Project, is being undertaken at Rs. 30 billion less than the initial estimate.
Cabinet Spokesperson Minister Dr. Rajitha Senaratne stated that reducing the cost by 30 billion on a single project conveys  the  scale of corruption that prevailed in Sri Lanka.
Dr. Senaratne said:
 They have increased the amount in large quantities for kilometre by kilometre which I pointed out in the run-up to the election. Nowhere in the world have they spent so much per kilometer.

heading: Australia announces Ashes squad
content:
The Champions of the recent ICC World Cup, Australia announced its 17 man squad for their next major encounter,The Ashes.
The team will consist of two new addittions Adam Voges and Fawad Ahamed whose performences in the domestic circuit sparked the attention of the national selectors. The first encounter between Australia and England in the five match test series will take place on the 8th of July In Cardiff, England.
The side will be captained by Michael Clarke, who retired from the one-day form of the game following their successful performance in the world cup.
Australia squad in full: Michael Clarke (c), Steve Smith, (vc) Fawad Ahmed, Brad Haddin (wk), Josh Hazlewood, Ryan Harris, Mitchell Johnson, Nathan Lyon, Mitchell Marsh, Shaun Marsh, Peter Nevill (wk), Chris Rogers, Peter Siddle, Mitchell Starc, Adam Voges, David Warner, Shane Watson.

heading: Relatives urge Government to ensure safe return of migran...
content:
Relatives of Sri Lankan migrant workers in Yemen have urged the Sri Lankan Government to set up a proper procedure to repatriate their loved ones.
International media reported today that Houti rebels have intensified their attack on the Capital of Sanna which continues for a 7th consecutive day on Wednesday (April 1).
The relatives and families of the migrant workers who met with the Minister of Foreign Affairs, Managala Samaraweera had requested him to assure the safety of the Sri Lankan workers.
International media reports that both India and China have taken steps to repatriate their migrant workers.

heading: ICC President Mustafa Kamal resigns from post
content:
International Cricket Council President, Mustafa Kamal has resigned from his post on Wednesday April 1,
Kamal announced his resignation, accusing colleagues within the games global body of acting ”Unlawfully”.
Even since Bangladesh lost to India in the 2015 World Cup quarterfinals, Kamal was upset after a controversial no-ball incident that allowed Rohit Sharma to score a decisive century. He openly alleged the ICC of favouring with India.
Following that Kamal was told he wouldn’t be able to give out the World Cup trophy. He protested that the decision went against his right as ICC president but to no avail. As per convention, it is the president who hands over the trophy to the winning captain.

heading: Train operations between Colombo and Talaimannar resume a...
content:
Train operations between Talaimannar and Colombo will commence on Wednesday after a span of twenty five years.
The Department of Railways noted that the first train will leave the Fort Railway Station at 7:40 p.m.
Meanwhile. a new train operation from Homagama to Fort, Colombo on the Kelaniweli railway line commenced at 7.20 on Wednesday morning.

heading: Court bans former FM Bogollagama from travelling overseas
content:
Former Foreign Minister Rohitha Bogollagama’s foreign travel has been suspended.
Colombo Chief Magistrate Gihan Pilapitiya imposed the ban after taking into consideration the petition filed by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption.
The petition presented by the Bribery Commission was filed under Section 70 of the Bribery Act.
The petition states that Bogollagama had encouraged the former Director General of the Board of Investment, Lakshman R. Watawala, to disburse 376 thousand Rs. 191 and Rs. 1,170,444 , in violation of the Treasury Circular, to participate in a Trade Expo in Britain.
Chief Magistrate Gihan Pilapitiya ordered that the former Minister be released on bail set at Rs.50,000 and two sureties of one million rupees each.
Former Minister Rohitha Bogollagama stated that he has the utmost respect towards the court and as senior lawyer he must uphold that respect. The court will serve justice

heading: FCID records statement from Dr P.B. Jayasundera
content:
A statement was recorded on Tuesday from Former Secretary to the Ministry of Finance, Dr. P.B. Jayasundera, over the Hedging Deal.
Police Media Spokesperson ASP Ruwan Gunasekera said that Dr. Jayasundera was summoned to the Financial Crimes Investigation Division of the police to record a statement.
Meanwhile,  Former Minister Johnston Fernando was summoned to the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption on Tuesday.
UPFA MP Johnston Fernando said:
… I was notified to appear here. So I am here. There is a confidentiality here. I cannot reveal details to you. This has become a media charade. There needs to be discretion. Ministers and MPs are summoned over bribes. If there is complete discretion there is no issue. They are slinging mud at their opponents …”
Meanwhile,  the Convenor of the Anti-Corruption Front Nishantha Sri Warnasinghe visited the Financial Crimes Investigation Division to provide a statement over a complaint filed by the Front on fraud and corruption.

heading: Investigations launched into clash between university stu...
content:
Investigations have been launched in to the clash that erupted between university students and the police.
According to Police Media Spokesperson ASP Ruwan Gunasekara, investigations will be carried out under the supervision of the Superintendent of Police in charge of the area.
Director of the National Hospital , Dr. Anil Jasingha noted that ten students were admitted to the accident ward subsequent to Tuesday’s clash between university students and the police.
Meanwhile, seven police officers have been injured following the pelting of stones by the university students. According to the Police Media Spokesperson, an injured police officer is currently receiving treatment at the National Hospital while the remaining  officers are receiving treatment at the Police Hospital.
The university students commenced their protest march on Tuesday from the premises of the University of Jayawardenapura citing a number of grievances, including the curtailing of education.
Police fired tear gas and water cannons at the students as the protesters attempted to approach Temple Trees in Colpetty through High Level Road.

heading: CEA studying public opinion on Sampur’s environment...
content:
The Central Environmental Authority says that they have not yet granted approval for the Environmental Impact Assessment report on the Sampur Power Plant .
Chairman of the authority, Lal Dharmasiri, stated that the authority has received a considerable amount of public views and a majority of it is in Tamil language. He added that the authority is looking in to those views at the moment and said that they authority will be considering  their opinions before granting approval for the EIA report.
The chairman noted that the accepting of the public opinions came to a close on March 31

heading: JHU files Supreme Court petition against 19th Amendment t...
content:
The Jathika Hela Urumaya (JHU) filed a petition with the Supreme Court on Tuesday against the 19th Amendment to the Constitution.
JHU Western Provincial Councillor Nishantha Sri Warnasinghe says that they do not need a president with arbitrary executive powers or the executive powers.
He went onto note that they even do not need a prime minister with arbitrary executive powers.
Speaking further, he said that some are attempting to pick-pocket the people’s votes.
Meanwhile,  the JVP filed a petition with the Supreme Court in favour of the 19th Amendment to the Constitutiion.
The petitions filed with the Supreme Court over the 19th Amendment to the Constitution will be taken up on Wednesday.
The petitions will be taken up before a bench comprising of Chief Justice K. Sripavan and Justice Chandra Ekanayake and Priyasad Depp.

heading: Several injured in Borella lorry collision (Video)
Min. Ranawaka speaks of a ‘powerful nation’ a...
content:
A ten-year road map indicating the development in the field of power and energy was launched on Tuesday.
The aim of this programme is to create a country that is able to cater to its own energy needs.
The launch was held under the auspices of Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe in Colombo.
Subject minister Patali Champika Ranawaka noted that the road map highlights eight points, adding that electricity would be provided for all people across the country, by the end of this year.
Minister of Power and Energy Patali Champika Ranawaka says that they aim to create a nation that is rich in energy and become self- sufficient and also to extract oil and gas resources from our seas as well as be able to produce wind energy in order to become a powerful nation.
Speaking further, the minister said that they aim to make Sri Lanka a super power and give the benefits of this new industrial revolution to the people.
Subsequent, to Minister Patali Champika Ranawaka’s address Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe launched a website on the ten-year road map of the development in the energy sector at this occasion.
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe speaking at the launch said that they wish to work together, with all parties in Parliament, in order to initiate this.

heading: Supreme Court rejects FR petition filed by Duminda Nagamu...
content:
The Supreme Court on Tuesday, rejected a Fundamental Rights Petition which cited Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, as a respondent.
The petition was filed by Duminda Nagamuwa of the Frontline Socialist Party.
In his petition, Duminda Nawagamuwa, who contested the 2015 Presidential Election under the Frontline Socialist Party, stated that the deploying of army personnel to several areas in the country under the directives of the former president Rajapaksa during the run up to the Presidential Election had violated his fundamental Rights and those of the public.
The Attorney at-Law,  representing the petitioner in court stated that such an act, does not keep with the security requirements of the country.
The counsel, speaking in court, requested that the former head of state be questioned in this regard as he was a candidate at the said election.
He went on to state that though the military personnel were summoned every month, there was no requirement to summon the personnel after the conclusion of the civil war.
President’s Counsel Palitha Fernando who appeared on behalf of Mahinda Rajapaksa stated in court that the President holds the right to make decisions on behalf of the country’s security.
Fernando pointed out that the current president too, has issued this gazette notice.
The Supreme Court bench comprising of Chief Justice K. Sripavan and Justices Sisira de Abrew and Anil Gunaratne rejected the petition after considering facts presented in court.

heading: Former monitoring MP Sajin Vass released on bail (Watch v...
content:
Former Monitoring MP Sajin de Vass Gunawardena was released on bail on Tuesday
Court made this order when MP Sajin de Vass Gunawardena appeared before the Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court today over a case filed by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption.
Court also ordered that the passport of the Former Monitoring MP be impounded.
The case was taken up before Colombo Chief Magistrate Gihan Pilapitiya. Court ordered a Rs.50,000  cash bail and two sureties of one million rupees each on Sajin de Vass Gunawardena.

heading: Deepika Padukone’s ” My Choice” goes vi...
content:
The video titled My Choice and featured by Bollywood star Deepika Padukone has gone viral in social media, accruing more than three million views in the three days since it was posted online by fashion magazine Vogue.
My Choice directed by Homi Adajania of Cocktail and Finding Fanny fame, features the 29-year-old Deepika Padukone as a brand ambassador for women’s empowerment.
The video which lasts a little less than three minutes, features Deepika calling for a change in the “caged” mindset of men about women.
The video asks men to stop judging women for their choices of clothes, profession, life, or anything else.
This video features 99 Mumbai women from different fields of life asserting their right to make political, sexual and economic choices.
Ms Padukone says that “My choice, to love a man, or a woman, or both. Remember, you are my choice. I am not your privilege,”

heading: Public Administration Ministry warns of strict legal acti...
content:
The Ministry of Public Administration, Provincial Councils, Local Government and Democratic Governance says that if allegations of breach of election laws which were allegedly have carried out by state officials were proved to be true, strict legal measures will be taken against them.
Secretary of the Ministry of of Public Administration, Provincial Councils, Local Government and Democratic Governance, Jinasiri Dadallage stated that immediate investigations will be carried out into close to 2000 complaints with regard to violation of election laws by state officials.
He noted that a seven-member committee has been appointed by the Cabinet to carry out investigations into these complaints. The secretary added that the committee will focus more on the complaints related the use of state vehicles during the election period and the misuse of public funds for election campaigns.

heading: Kolkata Knight Riders likely to pull out of IPL 8 if Nari...
content:
The eighth edition of the Indian Premier League is still nine days away but the first controversy has already hit the tournament. Defending champions Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) are set to get into a legal battle with the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) regarding the participation of their star spinner Sunil Narine, according to a report.
West Indian Narine was banned for his suspect action during the 2014 Champions League Twenty20 and was barred from playing in the final against Chennai Super Kings. KKR lost the game by eight wickets. Following that, Narine was dropped from West Indies’ tour of India in November and then, the mystery spinner himself opted out of the 2015 World Cup.
Narine went back to the nets to rework on his action and was cleared by the ICC after his bio-mechanical test in Loughborough.
However, BCCI refused to accept the ICC report and has insisted that the off-spinner from Trinidad has to undergo another round of testing at the Sri Ramachandra University in Chennai.
KKR, as expected, is now contemplating legal action against BCCI, according to a report in the Mumbai Mirror. The Kolkata franchise officials have pointed out that since Narine was cleared by the ICC, he shouldn’t be forced to undergo another one. The team has also alleged the BCCI of ‘targeting’ their star spinner.
KKR also said that Narine was not hauled up for ‘chucking’ during the IPL but his action was suddenly found illegal in the CLT20.
The BCCI president’s office has confirmed that a decision would be taken regarding this matter in the next few days. KKR chief executive officer Venky Mysore, however, has denied the reports about KKR speaking to the BCCI chief.
Source: NDTV

heading: Opposition leader Muhammadu Buhari ahead in Nigerian elec...
content:
With partial results reported in the Nigerian presidential election, opposition leader Muhammadu Buhari appears to be leading the incumbent President Goodluck Jonathan.
According to a tweet from Attahiru Jega, the chairman of the electoral commission, counting of votes stopped just before midnight on Monday and was postponed until Tuesday morning. Jega will be the one to announce final results.
 
“Distinguished ladies/gentlemen we’ve taken all the states, we’ll call it a day and convene tomorrow at 10am. Goodnight to you all”- Jega
— INEC Nigeria (@inecnigeria) March 30, 2015

 
With just over half of Nigeria’s states declared, Gen Buhari’s All Progressives Congress (APC) was reported to be ahead by some two million votes.
However more results are yet to be announced on Tuesday.
The candidate with the most votes will only avoid a run-off if they gain at least 25% of the votes in two-thirds of Nigeria’s 36 states.
However, if there is no outright winner, the law says a run-off election must be held within seven days and Victory in a run-off election will be assesed by simple majority.
A victory for Mr Buhari would make President Jonathan the first incumbent in Nigeria to lose his re-election bid.

heading: Update: Three arrests made over Nadarajah Raviraj killing...
content:
Three persons have been arrested over the murder of  TNA Parliamentarian Nadarajah Raviraj.
Police Media Spokesperson ASP Ruwan Gunasekera speaking to News1st said that one of the arrested is a member of the Sri Lanka Navy.
He went on to say that the two other suspects are former Sri Lanka Navy personnel. The Police Media Spokesperson said that the suspects are being interrogated based on detention orders.
TNA MP Nadaraja Raviraj, was shot to death on Matha Road in Narahenpita on the 10th of November 2006.
Nadaraja Raviraj who commenced his professional life as a lawyer in 1988, served as Deputy Mayor and Mayor of Jaffna, between 1998 and 2001.
He served as an MP from the Tamil National Alliance between 2001 and 2006.
Three suspects have been arrested 9 years after the 2006 assassination of Nadaraja Raviraj.
The case pertaining to the abduction of several school students in which accusations have been leveled at Navy personnel, is to be taken up in court once again on Wednesday.
The premise for this case, is a petition filed at the Court of Appeal in 2011, over the abduction of a group of school students in Dehiwela on the 17th of August 2008.

heading: WP Road Passenger Authority workers launch strike (Watch ...
content:
Workers of the Western Province Road Passenger Authority have launched a strike. Secretary of Joint Union, Rasika Kalhana Tilekaratne, said that the strike was commenced against the slashing of  wages and bonus allowance.
He added that the monthly race notes for April, the validation of road permits, transferring ownership of buses and route test services will all come to a standstill owing to the workers strike.
The chairman of the Western Province Road Passenger Authority, cAmila Ranmandala, commenting on the issue, said that there are several practical issues in providing these allowances with the wage.
He added that the Minister of Finance, the Prime Minister and the President have been notified of the situation.

heading: Breaking: Eastern PC Deputy Chairman removed through No-C...
content:
Deputy Chairman of the Eastern Provincial Council M.S. Zuhair has been removed through a No Confidence Motion.
The No Confidence motion was presented to the council by A.L. Thavam of the Sri Lanka Muslim Congress. The motion passed with 19 votes for and 11 votes against.
TNA Eastern Provincial Councillor Indrakumar Prasanna has been appointed the new deputy chairman of the provincial council.

heading: Five individuals arrested in Mundalama over poaching
content:
Five individuals engaged in poaching using illegal fishing equipment have been arrested off the Mundalama – Sinpadu coast.
The Police Media Unit stated that the suspects were arrested during a raid carried out near the Sinpadu coast. The suspects are at the ages of 19, 23, 27, 34 and 48.
The Police Media Unit added that the suspects will be produced before the Puttalam magistrate on Tuesday.

heading: SLBFE takes steps to evacuate Sri Lankans in Yemen
content:
The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment Bureau states that steps are being taken to evacuate the Sri Lankans in Yemen.
Deputy General Manager of the Bureau Mangala Randeniya said that there are 49 Sri Lankans in Yemen at the moment.
He added that the Bureau will be seeking assistance from India to evacuate the Sri Lankans

heading: Dr Amunugama stresses on value of educational qualificati...
content:
Minister of Higher Education Dr. Sarath Amunugama says that employment opportunities will be created in the future by producing individuals with educational qualifications.
The minister made this observation at the function organised in view of the Joint celebration of Indian Technical and Economic Cooperation Day and International Students Day.
The event was organised by the Indian High Commission.

heading: Police commence investigations into Pasyala death(Watch V...
content: Police have commenced investigations into the death of an individual, following a clash that broke out in the Pasyala area in Nittambuwa.

heading: President pays homage to Nikaweratiya Raja Maha Viharaya
content: President Maithripala Sirisena, paid homage to the Nikaweratiya  Budhumathawa Raja Maha Viharaya and engaged in religious observances at the temple, in line with Bak Poya Day today.

heading: A daily loss of Rs.100m due to CBSL bond issue – po...
content:
Speaking at a seminar titled “The second bomb attack that rocked the Central Bank”, Parliamentarian Bandula Gunawardena said that the Government is incurring a daily loss of 100 Million rupees due to the issuance of treasury bonds that had led to much controversy.
The Parliamentarian stated that the government was put in a position to deal with a 41 billion loss due to interest during the four weeks from 27th of February to the 31st of March. The MP noted that as a result of this, people have been forced to bear an additional cost which amounts to 100 million rupees on a daily basis.
Bandula Gunawardene also noted that the single digit interest rate which was maintained before, has now changed to double digits. The MP went on to say that this is not going to prevail for a short period but for 30 years.
Parliamentarian G.L. Peiris too shared his views at the seminar which highlighted the controversial bond issue. He stated that money was taken from the Bank of Ceylon three days prior to this incident. The MP also questioned on how this damage will be rectified.

heading: Hettipola , Ratnapura Mahawa residents killed in Akarawat...
content:
Three people were killed and another injured in a motor accident that occurred in the Akarawatte Junction along the Hettipola – Kuliyapitiya road.
According to our correspondent the accident took place at around 10.40 on Tuesday night.
The accident had occurred when a three wheeler and a bus collided.
The victims who died  were three persons travelling in the three-wheeler who are residents of Hettipola , Ratnapura and Mahawa.
The other injured individual was admitted to the Kuliyapitiya Base Hospital and was later transferred to the Kurunegala Teaching Hospital.
The driver of the bus has been taken unto custody.

heading: Iran nuclear talks: ‘Framework’ deal agreed
content:
An outline agreement on the future shape of Iran’s nuclear programme has been reached after marathon talks with six major powers in Switzerland.
Under the deal, Iran will reduce its uranium enrichment capacity in exchange for phased sanctions relief.
US President Barack Obama said a “historic understanding” had been reached with Iran. The world powers and Iran now aim to draft a comprehensive nuclear accord by 30 June.
The framework agreement was announced by the European Union and Iran after eight days of negotiations in Lausanne.
The talks between the so-called P5+1 – the US, UK, France, China and Russia plus Germany – and Iran at Lausanne’s Beau-Rivage Palace hotel continued beyond the original self-imposed deadline of 31 March.
After a missed deadline and two exhausting nights of negotiations Iran and the six world powers presented their framework as a major achievement.
The EU’s top diplomat, Federica Mogherini, read out a joint statement outlining the main points, including a reduction in the number of Iran’s operating centrifuges, changes to its nuclear facilities, and a promise to lift sanctions if these steps are verified.
This is an unwritten understanding, not a formal agreement, and it lays the foundation for very tough negotiations on the details.
But for now its architects are celebrating a hard won, potentially historic, achievement.
Source: BBC

heading: President holds discussions over resettlement and Mannar ...
content:
A special discussion was held under the auspices of President Maithripala Sirisena in order to give back lands, and resettle displaced persons in the Mannar district.
The main aim of the discussion, which was held on Thursday at the Presidential Secretariat, was the identification of lands.
At the discussion, President Maithripala Sirisena advised officials to utilise lands that are under the divisional secretariats for this purpose.
The President also advised officials that they needed to maintain and protect the forest cover while allocating lands.
While nearly 1734 families from the Mannar district have requested for lands, 902 families are said to have qualified to receive such lands.
A number of officials including Minister Rishard Bathiyutheen, and the district secretary of the Mannar district were present at the meeting.

heading: Breaking: SLC Chairman of Selectors Sanath Jayasuriya ten...
content:
Sanath Jayasuriya has tendered his resignation from the post of Chairman of Selectors for Sri Lanka Cricket.
The letter of resignation has thereby been officially handed over to the Minister of Sports Navin Dissanayake. Jayasuriya says, in his letter, that he has given his best to serve in the capacity of Chairman of Selectors during his tenure.
He also noted that he will always be available if Sri Lanka Cricket needs him, to serve the country in the future.

heading: Death row running out of room?
content:
The Prisons Department says that there are 1,050 persons who are on death row in in the country’s prisons.
Speaking to News1st, Prisons Commissioner General Rohana Pushpakumara said that at present there were also 9,700 prison inmates who had been accused of being involved in drug-related offences.
This was 34% of the total number of inmates in prison. It was further noted that 22% of total prison inmates were those accused of drug-related offences.
The Prisons Commissioner General said that the prisons in the country were becoming congested as a result.

heading: Police launch investigations into Wellawatte deaths(Watch...
content:
Police investigations have been launched into the suspicious death of an Indian couple inside a hotel in Wellawatte.
Police Media Spokeperson ASP Ruwan Gunesekera said that the cause of the death will be traced, following the magisterial inquest into the bodies which is scheduled to be conducted today, Friday, April 3.
He also added that an investigation will also get underway to find out whether the couple had consumed poison prior to their death.
Police say that the bodies of the couple were recovered following a tip-off received on Thursday night. The couple had arrived in the country on March 27.

heading: Today is Bak Full Moon Poya Day
content:
Today marks Bak Full Moon Poya Day, which also marks Lord Buddha’s second visit to Sri Lanka.
Bak Full Moon Poya Day is of great significance to Buddhist devotees in Sri Lanka. Five years after attaining enlightenment, the Lord Buddha undertook his second visit to Sri Lanka.
The purpose of this visit was to advise the kings Chulodara and Mahodara who were preparing to wage war.
The history of the Sasana notes that the Lord Buddha, on reaching Nagadeepa, preached to the Naga tribe and made them understand the value of peace and averting war between the two kings.

heading: Indian couple found dead in Wellawatte hotel
content:
The remains of an Indian couple was discovered from within a hotel in the Wellawatte area.
According to Police media spokesperson ASP Ruwan Gunasekera the remains of the couple, who had died under suspicious circumstances, was discovered based on a tip off.
The deceased have been identified as a 36 year old woman and a 37 year old man.

heading: Update: Court order stalls ban on full face helmets
content:
Court issued an interim injunction today, postponing the enforcing of the rule banning the use of full face helmets.
While the ban came into effect on Thursday morning, the interim injunction order was issued in the afternoon.
The Court of Appeal issued the interim injunction today, after considering two public interest petitions filed by two civilians.
Lawyers representing the petitioners submitted to court that using full face helmets gives added safety to motorcyclists.
They point out that the ban that has been enforced via a police circular issued in March in line with the gazette notice issued in 1991 pertaining to the headgear of motorcyclists, is illegal and unjust.
The ban on full face helmets was enforced this morning. The Police noted that rather than strictly enforcing the law from the outset, they would implement the rule in stages.
Accordingly, while motorcyclists were stopped and advised, no fine or punishment was imposed.
 Police claim that the ban was enforced, due to the spreading virus of theft carried out by thieves wearing full face helmets and the rise in accidents due to reduced visibility.
National Committee Member of Voice of the Youth, Asitha Niroshan expressed these views: 
Professor Dickman Otte of Hanoi University in Germany conducted a study in 2010 along with other experts. The full-face helmet was designed on a scientific basis. They have marked the damage that occurs when motorcyclists meet with accidents. 19.7 percent of the damage is on the base of the neck. Almost 35 percent is to the face. Just because a bank was robbed or a finance company was robbed, they cannot make such cheap arguments to ban something that has been designed by scientists to ensure the safety of motorcyclists.

heading: There is no project under the name Northern Expressway: E...
content:
Eran Wickramaratne, the Deputy Minister of Highways says that there is no project under the name of the Northern Expressway.
The Deputy Minister made this statement while addressing the media on Thursday. At this media briefing , details were provided on investment projects and road development projects.
Speaking at the Media briefing , Kabir Hasheem , the Minister of Higher Education, Highways and Investment Promotion said that the allegations made that the current government’s development projects have been suspended are baseless.
Minister of Higher Education, Highways and Investment Promotion, Kabir Hasheem said that in the name of development of the country, a large amount of money was used for the construction of roads and expressways. There was financial fraud. There were commissions being given. Racketeers were also involved. Work was provided to family and friends without following any proper tender procedure.
Journalists also raised questions on whether the Northern Expressway and the Colombo Outer Circular Highway will be suspended.
Deputy Minister of Highways, Eran Wickramaratne replied that there was something called the Northern Expressway. That is no more. There is only the Central Expressway.
He added that the Colombo Outer Circular Highway and the Central Expressway will be linked together. The expenditures are being cut down, the section of the Central Expressway will be open for public bidding. This link will be based on the construction of the roads and public transport. The highway concept does not mean the construction of roads.
Meanwhile, in the recent past, views were expressed over alleged irregularities said to have taken place in the issuing of treasury bonds to raise funds for expressway projects.
Meanwhile, the Voice against Corruption Movement says that in a backdrop where an investigation in still pending, the statements being made by ministers are confusing.

heading: UNP ministers are trying to take away privileges given by...
content:
MP Tissa Karaliyadda says that he was made to resign from his position as a deputy minister, due to pressure exerted by a UNP Minister.
He expressed these views in an exclusive interview with News 1st.
He said that instead of good governance, what they are doing is suppressing their opponents and that this is immensely harmful to President Maithripala Sirisena’s concept of good governance.
He further noted that two ministers threatened him when he was in the government. He also stated that some UNP Ministers are trying to take away the privileges given by the President.
Views were also expressed by government representatives on the resignation of MP Tissa Karaliyadda.
Minister of Social Services and Welfare, P. Harrison said that even without the minister the government is moving forward without any problem and that it doesn’t mean that the others are going to make the same decision.
Deputy Minister of Mass Media, Shantha Bandara stated that these ministerial Portfolios have not been discussed before appointment. Some people might raise questions that the deputy ministerial portfolios given to certain people might be inadequate given that they have served in the cabinet for years.

heading: Mahinda Rajapaksa is trying to make a ‘political de...
content:
At a meeting held on Wednesday, Western Provincial Councillor S.M Marikkar criticised the activities of Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa.
He said that a huge business campaign was carried out by a group to make Mahinda Rajapaksa the Prime Minister.
Provincial Councillor Marikkar said:
Mahinda Rajapaksa is a good political dealer. Now he is trying to create a political deal and stop the investigations against the individuals in their group, he is trying to show the power of the public through a deal with Maithripala Sirisena.
He added that he is sure that Mahinda Rajapaksa will not contest in the next general elections.

heading: Body of translator who served at SL Embassy in Russian Fe...
content:
The body of the translator who died last year while serving at the Sri Lankan Embassy in the Russian Federation was exhumed on Thursday
The order to exhume the body was made after the Attanagalla District Magistrate took into consideration claims made by the relatives that the death had taken place under suspicious circumstances.
Noel Ranaweera , a translator attached to the Sri Lankan Mission in Russia died on  June 11, last year.
The then Sri Lankan Ambassador to Russia had informed the relatives that the death was the result of a road accident.
Noel Ranaweera had flown to Russia to serve in a hotel owned by Udayanga Weeratunga and had later been employed as a Translator attached to the Sri Lankan Mission in Russia.
The body of the late Noel Ranaweera was brought to the country on the 15th of June 15 last year. His funeral took place  at the Welikadamulla cemetery in Attanagalla on June 18.
However, his family later claimed that the circumstances of his death were suspicious. The mother of the late Noel Ranaweera on Wednesday had informed the Attanagalla District Magistrate Court of their suspicions.
Lawyer representing the aggrieved party, Attorney-at-Law Upali Kumarasinghe said that the brother of the deceased, Dayaratne Ranaweera had visited the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. He has spoken to an Assistant Director there. They had shown the death certificate. The death certificate has been signed by the then Ambassador to Russia Udayanga Weeratunga and also bears the seal. However, there is no number in the death certificate.
Attorney-at-Law Upali Kumarasinghe further noted that the Assistant Director of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs had claimed that such certificates are not issued by the Ministry.
He added:
The deceased (had earlier)  met his relatives, family and siblings and shown them a bank book claiming to have a large amount of wealth. He had noted that Udayanga Weeratunga has sold an aircraft and deposited the money in a bank account under the name of the deceased. He had said that he was engaged in a large scale business and he does not need to remain there and had also noted that he would be returning to Sri Lanka. I informed court that this individual had been murdered over the money that was amassed. Or he was murdered over another reason .
Taking these facts in to account , the District Magistrate for Attanagalla ordered on Thursday morning for the body to be exhumed.
The body was exhumed in the presence of the Acting Magistrate of Attanagalla, S.Abeygunawardena. Later the body was taken to the Ragama Teaching Hospital for further examinations.
Meanwhile, recently the Ministry of Foreign Affairs revealed that it has received a complaint citing that Former Sri Lankan Ambassador to Russia Udayanga Weeratunga had engaged in weapons deals with Ukrainian separatists.
When inquired by News 1st, the Ministry said that the investigation is ongoing.
The Ministry added that however, after the election of the new government no complaint over the death of Noel Ranaweera has been received.

heading: A national crime committed at the Sugathadasa Stadium ...
content:
On several prior occasions, Sports 1st revealed to the country through the segment Bitter Truth, that the synthetic track at the Sugathadasa stadium, was sub-standard and that there were major irregularities in the contract.
Confirming what was reported by Sports 1st, Sports Minister, Navin Dissanayake revealed on Thursday that a national crime had been committed at the Sugathadasa Stadium.
The Sugathadasa Stadium established in 1983, is considered Sri Lanka’s oldest and best international sports centre.
The synthetic track was laid anew at the stadium in 2011.
Although the track reportedly received an international certification, since there were discolourations, tears and bubbles in the synthetic track within a short period of it being laid, various allegations were levelled at the contractor and the technical committee.
While The Bitter Truth, revealed this information to the authorities, they opted to follow a code of lethargy.
The truth of what Sports 1st reported was further affirmed today.
Following an inspection tour of the stadium, the Sports Minister expressed these views:
You can see that even our children are running on this track and are in harms way. We will take steps to lay a new track. What has been done here is a national crime. Such thievery has never happened in the history of sport in Sri Lanka. We will also take action against the company which did this. It will take a long time to get allocations from the government for this. Instead we will take steps to obtain a loan from Bank of Ceylon to lay a new track and repay it with the income of this institution in 10 to 15 years.

heading: Govt is acting contradictory to the hopes of Executive Co...
content:
JVP Leader Anura Kumara Dissanayake claims that the government is acting contradictory to the hopes of the Executive Council.
The JVP Leader made this statement when addressing a media briefing held on Thursday. He said:
They have been unable to reach an agreement on the 19th Amendment to the constitution even within the government. A situation has also been created where people are not receiving the benefits of concessions granted through the budget.
He stated that a massive fraud is taking place at the Central Bank
He said
 People who were defeated on the 8th of January, distasteful people who acted in a biased and insulting fashion, have been made stakeholders in the government. So,  the government is acting contradictory to the hopes of the Executive Council. This is completely in violation of the people’s mandate granted on the 8th of January.
Dissanayake added that the Executive Council reached several decisions today.He stated that among the decisions, was that maximum support would be rendered to ensure passage of the 19th Amendment on   April 10, in line with the determination of the Supreme Court.
The Executive Council has also decided to introduced the Right of Information Bill to Parliament on April  7 , 8,  9  and 10  and to convene the Consultative Committee on Mass Media to discuss it.
Dissanayake added that the Executive Council had also decided to appoint a commission to prepare an electoral system which fairly represents the people’s choice.

heading: Trade to GDP ratio – not one that the country can b...
content:
Treasury Secretary, Dr. R.H.S. Samaratunge says Sri Lanka’s Trade to GDP ratio is not one that the country can be proud of.
He made this statement at a forum organised by the Ceylon Chamber of Commerce on the Customs 24 X 7 initiative. Secretary of Ministry of Finance, Dr. R.H.S. Samaratunge said that the external trade transactions are the key source of further growth and economic progress, socio – economic progress in this country. He stated that at present trade to GDP ratio is at around 40 percent, which is not anywhere which can appreciate or be proud of.
He added that the similar kind of small nations of our size may have a trade to GDP ratio in excess of 100 percent.
Also speaking at the event, Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake noted that the Customs 24 X 7 initiative would help speed up trans-shipment in Sri Lanka.
Minister of Finance, Ravi Karunanayake said that there is  nobody that has said that this is a wrong process, except for people who lived on the system which was a failure, and thinking that they were able to make something out of that.

heading: Petitions filed over 19th Amendment taken up again
content:
Petitions filed over the draft 19th Amendment to the constitution, were taken up once again at the Supreme Court on Thursday.
The petitions are being considered by a three-judge bench, comprising of Chief Justice K. Sripavan and Justices Chandra Ekanayake and Priyasad Depp.
While some of the petitioners argue, that passage of the amendment will require a public referendum, others submit that a two thirds majority in parliament, will suffice. Several factions made submissions to court on the matter today .
The court will reconvene on Monday, where the bench has allotted one hour for the Attorney General to make submissions.
The Supreme Court noted that they would present their determination to the President, as soon as possible.

heading: CAA apprehends 3000 errant traders; more raids as festive...
content:
With days before the dawn of the Sinhala and Tamil New Year season, the Consumer Affairs Authority has begun to carry out raids.
The CAA has apprehended nearly 3000 vendors who violated consumer laws. Acting Director of the CAA, Asela Bandara said that the authority would continue to carry out raids on vendors who violated consumer laws.
Meanwhile, the Department of Measurement Units, Standards and Services seized a stock of 25 scales that were in violation of the required standards. As a result,  the stock was confiscated.
Officer-in-Charge of the Special Raids Unit, Upul Bambarenda said that 18 traders were also nabbed during the raid. Several traders and vendors had fled during the raid, leaving behind the scales that were in violation.

heading: Mother of three goes missing in Kahawatta (Watch video)
content:
A mother of three has been reported missing in the Kotakethana area in Kahawatta.
Police stated that the woman dissappeared at around 1 a.m. She was reported to have been at her residence at the time.
Police added that her husband who arrived at the residence was not able to locate his wife and had notified the police.
According to investigations carried out by police, it has been revealed that the back door of the house was opened and a blood stain was seen in the kitchen area.
A search operation is currently being carried out by the police and the Special Task Force has been deployed to search for the missing woman.

heading: Transportation comes to a halt in the Bata Atha area
content:
Transportation was obstructed in the Bata – Atha area after a tree fell across the Kataragama – Matara road at 7.30 a.m. on Sunday, April 5.
A two-hour road block ensued as a result of this situation. Vehicles were not able to pass the area. The tree was removed as police and residents worked together to rectify the situation.

heading: Cloud computing is safer than conventional data centres?
content:
Connventional IT wisdom says that you’re safer and more secure when you control your own on-premises data center. Yet if you think about every major data breach over the last two years, whether Anthem, Sony, JPMorgan or Target, all involved on-premises data centers, not the cloud.
In fact, if a cloud service has proper controls, it could be safer than running your own data center. Amazon, Google, Sales force and Box to a company have much more at stake when it comes to security. A breach could prove devastating to their businesses.
That could be why it’s hard to come up with a major security involving a cloud provider. Other than the Jennifer Lawrence photo breach and the subsequent celebrity leaks, it’s hard to think of anything on the magnitude of those high-profile hacks involving the cloud. It could simply come down to a feeling of control. When you run your data center on-premises, you feel like you’re safer, but are you?
First of all, aside from a few exceptions, most companies simply don’t put the resources into security that a cloud company does.
Their business is not about security, at least not directly, and it’s usually not the first priority for a CEO looking at the bottom line. While a high profile hack is embarrassing and creates a lot of economic fall-out, the primary purpose of the business is about servicing customers.
Source: Mashable

heading: Armed suspect arrested for entering Moratuwa finance company
content:
A armed suspect who entered a finance company  has been taken into custody in the Moratuwa area. It is alleged that the suspect had threatened that jewellery and money be handed over to him.
The Police Media Spokesperson stated that, upon investigations carried on by the Mirihana Special Crimes Investigation Unit, the suspect has been taken into custody.
The police had found 20 ammunition for a T56 type-gun and 75 grammes of gold. The suspect, aged  40, is a resident from the Homagama area.
It is learnt that the suspect and two others have been taken into custody for allegedly robbing a finance company  in Moratuwa on March 17.

heading: Police to implement new traffic rules – Galle, Colo...
content:
Police state that steps have been taken to initiate “lane discipline” in Colombo, and five other main roads as a pilot project from April 6 – 10.  It is noted that  the move will begin from 7.30 a.m. on Monday.
Police Media Spokesperson ASP Ruwan Gunsekera stated that, under this rule, drivers will have to keep to their specific lane without being negligent and driving cutting lanes will be prohibited.
This move will come into action from Moratuwa to Galle – Modhara on the Galle road, Colpetty to Bambalapitiya on the Duplication road, Senanayake junction in Borella to Polduwa on the Sri Jayawardenapura road, Peliyagoda to Kiribathgoda on the Kandy road and Peliyagoda to Wattala on the Negombo road.
Police stated that this exercise is  an experiment but will look to implementing the rule in the future.The Police Media Spokesperson also said that the programme is expected to of reduce traffic congestion and road accidents.

heading: British MP loses party membership for making sponsored trips to Sri Lanka
content:
The UK’s Democratic Unionist Party has decided to suspend MP Ian Paisley from membership pending further investigation into his conduct.
 
Ian Paisley is now listed as an Independent MP on the British Parliament's website.
 
The former DUP MP was suspended from the House of Commons for 30 sitting days from September 4 following the major breach of parliamentary rules.
 
He was found to have failed to declare the holidays, that cost more than £ 50,000 and to have lobbied on behalf of the Sri Lanka government, who paid for those holidays.

heading: Health alert : Vavuniya Sathosa worker accidentally mixes urea with sugar (Photos)
content:
The Public Health Inspectors of Vavuniya Urban Council say that sugar stocks at the Sathosa outlet in Vavuniya have been adulterated with urea.
 
The PHIs said this might have had happened due to the negligence of the Sathosa staff.
 
A team of PHIs had carried out the inspection after a consumer had informed them of noticing a change in sugar he had bought from the outlet.
 
Thereafter, the PHIs had checked the sugar sacks and found out that one of the sacks was mixed with urea.
 
They urged the public not to use sugar bought from the Vavuniya Sathosa outlet and if they had consumed them already such people are advised to seek medical treatment as soon as possible.

heading: Hospital functions cripple due to GMOA strike
content:
Our correspondents say that functions at hospitals have been affected due to a one-day token strike launched by the Government Medical Officers' Association from this morning (Aug 03).
They have cited 10 reasons and the Free Trade Agreement with Singapore for their strike action.The GMOA media committee member, Dr. Prasad Colombage said that clinical and OPD services at all government hospitals are disrupted as a result of their strike.
Meanwhile, the medical specialists have also joined the work stoppage and they have even moved out of private practice to show their protest against the new Inland Revenue Act.

heading: Court of Appeal rejects Minister Bathiutheen’s affidavit
content:
The Court of Appeal has rejected an affidavit submitted by Minister Risath Bathiutheen asking to dismiss the case against him over Wilpattu deforestation.Accordingly, Court of Appeal President Justice Preethi Padman Surasena and Justice Arjuna Obeysekere ordered that the case be taken up for trial on 12th of November this year.
A contempt of court case was filed before the Court of Appeal recently by attorney-at-law, Nagananda Kodituwakku alleging that the Minister had misled the judiciary with regard to the controversial deforestation in Wilpattu.
The Minister also accused of promoting the illegal settlement in the Wilattikulam forest reserve of Wilpattu National Park.
In the case, the Minister had submitted an affidavit citing that the Muslim community had been living in that area before they were chased away by the LTTE in 1990.
However, there was no such settlement according to the Surveyor General’s report.
Attorney-at-law, Kodituwakku has argued in his petition, therefore, that the Minister Bathiutheen has misled the court.

heading: Woman hacks man to death
content:
A woman has hacked a man to death in Rukgahawatte in Mulleriyawa following a personal dispute.
 
The incident was reported last afternoon and the reason for the murder is still unknown.
 
The victim was a 40-year-old, a resident of Mulleriyawa.
 
Police later arrested a woman who is accused of this murder.

heading: Former SLMC chairman says GMOA strike "illegal"
content:
The one-day strike action launched by the Government Medical Officers' Association will continue until 8 am tomorrow.
 
The strike saw the patients being inconvenienced throughout the country.
 
The Secretary of the GMOA Dr. Haritha Aluthge said that a series of strikes will be launched if their demands are not met.
 
The GMOA cited their opposition to Sri Lanka - Singapore FTA and 10 other reasons for their strike action.
 
Meanwhile, Medical Specialists Association's President Dr. Sunil Wijesinha said the strike has spread to the private sector hospitals as well.
 
Meanwhile, addressing the media in Colombo, former Chairman of the Sri Lanka Medical Council, Prof. Colvin Gunaratne said this strike is illegal.

heading: Indian drug peddler arrested at Pettah
content:
Police Narcotics Bureau has arrested an Indian national in Pettah with 878g of a drug named Methamphetamine or ice.
 
Police said that the estimated value of the detection was Rs. 10mn.
 
The suspect, a 30-year-old from Tamil Nadu, was arrested last evening (Aug 02) and police said that he was a frequent visitor to Sri Lanka.
 
Meanwhile, a resident of Gampaha was arrested by Customs in the Bandaranaike International Airport, while he was attempting to smuggle in Rs. 3.25 million worth of gold biscuits from Singapore.
 
The 51-year-old suspect arrived in Sri Lanka early hours of today.
 
An employee attached to a private cleaning firm was also arrested in connection with this case.

heading: Mismatch in a complaint on North East housing project
content:
Four members of the Anti-Corruption Front informed the court through affidavits that they do not know anything about a complaint lodged by the Anti-Corruption Front against Rada Institute accusing it of malpractice at a housing project in the North and East.
This was revealed when the relevant case was taken up at the Colombo High Court today (Aug 02).

heading: Strong winds hit Ampara, 76 houses damaged (Photos)
content:
Unusually strong winds damaged more than 76 houses in Sammanthurai and Navagampura in the Ampara District last afternoon.
 
Our reporters confirmed that the winds accompanied by heavy rains that hit the region.
 
Reports state that roads have been blocked by fallen trees.
 
The Disaster Management Centre and the District Secretariat have jointly launched a programme to provide relief to those who affected by the severe weather conditions.

heading: Mullaitivu experiences ice rain (Photos)
content:
After a long spell of drought, Mullaitivu experienced rain last afternoon (Aug 02).
 
The area residents said that pieces of ice fell in some area with rain.

heading: Traffic congestion in Town Hall area
content:
A traffic congestion is building up in the Town Hall area due to protest march conducted by the Joint Opposition.
 
The march, "Janabala Sena" has been organized to protest against the government.
 
The protest march which began at the Lipton Circus will reach Viharamahadevi Park, where they will have a rally.

heading: Aloysius & Palisena remanded
content:
Perpetual Treasuries owner Arjun Aloysius and its CEO Kasun Palisena have been further remanded till 9th of August.
 
The suspects who are accused of Central Bank bond scam were produced before Colombo Fort Magistrate today (Aug 02). Meanwhile, PTL's former Chief Dealer Nuwan Salgado and IT officer Sachitra Devathanthri have been arrested and granted bail.The Attorney General informed the courts that they will be state witnesses.

heading: Speaker seeks UPFA Gen. Sec. oppinion on Speaker
content: Speaker Karu Jayasuriya has asked the United People's Freedom Alliance's General Secretary his opinion on the request made by 8 UPFA MPs demanding to appoint Dinesh Gunawardena as the Opposition Leader.Those MPs had handed over the letter seeking MP Gunawardena be appointed as the Opposition Leader on 30th of last month.

heading: Mattala transfer : Minister reveals truth
content:
Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation Nimal Siripala de Silva reveals that talks are held with an Indian firm to make a decision on the Mattala International Airport.
 
The Minister De Silva revealed while responding to journalists after making an inspection visit at Ratmalana airport.

heading: Finance Minister explains reasons to increase vehicle taxes
content:
Finance Minister Mangala Samaraweera says the government was compelled to increase the import duty of vehicles less than 1000cc to contain the small vehicle usage.
He said this addressing a media conference at the Finance Ministry this afternoon (Aug 02).

heading: Prime Minister Wickremesinghe visits famous shrine in Tirumala
content:
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe offered prayers at the famous hill shrine of Lord Venkateswara in Tirumala town in India today (Aug 03).
 
Wickremesinghe, dressed in traditional attire and accompanied by wife Maithree and a few Sri Lankan officials, visited the shrine this morning, the India media reported.
 
On arrival, he was accorded a traditional welcome by priests and top officials of the temple, administered by the Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams.
 
Wickremesinghe here on a 20-hour spiritual visit, flew in from Chennai by an IAF helicopter last evening.
 
This is his third visit as Sri Lanka's prime minister to the hill shrine after previously coming here in 2002 and 2016.
 
Tight security arrangements were put in place in view of the visit to Tirumala hills.

heading: Two policemen dismissed for obtaining a bribe from a foreigner
content:
On a directive from IGP Pujith Jayasundera, the services of the two policemen from Habaraduwa Police in Galle have been suspended.
 
They are accused of obtaining Rs. 5,000 from a British national for a traffic violation.
 
This story was revealed by Hiru News.

heading: Rising trade gap : Reason for tax hike in small cars
content:
Central Bank Governor Dr. Indrajith Coomaraswamy says traffic congestion was not the only reason to increase the import tax of vehicles less than 1000 cc.
 
Addressing the media at the Central Bank this morning, he said controlling the rising trade gap was also factored in that decision.
 
He noted when the trade gap increases, it would also impact the debt portfolio as well as the devaluation of the rupee.
 
In turn, he said the cost of living would also rise.

heading: Shooting in Modera, one killed
content:
A 62-year-old person was killed in a shooting incident reported from Muthuwella, Modera this afternoon.
Police said the victim died after he was admitted to the National Hospital, Colombo with gunshot injuries.He was shot at by two men on a motorcycle.Police said that the deceased was a father of a youth who is wanted by police for several crimes.

heading: Rs. 77mn worth gold smuggled from Sri Lanka found in Tamil Nadu
content:
India police seized 11.15 kg of gold of foreign origin that had been smuggled into Mandapam off the Vedhalai coast.
 
The stock has been smuggled into India from Sri Lanka by sea was transporting by a bus at the time it was seized.
 
Three suspects who were acting as couriers were arrested in Madurai yesterday.
 
The gold, valued at 77 million rupees was found cut into different shapes and sizes.
 
This is the largest consignment of smuggled gold found in Tamil Nadu and in November 2017, 9.2kg of gold was detected in Kondai coast in Southern India and it was smuggled from Sri Lanka.
