heading: 11 arrested over incidents in Jaffna
content:
Police have arrested 11 persons for their alleged involvements with the recent unruly incidents in Jaffna.
 
Four motorcycles were also apprehended.
 
The suspects were residents of Jaffna and Manipay.

heading: Laos extends on arrival visa facility to Sri Lankans
content: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Laos has confirmed that with effect from this month Sri Lankan citizens holding valid travel documents could apply for the visa on arrival at the international border checkpoints of Laos.

heading: 130 kilos of KG found in Mannar
content:
Special Task Force has arrested an individual along with 130 kilos of Kerala cannabis in Mannar.
 
The raid was carried out following information received by the Navy Intelligence.
 
Police said that the illegal haul was ready to be transported and the suspect has been handed over to Police Narcotics Bureau for further investigations.

heading: Office of Mullaitivu Assistant Fisheries Inspector attacked (Photos)
content:
Mullaitivu Assistant Fisheries Inspector's office attacked"A group of fishermen staged a protest in Mullaitivu this morning (Aug 02), urging the authorities to ban fishing using illegal equipment and methods.
 
Our correspondent said the protestors marched towards the Assistant Fisheries Inspector's office from the town and then staged a protest there.
 
Police said after none of the officials came out of the office to meet the protestors, they had entered the office premises forcefully and destroyed the equipment.
 
Later, riot control teams were called in to control the situation.

heading: Prof. Colvin Gunaratne resigns
content: Prof. Colvin Gunaratne has resigned as the President of Sri Lanka Medical Council.

heading: Tense situation erupts during Dambulla match, 10 arrested
content:
Dambulla Police arrested 10 persons who behaved in an unruly manner during the ODI match between Sri Lanka and South Africa at the Dambulla International Cricket Stadium last night.
 
Police said a security guard who was on duty at the vehicle park and UNP Central Provincial Councillor Tissa Bandara Herath who received injuries were admitted to Dambulla Hospital.
 
The injured security guard, Chaminda Pushpakumara told us that one of the spectators attacked him with a glass bottle.
 
Later, the riot police arrested the attacker. 
 
Central Provincial Councilor, Tissa Bandara Herath said that he was also assaulted when he had intervened to settle the dispute.

heading: Forest fire causes damages to Northern Railway Line
content:
The Northern Railway Line has damaged as a result of a forest fire that has caused by vandals.
 
A spokesperson from the Railway Department said the forest fire had spread to the railway line where several wooden sleepers were damaged by fire.
 
He went on to say that several used sleepers had also been destroyed in the fire.
 
The Northern Railway Line comprises wooden sleepers from Maho to Vavuniya.
 
Meanwhile, the Disaster Management Center stated that the number of forest fires being lit by vandals is on the increase in Badulla and Monaragala districts.
 
78 such fires were reported in the recent past and, 500 hectares of forest have been destroyed as a consequence.
 
Badulla District Disaster Management Center Assistant Director, E. M. L. Udaya Kumara said that an SMS service will be launched effective today to report such fires, in an attempt to minimize damages incurred.

heading: Minister Kabir explains reason to increase vehicle tax
content:
UNP chairman Kabir Hashim says that congestion on roads is the main reason behind the increase in motor vehicle tax.
The Minister said this after calling on the Malwatta and Asgiri chapter chief incumbents.
The Finance Ministry announced yesterday that the import duty on motor vehicles with an engine capacity not exceeding 1000 cc had been increased.
Minister Kabir Hashim said that government policy had to be altered frequently based on country’s needs.

heading: More skeleton parts found from Mannar mass grave
content:
Our correspondent says that more skeleton parts have been found from the mass grave in Mannar.
 
The excavation of this grave began 46 days ago.
 
34 bone fragments have been handed over to the courts and more bone fragments will be handed over this week.
 
The authorities are considering to send those bone fragments to be tested at a lab in Florida, USA.

heading: ‘Jana Bala Sena’ to be held in Colombo
content:
The ‘Jana Bala Sena’ protest and the people’s rally being organized by the joint opposition in protest of the current government will be held in Colombo today (Aug 02).
The Joint Opposition also said that after the protest march will begin at 2 pm from the Lipton Circus and the protest rally will be held at the Viharamahadevi Park.

heading: Police in Jaffna to curb clashes between Ava & Dhanurok groups
content:
The leave of policemen attached to three police stations in Jaffna has been cancelled to assist to contain Ava and Dhanurok clashes.
A senior police officer from the Northern Province confirmed that leave for personnel attached to Manipay, Kopay, and Chunnakam police stations has been cancelled.
The decision has been taken in order to ensure that an adequate number of officers are on duty to assist with containing clashes in the Jaffna peninsula among the members of those gangs.
In addition to that police intelligence officials have also been deployed.

heading: Ministers clash over cabinet paper to solve Railway salary anomalies
content:
Reports say that a tense situation was erupted at the Cabinet meeting yesterday (Jul 31) as the opinions of Ministers Dr. Sarath Amunugama, Dr. Rajitha Senarathna and Mangala Samaraweera disputed over a special cabinet paper to rectify the salary anomalies of the railway employees.
Political sources confirmed that when Minister Dr. Sarath Amunugama submitted the special cabinet paper, Finance Minister Mangala Samaraweera expressed his stern opposition to it.
Minister of Health Rajitha Senarathna then expressed views supporting the cabinet paper of Minister Amunugama.
The Cabinet earlier appointed a committee headed by Minister Amunugama and this special cabinet paper had been prepared based on that committee recommendations.
On this occasion, Minister Samaraweera had noted that by putting forward special cabinet papers of this nature, problems could arise in other sectors as well.
In spite of Minister Samaraweera voicing his opposition, the cabinet paper was approved yesterday.
The railway trade unions earlier called off a planned token strike that was scheduled to be launched on Monday at midnight after Minister Amunugama assured that the issues will be resolved.

heading: Party leaders’ agree to hold Provincial Council election in January
content:
At the party leaders’ meeting held yesterday, a consensus was reached to hold the provincial council election on 5th of January next year.
 
Yesterday’s meeting was convened with Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe at the chair.When contacted, Minister Mano Ganeshan said that leaders except for the SLFP, that participated in the meeting agreed to hold the election according to the old method.At the party leaders’ meeting chaired by Speaker Karu Jayasuriya, on 20th last month, the Election Commission and Delimitation Commission Chairmen had stated that the election could be held on 5th of January next year if party leaders agreed to it.The Joint Opposition did not participate in the meeting which was held at Temple Trees last night.Joint Opposition parliamentary group leader MP Dinesh Gunawardena said that the Joint Opposition had already expressed its stance in writing.

heading: Kuwaiti couple : More videos of airport clash being published
content:
More videos of the recent incident at the Bandaranaike International Airport involving a Kuwaiti couple are circulating in social media.
 
Following the July 27th incident, five Customs officials were injured and hospitalized.
 
It has emerged that the Kuwaiti couple had clashed with the Customs officers after they did not allow a pet dog to be taken out for failure to follow quarantine procedures.
 
Later, the suspects were produced before Negombo Court and released on bail.
 
However, they are banned from leaving the country.

heading: Fire at factory in Kalutara
content:
A fire has broken out at a food factory in Kalutara North.
 
Fire Brigade units from Kalutara and Horana were deployed to douse the fire.
 
Police said that the reason for the fire is yet to be ascertained.

heading: Kopay Gramaseva Officers launch strike
content:
The Gramaseva Officers in Kopay have launched a strike against the threats posed by the Ava group members.
 
On Sunday (Jul 29), a group of persons, allegedly members of the Ava group had attacked an office of a GS officer, destroying the office equipment.

heading: STF to be deployed for search operations in prisons
content:
It has been decided to deploy the Special Task Force to carry out search operations inside prisons.
 
This was decided during a special discussion held today (Aug 01).
 
Several high ranked officers of the STF have visited Welikada, Magazine and Colombo Remand Prison on an inspection tour.
 
This decision has been taken to avoid illegal goods being taken to prisons.

heading: Underworld kingpin 'Pathalaye Police' handed over OCPD
content:
The underworld kingpin Arunashantha Attanayake alias 'Pathalaye Police' who was arrested by the Special Task Force yesterday in Devalapola, Minuwangoda has been handed over to Organized Crimes Prevention Division.
 
Police Media Spokesperson's office said the probe will be conducted covering several areas.
 
Drugs such as heroin and 'ice' were also found in his possession.
 
Recently, it was reported that this person is having close links with Minister Sarath Fonseka.

heading: NPC CM issues a warning
content:
The Chief Minister of Northern Province C. V. Wigneshwaran says if the party decides to field the Chairman of Ilankai Tamil Arasu Katchi, Mavai Senathiraja as party's nominee of the Northern Province CM, he would take a decision on his political future.
 
He said this joining HIRU TV for an interview yesterday (Jul 31).

heading: Two youths knocked down by Provincial Councillor’s vehicle, critical
content:
Two youths were admitted to National Hospital, Colombo in a critical condition after their motorcycle was knocked down by a car driven by United People's Freedom Alliance's Western Provincial Councillor Jagath Angage at Mahabellana in Panadura, last night.
 
Police said that the provincial councillor has also sustained injuries and was admitted to Panadura Hospital.
 
The car was plying from Bandaragama to Panadura, and the motorcycle was coming from the opposite direction.
 
The injured youths aged between 19 and 21 are residents of Poruwadanda, Horana.
 
Police said that the motorcycle had broken into two following the accident.

heading: Special High Court issues summons to Gamini Senarath
content:
The newly established three-judge bench of the Special High Court has issued summons to Chief of Staff of former President, Gamini Senerath, and three others to appear before courts on 24th of August.
They are accused of misappropriating Rs. 500 million from Litro Gas, in this case.
This case has been filed based on 24 charges and it will the first case to be heard by the Special High Court.

heading: Import duty of less than 1000cc cars increased
content:
The Finance Ministry says that the import duty of less than 1000CC motor vehicles has been increased with effect from today (Aug 01).
Meanwhile, vehicle importers say that the prices of motor vehicles less than 1000cc will increase by Rs.100000 and hybrid cars (less than 1000cc) will move up by Rs.400000 as a result of this latest duty increase.

heading: Cigarette prices increased
content:
The price of a cigarette stick has increased to Rs. 5 with the upward revision of excise duty by Rs. 3.80.
 
Accordingly, a cigarette which was sold at Rs. 50 will be sold at Rs. 55 and the price of a cigarette which was at Rs. 55 will be Rs. 60.

heading: Ministers exchange verbal volleys over railway salary issue
content:
Ministers exchange verbal volleys"Reports say that a tense situation was erupted at the Cabinet meeting yesterday (Jul 31) as the opinions of Ministers Dr. Sarath Amunugama, Dr. Rajitha Senarathna and Mangala Samaraweera clashed over a special cabinet paper to rectify the salary anomalies of the railway employees.
 
Political sources confirmed that when Minister Dr. Sarath Amunugama submitted the special cabinet paper, Finance Minister Mangala Samaraweera expressed his stern opposition to it.
 
Minister of Health Rajitha Senarathna then expressed views supporting the cabinet paper of Minister Amunugama.
 
The Cabinet earlier appointed a committee headed by Minister Amunugama and this special cabinet paper has been prepared based on that committee recommendations.
 
On this occasion, Minister Samaraweera had noted that by putting forward special cabinet papers of this nature, problems could arise in other sectors as well.
 
In spite of Minister Samaraweera voicing his opposition, the cabinet paper was approved yesterday.
 
The railway trade unions earlier called off a planned token strike that was scheduled to be launched on Monday at midnight after Minister Amunugama assured that the issues will be resolved.

heading: Police raid a mobile brothel in Wellawatte
content:
Police have carried out a raid following a tip-off in Wellawatte where a group of men had been allegedly trafficking heroin and prostitutes in a car.
 
The incident had occurred at around 11.40 pm yesterday (Jul 31).
 
When police were informed of the modus operandi taking place in front of a hotel in Wellawatte, a police team had arrived at the location in a jeep and a three-wheeler.
 
Then the car, which had attempted to speed away, collided with a parapet wall, after knocking down a policeman.
 
The injured policeman was admitted to National Hospital, Colombo.
 
Then a policeman who was in the three-wheeler had opened fire at the car injuring the main suspect.
 
The 39-year-old suspect, a resident of Gonapola, is now receiving treatment at National Hospital, Colombo with police protection.
 
Investigations revealed that he was on bail over a previous court case for having heroin in his possession and running brothel houses.
 
Police have also arrested the car driver and two other women who were inside the car.

heading: Term of Presidential Commission probing SriLankan Airlines extended
content:
The term assigned to the Presidential Commission, appointed to inquire into irregularities relating to Sri Lankan Airlines, Sri Lankan Catering, and Mihin Lanka has been extended by five months.
 
The special gazette notification issued by President Maitripala Sirisena yesterday states that the period allotted to the commission has been extended until 31st of December 2018. 
 
The period of service of the commission was previously scheduled to end yesterday.
 
The presidential commission had been appointed to inquire into irregularities alleged to have taken place within those companies between 1st of January, 2006 until 31st of January this year.

heading: HIRU TV's 20th anniversary : Lucky winner of 16th car from Hambantota
content:
The loyal viewers of HIRU TV's Tele Perahara now have a chance to win an Rs. 2.5 million worth Mahindra e20 car on five days of the week.
 
The 16th winner of this competition has been found and he is H. V. N. Gunatilleke from Hambantota.
 
HIRU TV's Tele Perahara runs from 7.30 pm to 9.55 pm on weekdays.
 
The respective winner will be chosen through an SMS competition.
 
Several questions will be posted during teledramas, and the viewers can send the answers via SMS to HTP (space) (number sequence of the answers) (space) name, NIC number, area and send the SMS to 7766.
 
The winner of that respective day will appear on the screen during the "Thaamath Adare Nathnam" teledrama.

heading: Sampanthan makes a statement on Opposition Leader's post
content:
The Leader of Opposition R. Sampanthan gave a statement to the media today on the different opinions expressed about the post.
Here, he said based on the traditions, the Speaker had made a decision on the Opposition Leader's post.
Sampanthan noted that if a same party's MPs are representing both the government and the opposition, they cannot function as the official opposition in the House.

heading: Prices of more essential drugs reduced
content: Health Minister Dr. Rajitha Senaratne says that prices of another 15 essential drugs and highly priced 10 cancer drugs will be reduced with immediate effect.

heading: Finance Ministry issues circular restricting payments to excess staff at state entities
content:
The Finance Ministry has issued a circular restricting payment to excess staff who had been recruited ignoring the approved service cadre at state entities.
 
The circular was issued after the Cabinet had decided recently that it will be the responsibility of the chairmen, CEOs, and accountants of such institutions to pay the salaries of excess staff.

heading: Person who sold heroin to UK rugger players arrested
content:
Police have arrested the heroin trafficker who sold drugs to the two UK rugger players who died in Sri Lanka recently.
 
The suspect was arrested in Wellawatte.
 
He was remanded until 10th of September after he was produced before the court.

heading: Two Navy intelligence officers remanded again
content:
Two Navy intelligence officers who were granted bail yesterday over their alleged links with the disappearance of 11 youths during 2008/09 period have been remanded again.
 
They were remanded after they had failed to fulfill the bail conditions.
 
The relevant case was taken up before the Colombo Fort Magistrate Court today and the Attorney General's Department said that the actions that would be taken against the other suspects will be taken after scrutinizing the witness statements.
 
After considering those submissions, magistrate Lanka Jayaratne ordered to call the case again on 25th of September.

heading: World's largest cargo plane lands at Mattala (Photos)
content:
The world's largest cargo plane, Antonov ADB 2540 landed at the Mattala International Airport this afternoon (Jul 31).
 
The plane which was flying from Indonesia to Muscat in Oman landed at the MIA for refueling at around 1.40 pm.
 
The flight had a crew of 19.

heading: Open warrant issued against Jaliya Wickramasuriya
content:
Colombo Fort Magistrates today issued an open warrant again for the arrest of former Sri Lankan ambassador to the US Jaliya Wickramasuriya.
 
When this case was taken up before Colombo Chief Magistrate Lanka Jayaratne, the magistrate said that notices will be issued again on his wife and a relation-sister who were the sureties of the bail.
 
The former ambassador is accused of misappropriating funds which were set aside to acquire a building for Sri Lanka's embassy in the US.
 
The hearing was postponed to 27th of August.

heading: Elderly man jailed for abusing 5-year-old girl
content:
The Colombo High Court has sentenced a 76-year-old person for a rigorous imprisonment of eight years for abusing a 5-year-old girl.
 
High Court Judge Vikum Kaluarachchi gave the ruling against a resident of Dematagoda.
 
The accused was imposed a fine of Rs. 20,000 and he was also ordered to pay a compensation of Rs. 50,000 to the victim.
 
The incident had occurred in October 2009.

heading: Additional Solicitor General to examine Vijayakala’s statement
content:
Attorney General, Jayantha Jayasuriya says that an additional Solicitor General has been assigned to study the ongoing investigation in connection with the pro-LTTE statement made by former State Minister, Vijayakala Maheswaran.
 
He said the additional Solicitor General will advise and make recommendations with regard to the ongoing police investigations.
 
Police are expected to submit a report citing progress of their probe to the Attorney General.
 
At the same time, the Organized Crime Prevention Divison has obtained statements from MP Vijayakalaa Maheswaran and Minister Vajira Abeywardana, TNA MP Mavai Senathiraja and Northern Provincial Chief Minister, C. V. Wigneshwaran.
 
In addition, statements have been recorded from 50 participants including the District Secretaries who were on stage at the time MP. Maheswaran made the controversial statement.

heading: 36 injured as two buses collide in Matale (Photos)
content:
36 persons including 11 school children were injured when two buses collided in Madawala on the Kandy - Jaffna main road this morning (Jul 31).
 
The injured were admitted to Matale Hospital.
 
The private bus was plying from Thalawakele to Dambulla while the CTB bus was heading towards Matale from Murutotuwa.
 
The buses collided head-on and police said the condition of the two drivers is serious.

heading: Commonwealth Sec. Gen. arrives tomorrow
content:
The Secretary-General of the Commonwealth Patricia Scotland will arrive in Sri Lanka tomorrow for a four-day official visit.
 
In a statement, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs said this would be Scotland’s first visit to Sri Lanka since she assumed the Office of Secretary-General in April 2016.
 
The main objective of the Secretary-General’s meetings will be to explore greater cooperation and collaboration in the implementation of the agreed outcomes at the 2018 Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting (CHOGM) in London, including promoting intra-Commonwealth trade.
 
Discussions will also include the implementation of the ‘Commonwealth Blue Charter’, under which Sri Lanka holds the role of a champion country to lead the Commonwealth effort towards the restoration of mangroves.

heading: Court allows Uduwe Dhammaloka Thera to travel abroad
content:
The overseas travel ban imposed on Ven. Uduwe Dhammaloka Thera has been removed until 10th of September by Colombo High Court.
 
The court ruling was announced after the counsels of the Thera made submissions.
 
On 26th of this month, the Thera was asked to descend from a flight bound to London.
 
The Thera was to visit London to attend a religious event.
 
Ven. Uduwe Dhammaloka Thera is accused of illegally keeping an elephant calf and Thera's passport was impounded when he was granted bail.

heading: SB, Susil, and WDJ to attend JO leaders' meeting
content:
Several members of the 'SLFP Group of 16' will participate in the Joint Opposition, coalition party leaders’ meeting for the first time today.
 
The meeting will be chaired by former President Mahinda Rajapaksa at his official residence at this afternoon.
 
MPs, S. B. Dissanayake, W. D. J. Senevirathna, and Susil Premajayantha are scheduled to participate in the meeting.
 
The General Secretary of the Pivituru Hela Urumaya, Udaya Gammanpila said that the new constitution and provincial council election will be discussed in detail during this meeting.

heading: School vacation starts on August 3
content:
All Government Sinhala and Tamil medium schools will close for vacation on 3rd of August.
 
The Ministry of Education said that the third term will start on 3rd of September.

heading: Ranjan goes mad, behaves violently
content:
Ranjan becomes mad inside elevator at Supreme Court...Deputy Minister Ranjan Ramanayake who had come to the Supreme Court to attend the Contempt of Court case against him yesterday (Jul 30) had behaved in an unruly manner at the elevator of the Superior Court Complex in Colombo.
 
Because of his unruly behaviour, two female attorneys-at-law who were in the elevator to go to the courtrooms 403 and 502 had got down from the elevator at the next floor.
 
The court staffer who was operating the elevator had said that he will lodge a complaint with the marshal who is looking after the security at the Superior Court Complex on this incident.
 
It was reported that Ranjan Ramanayake while going to the 5th floor of the court complex, after entering the elevator with few of others, had acted in an unruly manner hitting the iron-plated walls of the elevator with his elbow.
 
Then after the case was heard, while returning to the 2nd floor, Ramanayake had acted more violently, hitting the iron-plated walls furiously.
 
After coming out of the elevator, he had asked the operator "Are you well now and happy" ("Dan saneepada, hugak sathutuda" and then left.

content:
IP Neomal Rangajeewa and former Prisons Commissioner Emil Ranjan Lamahewa have been further remanded till 7th of August.
 
They are in custody after they were arrested over 2012 prison riots, where 27 prison inmates were killed.

heading: Protestors block Matara - Walasmulla road (Photos)
content:

The protestors urged the authorities to renovate the Aththudawa road.

heading: Three Facebook friends arrested over fire of ‘Lovers Mountain ’
content:
Three persons were arrested in connection the arson of Nearthegala Kanda in Ratnapura also known as ‘Lovers Mountain ’.
The Disaster Management Centre said that the fire erupted yesterday and has since been doused.
More than 300 acres were destroyed.
Disaster Management Centre’s Assistant Director Pradeep Kodippili said that three friends had coordinated a trip to the mountain, via Facebook.
It was found that the fire was erupted as a result of negligence by the group when they were lighting a campfire.
Later they were arrested by police for causing the fire.

heading: Party leaders meet to discuss 20 A
content:
A special party leaders’ meeting with the Speaker at the chair is scheduled to be held at the parliament complex today.
 
Political sources say that discussions will focus on the 20th constitutional amendment and the parliamentary session scheduled to begin on 7th of August.
 
Following today’s party leaders’ meeting, another party leaders’ meeting has been scheduled for tomorrow with the Prime Minister at the chair.

heading: Doctors’ DAT allowance increased, GMOA says token strike will go ahead
content:
The Treasury has approved an increase in the DAT payment, which is the Obstacle and Attendance Transport Allowance granted to doctors.
 
The allowance will be increased by Rs. 15,000 for a general practitioner and Rs. 25,000 for a specialist doctor.
 
The Finance Ministry said that at present all government doctors receive Rs. 35,000 as DAT allowance.
 
The Management Services Department had recently requested recommendations from the Treasury to increase the allowance.
 
However, the Government Medical Officers’ Association says that the island-wide token strike to be launched on 3rd of August will go ahead as scheduled.

heading: Mars gets closer to earth after 15 years
content:
Mars will be at its closest distance to Earth in 15 years tonight (Jul 31), wrapping up a memorable month for stargazers.
 
And we may never see the Red Planet so near for another 269 years.
 
The Red Planet will be 57.6 million kilometers from the earth, offering the clearest and brightest views since 2003.
 
The local stargazers are invited for a camp to witness the Red Planet from 7 pm to 10 pm tonight at the Colombo Campus grounds.

The Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna trade union leader Wasantha Samarasinghe says a huge commission has been obtained in bringing in the new aircraft (A -321) to SriLankan Airlines.
He made this accusation joining a seminar held in Ginigathhena yesterday (Jul 30).

content:
11 school children were injured and one student was killed when a three-wheel transporting students collided with a CTB bus at Puliyankulam in Vavuniya, this afternoon (Jul 30).
 
Our correspondent said at the time of the accident, 13 persons were onboard the three-wheel.
 
The students were from Puliyankulam Hindu Primary school.
 
The ill-fated bus was travelling from Colombo to Jaffna.
 
Police said the condition of some of those injured students is serious.

content:
Two Navy intelligence officers who were arrested on their alleged links with the disappearance of 11 youths during the 2008/09 period have been granted bail.
 
The relevant case was taken up before the Colombo High Court today.
 
The suspects were released on cash surety of Rs. 100,000 and a personal bail worth Rs. 500,000 each.

content:
The 48-hour token strike to be launched by the train engine operators, guards, controllers and station masters has been suspended.
 
The token strike was to be launched from midnight tonight.
 
This strike was planned in protest of the delay in implementation of the cabinet paper for the rectification of salary anomalies.
 
However, the trade unions had decided to suspend the strike action following talks that were held this afternoon.

The general public is advised to refrain from flying kites 5 km close to airports.
 
The Civil Aviation Authority says it is a threat to flight safety and an illegal act.

The loyal listeners of HIRU FM can now win 20 trucks worth Rs. 35 million that is offered to coincide with HIRU's 20th year anniversary.

The winner is T. M. Dilani of Ipalogama, Kekirawa.

heading: Kuwaiti couple accused of assaulting customs officials banned from leaving Sri Lanka
content:
Negombo Magistrate’s Court has ordered the Immigration and Emigration Department to ban the Kuwaiti couple who are accused of assaulting five customs officials at the Bandaranaike International Airport from leaving the country.
 
They had assaulted the customs officials on Friday when they were not allowed to take out their pet dog from the airport without following animal quarantine procedures.
 
The injured officials were admitted to Negombo Hospital for treatment and the suspected couple were arrested by police.
 
A woman customs official is reportedly in a serious condition with neck injuries.
 
They were granted bail and were ordered to be present in court today (Jul 30).
 
When the case was called in at the Negombo Magistrate’s Court, the Magistrate ordered them to reappear in court on 10th of this month.

content: The Import and Export Controller who was arrested by the Bribery Commission while soliciting a bribe of Rs.200,000 has been further remanded till 7th of August.

content: Railway Trade Unions including engine operators say they will go ahead with the planned strike from midnight today as there were no solutions given.

heading: Ingiriya OIC and three other policemen interdicted
content:
Three police officers at the Ingiriya Police Station have been interdicted for allegedly assaulting a suspect inside the police station.
 
The IGP Pujith Jayasundera had issued the directive.
 
Accordingly, services of a sub-inspector, sergeant, and a constable have been suspended.
 
The services of the OIC has also been suspended with the permission of the Police Commission.
 
The three policemen had arrested two youths who were loitering in the Ingiriya town and among them was a serving soldier.
 
The policemen are accused of assaulting the two youths at the police station.
 
Later, it was found that the three policemen were under the influence of liquor and they were arrested and remanded until today.

The Attorney General informed the Supreme Court on 4th of July that the respondent, Ramanayake’s controversial statement seemed at a glance to be in contempt of court.
 
On 21st August last year, following a meeting with the Prime Minister, Deputy Minister, Ranjan Ramanayake gave a statement to media, saying that the majority of judges and attorneys-at-law are corrupt.
 
Later, Ven. Magalkande Sudatta Thera and a retired airman Sunil Perera filed a contempt of court case against the Deputy Minister.

heading: Heroin found in foreign woman's bag
content:
Police have found a bag containing 886g of heroin in a bag from a house on Terrence Road, Dehiwala.
 
It was revealed that the bag is owned by a Bangladeshi woman and she was not at the house when it was searched.
 
Investigations found that the woman was living at this house on rent.

content:

Sri Lanka - Singapore Free Trade Agreement, non-issuance of the gazette notification pertinent to minimum standards of medical education and the arbitrary withholding of elections by the Minister of Health, for four vacancies at the Sri Lanka Medical Council are among those demands.

Train strike from midnight tonight....The General Secretary of the Train Guards’ Union P. M. T. Peiris says that train engine operators, guards, controllers and station masters are launching a 48-hour token strike beginning from midnight tonight.
 
He said that this strike would be carried out in protest of the delay in implementation of the Cabinet paper for the rectification of salary anomalies.

content: The National Water Supply and Drainage Board says a 15-hour water cut will be enforced from 9 am till 12 midnight tomorrow (Jul 31) in Biyagama North, Delgoda, Kaduboda, Malwana, Dompe and several other areas due to the maintenance of a pipeline.

heading: COPE to probe power purchasing accusations
content:
The secretaries of two Ministries have been summoned to the COPE today for an inquiry regarding the crisis situation that has cropped up relating to the price paid for purchasing electricity from private power plants and the unit price.
 
The secretaries to the Ministry of Power and Renewable Energy and the Ministry of National Policies and Economic Affairs have been summoned along with the chairmen of Sri Lanka Electricity Board and Sri Lanka Public Utilities Commission.
 
Reports say that the inquiry will be based on the payment of Rs. 800 million to a private power supplier in Embilipitiya after obtaining electricity.

content:
A general amnesty has been announced from 1st of August for the Sri Lankans who are staying in the United Arab Emirates without a visa.
 
Sri Lanka Foreign Employment Bureau said that those who overstaying visa could be able to renew their visa without any payment and those who had breached immigration laws would be allowed to leave the country during this amnesty period.

heading: Three Ingiriya police officers remanded for assaulting a youth
content:
The three policemen attached to Ingiriya Police who were arrested in connection with assaulting a suspect under the influence of alcohol were remanded until tomorrow when they were produced before Horana Magistrate Court.
 
The OIC of the Minor Complaints Division, a sergeant attached to the Traffic Division and a constable were arrested in connection with the incident.
 
The three officers were patrolling in Ingiriya last night, had questioned two individuals who were loitering at a bus halt.
 
It is reported that the policemen have assaulted the youth following an argument between the two parties.
 
One of the youths who sustained injuries was admitted to Ingiriya Hospital.
 
The 27-year-old individual is reported to be an army soldier attached to Slave Island Army Camp.
 
Following the incident, area residents staged a protest against the assault on the youth.
 
A tense situation arose during the protest at Ingiriya police and the situation was brought under control when the SP in charge of Panadura division deployed a team of officers including the OIC of Horana Police, to the scene.
 
The situation came under control when area residents learned that the tests confirmed that the police officers had been under the influence of alcohol.
 
 Meanwhile, IGP Pujith Jayasundara had issued a directive to the SP in charge of Panadura division to immediately suspend the three officers involved in the incident.
 
The IGP has also instructed to conduct a special investigation into the incident.

heading: Protest in Kotokawatte against Marikkar
content:

heading: Suspects arrested in connection with Bulathsinhala robbery detained for questioning
content:
Police have given permission by courts to detain the two suspects for 48 hours and question them over the robbery of Rs. 30 million in Pahala Naragala area on Horana Road in Bulathsinhala.
 
Police were granted permission when the suspects were produced before Matugama Magistrate today.
 
The driver of the van in which the cash was transported and its security officer were arrested in connection with the incident.
 
Police said that further investigations are underway by examining the footage of CCTV cameras placed in the vicinity of the location.
 
A private company was transporting the cash to be deposited in ATM machines of two private banks in Narahenpita.
 
The driver of the van, a security officer, and two cashiers, who had also been accompanying, had made a stop at a restaurant in Bulathsinhala to have lunch.
 
It is reported that an unidentified group who had arrived in a jeep had thrown chilli powder at the individuals and carried out the robbery.
 
It has further been revealed that the rear door of the van had not been locked at the time of the incident, creating suspicion.
 
The safe carrying 19 bags of cash had been locked using only two ordinary padlocks.
 
The robbers had fled the scene taking 12 out of the 19 bags with them in their jeep bearing license plate 64-9217.  
 
The security officer and the driver were arrested following the incident over their failure to follow strict security protocol.

heading: Party leaders to meet to finalize a date to debate 20th amendment
content:
The date on which the gazetted 20th constitutional amendment will be debated in parliament is to be decided at the upcoming party leaders’ meeting.
 
Parliamentary sources noted that the dates of the debate as well as additional amendments will be discussed at the meeting.
 
Meanwhile, the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna said that it soon expects to commence discussions with party leaders in order to obtain their support for the 20thconstitutional amendment.
 
The 20th amendment brought forward by the JVP in order to abolish the executive presidency and it was gazetted on the 9th of July.
 
It was handed over to the Speaker and the Secretary-General of the Parliament by the JVP on 25th of May.
 
The amendment proposes the Executive President to be made a President who is accountable to the Parliament.
 
Accordingly, the head of the state, as well as the commander of the tri-forces, will be the president.
 
However, the Prime Minister will be the head of the government and the head of the Cabinet of ministers.
 
The President will not be elected through a public election and will instead be elected by the parliamentary majority.
 
The powers of appointing ministers to the Cabinet, officials for commissions as well as naming diplomats will not be vested in the President as per the 20th constitutional amendment.
 
The term of the President will be limited to 5 years and during the tenure, the President will not be able to hold leadership or membership of any political party.
 
The power of dissolving the parliament which was vested in the President through the 19th constitutional amendment will also be stripped by the 20th amendment.
 
However, to be enacted this constitutional amendment should be approved in parliament by a two-thirds majority.
 
If the 20th constitutional amendment is passed in parliament, it will come into effect after the end of the current term of the President.

heading: Plans to jam mobile phone signals surrounding exam halls
content:
The Department of Examinations has decided to implement a mechanism to disable electronic communication equipment including mobile phones inside and in the vicinity of exam halls during this year’s Advanced Level examination.
 
Commissioner of Examinations, Sanath Pujitha said that the assistance of the Signal Corps of Sri Lanka Army and the Telecommunications Regulatory Commission of Sri Lanka will be sought for this matter.
 
Meanwhile, holding tuition classes targeting the Advanced Level examination will be prohibited from midnight Tuesday until the 1st of September.
 
The Examinations Department noted that tuition classes targeting the Grade 5 scholarship examination will be prohibited from being held between the 1st and the 5th of August.
 
Holding lectures, seminars and workshops will also be prohibited, accordingly.

heading: Another person arrested over Bulathsinhala robbery
content:
The driver of the van used to transport cash to be deposited to ATM’s which was robbed has also been taken into custody by police.
 
Over Rs. 10 million was robbed by unidentified men after throwing chilli powder at employees of a private company who were carrying cash in the Bulathsinhala area.
 
The employees had stopped their van at an eatery and had been having their meal when the robbers had arrived at the scene in a jeep to throw chilli powder.
 
Following the robbery, police arrested the guard of the van, for allegedly abetting the robbers.

heading: Van - tipper collision kills a couple (Photos)
content:
Police say a husband and his wife were killed in a road accident at Walathapitiya on the Ampara - Kalmunai main road.
 
The accident occurred last evening when a tipper collided head-on with a van, in which the deceased were travelling by.
 
The victims were residents of Pilimathalawa, Kandy.
 
The accident had caused extensive damages to the van and Samanthurai Police is probing the incident.

heading: Western province private bus owners to launch a strike
content:
The Western Province private bus owners say that they will stop operating buses from 15th of August against the newly introduced spot fines.
 
A number of new spot fines were introduced from 15th of this month and bus operators say it has affected their livelihood.

heading: Ven. Rathana steps down as Senior Advisor to President; Proposes cabinet to be dissolved
content:
Parliamentarian Venerable Athuraliye Rathana Thera says that he will resign from his post of Senior Advisor to the President.
 
The Thera expressed these views at the 30th anniversary event of the Women’s Co-operative Movement at the Vihara Maha Devi Park yesterday.

heading: Bike collides with train, two killed (Photos)
content:
Two persons -rider and a pillion rider - were killed when a motorcycle collided with a train in Nelukkulama, Ariyalai, Jaffna today.
 
Police said another person who was on the bike had been hospitalized with injuries.
 
The bike had hit the train due to excessive speed and the train was plying from Colombo to Kansesanthurai.
 
The victims were aged between 29 and 30.

heading: Youth thrown into Kandalama tank by drunken friends, dies
content:
A youth who was on a trip to Dambulla and thrown into the Kandalama Tank by his friends who were under the influence of alcohol has died.
Police said that a group of 17 were consuming alcohol at a venue where bathing in the tank was prohibited.
The 21-year-old deceased, who was intoxicated and lying on the ground when his friends carried him and dumped in the water.
However, he died of drowning.
The 16 friends have been arrested.

heading: Rs. 10mn robbed in Bulathsinhala
content:
Over  Rs. 10 million have been robbed by unidentified men after throwing chilli powder at the employees of a private company who were carrying cash to be deposited in ATM machines in the Bulathsinhala area.The robbery took place at around 5.30 pm yesterday.
 
The employees had stopped their van at an eatery and were having their meal when the robbers who had arrived at the scene in a jeep carried out the robbery after throwing chilli powder at the staff.
 
However, the security officer of the van was arrested for allegedly abetting the robbery.

heading: Assault on customs officers : Kuwaiti couple granted bail
content:
The Kuwaiti couple who were arrested by the Airport Police for assaulting five customs officials over a pet dog has been granted bail.
 
The couple was released on two surety bails of Rs. 100,000 each and the case will be taken up again day after tomorrow.
 
Five customs officials were hospitalized after they were assaulted by the suspects at the Bandaranaike International Airport after they were asked to quarantine their pet dog.
 
Sri Lanka Customs said that the couple arrived in Sri Lanka this morning from Kuwait bringing their pet dog with them, but were not willing to abide by the Sri Lankan Animal Quarantine regulation.
 
When customs officials had resisted them as they tried to forcibly take out the pet dog, they have assaulted the customs officers.
 
Later they were arrested and produced before Negombo Magistrate.

heading: Sri Lankans to witness longest lunar eclipse tonight
content:
Skywatchers will be treated to the longest "blood moon" eclipse of the 21st Century tonight.
 
As it rises, during this total eclipse, Earth's natural satellite will turn a striking shade of red or ruddy brown.
 
The "totality" period, when light from the Moon is totally obscured, will last for one hour, 43 minutes.
 
At least part of the eclipse is visible from Europe, the Middle East, Africa, Australia, most of Asia and South America.
 
The Moon will pass right through the centre of the Earth's shadow, at the shadow's widest point.
 
Because of that, the lunar eclipse will be so long.
 
"This is actually almost as long as a lunar eclipse could be," Prof Tim O'Brien, an astrophysicist at the University of Manchester, explained.
 
It coincides not only with Mars's close approach but with what he described as a "procession of planets" - a line-up of our celestial neighbours that will give skywatchers a particularly good view of Venus, Jupiter, Saturn, and Mars.
 
Stages of a total lunar eclipse
Penumbral eclipse begins: This starts when the outer (and lighter) part of the Earth's shadow begins moving across the Moon
Partial eclipse begins: This stage takes hold when the darker, inner part of the Earth's shadow (umbra) begins covering the Moon
Total eclipse begins: Also called totality, this occurs when the umbra completely covers the Moon, turning it a reddish brown colour
Maximum eclipse: The mid-point of totality
Total eclipse ends: The umbra starts moving away from the Moon's face after totality
Partial eclipse ends: Earth's umbra completely leaves the surface of the Moon
Penumbral eclipse ends: The outer part of the shadow (penumbra) completely moves away from the Moon
 
Sri Lankans will be able to witness this total lunar eclipse of the red moon from 10.45 pm to 4.58 am tomorrow.(Inputs: BBC)

heading: Century’s longest lunar eclipse to be seen tonight
content:
It has been reported that the longest total lunar eclipse of the 21st century will be able to be observed beginning tonight and extending into the early hours of tomorrow.
 
The total duration of the eclipse is projected to be 6 hours and 14 minutes and it will be able to be visible to people around the world including here in Sri Lanka.
 
A total lunar eclipse occurs when the earth's shadow moves across the moon, blocking out light from the sun.
 
As the shadow glides across the surface of the moon, it takes on a distinctive red glow — an effect caused by the bending of light in earth's atmosphere.
 
The period of totality during this eclipse, when earth's shadow is directly across the moon and it is at its reddest, will last 1 hour, 42 minutes and 57 seconds.
 
Given the moon is currently the furthest away in its orbit, it will take longer to pass through the shadow causing the eclipse to be the longest in 100 years.
 
It will be the longest blood moon witnessed in 100 years.

Police say he was arrested elsewhere in the country but gave no other details.
 
It was not immediately clear how the diamond was recovered from Sri Lanka.

heading: Party leaders fail to reach consensus on Provincial Council election system
content:
The political party leaders who met to discuss the method to hold next provincial council election have failed to reach a consensus.

Opposition Leader, R. Sampanthan, Joint Opposition Leader, Dinesh Gunawardena, JVP Leader, Anura Kumara Dissanayake; and SLFP representatives, Nimal Siripala de Silva and Faizser Mustapha participated.
 
In addition, Party leaders Mano Ganesan, Rauff Hakeem, Doulas Devananda and Patali Champika Ranawaka also took part in the discussion.

During the meeting today, SLFP and JVP opined that the provincial council election should be held under the new method.

heading: Baratha’s bodyguard Gamini, shot at Duminda’s head twice, while he was leaving, caused the incident: revealed in Supreme Court
content:
The Attorney General’s Department agreed again today that the bodyguard of Baratha Lakshman, Gamini, first fired gunshots not once but twice penetrating through the forehead of Duminda Silva.
 
President Counsel, Anuja Premarathna made submissions today when the appeal by former MP Duminda Silva requesting the court to acquit him was taken up for hearing before the bench of 5 Supreme Court Judges chaired by Chief Justice Priyasath Dep.
 
The President Counsel further stated that Baratha Lakshman’s bodyguard, Gamini fired gunshots at former MP Duminda Silva while he was turning back to leave the scene and this episode of shooting by Gamini led to every other subsequent incident.
 
President Counsel Anuja Premarathna reiterated today several factors that were agreed upon by all including the Attorney General’s Department.
 
The factors agreed with the Attorney General’s department are:
 


Duminda Silva sustained gunshots injuries first 




Baratha Lakshman’s bodyguard, Gamini fired two gunshots to Duminda Silva’s head 




Soon after he received gunshots, Duminda Silva was fatally injured and was removed from the scene and rushed to the hospital


 
President Counsel, Anuja Premarathna stated although all the parties including the Attorney General’s Department admitted that Duminda Silva was first shot. The majority trial at bar judgment had ignored this important fact.
 
President council said it is surprising to note that the majority judgment by Honorable Padmini Ranawaka stated that a case has been filed against Gamini for causing grievous hurt to Former MP Duminda Silva when there is no such case filed at all.
 
He questioned how the honorable judge arrive at such a conclusion, as nothing of this sort was revealed in evidence.
 
The President Counsel further pointed out that the Baratha Lakshman’s faction started the shooting as Duminda Silva was turning to leave the scene.
 
He said that every incident erupted because Baratha Lakshman’s bodyguard, Gamini started the shooting.
 
The President Counsel further stated that both factions would have dispersed if Baratha Lakshman's faction hadn’t fired gunshots injuring Duminda Silva.
 
He emphasized that when Duminda Silva Arrived at the scene no one including Duminda Silva would have ever imagined that Gamini will fire at Duminda Silva and as such the origin of the incident was sudden.
 
Under these circumstances, any charges if at all should be directed as personal and individual.
 
Further, it was pointed out that the prosecution had failed to prove who had shot at Baratha faction when they were running away after shooting Duminda Silva.
 
Meanwhile, President Counsel, Anura Meddegoda stated that the investigators have fabricated a story on the recovery of firearms with an intention to falsely implicate Duminda Silva.
 
He pointed out that the accused from whom recovery of such firearms was made had been wrongly arrested at the Airport and, the investigators had forced him to place his signature on blank papers.
 
The President Counsel pointed out that it is questionable how charges against Duminda Silva for using firearms had been filed.
 
In addition, President Counsel Saliya Peries stated that he too agreed with the submissions made previously by his two fellow President Counsels.
 
The oral submissions were concluded today and, Chief Justice Priyasath Dep stated that the written submissions should be filed before August 10th.
 
The bench of five Supreme Court Judges led by Chief Justice, Priyasath Dep advised the Attorney general and the defense counsels to address the written submissions to include matters relating to:
 


Factual and legal discrepancies and misdirections in the judgment of the high court 




Draw the attention of court on the omissions and contradictions in evidence that has not been considered by the high court 




Whether the high court order is in accordance with the requirements of the law 




Address court on legal implications of the unlawful assembly 




Legality of the evidence placed regarding a purported recovery of firearms 



Shooting incident at Himbutana

The suspect has been identified and he had fled the area.

heading: Fatal accident in Maggona, ten injured
content:
10 persons have injured in a road accident in Maggona, Kalutara.
Police said the accident had occurred at around 9.45 pm yesterday when a van collided with a private bus.
The injured persons were admitted to Nagoda Hospital and two persons were transferred to National Hospital, Colombo as their condition was serious.
Police said that the van which was driven at excessive speed has caused this accident..

heading: Mahanama & Dissanayake further remanded

President's Ex-Chief of Staff I. H. K. Mahanama and Former Chairman of State Timber Corporation P. Dissanayaka have been further remanded till 24th of July.

heading: Update : 10 visitors stranded inside Wangedikanda forest reserve, rescued
content:
The group of ten people who were stranded inside the Wangedikanda forest reserve has been rescued.They were rescued by the soldiers from the Diyathalawa Army Camp.Update: Friday, 13 May 2018 - 16.49--------------------------------------------------------------------Fire in Wangedikanda reserve, 10 visitors stranded inside10 persons who had entered the Wangedikanda reserve in Haldummulla, Badulla for sight-seeing, have stranded inside due to a wildfire spreading across the reserve.
 
Badulla District Disaster Management Unit said already a group of soldiers from the Diyathalawa Army Camp has been deployed to save them.

content: The Registrar of Pesticides has lifted the ban on Glyphosate for all crops throughout the country through a Special Gazette dated  11th of July.In October 2015, the government issued a Gazette banning the use of glyphosate.With this new Gazette, the previous Gazette will become null and void.

heading: Parliament to debate Sri Lanka- Singapore FTA
content:
A five-hour debate is scheduled to be held today (Jul 17) regarding the Sri Lanka – Singapore Free Trade Agreement.
 
This agreement has been the topic of much focus in the political arena over the past few days.
 
Joint Opposition Leader MP Dinesh Gunawardena is scheduled to present the motion in Parliament.
 
Deputy Parliamentary Secretary General Neil Iddawela said that the matter would be taken up today as an adjournment debate.

heading: Glyphosate ban lifted for only tea & rubber says Registrar of Pesticides
content: Joint Cabinet Spokesperson Minister Dr. Rajitha Senaratne pointed out that the Registrar of Pesticides does not have the authority to lift the ban on the glyphosate, disregarding cabinet decisions. Issuing a communiqué, Minister Senaratne pointed out that cabinet had approved to lift the ban on the glyphosate for only the tea and rubber industries.Previously, the Registrar of Pesticides issued an extraordinary gazette, lifting the ban on glyphosate for all the crops.When questioned by our news team, the Registrar of Pesticides Professor J. A. Sumith stated that a gazette will be issued, reinstating the ban on glyphosate for other crops except for tea and rubber.

heading: Camps will not remove, says Army Commander
content:
Army Commander Lt. Gen. Mahesh Senanayake stressed that none of the military camps in the country will be closed down.
Issuing a statement, the Army Commander said that at times the opportunistic politicians and certain media spread wrong information on Army's contribution for the country's forward march.
He said that it is a common strategy to use the military personnel to engage in administrative duties for field duties.
It was done to enhance their productivity, the Army Commander said.
He said through that regiments will not be abolished but those are amalgamated with others in an equal manner.
Lt. Gen. Senanayake stressed that Sri Lanka Army will never implement any decision that will threaten the national security.

heading: Construction projects in Knuckles halted
content:
The Chairman of the State Plantation Corporation, Thilak Mahanama says that they have decided to cancel certain projects at the Knuckles range.
 
Addressing a media conference held at the Central Environment Authority, he said the decision was taken after it was found that the acquired lands for these projects are within the Knuckles forest reserve.
 
The Knuckles reserve is the first ever conserved forest in Sri Lanka and the 4th on the list of World Heritage forests.
 
Environmental activists and the media emphasized the need to protect the forest from recent politically backed projects and vandalism.
 
The Minister of Public Enterprise and Kandy Development Lakshman Kiriella recently refuted the allegations that the Knuckles forest range is being destroyed by people with political backing.
 
However, addressing the media at the Central Environmental Authority yesterday, the Chairman of the State Plantation Corporation Thilak Mahanama said that he had instructed the ongoing constructions at the Knuckles range to be suspended.

heading: Protest in Lunugamvehera against proposed elephant fence
content:
Residents from four villages in Devramvehera and Lunugamwehera staged a protest this morning (Jul 13) saying that authorities are planning to erect an elephant fence across their farmlands.
 
The protesters blocked the Matara - Wellawaya road at the 70th Post in Devramvehera this morning.
 
Our correspondent stated that the protesters dispersed after Lunugamwehera Divisional Secretary promised to find a solution.
 
Meanwhile, the operation launched to drive away elephants from Suriyawewa was successful.
 
But Walawa Left Bank Joint Farmers' Union stated that there are defects in the electric fence, which was erected to prevent the return of elephant to human habitat.
 
The farmers' union, President S.K. Mahinda said that the wildlife officials are responsible for the defects.

heading: Leading Buddhist monk expresses views on death penalty

Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa and former Defence Secretary Gotabhaya Rajapaksa also attended the event.

heading: No doctors at hospital, father & son die in accident
content:
The health authorities have commenced an investigation as it was found that no doctors were on duty at the Thammannawa Hospital to treat when two accident victims were brought for medical treatment.
The incident had occurred yesterday.
At around 4.15 pm, a motorbike travelling on the Anuradhapura - Trincomalee road had veered off the road at hit a lamp post at the Ambagahawela Junction.
Three of the same family, father, mother, and son were critically injured in the mishap.
However, when the injured were taken to the Thammannawa Hospital, the villagers accused that there were no doctors on duty to accept the injured.
Then they were taken to Mihintale Hospital and while they were being taken, the son and his father had passed away.

heading: ETI chaos : Depositors charges Central Bank

The depositors say they do not have any trust about the investor.

content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa points out that a special court is unnecessary when the country’s current judicial system is functioning efficiently.He made this statement while answering questions raised by journalists during his visit to a temple in Piliyandala.

heading: Police to probe an incident where an infant is given alcohol
content: At a time when everybody is demanding and promising to create a disciplined and well-mannered society, the video footage of an incident which does not augur well for that is being shared in the social media platforms.That footage clearly shows an individual while taking part in a party with a group of friends is feeding an infant sitting on his lap, something similar to liquor.They also talk in improper language and the question is why did they allow a small child who does not understand any of these, is taken to such a place.Can we imagine the future of those children, when they are exposed to such environments?In a country, where we have a number of institutions to prevent such actions, those institutions should take immediate steps to find those perpetrators.When contacted Police Spokesperson SP Ruwan Gunasekera said action will be taken against the perpetrators.rnrn

content:
President Maithripala Sirisena has arrived in Georgia to attend the fifth Session of Open Government Partnership.
 
The President arrived in the Shota Rustavelli International Airport in Tbilisi, the Georgian capital, where he was welcomed by the Deputy Foreign Minister of Georgia, George Sharvashidze.

Six girls who had been summoned to police to make preliminary investigations into a complaint had clashed with each other inside the police station.

The police had summoned the girls after it received a complaint about an incident where each other had traded bad language and indecent photos via the Facebook.
 
When a police officer inquired about this from the girls, they had started to attack each other.
 
A police source said the clash was quelled after a great difficulty.
 
Later, police arrested them all and produced before the Kurunegala Magistrate Court.
 
They were released on cash sureties of Rs. 1,000 each.

heading: Fake passport racket in Tamil Nadu: Sri Lankans helped fly abroad as Indians
content:
Tamil Nadu Police have busted a fake passport racket in Tamil Nadu, which helped Sri Lankan nationals fly abroad as Indian citizens.
Two Sri Lankans, including a 38-year-old woman, suspected to be part of the racket, have been arrested.
Earlier, the crime branch wing had arrested 11 people, including a travel agent, for allegedly preparing fake passports by collecting up to INR 1 million from Sri Lankan nationals.
Police said investigations revealed that the woman had come to Tamil Nadu from Sri Lanka on a tourist visa some time back and had been over-staying.
She had sought the help of the travel agent, who prepared a fake passport for her.
Her accomplice, who also possessed a Sri Lankan passport, managed to get a fake Aadhar card for her, police said.
The woman and her accomplice were arrested from a house in the city on Friday and produced before a local court, which later sent them to Puzhal central prison.
Describing the modus operandi, police said the travel agent used to prepare fake Indian passports for Sri Lankan nationals, based on the information he received from his aide in Colombo.
The man, with the help of his gang, collected expired passports from people of economically weaker sections and sold them to Sri Lankan nationals as valid Indian passports for a monetary consideration.
Police also recovered 77 Indian passports, 12 Sri Lankan passports and machines used to prepare them and cash in INR 85,000.(Deccan Chronicles)

When contacted an MP who was a member of the Committee said they discussed the disciplinary issue of MP Ranaweera at length.

heading: Good news for Sri Lankan health authorities
content:
Sri Lankans each year struggle to cope up with mosquito-borne diseases after monsoon seasons each year.
 
Dengue is the most dangerous disease, feared by the Sri Lankans.
 
Now, the health authorities can seek the help of a team from Queensland experts who had done the experiment.
 
The landmark experiment saw more than 80 percent of deadly disease-carrying mosquitoes being wiped out from an Australian town.
 
Scientists sterilized millions of killer Aedes aegypti mosquitoes, considered one of the world's most dangerous pests.
 
The results of the experiment see the Australian team now hoping they have a way of tackling the insects which are spreading across the world with global warming.
 
Millions of people around the world are infected each year by the mosquito, which can carry dengue, Zika, and chikungunya, among other killer bugs.
 
Zika is an 'urgent' threat to humanity, while the other two pose 'major' danger, says the World Health Organization.
 
Australian researchers purposely bred around 20 million non-biting male Aedes aegypti mosquitoes for the experiment.
 
The mosquitoes, which have white markings on their legs, were then infected with the Wolbachia bacteria, which renders them sterile.
 
The killer insects, which have white markings on their legs, were infected with the Wolbachia bacteria, which renders them sterile.
 
Scientists released them into the wild at trial sites around Innisfail, a town with a population of around 7,000 in northern Queensland.
 
Over the course of three months, they mated with females who laid eggs that did not hatch - causing the population to plummet.
 
The trial, described as a victory by the researchers, was funded by Google's parent company Alphabet.
 
It was led by experts from The Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organisation and James Cook University.
 
Speaking about the study, Dr. Kyran Staunton, a researcher involved in the study from James Cook University, said, “We learned a lot from collaborating on this first topical trial.”
 
He further added, “We're excited to see how this approach might be applied in other regions where Aedes aegypti poses a threat to life and health.”
 
The process, known as the Sterile Insect Technique has been used successfully by scientists since the 1950s.
 
But this was the first time researchers had been able to use it against Aedes aegypti mosquitoes.

heading: Death sentence or GSP+? EU warns
content:
Media reports citing the European Union diplomatic sources say that if Sri Lanka is to implement the death penalty, the nation will lose the concessionary GSP+ provided by the European Union.
 
Further, it had noted that the GSP+ concession is provided for developing countries as a measure to encourage respecting human rights.
 
Sri Lanka was initially awarded the trading facility by the EU bloc following the 2004 Boxing Day Tsunami.
 
However, the facility was revoked in 2010 after the previous regime did not agree to accept the condition laid by the EU to renew the GSP+.
 
Sri Lanka obtained GSP+ following a 7-year hiatus following a thorough process after the current government came into power in 2015.
 
The EU diplomats believe that Sri Lanka receives an economic benefit of nearly 300 million euros through the GSP+ concession.
 
According to the United Kingdom's Annual Human Rights Repor,t 2017 released by the UK Foreign and Commonwealth Office, Sri Lanka remains a priority country.
 
The British High Commission in Sri Lanka said in a press statement that Sri Lanka is one of 30 'Human Rights Priority Countries' ;those countries being nations  where the UK has human rights concerns and hopes to engage positively to develop human rights performance,
 
The report acknowledges that there has been limited progress in the area of human rights in Sri Lanka.

heading: Woman agrees to accept hangman's post
content:
The Ministry of Justice says the details of the death-row drug convicts will be fully scrutinized.
The Department of Prisons said yesterday that names of 18 convicted drug traffickers were sent to the Ministry of Justice.
Foreigners are also among those criminals.
The Ministry said it will also look into the charges against them and whether they have filed appeals against their convictions.
Meanwhile, a 71-year-old woman from Arachchikattuwa, Chilaw says that she is ready to accept the post of hangman without a wage.
The local media reported as the woman was saying that she would be able to do something good for the society through this.Meanwhile, the Delegation of the European Union, the missions of the EU Member States in Sri Lanka as well as the diplomatic missions of the Governments of Canada and Norway in Sri Lanka have written to President Maithripala Sirisena to verify the worrying information in the public domain about the intention of the Sri Lankan government to resume implementing the death penalty after a moratorium of more than 40 years.

Those diplomatic missions have made known in their letter that they strongly and unequivocally oppose capital punishment in all circumstances and in all cases. 
The death penalty is incompatible with human dignity, does not have any proven deterrent effect, and allows judicial errors to become fatal and irreversible, a statement by the EU Delegation in Colombo said.
The diplomatic missions have requested the President to maintain the moratorium on the implementation of the death penalty and to uphold Sri Lanka's tradition of opposition to capital punishment.

heading: MP Ranaweera to appear before Parliamentary Committee on Privileges
content:
Joint Opposition MP Prasanna Ranaweera is scheduled to appear before the Parliamentary Privileges Committee today.
 
He is accused of unruly behavior in Parliament urging the Speaker to take action against MP Vijayakala Maheshwaran for making a pro-LTTE statement in Jaffna.

content:

heading: Malaysian politician questioned over alleged LTTE links
content:
Malaysian Police have recorded Penang Deputy Chief Minister II P Ramasamy’s statement on his alleged links with now defunct Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam.
 
State police Chief Datuk Seri A Thaiveegan said the Dap politician was called in on Tuesday following numerous reports that had been lodged against the latter.
 
“He was called to have his statement recorded and he co-operated with us,” he said, adding the case was also being handled by the Bukit Aman police headquarters as the reports against Ramasamy were lodged in various states.
 
Earlier, Inspector-General of Police Tan Sri Mohamad Fuzi Harun said police had received 53 reports against Ramasamy over the latter’s alleged ties with Tamil Nadu politician and vocal LTTE supporter V. Gopalasamy, or Vaiko.
 
He said the reports were lodged in various parts of the country, and that Ramasamy himself had lodged a counter-report.
 
“Initially, the case was being handled by Penang police. However, because it is now a case of national interest, it has been taken over by Bukit Aman’s Special Investigations Unit,” he told reporters after a ceremony at which police received expressway patrol vehicles at Persada Plus.
 
The LTTE, founded in northeastern Sri Lanka in 1976, waged a secessionist insurgency for a Tamil state in the South Asian country and was declared a terrorist organization by the United Nations.
 
On Saturday, Ramasamy caused controversy when he uploaded a picture of himself posing with Vaiko onto his Facebook page. The picture was taken when Vaiko attended a wedding in Penang.
 
In June last year, Vaiko had been detained by Immigration officers at the Kuala Lumpur International Airport and barred from entering the country.
 
However, on Monday, Immigration director-general Datuk Seri Mustafar Ali had confirmed that Vaiko’s name had already been dropped from the blacklist and he was no longer barred from entering Malaysia.

heading: Life expectancy of Sri Lankans improves
content:
The life expectancy of a Sri Lankan male has increased to 79.
 
The Ministry of Health also stated that a women’s life expectancy is higher than their male counterparts.
 
The birth rate, however, remains at a low level, thereby leading to the younger population notably decreasing.
 
 Director of Youth, Elders and Differently-abled, Dr. Ananda Jayalal said that economic and health issues are likely to increase as a result.
 
At the same time, a World Bank report released on primary health in Sri Lanka stated that the population over 60 would double within the next 25 years.

heading: Police protection for Galle Intl. Cricket Stadium
content:
It has been confirmed that special police protection has been put in place around Galle International Cricket Stadium.
 
A senior police officer stated precautions have been taken to avoid any issues that might crop up while removing the buildings around the stadium.
 
Meanwhile, Galle Mayor Priyantha Sahabandu stated that a request was made to provide security considering the current situation.
 
Contrary to this, Galle International Cricket Stadium's Administrative Officer, Western Province Sports Association's Secretary Anura Weerasinghe revealed that although it was said that preparations were underway to demolish the building around the Galle International Cricket Stadium and reconstruct new buildings nearby, no such plans are still in place.

heading: SIM cards seized from Aloysius’s prison cell reveal details leading to different crimes
content:
The Attorney General’s Department informed the court today (Jul 19) that the SIM cards found in the prison cell of Arjun Aloysius have revealed details on various crimes.
This was disclosed when the controversial Central Bank Bond Scam case was taken up before the Colombo Fort Magistrate, Lanka Jayaratne.
The Senior Deputy Solicitor General who appeared for the Attorney General's Department told the court that steps would be taken to make submissions to relevant courts, after conducting a proper investigation with regard to those SIM cards.
Meanwhile, the Attorney General’s Department informed the court today that Perpetual Treasuries Limited has conducted illegally as a primary dealer in Central Bank bond transactions.
Senior Deputy Solicitor General Haripriya Jayasundera told the court that Perpetual Treasuries has violated the Financial Act through those actions.
She also said that Perpetual Treasuries Limited has been ordered to provide the information about the third party to which the bond scam money was remitted.
She said the chairman of that group of companies, Jeffrey Aloysius has not done it as yet.
At that juncture, Attorney-at-Law, Jeevantha Jayathilaka who appeared for Jeffrey Aloysius informed the court that the CID has already taken into their custody the documents and computers of that company.
He said, therefore, the company has found it difficult to provide the required information.
He further told the court that only some furniture is left in the company office at the moment and its staff does not report for work as the company has no money to pay their salaries.
Meanwhile, Perpetual Treasuries owner Arjun Aloysius and his CEO Kasun Palisena who are in prison in connection with the Central Bank Bond scam were further remanded until 2nd of August.

content:

content:
The Department of Meteorology says that the low-lying areas in the coast extending from Puttalam to Batticaloa via Colombo and Galle may become rough and may experience surges from 24th of July to 26th due to the effect of swell waves, having 3.0 - 3.5-meter height.

content:
Police Narcotics Bureau has arrested a suspect in Welikada while having in possession of more than 200 grams of heroin valued at around Rs. 2.4 million.
 
The arrest was made last night (Jul 23).

heading: Railway technical staff to resort to work-to-rule
content:
The railway technical staff and assistants say they will resort to a work-to-rule campaign from tomorrow midnight (Jul 22).
 
They have cited several job-related issues as the reason for the trade union action.

content:
The water-filling of Kalu Ganga under the Kalu Ganga- Moragahakanda project was inaugurated by President Maithripala Sirisena today (Jul 23).
 
Kalu Ganga reservoir has been built by blocking the Kalu Ganga at Laggala and Pallegama areas.
 
The capacity of the reservoir is 248 million cubic meters.The capacity of Kalu Ganga reservoir is 265 million cubic meters and will divert 100 million cubic meters a year to the Moragahakanda Reservoir. The reservoir will irrigate 3,000 hectares in the Kalu Ganga basin.

heading: Special unit to thwart corruption in Moragahakanda project

The President said this addressing a ceremony to launch the water-filling of Moragahakanda - Kalu Ganga reservoir this morning (Jul 23).

heading: Court seeks details from a private bank relating to alleged financial transactions
content:
Colombo Chief Magistrate Ranga Dissanayake has ordered that bank reports required for an investigation relating to cheques that were released during the last presidential election, be handed over to the Police Special Investigation Unit.
 
It was related to Rs. 11.5 billion that were allegedly removed from Temple Trees within a few days prior to the last presidential election.
 
The order was issued to a leading commercial bank.
 
The unit led evidence before the court and according to investigations carried out regarding the incident, between 20th of November 2014 and  8th of January 2015,  eighty-two suspicious cheques worth almost Rs. 10 billion had been released from the relevant bank.

heading: British parliament suspends MP Paisley for visiting Sri Lanka under state sponsorship
content:
British MP, Ian Paisley Jr. has been suspended for a month for allegedly touring Sri Lanka on a trip sponsored by the Sri Lankan government.
 
He was charged for visiting Sri Lanka with his family in 2013, without obtaining approval from the British government.
 
It was revealed that the Sri Lankan government spent 100,000 Sterling Pounds on his trip.
 
An investigation into the allegations has led to the MP being suspended for a month, beginning from 4th of September.
 
MP Ian Paisley Junior wrote to former British Prime Minister, David Cameron in 2014 objecting the proposal made to the UN against Sri Lanka.
 
The British media reported earlier that MP Paisley Junior met top government representatives of the then regime of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa during his tour of the island.
 
The UK Prime Minister, Theresa May is facing political issues over the suspension of MP, Ian Paisley as the voters of his constituent have asked for a by-election.

content:

US dollars, Hong Kong dollars, and Indian rupees were among the currency notes that were detected.
