The postal strike completes 16 days today.Meanwhile, discussions with the authorities failed today as well.Consequent to the strike, payments to elders and other needy including kidney patients have been affected.

heading: Husband who killed his wife & mother-in-law arrested
content:
The suspect who had recently murdered his wife and mother-in-law using a sharp object inside their home at Waga, in Welipillewa, Padukka has been arrested.
 
He was arrested while hiding in Welikanda.
 
Police said that the 33-year-old person had fled the area after committing the murders on 19th of this month.

heading: A change in the team of 16, following meet up with Basil
content: Member of the group of 16 SLFP MPs who left the government, MP T. B. Ekanayake said that he would not participate in the SLFP Central Committee in the future.He said so expressing his views to the media after a discussion held with the Sri Lanka Podujana Front yesterday.Similarly MP Lakshman Yapa Abeywardhana who participated in the discussion said he had also received an invitation to attend the joint opposition meeting due to be held next Monday. While 9 of the SLFP group of 16 participated in the discussion held last afternoon, seven MPs including S. B. Dissanayake, Dilan Perera and Dayasiri Jayasekera did not participate in the meeting.Although Podujana Front Chairman Professor G. L. Peiris and former Minister Basil Rajapaksa participated in the discussion representing the Podujana Front, they did not express their views to media.A senior SLFP Assistant chairman, Minister Sarath Amunugama says that the group of 16 SLFP MPs who left the Government should take a decision regarding party posts.The Minister said so expressing his views to media after a function held in Kandy yesterday.

heading: Makandure Madush’s main accomplice in the South, gunned down by STF
content:
Police urge two of the three civilians who came forward to assist the injured police officers during the recent robbery of a jewellery shop in Matara to come to the Matara Police Superintendent’s office.
Three persons, without considering their own safety, came forward to take the critically injured policeman to the hospital. 
One of them has already reported to the Matara Police Superintendent’s office. 
Police Media Spokesperson SP Ruwan Gunasekera said that a decision has been taken to financially award the three civilians for their brave act.

Meanwhile, Manel Rohana alias Thilak,  underworld kingpin Makandure Madush’s main accomplice in the South, was shot dead by the STF at Kamburupituya in Matara last evening (Jun 25).
 
A team of Special Task Force launched a search operation after they were tipped off that an armed gang was roaming in the Kamburupitiya area in Matara.
 
The Police Media Spokesperson’s Office said that STF officers had ordered a three-wheeler speeding towards Kamburupitiya to stop, however, the driver chose to ignore the order.
 
Subsequently after pursuing the three-wheeler, into a nearby forest and the members of the STF were shot at.
 
Following the exchange of gunfire, the STF found a gunman who was
Manel Rohana alias Thilak, one of the main accomplices of underworld leader Makandura Madhush.
 
The STF also recovered a T – 56 firearm in the suspect’s possession.
 
Police Media Spokesperson SP Ruwan Gunasekera said that a special search operation was launched last night to have the other suspects apprehended.

heading: Wild elephant gives chase to Deputy Minister (Photos)
content:
A wild elephant gave chase to a team of officials and Deputy Minister Palitha Thewarapperuma nearby the Iddapichcha Tank in Dimbulagala.
 
The Deputy Minister along with Weheragala Wildlife officials and a police team had gone to this area to inspect an injured wild elephant in the area.
 
When the team arrived there, the animal got up suddenly and gave chase to the people including the Deputy Minister.

heading: Liquor shops in Anuradhapura to be closed for one week
content:
Department of Excise says that the liquor shops in Anuradhapura will be closed during the Poson Week.
 
The Assistant Excise Commissioner of Anuradhapura, R. M. Ratnayake said raids will be carried out starting from today (Jun 26) to apprehend those who sell liquor illegally.
 
He said that they have received information that liquor is sold illegally at lodging places and nearby the locations where pilgrims used to bath.

heading: Chief Minister of the Northern Province should step down, says opposition leader
content:
The leader of the Opposition of the Northern Province, S. Thawaraasa says that the Chief Minister of the Province, C. V. Vigneswaran should step down from his post.
 
He made this comment speaking to media in Jaffna yesterday (Jun 29).
 
The Court of Appeal yesterday issued an interim injunction suspending the directive issued by the Chief Minister of the Northern Province, C. V. Vigneswaran, removing the Provincial Minister of Transport and Fisheries, B. Deneshwaran.
 
The interim injunction was issued following the petition filed by the former minister, B. Deneshwaran.
 
The Chief Minister issued the directives last year August removing the minister from his portfolio.
 
Meanwhile, speaking at a conference in Kandy, TNA MP M. A. Sumanthiran stated that the appointment of C. V. Vigneswaran as the Chief Minister of the Northern Province is a failed experiment.

heading: SLFP wants to have PC elections soon
content:
General Secretary of the SLFP, Professor Rohana Lakshman Piyadasa says even though the SLFP agreed to sign a document in support of holding the provincial council election soon, an encouraging feedback was not received from other political parties.
 
He made this comment in response to questions raised by journalists following a ceremony held in Katukale in Kandy this morning (Jun 30).

heading: SLFP Gen. Sec. says fmr. President cannot be made Co-Chairperson
content:
The General Secretary of the SLFP, Professor Rohana Lakshman Piyadasa stated that former President Mahinda Rajapaksa cannot be made a Co-Chairperson of the party.
 
He said this after speaking to media following a ceremony held in Katukale in Kandy this morning (Jun 30).

heading: Two more remanded over murder of Jaffna girl
content:
The two suspects who were arrested over the murder of a 6-year-old girl in Sulipuram area were remanded until 11th of next month.
They were produced before Mallakam Magistrate today (Jun 30).
A Senior Police Officer in the Northern Province said that it is believed that the two 17-year-olds were directly involved in the killing of the girl.
On the 27th of this month, a 22-year-old was arrested over the murder and it was revealed that he was a relative of the little girl.
He was also remanded until 11th of July.
The suspects had lured the child to a nearby forest on the pretext of showing her birds and had abused the child.
When the girl became unconscious, they have thrown her to a nearby well.

heading: STF launch operation in Wilpita forest in Akuressa
content:
The Special Task Force has launched a strike in the Wilpita Forest Reserve in Akuressa to locate the two underworld gangsters who had fled following a clash with the STF last night.
Police Media Spokesperson, SP, Ruwan Gunasekera said that one of the notorious underworld members in the South, Manel Rohana alias Thilak was killed during the shooting.Thilak is believed to be one of the closest associates of an underworld kingpin, Makandure Madush.
Acting on a tip-off, STF set up a roadblock to apprehend an armed gang travelling in a three-wheeler from Akuressa to Kamburupitiya.However, the three-wheeler sped away neglecting the police order to stop.
Later, the three-wheeler diverted towards Wilpita forest reserve and suspect, Thilak had opened fire at the STF.
Then during the exchange of fire, the suspect received gunshot injuries and, he succumbed to injuries at Kamburupitiya Hospital.
The other two suspects have fled into the forest during the melee.
Police discovered a T-56 weapon from the forest.

heading: ETI depositors continue to suffer
content:
The depositors of the ETI Finance gathered at the Head Office of the company hoping that they would get their money today.
 
However, they did not get anything.
 
They accused that the facts revealed by the Central Bank and ETI owners on the ETI Finance are conflicting.
 
ETI Finance is a subsidiary of EAP Group.
 
The ETI depositors gathered at the ETI premises for an 11th occasion today and the management of the company also attended the meeting.
 
A tense situation arose between the two parties here.

heading: Misappropriation of state vehicle : Case against Fowzie postponed
content:
The case against former Minister of Disaster Management, A. H. M. Fowzie who is accused of misappropriating a state vehicle worth over Rs. 20 million was postponed to 11th of September.
 
The case was taken up before Colombo Chief Magistrate Ranga Dissanayake and the former Secretary to the Ministry of Disaster Management gave evidence today (Jun 25).
 
Here, she said that the relevant vehicle was provided to the Ministry by the government of Netherland.
 
She said four vehicles including that vehicle were given to the then Minister and of that only three vehicles were returned.

heading: Shooting in Ratmalana, soldier injured
content:
An army corporal was injured in a shooting incident in Chakindarama area in Ratmalana.
 
Police Media Spokesperson's Office said that the shooting took place at around 7.20 am today nearby a residence of a lieutenant colonel.
 
The gunmen had arrived in a three-wheeler and on a motorcycle.
 
Meanwhile, two unidentified persons shot at a person in Jampettah Street in Kotahena at around 9.15 last night.
 
The injured person was a shop owner and a resident in the area.
 
Police believe that the shooting was a result of a personal dispute.

heading: A message for striking postal workers
content:
The Post Master General is requesting the postal workers who are unable to report to work to their assigned post office, to report to the office of nearest Postal Superintendent.
 
Issuing a communique, he said arrangements have been made to provide transport facilities to such workers.
 
Post Master General Rohana Abeyratne said there were reports of obstructions and harassment to postal employees who are willing to return to work.
 
The striking postal unions held a discussion with the authorities yesterday (Jun 25) and that too ended without a compromise.
 
The strike launched by the postal workers seeking a specific service constitution for the Postal Department continues for a 16th day today.

heading: Prices of a cup of tea & plain tea reduced
content:
The prices of a cup of tea and plain tea have been reduced by Rs. 5.
 
It will be effective from tomorrow.
 
It was announced in line with yesterday's reduction of domestic gas price by Rs. 138 for a 12.5kg cylinder.

heading: Arrest warrant issued against Sarana Gunawardena
content:
Colombo Fort Magistrate has issued an arrest warrant against former Deputy Minister Sarana Gunawardena.
 
It was issued after he was not present in the court today (Jun 25) in relating to a case involving misappropriation of a vehicle.
 
This case has been moved against him for allegely misappropriating a Rs. 8 million worth vehicle while he was the Chairman of the Development Lotteries Board.

heading: Eravur accident kills two including a child (Photos)
content:
Two persons were killed and three others injured when a bus collided head-on with a van in Eravur on the Batticaloa - Trincomalee main road last night (Jun 25).
 
Police said the van driver and a child who was travelling in the van were killed.
 
The victims were residents of Batticaloa. The child was aged 11 and the driver was a 25-year-old.
 
It was found that the bus driver had fled the area following the mishap and police commenced an operation to apprehend him.

heading: Wild elephant attack kills woman in Meegalewa
content:
A woman was killed in a wild elephant attack in Pothanegama in Meegalewa yesterday (Jun 25).
 
She was a 61-year-old.
 
Police said that the victim was walking towards her sister's house when she was attacked by the elephant.
 
During the recent few weeks, more than 10 people had killed in wild elephant attacks.

heading: Mini Uzi weapon used in Matara robbery sent to Government Analyst
content:
The mini uzi weapon used by the robbers of the Matara jewellery shop heist has been sent to Government Analyst.It is stated that an investigation has been initiated already as to how a weapon being used only by VIP security personnel is in the possession of the underworld groups.
 
It is also stated that the suspects have altered the serial number of the weapon.
 
It is significant that mini-uzi weapons are currently manufactured only by Israel.
 
This latest gun has the capacity to shoot 600, 9-millimeter bullets per minute.
 
Meanwhile, the business community of the Matara town has decided to offer two million rupees to the family of Sergeant Suranga Pradeep Weerasinghe in appreciation of his bravery.
 
In addition, they have volunteered to look after the education of the two children of the late police Sergeant Weerasinghe.Meanwhile, three civilians who came forward to assist in hospitalizing the injured policemen, while gunmen were still in the vicinity, have been felicitated by the police.A ceremony to recognized their bravery was held at Matara police superintendent's office this morning.

heading: National Transport Commission threatens to suspend route permits of Southern long-distance bus operators
content:
The National Transport Commission has requested that Southern Province’s long distance private bus operators call off their strike.
 
Otherwise, the NTC says that the route permits of the striking bus operators will be suspended.
 
The long-distance bus operators launched the strike yesterday (Jun 25) after they were not permitted to stop at short distance bus halts.
 
Due to the strike passengers and office staff heading to Colombo are being inconvenienced.
 
The Chairman of the National Transport Commission M. A. P. Hemachandra urges the bus operators to resume their services today to avoid their route permits being suspended.

heading: Decision on Provincial Council Election to be taken within one week
content:
The Election Commission chairman, Mahinda Deshapriya quoted the Speaker and the ministers as saying that necessary steps to hold provincial council election will be taken next month.
The Commission chairman Deshapriya was speaking to the media after having a discussion with the speaker, provincial council, and local government minister, Faizer Mustapha and Delimitation Commission chairman K. Tavalingam at the parliament complex today (Jun 28).
An adjournment debate has been scheduled for July 5th and, the speaker has informed the Delimitation Committee to draw its attention to the views to be expressed by the MPs during the debate.
All participants have emphasized the need to hold provincial council election without delay and, the attention was drawn under what method the election is conducted.

heading: Part of jewellery stolen from Matara found
content: A part of jewellery hidden by 'Habarakada Wasantha' after Matara robbery found.Four more arrested, including his father and mother.

heading: Teachers to launch a strike in July
content:
Principals and teachers of public schools are planning to go on sick leave on 4th of July as a trade union action against making appointments in the education sector violating service cadre.
 
Its convener, Joseph Stalin stated that the government is making such appointments saying that the appointees are political victims.
 
 
The Secretary of Lanka Teacher Services' Association, Mahinda Jayasinghe stated that his union also would be taking part in the strike action.

heading: Domestic gas prices reduced from midnight
content: Price of a domestic gas cylinder (12.5kg) will be reduced by Rs.138 from midnight today.

heading: Rs. 6 million worth gold found from Habarakada Wasantha
content:
Police Media Spokesperson SP Ruwan Gunasekara says that 75 gold chains hidden by Habarakada Wasantha who fled after robbing the Matara Jewellery shop have been found.
 
He said that the gold items were worth nearly 6 million rupees and they were found after Habarakada Wasantha’s wife was arrested and interrogated.
 
The jewellery had been buried in the garden of a house in Homagama, Habarakada.
 
Meanwhile, the STF stated that 5 persons including the wife, mother, and father of the suspect are detained further for questioning.
 
Meanwhile, a revolver, four live bullets and two empty ammunition casings were also recovered.
 
Police Media Spokesperson stated that investigations are been carried out to arrest Habarakada Wasantha.

heading: Wild elephant attack kills villager
content:
A 42-year-old person was killed in a wild elephant attack in Uttimaduwa area in Thirappane last night (Jun 27).
 
Police said that the victim came under attack while he was travelling on a tractor.
 
He was a resident of Pallama in Madurankuliya.

heading: MP Bandula visits Finance Ministry
content:
Joint Opposition MPs, Dr. Bandula Gunawardana and Sisira Jayakody visited the Finance Ministry once again today (Jun 28).
 
Earlier, they had demanded that they will be given information about the cost of advertisements published by the ministry.
 
The Opposition MPs had made this demand two weeks ago, from the Ministry Secretary, Dr. R.H.S. Samaratunga under the Right to Information Act.
 
The secretary had told the MPs that they would be given the information by today.

heading: 17 snakes including pythons found in Rajagiriya
content:
The Wildlife Conservation Department arrested an individual for having in his possession nearly 17 species of snakes.
The suspect is a resident of Rajagiriya.
Two pythons were also among the snakes found.
Later one suspect was produced before courts and he was released on a cash surety of Rs. 50,000.
The charges will be filed against the suspect and the case will be heard on 7th of September.
The snakes will be handed over to Zoological Garden in Dehiwela until the case is over.

heading: Two more arrested over killing of Jaffna little girl
content:
Two more persons have been arrested over the brutal abuse and killing of a 6-year-old school girl in the Sulipuram area in Jaffna.
 
A Senior Police Officer in the Northern Province said that it is believed that the two 17-year-olds were directly involved in the killing of the girl.
 
On the 27th of this month, a 22-year-old was arrested over the murder and it was revealed that he was a relative of the little girl.
 
The suspect had lured the child to a nearby forest on the pretext of showing her birds and had abused the child.
 
When the girl had become unconscious, they have thrown her to a nearby well.

heading: Sinhale Jathika Peramuna and Ravana Balaya write to President on selling of EAP companies
content:
Sinhale Jathika Peramuna and Ravana Balaya have written to President Maithripala Sirisena on selling of companies of the EAP Group to a Non-Governmental Organization allegedly owned by the Tamil Diaspora.
The representatives of those organizations said that the document was handed over President's additional secretary Sunanda Kariyapperuma.

heading: Dispute between siblings ends in murder (Photos)
content:
A 42-year-old person was stabbed to death in Barawakumbuka in Ambalantota this morning (Jun 30).
 
The victim was a resident of the Samanalagama area.
 
Police said that the elder brother of the victim had killed his younger brother following an argument.
 
The attacker was later arrested by police and he will be produced before the court.

heading: Missing Deegadanthu found
content: The elephant named Deegadantu which was missing for 10 days while roaming in the Kala Wewa National Sanctuary was found after 10 days last night in the ‘Kanda’ area Kahalla – Pallekele reserve. That was after a special joint operation carried out by the STF and wildlife officers.The wildlife officials said that the tusker is nursing a gunshot injury when he disappeared from the area.

heading: Joint Opposition to act as an “Independent Group” in parliament
content:
The Joint Opposition has decided to request the Speaker to recognize the Joint Opposition as an independent group in parliament as its number of MPs now stands at 70.
 
The number of MPs in the Joint Opposition rose to 70 with the 16 MPs who left the SLFP recently, said that they would join with the JO.
 
Therefore, the Joint Opposition has decided that they should be recognized as an independent group instead of being considered as a part of the UPFA.
 
They would also demand the Opposition Leader’s post.

heading: Wimal says JVP has issues over 20 A
content:
The leader of the National Freedom Front MP Wimal Weerawansa says that there are conflicts within the JVP itself over the 20th amendment which they put forward as a private member motion in Parliament.
 
He expressed these views at a seminar in Kandy yesterday.

heading: Fmr. Chief Minister ordered to pay Rs. 250,000 to a principal
content: The Supreme Court ordered former North Central Province Chief Minister, Peshala Jayarathna to pay compensation of Rs. 250,000 to R. P. K. Bandara, a former principal of Nivanthaka Chetiya Maha Vidyalaya in Anuradhapura.At the conclusion of a Fundamental Rights petition filed by the principal, the judgment was given by a bench of three Supreme Court judges including Justice Eva Wanasundara, Justice Sisira de Abrew and Justice Nalin Perera today. The petitioner sought justice citing that in 2016, he was illegally transferred, thereby violating his fundamental rights. In addition to the compensation, the court ordered that the complainant is reinstated to his previous post at the same school within two months.In addition, the Supreme Court ordered that the state award a compensation of Rs. 50,000 to the principal.

heading: Two groups clash in Jaffna
content:
The members of the Aava Group in Manipay, Jaffna have launched an attack on the residence of a member of the Dhanu-rock group early this morning (Jun 28).
 
Police said the Dhanu-rock member and his sister were admitted to Jaffna Teaching Hospital with injuries following the attack.

heading: Speaker signs 'Act' on SAITM students
content:
The Act which was recently passed in parliament transferring 982 SAITM medical students to Kotelawala Defence University has been signed by the Speaker.
 
The Speaker's Office announced with this the new Act will become a law.
 
The Act was passed in parliament on 20th of June.

heading: 7 of the SLFP "Group of 16" absent from meeting with Basil R
content:
The discussion between the SLFP "Group of 16" and the Podujana Peramuna was held at the Podujana Peramuna office in Battaramulla.
 
Nine members of the group, including MPs, Susil Premajayantha, Anura Priyadarshana Yapa and W. D.J. Senevirathna participated in the discussion.
 
Party chairman, professor, G. L. Peries and former minister Basil Rajapaksa are representing the Podujana Peramuna.
 
This is the first official discussion being held between the two groups.
 
Meanwhile, SLFP Group-16 member, Lakshman Yapa Abeywardana described the future cause of action of the group during a media conference held in Colombo today.

heading: Deputy Minister Thewarapperuma and STF in a heated argument
content:
A heated argument took place between the Deputy Minister of Wildlife Palitha Thewarapperuma and officers of the Police Special Task Force in Suriyawewa yesterday.
 
The Deputy Minister had visited the area to inspect the construction of a fence to avoid elephants from entering villages in Suriyaweva.
 
However, at this instance, the Deputy Minister was informed that an STF team was obstructing the tippers that were transporting gravel for the construction of the Southern Expressway.
 
Then the Deputy Minister visited the location from where the gravel is transported.
 
At the same time, a group of STF personnel also arrived there and it led to a tense situation.

heading: Investigation sought for Oddusudan incident
content:
National Alliance of War Heroes is demanding an investigation into the recent find of military items including a claymore bomb in Oddusudan, Mullaitivu.
 
The Retd. Rear Admiral Sarath Weerasekera highlighted this addressing a media conference in Colombo today (Jun 28).

heading: CBSL Governor says allegations against Dr. Weerasinghe 'baseless'
content:
Central Bank Governor Dr. Indrajith Coomaraswamy says in recent days, former Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake has repeated his
allegations against Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe, Senior Deputy Governor of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka without producing any evidence.
As the Governor of the CBSL, the Coomaraswamy says that he wants to formally place on record that Dr. Weerasinghe is an outstanding economist who has made a stellar contribution to the work of the Bank during the two years that he has spent in that position.
Dr. Coomaraswamy added, "In addition, I am compelled to point out that the former Finance Minister Hon Ravi Karunanayake has not produced any evidence to back up his unfounded allegations".

heading: Group of 16 meets Basil Rajapaksa
content:
A discussion between the SLFP Group of 16 and the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna is scheduled to be held at Podujana Peramuna head office at Battaramulla at 4 pm today (Jun 28).
 
This will be the first official discussion to be held between the two groups.
 
Former minister, Basil Rajapaksa will also participate in the discussion.
 
However, some reports were published in the last few days citing that the SLFP Group-16 had criticized former minister Basil Rajapaksa and Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna.

heading: State Minister Vijayakala Maheswaran wants LTTE back
content:
State Minister of Child Affairs Vijayakala Maheswaran says her intention is to see the reemergence of the LTTE.
She said this during an event held at Jaffna Weerasinham Hall today (Jul 02).
Ministers Vajira Abeywardena, Tilak Marapana and Chief Minister of North C. V. Vigneshwaran were present at the occasion.
Meanwhile, police have launched an investigation on an alleged incident where a banner depicting an Elam map was exhibited.
Police are looking out for the person who had been carrying out that banner.

heading: Hearing on petition against Kerawalapitiya tender postponed
content:
The petition filed against a Cabinet decision to award the tender to build an LNG plant in Kerawalapitiya to a Chinese firm was taken up before a three-member bench at the Supreme Court today (Jul 01).
 
A local company has filed this petition alleging that the Ministry of Power and Renewable Energy had decided to award the tender to a higher bidder disregarding a lower bid moved by them.
 
Here, the senior state counsel appearing for the Attorney General requested time to get more information from the defendant in order to make submissions.
 
Considering that request, the three-member Supreme Court bench postponed the case to 11th of July.

heading: Sandya Eknaligoda goes to CID
content:
The wife of missing journalist Prageeth Eknaligoda, Sandya Eknaligoda has filed a complaint with the Criminal Investigation Department.
 
She says that she is receiving death threats and being subjected to harassment over the social media.
 
In her complaint, Sandya says she is being threatened since Ven. Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thera was jailed.

heading: CPC introduces Euro 4
content:
Ceylon Petroleum Corporation today (Jul 02) introduced environmentally friendly Euro 4 petrol and diesel to the market.
 
The CPC said Euro 4 will help engines perform better with less toxic emissions.

heading: Two students attack another student with a sword
content:
An 18-year-old school student was attacked with a sword at a dansala in Welipenna in Meegama.
 
He was attacked by two other students.
 
Police noted that the victim was with few of his friends when one of the suspects launched the attack with a sword hidden inside an umbrella.
 
The student who sustained injuries was admitted to the Iththapaana Hospital and later transferred to Kalutara, Nagoda Hospital for further treatment.
 
A spokesperson for the hospital said that the student had a slash in his back but he was not in a critical condition.

heading: STF launches special operation in South
content:
The Special Task Force has launched a special operation to curb the current underworld activities which are taking place in several parts of the country including in the South.
 
An STF spokesperson told us that the operation has already been launched in Galle, Matara, Elpitiya, and Tangalle police divisions.
 
Several underworld activities were reported during the last few days.
 
The jewellery shop heist in Matara town and the exchange of fire between the STF and a group of underworld gangsters were the latest incidents.
 
It is reported that one of the underworld kingpins, Makandure Madush, who is hiding overseas, is the mastermind behind most of these crimes.
 
Meanwhile, 2 322 suspects including 423 wanted suspects were arrested during a special operation conducted by police last night and early this morning.
 
The first phase of the operation was conducted from 10 to 12 midnight yesterday while the second phase was conducted from 3 to 5 early this morning.
 
Over 14,000 police officers participated in this operation.
 
Among the arrested, there are 650 drunk drivers, 635 wanted suspects in connection with various crimes and 5 others for possessing illegal arms.
 
Police Media spokesman, SP, Ruwan Gunesekera said that another 531 heroin dealers, 78 illicit liquor sellers and who behave indecently in public were also arrested.
 
In addition, 5, 254 cases have been filed for traffic violations.

heading: HIRU Shraddhabhiwandana attracts huge crowds to Kataragama (Photos)
content:
HIRU Shraddhabhiwandana programme organized by Asia Broadcasting Corporation to celebrate Poson Poya is held at the historical sacred premises of Kataragama Kirivehera.
 
An offering of fragrant flowers and incensed smoke to the sounds of traditional drum beating was also held.
 
The ceremony began early this morning with the participation of a large number of devotees.
 
Hundreds of devotees observed Ata Sil under this ceremony.
 
Later, several dhamma preachings, dhamma discussions, and other religious programs were held with the participation of the Maha Sangha and other Buddhist scholars.
 
HIRU TV and HIRU FM led by Asia Broadcasting Corporation telecasted these programs live from Kirivehera temple throughout the day.
 
In addition, an ordaining ceremony was held for the 6th consecutive year this year at the Kirivehera sacred premises this morning.
 
15 young children were ordained under this program.
 
It is significant that Asia Broadcasting Corporation has been able to make a contribution to the Sasana by ordaining over 70 novice monks in support of the propagation of the Buddha Sasana so far.
 
This righteous effort is a concept of the chairman of Asia Broadcasting Corporation, Mr. Rayynor Silva.
 
A sanghika dana for over 200 Bhikkhu was held at the Kirivehera temple premises thereafter.In addition, copies of Tripitaka dhamma were donated by the chairman of Asia Broadcasting Corporation, Rayynor Silva to all the pirivenas in the Moneragala district.

heading: 81 new HIV cases found
content:
National STD/AIDS Control Programme says 81 new cases of HIV AIDS are reported during the first three months of this year.
Its director, Dr. Sisira Liyanage said most of the new cases were males.
He also said that around 2,800 AIDS infected persons are in Sri Lanka.

heading: Govt. to renew visa process
content:
The Ministry of Internal Affairs and North Western Development has decided to revise the method of issuing visas.
 
Minister S. B. Navinna said that this decision was taken, taking into consideration the problems that had cropped up due to the previous method which had not been updated for a significant period of time.
 
A new set of regulations have been formulated, with the assistance of several ministries including the Foreign Affairs Ministry.
 
The Minister said that once the Attorney General’s approval was received, he hopes to have the regulations published by a gazette notification.

heading: Joint Opposition to demand 'Opposition Leader's' post
content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa stated that the group of 16 that participated in the Joint Opposition group meeting, cannot participate in SLFP meetings.The SLFP group of 16 that left the government, participated in the joint opposition group meeting for the first time yesterday.The former president made the above statement expressing his views to media. Meanwhile, the Joint Opposition says that it will make a written request to Speaker the post of Opposition Leader be granted, as they are the largest opposition party. MP Ranjith Soysa told our news team that this request would be made as the number of MPs representing the joint opposition has increased to 70 members

heading: Southern underworld members flee
content:
Security sources say that persons linked to Southern Province underworld activities have fled to neighbouring regions.
 
A high ranking police STF officer told us that the criminals have fled as a result of special operations being carried out by the STF in the Southern province.
 
The officer confirmed that attempts to contain underworld activities in the Western and Southern provinces have been successful.
 
The STF launched operations in Galle, Matara, Elpitiya, and Tangalle police divisions after underworld activities spread in those areas.

heading: Services halted on Kelani Valley railway track
content:
Sri Lanka Railways says that due to a crack on a rail line services on the Kelani Valley track has been disrupted.
 
The incident had occurred between Maharagama and Pannipitiya.

heading: CID to probe Thalawa bank robbery
content:
The investigation into the weekend robbery at a branch of a state bank in Thalawa, Anuradhapura has been handed over to the Criminal Investigation Department.
The cash and jewellery robbed from the bank are estimated to be over Rs. 87 million.
Police Media Spokesperson’s office stated that the value of the robbed gold jewellery is still being estimated.
Police received a complaint that a group had entered the bank and removed cash and jewellery at the weekend.
The robbers had entered the bank by breaking the back door open and forced open three safety boxes.
Police also said that the CCTV system in the bank premises has also been removed by the robbers.

heading: Election Commission to discuss roadblocks to hold PC elections with Speaker
content:
Chairman of the Election Commission, Mahinda Deshapriya is scheduled to meet with the Speaker of parliament Karu Jayasuriya at the parliamentary complex this morning for a special discussion on the provincial council elections.
 
It is reported that the Election Commission Chairman is to request from the speaker that The Provincial Council Elections be held without further delay and that the necessary legal environment is set up as soon as possible.
 
The official term of the Eastern, North Central and Sabaragamuwa provinces ended last September.
 
The official term of the Central, North Western and Northern provinces will end this September.
 
If the Provincial Council Elections are to be held according to the proportional voting system, the current act should be amended.
 
If the election is to be held under the new electoral system, the delimitations report which has been presented to parliament should be passed.
 
The Elections Commission cannot hold elections until one of these requirements are fulfilled.
 
Chairman Mahinda Deshapriya met with political party representatives on Monday to discuss the matter.

heading: Railway security officers to be deployed in civvies
content:
Minister of Transport, Nimal Siripala de Silva says Railway security officers will be deployed inside trains in civvies to prevent destructive activities in trains.
 
He said if caught the passengers will be taken action using the Public Properties Act.
 
A train fitted with locally manufactured compartments was added to the fleet and the Minister said this joining the inaugural journey of the train at the Fort Railway Station this morning (Jul 02).

heading: Cash and jewellery worth over Rs. 87mn robbed from Thalawa bank (Photos)
content:
It is estimated that the robbers have taken away cash and jewellery worth over Rs. 87 million from the branch of a state bank in Thalawa which had been broken into during the weekend.
 
The robbers have cut opened three safes in the bank using gas cutters.
 
22.5kg of gold and Rs. 10.7 million in cash is missing.
 
Preliminary investigations revealed that the robbers had entered the premises breaking the back door and they have also taken away the CCTV recorder and the siren has been deactivated.
 
Police say this would the largest robbery at a financial entity in Anuradhapura.

heading: Mother of two hacked to death
content:
A mother of two has died after she was attacked with a sharp object in Meegoda.
 
The victim, aged 45 was a resident of Vihara Mawatha at Henawatte in Dickhathakma in Meegoda.
 
The victim's husband was a retired army officer.
 
Her mother had told police that she came out of the house early morning and little later she heard her daughter was screaming.
 
She added when she came out of the house and found her daughter lying in the garden unresponsive.
 
However, police are yet to identify the suspect.

heading: Minister Fonseka 'not sure' of his political future
content:
Minister Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka says that he is not sure whether he would be elected to parliament in the forthcoming election.
 
He was speaking at a public rally held at the Medawachchiya Divisional Secretariat yesterday (Jul 01).
 
He said he has only 1 and 1/2 years and he had decided to erect elephant fences during the remaining time.
 
He also said so far elephant fences covering a length of 4500 km exist in Sri Lanka.

heading: Hand grenade attack in Kuliyapitiya
content:
Four persons including a woman were injured in a hand grenade attack which was carried out targeting a house in Bohingamuwa, Kuliyapitiya.
 
The attack was carried out at around 9.45 pm yesterday (Jul 01) and the injured were admitted to Kuliyapitiya Hospital.
 
The attacker has been identified.
 
Police said that the suspect had attended a wedding ceremony last night and he had involved in a clash with another group there.
 
Thereafter, he had thrown a hand grenade at a house.
 
The suspect has fled the area following the incident.

heading: Bodies of two drowned in Wariyapola raft mishap, found
content:
The bodies of the two persons who were reported missing after they drowned in the Malagane Tank in Wariyapola were found.
 
They drowned in the tank after the raft in which they were onboard had toppled in the middle of the tank.
 
Police said there were five persons onboard the raft and three of them were able to swim ashore.
 
They had gone to the tank to pluck lotus leaves for a dansel.
 
The incident took place last afternoon and the bodies were recovered in the evening.
 
The victims aged 48 and 20 were residents of Batuwatte, Gampaha.

heading: Killing of leopard : Four more suspects remanded
content:
Four suspects who were arrested today (Jun 25)  over the brutal killing of leopard in Kilinochchi have been remanded until 29th of June.
 
The suspects were produced before Killinochchi Magistrate this morning and the Magistrate ordered them to be remanded.
 
earlier, two other suspects were arrested and they were also remanded until 29th of June.

heading: Vehicle used by Matara robbers found
content:
The motor car used by the underworld gangsters to flee after the robbery at a jewellery shop in Matara was found in Thalagala, Moragahahena early this morning (Jul 02).
 
The Police Media Spokesperson SP Ruwan Gunasekera said that one suspect was also arrested.
 
The preliminary investigations revealed that the vehicle was registered under the name of the suspect's wife.
 
He was a three-wheel driver.
 
Police also said that the suspect was very close to Kosgoda Tharaka, who was injured during the exchange of fire with police.
 
It was revealed that the robbery was planned at the suspect's house in Thalagala.

heading: Human-killing wild elephant captured (Photos)
content:
Wildlife officials have captured a 9-foot tusker that had recently killed a woman in Kivula, Kottukachchiya.
 
The tusker was captured in Simentigama, Kalladiya.
 
The tusker will be relocated to Yala National Park tomorrow.
 
Meanwhile, the wild elephant that fled during a raid at Keppetipola in Kurunegala is now roaming in Ratthati Uyana in Barandana, Mawathagama.
 
Wildlife officials stated that they are continuing the operation in collaboration with the STF to chase the elephant from the area.

heading: More cocaine retrieved from arrested Brazilians (Photos)
content:
163 cocaine capsules have so far been retrieved from the two Brazil nationals who were apprehended at the Bandaranaike International Airport following a tip-off.
 
The total weight was 1.950 kg and the estimated value is Rs. 48.5 million.
 
The two Brazilians were arrested by a combined effort carried out by the Police Narcotics Bureau and Sri Lanka Customs based on intelligence gathering.
 
The suspects aged 30 and 24 were apprehended on 30th of June and yesterday.
 
Now they are warded at Negombo Hospital under police protection.

heading: Postal workers stage a protest
content:
The postal workers staged a protest in front of the Presidential Secretariat in Colombo this morning (Jul 03).
 
They protested against the non-payment of June salary for the postal workers who took part in the recent strike and submission of a cabinet paper for a salary cut.

heading: Shooting in Kotahena, one injured
content:
One person was injured when two persons on a motorcycle had opened fire at him in Jampettah Street, Kotahena.
 
Police said that the injured person was admitted to National Hospital, Colombo.
 
The shooting took place at around 9.15 pm.

heading: Gotabhaya Rajapaksa gives statement to FCID
content:
Former Defence Secretary Gotabhaya Rajapaksa has left the Financial Crime Investigation Division, after giving a statement.
 
He was there for almost three hours.
 
The former Defence Secretary was noticed to appear at the FCID to record a statement on the alleged misappropriation of state funds to build D. A. Rajapaksa Commemorative Museum in Weeraketiya, Tangalle.
 
The Court of Appeal has earlier issued an injunction preventing taking actions against him under the Public Properties Act.

heading: Sooriyawewa protesters occupy Hambantota administrative building
content:
A group of people who say that they are yet to recieve compensation for acquition of their lands for the Sooriyawewa 100-feet road project are engaging in a protest inside the Hambantota administrative building.
 
The protesters had entered the premises after they were invited to attend the Hambantota District Development Committee meeting.
 
However, protesters say they will not leave the administrative premises until their issue is not sorted.

heading: Woman killed in wild elephant attack in Amparai
content:
Wildlife officials have widened the search operations to locate Deegadanthu, the wild elephant with the longest tusks in the Kalawewa National Park.
 
Wildlife officials said that they did not see the tusker that suffered a serious trap-gun injury in one of its legs.
 
Deegadanthu was reported missing from last Monday (Jun 18).
 
The veterinarian in charge of North Western and Anuradhapura, Chandana Jayasinghe said that a search operation is currently underway in Kahalla, Pallekelle forest reserve.
 
Meanwhile, a 55-year old woman was killed in a wild elephant attack at Raswehera in Galgamuwa early this morning (Jun 25).
 
It was revealed that nearly 10 persons were killed in wild elephant attacks during over the last several days.

heading: Galle Road bus strike continues
content:
The National Transport Commission says that the on-going strike by the Southern long distance private bus owners is not fair.
The Commission's chairman, M. A. P. Hemachandra said that steps will be taken to cancel the route permits of the bus owners and permits of the drivers and conductors, who take part in this strike.
 
The strike was launched this morning (Jun 25) citing that they are not allowed to pick up passengers for short distances.
 
Our correspondents stated that hundreds of office workers who were returning to Colombo after the weekend were gravely inconvenienced.
 
Meanwhile, short distant bus operators complained that their daily income has dropped consequent the passengers being picked up by long distant service buses.
 
National organizer of Lanka Private Bus owners union, Dilip Ratnaweera said that long distance service buses cannot be allowed to pick up passengers from short distant bus halts, as their incomes are declining.

heading: Fast in Batticaloa seeking release of Pillayan
content:
A fast began in Batticaloa today (Jun 25) seeking the release of former Chief Minister of East, Sivanesathurai Chandrakanthan alias Pillayan.
 
He is in remand custody at the Batticaloa Prison for the last three years.
 
The protest has been organized by a group of councillors including the secretary of the TMVP.
 
Pillayan is in remand as he's accused of murdering the former TNA MP Joseph Pararajasingham inside a church on 2005.

heading: Murder accused sentenced after 17 years
content:
A person who was convicted of gunning down a person at Palliyapitiya in Rathgama, Galle has been sentenced after 17 years.
 
The case was taken up at the Galle High Court.
 
One person was killed in a shooting in Palliyapitiya in Rathgama, Galle in October 2001.
 
Three persons were charged over the murder and one of them was sentenced today (Jun 25).
 
He was Udaya Kumar alka Podi Paul.

heading: Postal workers to launch fast-unto-death
content:
The Joint Postal Trade Union Front says that a protest would be staged in Colombo today (Jun 25) with the support of several main trade unions urging the Government to provide solutions to their demands.
The strike was launched 15 days ago.
Meanwhile the strikers have decided to covert the ongoing fast in front of the Colombo Mail Exchange, into a fast unto death.
The postal trade unions yesterday briefed both Malwatte and Asgiri Chapter Chief Incumbents about the trade union action that they have launched.

heading: Three heroin peddlers arrested in Borella
content:
Police have arrested three youths in separate raids for peddling heroin in Borella.
 
Two of them were arrested at Borella Cemetery Junction with 46.5 g of heroin.
 
The third suspect was arrested with 24.1 g of heroin in the Kithulwatte area in Borella.
 
The arrests were made last night (Jun 24).
 
The suspects are aged between 20 and 23.

heading: Gotabhaya arrives at FCID
content:
Former Defence Secretary Gotabhaya Rajapaksa has arrived at the Financial Crime Investigation Division.
 
He was noticed to appear at the FCID to record a statement on the alleged misappropriation of state funds to build D. A. Rajapaksa Commemorative Museum in Weeraketiya, Tangalle.
 
The Court of Appeal has earlier issued an injunction preventing taking actions against him under the Public Properties Act.

heading: Eight Sri Lankans arrested while trying to enter Turkey illegally
content:
Eight Sri Lankans have been arrested by the border police of Georgia and state security service for attempting to illegally cross the border in the Adjara region.
 
Investigators say that the detainees were trying to cross the Georgia-Turkey border aiming to enter Turkey and avoiding border control.
 
The offence is punishable from four to five years of imprisonment.
 
According to official data there have been 38 cases of attempted illegal border crossings revealed by the Interior Ministry of Georgia in 2016, while 55 such cases were recorded in 2015.

heading: State bank broken into in Thalawa
content:
Police say that an unidentified group has entered a state bank in the Thalawa town in Anuradhapura and fled with cash and jewellery.
 
It was believed that the robbery would have taken place during the weekend.

heading: Four more arrested over killing of Kilinochchi leopard
content:
Four more suspects have been arrested in connection with killing of a leopard in Kilinochchi.
The suspects are aged 22 and 26 were arrested last night (Jun 24).
Already six suspects who were allegedly involved in the incident have been arrested , two were detained.

heading: Postal strikers stage protest blocking D. R. Wijewardena Mw
content:
The striking postal workers are staging a protest march along the D, R. Wijewardena Mawatha, Colombo 10.
 
Our correspondent said because of that the is blocked for traffic.

heading: Cocaine worth Rs. 35mn retrieved from Brazilians
content:
The medical staff at Negombo Hospital has retrieved 153 cocaine capsules from the two Brazilians who were arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport.
 
The estimated value of cocaine capsules weighing 1.4 kg, was Rs. 35 million.
 
The two Brazilians were arrested by a combined effort by Police Narcotics Bureau and Sri Lanka Customs based on intelligence gathering.
 
The suspects aged 30 and 24 were apprehended on 30th of June and yesterday.
 
Now they are warded at Negombo Hospital under police protection.

heading: Teachers and principals report sick leave
content:
The Trade Union Collective for Protecting Education says that as planned it has implemented a trade union action today by reporting sick leave.
The trade union action is being taken to voice its opposition to appointments being made in the education sector citing political revenge.
This strike will be carried out by 11 unions including the Sri Lanka Education Administrative Service Officers’ Union, Sri Lanka Teacher Educational Service Officers’ Union, Lanka Teachers’ Union and the Lanka Teacher Services Union.
Discussions held with the Prime Minister at his office yesterday were unsuccessful.
As a consequence of this, Lanka Teachers’ Union General Secretary Joseph Stalin said that the trade union action would take place today as planned.
However, Education Minister Akila Viraaj Kaariyawasam said that in spite of statements made by trade unions, he believed duty-conscious school principals and teachers would report to work today.

heading: PM requests President to remove Vijayakala from her Ministerial post
content:
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe has requested President Maithripala Sirisena to suspend State Minister Vijayakala Maheshwaran from her portfolio until the investigations are completed on her controversial statement.
 
She told a gathering in Jaffna yesterday (Jul 02) that she wants to see the resurrection of the LTTE.
Meanwhile, the Speaker has also informed the Attorney General to scrutinize her statement and if it has violated the country's law and the constitution to take action against her.

heading: Talks with PM fail, teachers & principals to strike
content: Government teachers and principles will stick to their planned sick leave campaign tomorrow as discussions with Prime Minister have failed.

heading: Matara, Galle & Ambalangoda - Colombo private buses launch strike
content: Matara, Galle & Ambalangoda long distance private bus operators, are on strike saying they have been prevented from taking short distance passengers.

heading: Deegadanthu reported missing from 'Kala Wewa'
content:
One of the most attractive wild elephants in the Kala Wewa area is reportedly missing.
The elephant, which was aged around 25 to 30 years, was nursing a gunshot injury.
The wildlife officials have commenced an operation to locate the animal.

heading: Former UPFA MP V. K. Indika dies
content:
The United People's Freedom Alliance's former Hambantota District MP V. K. Indika has passed away.
 
He was 51-year-old at the time of his demise.

heading: Sri Lanka Freedom Party appoints new Media Spokespersons
content:
Minister, Mahinda Samarasinghe, and MP Dayasiri Jayasekera have been appointed as the new media spokespersons of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party.
 
This was revealed when the new office bearers and President Maithripala Sirisena met at the president's official residence in Colombo last afternoon (Jul 02).
 
When contacted, Dayasiri Jayasekera told us that he is not aware of the new appointment.
 
Meanwhile, Jayasekera did not attend the yesterday's Joint Opposition group meeting held under the patronage of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa.
 
He said he would be issuing a statement soon about his future political actions.

heading: Leopard killing : 10 suspects further remanded
content: 10 suspects who were arrested over the brutal killing of a leopard in Kilinochchi have been further remanded until 5th of July.

heading: President’s Secretary clarifies annexures of bond report
content:
President’s Secretary Austin Fernando says that no third annexure was submitted with the report which was compiled by the Presidential Commission on Inquiry on the Central Bank bond issue.
 
Fernando, issued a communique clarifying this, in response to a media statement by MP Jayantha Samaraweera, the Deputy Leader of the National Freedom Front at the Department of National Archives on Monday, that the annexure had not been submitted.
 
MP Samaraweera made a request on Monday for information on the bond report from the National Archives under the Right to Information Act.
 
The Director-General had said that if the President’s Secretary issues a directive, the report of the commission could be provided with annexures 1, 2, 4 and 5.
 
However, issuing a communiqué the President’s Secretary noted since a third annexure had not been submitted he cannot make a statement regarding an annexure that had not been received.

heading: Met Dept. says wind speed may rise
content:
Met Department says there is a possibility of increasing the wind speed to some extent over the Island and surrounding sea area during next few days.
 
Several spells of showers will occur at Western, Sabaragamuwa and Central provinces and Galle and Matara districts.
 
Showers or thundershowers will occur at a few places in Eastern and Uva provinces after 2 pm.
 
Fairly strong gusty winds up to 40-45kmph can be expected over the Hambantota district.

heading: Police Commission receives 625 complaints against police
content:
National Police Commission says it has received 625 complaints against police during the first six months of this year.
 
The Commission's Public Complaints Division's Director Prabath Lakshman told us that investigations on half of those are completed.
 
250 of those complaints against police inaction and 173 cases were against using force.
 
Meanwhile, the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption said so far this year 42 persons have found guilty in bribery cases.
 
Last year, 57 persons were found guilty of accepting bribes.

heading: Thalawa bank robbery suspects identified
content:
The suspects in the Thalaawa bank robbery have been identified.
 
An unidentified number of robbers entered the state bank branch in the Thalawa town during the night of the weekend.
 
The robbers have taken away Rs. 96 million in cash and jewellery by breaking open three safes.
 
Eight police teams and the Criminal Investigation Department have been deployed to apprehend the suspects.
 
Police said that the suspects could be arrested within the next two days.
 
Meanwhile, a mobile bank service has been set up for customers at the bank, so that the services can be provided without interruption.
 
It has been confirmed that the CCTV cameras at the bank premises had also been removed by the robbers.

heading: Speaker informs AG to scrutinize Vijayakala’s statement
content:
Speaker Karu Jayasuriya has informed the Attorney General to take appropriate action if any violation of constitution has occurred from State Minister Vijayakala Maheshwaran's speech on LTTE's resurgence.
 
Addressing an event held at the Weerasingham Hall in Jaffna yesterday (Jul 02), MP Vijayakala said that she would like to see the resurgence of the LTTE.
 
Ministers Vajira Abeywardena and Tilak Marapana were also present at the occasion.
 
The Joint Opposition MPs took the matter to the parliament today and they disrupted the proceedings urging the Speaker to take actions against the State Minister.
 
Later, the Speaker adjourned the sittings until tomorrow.

heading: UNP backbenchers want Vijayakala to be removed
content:
Backbenchers of the United National Party have requested the Party leadership to remove State Minister Vijayakala Maheshwaran from all positions of the party and her State Ministerial post for making a statement that the LTTE should be re-emerged.
Several factions made complaints with the Police Headquarters today against the statement made by her yesterday.
Pivituru Hela Urumaya, Sinhale Api Jathika Sanvidhanaya, Sinhala Ravaya and Jathika Sanvidanaya are among them.
Legal aspects with regard to the swearing-in by a parliamentarian are explained under the 5th Chapter of the constitution.
It further describes that all elected public representatives should swear and pledge with honour to protect and follow the constitution.
Accordingly, the Republic of Sri Lanka has been identified as a unitary state and what kind of impact would bring by making a statement similar to that of the one made by State Minister Maheswaran on the sovereignty of such a unitary state.
The General Secretary of Sinhala Ravaya, Magalkande Sudaththa Thera who made the first complaint against the statement made by Child Affairs State Minister, Vijayakala Maheswaran demanded that State Minister, Maheswaran should be arrested and initiate investigations.

heading: Fuel prices revised upwardly
content: Lanka Indian Oil Company has announced their new fuel prices:Lanka Auto Diesel Rs. 118Xtra MILE Rs. 122Lanka Super Diesel (Euro 4) Rs. 129Lanka Petrol 92 Octane Rs. 146Xtra Premium (EURO3) Rs.149Xtra Premium 95 (EURO 4) Rs.158Meanwhile, Ceylon Petroleum Corporation also increased the fuel prices from midnight yesterday (Jul 05).New prices:Petrol (92) Rs.145Petrol (95) Rs.155Diesel Rs.118Super Diesel Rs.129

heading: Vijayakala Maheswaran resigns from Ministerial portfolio
content:
State Minister of Child Affairs Vijayakala Maheswaran has handed over her letter of resignation from her portfolio.
She had handed over her letter of resignation this afternoon (Jul 05).
She had a meeting with Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe last evening and later she said she had decided to resign from her post.
On 2nd of July, addressing a public event in Jaffna she had said that she wants to see the resurrection of the LTTE.
The statement drew criticism of many.
Jaffna District Secretary, Nagalingam Vedanayagam said that an inquiry would be conducted against the public officials who approved her controversial statement by applauding her speech at the event.
Meanwhile, the main witness of the murder of T. Maheswaran who was gunned down by the LTTE near a Hindu Kovil in Kotahena in 2008 expressed surprise on the statement made by Vijayakala Maheswaran.

heading: Vijayakala's statement creates tension in Parliament
content:
The Joint Opposition MPs are demanding a probe against the statement made by State Minister Vijayakala Maheshwaran.
 
She told a gathering in Jaffna yesterday (Jul 02) that she wanted to see the re-emergence of the LTTE.
 
Since the start of the session, the Joint Opposition MPs began to demand action against the State Minister.
 
It prompted the speaker to adjourn the sessions briefly.
 
However, when the session re-commenced the Joint Opposition members continued to agitate.
 
They did not heed the requests by the speaker to allow the session to continue.
 
Then at around 2.25pm, the speaker adjourned the sessions until tomorrow.

heading: New York Times issues a statement
content:
The New York Times has issued a statement on its report on Hambantota Port.
 
It said that if former President Mahinda Rajapaksa takes issue with its reporting, they will encourage him to contact senior editors of New York Times.

heading: Prices of 5 Kg & 2.3 Kg domestic gas reduced
content:
Along with the recent price reduction of 12.5 Kg cylinder, prices of 5 Kg and 2.3 Kg LPG gas cylinders have been reduced accordingly.
 
The price of a 5 Kg LPG domestic gas cylinder has been reduced by Rs. 55 and price of a 2.3 Kg cylinder has been reduced by Rs. 25.
 
The Minister of Industry and Commerce said that the Consumer Affairs Authority has been instructed to raid errant retailers who violate the new price structure.

heading: Gotabhaya to visit SLPP head office
content:
Former Defence Secretary Gotabhaya Rajapaksa will today for the first time, will visit the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna's party office located at the Nelum Pokuna Mawatha in Battaramulla.
 
He will be participating in an event where a group of provincial councillors of UPFA will obtain the membership of the SLPP.
 
The event will take place under the patronage of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa.
 
Former Minister Basil Rajapaksa is also scheduled to be present.

heading: Emil Ranjan & Neomal Rangajeewa remanded again
content:
Ex Prisons Commissioner Emil Ranjan Lamahewa and IP Neomal Rangajeewa who are in remand custody over the Welikada Prison shooting case, have been further remanded.
 
They were remanded until 17th of July when they were produced in court today (Jul 03).

heading: Policeman commits suicide in Jaffna
content: A police officer attached to Thelippalai Police Station has committed suicide using his service weapon.

heading: Parliament tensed due to Wijayakala’s statement, Speaker informs AG to scrutinize it and take action
content:
Parliament was adjourned until tomorrow as a tense situation erupted in the House following continuous arguments over the controversial speech made by State Minister Vijayakala Maheswaran.
Maheswaran told a gathering in Jaffna yesterday that she wanted to see the resurrection of the LTTE.
Later, the Speaker stated that he informed the Attorney General to ascertain whether Maheswaran has violated the constitution by stating that the LTTE should be revived and if so, to take necessary legal action.
It is significant that a UNP MP asked party General Secretary Akila Viraj Kariyawasam to explain the party stance on the state minister, Vijayakala Maheshwaran’s statement.
Later, Minister, Kariyawasam refuted Maheshwaran’s statement.
When MP Wimal Weerawansa expressed his views, a tense situation erupted in the House.
However, it is significant that UNP MP Ashoka Priyantha proposed to sack State Minister Vijayakala from her current portfolio.
Later, the House was adjourned for 10 minutes.
Subsequently, Joint opposition MPs, as well as UNP MP Ashoka, also expressed their opposition to the statement made by MP Vijayakala Maheswaran.
Speaker Karu Jayasuriya quoted Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe as saying that he would hold an investigation on the statement made by the State Minister.
However, opposition MPs demanded that such an answer is not sufficient and the Speaker should take some substantial action against her.
Our correspondent stated that MPs Wimal Weerawansa, Mahindananda Aluthgamage, Dayasiri Jayasekera and Prasanna Ranaweera walked into the well of the House and protested.
At the same time a letter that asked action against Maheswaran was handed over to the Speaker with 11 signatories but the latter refused to accept it.
MP, Prasanna Ranaweera attempted several times to remove the Mace and the Speaker was compelled to adjourn the House amidst continuous protests by the opposition MPs.

heading: Brave policeman who fought with robbers laid to rest
content:
The funeral of the police sergeant Suranga Pradeep Weerasingha who was killed while trying to arrest a group of robbers in Matara was held at the Matara public cemetery this evening (Jun 24).
 
Shops in Matara were closed for two hours in respect of the policeman who lost his life.
 
Meanwhile, 2 suspects who were shot by police and was receiving treatment at the Karapitiya Teaching Hospital were transferred to the Angunukolapalassa prison.
 
One more suspect is receiving treatment at the Karapitiya Teaching Hospital under police protection.
 
Meanwhile, Minister Mangala Samaraweera has made a critical statement over the death of a suspect involved in the recent robbery in Matara.
 
The Minister stated that a suspect being died in police custody will not make up for the loss of the Police Constable’s life.
 
He also said that this does not fall in line with good governance.
 
The Chairman of the Office of Missing Persons President Counsel Saliya Peiris had also said that an independent investigation should be carried out into deaths of suspects while in police custody.

heading: Kelani Valley rail track repaired
content:
Sri Lanka Railways says that the services on the Kelani Valley rail track have been restored.
 
The train service on the Kelani Valley rail track was disrupted this morning (Jul 03) due to a crack on one of the lines between Maharagama and Pannipitiya.

heading: Six students arrested at Ragama railway station
content:
Six students were arrested by Ragama police at the Ragama Junction Railway station, for unruly behaviour on board a train.
 
Railway security officers informed police that the boys had exhibited the same disruptive behaviour over the last two days.
 
Police stated that the boys, aged between 18 and 20, will be produced before Negombo Magistrate today (Jul 05).

heading: Mobile phone found under Arjun Aloysius’s mattress in prison
content:
The owner of Perpetual Treasuries Limited Arjun Aloysius and its CEO Kasun Palisena were further remanded until 19th of July by the Fort Magistrate.
The case on Central Bank bond scam was taken up before Fort Magistrate Lanka Jayaratne today (Jul 05).
The Magistrate also rules that Arjun Aloysius's father and eight other Directors of Perpetual Treasuries Limited are banned from traveling overseas without court's permission.
 
Making submissions on the progress of the probe, the Attorney General’s Department informed that W. M. Mendis Co. had given an Rs. 5 million cheque to the Chief Financial Officer of a company owned by former Minister Ravi Karunanayake.
 
Meanwhile, the AG's Department also informed the courts that three phones and five SIM cards found in the prison ward of Arjun Aloysius.
 
It was also revealed that the authorities have found a phone under his mattress.
Meanwhile, the Monetary Board of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka, acting in terms of the Regulations made under the Registered Stock and Securities Ordinance and the Local Treasury Bills Ordinance, has decided to extend the suspension of Perpetual Treasuries Limited from carrying on the business and activities of a Primary Dealer for a period of six months.
The suspension is effective from today (Jul 05), in order to continue the investigations being conducted by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka.

heading: Attorney General takes PTL to courts to recover losses to public institutions
content:
It was revealed at the Court of Appeal that five state institutions have incurred losses amounting to Rs. 8.5 billion owing to the unlawful gains made by Perpetual Treasuries Limited through two Central Bank bond auctions.
 
Additional Solicitor General Yasantha Kodagoda disclosed that the Attorney General has filed five civil cases against the PTL at the District Court in order to recover the losses.
 
The ASG Kodagoda disclosed this yesterday (Jul 04), making the submission when a revision petition filed by the owner of the PTL0 Arjun Aloysius and its CEO Kasun Palisena was taken up at the Court of Appeal.
 
The petition was considered before the President of the Court of Appeal, Justice Preethi Padman Surasena and Justice Shiran Gooneratne.
 
ASG Kodagoda making submissions on behalf of the AG noted that according to two judicial precedents, it was not possible to continue the petition, and no specific reasons have been produced to consider the bail application.
 
He added that what could be done, by considering the revision petition is that the High Court order could be cancelled and the petition could be directed to the High Court.
 
The ASG concluded his submissions and the Court of Appeal bench then postponed the hearing to 18th of July.
 
The petitioners in their appeal to the Court of Appeal stated that the Colombo Fort Magistrate has refused bail under the Public Property Act.
 
The Attorney General and the OIC of the FCID have been named as the respondent for this petition.

heading: CHEC rejects “election-funding” allegation
content:
China Harbour Engineering Corporation says that the speculation by an international media organization that CHEC funded former President’s 2015 Presidential Election campaign is completely inconsistent with the facts.
 
The firm had said that the construction of the Hambantota Port by CHEC was an important national task based on mutual agreement between Sri Lanka and China Governments, and was implemented under a transparent model.
 
The CHEC stressed that it has never been involved in the internal affairs of Sri Lanka.
 
These details were mentioned in a media communique which was issued following a joint media conference held at the Chinese Embassy.  
Meanwhile, the Spokesperson of the Chinese Embassy in Sri Lanka said that Chinese loans are not the main part of Sri Lanka's foreign debt.
Quoting the Annual Report 2017 of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka, he said the total external debt of the Island country counts US dollars 51.824 billion, among which outstanding Chinese loans takes up only about 10.6% with the amount of USD 5.5 billion.
He added that besides, 61.5% the Chinese loans (USD 3.38 billion) are concessional ones with a much lower interest rate than the international market.

heading: Teacher union leader hospitalized
content:
The President of Lanka Teacher Services Union, Dhammika Alahapperuma has been hospitalized after he was hit with a stone during a protest held in front of the Education Ministry in Battaramulla this afternoon (Jul 04).
 
When contacted a hospital spokesperson said that his condition is not serious.
 
The teacher and principal unions reported sick leave today and they staged a protest march towards the Ministry.
 
Then a tense situation was created between the protestors and a group who had received new appointments.
 
It was during this melee, that the union leader was attacked with pelts.

heading: Monkey attacks schoolgirl inside classroom
content:
A 12-year-old schoolgirl had sustained injuries after she was bitten by a monkey at a school in Uhana, Amparai.
 
The money had entered the classroom to attack the girl.
 
Later, she was admitted to Amparai General Hospital for treatment.

heading: Leopard killing : Suspects granted bail
content:
The ten suspects who were in remand custody over the killing of a leopard in Ambalkulam area in Kilinochchi have been granted bail.
Each person was ordered to place two personal bails worth Rs. 200,000 and cash surety of Rs. 5,000.
The suspects are residents of Ambalkulam.

heading: Kirivehera shooting CCTV footage out
content:
The CCTV recording relating to the shooting on the Chief Incumbent of Kirivehera Temple, Ven. Kobawaka Dhamminda Thera has been released.
 
The shooting incident took place on the 12th of June.
 
The injured Thera is still being treated at a private hospital in Colombo.
 
Meanwhile, the seven suspects who are in remand custody were further remanded until 18th of July.
 
The suspects were produced before Tissamaharama Magistrate yesterday.

heading: Sinhala Ravaya requests President to issue an order to arrest Vijayakala
content:
Sinhala Ravaya says they will submit a letter to the President today (Jul 06) requesting that Vijayakala Maheshwaran who resigned from her portfolio of State Minister of Child Affairs, be arrested.
 
The General Secretary of Sinhala Ravaya, Magalkande Sudaththa Thera said that the party would give evidence against the former State Minister.
 
Maheshwaran had submitted her letter of resignation to the President and the Prime Minister last afternoon.
 
She had decided to resign following a meeting with Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe after her controversial statement on the revival of LTTE drew condemnation from many quarters.

heading: Probe underway to identify public officials who applauded Vijayakala’s statement
content:
Jaffna District Secretary, Nagalingam Vedanayagam says that an inquiry would be conducted to identify the public officials who applauded State Minister Vijayakala Maheswaran’s statement during a recent event in Jaffna.
 
The District Secretary said that certain public officials who were on stage at that time had reportedly approved her controversial statement by applauding her.
 
The District Secretary has already informed all Divisional Secretaries in the Jaffna district to provide him with information of such officials.
 
Meanwhile, Speaker Karu Jayasuriya informed the Attorney General to determine if the State Minister has, in fact, violated the constitution through her statement.
 
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe also told parliament yesterday that a special inquiry would be conducted with regard to the statement.
 
Several organizations have complained to police against her statement and the IGP has handed over the investigation to the Colombo Crimes Division.
 
Accordingly, Senior DIG in charge of Crimes told us that the director is conducting the investigation.
 
He also said that police expect to make submissions to the Jaffna Magistrate Court and obtain his views over the incident.
 
Meanwhile, State Minister of Child Affairs, Vijayakala Maheswaran this morning said that she decided to resign from her portfolio.
 
She said she took the decision after having consulted Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.
 
She met the PM at Temple Trees last evening.
 
During a public event in Jaffna, the State Minister said that she would like to see the resurrection of the LTTE in the North.

heading: Objections in Parliament for proposed limitations to representation in regional development committees
content:
The Opposition MPs raised objections in Parliament today (Jul 05) to the new circular restricting the participation by local government councillors in regional development committee meetings.
 
Opposition MP, Ranjith Zoysa questioned the Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe as to whether the new circular has been cancelled.
 
Recently, a tense situation erupted in Mulatiyana Development Committee meeting when a JVP councillor asked a question from Minister Sagala Rathnayake.
 
Minister Rathnayake responded by saying that only the Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman, his representative, and the Opposition Leader have authority to participate in the meeting.
 
The relevant councillors then walked out, in protest of the Minister’s statement.
 
The new circular was introduced consequent to that incident.

heading: 12 Indian fishermen apprehended
content:
Sri Lanka Navy has apprehended 12 Indian fishermen for encroaching Sri Lankan waters in the early hours of today (Jul 05).
 
They were arrested off Delft Island along with two fishing vessels.
 
The arrested Indian fishermen will be handed over to Jaffna office of the Fisheries Department for necessary action.

heading: Millions of rupees worth liquor and narcotics found at Orugodawatta
content:
Customs officers have found foreign liquor and narcotics inside a container at Orugodawatta cargo terminal.
 
The Media spokesperson of Customs, Sunil Jayaratne noted that hashish worth Rs. 2.9 million weighing 2.945 kilos and 2 kilos of kush cannabis worth Rs. 80 million were also found.
 
Further 220 bottles of liquor, 225 bottles of wine, and 110 cans of beer had also been seized by customs.
 
The container had arrived into the country from Italy, and there had been no address or name of the supposed receiver.
 
A clearance representative and a wharf clerk have been arrested in connection to the incident.

heading: Suspects in Kirivehera shooting further remanded
content:
The seven suspects who are in remand custody over the shooting of the Chief Incumbent of Kirivehera in Kataragama have been further remanded.
 
The Tissamaharama Magistrate remanded the suspects until 18th of this month when they were produced in court yesterday (Jul 04).
 
Ven. Kobawaka Dhamminda Thera who received gunshot injuries to his abdomen and a hand is still being treated at a private hospital in Colombo.

heading: National Audit Bill passed with amendments
content:
The National Audit Bill was passed in Parliament with amendments today (Jul 05).
Chief Government Whip Minister Gayantha Karunatilleke presented the draft in Parliament on 3rd of April.
Powers and functions of the National Audit Commission and the provisions for setting up of the national audit Office as well as the Sri Lanka State Audit Service are included in the bill.
Meanwhile, addressing the House, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said the government opted to discuss the operations of the Mattala International Airport with India as China does not show positive interest about it.

heading: Newly married 19-year-old dies in motorcycle accident
content:
Newly married 19-year-old dies in motorcycle accident"A 19-year-old youth was killed when a motorcycle collided head-on with a luxury bus at Henwala in Weligama, Matara this morning (Jul 05).
 
The victim, a resident of Kapparatota, Matara had married just two days ago.
 
The pillion rider was admitted to Matara General Hospital with critical condition.
 
Weligama Police is probing the incident.

heading: President's Secretary resigns
content:
President's Secretary Austin Fernando has resigned.
 
The President's Media Division made the announcement in a Twitter message.
 
It adds that Fernando left his office at the Presidential Secretariat a short while ago.

heading: "Hiruta Wissai Thagi Wassai" - Awarding of trucks commences
content: The Awarding of trucks under the "Hiruta Wissai Thagi Wassai" programme began this morning (Jul 06).Under this programme Rs. 35 million worth 20 Mahendra Supro trucks, each valued at Rs. 1.75 million will be presented to lucky winners.This is the largest ever award programme in the country's media history.The winners are chosen through SMS and once the name of the lucky winner is announced through the HIRU FM, he or she needs to contact us over the phone.Meanwhile, HIRU TV presents 20 Mahendra Reva cars which are worth Rs. 2.5 million each to the viewers of HIRU Tele Perahera.

heading: Bond report's section 'C-350' published
content:
Director of the National Archives, Madeera Rupasinghe says on a request by the President's Secretary, the section C-350 of the Bond Commission report is published.
