She said it could be purchased from the National Archives.
 
It contained telephone conversation details of COPE members and former Finance Minister relating to the bond controversy.

heading: Two schoolboys die in Denagama road accident (Photos)
content:
Two schoolboys were killed when the motorcycle that they were riding collided with a CTB bus at Pitawalgamuwa on the Deiyandara - Hakmana road.
 
The incident occurred at around 6.45 this morning.
 
The bus was heading towards Hakmana from Deiyandara.
 
The victims, Kelum Sandaruwan was aged 16 and Indrajith Kumara was aged 19 and they are residents of Denagama.
 
The bus driver has been arrested by police.

heading: Military uniforms and weapons found in a house in Medirigiriya
content:
Two Army uniforms, five magazines, three magazine holders and two anti-personal mines have been found from a house in Medirigiriya.
 
The military items were hidden in a hut nearby the house.
 
Police said an elderly woman was living at the house and her two sons are soldiers.
 
Her third son was a former soldier and he had been legally discharged from service.

heading: Teacher strike disrupts school activities
content:
Today’s joint strike launched by several teacher unions and principles, left activities at most government schools disrupted.
 
The Union Collective for Protecting Education launched the strike to voice their opposition against politically motivated teacher transfers and appointments.
 
Our correspondents said that students in certain areas although students were present at schools, teachers were not available.
 
In some areas, students were sent home.
 
Meanwhile, the Union Collective for Protecting Education engaged in a protest in front of the Education Ministry in Pelawatta, Battaramulla.

heading: Leave of police officers in Jaffna Division cancelled
content:
Considering incidents reported in recent days the leave of all police officers in Jaffna division have been cancelled.A senior police officer said that the decision was taken to expedite the investigations on those reported incidents.
Meanwhile, Senior DIG in the Northern Province, Roshan Fernando has also called in additional 100 police officers from Vavuniya and Mannar Divisions to the Jaffna Division to help the ongoing probes.

heading: Vijayakala in Colombo to meet Prime Minister
content:
State Minister, Vijayakala Maheswaran has arrived in Colombo to meet with the Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe.
 
The government sources revealed that the meeting is scheduled for 6.30 this evening.
 
The State Minister became a talking point following her controversial statement where she had said, a public gathering in Jaffna, that the LTTE should be resurrected.
 
The matter created tension in Parliament yesterday (Jul 03) and the House was adjourned as the heated situation escalated beyond control.
 
The Joint Opposition demanded that the Speaker expel State Minister Maheswaran from Parliament.
 
Accordingly, the Speaker informed the Attorney General to ascertain whether the State Minister has violated the constitution in making that statement.
 
The TNA, SLFP as well as fellow MPs from her own party, the UNP protested against her statement.
 
Meanwhile, State Minister Maheswaran has informed her party that she would attend Parliament this afternoon.
 
Prime Minister, Ranil Wickremesinghe is scheduled to make a special statement in parliament today with regard to this matter.
 
In addition, several factions made complaints to police yesterday against her controversial statement.

heading: Court of Appeal issues 'Stay Order' against Gotabhaya's case
content:
The Court of Appeal has issued a 'Stay Order' preventing the hearing of Avant-Garde case against Gotabaya Rajapaksa and 8 others at Colombo Magistrate's Court.
 
The Bribery Commission filed this case against the accused saying that by allowing Avant-Garde to maintain a floating armoury they have incurred a loss of 11,400 million rupees to the state.
 
The Court of Appeal issued this order today (Jul 04), considering a revised appeal filed by the former Defence Secretary Gotabhaya Rajapaksa.
 
He wanted the court to acquit from this case.

heading: Weerakumara & Wijewickrama appointed as SLFP Organizers
content:
State Ministers Weerakumara Dissanayake and Sriyani Wijewickrema have been appointed as the Sri Lanka Freedom Party electoral organizers.
 
State Minister Weerakumara is the new SLFP organizer for Horowpathana and Sriyani Wijewickrama is the new SLFP organizer for Amparai.
 
They had obtained their appointment letters from President Maithripala Sirisena at his official residence in Colombo this afternoon (Jul 04).

heading: IGP assigns DIG to probe allegations against Vijayakala
content: IGP Pujith Jayasundera has handed over investigations into the complaints against State Minister Vijayakala Maheswaran to the Senior Crime DIG.

heading: Diverse views expressed on Vijayakala's statement
content: Politicians expressed diverse views on the statement made by State Minister Vijayakala Maheshwaran on LTTE's revival.

heading: Rajapaksa brothers meet at SLPP office
content:
Chamal, Mahinda, Basil & Gotabhaya meet at Podujana Peramuna Office....Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa says that the law of the land should be protected before establishing party discipline.
He said this speaking at a ceremony to offer Podujana Peramuna membership to a group of UPFA Provincial Councillors at the party headquarters in Battaramulla today (Jul 04).
135 UPFA Provincial Councillors obtained membership of the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna during this ceremony.
Chamal Rajapaksa, Basil Rajapaksa and a former Defense Secretary, Gotabhaya Rajapaksa were also present.

heading: State Minister Vijayakalaa meets Prime Minister
content:
State Minister Vijayakalaa Maheshwaran met with Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe at Temple Trees yesterday (Jul 04).
 
However, at this stage details regarding the discussion are not released.
 
Our correspondent who was present at Temple Trees at the time of the meeting said the State Minister left the premises via an alternative route to avoid the media.
 
A potentially tense situation was created in the country in response to the statement made by her that the LTTE should be resurrected.
 
Making a special statement in Parliament yesterday, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe said that there was no change in the government’s stance regarding protecting unity in the country.
 
Prime Minister said that State Minister Vijayakalaa Maheshwaran would be summoned get clarifications about her statement and the party has already decided to take actions against her.

heading: Attempt to smuggle in gems to Sri Lanka thwarted (Photos)
content:
A 35-year-old Chinese female passenger arrived from Bangkok was apprehended by Customs officers attached to the Bandaranaike International Airport last night while attempting to smuggle in 13 lots and 18 pieces of gems into the country.
 
The estimated value of the gems was Rs. 4.8 million.
 
Following a probe the gems were forfeited and a penalty of Rs. 40,000 were imposed on the Chinese passenger.

heading: Thalawa bank heist : Cash & jewellery worth over Rs. 160mn looted
content:
The Manager of the Thalawa bank, which was looted by a gang of robbers over the weekend has informed police that the total value of cash and jewellery found to be missing is over Rs. 160 million.
 
This robbery in a branch of a state bank is considered to be the largest bank robbery in Anuradhapura to date.
 
No one has been arrested over the incident as yet.
 
Police have deployed eight teams to apprehend the robbers.

heading: “China – Sri Lanka cooperation on Hambantota Port will continue”, Chinese Foreign Ministry
content:
China and Sri Lanka are committed to pushing forward cooperation on the Hambantota port project and realizing the goal of making Sri Lanka the logistics center of the Indian Ocean, said a Foreign Ministry spokesperson yesterday.
 
"This is not only conducive to the economic development of Sri Lanka but also conducive to regional interconnection and the common prosperity of regional countries," Spokesperson Lu Kang told a press briefing.
 
Lu made the remarks in response to allegations that appeared in US media reports, which stated that China's acquisition of the Hambantota port from Sri Lanka highlights its "debt trap" and ambitious use of loans to gain influence around the world.
 
Lu said such reports seriously distort the facts, which are either irresponsible or under the orders of people with ulterior motives, "We hope that the relevant media will not be keen on fake news."
 
The construction of the Hambantota port is the wish of successive governments and people of Sri Lanka, said Lu, adding that China encourages its companies to cooperate with the Sri Lankan side according to commercial principles and on the basis of equality and mutual benefit.
 
"According to the needs of Sri Lanka, Chinese financial institutions have provided support to Sri Lanka in solving the financing gap. Later, the Chinese side made efforts to adjust relevant asset allocation according to the wishes of the Sri Lankan side," said Lu, noting that those arrangements will benefit the business cooperation between the two sides.
 
"If the fabricators of the so-called 'debt trap' cannot give the developing countries real help, they can at least take a healthy attitude towards the sincere cooperation between other countries," said Lu.

heading: Group of 16 to meet MR
content:
The Sri Lanka Freedom Party's 16 parliamentarians who resigned from the government in April are meeting former President Mahinda Rajapaksa this afternoon (Jul 02).
MP Ranjith de Zoysa said the meeting will take place at the Wijerama Road residence of the former President.

heading: Rs. 23 million worth of cocaine retrieved from Brazilians
content:
The Police Narcotics Bureau says the value of cocaine capsules retrieved from two Brazilians who were arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport is 23 million rupees.
 
The doctors at the Negombo Hospital were successful in their attempts to retrieve cocaine from the two individuals who had arrived from Doha Qatar yesterday and this morning (Jul 01).
 
 The doctors had retrieved 103 pellets were recovered, and the collective weight was 900 grams.
 
The Customs Media Unit said that the suspects were arrested following intelligence information gathered by their officials and the PNB.
 
The 30-year-old Brazilian national arrested yesterday was remanded for 7 days for questioning after he was produced before the Negombo Magistrate today.

heading: Wild elephant flees from Kurunegala to Rambukkana
content:
A wild elephant that had fled during a mission in Kappetigala, Kurunegala, has spotted in Halagiriya, Rambukkana.
 
Our correspondents said that a special operation by Wildlife Conservation Officers and Special Task Force is underway since this morning to chase the wild elephant away.
 
The Operation Director of the Wildlife Conservation Department, Manjula Amararathna urged the general public to refrain from visiting the area to witness the elephant.

heading: Deputy Minister Ranjan makes conflicting statements
content:
Deputy Minister Ranjan Ramanayake is making conflicting statements on an article published in The New York Times.
 
He earlier said that the female journalist had told him that she obtained details to write the article from the Criminal Investigation Department.
 
However, convening a media conference in Colombo today (Jul 01), the Deputy Minister said that he did not make such a statement.
 
Ramanayake told the media on 29th that he spoke to the female journalist over the phone and then she told him that she got relevant details from the CID.

heading: Another foreigner arrested at BIA with cocaine
content:
Another foreigner was arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport who had attempted to smuggle in cocaine.
 
The 24-year-old suspect was from Brazil.The suspect had arrived in Sri Lanka at around 11.20 am today from Doha Qatar.
The PNB has already retrieved five cocaine pills from him.
He will be admitted to Negombo Hospital and then conveyed information to Negombo Magistrate, the police said.The PNB officials said that the suspect had swallowed cocaine pills.

He was the second Brazilian arrested at the BIA within two days with cocaine.

Meanwhile, the PNB had obtained detention orders from the Magistrate to interrogate the other suspect who was arrested at the BIA yesterday.

heading: 31 injured as elephants go on a rampage in Kahawatte
content:
31 individuals admitted to hospital after they got injured as elephants went on a rampage at the Mihindu Perahera in Kahawatta.
The Police Media Spokesperson noted that 19 women and 12 men were injured in the incident.
An on-duty police officer at the Perehera was also injured and admitted to the Ratnapura hospital.
One of the elephants taking part in the Perehara had first gone berserk and few other elephants joined it creating a chaotic situation.

heading: JVP's 20 A plans hindered - Vasu
content:
The Joint Opposition says that the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna has unable to bring in the 20th amendment to the constitution due to lack of a majority.
MP Vasudeva Nanayakkara said this addressing a public forum titled "Ratata Hathuru 20 Epa" held in Ruwanwella yesterday (Jul 01).
He said that the JVP had brought in the 20 A as a result of United National Party's influence.

heading: CPC losses mount - Ministry Secretary
content:
The Secretary to the Ministry of Petroleum Resources Development, Upali Marasinghe says the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation is suffering due to payments to be settled by SriLankan Airlines and Ceylon Electricity Board.
 
The national carrier owes Rs. 12 billion while the CEB is to settle Rs. 55 billion to the CPC.
 
Marasinghe said because of this, the CPC is struggling to survive and the CPC is paying Rs. one billion as interests for loans it acquired.

heading: CPC warns SriLankan Airlines
content:
Ceylon Petroleum Corporation says if dues are not paid by Wednesday, it will not issue fuel to SriLankan Airlines.
 
The CPC chairman Dammika Ranatunga said that Ceylon Electricity Board has also been informed of the debt owed to the CPC.
 
Earlier, the Ministry said that SriLankan Airlines owes Rs. 12 billion to the CPC for supplying fuel.

heading: Various views expressed on NYT report
content: Various views were expressed on the details mentioned about former President Mahinda Rajapaksa in a New York Times article.

heading: Chinese embassy responds to NYT article
content:
The Chinese Embassy in Colombo has responded to the recent article on New York Times, which said China cough up Hambantota Port through loans.
 
The embassy said that the article was full of political prejudice and completely inconsistent with the fact.

heading: Largest promotion ever 'Hiruta wissai, thagi wassai programme' commences
content: 'Hiruta wissai, thagi wassai programme' commences...20 cars and 20 trucks worth millions will be awarded to our loyal audience in view of the 20th anniversary of HIRU, which will be the largest promotional giveaway ever.20 Mahendra Reva luxury motor cars worth 2.5 million rupees each will be on offer to HIRU TV viewers.20 Mahendra Supro trucks worth 1.75 million rupees each will be offered for HIRU FM listeners in view of the 20th anniversary of Hiru.Over 50 million rupees worth vehicles are on offer through the “20 cars in 20 days as HIRU turns 20” programme.Anyone who watches HIRU TV Tele series from Monday to Friday from 7.30 pm to 9.55 pm will stand a chance to win a luxury Mahendra Reva motor car worth 2.5 million rupees.Simultaneously 20 Mahendra Supro trucks worth over 35 million rupees will be on offer for HIRU FM listeners.This is the largest promotional giveaway ever and this is in appreciation of our loyal audience which is our greatest asset.

heading: Veteran cinema personality Roy de Silva dies
content:
Popular actor and film director Roy de Silva has passed away.
He was aged 80 at the time of his death.
He entered the cinema industry in 1964.

heading: Former President rejects New York Times report
content:
Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa has categorically rejected claims by The New York Times that he had obtained money from China Harbour Company for expenses related to the 2015 Presidential Election.
 
He rejected these claims in a communiqué, in response to the article published by The New York Times titled “How China got Sri Lanka to cough up a port”.
 
The former President said that the main allegation in this article that funds had been given to me as campaign contributions by China Harbor Company during the 2015 Presidential Elections, is based on a Reuters report that appeared three years ago in July 2015.
 
At that time the Yahapalana government had suspended all Chinese funded projects and all Chinese firms including China Harbour which was building the Colombo Port City were being investigated.
 
Former President Rajapaksa said that more than a year later, this government cleared China Harbour Company of any wrongdoing and the Port City project was handed back to them.
 
He also said that the New York Times article has been intentionally vague about who had given this money and who had received it.
 
The former President also said that the main preoccupation of this government since it came into power has been to sling mud at the opposition.
 
While pointing out that the New York Times report had said that the Hambantota Port drew only 32 ships in 2012 but failed to mention that this increased to 335 in 2014.
 
Former President Rajapaksa finally said that the New York Times had described me as China’s preferred partner in Sri Lanka but given what has taken place after 2015, he has no doubt that he is now the preferred partner of India as well.
 
Meanwhile, the Chinese embassy in Colombo has issued a statement regarding the reports published by New York Times which said that China had funded former President Mahinda Rajapaksa’s election campaign.
 
The statement said that the report was unsubstantiated and full of political prejudice and has already been criticized by many.

heading: Two arrested at BIA with foreign currency (Photos)
content:
Sri Lanka Customs unit at the Bandaranaike International Airport has arrested two Sri Lankans while trying to smuggle out Rs. 6.4mn worth foreign currency notes.
 
The suspects aged, 61 and 33 were residents of Gampaha.
 
British Pound, Euros and Saudi Riyal were found.
 
The suspects have been released after forfeiting the foreign currency.

heading: MR says "Group of 16" is with him
content:
Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa says that no matter how the government decides to hold the provincial council elections, his team will emerge victoriously.
 
He also said that the SLFP's 16 MPs who resigned from the government in April are now supporting him.
 
The former President made these comments at an event held in Mawathagama Kurunegala.

heading: Brazilian's attempt to smuggle in cocaine foiled (Photos)
content:
Police Narcotics Bureau has apprehended a Brazilian who had attempted to smuggle in 500g of cocaine to the country.
 
He had arrived in the island last morning from Doha Qatar and later he was admitted to Negombo Hospital.
 
At the hospital, 60 capsules containing cocaine were retrieved.
 
The estimated value of the narcotic haul was Rs. 15 million.
 
The PNB will produce the suspect before Negombo Magistrate.

heading: Losses at CEB increase by 240%
content:
The losses suffered by the Ceylon Electricity Board during 2017 has increased by 240 percent in comparison to 2016.
According to the latest report issued by the Finance Ministry, the CEB had incurred losses of 49.231 billion rupees.
In 2016 the figure stood at 14.499 billion rupees.
Dry weather in catchment areas of hydropower stations was cited as one reason for the increase in losses.

heading: Husband throws acid at wife
content:
A husband in Hanwella has thrown acid at his wife following a family dispute.
 
The incident had occurred on last Tuesday (Jun 26).
 
The suspect who had fled the area following the incident was arrested today.
 
His two daughters were also injured in the incident and they are now receiving treatment at Avissawella Hospital.

heading: Fuel pricing formula to be continued
content:
State Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs Dr. Harsha de Silva says that the fuel pricing formula will continue to be in place.
Although the Finance Ministry said that fuel prices were increased with effect from midnight day before yesterday, based on the pricing formula, the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation took steps to sell fuel at previous prices from last afternoon.
It seemed that the decision to increase the prices had been implemented without making the relevant authorities known about it.
However, Lanka IOC said that they would sell fuel at the increased rates.
State Minister Dr. Harsha de Silva said that the CPC has no authority in deciding the fuel prices.
However, President of the Jathika Sevaka Sangamaya at the CPC, Ananda Palitha said that the issue had cropped up by leaving the subject Minister in the dark regarding the decision taken by the committee looking in to fuel prices.
Thereafter, the Finance Ministry yesterday said that a decision on the fuel price will be taken at the next cabinet meeting.

heading: Joint Opposition demands PC election be conducted under old system
content:
The Joint Opposition has demanded that the Provincial Council Election be conducted under the old system.
 
Addressing a media conference in Colombo today (Jul 06), MP Dr. Ramesh Pathirana said that the government is intentionally delaying the election.

heading: Senior administrative officer appointed as President's Secretary
content:
Senior administrative officer Udaya R. Seneviratne has been appointed as new Secretary to President.
 
He had assumed office this afternoon.
 
Seneviratne succeeded veteran civil servant Austin Fernando, who resigned from the post yesterday.

heading: Female drug trafficker escapes from police
content:
A female drug trafficker has escaped from the custody of Kandana Police.
Police Spokesperson SP Ruwan Gunasekera said that the woman who was arrested on Thursday had escaped from the police custody in the early hours of yesterday (Jul 06).
He said that the woman was arrested for having heroin, cannabis and an artificial drug in her possession.
The woman was a resident of Sebastian Road, Kandana and police have launched an operation to apprehend her.
A special probe has also been launched under the ASP in Charge of Kelaniya Division.

heading: HIRU TV's 20th anniversary: Homagama wins second car
content:
The loyal viewers of HIRU TV's Tele Perahara now have a chance to win an Rs. 2.5 million worth Mahindra Reva e20 car on five days of the week.
 
HIRU TV's Tele Perahara runs from 7.30 pm to 9.55 pm on weekdays.
 
The respective winner will be chosen through the SMS.
 
A question will be posted during a teledrama, and the viewers can send the answer via SMS to HTP (space) (number sequence of the answers) (space) name, NIC number, area and send the SMS to 7766.
 
The winner of that respective day will appear on the screen during the "Thaamath Adare Nathnam" teledrama.
 
The winner should confirm his identity within three minutes by calling 0114 799736.
 
The winner of the first car was a resident of Hakmana and the lucky winner of the second car found from Homagama.

heading: Prime Minister leaves for Singapore on Sunday
content:
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe will be visiting Singapore on Sunday (Jul 08) to attend the World Cities Summit, Singapore International water week and Clean Environment Summit Singapore 2018.
 
Prime Minister Wickremesinghe will deliver the Keynote address on Monday, at the summit covering the insight, trends, and solutions concerning Urban Development and Environment protection.
 
During his visit, he is also scheduled to meet the Prime Minister of Singapore Lee Hsien Loong, Tharman Shanmugaratnam, Deputy Prime Minister and Coordinating Minister for Economic and Social Policies, Former Prime Minister Goh Chok Tong and high-level dignitaries of the Singapore Government.

heading: Cabinet to decide on Ceypetco fuel prices
content: The decision on Ceypetco fuel prices will be taken at the next Cabinet meeting.This was announced by the Finance Ministry.

heading: GMOA to make a revelation next week
content:
The Government Medical Officers' Association says they would make an analytical revelation on Sri Lanka - Singapore Free Trade Agreement on 12th of this month.
 
The President of the GMOA, Dr. Anuruddha Padeniya revealed this after having called on Archbishop of Colombo, His Eminence Malcolm Cardinal Ranjith yesterday (Jul 06).
 
Here the GMOA delegation appraised the Archbishop on the possible negative impacts of the SL - Singapore FTA.

heading: Fire breaks out at a Pettah shop
content: Colombo Fire Brigade says that a fire has broken out at a shop in the Main Street of Pettah.

heading: Gangsters clash in Jaffna
content:
A house of a former member of an 'Avaa Group' came under an arson attack last night.
 
The owner of the house has complained to the police that he suspects that the members of Dhanu-rock Group may have carried out the attack.
 
It was reported four-masked men arrived on motorcycles to carry out the attack.

heading: UNP appoints committee to examine Vijayakala's statement
content:
The United National Party has appointed a four-member Committee to examine former State Minister Vijayakala Maheswaran's statement.
 
The Committee members are Ministers Thalatha Athukorala, Akila Viraj Kariyawasam, Kabir Hashim and Ranjith Maddumabandara.
 
Meanwhile, Speaker Karu Jayasuriya told the Parliament today (Jul 06) that the highest possible action has been taken against Jaffna district UNP MP Vijayakala Maheshwaran.
 
He said this in response to a query posed by the leader of National Freedom Front Wimal Weerawansa.
 
The Speaker said that the Attorney General has been adviced to take necessary action against her.
 
Colombo Chief Magistrate Ranga Dissanayake today (Jul 06) ordered five media institutions to provide the unedited recording containing the controversial statement of former State Minister Vijayakala Maheshwaran to the Organized Crimes Prevention Division.
He gave the order considering a case filed by the National Organizer of Sinhala Ravaya, Ven. Magalkande Sudaththa Thera.
 
Our court correspondent said that the Organized Crimes Prevention Division made a submission to the court on the incident and the Magistrate issued the order based on their submissions.
 
Meanwhile, Sinhala Ravaya said they will hand over a letter to the President’s Secretariat today (Jul 06) requesting that Vijayakala Maheshwaran is arrested.
 
The National Organizer of Sinhala Ravaya, Ven. Magalkande Sudaththa Thera said that the party would give evidence against the former State Minister in the court.
 
Maheshwaran submitted her letter of resignation to the President and the Prime Minister last afternoon.
 
She had decided to resign following a meeting with Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe after her controversial statement on the revival of LTTE drew condemnation from many quarters.

heading: SL Customs generate Rs. 724mn via raids
content:
The Sri Lanka Customs has said that it has been able to generate a revenue of Rs. 724 million in raids carried out on attempted smuggling of gold and narcotics in the last 6 months.
 
Customs Media Spokesperson, Sunil Jayarathne told us that raids on gold carried out by Sri Lanka Customs have increased by 400% compared to the previous year.

heading: Four ETI directors barred from going abroad
content:
The Fort Magistrate Court has issued an order barring four of the ETI Finance directors from going abroad.
Jeewaka Edirisinghe, Nalaka Edirisinghe, Deepa Edirisinghe and Asanka Edirisinghe are among them.
They were also ordered to appear before the Fort Magistrate on 17th of July.
Meanwhile, the Attorney General has informed the court that since 2011, ETI Finance has been operated disregarding the Central Bank's financial regulations and monetary laws.

heading: Court orders five media institutions to provide full statement of Vijayakala
content:
Colombo Chief Magistrate Ranga Dissanayake today (Jul 06) ordered five media institutions to provide the unedited recording containing the controversial statement of former State Minister Vijayakala Maheshwaran to the Organized Crimes Prevention Division.
 
He gave the order considering a case filed by the National Organizer of Sinhala Ravaya, Ven. Magalkande Sudaththa Thera.
 
Our court correspondent said that the Organized Crimes Prevention Division made a submission to the court on the incident and the Magistrate issued the order based on their submissions.

heading: Post-Master General transferred
content: Post-Master General Rohana Abeyratne has been transferred to the Presidential Secretariat.He had been transferred following a request by the Presidential Secretariat.Minister of Posts, M. H. A. Haleem confirmed this with us.

heading: President makes a tough decision
content: The President Maithripala Sirisena said that he would sign required documents to execute death penalty on convicted drug peddlers if such convicts dare to keep involved in the same crime.President Sirisena said this while speaking at the launch of school drug prevention campaign at the Gatambe sports ground in Kandy today.

heading: Lanka IOC says 'will sell fuel at new prices'
content: Lanka IOC says it will not reduce fuel prices and will continue to sell fuel at new prices revised from midnight yesterday.

heading: Armed forced to be deployed to prevent drug trafficking
content:
Government is considering to seek the active participation of the three-armed forces to tackle drug trafficking.
Accordingly, the Cabinet had passed a proposal to draft the relevant bill.
Co-Cabinet Spokesperson Minister Gayantha Karunatillake revealed this during the weekly Cabinet media briefing held at the Government Information Department this morning (Jul 11).The new legislature, Drug Controlling Special Provision Bill will empower the armed forces for a particular period to fight the drug menace as recommended by the Attorney General.

heading: Heap of concealed mail sacks found in Galle
content:
Ministry of Posts and Postal Services M. H. A. Haleem says that an investigation has commenced into sacks of mail that were recovered in the inspecting officers’ room at the main post office in Galle.
 
The sacks appear to be several months old.
 
Thousands of items dated several months back were recovered yesterday upon an investigation conducted by the Southern Province Deputy Postal Director and the Galle District Postal Director.
 
The Southern Province Deputy Postal Director had received several anonymous complaints about the mail sacks being stored at the main post office in Galle.
 
During this inspection, it was observed that several letters as well as parcels sent from overseas been opened.
 
Additionally, a large number of letters sent by two Ministers of the Galle District which were to be sent to the voters during the recent Local Government Election were also found, in this room.
 
The Joint Postal Trade Union Front’s Convener, Chinthaka Bandara urged that the Minister should take immediate action against the wrongdoers.

heading: Private bus unions expect a fair hike after increase in fuel prices
content:
The private bus unions have says that bus fares should be increased in line with the increase in fuel prices.
 
The Secretary of the All Ceylon Private Bus Federation, Anjana Priyanjith said that bus owners will have to bear a loss of between Rs. 500 to Rs. 750 for short-distance services and Rs. 1200 to Rs. 1500 for long distance services.
 
From midnight yesterday, the Finance Ministry increased the fuel prices based on the recently approved to the price formula.
 
As a result, a liter of petrol was increased by Rs. 8 while a liter of diesel was increased by Rs. 9.
 
According to the current price formula, fuel prices will be revised every two months.
 
 The next revision is scheduled for 5th of September 5th.
 
Petrol and diesel prices were increased by Rs. 20 and Rs. 14 per liter respectively on 10th of May.
 
Meanwhile, JVP leader, Anura Kumara Dissanayake revealed in Parliament today (Jul 06) that President Maithripala Sirisena has instructed to cancel the new fuel price increase.

heading: Still no price revision at CPC fuel sheds ?
content: The fuel station owners who sell fuel provided by the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation says that they sell CPC fuel based on previous prices, on the instructions of the CPC.

heading: Water cut in Kotte MC and Colombo 5
content:
A 9-hour water cut from 9 am tomorrow in Kotte Municipal Council area and Colombo 5.
 
The National Water Supply and Drainage Board also said low pressure will be experienced in Colombo 4, 6, 7, 8, Maharagama and Borelesgamuwa.

heading: Owners of houses damaged by strong winds, compensated
content:
Disaster Management Ministry has disbursed Rs. 10,000 each among the owners of the houses that were damaged by strong winds that affected several parts of Colombo this morning (Jul 11).
 
The payment was made to the households in Dehiwela and Mount Lavinia.
 
Minister of Disaster Management, Duminda Dissanayake said that the owners of the damaged houses in other areas will be given the money within the course of today.

heading: School vans and three-wheeler drivers demand a fare hike
content:
The school van operators and three-wheeler drivers demand that the fares should be increased following the upward revision of the fuel prices.
 
Meanwhile, Chairman of the Lanka Self-Employed Three-Wheeler Operators' Union, Sunil Jayawardena said that the fare for the first kilometer should be increased up to 80 rupees.However, All-Island Three-Wheeler Operators' and Owners' Union PresidentSudil Jayaruk said that they will not increase the fares.
He said if fares are increased further public will not use three-wheelers as a mode of transport.
When contacted, Malsri de Silva, All-Island School Children Transport Union's President said that they might have to increase the fares of school vans and buses due to the latest fuel price revision.

heading: Monk remanded for strangulating policeman
content:
The resident monk of Gallanda temple in Ratnapura who was arrested yesterday after being accused of strangulating a policeman to death was remanded until 25th of July.
 
The monk was produced before Ratnapura Magistrate, Saliya Chandana Abeyratne today (Jul 11).
 
It was revealed that the monk had assaulted and strangulated the policeman who had visited the temple to serve a warrant on the monk.
 
The policeman died upon admission to Ratnapura Hospital.
 
Police Spokesperson said that the deceased was 55-year-old sergeant Chandra Jayalal Samarawickrema.
 
He was a father of two.

heading: Two arrested with heroin worth Rs. 118mn
content:
Criminal Investigations Department has arrested two persons in Seruwawila with 9.9kg of heroin.
The estimated value of the find was Rs. 118 million.

heading: CPC says fuel price increase 'not enough'
content:
The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation says that the fuel prices should be increased by another 7 rupees to offset its accumulated losses.
It further says that a severe loss is accrued by selling kerosene at 70 rupees per litre in addition to subsidizing diesel and petrol.
Meanwhile, private bus and school van operators, office transport operators and three wheel drivers demand that the fares should be increased following the increase in fuel prices.

heading: US maritime aircraft locates missing Sri Lankan fishing vessel
content:
US embassy in Colombo says that US Navy's P-8A Poseidon maritime patrol aircraft located the missing fishing vessel with seven Sri Lankans onboard after joining search efforts at the request of the Sri Lankan Navy.
 
The vessel was located by an aircraft from the “Pelicans” of Patrol Squadron (VP) 45 assigned to US 7th Fleet and flew out of Naval Support Facility Diego Garcia, the embassy added.
 
The 40-foot vessel and crew went missing the morning of 8th of July Dondra Head, Sri Lanka.
 
Now a Sri Lankan Navy ship is heading to the location provided by the P-8A along with a commercial vessel nearby to render assistance.

heading: Detention Center for Sinharaja elephants
content:
The Cabinet has approved a proposal for the establishment of an Elephant Detention Centre for two elephants in Sinharaja Reserve.
 
The relevant cabinet paper has been moved by Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka, Minister of Sustainable Development, Wild Life and Regional Development.
 
Accordingly, 36 hectares of land in Parugala area in the Dolekanda Grama Niladhari Division will be acquired for this purpose.

heading: Anura Kumara reveals President's directive on fuel price revision
content:
The leader of the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna, Anura Kumara Dissanayake says that President Maithripala Sirisena has informed the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation to reduce fuel prices.He told this in Parliament.
 
The Finance Ministry upwardly revised the fuel prices with effect from midnight yesterday (Jul 05).
 
Accordingly, Lanka IOC also increased the fuel prices.

heading: Singer Priyani Jayasinghe murdered
content:
Police say that singer Priyani Jayasinghe has been stabbed to death.
Her body was found at her home in Panadura.
Police said that her husband is suspected of committing the crime.

heading: Two young women jump before a moving train in Gampaha
content:
Two young women have committed suicide by jumping before Badulla bound night train in Gampaha.
 
The incident had occurred at around 8.45 pm yesterday in Gampaha.
 
Police said both of them died instantaneously when they jumped before the train.
 
One of the women was a 21-year-old from Minuwangoda and the other young woman was a 22-year-old from Negombo.
 
One of them had left a suicide note and police found it at the location where they committed suicide.
 
Police also found a passport, travelling bag, service ID card, key and two mobile phones from the location.

heading: Strong winds damage houses in Colombo
content:
Over 150 houses in the Colombo district have damaged due to strong winds that prevailed over the island.
 
The Deputy Director of the Disaster Management Centre Pradeep Koddippili, speaking says that many houses in the Homagama, Piliyandala, Moratuwa, Dehiwala and other areas have damaged due to strong winds.
 
Our correspondent in Arawwala said at least 10 houses along the Arrawwala - Piliyandala road were also damaged.
 
The Met Department predicted that the wind speed could increase over the Island and surrounding sea areas and.
 
It added that the strong winds will continue further in next few days.

heading: Fatal accident in Vavuniya kills two
content:
Two persons were killed and three others injured in a road accident involving a bus and a lorry in Puliyankulama, Vavuniya this morning (Jul 11).
 
The bus was plying towards Vavuniya from Kilinochchi while the van was travelling towards the opposite direction.
 
The lorry driver and a female passenger of the bus were killed in the mishap.
 
Police said the excessive speed was the cause of the mishap.
 
The injured were admitted to Puliyankulama and Vavuniya Hospitals.

heading: Hiru TV's 20th anniversary : First car winner from Hakmana
content:
The giving-away of Rs. 50 million worth 20 cars to the loyal viewers of HIRU TV began yesterday (Jul 10).
 
The viewers could be able to get a chance to win a car by watching HIRU TV Tele Perahara which runs from 7.30 pm to 09.55 pm on the weekdays.
 
The first winner of the Rs. 2.5 million worth Mahindra Reva is D. J. Dharshani from Hakmana.
 
You will also be able to win a car by sending the answers to each of the questions being posed during the HIRU Tele Perahara, by SMS in a sequence.

heading: Blood Bank's DG removed
content:
The Director-General of the National Blood Transfusion Service, Dr. Rukshan Bellana has been removed.
 
He is accused of corruption and malpractice.
 
The GMOA branch of NBTS staged a strike yesterday demanding that Dr. Bellana is removed from the post.

heading: Update: Two die in Jampettah shooting
content:
A short while ago, police said that two of the four persons who were admitted to the National Hospital, Colombo following a shooting incident in Selvigewatta in Jampettah Street have succumbed to injuries.The deceased were 58-year-old Sellia Selvaraj and 50-year-old Elizebeth Perera.Two more men are being treated at the hospital.
.............................................Shooting in Jampettah StreetPolice say that a shooting incident was reported in Jampettah Street, Colombo.
Few persons were injured in the incident.

heading: Army Commander's service extended
content:
President Maithripala Sirisena has given a one-year service extension to Army Commander, Lt. General Mahesh Senanayake.
 
Lt. Gen. Senanayake assumed office on 4th of July 2017 and his service was to be ended on 19th of August.
 
He is an old boy of Ananda College, Colombo.

heading: Three bodies of four who went missing in Eggaloya found
content:
Three bodies of the four persons who went missing after their raft capsized in Eggaloya, Damana in Amparai have been recovered.
The police noted that they suspect the body of the fourth individual is stuck amongst the silt in the tank.
A group of students and teachers from a school in Badulla had arrived in the area on a trip and 9 persons had boarded a raft.
However, it had capsized in the middle of the tank. Five persons were rescued.The divers were able to retrieve the bodies of the principal, a teacher and the student.The body of the school watcher is yet to be found.

heading: Treasury firm on implementing fuel pricing formula, CPC remains silent
content:
State Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs, Dr. Harsha de Silva reiterates that the government has been inconvenienced with regard to fuel prices due to the conduct of the Chairman of Ceylon Petroleum Corporation.
Our attempts to contact the Chairman of the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation, Dhammika Ranatunga with regard to the State Minister’s statement failed.
The Ministry of Finance took measures to revise fuel prices from midnight Thursday as per the pricing formula introduced in May.
However, the CPC issued a directive last morning stating that the price revision should not be implemented until a directive is issued by the CPC.
The Ministry of Petroleum Resources Development noted that the Finance Ministry can only make recommendations to the revision of fuel prices and that only the Petroleum Resources Development Ministry has the authority to make the final decision whether the fuel prices should be revised or not.
The Ministry of Finance said that the matter will be sorted out at the next Cabinet meeting.
The Committee appointed to revise fuel prices consists of a representative of the Secretary to the Ministry of Petroleum Resources Development, Deputy Secretary to the Treasury and two directors of the treasury.
With the revision of fuel prices, Ceypetco filling stations are selling fuel at the previous prices while the LIOC filling stations sell fuel at the revised prices.

heading: Hikkaduwa fishermen’s protest ends
content:
The protest carried out by fishermen blocking a part of the Galle Road in the Hikkaduwa – Thotagamuwa area has been concluded.
They were demanding immediate steps be taken to locate the seven fishermen who had gone missing.
However, State Minister of Fisheries and Aquatic Resources Development Dilip Wedaarachchi yesterday said that all measures have been taken to locate the fishermen and that India had even provided a helicopter to carry out search operations.
Meanwhile, a group of officials from the Fisheries Ministry met with the protesting fisherfolk and assured that search operations will be continued.

heading: Fuel prices to be revised on a weekly basis
content:
Finance Ministry says they are looking at the possibility of revising the fuel prices each week based on a pricing formula.
An official from the Finance Ministry said that then the prices could be revised depending on the world market fluctuations.
He said that the relevant Cabinet paper will be submitted next week.
The Finance Ministry issued a directive on 5th to increase the fuel prices from midnight.
However, Ceypetco, the state-owned fuel retailer said that it had not issued any directive to the filling stations to increase the prices, hence it asked the filling stations to sell the fuel at the previous prices.
Amidst this confusion, Lanka IOC, the Indian owned company said it will not reduce the prices.
Then the State Minister Dr. Harsha de Silva said that the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation does not have an authority to revise prices.
This confusion is expected to be sorted out at the upcoming Cabinet meeting, the official said.

heading: Work at Blood Bank interrupted
content:
The Government Medical Officers' Association says that National Blood Transfusion Service doctors will initiate a strike action beginning today (Jul 09).
 
The Media Spokesperson of the association, Dr. Samantha Ananda noted that the strike has been launched against the appointing of an unqualified individual for the post of Acting Director of the National Blood Transfusion Service
 
He further noted that there are 107 branches for the National Blood Transfusion Service.
 
The first phase of the strike will have services at all blood donation camps halted.

heading: Two arrested over Wanniyakulam murder
content:
Police have arrested two persons over the recent murder of a 45-year-old person in Wanniyakulam area in Anuradhapura.
The victim was waylaid when he was travelling in a car and was attacked with sharp objects killing him.
The incident occurred on 5th of July.
Police said that the main suspect was also arrested.
It was reported a dispute prevailing between the two families was the main reason for this murder.

heading: Three arrested with Rs. 50mn worth foreign currency notes
content:
Sri Lanka Customs at the Bandaranaike International Airport arrested three persons this morning (Jul 13) for attempting to smuggle out Rs. 50 million worth of foreign currency notes.
 
One of them was an Indian and other two were residents of Kuliyapitiya.
 
They were to onboard a flight to Dubai and foreign currency notes were found hidden in their luggage.
 
Euro, US dollar, and Saudi Riyal were among the detected currency notes.

heading: Rs. 1.2bn worth heroin found
content:
Police Narcotics Bureau detected 102 kilos of heroin in a raid carried out in Kalubowila and Suboothipura.
Police Spokesperson SP Ruwan Gunasekera said that the PNB officials found heroin in 96 parcels and the estimated value was Rs. 1248 million.
The PNB also arrested two suspects.

heading: India intervenes to find missing fishermen
content:
The Fisheries Department says that India is also involved in the operation launched in search of the seven fishermen who are reported missing.
The relatives of the missing fishermen staged a protest obstructing vehicular movement along the Galle Road at the Thotagamuwa Junction in Hikkaduwa, charging that authorities have not paid sufficient attention towards the matter.
The fishermen had set sail from Galle fisheries harbour on 14th of last month and have last had contact on 29th.
Their relatives along with other fishermen staged a protest this morning obstructing traffic along the Colombo – Galle main road in Werellana, Hikkaduwa.
Later, they staged another protest obstructing Galle road at Thotagamuwa junction in Hikkaduwa.

heading: Motorcyclist dies in Nithavur
content:
A motorcyclist was killed in a road accident occurred in Nithavur on the Kalmunai - Akkaraipattu main road.
 
Police said first the motorcyclist had collided with a lorry head-on at the Ninthavur junction then he was run over by another lorry.
 
The critically injured motorcyclist died upon admission to Ninthavur Hospital.
 
The victim aged 49 was an area resident.
 
Police have arrested both the lorry drivers.

heading: Heart surgeries at Karapitiya Teaching Hospital suspended
content:
A cardiologist attached to Karapitiya Teaching Hospital, Dr. Namal Gamage has decided to withdraw from performing heart surgeries from next Monday (Jul 16).
 
He has informed the Hospital Director that the decision was taken as the central air-conditioning system of the Heart Surgery ICU is malfunctioning.
 
It has been reported that several patients had died recently after they were admitted to the ICU following the surgery, due to the defective air-conditioning system.
 
Another patient is fallen critically ill due to an infection caused due to the ICU’s defective AC.
 
It has also been noted that the Ceylon Electricity Board had informed the hospital authority way back in 2013 that the air-conditioning system needed to be upgraded.
 
However, these recommendations were ignored and the AC system has been malfunctioning since 2015.
 
To date, tenders have been called on three occasions to restore the system.
 
There are over 3,000 heart patients on the waiting list, in need of surgery at the Karapitiya Teaching hospital.
 
Amongst those patients, Dr. Gamage has the highest number of surgeries scheduled to be performed.
 
Although Dr. Namal Gamage and hospital authorities have informed the Ministry of Health regarding the situation, the Ministry had yet to respond.
 
Meanwhile, we contacted the Health Services Director General, Dr. Anil Jasinghe to get his comments on the issue.
 
He said that the Ministry will be able to finalize the procedure within the next week.

heading: Teachers charge “WP term test papers are leaked”
content:
Teacher associations are raising concerns that they believe there have been discrepancies in the printing of the first draft of term test papers of the government schools.
 
They raise concerns as papers are being handed over to school principals in CDs, in several education zones within the Western Province.
 
The General Secretary of the Ceylon Teachers’ Union Joseph Stalin noted that as a result, the term test papers have leaked in the Western Province.
 
The Western Province Education Minister Ranjith Somawansa noted that necessary action would be taken to inform officials of the issue.

heading: Vijayakala asks for a change
content:
Former State Minister, Vijayakala Maheshwaran says that certain persons in the South label those who speak about the problems of the Tamil community as racists.
The former State Minister made this statement addressing a ceremony in Jaffna today.
This was the first time the former State Minister made a statement following her previous controversial statement that the LTTE should be revived.
She stated that this situation should change.

heading: Four missing in a boat mishap in Amparai
content:
Police say four persons are missing after their boat capsized in the Ekgaloya in Damana, Amparai.
A group of teachers and students have come here for a picnic and they had visited the Oya to have a bath.
The incident had occurred at around 6.45 am today (Jul 08).
It was revealed nine persons were on the boat when it was capsized and the fishermen were able to rescue five of them.
The missing persons are a 53-year-old principal, a 43-year-old teacher, 31-year-old watcher and a 13-year-old student.
Police along with the area residents have launched an operation to find the missing persons.

heading: Strong gusty winds predicted to continue
content:
The Met Department says there’s a high probability that wind speeds will continue to increase up to 50- 60 kmph, throughout the island and surrounding sea areas in the next few days.
 
Intermittent showers will occur in the Central and Sabaragamuwa Provinces, and light showers could be expected elsewhere.
 
The coast belt extending from Negombo to Batticaloa via Puttalam, Kankesanturai to Trincomalee, and Hambantota to Pottuvil are expected to be unusually rough at times,  as  wind speeds increase up to 60 to 65 kmph.
 
Naval and fishing communities are requested to be vigilant over this development.

heading: Army camps closed for all those who disrupt harmony
content:
Sri Lanka Army has decided to deny entry to camps for those who act in a manner that disrupts the reconciliation process.
The Army said that they have decided not to take part in or to assist or sponsor any ceremony that such persons will be participating in.
Certain politicians, retired Army officials as well as civil activists criticizing the reconciliation process carried out by the government and the Army has been highlighted as the main reason behind this.
Pointing out that some make speeches admiring the activities of terrorists, in a manner that diminishes the faith the peace-loving people in the North and the East have, the Army emphasizes that they have observed such activities to stir the germs of war in the people once again.
The Army further highlights that they are making a very significant contribution to the reconciliation mechanism and that they have also managed to provide solutions to many grave issues faced by the people in the North and the East.

heading: Excise Dept. conducts over 25,000 raids
content:
The Department of Excise has conducted 25,214 raids during the first six months of 2018.
 
Of that, 4,569 incidents were related to the selling of liquor illegally.
 
The Department had also conducted over 2,000 raids on other narcotics.

heading: Bus associations demand revision in bus fares
content:
The bus associations say that a revision of bus fares should be made or concessions should be provided to them after the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation decided to increase the fuel prices from midnight yesterday.
 
Accordingly, a liter of 92 Octane petrol was increased by 8 rupees, 95 Octane petrol by 7 rupees, auto diesel by 9 rupees and super diesel by 10 rupees.
 
However, the petroleum trade unions have requested from the government to make the fuel pricing formula public.
 
The President of the CPC trade union, D. J. Rajakaruna noted that according to the Right to information act, a written request would be made to the officials today (Jul 11).

heading: Wild elephant attack kills villager in Polonnaruwa
content:
Police say that a villager in Gallaalla, Polonnaruwa was killed in a wild elephant attack last evening.
The 61-year-old victim had ventured into the nearby jungle to look out for cattle when he was attacked by the wild elephant.

heading: New organization named 'Hari Maga' launched
content:
A new organization named 'Hari Maga' was launched today.
It was launched at the Kolonnawa Tempe under the patronage of former Defence Secretary Gotabhaya Rajapaksa.

heading: Suspects in Anuradhapura murder arrested, three swords and a motorcar found
content:
Another two suspects have been arrested in Thammannakulama, Anuradhapura over the murder of a father of three.
They have killed him using sharp objects in Vanniyakulam, Anuradhapura.
Police said that three swords used in the murder were also recovered in Yahalegama Tank in Anuradhapura today.
Additionally, the motorcar used for the murder has also been found.
The main suspect behind the incident along with another individual was arrested this morning in Nochchiyagama.
45-year-old Sujeewa Prasanna Kumara Hettiarachchi, who was a resident of Ruhunu Mawatha, Wijayapura -, Anuradhapura was murdered on 5th of this month using sharp objects.
Initial investigations revealed that four individuals were involved in the murder.
Speaking to media, the wife and a daughter of the deceased stated that they too have received death threats now.
However, Police Media Spokesperson, SP Ruwan Gunasekara speaking at a media briefing in Colombo today said that the police have received several complaints against the victim and his family before.

heading: UNP Natl. Organizer says Vijayakala should be expelled
content:
The United National Party’s National Organizer, Navin Dissanayake says that the parliamentary seat of former State Minister, Vijayakala Maheswaran should be annulled for her pro-LTTE statement.
 
Addressing a media conference at party headquarters this morning (Jul. 12), Minister Dissanayake said that the future course of action with regard to MP Maheswaran will be taken once the relevant committee report is released.
 
Meanwhile, Sri Lankan expatriates in France staged a protest against the pro-LTTE statement made by the former State.
 
It was held on Tuesday.
 
The Sri Lankan Ambassador to France, Buddhi Athauda participated in the protest which was held in front of Sri Lanka Embassy.

heading: Fmr. President seeks clarification on upward revision of fuel prices
content:
Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa has sought a clarification from the government on the recent upward revision of fuel prices.
 
Issuing a statement, Mahinda Rajapaksa said that although government talks about a pricing formula to justify the price increase, nobody has seen such a formula.
 
The former President said that government is trying to generate a maximum revenue by fluctuating the fuel prices.
 
He also said it could be the first time that fuel prices were increased twice within two months.

heading: "Hiruta wissai - Thagi wassai" Winner of second truck is from Athurugiriya
content:
The awarding of 20 trucks worth Rs. 35 million to loyal listeners of HIRU FM to mark the premier radio channel's 20th year anniversary is now underway.
Accordingly, the trucks each worth Rs. 1.75mn will be awarded for 20 weeks.
The winner of the first truck was Upatissa Witharana, a resident of Omalpe, Embilipitiya.
And today, the HIRU found the second winner of this extraordinary competition.
He was Warna Sanjeewa from Athurugiriya.
Listen, HIRU FM for more details of this competition.

heading: CID allowed to question drug traffickers arrested in Seruwawila
content:
The Muttur Court has allowed to detain and question the two suspects who were arrested in Seruwawila yesterday with 9.9kg of heroin.
 
The suspects were produced before courts today (Jul 12).
 
The CID sleuths found 22 heroin packets hidden in rice sacks last afternoon.

heading: Organized Crimes Prevention Division commences probe on Vijayakala’s statement
content:
The Organized Crimes Prevention Division has decided to record statements from those who were present at the state-sponsored event when the former State Minister of Child Affairs Vijeyakala Maheshwaran, made the controversial pro-LTTE comment.
 
The IGP recently assigned the Organized Crimes Prevention Division to launch a probe into complaints filed at the Police Headquarters in connection with the statement.
 
The division has decided to record statements to assist with the probe.
 
On 2nd July the former State Minister of Child Affairs, while attending the launch of a programme implemented by the Home Affairs Ministry in Jaffna, said that she prefers the resurgent of the LTTE.
 
Minister of Home Affairs Vajira Abeywardhana, Foreign Affairs Minister Thilak Marapana as well as Northern Province Chief Minister C. V. Wigneswaran were present at this occasion.

heading: Thailand PM arrives in Sri Lanka
content:
Thailand Prime Minister Prayut Chan -O-Cha arrived in Sri Lanka this afternoon (Jul 12) on a two-day state visit.
 
Our airport correspondent said a strong 40-member delegation arrived in Sri Lanka with the Prime Minister.
 
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe received the visiting Thai PM at the BIA.
 
Sri Lanka and Thailand will discuss the proposed Free Trade Agreement during this visit.

heading: Third car offered to lucky viewers of HIRU Tele Perahara goes to Kandy
content:
Indunil Kumari from Kandy has become the winner of the third car offered to the lucky viewers of the Hiru Tele Perahara. 
The loyal viewers of HIRU TV's Tele Perahara now have a chance to win an Rs. 2.5 million worth Mahindra Reva e20 car on five days of the week.
HIRU TV's Tele Perahara runs from 7.30 pm to 9.55 pm on weekdays.
The respective winner will be chosen through SMSs.
A question will be posted during a teledrama, and the viewers can send the answer via SMS to HTP (space) (number sequence of the answers) (space) name, NIC number, area and send the SMS to 7766.
The winner of that respective day will appear on the screen during the "Thaamath Adare Nathnam" tele drama.
The winner should confirm his identity within three minutes by calling 0114 799736.
The winner of the first car was a resident of Hakmana and the lucky winner of the second car found from Homagama.

heading: Keselwatte Dinuka's accomplice arrested
content:
One of the main accomplices of underworld leader Keselwatte Dinuka was arrested by Special Task Force at his home in Gunasinghepura last night (Jul 09).
 
The STF sleuths have found narcotics also from his residence.
 
Police said that the suspect was one of the accomplices who was handling the underworld activities of Keselwatte Dinuka.
 
Dinuka is hiding in Dubai.

heading: Relocation of Sinharaja elephants opposed
content:
The Organization to Protect Tamed Elephants is objecting to the government's decision to build an elephant captive center at Kalawana.
 
The Cabinet which met on Tuesday decided to acquire a 36-hectare block of land, to build the captive center to keep the last known two elephants that are roaming in the Sinharaja forest.
 
Earlier, the Minister of Wildlife, Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka said that the two should be relocated at the Horowpathana Elephant Orphanage.
 
However, many people and civil organizations objected to the move.
 
But the residents around the Sinharaja forest complain that the two elephants are encroaching their villages, creating fear among them.
 
It prompted the authorities to find an alternative solution.

heading: Two arrested in Ambalangoda with firearms
content:
Police have arrested two persons in Ambalangoda with locally made firearms in separate raids.
 
Last afternoon, a resident of Nindaana was arrested in Akurala, Ambalangoda with a locally made pistol and a live bullet.
 
Police also found 2.8g of heroin in his possession.
 
The 24-year-old suspect will be produced before Balapitiya Magistrate today (Jul 12).
 
In a separate raid in Diyasenpura, Ambalangoda, police arrested a suspect with a locally made revolver, three live bullets, and two swords.
 
The 24-year-old suspect was a resident of Tilakapura, Ambalangoda.

heading: Fuel pricing formula opposed
content:
The Joint Opposition says that the fuel pricing formula is not something prepared for the benefit of the masses.
 
Meanwhile, the National Freedom Front said that because of this fuel pricing formula, the government earned a profit of Rs. one billion.

heading: Three-wheeler operators seek legal remedy
content:
The Lanka Self-Employed three-wheeler Operators’ Union has decided to file a court case on the recent directive by the government on taxi meters.
 
Recently, the government told the three-wheeler operators to fix running meters and issue a receipt to the passengers once the journey is over.
 
The authorities said the three-wheeler operators who do not follow this directive will be booked.
 
However, the three-wheeler operators are opposing this move.
 
The National Council for Road Safety said that police has been vested with authority to arrest the three-wheeler operators who are without meters from 10th of August.

heading: Lorry topples on expressway flyover at Athurugiriya (Photos)
content:
A lorry transporting iron pipes topples on the expressway flyover at Athurugiriya this morning (Jul 10).
 
Fortunately, no one was on the road at the time of the accident.
 
The incident created a traffic congestion on the expressway and police took action to clear the road quickly.

heading: Anuradhapura murder suspects remanded
content:
Four suspects who were arrested over the Anuradhapura Vanniyakulam murder have been remanded until 23rd of July.
 
The suspects who are accused of hacking the father of three to death were produced before Anuradhapura Magistrate this morning (Jul 09).

heading: Capital punishment in Sri Lanka : What next?”
content:
Justice Ministry prepares a list of drug traffickers facing capital punishmentThe Justice Ministry says that the list of narcotic dealers who have been condemned to death is currently being prepared.
The inside sources of the Ministry told our news team that the finalized list will be submitted to the President.
President Maithripala Sirisena announced yesterday that he would sign off the execution for convicted drug dealers who still run the racket from jail.
Meanwhile, Prisons' Commissioner General Nishan Dhanasinghe told our news team that steps are being taken to fill the vacancy of the executioner post.

heading: Tissa Attanayake to launch a new political movement
content:
Former UNP General Secretary, Tissa Attanayake says that he intends to launch a new political movement in the near future.
 
The announcement was made after paying a courtesy call on Asgiri Chapter Chief Prelate, the Venerable Warakagoda Sri Gnanarathana Thera in Kandy yesterday (Jul 08).
 
In response to questions from journalists, Attanayake said that he is no longer prepared to bow down to the UNP.
 
Meanwhile, Minister, Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka said that the UNP will field Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe as its candidate for the 2020 Presidential Election.
 
He was speaking to the media after having a discussion on wild elephant menace at Naula in Matale yesterday.

heading: No tour guides at Sigiriya today
content:
The Sigiriya Tour Guide Association says that it will engage in a protest by blocking the main entrance of Sigiriya from 7 am today.
The association is voicing its opposition to the incident where a Sigiriya tour guide was assaulted by a Chinese national.
It has been reported that a clash broke out when the Chinese national had opted to guide a group of 8 Chinese nationals without a license.
The local tour guide is currently receiving treatment at the Sigiriya- Kimbissa Provincial Hospital after sustaining injuries during the assault.
The Sigiriya Tour Guide Association Secretary Prasanna Danushka noted that the association decided to refrain from engaging in guiding tours today, protesting against the incident.

heading: Blood Bank activities crippled by GMOA strike
content:
The activities at the National Blood Transfusion Center and island-wide blood donation activities have been crippled by the strike launched by the doctors attached to the Government Medical Officers’ Association of the National Blood Transfusion Center.
 
The GMOA branch of NBTC launched this strike against the Director of the institution, Dr. Rukshan Bellanage.
 
Meanwhile, the members of the Sri Lanka Accountants’ Service Union launched a sick leave campaign against the decision to increase salaries and allowances only for several selected services.
 
In addition to accountants, representatives from Inland Revenue, National Auditing and, Ayurveda Physicians have joined in the trade union action.
 
The General Secretary of the Sri Lanka Accountants Service Union, Anton Perera said that a protest will be held in front of the Inland Revenue Department this afternoon to press their demands.

heading: Murdered policeman promoted posthumously
content:
Murdered police Sergeant Chandra Jayalal Samarawickrema attached to the Ratnapura Police, who was strangled to death by a monk has been posthumously promoted to the rank of Sub Inspector.
 
Police Media Spokesperson SP Ruwan Gunasekera said that this promotion had been made on the order of IGP Pujith Jayasundera.
 
Sergeant Samarawickrema was strangled to death when he visited the Gallanda Temple in Ratnapura on Tuesday to serve a warrant to the resident monk there.
 
Subsequently, the monk was arrested and was remanded till 25th of this month after being produced before Ratnapura Magistrate Saliya Chandana Abeyratna.

heading: 60 injured in Gokarella bus accident
content:
Around 60 persons were injured and hospitalized when two buses collided head-at Diyathura in Gokarella on the Dambulla - Kurunegala main road.
 
One of the buses was heading towards Embilipitiya from Jaffna and the other bus was travelling from Embilipitiya to Vauvniya.
 
The injured have been hospitalized and our correspondent said that around 40 passengers with critical injuries have been admitted to Dambulla Base Hospital and Kurunegala Teaching Hospital.

heading: Motive behind Jampettah Street shooting revealed
content:
The relatives of the victims who were shot dead at Jampettah Street last night (Jul 08) charge that the motive behind the killing was to take revenge from the latter for not giving evidence on another shooting that took place at the same place on 24th of June.
A husband and wife of Selvigewatta were shot dead while they were selling street food on Jampettah street last night.
Two assailants had arrived on a motorcycle and, fled the scene after opening fire with a T-56.
Two other persons also received gunshot injuries and, Colombo National Hospital sources told us they are out of danger.
Meanwhile, police have received vital information about the assailant who shot dead Colombo Municipal Councilor and Janatha Peramuna leader, Kirubanandan Krishnapillai alias Krishna.
A Senior Police official stated that CCTV footage is being scrutinized to identify the assailant.
Meanwhile, police said that the wife of the murdered three-wheeler driver is believed to have been involved in the killing of her husband at Kiribathgoda early this morning.
The body of the 40-year-old victim was found in his own three-wheeler that was abandoned by his assailants on a road at Jayanthiwela, Nahena in Hunupitiya this morning.
Meanwhile, The 4 suspects arrested in connection with the murder of a father of three at Wanniyakulama in Anuradhapura have been remanded until 23rd of July.
The suspects were produced before Anuradhapura Chief Magistrate Harsha Kekunawela today.
The Magistrate also ordered to produce the suspect for an identification parade.

heading: Two boys missing from Puttalam, found in Pettah
content:
Two boys aged 11 and 13, who were reported missing from Puttalam, were found from a bus stand at Dam Street in Pettah, last night (Jul 09).
 
The two boys were reported missing from Sunday and the parents had lodged a complaint with police.
 
Police found a push-cycle believed to be belonging to them from the Madurankuliya town.
 
Police are recording statements from the boys now.

heading: Main suspect in Mt. Lavinia shooting arrested
content: The main suspect who shot an Army corporal at Mt. Lavinia, Chakindarama Road, arrested in Agunukolaplassa.

heading: Protestors block Tissa - Kataragama road
content:
A group of villagers from Sandagirigama is staging a protest blocking the Tissa - Kataragama main road, demanding the supply of drinkable water.
 
They say although they are lacking drinkable water for a quite some time, the authorities are disregarding their plight.
 
Our correspondent said that a representative from the Water Supply and Drainage Board is now having a discussion with the protestors.

heading: Death toll in Japanese floods risen, Sri Lankans not affected
content:
At least 100 people are thought to have died after record rainfall caused flooding and landslides in western Japan, a government spokesman says.
 
More than 50 others are believed to be missing, the Japan Times reported.The Foreign Ministry of Sri Lanka said they are also monitoring the situation and as of now, no Sri Lankan is affected by the weather havoc in the region.
 
Since Thursday, parts of western Japan have received three times the usual rainfall for the whole of July. Two million people have been ordered to evacuate as rivers burst their banks.
 
"We've never experienced this kind of rain before," a weather official said.
 
Rescuers restarted their search through the mud for any survivors or the bodies of those killed on Monday morning.
 
An official in Okayama prefecture told AFP news agency that water levels were gradually receding and that emergency teams may be able to access the worst-hit areas on foot.
 
Most of the deaths have occurred in Hiroshima prefecture.

heading: Monk kills a police officer in Ratnapura
content:
A police officer who had visited a temple in the Gallanda area to investigate a complaint had been allegedly murdered.
The police officer was attached to the Minor Complaints Unit of the Ratnapura Police.
The suspect was on an arrest warrant.
Police said a resident monk at the temple had strangulated the police officer to death.
Police Spokesperson SP Ruwan Gunasekera said that the victim died while he was being taken to a hospital.
Then the Ratnapura Head Quarters Inspector had visited the temple and the suspect had attempted to hurl a hand grenade at him.
However, the HQI was able to arrest the monk.

heading: Winning truck handed over to first lucky winner of "Hiruta wissai - Thagi wassai"
content:
The giving away of 20 trucks worth Rs. 35 million to loyal listeners of HIRU FM to mark the premier radio channel's 20th year anniversary has now begun.
Accordingly, the trucks each worth Rs. 1.75mn will continue for 20 weeks.
The winner of the first truck was Upatissa Witharana, a resident of Omalpe, Embilipitiya.
The HIRU team that left the Colombo head office this morning reached the home of Upatissa this evening to hand over the key of the truck.

heading: Three LG councillors murdered within one and half months
content:
Three councillors representing Local Government Institutions have murdered within the last one and half months.
 
The most recent incident was reported yesterday with the murder of Colombo Municipal Council councillor, the leader of the National Front Organization, Kirubanandan Krishnapillai alias Krishna.
 
An individual on a motorcycle shot the councillor at a shop that he owned, in Adiwal Street, Pettah.
 
 The assailant fled the scene after the shooting.
 
Police Media Spokesperson’s Office noted that the victim was on bail relating to two drug cases.
 
Meanwhile, last month, the Deputy Chairman of Karandeniya Pradeshiya Sabha Donald Sampath was shot dead while he was returning home after attending a wedding.
 
A suspect was arrested while hiding in a house in Weragoda and it was found that he was a close associate of the underworld gang leader Kosgoda Sujee who is currently overseas.
 
In addition, Ranjan de Silva, the father of Sri Lankan cricketer, Dananjaya de Silva, who was a councilor of the Dehiwala- Mt. Lavinia Municipal Council, was shot dead in front of his residence on 24th of May this year.

heading: Wife and her paramour arrested over Hunupitiya three-wheeler driver's death
content:
Police have arrested the wife of the murdered three-wheeler driver in Hunupitiya and her paramour over the alleged killing.
The body of the victim was found inside his three-wheeler in Nahena, Hunupitiya yesterday.

heading: Increasing wind speeds and showers predicted
content:
The Met Department says that the possibility for increasing wind speed to a certain extent is still high over the Island and surrounding sea areas.
 
Several spells of showers will occur in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central, North Western provinces and in Galle and Matara districts.
 
Light showers may occur in the Anuradhapura district.
 
Fairly strong gusty winds up to 40-50 kmph can be expected over the island, particularly in Northern, North Central, North-Western provinces and in Matale, Trincomalee, Ampara, Monaragala and Hambantota districts.

heading: Fatal accident reported on Southern Expressway (Video)
content:
Police say several people have been critically injured in an accident on the Southern Expressway.
It has happened between Kurundugahahathakma and Baddegama.
Police said a luxury jeep had involved in the accident.One woman was confirmed dead.The luxury jeep heading to Colombo from Galle had hit the protective fence of the expressway.

heading: Husband arrested for killing popular female singer Priyani Jayasinghe
content:
Police have arrested the husband for murdering the popular female singer Priyani Jayasinghe.
 
He was arrested at the Panadura Railway Station, this morning (Jul 09).
 
Initial investigations found that she was stabbed to death using a pair of scissors.
 
Police said that her husband, the prime suspect in the crime had fled the area following the incident.
 
The 51-year-old singer found dead at around 8.45 pm yesterday (Jul 08) at her home in Panadura.
 
It was found that the couple was having family issues since last year.

heading: SInger Priyani Jayasinghe's husband remanded
content:
The husband of Priyani Jayasinghe who was accused of murdering the popular female singer has been remanded.
 
The suspect was produced before Panadura Magistrate Court today (Jul 10).
 
Jayasinghe had been killed at her home on Sunday night.
 
Police said that a pair of scissor had been used to stab her.
 
The suspect fled the home following the incident and he was arrested by police the next day.

heading: STF protection for Kirivehera Thera
content:
The government has decided to provide Special Task Force protection for the chief incumbent of the Kataragama Kirivehera temple, Ven. Kobawaka Dhamminda Thera.
Buddha Sasana Minister, Gamini Jayawickrama Perera said that the President announced the decision during the Cabinet meeting this morning.
Meanwhile, the President has stated that he did not receive the hospital bill of the ailing Thera as yet.
Minister, Gamini Jayawickrama Perera further described the matter during a media conference held in Colombo today (Jul 10).

heading: Joint Opposition dashes coconuts in Seenigama
content: The Joint Opposition will dash coconuts in Seenigama against the government today (Jul 11).They said they are urging the divine support to act against the government for the non-implementation of justice for the social injustices forced on the masses and selling off of national assets including the Mattala International Airport.

heading: Fuel prices to be increased from midnight
content: The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation will increase its prices of fuel with effect from midnight today.Accordingly, Octane 92 petrol will be increased by 8 rupees while Octane 95 by 7 rupees. Auto diesel will be increased by 9 rupees while super diesel by 10 rupees per liter.Minister, Rajitha Senarathna said that the decision to increase fuel prices was taken during the special meeting held at the presidential secretariat this afternoon.

heading: Hemantha Warnakulasuriya passes away
content: President's Counsel Hemantha Warnakulasuriya passed away aged  74, last night at a private hospital in Colombo.

heading: AG advices to IGP to probe Vijayakala's statement
content: The Attorney general has advised IGP to probe MP Vijayakala Maheshwaran's statement on LTTE and submit a report as soon as possible.

heading: Name of Joint Opposition changed
