content: The leaders of the affiliated parties in the Joint Opposition have decided to function as the Joint Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna.

heading: 2322 arrested in four-hour operation
content:
Police have arrested 2322 persons during an island-wide operation.
423 of them were wanted persons.
The operation was carried out from 10 pm to 12 midnight yesterday and from 3 am to 5 am today.
14,070 policemen had taken part in the operation.

heading: A special investigation on LTTE weapons found in Tamil Nadu
content: A huge cache of ammunition and explosives, suspected to belong to LTTE, was unearthed near Thangachimadam in Rameswaram yesterday.More than 50 boxes of abandoned ammunition, 41 Light Machine Guns, 22 Machine guns, five land mines detonators, and detonator launchers were recovered while a septic tank was being dug in a house near Thangachimadam area in the Rameswaram district.A resident of Anthoniyarpuram, found a box of bullets while constructing a septic tank and alerted the police.Deputy Inspector General said the stash could have belonged to a group like LTTE that were active in the area and would be 25 to 30 years old.

heading: MR says Udayanga will return after a month
content:
Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa says he said that he would bring back former Sri Lanka ambassador to Russia Udayanga Weeratunga in an attempt to support the government.
 
He said it would take one more month. The former President said he needed to time to get his children removed from schools.
 
The former President said this speaking to media after taking part in religious observances at Kirivehera in Kataragama last afternoon (Jun 26).

heading: STF operation in Wilpita forest suspended
content: The special search operation to arrest the two suspects who fled to the Wilpita forest reserve after exchanging fire with the STF has been suspended.However, an STF official told our news team that roadblocks have been set up on every road leading to the forest reserve in order to prevent the suspects fleeing from the forest.One of the close associates of an underworld kingpin, Maakandure Madush, Manel Rohana died during the exchange of fire with the STF on Monday.His two accomplices fled to Wilpita forest after the shooting and, a search operation was launched to apprehend them.Meanwhile, STF sources stated that a special operation has been launched to thwart underworld activities in the south.

heading: Police arrest suspect with a revolver
content:
A 43-year-old resident of Matugama was arrested in Meegahatenna last night by police with a foreign revolver and four bullets.
 
He was arrested following a tip-off.
 
Police said that the suspect will be produced before Matugama Magistrate court today (Jun 27).

heading: Underworld link to heroin detected at BIA !
content:
Details have come to light that a detainee at the Welikada Prison is directly linked with the heroin which was detected at the Bandaranaike International Airport by the officials of Sri Lanka Customs.
 
227 g of heroin was detected at the airmail section at the BIA and the estimated value was Rs. 3 million.
 
The spokesperson of Sri Lanka Customs Sunil Jayaratne said that three persons have been arrested and they were handed over to the Police Narcotics Bureau.
 
The suspects are aged 26, 30 and 45 and residents of Veyangoda and Colombo.
 
The narcotic had sent from Mumbai hidden in a garment sent to a resident of Minuwangoda.

heading: Police Inspector arrested for accepting a bribe
content:
The officials of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption have arrested an Inspector of Police, attached to kalkudah Police for accepting a bribe of Rs. 300,000 from a businessman.
 
The arrest was made this morning (Jul 10).
 
The Director of Investigations at the Bribery Commission, Priyantha Chandrasiri said that the police officer has demanded the bribe to issue a document to a businessman from Veyangoda for him to obtain the license from the Central Environmental Authority to start a bricks manufacturing factory in Kalkudah.
 
The suspect was arrested inside the Koralepattu Pradeshiya Sabha while he was accepting the bribe.
 
The suspect will be produced before the Valachchenai Magistrate.

heading: Navy cab collides with ambulance
content:
A Navy cab collided with an ambulance which was transporting a critically ill patient from Horana Hospital to Kalubowila Hospital at Pepiliyana early this morning.
 
A doctor and an attendant travelling in the ambulance were also injured.
 
However, the critically ill patient was sent to the hospital using another ambulance.
 
It was reported that the cab was travelling disregarding road rules.
 
The driver of the cab had attempted to flee after the mishap but the area residents had wrestled him.
 
The suspect was under the influence of liquor and police said that the cab was belonging to the Navy Camp in Welisara.
 
The suspect who was arrested and produced before the court was released on bail this afternoon.

heading: 42 fake Rs. 500 notes found
content:
Police have found 42 fake notes of Rs. 500 denominations from a lorry parked at a garage in Thambuttegama.
 
Police launched the raid after they were tipped-off that heroin is hidden in a garage there.
 
Police found the fake notes inside a bag in the lorry, which was taken there for repairs.
 
However, 300 mg of heroin was detected from a car which was parked close to the lorry.
 
Thambuttegama Police is probing the incident.

heading: Suspect in Jaffna girl's murder remanded
content:
The 22-year-old suspect who was arrested over the strangulation of the 6-year-old schoolgirl in Sulipuram, Jaffna has been remanded until 11th of July.
The suspect was produced before Mallakam Magistrate today (Jun 27).
The suspect, a relative of the victim, was arrested yesterday.
Police found the body of the little girl in a well in the area.
She was reported missing while returning home from the school.
Later, during the post-mortem, it was found that the girl had been strangulated to death.

heading: Finance Minister and President to discuss fuel price issue
content:
A special meeting will be held between President Maithripala Sirisena and Finance Minister Mangala Samaraweera at the President's Secretariat at 4 pm today (Jul 10).
 
The main topic will be the issue relating to the revision of fuel prices.
 
Minister Mano Ganeshan told us that the decision was reached at this morning's Cabinet discussion.
 
The President has invited interested Ministers to attend the discussion.

heading: Reason for Gokarella bus accident revealed
content:
Police have launched a special operation into last afternoon's head-on bus crash in Gokarella where 70 passengers were injured.
 
The investigations found that the two buses are owned by the same person and one of the buses even did not have a route permit.
 
The two drivers were close friends and they were used to make jokes at each other while driving.
 
Even at the time of the fateful collision, they were talking to each other.
 
Police said negligence driving was the cause of the mishap.

heading: Missing fishermen found in seas off Maldives
content:
The seven fishermen who were feared missing have found in the seas off the Maldives.
 
The vessel with the fishermen had left from the Galle Fisheries Harbour on 14th of last month.
 
However, they lost contact last week and then the relatives staged a demonstration in Hikkaduwa blocking the Galle road.
 
India and the Maldives came to support Sri Lanka to find the missing fishermen.

heading: Two arrested at Central Mail Exchange with a heroin parcel
content:
Customs staff attached to the Air-mail Parcel section has detected a parcel containing 227g of heroin last evening (Jul 09).
The estimated value was Rs. 3 million.It has sent to a resident of Minuwangoda from Mumbai, hidden in a garment.
Two suspects aged 45 and 26 were arrested during the preliminary investigations.
   Meanwhile, a 58-year-old Sri Lankan passenger who was to travel to Singapore by was apprehended by the Customs officials attached to the Departure Terminal of the Bandaranaike International Airport last evening.
The estimated value was Rs. 2.7 million.

heading: Two State Ministers sworn in
content:
Two new State Ministers have sworn in before President Maithripala Sirisena at the Presidential Secretariat today. 
 
The Deputy Minister of Home Affairs J. C. Alawathuwala was sworn in as the State Minister of the same Ministry.
 
Meanwhile, the State Minister for Hill Country New Villages, Infrastructure and Community Development Lucky Jayawardena was sworn in as the State Minister of City Planning and Water Supply.

heading: Rs. 20mn bribe case : Suspects further remanded
content: President's former Chief of Staff I. H. K. Mahanama and former chairman of State Timber Corporation P. Dissanayaka have been further remanded till 13th of July.They are in remand custody after they were arrested by the Bribery Commission for obtaining a bribe of Rs.20 million from an Indian investor.

heading: 15 more children ordained under HIRU Shasanawa-tharanaya
content: HIRU Shraddhabhiwandana program organized by Asia Broadcasting Corporation to celebrate Poson Poya is now being held at historical sacred premises of Kataragama Kirivehera.The ceremony began early this morning with the participation of a large number of devotees.Hundreds and thousands of devotees observed Ata Sil under this ceremony.In addition, an ordaining ceremony was held for the 5th consecutive year this year at the Kirivehera sacred premises this morning.15 young children were ordained under this program, which is a concept of the chairman of Asia Broadcasting Corporation, Mr. Rayynor Silva.A sanghika dana for over 200 Bhikkhu will also be held at the Kirivehera temple premises tomorrow.In addition, copies of Tripitaka dhamma will be donated to the all pirivenas in the Moneragala district.The chairman of Asia Broadcasting Corporation, Mr. Rayynor Silva offered Atapirikara to the novices monks after the ordain ceremony.

heading: Cabinet approves pricing formula for fuel
content:
The cabinet of Ministers has approved to introduce a cost-based price formula for fuel.
It will be executed with effective from 11th May.
Accordingly, fuel prices will be updates before 5th day of the third month based on the international prices of previous two months.
A committee consisting of the officials of Treasury and Ministry of Petroleum Resources Development will be appointed to maintain the transparency of methodology.
The committee will come up with recommendations to update petrol and diesel price for a period of three months on 5th day of the third month.

heading: Sri Lanka's raking improves in Global Peace Index
content: Sri Lanka has improved five places in the latest Global Peace Index.Last year, Sri Lanka was ranked at 72 and it has improved to 67 this year.The report ranked 163 countries based on how peaceful they are. The ranking is determined by 23 factors, which include murder rate, political terror, and deaths from internal conflict.For an 11th consecutive year, the tiny northern European nation of Iceland was ranked as the world's safest place. Home to around 300,000 people, Iceland's crime rate is minuscule, with just 1.8 murders per 100,000 people annually. That's around one-third the murder rate in the USA.

heading: Biggest car giveaway : SUN FM presents first car
content:
Treherne Juriansz won the first car of the biggest car giveaway ever in the country's radio history organized by SUN FM.
 
This programme is organized to mark the 20th year anniversary of SUN FM and cars will be given away to the lucky winners for 19 more weeks.
 
The 19 winners will be chosen through an SMS draw, one winner per each week.

heading: Nearly 100,000 SL refugees still in Tamil Nadu
content:
It is reported that nearly 100,000 Sri Lankan refugees are in welfare camps in Tamil Nadu.
 
Most of them had gone there during the 1983 communal riots and subsequent escalation of hostilities in the North and East.
 
61,422 persons were now staying in 107 refugee camps in 24 districts of the state as of 1st of May this year.
 
In addition, 35,316 Sri Lankan Tamil refugees are staying outside the camps.
 
The refugees were provided with various relief measures as stipulated by the Central and state governments in India.
 
The data showed only around 3,000 Sri Lankan refugees, who had been staying in India, have returned to the island since 2015.
 
Indian media reports said that the largest number in this regard was reported last year, at 1,520.
 
Those refugees were repatriated with the assistance of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees.

heading: Mahinda Deshapriya writes to political parties
content:
The Chairman of the Elections Commission Mahinda Deshapriya has sent a letter to political party leaders and parliamentarians requesting necessary steps be taken to hold elections for Eastern, North Central, and Sabaragamuwa Provincial councils as their terms have expired.
 
The Additional Elections Commissioner M. M. Mohommad said that the letter was sent last week.
 
The letter also said that the Commission opposes delaying elections and that reports pertaining to delimitation should be completed soon in order to hold the PC elections.

heading: Fuel bowser operators to strike !
content:
The private fuel bowser operators of the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation says they will launch a two-day work stoppage from midnight of this Friday if their demands are not addressed.
 
They are asking the CPC to revise their payment structure based on a pricing formula.
 
The fuel bowser operators say although they have raised this issue a number of times, they are yet to get a favourable solution.

heading: Immigration & Emigration to purchase 1 million passport copies
content:
The Cabinet has given its approval to purchase the passports from Epic Lanka Private Limited, the company from which they had been obtained thus far.
 
Internal Affairs Minister S. B. Navinna told our news team that accordingly action would be taken to procure one million passports from this company.
 
The company had earlier informed the government that the stock of passports was gradually decreasing, and then the Ministry had submitted a Cabinet paper last November for procuring new stocks.
 
Earlier the Ministry of Telecommunication and Digital Infrastructure that implements the Electronic Passport Project had objected to it.
 
It was then decided to appoint a committee comprising of secretaries from the three ministries to look into the matter.
 
Subsequently, the Cabinet approved the assigning printing of passports to De La Rue, the company that prints the currency notes.
 
However Internal Affairs Minister S.B. Navinna told our news team, taking into consideration the delay that might occur, yesterday the Cabinet approved procurement of passports from Epic Lanka Private Limited, the former supplier.

heading: HIRU Shraddha-bhiwandana underway in Kataragama
content:
HIRU Shraddha-bhiwandana programme to celebrate Poson Poya commenced at the historical sacred Kataragama Kirivehera premises this morning (Jun 27).
 
Giving priority to Buddhist religious rites, a series of religious events including ordaining of several youngsters will be held at the temple premises.
 
The program which began at 6 am is being televised live on HIRU TV and HIRU FM.
 
The ordaining ceremony is held for the 5th consecutive year.
 
15 children will be ordained this year, a concept introduced by the chairman of Asia Broadcasting Corporation, Mr. Rayynor Silva.
 
A sanghika dana for over 200 Bhikkhu will also be held at the Kirivehera temple premises.
 
In addition, copies of Tripitaka will be donated to the all pirivenas in the Moneragala district.

heading: 15 children ordained under HIRU Shasanawatharana programme
content: HIRU Shraddhabhiwandana programme organized by Asia Broadcasting Corporation to celebrate Poson Poya is now being held at historical sacred Kataragama Kirivehera premises.The ceremony began early this morning with the participation of a large number of devotees.Hundreds and thousands of devotees observed Ata Sil.In addition, an ordaining ceremony was held for the 5th consecutive year at the Kirivehera sacred premises this morning.Here, 15 young children were ordained, which is a concept of the chairman of Asia Broadcasting Corporation, Mr. Rayynor Silva.A sanghika dana for over 200 Bhikkhu will also be held at the Kirivehera temple premises tomorrow.In addition, copies of Tripitaka dhamma will be donated to the all pirivenas in the Moneragala district.The chairman of Asia Broadcasting Corporation, Mr. Rayynor Silva offered Atapirikara to the novices monks after the ordain ceremony.

heading: Fines for road rule violations to be increased
content:
Motor Traffic Police say that the fines on 33 road-rule violations will be increased from 15th of July.
In addition to this change, violations on the booking sheet which stood at 23 have been increased to 33.
In addition, the minimum fine of Rs. 500 has been increased to Rs. 1000.
According to the new mechanism the fine which was to be paid within 14 days, has been extended to an additional 14 days.
However, during this extended period, the fine would be doubled.

heading: Sandhya Eknaligoda says she receives death threats
content:
The wife of missing journalist Prageeth Eknaligoda, Sandhya Eknaligoda says she is being threatened with death.
 
She said this addressing the media in Colombo this afternoon (Jun 26).

heading: Postal workers to stay away from OT work
content:
The postal workers say although they have decided to suspend the 16-day long strike, they will not engage in Over-time work.
 
The unions said that they would stop the strike completely if an acceptable solution is given by 7th of July.
 
The unions decided to call off the strike yesterday after a discussion with the Chairman of the Salaries and Cadre Commission.

heading: Scooty - bus accident sends mother and son to hospital (Photos)
content:
A mother and her little child were hospitalized after the scooty on which they were travelling collided with a CTB bus in Warunagama on the Wellawaya - Moneragala road.
 
The mother was aged 38 and her son was aged 5 and they are residents of Weerasekeragama in Wellawaya.
 
The CTB bus was heading towards Moneragala from Wellawaya and the scooty was heading towards the same direction.
 
The injured were admitted to Moneragala General Hospital.
 
Police have arrested the bus driver.

heading: Dr. Padeniya re-elected as President of GMOA
content:
The Government Medical Officers' Association for an eighth year, has chosen Dr. Anuraddha Padeniya as its President.
 
The office bearers were elected at the GMOA Annual General Meeting held in Colombo last night (Jun 30).
 
The team led by Dr. Padeniya secured the positions of office bearers for a third consecutive year.

heading: Pakistani arrested with heroin worth Rs. 50mn
content:
A Pakistani national was arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport who had attempted to smuggle in 4.186 kg of heroin to Sri Lanka this morning (Jul 09).
 
The estimated value of the find was Rs. 50 million.
 
Police Narcotics Bureau officials at the BIA found the heroin haul hidden in his baggage.
 
The suspect has arrived in Sri Lanka from Lahore, Pakistan.

heading: Husband flees after killing popular female singer
content:
Initial investigations found that popular female singer Priyani Jayasinghe has been stabbed to death using a pair of scissors.
 
Police said that her husband, who had fled the area, is the prime suspect in the crime.
 
The 51-year-old singer found dead at around 8.45 pm yesterday (Jul 08) at her home.
 
It was found that the couple was having family issues since last year.

heading: China cough up Hambantota Port through loans says New York Times
content:
The New York Times in an article says China has managed to take over the Hambantota Port operations using its financial assistance as a tool.
 
It said although feasibility studies said the port wouldn’t work and though other frequent lenders like India had refused, China came forward to assist the port construction, knowing it would put Sri Lanka in a debt trap.
 
The article also revealed that the Chinese firms funded Sri Lanka election campaigns.
 
It added that the Chinese authorities have realized the strategic importance of the Hambantota Port and they coughed it up through loans.  New York Times article:

heading: Post-mortem reveals little girl from Jaffna strangled
content:
The post-mortem conducted on the body of the 6-year old school girl at Sulipuram in Jaffna has confirmed that the girl was strangled to death.
 
The parents searched for the girl as she did not return home from school and then found her body from a well yesterday.
 
Later, her body was sent to Jaffna Teaching Hospital and the post-mortem was conducted today.
 
It revealed that the girl had been strangled.
 
Then police arrested a 22-year-old youth, a resident of Sulipuram for the murder.
 
He will be produced before courts tomorrow.
 
So far four suspects have been arrested over the murder.

heading: "Murder-suicide" in Urubokka
content:
A mentally unstable person has forcefully entered two houses in Galbokka, Urubokka and carried out a knife attack.
Police said that a 28-year-old woman was killed and a mother aged 64 and her daughter, aged 32 were admitted to Embilipitiya Hospital with critical condition with cut injuries following the attack.
The incident had occurred at around 7.30 pm yesterday (Jul 01).
Police said that the 40-year-old suspect committed suicide following the attack.
Police investigations are underway to ascertain the reason behind the attack.

heading: Gunman kills Colombo Municipal Councillor
content:
Colombo Municipal Councillor Krishnapillai Thirubanandan alias Krishna was killed by a gunman inside a fruit stall in Sea Street, Pettah.
 
The Police Spokesperson said that the gunman arrived on a motorcycle opened fire at the councillor at around 7.45 am today (Jul 09).
 
The 40-year-old victim died after being admitted to the National Hospital, Colombo.He was elected to the Colombo MC in February this year.He was a father of one. Police said that statements were recorded from 20 persons following the shooting.

heading: Rajanganaya Reservoir invaded by a bacteria (Photos)
content:
The area residents claim that water in the Rajanganaya Reservoir has turned dark green and an unbearable odour is emanating from the water.
 
The senior lecturer of the Department of Biological Sciences at Rajarata University, Dr. Wasantha Sena Welianga said that the dark green colour change was a result of a reaction of a bacteria species.
 
He said the bacteria species could be over two billion years old.

heading: Strong wind advisory issued
content:
Department of Meteorology says that the prevailing windy condition is likely to continue further in the island.
 
It added that strong gusty winds up to 50-60 kmph could be expected over the island particularly in Central, Northern, North-Central, North-Western, and Uva provinces and in Trincomalee, Amparai and Hambantota districts.

heading: Fmr. President threatens to take NYT to court
content:
Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa is preparing to take The New York Times to court for publishing a report that states he allegedly accepted a sum of 7.6 million US dollars from China Harbour Company for expenses during the 2015 presidential election.
Issuing a media communiqué yesterday (Jul 01), the former President noted that the China Harbour Company did not offer any money for his 2015 presidential election.

heading: "Hiruta Wissai: Thagi Wassai" - First winner found
content:
The awarding of trucks under the "Hiruta Wissai Thagi Wassai" programme began this morning (Jul 06).
 
Under this programme Rs. 35 million worth 20 Mahendra Supro trucks, each valued at Rs. 1.75 million will be presented to lucky winners.
 
The first lucky winner was Upatissa Vitharana, a resident of Omalpe in Embilipitiya.
 
This is the largest ever award programme in the country's media history.
 
The winners are chosen through SMS and once the name of the lucky winner is announced through the HIRU FM, he or she needs to contact us over the phone.The first winner of the programme was chosen at HIRU FM premises this morning.

heading: Rohana Wijeweera's wife goes to Court of Appeal
content: Wife of JVP founder Rohana Wijeweera, who was missing after arrest during 89/90 insurgency, filed a case at Appeal Court asking to produce or release him.

heading: Update: Udayanga detains at a Dubai prison, AG Dept.
content: informs court The Attorney General 's Department informs court that former Sri Lanka ambassador to Russia, Udayanga Weeratunga is currently detained at a prison in Dubai.Update : Friday, June 29, 2018 11.20---------------------------------------------Udayanga Weeragunga's lawyer informs court that his client hopes to arrive in Sri Lanka to appear before courts on case of controversial MiG deal.

heading: Wife remanded for killing husband
content:
Nivithigala Police have arrested a woman who had clubbed his husband to death.
 
The woman aged 39 years, was produced before Acting Magistrate of Ratnapura and she was remanded until 10th of this month.
 
She had told police the deceased used to come home drunk and then assault and harass her and children.
 
On the day of the incident, he had attempted to strangulate the second son.
 
She had said then she hit the husband with a club and once it broke, she had used a pestle to attack him, to save the son.
 
The deceased was aged 42 years and was a resident of Nivithigala.

heading: Speaker says highest possible action taken against Vijayakala
content:
Speaker Karu Jayasuriya told the Parliament today (Jul 06) that the highest possible action has been taken against Jaffna district UNP MP Vijayakala Maheshwaran.
 
He said this in response to a query posed by the leader of National Freedom Front Wimal Weerawansa.
 
The Speaker said that the Attorney General has been adviced to take necessary action against her.
 
Meanwhile, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe told in Parliament that former President Mahinda Rajapaksa should make a statement in Parliament regarding the New York Times article on Hambantota Port and election funding allegations.

heading: Mattala to be run by Indo - Lanka JV
content:
Deputy Minister of Civil Aviation Ashok Abeysinghe says after cabinet approval is obtained Mattala International Airport will be run by a joint venture.
 
The joint venture will be formed by Sri Lanka and India.
 
It was reported that the relevant agreement will be entered into on 6th of August.
 
The Deputy Minister added that a delegation from the Indian Civil Aviation Authority visited Sri Lanka last week to discuss the JV plan.

heading: Expenditure of elections commission increase by 240 million rupees
content: The expenditure of the national elections commission has increased by 240 million in the last year.It has been reported that an additional 30 million rupees was expended over the printing of voter’s lists on an institutional basis for the local government elections held last year.A spokesperson for the elections commission noted that due to the recurrent expenses of the preliminary process of the election, which amounted 210 million rupees, the expenditure had increased last year.Further, the 130 million rupees had been expended for the preparation of the voters list.Meanwhile, the spokesperson for the elections commission noted that the expenses for the provincial council elections is yet to be calculated, and the upcoming provincial council elections would be held according to a mechanism approved in parliament.

heading: MP Bandula talks about New York Times report
content:
The Joint Opposition says the government is attempting to target China by the raising charges against former President Mahinda Rajapaksa through the New York Times.
 
Dr. Bandula Gunawardena said this addressing a media conference in Colombo today (Jul 03).

heading: Sinhala Ravaya goes to police against Vijayakala's statement
content:
Sinhala Ravaya says they will file a case at the Police Head Quarters today (Jul 03) against a statement by State Minister of Child Affairs Vijayakala Maheswaran who had said that her intention is to see the reemergence of the LTTE.
 
She said this during an event held at Jaffna Weerasinham Hall yesterday (Jul 02).
 
Ministers Vajira Abeywardena, Tilak Marapana and Chief Minister of North C. V. Vigneshwaran were also present at the occasion.

heading: Vijayakala decides to resign
content:
State Minister of Child Affairs Vijayakala Maheshwaran says she has decided to resign from the State Ministerial post.
 
She had a meeting with Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe at Temple Trees last evening and the decision had made following that discussion.
 
An uproar was created within the country after she told a gathering in Jaffna recently that she wants to see the resurrection of the LTTE.

heading: Postal strike seems to be affecting judiciary !
content:
The Minister of Post and Postal Services says that solutions have been provided to the ongoing strike by the postal workers.
 
However, the strike is continued for a 13th day today (Jun 23).
 
The President of National Trade Union Centre, JVP Politburo member K. D. Lalkantha visited the Central Mail Exchange today to meet those who engage in a fast there.
 
Meanwhile, Sri Lanka Bar Association urged the authorities to come up with an alternative programme to minimize the effect of the postal strike affecting the judiciary.

heading: Veteran author Somaweera Senanayake dies
content:
Veteran author and scriptwriter Somaweera Senanayake has passed away.
He died at a private hospital early this morning due to a heart attack at the age of 74.
He is the author of the popular novel 'Yashorawaya'.

heading: Indian construction worker dies
content:
An Indian construction worker died last night (Jun 08) after he was run over by a bus, which came into the construction site to take the workers to their lodging place.
It was reported that the 24-year-old victim had attempted to get onboard the bus before it was stopped and then he had slipped and fell.
The incident occurred at a construction site in Slave Island at around 9 pm.
Police have arrested the bus driver.

heading: Rains predicted for several areas
content:
Met Department says that the prevailing windy condition is expected to continue over the island and in the sea areas around the island in next few days.
Showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Sabaragamuwa, Central provinces and in Galle and Matara districts, fairly heavy falls about 75 mm can be expected at some places.
Several spells of showers will occur in Western and North-Western provinces and in Hambantota district.
Strong gusty winds up to 60 kmph can be expected over the island particularly in Western, Southern, Central, Northern, North-central and North-western provinces and Monaragala district.

heading: 5 faculties of Ruhuna University closed
content: Vice Chancellor of Ruhuna University says that five faculties of the university including Arts and Commerce situated in Wellamadama were closed due to a clash between two student groups.

heading: Unidentified gunmen kill trader in Kaththankudi
content:
Two unidentified gunmen on a motorcycle had shot and killed a shop owner in Deen Road, Kaththankudi, last night.
The incident occurred at around 11 pm.
The reason for the killing is unknown.

heading: Lorry catches fire on Southern expressway
content:
A lorry has caught fire between the 19. 4 and 19.5 km posts of the Southern Expressway.
Police said the lorry which was plying from Kadawatha to Matara caught fire at around 12.10 pm.
No one was injured in the incident.
The police officers at the Galanigama Interchange had intervened to douse the fire.

heading: Young worker falls to death from Lotus Tower
content:
Police say that a 19-year-old worker from Kilinochchi had died after falling in the lift shaft of the Lotus Tower in Colombo, which is under construction.He had fallen from the 17th floor. The incident occurred at around 2 pm.
Police said he was working in the tower when the mishap happened.
The victim was Koneshwaran Nidharshan, a resident of Aththarekulam in Kilinochchi.

heading: Election Commission's Chairman explains ill effects of postponing elections
content:
Chairman of the Election Commission Mahinda Deshapriya says postponing elections creates ill effects.
Addressing a programme in Anuradhapura yesterday (Jun 08), he also spoke of the recent controversy at the Maharagama Urban Council.

heading: Deputy Chairman of Karandeniya PS gunned down
content:
Deputy Chairman of the Karandeniya Pradeshiya Sabha Donald Sampath was killed in a shooting last night (Jun 08).
Police stated that 2 persons who arrived on a motorcycle had opened fire at Sampath's double cab before fleeing the area.
48-year-old Donald Sampath was elected to the Karandeniya PS from the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna.
He was returning home after attending a wedding when the shooting took place.
The driver of the cab was also sustained injuries.
Uragasmanhandiya Police is conducting further investigations.

heading: Kerosene price to be reduced ?
content:
Representatives of Fishermen’s Organizations say that Kerosene should be offered to all citizens at the previous price.
However, the Subject Minister and State Minister share different views.
State Minister Dileep Wedarachchi had said that it may be possible to offer a litre of Kerosene at a price between 70 to 80 rupees, by next Monday.
However, Minister of Fisheries and Aquatic Resources Development Vijith Vijayamuni Soyza said that he withdrew from discussions held regarding the matter.
However, the All Island Fishermen’s Federation said that if steps are not taken to provide Kerosene at 44 rupees, they would carry out a major struggle.
The price of kerosene was increased by Rs. 57 to Rs. 101 in April this year.
The government said the price was increased in such a way to reduce misuse.
They said certain buses and lorries adulterate kerosene with diesel.
However, this price hike has affected the fisheries community and they are urging the government to cut down the price in order to save their livelihood.

heading: Bank robbed in Kaduwela
content:
Two persons arriving on a motorcycle have robbed a bank in Ihala Bomiriya, Kaduwela.
 
Police said that the Samurdhi Development Bank was robbed by them this afternoon and sped away with Rs. 120,000.
 
It was reporters that the robbers had in their possession a sharp object and a firearm.

heading: Tipper - bike accident kills 2 youths
content:
Two young men were killed when the motorcycle that they were traveling on collided with a tipper at Pallegama in Laggala, Naaula, yesterday.
The two men aged 19 and 22 were killed after being admitted to Dambulla Hospital.
They are residents of Rathalawela, Mahawela.

heading: State Minister Senasinghe to be questioned by CID
content:
State Minister, Sujeewa Senasinghe admitted today that he spent the 3 million rupees that he received from Perpetual Treasuries Limited for his election campaign.
However, according to the investigation report of the Criminal Investigation Department that was submitted to Courts, the state minister has accepted the money after the election was over.
The CID informed the Colombo Fort Magistrate that the PTL has offered the 3 million rupees to State Minister, Senasinghe on three occasions.
This was revealed when the Central Bank Bond case was taken for hearing yesterday.
The CID report further revealed that one of the cheques for one million rupees had been encashed by an S.I. attached to the state Minister Sujeewa Senasinghe’s security detail on the directives of Senasinghe.
The report also states that the rest of the cheques had been encashed by Senasinghe’s security personnel on the directives of the minister’s election and financial coordinator.
Contradicting the above statement by the minister, the CID revealed in Court that all the cheques have been issued by a subsidiary of Perpetual Treasuries, W. M. Mendis Company Limited.
It is significant that all the cheques were issued after the conclusion of the general election in 2015.
According to the CID report, the cheque bearing No.401139 for one million rupees had been issued 7 days after the conclusion of the election.
It further said that State Minister Senasinghe had directly instructed an S.I. attached to his security division to encash the first cheque.
According to the same CID report, state minister Senasinghe received the second cheque on November 12, 2015.
That was 87 days after the election.The third cheque had been issued to Senasinghe on March 31, 2016, that was 227 days after the general election.
Additional Solicitor General, Yasantha Kodagoda pointed out in court yesterday that one of the controversial Central Bank Bond issuances was also conducted on the same day.
Under these circumstances, the CID is investigating state minister Senasinghe for accepting three million rupees on three occasions from the third respondent of the controversial Central Bank bond case, at a time when there was no election.
The CID has also recorded a statement from state minister, Senasinghe’s election and financial coordinator with regard to the incident.
The minister’s election and financial coordinator said in his statement that he did not keep any record of the money that was received from Perpetual Treasuries nor did he deposit such money in any bank.
He has also stated that he did not know the origin of the cheques.
Accordingly, the CID informed the court that State Minister Senasinghe will be questioned over the reasons as to why he received cheques amounting to millions of rupees from Perpetual Treasuries.

heading: Yasodha Range Bandara remanded
content:
State Minister Palitha Range Bandara's son Yasodha Range Bandara has been remanded until 12th of this month.
 
He is accused of drunk-driving and misuse of public property.Yasodha was produced before Nugegoda Magistrate Court this afternoon by a police team from Arachchikattuwa Police.The cab, which is a property of a Ministry, driven by him crashed into a house early morning on Wednesday.He and another person injured in the accident and it caused extensive damages to the house.

heading: Landslide kills a 3-year-old girl
content:
A 3-year-old little girl was killed when an earth mound collapsed on a house in Uda Maaliboda in Deraniyagala this morning (Jun 07).
Police said an earth mound has collapsed on their house as a result of the prevailing rains.
She was with her mother and a sibling in the home when the incident happened at around 11 am.
The mother and the other child escaped unhurt.
Police said that the body of the victim is kept at Deraniyagala Hospital.

heading: Range Bandara’s son admitted to J’pura Hospital, police seek court permission to arrest him
content:
Arachchikattuwa police have submitted a report to the Chilaw Magistrate Court this morning (Jun 07) with regards to the crash involving Yashodha Range Bandara, the son of State Minister, Palitha Range Bandara.
 
A senior police officer investigating the accident said that court permission will be sought to have the suspect arrested.
 
The medical tests have confirmed that the suspect was driving under the influence of liquor at the time of the accident.
 
Yashoda Range Bandara was driving a double cab belonging to a government Ministry when he lost control of the vehicle which saw it being veered off the road at the Kottapitiya junction early last morning (Jun 06) before crashing into a nearby house.
 
The house was extensively damaged in the incident.
 
The suspect who was transferred from Chilaw hospital to Colombo National Hospital for a test had discharged himself and got admitted to Sri Jayewardenepure Hospital instead.

heading: Arrested Yashoda Range Bandara undergoes MRI scan
content:
The son of State Minister Palitha Range Bandara, Yashoda Range Bandara who was arrested by the police this morning (Jun 08) was taken to a private hospital for an MRI test.
 
Later, the suspect returned to Sri Jayewardenepura Hospital.
 
Police have filed 3 charges against the suspect.
 
The misappropriation of state property, causing an accident driving under the influence of liquor and having a sword in possession.
 
Medical reports confirmed that Yashoda Range Bandara was intoxicated at the time of the accident which occurred during the early hours of Wednesday in Bangadeniya - Kottapitiya junction along the Chilaw- Puttlam main road.
 
The suspect was originally admitted to Chilaw hospital and was later transferred to Colombo national hospital for further tests.
 
The Police Media Spokesperson’s Office further noted that the suspect is to be produced before courts.

heading: Water Board employees end strike
content:
The strike launched by the employees of the National Water Supply and Drainage Board citing several demands including a 25% salary hike has been suspended.
 
The Union said that they took the decision after the Subject Minister and Secretary of the Ministry agreed to look into their issues during a meeting yesterday (Jun 06).

heading: A list of MP's who obtained money from Aloysius does not exist says Speaker
content:
Speaker Karu Jayasuriya told in Parliament today (Jun 07) that all responsible stakeholders confirmed that there's no list of parliamentarians or other persons who had allegedly received money from PTL owner, Arjun Aloysius.
 
The Speaker also said there is no truth in reports that said 25 security personnel of the MPs' had been questioned in this regard.
 
He said that the police confirmed that there was no such questioning.
 
The Speaker added that he had informed the President's Secretary to hand over all the related documents to him and those will be collected after he returns to the country.
 
The IGP's assistance has been sought for that.
 
The Speaker made this statement after speculations were surfaced that there's a list of MP's who had obtained money from the remanded businessman.

heading: SLFP CC meets today after positions changed
content:
The Sri Lanka Freedom Party Central Committee meets today (Jun 07) for the first time after the temporary appointment of the new office-bearers.
 
The meeting will take place in the afternoon, at the President’s official residence, with President Maithripala Sirisena at the chair.
 
The SLFP temporary office bearers were appointed last Sunday, where Prof. Rohana Lakshman Piyadasa was appointed the new General Secretary.
 
The President was re-appointed as the party Chairman, former Presidents, Mahinda Rajapaksa and Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga, as well as the former Prime Minister D. M. Jayaratne, were re-elected as advisors of the party.
 
Similarly, Minister Duminda Dissanayake was elected the party’s National Organizer.

heading: Heavy rains and winds predicted
content:
Met Department says due to the active South-west monsoon, the windy condition is expected to strengthen over the island and in the sea areas around the island in next few days.
 
Showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Southern, Central and North-Western provinces.
 
Heavy falls above 100mm can be expected at some places in Sabaragamuwa and Central provinces and in Kalutara, Galle, and Matara districts.
 
Strong gusty winds up to 60 kmph can be expected over the island particularly in Southern, Central, Northern, North-Central and North-Western provinces and Monaragala district.

heading: Heavy rains lash Central hills
content:
Our correspondents say the Central hills have been experiencing heavy rains since early this morning (Jun 07).
 
The water level of the Wimalasurendra Reservoir is also rising and the authorities have opened one of the spill gates of the dam.

heading: "No personal agenda" - Anura Kumara
content:
The leader of the Janatha Viumkthi Peramuna says that they did not have any personal political agenda in deciding to bring in the 20th amendment to the constitution.
 
The JVP leader Anura Kumara Dissanayake said this addressing a seminar in Galle yesterday (Jun 06).

heading: Maharagama Urban Council tense
content:
A tense situation has been prevailing at the Maharagama Urban Council with the nomination of the former Chairperson Kanthi Kodikara and 5 others as councillors of the Maharagama Urban Council.
 
Our correspondent said police have been called in to strengthen the security there.
 
6 elected councillors from the February 10th Local Government Election under the Independent Group 11, had resigned to facilitate those nominations.
 
Accordingly, Kanthi Kodikara and 5 others took oaths before former President Mahinda Rajapaksa at his residence this morning (Jun 07).
The nominations submitted by Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna were rejected and later, the party supported the Independent Group 11.

heading: Child born inside night mail train
content:
A 26-year-old mother has given birth to a baby boy inside the Batticaloa bound night mail train.
 
The incident occurred last night (Jun 06). The mother and the newborn were first admitted to Habarana Hospital and from there to Dambulla Hospital.
 
The mother was a resident of Kaththankudi.
 
A hospital source said that the health condition of both mother and the child is good.

heading: Three arrested with a firearm
content:
Three persons were arrested in Thalathuoya with a firearm.
 
Police found the firearm after the car in which they were travelling was checked.
 
The suspects were residents of Negombo and Wennappuwa.

heading: Minister Dissanayake challenges Dilan Perera to get elected to Parliament
content:
Sri Lanka Freedom Party National Organizer, Duminda Dissanayake says that he wishes MP Dilan Perera would be able to contest in the next general election and be elected to Parliament.
Minister Dissanayake was speaking to the media after an event in Anuradhapura today (Jun 08).
He said this in response to a statement by Dilan Perera, who said yesterday that if Dissanayake does not perform properly in his new post, he would be removed from that post also.

heading: Paternity leave proposed during childbirth
content:
The Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna has made a proposal to the Parliament saying that paternity leave should be granted for fathers during childbirth.
 
This was proposed during the debate on the draft bill to streamline salaries of office and shop workers in Parliament yesterday (Jun 06).

heading: FlyDubai suspends flying to Mattala
content:
FlyDubai, the only international airline that operated to Mattala International Airport has suspended its regular flights until November.
Deputy Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, Ashok Abeysinghe confirmed it.The Deputy Minister said that the airline has taken the decision due to lack of passengers.

heading: Viral fever shuts down Agri Faculty of Ruhunu University
content:
The Ruhunu University’s Agriculture Faculty in Mapalana has been shut down until further notice due to a viral fever, which is spreading in the region.
 
The Ruhunu University’s Vice-Chancellor, Prof. Gamini Senanayake told us that in the last few days close to 100 students fell ill due to a viral fever.
 
The professor said that health authorities have been informed of the situation.
 
Meanwhile, the Medical Superintendent of Embilipitiya Hospital N. S. Dharmathilaka says that 30 patients believed to have been suffering from influenza have been hospitalized to receive treatment.
 
Meanwhile, Sabaragamuwa Provincial Health Services Director Dr. Kapila Kannangara said that the flu which was spreading in the South is now entering the Sabaragamuwa province.

heading: Fisherman from Beruwela reported missing
content:
A fisherman onboard a multi-day fishing craft is reported missing after falling into the sea.
 
The fishing craft that had left from Beruwela on 1st of this month with 4 fishermen onboard, and it had caught in a high wave, while it was on its way back.
 
The missing fisherman was a 38-year-old, father of 2 from Bangalawatte in Beruwela.
 
A group of naval divers has been deployed in a search operation to locate the missing person.

content:
President Maithripala Sirisena has ordered not to charge 14% withholding tax on the sale of teledramas.
 
The President also advised the Finance Minister to inform in writing to relevant institutions not to charge it.
 
During a discussion with a group of artists, the President had pointed out that this tax has been charged as a result of misunderstanding the newly introduced tax policies.
 
The President also promised that if the new tax policies have become an obstruction to the growth of local cinema and teledrama industries, it will be rectified.

heading: Reckless driving kills 2 men
content:
Two persons were killed when two private buses collided at Muruthawela in Pasyala, this morning (Jun 07).
 
One of the buses was plying from Mawanella to Colombo while the other one was heading to Anuradhapura from Colombo.
 
The victims aged 22 and 32 were residents of Kegalle and Mawanella.
 
3 other passengers were admitted to Wathupitiwela Hospital.
 
After the collision, the Anuradhapura bound bus had veered off the road and crashed into the wayside shop.

heading: Consumer Affairs Authority management released
content:
The Chairman, Director General and other top officials who were taken hostage by other workers, have been released.
 
The employees took the management into their custody demanding removal of the Human Resources head.
 
The management staff had been released after they had agreed to dismiss the HR head, who is accused of malpractice.

heading: Fishermen to strike from today
content:
The All Island Fisher Community's trade union says they will not venture into the sea from today as a protest against kerosene price increase.
 
Accordingly, the fishermen from Negombo and the Southern coastal belt from Dehiwela to Beruwela will join the strike action.
 
The union's President Aruna Roshantha said the discussions they had with the authorities seeking a reduction in kerosene prices were unsuccessful.
 
He said that will launch an island-wide strike from Monday.

content: Attorney General has informed President's Secretary, releasing the Annex C-350 of the Bond Commission Report will not have an impact on ongoing investigations into the bond scam.

heading: Viral flu spreads from South to Sabaragamuwa
content:
The Medical Superintendent of Embilipitiya Hospital N.S. Dharmathilaka says that 30 patients believed to have been suffering from influenza are receiving treatment in the hospital.
Earlier, the Health Ministry stated that 2500 infected patients have been found in the Southern province.
Meanwhile, Sabaragamuwa Provincial Health Services Director Dr. Kapila Kannangara said that the flu is spreading from the South to the Sabaragamuwa province.

heading: M. K. Sivajilingam hospitalized
content:
Northern Provincial Council member M. K. Sivajilingam has been hospitalized following a heart attack.
 
Our correspondent said the Councillor who fell ill last night at his home, was hospitalized by the security officers and his relatives.
 
Later, he was admitted to the Intensive Care Unit of Jaffna Teaching Hospital.
 
When contacted, a hospital source said that Sivajilingam is recovering now.

content:
The government is planning to enhance the bus fleet at Sri Lanka Transport Board by importing 500 new buses.
 
The relevant Cabinet paper was approved yesterday (Jun 05).
 
According to the running timetable of the SLTB, 7257 buses are needed to accomplish the passenger service properly.
 
However, as of now, the SLTB has only 6000 buses in running condition and 1560 of this fleet is more than 15 years old.
 
Accordingly, 400 buses with 50-54 high-back seats for urban service and 100 buses with 32-35 seats for rural service will be purchased.

heading: Indian national arrested with foreign liquor
content:
An Indian national was arrested yesterday at the Bandaranaike International Airport with 12 bottles of foreign liquor.
 
The suspect was a 21-year-old.
 
After he was apprehended police produced him before Negombo Magistrate Court.
 
He was released for a fine of Rs. 2,000.

heading: Police say Range Bandara's son will be arrested
content: Police say since it has been proven that State Minister Palitha Range Bandara's son, Yasodha Range Bandara was under the influence of liquor at the time of this morning's accident in Bangadeniya, he will be arrested.The police said the suspect will be arrested after submitting details to the court.This afternoon Yasodha Range Bandara was taken to the National Hospital, Colombo for a test, thereafter he had left the hospital. Related story:Probe underway to arrest Range Bandara's son

heading: Who is responsible for Arjuna Mahendran? PM is asked
content:
Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe says that he no longer has any responsibility with regard to the former Central Bank Governor, Arjuna Mahendran after the latter had resigned from the post.
Prime Minister Wickremesinghe made this statement while answering a question posed by the Chief Opposition Whip Anura Kumara Dissanayake in Parliament today (Jun 06).

content:
The son of State Minister Palitha Range Bandara, Yasodha Range Bandara who was involved in an accident under the influence of liquor has been arrested.
The suspect is being treated at Sri Jayewardenepure Hospital for injuries incurred during the accident.
The Police Media Spokesperson’s Office said that officers from Arachchikattuwa Police made the arrest at the hospital.
3 allegations have been levelled against the suspect.
Firstly the misappropriation of state property, secondly driving under the influence causing an accident, and lastly being in possession of a sword - violating the ordinance prohibiting the possession of dangerous knives.
Medical reports confirmed that Yashoda Range Bandara was intoxicated at the time of the accident which occurred during the early hours of Wednesday in Bangadeniya, Kottapitiya junction along the Chilaw- Puttlam main road.
The suspect was originally admitted to Chilaw Hospital and was later transferred to National Hospital, Colombo for further testing.
The Police Media Spokesperson’s Office further noted that the suspect is to be produced before courts.
