content:
A cache of arms and ammunition hidden during the conflict by the LTTE cadres were detected following a tip-off.
 
The STF officials found them in an abandoned toilet pit in Puliyanpokkanai in Kilinochchi.
 
A group of people who had ventured into the area taking their cattle herds had seen the ammunition and had informed the police.
 
Our correspondents said 184 hand grenades, 35,500 T-56 ammunition, 5 claymores, 4 kg of explosives, 34 40mm mortars, and 4 RPG's were among the find.

heading: Rathana Thera becomes emotional
content:
Parliamentarian Ven. Athuraliye Rathana Thera says that an internationally recognized legal document should be prepared to regulate Glyphosate in Sri Lanka.
The Thera said this speaking at a conference held in Colombo yesterday (Jun 05).
Ven. Rathana Thera became emotional while recalling a past incident at the conference.

heading: Who got money from Arjun Aloysius ?
content:
Two more parliamentarians, Minister Chandrani Bandara and MP C. B. Ratnayake told today (Jun 06) that they did not obtain money from Perpetual Treasuries owner Arjun Aloysius.
With that as of today, 57 MPs have said that they have not received money from Aloysius.
Minister Sarath Fonseka and MP Dayasiri Jayasekera accepted that they got money.
Meanwhile, the Youth Wing of the Pivithuru Hela Urumaya lodged a request with the Office of Missing Persons seeking their assistance to locate former Central Bank Governor Arjuna Mahendran.

heading: PTL deposits Rs. 3.2mn in Arjuna Mahendran’s credit card, State Minister Senasinghe's name also transpired in courts
content: It was revealed in Colombo Fort Magistrate today (Jun 07) that Perpetual Treasuries Limited has deposited 3.2 million rupees in the credit card belonging to former Central Bank Governor Arjuna Mahendran.In addition, it was further revealed that another 3 million rupees have been given to a state minister.Additional Solicitor General and President Counsel Yasantha Kodagoda revealed these details to the court today.Later, the owner of Perpetual Treasuries Limited, Arjun Aloysius and his CEO Kasun Palisena were produced before Court today.At the same time, Magistrate Lanka Jayarathna ordered Perpetual Treasuries chairman, Jeffrey Aloysius to release the asset and liabilities and income and expenditure to the Criminal Investigation Department. Meanwhile, Additional Solicitor General Yasantha Kodagoda informed Court that Singapore police have informed that Arjuna Mahendran cannot be arrested on the orders of Interpol Red Notice.He further said that therefore, a diplomatic request will be made to Singapore to extradite Arjuna Mahendran to Sri Lanka if the latter cannot be arrested under Singaporean law.President Counsel Yasantha Kodagoda said that the Legal Draftsman Department is currently preparing the necessary documents with regard to the diplomatic request.President’s Counsel Yasantha Kodagoda revealed that a State Minister had received funds from Perpetual Treasuries through another Company.He stated that the State Minister had received money on 2 occasions amounting to 3 Million Rupees.It was also revealed that the Police Officers attached to the security unit of the MP had encashed the cheques.According to the CID report, the State Minister concerned was Sujeewa Senasinghe. Meanwhile, President’s Counsel Yasantha Kodagoda also said that Former Central Bank Governor Arjuna Mahendran had received cheques amounting to 3.2 Million Rupees from Perpetual Treasuries.He stated that the funds had been used to settle the bill of the limitless credit card of Arjuna Mahendran.Meanwhile, President Counsel, Kalinga Indratissa who appeared for PTL objected to the revelation of payment of cash to various individuals by his client.The case will be called again on 20th of June and, Arjun Aloysius and Kasun Palisena were further remanded until that day.

heading: CEB engineers issue a warning again, postal workers also to strike
content:
Ceylon Electricity Board's Engineers' Union says they will again stop attending to emergency repairs and maintenance work from this afternoon (Jun 11), if their demands are not addressed.
 
The CEB Engineers are undertaking a work-to-rule campaign, citing the Public Utilities Commission's failure to approve CEB's Long-term Power Generation Plan.
 
Intensifying their trade union action, they moved out of attending to emergency work from last Wednesday afternoon.
 
However, later they agreed to suspect that action after authorities agreed to approve the plan.
 
But they say since it is being delayed again, they will recommence their trade union action from this afternoon.
 
Meanwhile, postal workers are planning to launch a strike from 4 pm today (Jun 11), to show their protest against misuse of recruitment policies and the way interviews are held to recruit Sub-Post Masters.

heading: Journalist Mahesh Nissanka arrested
content:
TV presenter and journalist Mahesh Nissanka has been arrested by Kadawatha Police.
Nissanka is accused of attacking an owner of a fitness center in Enderamulla, Wattala with a knife on Saturday night.
 
The fitness center owner is now being treated at the National Hospital.
 
Police said that the attack was a result of a personal dispute.
 
The victim was Wasantha Kumara Liyanage.

heading: Fmr Minister Sarath Kumara Gunaratne granted bail
content:
Colombo High Court today (Jun 12) granted bail to former Deputy Minister Sarath Kumara Gunaratne and 5 others over their alleged links to a financial fraud.
 
They were issued charge sheets today.
 
The suspects were released on cash sureties of Rs. 25,000 each and personal bails of Rs. 1 million each.
 
The suspects are accused of misappropriating Rs. 9 billion from Lanka Fisheries Corporation during the 2015 Presidential Election.

heading: Australia jails Sri Lankan man over Malaysia Airlines plane bomb threat
content:
A Sri Lankan man who threatened to detonate a bomb on a Malaysia Airlines plane has been jailed in Australia.
 
Manodh Marks, 26, forced Kuala Lumpur-bound jet MH128 to turn back to Melbourne in May last year after he tried to access the cockpit.
 
He was later found not to be carrying explosives and in a drug-induced psychosis, a court heard.
 
It is the first time Australia has jailed a person for attempting to take control of an aircraft.
 
Marks will be deported after serving a maximum sentence of 12 years, judge Michael McInerney told the County Court of Victoria today (Jun 07).
 
"The passengers and crew certainly were not only concerned but convinced, that you were indeed in possession of a bomb," the judge said in his sentencing remarks.
 
The flight, carrying more than 200 people, landed safely about 15 minutes after Marks was tackled to the ground by passengers.
 
Marks, who was in Australia on a student visa, had been released from a psychiatric facility on the day of the incident.
 
The court heard that he had taken crystal methamphetamine, known locally as ice, on the way to the airport.
 
Shortly after take-off, he brandished two black items - later found to be a portable speaker and a battery pack - with flashing lights.
 
"I have a bomb with me," Marks told the crew, according to Fairfax Media.
 
"I want to talk to the captain. I want to talk to the pilot. Don't come near me. I want to destroy this aircraft. I will destroy this plane."
 
About five minutes later, Marks was subdued by passengers who bound his hands with cable ties.
 
The Airbus A330 landed safely a short time later.
 
McInerney said the threat had placed intense stress on the pilots, putting passengers at risk.
 
At the time, Australian police were criticised for taking almost 90 minutes to board the plane after it landed.
 
Victoria Police Chief Commissioner Graham Ashton said police had initially treated it as a possible terrorism incident, before deciding it was "a case involving a mental health issue".
 
"I certainly appreciate when you are on a plane in that situation one minute could seem like an hour," he said.
 
"The objective in any serious incident like this is to get every member of the crew, every passenger off the plane safely, and that is what was able to be achieved."
 
Marks will be eligible for parole after nine years.
 
(BBC)

heading: Cabinet approves reduction of kerosene price
content:
The Cabinet has approved to reduce Kerosene price to Rs.70 per litre from Rs. 101.
 
Minister Vijith Vijayamuni Zoysa confirmed this.
 
The price was agreed upon with a discussion with fisheries unions yesterday (Jun 11).

heading: Gampola - Udapalatha PS chairman assaulted
content:
The Chairman of Gampola - Udapalatha Pradeshiya Sabha has been hospitalized after he was assaulted by a group of councillors.
 
He was admitted to Gampola Hospital.
 
The clash had occurred following a tense situation at the council.

heading: G. L. dismisses speculations on meeting between US envoy & MR
content:
The Chairman of Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna, Professor, GL. Peiris says that no political matters were discussed during the recent meeting between former President Mahinda Rajapaksa and outgoing US Ambassador, Athul Keshap.
 
Professor Peiris said that the outgoing ambassador only paid a customary call to the former President.
 
Meanwhile, the current US ambassador to Nepal, Aliana B. Teplitz will be appointed as the next US envoy to Sri Lanka.
 
She was appointed as ambassador to Sri Lanka and the Maldives by US President Donald Trump on 25th of May and, the appointment has been endorsed by the American Senate.

heading: Rehabilitated LTTE members give emotional send off to Colonel Bandu
content:
A group of rehabilitated former LTTE members got emotional when they bade farewell to the commander of the Civil Defence Force of Mullaitivu camp in Kilinochchi yesterday.
Our correspondent said that the rehabilitated former LTTE members, as well as residents in the area, got very emotional at the farewell.
The Commander of the Mullaitivu Civil Defence Force, Colonel Ratnapriya Bandu helped a number of rehabilitated former LTTE cadres during the last five years to return to normal society.Meanwhile, today marked the 28th year since the LTTE murdered 400 unarmed policemen in the Rupaskulam area in Thirukkovil, Ampara.A remembering ceremony was held there today with the participation if IGP Pujith Jayasundera.

heading: Rs. 1.75 million worth gold detected at BIA
content:
A 39-year-old resident of Kalmunai was arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport while trying to smuggle in Rs. 1.75 million worth of gold biscuits into the country.
 
He had arrived from Qatar at around 2.45 am today (Jun 12).
 
The gold biscuits were forfeited and the suspect was released on a fine of Rs. 25,000.

heading: Perpetual Treasuries pays Rs. 3.2mn to Mahendran's credit card
content:
Colombo Fort Magistrate ordered to extend the detention of Perpetual Treasuries owner Arjun Aloysius and its CEO Kasun Palisena until 21st of this month.
 
They were remanded when the Central Bank bond scam case was taken up before Colombo Fort Magistrate Lanka Jayaratne today (Jun 07).
 
Here, the Criminal Investigation Department informed the court that the PTL has paid Rs. 3.2mn for former Central Bank Governor Arjuna Mahendran's credit card.

heading: Sunil Handunnetti reappointed COPE chairman
content: Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna MP Sunil Handunnetti has been reappointed the Chairman of Committee on Public Enterprises.

heading: Four youths arrested for posting pictures of sharp objects on Facebook
content:
Dambulla Police has arrested 4 youths for posting pictures of swords, Kris knives and some other sharp objects on Facebook accounts.
 
The youths, aged between 16 and 21 years and are residents of Dambulla, Kandalama, and Cap-Ela.
 
Dambulla Police received a complaint that the group was harassing neighbours there was also a complaint of an assault.
 
Police investigations revealed that the suspects used the sharp objects in the photos to intimidate their neighbours.
 
Police have since released the suspects after having given a severe warning.

heading: CCTV captures Galewela accident
content:
Two off-duty soldiers were killed on the spot when the three-wheeler that they were travelling by collided head-on with a tipper in Puwakpitiya on the Dambulla - Galewela road.
 
Another person was critically injured in the accident.
 
He was first admitted to Galewela Hospital and later transferred to Kurunegala Teaching Hospital.
 
The deceased were 22-year-old Samith Maduranga Ekanayake and 23-year-old Supun Kalhara Rajathilleke.
 
They were on leave and were serving at an army camp in Diyathalawa.
 
The victims were returning home after attending a funeral when the tragedy struck.
 
Police said that the three-wheeler had attempted to overtake a car at high speed and then hit the tipper head-on.
 
The tipper driver was arrested by police.

heading: Yasodha Range Bandara remanded further
content: State Minister Palitha Range Bandara's son Yashoda, who was arrested over an accident, was further remanded until 14th of June by Chilaw Magistrate.He was brought to the courts from Sri Jayewardenepure Hospital.Yasodha Range Bandara was arrested and remanded on 8th of this month.He is accused of causing an accident in Bangadeniya on 6th of this month while driving under the influence of liquor.Bandara was arrested while he was receiving treatment at the Sri Jayewardenepure Hospital.

heading: Two policemen jailed for raping two young women
content:
Colombo High Court judge Gihan Kulatunga today (Jun 07) sentenced 2 policemen for 20 years and six months in jail for gang-raping 2 women in 2003 after abducting them.
 
The incident had taken place in 2003.
 
The accused, a sub-inspector and a police assistant, were serving at Sapugaskanda Police.
 
They were also ordered to pay Rs. 200,000 each to the 2 young women as compensation.

heading: Cabinet paper to reduce kerosene to Rs. 70
content:
If cabinet approval is granted, the price of kerosene will be dropped to Rs.70 per litre from midnight tonight (Jun 12).
 
The relevant proposal is scheduled to be tabled before the cabinet today.
 
Discussions were held yesterday between the Minister of Fisheries and Aquatic Resources Development Vijith Vijayamuni Soysa and representatives from the fisheries union on this proposal.
 
On this occasion, the fishermen agreed to the proposed price of 70 rupees per litre of kerosene oil.

heading: Traffic congestion in Town Hall
content:
Traffic congestion is reported from Town Hall area due to a protest by Inter University Students' Federation.
 
Police said that the road leading to the Ward Place is also closed.

heading: Minister Ranawaka withdraws two court cases
content:
Minister Chmapika Ranawaka today (Jun 07) withdrew two defamation cases against Maubima newspaper that were filed seeking Rs. 1.5 billion for causing damages to his reputation.
 
One of those cases said that his reputation was damaged through an article published on 30th of December 2014, on the disappearance of journalist Prageeth Eknaligoda.
 
The other was against an article on alleged irregularities on the importation of coal, published in the same newspaper.
 
The Minister's attorney informed the Colombo District Court today that his client is willing to withdraw those 2 cases.
 
Considering that the judge dismissed the cases without costs.

heading: "Committed towards reconciliation", says President
content:
President Maithripala Sirisena says the present government is committed to creating peace and reconciliation in the country.
 
President said that during the Iftar ceremony held at the President's House in Colombo yesterday (Jun 07).

heading: Finance Minister outlines reasons for collapse of finance companies
content:
Finance Minister Mangala Samaraweera says lack of proper financial management, improper investments and fraudulent activities of the management members have been identified as reasons for the collapse of certain finance companies.
 
Minister Samaraweera said this in Parliament today (Jun 07).
 
He said this after Chief Opposition Whip, Anura Kumara Dissanayake made a statement on the collapse of ETI Finance.
 
He was speaking during the adjournment debate on the collapse of finance companies including ETI Finance.

heading: Heavy showers of over 100mm predicted (Photos)
content:
The Met Department says due to the active south-west monsoon, windy and showery conditions are expected to continue over the island and in the sea areas around the island in next few days.
 
Showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Southern, Central and North-Western provinces.
 
Heavy falls above 100mm can be expected at some places in Sabaragamuwa, Western and Central provinces and in Galle and Matara districts.
 
Strong gusty winds up to 60 kmph can be expected over the island particularly in Southern, Central, Northern, North-central and North-western provinces and Monaragala district.Meanwhile, our correspondents said due to heavy showers some areas of Hatton were experiencing flash floods. In Ginigathhena, traffic has been restricted as a result of an earth mound collapsing on the road in Diyagala.

heading: Journalist Mahesh Nissanka remanded
content:
Journalist Mahesh Nissanka, who was arrested by Kadawatha Police over an alleged assault has been remanded until tomorrow by Mahara Magistrate.
 
He is suspected of attacking a fitness center owner in Enderamulla, Wattala on Saturday night over a personal dispute.

heading: SLFP restructuring to be expedited
content:
The Central Committee of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party that met yesterday (Jun 07) decided to expedite the restructuring process of the party.
 
The CC members had also talked about the 20th amendment to the constitution moved by the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna.
 
It was the first SLFP CC meeting since the appointment of temporary office bearers.
 
The meeting was chaired by President Maithripala Sirisena.

heading: TV presenter attacks neighbour with a knife (Photos)
content:
A presenter at a leading TV has attacked an owner of a fitness center in Enderamulla, Wattala.
The owner of the fitness center is now receiving treatment at the National Hospital, Colombo.
It was reported that the incident had occurred in Saturday night following a personal dispute.
The victim was Wasantha Kumara Liyanage, a resident of Enderamulla has lodged a complaint with police.
Police said that the TV presenter is not at home.

heading: Former President Rajapaksa says “certain individuals were bought during last Presidential election”
content:
Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa says that certain individuals were “bought’ during the last presidential election.
Addressing a gathering at a book launch in Colombo last evening (Jun 10), the former President said all allegations that were made against him are, one by one, being revealed as false.

heading: JVP urges to table remaining sections of Bond Commission report soon
content:
The Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna urges to submit the remaining sections of Bond Commission report in Parliament soon.
The JVP's Propaganda Secretary MP Vijitha Herath said this addressing a media conference in Battaramulla today (Jun 11).
Herath also spoke about the allegations level against JVP MP Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa of accepting money from Arjun Aloysius.

heading: Witness hearing on case against Prasanna Ranatunga begins
content:
The witness hearing on the case against Gampaha district UPFA MP Prasanna Ranatunga and 3 others for allegedly obtaining Rs. 64mn from a businessman after threatening him, began today (Jun 11).
 
It was taken up before the Colombo High Court Judge, Champa Janaki Rajaratne.
 
The complainant said that in the afternoon of 29th of May 2015, Ranatunga gave him a telephone and demanded money.
 
He had said that the MP again visited his premises with 3 security personnel on the same evening and again demanded money.
 
The relevant audio recordings of telephone conversations were played at the court.
 
Thereafter, the case was postponed to 28th of this month.

heading: Rs. 5 million robbed in Ududumbara
content:
Police say an unidentified group of 5 men in a van have robbed around Rs. 5 million from another van in Galekele in Ududumbara.
The money, belonging to 2 private firms, was transported from Mahiyanganaya to Kandy by a private security firm.
The incident had occurred at around 4.35 pm.
Police said that the robbers have threatened the staff of the security firm with a pistol.
Later, police found the van used by the robbers, abandoned in the Pallekele area.

heading: Southern PC debates spread of Influenza
content:
A debate regarding the spread of influenza in the South is being held at the Southern Provincial Council.
 
A senior officer of the Southern Province Ministry of Health stated that to date 24 deaths have been reported and of them 17 were children.
 
Meanwhile, the technical equipment required for the Karapitiya Teaching Hospital’s ICU for children, the only one available in the South, has not yet been provided.
 
The GMOA Joint Secretary, Dr. Kanchitha Samararathna said that treating the diagnosed children has become impossible under these circumstances.

heading: Dayasiri Jayasekera at CID
content:
Former Minister, MP Dayasiri Jayasekera has arrived at the Criminal Investigation Department.
 
He arrived there to give a statement over his confession that he accepted Rs. 1 million from Perpetual Treasuries.
 
Earlier, Jayasekera accepted he received funds from the PTL, which is accused of Central Bank bond scam, for his election campaign.

heading: Police seek public support to arrest a chain snatcher (Photos)
content:
Police are seeking public assistance to apprehend a suspect who used to flee after snatching gold chains from women.
Police have identified the suspect as K. G. Sagara Sawrnamal, and he had snatched a chain from a woman in Madawala, Wattegama in February this year.
The 24-year-old suspect is reported missing from the area since then.
Police urge the public to provide details to 081 - 2 476222 and 0718 - 591063.

heading: Dayasiri Jayasekera grilled for 5 hours
content:
MP Dayasiri Jayasekera who had appeared before Criminal Investigation Department left the premises.
 
He was grilled for 5 hours by the CID sleuths.
 
The MP was asked to come to the CID to record a statement after he made a confession that he received Rs. 1mn from Perpetual Treasuries Limited for his election campaign.

heading: State Minister Range Bandara faces criticism
content:
State Minister Palitha Range Bandara is facing criticism from many sides after he made several statements with regard to the accident involving his son Yashoda Range Bandara.
The police reported that Yasodha Range Bandara had caused the accident while driving under the influence of liquor.
The National Movement of web journalists convened a media conference to educate the people on this incident today.

heading: Woman arrested at BIA with RS. 8mn worth gold
content:
Sri Lanka Customs Unit at the Bandaranaike International Airport has arrested a woman who attempted to smuggle Rs. 8mn worth jewellery into the country.
 
The arrest was made early this morning (Jun 11) and she had arrived from Dubai.
 
The net weight of the jewellery items was 1.3 kg and the 54-year-old suspect was a resident of Warakapola.

heading: Teledrama actress among arrested in a brothel raid
content:
Police have raided a brothel in Kidagammulla, Gampaha, which was operated in the guise of a hotel.
 
Seven women who had allegedly engaged in prostitution were arrested by the police personnel from this place.
 
The person who had managed the brothel was also arrested and later they were remanded until 18th of this month.
 
Gampaha Headquarters Police conducted the raid early last morning following complaints by area residents.
 
Police also arrested 6 men at the location and they were released on bail.
 
Police said that among the arrested women, was a teledrama actress.
 
Investigations revealed that she had used to work at nightclubs.
 
The arrested women aged between 30 and 40 years are residents of Nittambuwa, Ganemulla, Yagoda, Siyambalape, and Delgoda.

heading: MR arrives at Mattala in a light aircraft
content:
Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa says restriction of the arrival of flights to Mattala is done with an intention of revenging.
The former President said this in response to the questions posed by the journalists after he arrived at the Mattala Airport in a light aircraft.
Meanwhile, after an event held in Colombo, yesterday the former President said that the recent changes implemented at the Sri Lanka Freedom Party are useless.
He said before making changes, one should understand the aspirations of the public.

heading: Winds to subside from tomorrow
content:
Met Department says that the prevailing windy condition over the island and in the sea areas around the island is expected to reduce gradually from tomorrow (Jun 12).
 
Several spells of showers will occur in Sabaragamuwa and Central provinces and in Kurunegala district.
 
Light showers will occur in Western province and in Puttalam, Galle, and Matara districts, particularly in the morning.
 
Strong gusty winds up to 60 kmph can be expected over the island particularly in Western, Southern, Central, Northern, North-central and North-western provinces and Monaragala district.

heading: Update: New State Ministers & Deputy Ministers sworn in
content:
Seven parliamentarians were sworn in as State Ministers and Deputy Ministers at the Presidential Secretariat this morning (Jun 12).



State Ministers:Ranjith Aluvihare - State Minister for Tourism Development & Christian AffairsLucky Jayawardene - Hill County New Villages Community Development
New Deputy Ministers:
Kader Mastan - Resettlement, Rehabilitation, Northern Development & Hindu Affairs
Angajan Ramanathan – Agriculture
Ajith Mannapperuma – Environment
Edward Gunasekara - Internal Affairs & North - Western Development
Nalin Bandara - Public Administration, Management, Law & Order

heading: Lindula UC Chairman & 3 others further remanded in child kidnapping case
content:
Ashoka Sepala, Chairman of the Lindula Urban Council along with three others were further remanded until 18th of June for allegedly kidnapping and trafficking of a 5-year-old girl.
The suspects were produced before Nuwara Eliya Magistrate Pramodaka Jayasekera this morning (Jun 11).
The Magistrate also ordered that the small girl should be returned to the custody of her father.
Ashoka Sepala who contested from an independent group under the election symbol, clock, during the recent Local Government election was elected the Chairman of Lindula Urban Council.
On the 4th of June police arrested four suspects including Sepala, and 3 others, one of whom was councilor Ishara Anuruddha.
An investigation was launched in response to a complaint made in 2017, regarding the alleged kidnapping and selling a 5-year-old girl from Portmore Estate in Agarapatana.
The investigation led to the arrest of the 4 suspects by Nuwara Eliya Police.

heading: Fishermen stage a protest
content:
A group of fishermen staged a protest in Maggona, Kalutara this morning (Jun 11).
They are demanding that kerosene oil is sold to them at Rs. 44.Our correspondent said that fishermen from Beruwela and Payagala also joined the protest.

heading: Chinese woman arrested in Colpetty
content:
A Chinese woman who was staying in Sri Lanka without a visa was arrested in Walukarama Road in Colpetty, last night (Jun 10).
The woman was arrested last night at around 10, following a tip-off.
The 35-year-old suspect will be produced before Fort Magistrate today.

heading: No written approval for 1st Mihin board, Presidential Commission found
content:
The first board of directors for Mihin Lanka had been appointed without any written approval from the government.
 
This was revealed during the hearing by the Presidential Commission probing alleged malpractice at SriLankan, Mihin Lanka and SriLankan Catering.
 
The Commission met for a 4th day today (Jun 11).

heading: Wife kills husband following a family dispute
content:
A 42-year-old woman has killed her husband by attacking him with a crow-bar in Gokarella, Kurunegala, following a family dispute.
 
The husband was 50-year-old and the incident had taken place last afternoon (Jun 10).
 
Later the woman was arrested by police and she will be produced before Kurunegala court today.
 
They have 3 children of age 18, 12 - both boys - and an 8-year-old girl.

heading: Joint opposition discusses 4 presidential candidates
content: Joint Opposition MP Udaya Gammanpila says that discussions are held regarding candidates that are being considered for the next presidential election.The MP made this known to media after a Joint Opposition party leaders meeting  held last afternoon with former President Mahinda Rajapaksa at the chair.MP Wimal Weeravansa said that during this meeting, discussions regarding defeating the draft 20th constitutional amendment were taken place.

heading: Three treasure hunters arrested
content:
Moneragala Police have arrested 3 persons while engaging in treasure hunting at Guruhela in Moneragala.
 
The suspects are residents of Kaduwela and Moneragala.
 
Few pieces of equipment were also apprehended.
 
The suspects will be produced before courts today (Jun 13).

heading: Various views expressed on minister Sujeewa's acceptance of collecting money from Aloysius
content: Various personalities expressed views on State Minister Sujeewa Senasinghe, who had accepted that he had obtained money from Arjun Aloysius who is accused of Central Bank bond scam.

heading: Three arrested with a high sensitive scanner
content:
Police have arrested 3 persons while transporting a high sensitive scanner which is used to check underground objects, in the Irattaperiyakulam area in Vavuniya.
 
Police said that the suspects were arrested following a tip-off by Special Task Force last night (Jun 10).
 
The suspects were residents of Kandy and Police said they were on a mission to find gold hidden by the LTTE.
 
The scanner is valued at around Rs. 5 million.

heading: Chief incumbent of Kirivehera admitted to a private hospital
content:
The chief incumbent of Kirivehera, Ven. Kobawaka Dhamminda Thera who was airlifted from Hambantota Hospital has been admitted to a private hospital in Colombo.
 
The Thera had received gunshot in his abdomen and right hand, and the Director of Hambantota Hospital, Dr. Dhanushka Perera said that the Thera underwent a surgery at the hospital.
 
Ven. Dhamminda Thera and another resident monk Ven. Vidyapola Sobitha Thera were shot at last night by 3 suspects last night at the Kirivehera premises.
 
Later police found the jeep used by the assailants.
 
The investigators have also identified the gunmen.
ඡායාරූප - සූරියවැව නුවන් ජයසේකර

heading: Chief incumbent of Kirivehera to be airlifted to Colombo
content:
The Director of Hambantota Hospital says that the chief incumbent of Kirivehera, Ven. Kobawaka Dhamminda Thera will be airlifted to Colombo for further treatment.
 
Dr. Dhanushka Perera said that the Thera had received gunshot in his abdomen and right hand.
 
Ven. Dhamminda Thera and Ven. Vidyapola Sobitha Thera were shot at last night by 3 suspects last night.
 
Later police found the jeep used by the assailants.
 
The investigators have also identified the gunmen.

heading: Veteran musician Cyril Perera dies
content:
Veteran musician Cyril Perera has passed away.
 
He was 73-years-old at the time of his demise.
 
It is reported that he was receiving treatment at a private hospital in Colombo.

heading: Three underworld figures arrested in Kadugannawa
content: Three accomplices of the underworld figure 'Makandure Madush', arrested by Kandy police from a hotel in Kadugannawa.Police said that over Rs. 100,000 was also recovered from them. The suspects will be handed over to the Organized Crimes Investigation Division for further action.

heading: Journalist Mahesh Nissanka sends to remand custody
content:
Journalist Mahesh Nissanka and his eldest son, who are accused of assaulting another individual have been remanded until 18th of this month.
 
They were produced before Mahara Magistrate today (Jun 13).
 
The alleged assault had taken place on Saturday night in front of a supermarket in Enderamulla, Wattala.
 
A fitness center owner, named Wasantha Liyanage was assaulted by Nissanka and his 2 sons following a verbal exchange.
 
Wasantha was later admitted to National Hospital, Colombo with cut injuries.
 
Meanwhile, Nissanka and his 2 sons surrendered to police through a lawyer yesterday (Jun 12).
 
Later, the younger son was released on a cash surety of Rs. 10,000 and a personal surety of Rs. 100,000.
 
However, Nissanka has also made a complaint to police against the injured person and Kadawatha Police said it will also be probed.

heading: Special office to pay compensation for war-affected
content:
Cabinet has approved the establishment of a special office to pay compensation for conflict-affected people in North and East.
 
Joining the weekly Cabinet media briefing, Co-cabinet spokesperson Minister Gayantha Karunatillake said the relevant draft bill will be presented in Parliament soon.

heading: Postal trade unions vow to continue strike
content:
The Joint Postal Workers' Union says that they have decided to continue their strike as the authorities are reluctant to address their issues.
 
It is reported that more than 300,000 letters are to be distributed at the Central Mail Exchange.

heading: One arrested over Grandpass murder
content:
Police have arrested a 28-year-old resident of Wellampitiya for supporting and abetting a recent shooting in Grandpass.
 
One person was killed and 3 others were critically injured in the shooting which took place in January this year.
 
It is reported that the shooting was a result of a dispute over a financial transaction in drug dealing.

heading: Mastan’s Deputy Ministerial portfolio likely to be changed !
content:
Internal government sources say that the Deputy Ministerial post offered to the Sri Lanka Freedom Party MP Kader Mastan yesterday is likely to be changed.
 
He was appointed the Deputy Minister of Resettlement, Rehabilitation, Northern Development and Hindu Religious Affairs.
 
However, many have raised objections against the appointment.
 
When we contacted Minister Mano Ganeshan, he confirmed that the matter was discussed with the President and that a suitable change may be made after reviewing the objections.
 
Meanwhile, councilor M. K. Sivajilingam said at the Northern Provincial Council session that he did not agree with the appointment.
 
In addition, General Secretary of TELO, P. Udayarasa also voiced his objections to the appointment.
 
 He said MP Mastan’s background does not qualify him to hold such a portfolio.
 
PLOTE leader, Dharmalingam Siddharthan also raised his objections to the appointment.
 
Wanni District MP, Kader Mastan who took oaths yesterday stated that there are Hindu voters amongst his supporters.

heading: Case against Ghanasara Thera postponed
content:
The Court of Appeal postponed a case filed by the Attorney General against Ven. Galagodaatte Ghanasara Thera and 12 others until 23rd of November.
 
The case was taken up before CoA judges, Deepali Wijesundera and Achala Wengappuli.
 
They were earlier released by the Colombo High Court in a case where they were accused of entering a religious place in Thalahena, Thalangama and causing damages to it.
 
Thereafter, the AG filed a case in the Court of Appeal, challenging the decision.

heading: Move to relocate 2 elephants from Sinharaja being criticized
content:
The environmental protection organization, Surakimu Sri Lanka charges that the Minister of Wildlife, Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka has decided to have the two elephants, both inhabitants of the world heritage rainforest, Sinharaja, to be moved to the elephant detention center at Horowpathaana.
 
Addressing a media conference in Colombo this morning (Jun 13), National Organizer of Surakimu Sri Lanka, Pahiyangala Ananda Thera disclosed this.
 
When we contacted Wildlife Director General C. Suriyabandara to comment on the matter, he said that the two elephants were creating havoc for residents of the boundary villages of Sinharaja, thus they decided to move the elephants out of the forest.
 
He also said that the two elephants' lives are at risk as they used to encroach the adjourning villages.

heading: Group of 16 to meet Gotabhaya
content:
The Sri Lanka Freedom Party's 'Group of 16' says they are planning to meet former Defence Secretary, Gotabhaya Rajapaksa on Wednesday (Jun 13).
 
Confirming the meeting, former Minister S. B. Dissanayake said Gotabhaya Rajapaksa has a good acceptance in the country as a person who had done a service to the country.

heading: EURO 4 standard fuel to be introduced
content: Ministry of Petroleum Resources Development says Euro 4 fuel to be introduced to the market, replacing Super Diesel and 95 Octane petrol.

heading: His appointment not yet informed says, former President
content:
Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa says he has not been informed as yet that he was appointed as an advisor of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party.
The former President said this after attending an event in Kottawa today in response to the questions posed by the journalists.

heading: Postal strike continues, letters piling up
content:
The Joint Postal Workers' Union says that the strike launched by them will be continued today (Jun 13) as well.
Its convener Chintaka Bandara said by last evening around 300,000 letters had piled up at the Central Mail Exchange.
The postal workers began this strike 2 days ago, demanding a separate recruitment strategy for Department of Post and to ensure the job security to Sub-Post officers.

heading: Kosgoda Sujee suspected of ordering Karandeniya murder
content:
Police say that it has been confirmed the Vice Chairman of Karandeniya Pradeshiya Sabha, Donald Sampath Ranaweera, was murdered over a personal dispute.
A senior police official in charge of the investigations said that the late Vice Chairman’s relatives, as well as the other party, is refraining from disclosing information about the dispute.
It has been revealed at the autopsy that the Vice Chairman has sustained seven bullet wounds to his chest and another wound to his head.
Donald Sampath was shot last Friday night in Korakeena area in Uuragasmanhandiya.
Police Media Spokesperson, SP Ruwan Gunasekara noted that the suspect, who was arrested while receiving treatment in hospital, is a close accomplice of Kosgoda Sujee, an underworld leader.
Investigations have revealed that the Vice Chairman had been shot following a dispute between him and Kosgoda Sujee.
Donald Sampath Ranaweera has operated a real estate development business in the area and it has been reported that he had received the support of Kosgoda Sujee and his accomplices to operate the business.
However, both factions have had a dispute later and it is reported that the father and son who were murdered in Yudapitiya in Karandeniya, recently also had maintained close ties with the late Vice Chairman.

heading: State Minister's lies exposed
content:
The owner of the house which State Minister Palitha Range Bandara’s son, Yashoda Range Bandara’s vehicle crashed into, has stated that there was no clash after the accident.
State Minister Range Bandara who was avoiding media, speaking at a ceremony in Anamaduwa, Puttalam yesterday for the first time after the incident, stated that a certain faction had left a sword and a club in the vehicle after assaulting the occupants of the cab.
State Minister Palitha Range Bandara had convened a press briefing today as well, where he once again stated that a clash took place after the collision.
However, the owner of the house assured our news team that no such clash took place after the incident.
Further, the State Minister leveled allegations against the police and media at the press briefing held today.

heading: Chief incumbent of Kiri Vehera admitted to Hambantota Hospital
content: Chief Incumbent of the Kataragama- Kirivehera, the Ven. Kobawaka Dhamminda Thera has been shot at.The Thera is currently receiving treatment at Hambanthota General Hospital’s  ICU.A spokesperson for the hospital noted that the condition of the Thera is not critical.Preliminary investigations revealed that the Thera, accompanied by Ven. Veedaapola Sobhitha Thera, was making his way down to the lower compound from the upper compound of KiriVehera, last night when they were shot at.Three unidentified gunmen who were hiding in the lower compound shot at the thera and subsequently fled the scene in a red jeep which was parked near Kiri Vehera.Both of them were admitted to Debarawewa Base Hospital and later transferred to Hambanthota General Hospital for further treatment.A spokesperson for the hospital noted that the chief incumbent had sustained injuries to his right leg and left arm while the other Thera had sustained injuries to his right leg.The jeep used to flee the scene, which was later located by police,  in close proximity to Kiri Vehera.The motive behind the incident is yet to be determined. 5 police  teams have been deployed to undertake the investigation.

heading: JVP MP Nalinda Jayatissa goes to court
content:
JVP parliamentarian Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa says he will take legal action against the leader of the United National Freedom Front, Maithri Gunarathna, who had leveled allegations against the MP that he accepted funds from Perpetual Treasuries.
MP Jayatissa made this comment in response to the statement made by Maithri Gunarathna yesterday.
Addressing a media briefing in Negombo yesterday, leader of the United National Freedom Front, Maithri Gunarathna stated that JVP MP Nalinda Jayatissa accepted funds from Perpetual Treasuries.

heading: Mother consumes poison at the child protection authority
content: A mother who had attempted to commit suicide by drinking poison at the National Child Protection Authority, was hospitalised last afternoon.An Authority spokesperson  said the mother had attempted suicide saying that no response was being given from the Authority although complaints had been lodged regarding harassment imposed on her son, who is currently in probation office custody. After the 24-year-old mother consumed the poison, Child Protection officials had originallyadmitted her to the Sri Jayawardenepura Hospital.Responding to a query by our news team, Child Protection Authority Chairman, H. M. Abeyrathne said the woman had been admitted to hospital without delay.The woman had later been transferred from sri Jayewardenepura Hospital to the Kalubowila Teaching Hospital, as her condition was not serious.

heading: NFF says hidden agenda in 20th amendment
content:
The National Freedom Front says that the JVP is bringing forward the 20th constitutional amendment with a separatist agenda.
Its media spokesperson, Mohammed Muzzamil made this comment addressing a media briefing in Colombo today.

heading: Joint Opposition charges government
content:
The Joint Opposition charges that the government has been able to improve the state revenue over the last three years by intimidating the masses through taxes.
The details were disclosed during a media conference in Colombo today (Jun 12).

heading: Colombo 7 millionaire arrested for electricity piracy
content:
Maligakanda Magistrate has ordered a wealthy resident of Colombo 7 to pay a fine of Rs. 606,487 for electricity theft.
 
He had done so by manipulating the electricity meter.
 
It was found that the suspect had carried out the fraud for a long time, causing losses to the CEB.
 
The Maligakanda Magistrate also imposed a fine of Rs. 10,000 on the suspect.

heading: Wasantha Samarasinghe makes a revelation on Singapore FTA
content:
The Central Committee Member of the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna, Wasantha Samarasinghe says two tax bills relevant to the Singapore Free Trade Agreement have been passed in Parliament after the FTA was signed.
He said this addressing a media conference at Battaramulla today (Jun 12).

heading: Windy conditions to prevail
content:
Met Department says that the prevailing windy condition is likely to continue until 11th of June over the island and in the sea areas around the island.
It’s expected to reduce gradually after 11th of June.
Showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Sabaragamuwa and Central provinces, fairly heavy falls above 50 mm can be expected at some places.
Several spells of showers will occur in Western, Southern and North-Western provinces.
Strong gusty winds up to 60 kmph can be expected over the island particularly in Western, Southern, Central, Northern, North-central and North-western provinces and Monaragala district.

heading: Clandestine affair ends in tragedy
content:
A 28-year-old woman and a 54-year-old man have committed suicide by jumping in front of a moving train in Hadiwatte in Habaraduwa.
 
They had ended their life by jumping before the Matara bound Ruhunu Kumari train last evening (Jun 14).
 
The woman, a mother of one child was a resident of Habaraduwa while the man was a resident of Ahangama.
 
He was a father of two.
 
According to information, the woman, a garment employee was having a clandestine affair with the man who was a three-wheel driver.
 
The reason for their tragic decision is yet unknown.
 
Habaraduwa Police investigate the incident.

heading: Main suspect in Kirivehera shooting still hiding
content:
The chief incumbent of the Kataragama Kirivehera, Ven. Kobawaka Dhamminda Thera is now recovering at a private hospital in Colombo.
 
The Thera was airlifted to Colombo for further treatment.
 
Meanwhile, police have widened the search operation to apprehend the main suspect in the shooting which occurred on Monday.
 
The main suspect has been identified as the former caretaker of Mahasen Devalaya, Bopegedara Asela Lakshman Bandara.
 
Meanwhile, a resolution demanding security forces should intervene to provide sufficient security for all temples throughout the country is scheduled to be passed in the Kataragama Sasanarakshaka Bala Mandalaya meeting this afternoon.
 
Meanwhile, the registrar of the organization, Ven. Kapugama Saranatissa Thera told us that they condemn the gun attack on the Kirivehera chief incumbent.
.

heading: Deputy Minister at FCID
content:
Deputy Minister Nalin Bandara has arrived at the Financial Crimes Investigation Division to give a statement on an alleged financial fraud taken place at the Ceylon Shipping Corporation during the previous regime.
The Deputy Minister had made the complaint to the FCID on this alleged financial misappropriation in July 2016.

heading: Joint Opposition to stage demonstrations against delaying elections
content:
The Joint Opposition is preparing to carry out a series of protests across the country.
Parliamentarian Dilum Amunugama said that the protests are held against delaying elections and the rise in the cost of living.
Meanwhile, Parliamentarian Bandula Gunawardena addressing a seminar in Thalangama said that they will not let the government’s new trade policy to be implemented.

heading: Health authorities warn "Influenza could spread island-wide"
content:
The health authorities say that influenza which has killed 20 persons in the South could spread to other areas of the island.
The Director of Health Education Bureau Dr. Paba Palihawadana said it is reported that the disease is now found in the Sabaragamuwa as well.
It was reported that 30 patients suffering from viral fever are being treated at Embilipitiya Hospital.

heading: SAITM Sameera arrested for fake shooting incident
content:
The Criminal Investigation Department has arrested former Chief Executive Officer of SAITM, Dr. Sameera Senaratne.
His car came under gunfire in February 2017 in Malambe and it was found it was a pre-meditated incident.
Later, CID questioned him over the incident.
He was arrested today and was remanded until 14th of June when he was produced before Kaduwela Magistrate.

heading: China delays last installment in Hambantota Project over a dispute
content:
The last installment under the agreement on the Hambantota Port with China, amounting to 584 million US Dollars has been delayed.
This is reportedly over a dispute involving infrastructure facilities.
The agreement between China Merchants Port Holdings Company and Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Ports was signed on the 29th of July last year.
292.1 million Dollars was received in December last year while a further 97.3 Million dollars was received in January.
The remaining 584 Million was due, a day before yesterday.
Sri Lanka Ports Authority Chairman Parakrama Dissanayake said that they hope to meet the conditions under the agreement soon.

heading: 24 injured in Velvetithurai clash, 7 arrested
content:
24 persons, who were injured following a clash in the Jaffna-VelVetithurai area yesterday, have been admitted to hospital for treatment.
The incident, which occurred, at a playground when a verbal argument between two groups of youths had intensified into an altercation last evening.

heading: Identities of underworld members killed in Madawala revealed
content:
Two underworld figures were killed in a shootout with Special Task Force in Madawala, Kandy this afternoon (Jun 09).
Police Media Spokesperson, Superintendent of Police, Ruwan Gunasekara says that the shootout took place at around 12.15 pm.
He said the STF set up a roadblock in Madawala area following a tip-off that a vehicle carrying underworld members is approaching the area.
The two underworld members were killed when the Police Special Task Force retaliated after the two individuals opened fire at the STF personnel.
A spokeswoman at Katugastota Hospital stated that the two individuals were already dead when they were brought to the hospital.
It has been revealed that one of the deceased was the person who operated the drug racket of underworld kingpins Makandure Madush and Angoda Lokka, in Sri Lanka and that he was also involved in collecting their ransoms.
The individual has been identified as 30-year-old Rumalsa Iresh Madushanka Nawagamuwa alias Baila, who is said to own two houses in Panagoda and Imbulgoda.
The other individual who was killed in the incident has been identified as Polwaththage Upali alias Jana who was a resident of Angoda.

heading: Sudden breakdowns: few Districts without electricity
content:
The power supply was disrupted last night in several areas due to a breakdown in the 132KW power-line from New Laxapana to Balangoda.
Media Spokesperson of the Ministry of Power and Renewable Energy Sulakshana Jayawardana said that few more hours will be required to restore power supply.

heading: A proposal from Kaduwela to remove Sujeewa Senasinghe
content:
The organization against corruption in Kaduwela has called for State Minister Sujeewa Senasinghe to be removed from all posts he holds, in addition to removing him from the UNP following his acceptance that he received money from Perpetual Treasuries.
 
Speaking at a media briefing called today (Jun 08) the former Opposition Leader of Kaduwela, Priyantha Pathberiya made these comments.
State Minister Senasinghe accepted that he conducted his election propaganda with 3 million rupees allocated by Perpetual Treasuries.
The CID noted the there were three instances where Perpetual Treasuries had allocated 3 million rupees to the State Minister.
Meanwhile addressing a media briefing held in Negombo the leader of the United National Freedom Front Maithree Gunaratne stated that JVP MP Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa was one of the individuals that received money from Perpetual Treasuries.

heading: Range Bandara criticizes media that reported his son’s accident
content:
State Minister Palitha Range Bandara expressed his views about the accident caused by his son, Yashoda Range Bandara on the 6th of this month while driving under the influence of alcohol.
Our news team attempted to contact State Minister Palitha Range Bandara he avoided speaking to media willingly or unwillingly.
When we attempted to contact the State Minister on his mobile on several occasions, we were told by his security officers that the minister is not available.
Despite the State Minister’s allegations, our reports were all based on accurate facts provided by the Police Media Division.
Police stated that the sword and the club were found inside the cab.
Additionally, Arachchikattuwa police have not yet received a complaint regarding a tense situation, as alleged by the State Minister, erupting following the accident.
Hence, it is questionable as to how the State Minister can make such allegations against media reporting.
A communiqué issued by Police Media Division yesterday at 6.10 am stated that Yashoda Range Bandara was arrested following an accident in Arachchikattuwa on the 06th of June 2018.
The communiqué noted that Yashoda Range Bandara will be produced before courts on the charges of misuse of state property, causing an accident while driving under the influence of alcohol and having a sword in his possession.
Meanwhile, Yashoda Range Bandara had several other allegations leveled against him for causing accidents on several previous occasions.
However, we had not reported that the Minister’s son was driving the vehicle on those incidents.
We would like to kindly remind State Minister Range Bandara that he should study the reported items properly prior to leveling allegations against media.
Further, despite the statement made by the Minister that parties who were affected in the previous incidents were looked after, it was revealed that no such action has been taken thus far.

heading: Police allowed to question underworld figures arrested in Kadugannawa
content:
Court has given permission to question the 3 underworld figures linked to underworld kingpin Makandure Madush while keeping them in custody.
 
The Colombo Organized Crimes Investigation Unit will now be able to question the suspects further.
 
The suspects were arrested while hiding at a hotel in Kadugannawa yesterday (Jun 13).

heading: Sujeewa should be punished, fmr. Kaduwela Opposition Leader says
content:
Former Opposition leader of Kaduwela Priyantha Pathberiya says the State Minister Sujeewa Senasinghe who accepted that he obtained money from Perpetual Treasuries should be punished.
Senasinghe accepted that he received 3 cheques worth 3 million rupees from the PTL.
Priyantha Pathberiya addressing a media conference organized by the "Organization against Corruption in Kaduwela", said today (Jun 09) if this issue is not addressed properly, the public will react to it.

heading: Suspect in murder of Karandeniya Vice Chairman arrested
content:
Police have arrested a suspect, an accomplice of Kosgoda Sujee, in the recent murder of Vice Chairman of the Karandeniya Pradeshiya Sabha, Donald Sampath.
 
Police said he was the main suspect in the shooting.
 
The suspect was arrested in Weragoda in Kahawa by the officers of Uragasmangandiya Police.

heading: Police widen probe into Karandeniya shooting
content:
Two police teams are conducting investigations to arrest the other individual who is suspected to have carried out the murder of the Vice Chairman of Karandeniya Pradeshiya Sabha, Donald Sampath.
One suspect was arrested in connection with the incident and police stated that the individual is a close accomplice of Kosgoda Sujee, who is currently overseas.
Police arrested the individual this morning (Jun 09) while he was receiving treatment at Uuragasmanhandiya Hospital.
Police Media Spokesperson, SP Ruwan Gunasekara stated that a T-56 magazine and 30 bullets found in possession of the 22-year-old suspect were also seized.
The incident took place last night when Sampatha was returning home after attending a wedding reception in Korakeena, Uuragasmanhandiya last night.
The driver of the cab has also sustained injuries in the shooting.
Initial investigations revealed that 15 shots had been fired at the cab by two individuals who had arrived on a motorbike.
It is reported that the assailants have met with an accident after their motorbike veered off the road about 100 meters away from the scene.
48-year-old Donald Sampath was elected to Karandeniya Pradeshiya Sabha from the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna at the recently held local government election.
Initial investigations have revealed that he has had a dispute with Kosgoda Sujee for some time.

heading: Businessmen cautioned over online transactions
content:
The Sri Lanka Computer Emergency Response Unit says that businessmen should be cautious when transactions are conducted through online.
Senior Engineer of CERT Roshan Chandragupta said that bank accounts to which payments are made should be verified prior to initiating transactions.
He said that SL CERT has received 10 complaints so far this year on online financial fraud.

heading: Swiss court refuses to sentence LTTE financiers
content:
13 Sri Lankan LTTE supporters charged with financing the terror outfit by extortion, fraud and other illegal means escaped jail terms when the Swiss Federal Criminal Court refused to sentence them yesterday. 
The Swiss Federal Criminal Court has given no prison terms to the 13 alleged LTTE financiers and they were either given suspended custodial sentences or acquitted. 
The court said accusations of participation in and supporting of a criminal organization did not stand and released all of the accused. 
The accused are from Switzerland, Germany, and Sri Lanka. 
Some are former members of the World Tamil Coordinating Committee, which represented the LTTE in Switzerland until 2009, and include its founder, his deputy and the person in charge of finances. 
In its judgment, the court noted that the hierarchical link between the LTTE and WTCC was not sufficiently established. 
The judges also felt there was not enough concrete proof to consider the LTTE as a criminal organization. 
While the federal prosecutor had asked for prison terms of between 18 months and six years for the accused, the court did not oblige. 
During her indictment, Juliette Noto, a federal prosecutor, described a sophisticated system used by the WTCC to raise funds largely from the Tamil community in Switzerland

heading: Losses mount, postal strike continues
content:
The Joint Postal Trade Union Front says that about 1,000 airmail sacks have piled up at the Bandaranaike International Airport in Katunayake as a result of the ongoing strike by the postal workers.
 
The Postal Department said they were earning Rs. 150 million to 180 million on a daily basis and added since the start of the strike that the Department has failed to earn any revenue.
 
The Postal Trade Unions Front launched this strike 5 days ago demanding to put in place a recruitment procedure specifically tailored for the Postal Department and to ensure job security of the Acting Assistant Post Masters.

heading: SLAS officers suspend strike
content:
The strike action launched by the Sri Lanka Administrative Service Union over a non-payment of a promised allowance has been suspended.
 
The decision was taken following a discussion with the State Minister of Public Administration.
 
The daily activities at the Department of Emigration and Immigration, Department of Registration of Persons and several other state entities were affected by the strike.

heading: Met Department issues strong winds advisory
content:
Met Department says that strong gusty winds up to 60-70kmph are likely over Northern sea areas and in Gulf of Mannar from today (Jun 19).
 
Wind speed can be increased up to 60-70 kmph at times in the sea areas extending from Puttalam to Kankesanturai via Mannar and the sea areas extending from Puttalam to Mannar can be rough or very rough at times.
 
The sea areas extending from Hambantota to Pottuvil can be rough at times as the wind speed can increase up to 60 kmph at times.
 
Other sea areas can be fairly rough at times as the wind speed can increase up to 50 kmph at times.
 
Naval and fishing communities are requested to be vigilant.

The sea areas extending from Hambantota to Pottuvil can be rough at times as the wind speed can increase up to 60 kmph at times.
 
Other sea areas can be fairly rough at times as the wind speed can increase up to 50 kmph at times.
 
Naval and fishing communities are requested to be vigilant.

heading: Wild elephant electrocuted in Wellawaya (Photos)
content:
A wild elephant was electrocuted inside a private land in Neluwagala, Wellawaya, last night (Jun 13).
 
Our correspondent said that the elephant had got contacted with a live power line that connected to a water pump.
 
Investigations are underway to ascertain whether that the power line was laid purposely to harm the animals.
 
A wildlife official said that the wild elephant was aged around 25 to 30 years.
 
Our correspondent said that human-elephant conflict has affected the Wellawaya area and many cultivated lands have been destroyed by encroaching wild elephants.
    <br /

heading: Police child molester identified
content:
The police constable who had molested a 15-year-old boy inside the Welioya Police Station was identified by the boy during an identification parade.
 
The identification parade was held at the Kebitigollawa Magistrate Court yesterday (Jun 14).
 
Then the Magistrate ordered to extend the remand custody of the policeman until 23rd of this month.
 
It was revealed that the suspect was the telephone operator at the police station.
 
The victimized teenager was arrested by police for allegedly stealing corrugated iron sheets and he had been abused by the suspect on the night of 8th of May.

heading: Buddhika Pathirana sworn in as a Deputy Minister
content:
Matara district United National Party MP Buddhika Pathirana was sworn in as the Deputy Minister of Industry and Commerce today (Jun 19).
He was sworn in before President Maithripala Sirisena.

heading: Relocation of Sinharaja elephants stopped (Photos)
content:
President advises officials to allow the two rare wild elephants to continue to remain at the Sinharaja forest reserve.
He told if it is to be done it should be done after obtaining the expert view of professionals who can conduct a scientific study.The instructions were issued during a discussion with the officials of the Mahaweli Development and Environment today (Jun 14).

 
The officials were also instructed to speed up the construction of an elephant fence to avoid those elephants encroaching the nearby human habitat of the Sinharaja forest.

heading: Date of Ramazan celebration to be decided tomorrow
content: Since the New Moon was not sighted, Grand Mosque said it will decide on the date to celebrate Ramzan after convening a meeting tomorrow.

heading: Oman suspends sending mail to Sri Lanka
content:
Oman Post has announced that it will temporarily stop receiving any mail to be sent to Sri Lanka, "due to unforeseen circumstances".
 
In a statement online, the postal agency said, "We would like to inform you that Oman Post will stop accepting P.O. mail to Sri Lanka, Colombo due to unforeseen circumstances until further notice."
 
An official from Oman Post told Times of Oman that the decision came from the Sri Lankan authorities: "We received an email that Sri Lanka Post will not be accepting any international mail until further notice."(Times of Oman)

heading: Central Province's Vice Chairman joins SLPP
content:
R. M. S. B. Rathnayake, the Vice Chairman of the Central Provincial Council says that he will support the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna in the future.
 
He is also the Chief Organizer of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party for Nuwara Eliya District.
 
Addressing a media conference in Kandy yesterday (Jun 19), he said that he took this decision to show his protest against the present government's rule.

heading: Former President says 'police inactive'
content:
Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa says the country's law and order dwindled due to the inactiveness of police.
 
He said this in response to the questions posed by the journalists following a religious event in Mattegoda, Polgasowita today (Jun 14).

heading: Postal workers to launch a fast
content:
The Joint Postal Trade Union Front says that since authorities have failed to provide solutions to their demands, it will launch an uninterrupted fast in front of the Central Mail Exchange this afternoon (Jun 20).
 
The Joint Postal Trade Union Front’s convener, Chintaka Bandara, said that a discussion will also be held this afternoon with leaders of other trade unions to obtain their support.
 
Postal employees launched the strike over several demands, including that a recruitment procedure specifically designed to cater to the needs of the Postal Department be implemented.
 
Bandara said that the Front would continue the strike until appropriate solutions to their demands were presented.

heading: New condition laid for principals of National schools
content:
The Committee on Educational Services has decided that a principal of a national school could serve at a particular school for only 8 years.
 
Earlier, the duration was 10 years.
 
A high ranking official of the Committee said that a policy will also be adopted to allow an official of the Education Administrative Service to employ at one location for only 6 years.
 
Up to now, there was no proper policy on their service duration.
 
The Education Ministry will soon call applications to fill vacancies at around 250 schools in the country.

heading: Customs detect illegally imported reptiles
content:
Sri Lanka Customs officers at the Bandaranayake International Airport's Cargo Village detected 32 chameleons or lizards sent from Australia illegally.
 
The reptiles were concealed in a CPU in 4 bags.
 
The goods have been sent from Australia via Singapore to an address in Kalutara.
 
However, since no one came to clear the goods, the authorities have checked the address and it was found to be a fake one.
 
Then a decision was made to open the package.
 
The animal quarantine officer has recommended sending back the reptiles. 
 
Investigations are being carried out jointly by the Directorate of Revenue and Services Katunayake and Bio-Diversity Control Unit of Customs.

heading: Deputy Minister to appear at FCID
content:
Deputy Minister of Law and Order, Nalin Bandara who assumed duties yesterday (Jun 14) has been summoned to the Financial Crime Investigation Division.
 
That is to obtain a statement.
 
He is scheduled to arrive at the FCID to give a statement for a complaint lodged earlier.

heading: An accomplice of Wele Suda arrested with drugs and weapons
content:
Police Narcotic Bureau has arrested a close accomplice of jailed Wele Suda with 2kg of heroin in Maviththara, Piliyandala.
 
The estimated value of the narcotic haul was Rs. 25 million.
 
The find was made when the suspect's house was searched following a tip-off.
 
The PNB sleuths also found the locally made revolver, a repeater gun, and 16 live ammunition.
 
The 35-year-old suspect has been carried out drug trafficking for a long period of time, the probe revealed.

heading: 2 more suspects including a woman arrested over Kirivehera shooting
content: Police Spokesperson says 2 more suspects including a woman have been arrested for aiding and conspiring shooting of the chief incumbent of the Kirivehera in Kataragama.

heading: Two women hacked to death in Welipillewa
content:
Police have found the bodies of 2 women, who were hacked to death in Waga in Wlipillewa, Hanwella.
Police were tipped-off on these deaths.
The mother was aged 68 and her daughter was aged 38.
Police suspect that the husband of the second woman might have committed the murders last night.
When police reach the house, they found the 4-month-old daughter of her and she was hospitalized by the police.
Hanwella police are probing the incident.

heading: Yashoda Range Bandara granted bail
content: State Minister Palitha Range Bandara's son Yashoda Range Bandara, who was remanded over an accident, has been granted bail by Chilaw Magistrate.

heading: Stay order preventing action against GR extended
content: The Court of Appeal has extended stay order preventing action against former Defence Secretary Gotabhaya Rajapaksa under the Public Property Act, till the petition is heard.

heading: A/L students assault teacher
content:
A teacher of a leader school in Anamaduwa has been admitted to Anamaduwa District Hospital after he was assaulted by the A/L students of the school.
The students have assaulted the teacher after he had punished a student while teaching at a classroom.
However, 2 students have also admitted to hospital alleging that they were assaulted by the teacher.

heading: Hindu Affairs removed from Deputy Minister Masthan's portfolio
content:
Minister D.M. Swaminathan says that Deputy Minister Kader Masthan's portfolios were gazetted without Hindu Affairs.
 
The Minister said that he discussed the matter with the President over the phone and then the President informed him about it.
 
Masthan was recently sworn in as the Deputy Minister of Resettlement, Rehabilitation, North Development and Hindu Religious Affairs.
 
Several factions raised objections for giving Hindu Religious Affairs to the Vanni district SLFP MP.

heading: Australian mother and daughter die in Southern expressway accident
content:
Careless driver shatters Monica's dream"An Australian mother and her daughter have died following a motor accident near 65th-kilometre post along the Southern Expressway.
The accident had occurred at around 5 am.
 
A van which was heading towards Galle had collided with a container which was parked on the roadside due to a mechanical issue.
 
Four Australian nationals travelling by the van and the lorry driver were injured in the accident.
 
They were admitted to Nagoda Hospital, Kalutara and Elpitiya Hospital.
 
Later, Colin Lewis Monica, aged 37 and Colin Poppy Gabriel, aged 4 years and 5 months had succumbed to their injuries.

heading: Inter-University Students' march comes under teargas attack
content:
Police fired teargas and water cannon to disperse an anti-SAITM march organized by the Inter-University Students' Federation at the Parliament round-about.
 
Police said a traffic congestion has been created in and around Rajagiriya as a result of this action.
 
The undergraduates are demanding to abolish the SAITM.

heading: Gnanasara Thera's appeal to be heard today
content:
Minister of Buddha Sasana, Gamini Jayawickreme Perera says that he hopes to meet the President today (Jun 19) to discuss the imprisonment of Venerable Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thera.
Meanwhile, the appeal filed by Bodu Bala Sena General Secretary, requesting his release is scheduled to be heard before Homagama High Court today.
The attorneys handed the petition to Homagama Magistrate court on 15th of this month.
Sinhala Ravaya General Secretary Venerable Maagalkandey Sudatta Thera said that he felt strongly that the Ven. Gnanasara will get bail soon.

heading: Date fixed to hear Gotabhaya's appeal petition
content:
Court of Appeal today (Jun 19) fixed the dates to hear an appeal petition filed by 8 accused including former Defence Secretary Gotabhaya Rajapaksa to acquit them from the Avant-Garde court case.
 
State Counsel representing the Attorney General's Department requested the court to fix a date to consider the petition.
 
Accordingly, justices Achala Singappuli and Arjun Obeysekera ordered to call the case again on 2nd of next month.
 
This case has been filed accusing them of incurring a loss of Rs. 11,400 million to the state by allowing to operate a floating armoury to Avant-Garde.

heading: New petrol variety to enter market
content:
The Ministry of Petroleum Resources Development says a new variety of petrol will be introduced to the market to be used for motorcycles and three-wheelers.
 
Minister Arjuna Ranatunga said required testing is being done these days.
 
He said that the new petrol variety will transfer an economic benefit to the users.

heading: VAT on doctors' consultation fee, channeling fee and professional charges removed
content: Finance Minister Mangala Samaraweera says that the Cabinet decided to remove 15% VAT on doctors' consultation fee, channeling fee and professional charges from 1st of July.

heading: Norway to help Sri Lanka map marine resources
content:
The Norwegian research vessel Dr. Fridtjof Nansen will arrive in Sri Lanka on Thursday for a 26-day research journey around the island.
 
The research vessel will assist Sri Lanka in mapping the country’s marine resources.
 
Meanwhile, the State Minister of the Norwegian Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Jens Frølich Holte will arrive also in Sri Lanka tomorrow, the Norwegian Embassy in Colombo said.
 
The State Minister’s visit coincides with the arrival of the research ship.
 
The State Minister will also meet senior politicians, ministers and members of civil society in Sri Lanka.
 
The State Minister will also pay a short visit to Jaffna, where he will learn more about the outcomes of the long-term Norwegian support to livelihood activities in the resettled areas.

heading: Former chief of staff of President & STC chairman further remanded
content:
Former Presidential Chief of staff I.K. Mahanama and former chairman of State Timber Corporation P. Dissanayake further remanded until 26th of June.
 
They are in remand custody after they were apprehended by the investigators of Bribery Commission for allegedly soliciting a bribe of Rs. 20 million from an Indian businessman.

heading: Mother & daughter, unable to pay hospital bill stranded in Chennai
content:
A mother and her daughter who have unable to settle the hospital bill following the daughter was undergone surgery are stranded at a private hospital in Chennai.
 
The mother told us that the hospital authorities before the surgery said that the estimated the cost of the operation would be 750,000 rupees.
 
However, after the surgery was done, the hospital has issued a bill of Rs. 900,000.
 
The 45-year-old mother and her 15-year-old daughter are residents of Parasangaswewa in Anuradhapura.

heading: Medical practitioners await a decision on Influenza injection
content:
The Ministry of Health says that the recommendation to be given by the special committee appointed to advise on the injection to be administered to control the Influenza virus is yet to be released.
 
The Secretary to the Ministry of Health, Janaka Sugathadasa said that as a consequence there has been a delay in making an injection available to government hospitals.
 
To date, 25 deaths have been reported due to the spread of influenza in the Southern Province, 18 of those victims were children.
 
Most recently a 4-month-old baby died of the virus at Karapitiya Teaching Hospital last Sunday.
 
Meanwhile, Southern Health Director, Dr. G. Wijesuriya said that on a daily basis approximately 60 patients are seeking treatment from government hospitals for the disease.
 
Additionally, according to Sabaragamuwa Provincial Health Director, Dr. Athula Kannangara on a daily basis, approximately 10 patients seek treatment from government hospitals in the province.

heading: A group of postal workers returns to work, police protection given
content:
The Postmaster General Rohana Abeyrathna says that all post offices in the country were opened today (Jun 19) and most of the workers reported to duty.
 
He further said that police protection has been provided for those workers.
 
However, Chinthaka Bandara, the convener of the Joint Postal Trade Union Front, said that the strike will continue on today, making it 9 days since the launch.
 
Meanwhile, over 500,000 pieces of mail have been accumulating at post offices including the Central Mail Exchange in Colombo, as delivery of mail has been suspended during the strike.
 
Trade unions stated that over 150 million rupees in revenue per day, was lost by the Department due to the strike.

heading: SDIG Nanayakkara further remanded
content:
Mount Lavinia Magistrate today (Jun 10) ordered to re-remanded former Mount Lavinia Crimes OIC Tissa Sugathapala and former Senior DIG Prasanna Nanayakkara till 3rd of July.
 
They are in remand in connection with the killing of Sunday Leader former editor-in-chief Lasantha Wickramatunga.
 
They are accused of concealing of evidence.
 
The case was taken up before Mount Lavinia Chief Magistrate Mohammed Mihail.
 
The court also gave permission to the Criminal Investigation Department to record a statement from the SDIG inside the prison.
 
The CID also informed the court that they will record a statement from former IGP Jayantha Wickramaratne on 22nd of this month, relating to this incident.

heading: Striking postal workers urged to report to work
content:
The Postmaster General Rohana Abeyratne says that employees of the Postal Department who fail to report to work today (Jun 19) will be considered as having vacated their posts.
 
Issuing a communiqué, the Postmaster General said that holiday leave for employees had been cancelled.
 
He said that it is the responsibility of the Staff Officers for providing facilities and security, to open and operate the post offices.
 
Police assistance will also be made available.
 
The Postmaster General also stressed that the administration is no longer accountable for the security of temporary staff, casual, substitutes, acting and permanent workers who do not return to work today.
 
The strike action launched by the Joint Postal Trade Union Front in protest against the recruitment process has entered into its second week.

heading: IP Neomal and Lamahewa further remanded
content:
IP Neomal Rangajeewa and suspended Prisons Commissioner Emil Ranjan Lamahewa have been further remanded till 3rd of July.
They were remanded after being produced before Colombo Additional Magistrate today (Jun 19). 
They are in remand custody over Welikada Prison riots which saw 27 prison inmates were killed.

heading: Anti-SAITM march blocks roads
content: An anti-SAITM march organized by the Inter-University Student's Federation has created a traffic congestion in Rajagiriya.

heading: 25,000 families in Monaragala without toilets
content:
It is reported that 25,000 families in Monaragala district are without toilets.
 
This was revealed during an event to coincide with the "Gamperaliya Programme", which was held at the Monaragala District Secretariat under the patronage of Finance Minister Mangala Samaraweera.
 
The Minister promised to allocate funds to address the issue.

heading: Film Corporation takes over distribution of films
content: Chairman of National Film Corporation says that the distribution of films which was handled by four private sector companies will be vested with the National Film Corporation.

heading: MR to take over SLPP leadership
content:
Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa will take over the leadership of the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna at the second annual convention of the party to be held in November, this year.
