MP Rohitha Abeygunawardene disclosed this addressing the media at Battaramulla today (Jun 18).

heading: Wild elephant attack kills two in Panama
content:
Two persons have died due to being attacked by a wild elephant in Panama, Amparai.
 
Police said that the victims were fishermen and they were on their way toward Panama tank when the tragedy struck.
 
They succumbed to their injuries after being admitted to Akkaraipattu Hospital.
 
The victims, aged 56 and 61, were residents of the area.

heading: MR says Udayanga Weeratunga will return
content:
Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa says that former ambassador to Russia, Udayanga Weeratunga will return to the island soon following requests made by him and several others.
He revealed this responding to questions posed by journalists in Anuradhapura today.

heading: Public entities incur Rs. 50bn loss
content:
Speaker Karu Jayasuriya says that according to the reports of the Finance Ministry, in 2017, the state entities had caused a loss of over Rs. 50 billion.
 
He said this addressing a seminar organized by the Committee on Public Accounts, for journalists held in Colombo yesterday (Jun 18).
 
The Auditor General Gamini Wijesinghe also attended the event.

heading: Warning to striking postal workers
content:
Post-Master General says the postal workers who do not report to work will be considered as vacated their posts.
The postal workers are engaging in a strike for almost a week now.

heading: Appeal of Gnanasara Thera postponed
content:
The hearing of the appeal filed by jailed General Secretary of Bodu Bala Sena, Venerable Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thera was postponed to 22nd of this month.
 
Our correspondent said that when the appeal was taken up at the Homagama High Court, the judge decided to postpone it due to the non-attendance of representatives from the Attorney General's Department.
 
Meanwhile, a group of Buddhist monks from several organizations commenced an agitation campaign in front of the Pettah Bo tree, against the jailing of Gnanasara Thera.

heading: Ivor Dennis passes away
content: Veteran singer and musician Ivor Dennis passed away today (Jun 18) at the age of 86.He had died at his home in Seeduwa.The final rites will be taken place on Wednesday.Dennis is regarded as the singer who took forward the musical legacy of Sunil Shantha.

heading: Speeding car kills policeman
content:
One police officer was killed and another was injured when a speeding car veered off the road in the Nildiya Uyana area on the Kandy - Jaffna main road, knocked them down.
 The policemen were on night patrol duty. 
Two others who were onboard the car were also injured.
 
It is reported that the driver of the car has fallen asleep on the wheel, causing this accident.
 
The victim was a 49-year-old, police sergeant, a resident of Tittawellagoda in Matale.
 
The driver of the car was arrested following the mishap.

heading: Monks engage in satyagraha over imprisonment of Gnanasara Thera
content:
Several groups of monks affiliated with different organizations staged a sit-in protest against the imprisonment of Ven. Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thera, in front of the Bodhi Tree at Colombo Pettah this afternoon (Jun 18).
 
Meanwhile, another group of monks from Sinhala Ravaya were not allowed to meet the jailed monk by Welikada prison officials today.
At the same time, Pavidi Handa also convened a media conference to express their views on the imprisonment of Ven. Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thera.
Meanwhile, the National Intellectual Sangha Council issuing a media communique pointed out that President Maithripala Sirisena should intervene to give a general amnesty to the jailed monk.

heading: SriLankan Airlines makes a request
content:
SriLankan Airlines says since the planned renovation activities of the Bandaranaike International Airport will be delayed, there is no need for the outbound passengers to come 4 hours early to their departure time.
 
Yesterday, the airline requested the passengers to arrive early to minimize congestion at the departure counters.

heading: Kelaniya undergraduate electrocuted
content:
A 3rd year undergraduate at the Kelaniya University has died of electrocution.
He was electrocuted when he attempted to pluck fruits using an iron bar inside the university premises.
The victim was aged 23 years.

heading: SLHRC probes Jaffna police shooting
content:
The Human Rights Commission of Sri Lanka has initiated a special investigation into the death of a person during a clash between two groups at Mallakam in Jaffna, last night.
It is reported that several SLHRC officials attached to the Jaffna office inspected the clash site and recorded statements from several factions.
The police firing took place after two officers of Chunnakam police on road patrolling had intervened to settle the clash between the two groups.
Police said that they opened fire after a member of one of the groups attacked them with a sharp object.

heading: Two other suspects remanded over Kirivehera shooting
content:
The two suspects who were arrested in Kataragama yesterday over the Kirivehera shooting incident were remanded until 20th of this month today (Jun 18).
 
They were remanded when they were produced before Tissamaharama Magistrate.
 
With this altogether 5 suspects are in remand custody.

heading: Small boy drowns in Walawe River
content:
A 10-year-old boy who had gone to bath in Walawe River, in Rideegama, Ambalantota, with a group of friends, is reported missing.
 
The parents of the child had informed the police of this incident which has had taken place last evening (Jun 21).
 
Search operations are underway to find the boy.

heading: Scanner used to detect metal recovered in Kobeigane
content:
Police have arrested a person in Kobeigane, Kurunegala along with a scanner which is used to detect hidden metal.
 
The suspect was arrested during a raid last night.
 
The scanner, which was produced in the USA is reportedly could be used to detect hidden metal objects underground.
 
The 29-year-old suspect is a resident of Polpithigama.

heading: A senior immigration officer arrested with gold worth 36 million rupees
content: A senior immigration officer at the Katunayaka airport was arrested along with 6 kilo grams of gold worth 36 million rupees.The customs stated that the immigration officer was arrested when he attempted to smuggle the gold out of the airport.The suspect is currently being further questioned by the air port custom officers.

heading: Postal workers to meet political parties
content:
The striking postal workers are planning to meet the representatives of the political parties to discuss their issues.
 
A group of representatives from the unions will visit the party head offices to meet the political party members.

heading: New Deputy Ministers meet Maha Nayaka Thera's
content:
Newly appointed Deputy Minister of Law and Order Nalin Bandara says the United National Party candidate will contest the next Presidential Election under a common alliance.
The Deputy Ministers, Ajith Mannapperuma, Lucky Jayawardene, Nalin Bandara and Edward Gunasekera paid a courtesy call on the chief prelates of the Malwathu and Asgiri chapters yesterday and Bandara spoke to the media following that.

heading: Matara robbery - Case to be informed to court
content:
Police that the suspects involved in the Matara robbery will be produced before courts today (Jun 23).
Police Media Spokesperson SP Ruwan Gunasekara stated that the mastermind of the robbery Tharaka Perera Wijesekera alias Kosgoda Tharaka is still receiving treatment at the Karapitiya hospital ICU along with his brother.
Kosgoda Tharaka and his brother Mahesh exchanged fire with police and, the two suspects who received injuries during the shooting were hospitalized.
A police officer was killed, and four others including 2 policemen were injured in the shootout when the thieves broke into a jewellery
shop in Matara last morning.
Subsequent to a search operation, police arrested Chamara Indrajith of Maligatenna in Veyangoda.
Two motorcycles and two automatic weapons were also seized by police.Police said it is found that 6 men had involved in the Chicago-type robbery and 4 of them were arrested.

heading: JVP urge to probe leopard killing
content:
The Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna has demanded an investigation into the killing of a leopard by the villagers at Ambalkulam in Kilinochchi yesterday (Jun 21).
 
MP Bimal Rathnayake said that authorities should take action to have the villagers who killed the animal arrested without delay.
 
10 residents were hospitalized after they were attacked by the leopard and, residents said they killed the animal in self-defence.
 
Meanwhile, Wildlife Deputy Minister, Palitha Thevarapperuma told us the issue will be investigated by the Ministry.

heading: Suspected serial murderer gunned down in Hikkaduwa
content:
A 30-year-old person was gunned down in Wewala, Hikkaduwa this morning while he was cycling along the Galle - Colombo main road.
 
Police said the deceased was connected to a number of murders in the area.
 
The shooting took place at around 7.45 am and the gunmen had arrived on a motorcycle.
 
He died upon admission to Arachchikanda Hospital.
 
The victim, Inasi Chaminda, was a resident of Meetiyagoda.

heading: Postal strike causes a daily loss of Rs. 150mn
content:
Post-Master General Rohana Abeyrathna says that due to the trade union action of postal employees, the department suffers a loss of around 150 million rupees daily.
He further said that they hope to have a discussion with the trade unions tomorrow.
However, the Convenor of the Joint Postal Trade Unions Front said that no positive response has been received for their demands.

heading: Sooriyawewa protesters to launch a fast
content:
Residents who were denied compensation for their plots of lands that were acquired to construct the 100-feet road in Sooriyawewa say they will launch a fast unto death campaign from this afternoon (Jun 22).
 
The affected residents have been protesting in front of the Sooriyawewa Divisional Secretariat for the last three days and are demanding compensation.
 
The protesters said the authorities are not responding to their demands and they are denied of the compensation for the last 5 years.

heading: Matara robbery : Police arrest Kosgoda Tharaka’s mother, 3 suspects at Karapitiya ICU
content:
Police have arrested the mother of underworld gangster 'Kosgoda Tharaka' after it was found that one of the motorcycles which were abandoned following the Matara jewellery shop heist, was registered under her name.
 
Police have also found a locally made gun, which could use 9mm bullets, from her home in Kosgoda.
 
She was arrested by a police team from the Kosgoda police.
 
Meanwhile, police constable Suranga Pradeep Weerasinghe who died at Matara General Hospital, after being shot at by the robbers, has been promoted to the rank of Sergeant.
 
Three policemen and two civilians including a woman were injured when police and around 10 robbers exchange fire at the heart of Matara Town, this morning (Jun 22).
 
Investigations found that around 10 robbers had arrived on motorcycles, wearing face masks at around 10.25 am to rob the jewellery shop.
 
They had entered the jewellery shop and ransacked the shop at gunpoint.
 
However, a group of armed policemen had arrived in the scene and they had engaged with the robbers.
 
The drama saw panicked people running here and there in the Matara Town.
 
Then the robbers had fled the area abandoning two motorcycles, two firearms, and several live bullets.
 
Police also launched a search operation to apprehend the suspects and one of the suspects was found while hiding inside a nearby house.
 
Meanwhile, three more suspects were arrested while they were receiving treatment at the Karapitiya Teaching Hospital.
 
Police said Kosgoda Tharaka, his brother, and another suspect are among them.
 
All those suspects are receiving treatment in the Intensive Care Unit of the hospital under police protection.

heading: Entrepreneurs should be encouraged, says President
content:
President Maithripala Sirisena says just like credit schemes are introduced to uplift the entrepreneurs, steps should be taken to avoid importation of the same goods produced by the local manufacturing community.
 
The President said this addressing an event at the BMICH yesterday (Jun 22) where a series of loan schemes were introduced under the "Enterprise Sri Lanka" programme.

heading: Operation to capture Sinharaja elephants stopped
content: Deputy Minister Palitha Thewarapperuma says that the operation to capture 2 elephants in Sinharaja has been suspended following the orders of the President.

heading: Supreme Court orders AG to draft charges against Ranjan Ramanayake
content:
The Supreme Court ordered the Attorney General to file a draft charge sheet before June 30th, against deputy minister Ranjan Ramanayake for being in contempt of court.
The case was taken before Chief Justice Priyasath Dep and Justice Murdu Fernando this morning.
Additional Solicitor General Priyantha Navaana who made submissions before Court on behalf of the Attorney General said that all Supreme Court judges  have already observed that deputy minister Ranjan Ramanayake’s statement was, at a glance, in contempt of court
The bench of Supreme Court judges including the chief justice ordered the Attorney General to draft a rule document before June 30th asking Ranjan Ramanayake to show cause as to why he was not punished after being in contempt of court.
After a meeting with the Prime Minister on August 21st last year, deputy minister, Ranjan Ramanayake said, to media, that the majority of judges and attorneys-at-law are corrupt.
Later, MaagalKande Sudaththa Thera and a retired air force officer, Sunil Perera filed a petition against the deputy minister with the Supreme Court.

heading: Matara robbery : CCTV footage
content:
Kosgoda Tharaka and 2 underworld members arrested while being treated at Karapitiya Hospital....Police have widened the operations to apprehend the robbers who had broken into a jewellery shop in Matara at around 10 am today (Jun 22).
 
Police said around 10 masked men who arrived on motorcycles had entered the jewellery shop forcefully and ransacked it after threatening the staff.
 
However, after being informed through the emergency hotline, a police team arrived at the scene, which led to a gunfight.
 
Three policemen, a woman, and a bus conductor sustained injuries in the crossfire.
 
One of the policemen succumbed to his injuries at the Matara General Hospital.
 
Meanwhile, the thieves had fled the scene during the chaotic situation.
 
But police found two firearms and two motorcycles abandoned in the road.
 
Later, one of the suspects in the incident Chamara Indrajith, was captured by the police.
 
He was a resident of Veyangoda.
 
Meanwhile, sources say that three injured youths with gunshot injuries have found nearby the Karapitiya Hospital.
 
They are believed to be the members of the robber gang.
 
Police said one of the suspects was underworld member Kosgoda Tharaka.
 
The other two are also underworld members (one of them was Tharaka's brother), the Police Spokesperson said.

heading: School head prefect dies after being assaulted by a student group (Photos)
content:
A 16-year-old schoolboy at a leading school in Chilaw had died while being treated at the National Hospital in Colombo after he was assaulted by a group of students.
 
The Grade 11 student died early this morning (Jun 23).
 
Our correspondent said the victim, who was the head prefect of the school was assaulted while he was returning home in the night of 15th of this, after attending a religious event held at the school.
 
The student who had been assaulted mercilessly first admitted to Chilaw Hospital and then transferred to National Hospital, Colombo in critical condition.
 
Police arrested one of the fellow students of the school on 16th and then arrested two more students on 17th.
 
The student who was arrested earlier was remanded until 26th while the other two students were granted bail.

heading: One dead after police open fire in Jaffna clash
content: A person was killed as police opened fire during an attempt to contain a riot that broke out between two groups in Thellippalai in Jaffna .An OIC in the area said that the clash took place last night  near Our Lady of Perpetual Sucker church in Maallaakam, Theli-palai.The riot broke out over a private dispute.Reports state that when police attempted to intervene, a  group present at the site had tried to attack the police. Preliminary investigations revealed that a person was fatally shot as police fire arm went off . The person killed was a 31 year old resident of  Mallaakam.

heading: Update: Main suspect in Matara jewellery shop theft arrested
content:
Police have arrested the main suspect involved in the theft of a jewellery shop in Matara Town this morning.
The suspect Chamara Indrajith is a resident of Veyangoda.
Police said that 10 men in motorcycles had arrived in the jewellery shop and police had arrived little later.
It led to a gun fight in which 3 policemen and two civilians were injured.
One of the policemen died at the hospital.
Update: Friday, June 22, 2018, 12.25 pm..................................................................Policeman killed in Matara shootoutA policeman, who was among the 3 policemen injured in the shootout during the attempted jewellery shop theft in Matara has succumbed to his injuries.
He was among the 3 policemen admitted to Matara General Hospital, after being shot at by the robbers.
Meanwhile, the Police Spokesperson said that two motorcycles and an automatic gun used by robbers were taken into police custody.
Update: Friday, June 22, 2018, 11.55 am................................................................Police thwart the robbery of a jewelry shop in Matara, robbers open fire at policeThree policemen and two civilians were injured when a group of robbers opened fire at police in Matara.A woman was among the injured.
 
The robbers were attempting to break into a jewellery shop.
 
An eyewitness said that a gun battle erupted between the police and the gang who tried to rob the jewellery shop.
 
The injured were admitted to Matara General Hospital.The robbers had fled the area and a senior police official said that several teams have been deployed to apprehend the criminals.

heading: Mahesh Nissanka granted baill (Photos)
content: Journalist Mahesh Nissanka and his eldest son who were remanded over an alleged assault were granted bail by Mahara Magistrate.

heading: Kilinochchi leopard killers to be arrested
content: The Kilinochchi Magistrate Court has ordered the police to examine the video footage of killing a leopard and arrest the suspects who killed the leopard by beating it.

heading: Matara robbery suspect dies in police fire
content:
Chamara Indrajith who are arrested following the jewellery shop burglary in Matara town was killed in police fire last night (Jun 22).
 
Police Media Spokesperson, SP Ruwan Gunasekera said the suspect guided a team of policemen to locate a bag hidden at Kiralakele in Matara and in the process he had attempted to throw a hand grenade at the police team.
 
Then police had opened fire, killing the suspect.

heading: Panadura, Moratuwa private buses strike
content: Panadura - Colombo (100) and Moratuwa - Colombo (101), private bus operators commenced a strike this morning.

heading: Postal Employees on strike head to Colombo today
content: The joint postal services trade union states that Postal Employees currently on strike will engage in a protest march this morning in Colombo.They are scheduled to gather near the Central mail exchange and march towards Fort Railway station.Subsequently the protestors will hand over a letter to the Presidential Secretariat demanding solutions.

heading: The main suspect along with 2 others who shot at Kirivehera Chief Incumbent have been remanded
content: Three persons responsible for the shooting that took place at Kataragama Kirivehera have been remanded until the 20th of  this month after being produced before Tissamahaaraama Magistrate yesterday.  As a consequence of the shooting Chief Incumbent Venerable Kobavaka Dhamminda Thera was injured.Amongst those arrested, was the main suspect, a former caretaker at Mahasen Devaalaya,  Bohpegedera Asela Lakshman Bandaara.Kataragama police said that the other two suspects who were arrested yesterday are being detained for further questioning.initial investigations have revealed that the former custodian, had been given a 3 million rupee contract to have the chief incumbent of Katharagama – Kiriwehera, shot at.At the time of arrest, police recovered ammunition, a firearm and a locally manufactured gun, believed to have been used in the crime.Chief Incumbent Venerable Kobavaka Dhamminda Thera, who was injured in the shooting on the 12th of this month, is currently receiving  treatment  at a private hospital in Colombo.

heading: Two killed in Kandana train accident
content:
Two persons, a motorcyclist and a pillion rider were killed when their motorcycle collided with a goods train in Peralanda, Kandana last afternoon.
It was reported that the motorcycle had entered the level crossing disregarding the signals.
The deceased were residents of Kelaniya.

heading: Gnanasara Thera released on bail
content:
Ven. Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thera who was jailed for threatening the wife of missing journalist Prageeth Ekanaligoda has been released on bail.
 
The Homagama Magistrate gave the order a short while ago.
 
Our correspondent said that he was released on two Rs. 500,000 worth personal sureties and the Magistrate also ordered to impound his passport.
 
The Thera was jailed on 14th of this month.

heading: Three High Court Judges appointed to hear high profile frauds
content:
Chief Justice Priyasath Dep has appointed three High Court judges to the special High Court which will hear high-profile financial fraud and corruption cases.
 
The special Trial-at-Bar will comprise three High Court Judges Sampath Abeykoon, Sampath Wijeratne and Champa Janaki Rajaratne, the Government Information Department said.
 
The Cabinet had given its approval to establish three anti-corruption High Courts.
 
This is the first special High Court established within the Hulftsdorp Court complex to try high-profile cases.
 
The new cases are to be heard from July 15.

heading: Deputy Minister Masthan meets President’s Secretary
content:
A special meeting was held between Deputy Minister K. Kader Masthan and secretary to the President at the Presidential Secretariat this afternoon (Jun 14).
 
It is reported that the meeting is focused on removing the subject of Hindu Religious Affairs from his purview.
 
Masthan was recently sworn in as the Deputy Minister of Resettlement, Rehabilitation, North Development and Hindu Religious Affairs.
 
Several factions raised objections for giving Hindu Religious Affairs to the Vanni district SLFP MP.
 
UNP MP Wadiwel Suresh, Northern Provincial Councilor, M. K. Sivajilingam and TELO and PLOTE organizations objected to the appointment.
 
Minister Mano Ganeshan also said that he drew the attention of the President to the appointment.

heading: Former President reveals a new betrayal by government
content:
Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa says that the government has produced a draft bill in parliament to amend the Mutual Assistance in Criminal Matters Act No. 25 of 2002.
 
The former President in his communiqué further emphasizes that the structure of the initial act will change significantly with many clauses being changed through the new draft bill.
The prevailing law is only applicable to nations while the amendment will facilitate the infiltration of organizations such as the International Criminal Court.
The former President highlights that the proposed amendment is coupled with the Office on Missing Persons Act which was previously introduced by the present government and the Act which was brought forward to enforce the International Convention for the Protection of All Persons from Enforced Disappearance, in Sri Lanka.
Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa in his communiqué further notes that the draft bill will facilitate the implementation of the provisions in the International Convention for the Protection of All Persons from Enforced Disappearance Act No 5 of 2018.
A mechanism should be in place to obtain evidence from Sri Lanka for a case that is being heard in another country regarding crimes that are said to have taken place in Sri Lanka.
Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa in his communiqué thus stresses that the objective of the proposed amendments to the Mutual Assistance in Criminal Matters Act of 2002 is in fact, to pave way for such a mechanism.
Meanwhile, the former president stated that the general public will respond in the near future to the suppressive programme adopted by the government to imprison leaders in the opposition.
The former president made this comment addressing a ceremony at the Jumma Mosque in Mukarawewa – Horowpathaana this morning.

heading: Sarath N. Silva’s FR petition dismissed
content:
The Fundament Rights petition filed against Provincial Council Elections (Amendment) Act before Supreme Court by former Chief Justice Sarath N. Silva has been rejected.
 
It was dismissed by the majority of a 3-member bench, even without granting leave to proceed.
 
The bench comprised of Chief Justice Priyasath Dep, Justice Nalin Perera and Justice Buwaneka Aluwihare.
Former Chief Justice Sarath N. Silva filed his Fundamental Rights petition on 28th of September last year.
He requested the Supreme Court to issue a decree announcing the manner in which the Provincial Council Elections (Amendment) Act was passed in Parliament in last May, was illegitimate.
The petition by Sarath N. Silva noted that passing the draft bill by a two-thirds majority in Parliament without holding a referendum is contravened to the Constitution.
The Speaker, the Attorney General and the Chairman of the Election Commissioner were named as respondents in the petition.
Announcing the decree in open Court, Chief Justice, Priyasath Dep said that the petition is rejected without granting leave to proceed on the majority decision of the three-member bench of Judges.

heading: Former Minister talks about a misery
content:
Former Minister and Senior Vice Chairman of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party says that it is unfortunate that other members of the SLFP are still stuck with the government.
The former Minister said that addressing a seminar titled, "Nidahase Vedikawa", which was organized by the Group of 16 in Matale.
Addressing the seminar, MP Sudharshini Fernandopulle said without accepting those who are willing to join the opposition, the United National Party could not be expelled.

heading: Elle Gunawansa Thera says "Election is needed"
content:
Ven. Elle Gunawansa Thera says it is highly important to call for an election soon.
The Thera said this addressing the Colombo District Conference of the Sri Lanka Mahajana Party held at the New Town Hall yesterday.
Former Minister Basil Rajapaksa and MP Udaya Gammanpila also attended this event.

heading: Important message for airport passengers
content:
SriLankan Airlines urges the passengers to arrive at the airport four hours prior to their departure time effective from tomorrow (Jun 18).
The airline said this is mainly due to a series of renovation work expected to commence shortly at the emigration counter areas at the departure terminal of the BIA.
For more information, the passengers are urged to check www.srilankan.com or call center 1979 from any telecommunication provider.

heading: Sri Lanka obtains loans worth over Rs. 1029 billion from China
content:
It has been revealed that Sri Lanka has obtained $ 8.2 billion or Rs. billion from China as loans for the last 12 years.
Those loans have been obtained from China Development Bank and China EXIM Bank for large-scale projects.
Main project loans:
Hambantota Port : Rs. 188bn
Norochcholai Coal Plant : Rs. 72bn
Southern Expressway Extention (Matara - Beliatte) : Rs. 300bn
These details were revealed by the Finance Ministry following a request made through the Right to Information Act.

heading: Rs. 3 million contract to shoot Kirivehera chief incumbent
content:
Investigations reveal that the caretaker of Mahasen Devala Bopegedera Asela Lakshman Bandara has given a Rs. 3 million contract to shoot at the chief incumbent of Kirivehera Ven. Kobawaka Dhamminda Thera.
Police Spokesperson SP Ruwan Gunasekera said it will be further probed based on the bank details of the suspects who are in police custody.
Already 5 suspects along with 2 firearms are in police custody over the incident.
2 suspects were arrested in Kataragama today and the main suspect was arrested along with 2 other suspects in Pepiliyana yesterday.

heading: Requests galore seeking Ven. Gnanasara's release
content:
Minister of Justice and Prison Reforms, Thalatha Athukorala stated that the General Secretary of the Bodu Bala Sena, Venerable Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thera will have to comply with the Prisons Ordinance.
Meanwhile, when we inquired from the Prisons Media Spokesperson, Thushara Upuldeniya regarding the recent reports that Venerable Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thera is suffering from abdominal pain, he stated that such a condition was not diagnosed when the Thera underwent a medical examination.
Meanwhile, several factions made requests today as well to release Venerable Galagoda Aththe Gnanasaara Thera.
The Sinhala Ravaya Organization and the Bodu Bala Sena visited the chief prelate of the Ramagngna Chapter, Most Venerable Napane Pemasiri Thera and the Registrar of Asigiri Chapter, Venerable Medagama Dhammananda Thera to inform them about the imprisonment of Venerable Gnanasara Thera.
Furthermore, they also paid a courtesy call on the Anu Nayake Thera of Malwathu Chapter, Most Venerable Dimbulkumbure Sri Wimaladhamma Thera.
Further, the Sri Rohana Maha Sanga Sabha of the Syamopalika Wanshika Maha Nikaya wrote to the President today requesting the release of Venerable Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thera.
An Adishtana Pooja was also held yesterday in Mahiyangana town against the imprisonment of Ven. Gnanasara Thera.
Subsequent to the Adishtana Pooja, a plea to gods was also made at the Mahiyangana Sri Sumana Saman Devala.

heading: Main suspect and twins involved in Kirivehera shooting arrested
content:
The main suspect along with twins involved in the shooting of chief incumbent of Katharagama Kiri Wehera, Venerable Kobowaka Dhamminda Thera have been arrested in Pepiliyana.
Police Media Spokesperson SP Ruwan Gunasekara stated that the suspects were arrested by a group of Officers attached to the Tangalle Crimes Division.
The chief incumbent of Kirivehera, Venerable Kobowaka Dhamminda Thera continues to receive treatment at a private hospital in Colombo.
Three armed persons carried out the shooting on 12th night where the chief incumbent sustained injuries to the arm and abdomen.
Another monk who sustained injuries was admitted to Hambantota General Hospital and was later discharged.

heading: Police fire kills one person in Jaffna
content:
One person was killed and 2 policemen were injured when police attempted to control a clash between 2 groups in Tellippalai in Jaffna.
It was revealed that police had opened fire when the people attempted to attack the police team,

heading: Ven. Gnanasara sentenced to rigorous imprisonment
content:
The General Secretary of the Bodu Bala Sena, Ven. Galagodaatte Gnanasara Thera has been sentenced to 1-year rigorous imprisonment to be ended in 6 months by Homagama Magistrate court.

 
The Thera was found guilty for threatening the wife of missing journalist Prageeth Eknaligoda, Sandhya Eknaligoda inside the Homagama Court premises.
 
Homagama Magistrate and Additional District Judge Udesh Ranatunga delivered the verdict.
 
The Thera was imposed a fine of Rs. 3,000 and also ordered the Thera to pay a compensation of Rs. 50,000 to Sandhya Eknaligoda.

heading: Heads of State Institutions should be responsible for paying salaries to excess employees, says Finance Ministry
content:
The government has decided that the Secretaries to Ministries, Heads of Departments, Chairpersons, executive officers and Accountants of Government Institutions should take the responsibility of paying salaries to redundant workers they have employed in addition to the approved Cadre.In a media statement, the Ministry said, "At the same time, the Cabinet has also decided that making relevant statutorypayments in time such as contributions to Employees Provident Fund and Employees Trust Fund of state corporations, statutory boards and government-owned companies is also the responsibility of the heads of such institutions".It added that the Cabinet has taken these decisions when the Report of the Final Quarter of the State Sector Employees – 2017 was submitted by Finance and Media Minister Mangala Samaraweera recently.It is reported that there are over 7500 personnel employed in various government institutions above the Cadre positions approved by the Management Services Department of the Treasury.It has been computed that there are currently 1,375,499 public servants employed in the entire state sector including government ministries, departments, provincial councils, and local government institutions as well as other public enterprises, government-owned institutions, and state banks at the end of 2017.During the year 2017 alone, 23,224 persons have been recruited to state service. At the same time, 5,000 servants have retired from the services and another 246 servants have been dismissed on various disciplinary actions during the same time.It was also revealed that there are a large number of vacancies at senior executive level positions of the state sector. The Director General of Management Services Department stated that the main reason for this situation is that there is a limited number of officers who have completed the required number of years in service to be eligible for promotions.There are 74,872 approved positions for development officers service in the state sector and, nearly 18,000 positions out of them are currently vacant. 
However, the Director General of the Management Service Department further said that it was observed during staff review meetings that development officers attached to certain institutions are not assigned on a particular subject or are not given a specific job of work.

heading: New Deputy Ministers assume duties
content:
Newly appointed Deputy Ministers Nalin Bandara and Ajith Mannapperuma assumed office today (Jun 14).
 
President Maithripala Sirisena also attended the occasion.

heading: Two Youths steal Rs. 8 million from ATMs
content:
Police have arrested 2 youths from Negombo for fraudulently drawing Rs. 8 million from ATM machines.
They had stolen money from ATMs in Negombo and Ja Ela and police arrested them following a thorough investigation.
They were arrested in Kurana last evening, and police recovered Rs. 2.8 million from them.
A motorbike, purchased by the 26-year-old youths, using the stolen money was seized.

heading: Special "Balaya" programme today
content:
A special "Balaya" political discussion will be telecast by Hiru TV today (Jun 14) which will discuss the 20th amendment moved in Parliament by the Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna.
The programme will be featured by JVP Propaganda Secretary MP Vijitha Herath and General Secretary of the Pivithuru Hela Urumaya, MP Udaya Gammanpila.
It will start at 10.30 pm.

heading: Showery condition to enhance
content:
The Met Department says that the showery condition in the South-Western part of the island is expected to slightly enhance.
 
Showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central and North-western provinces and Galle and Matara districts.
 
Fairly heavy falls about 50mm can be expected at some places in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central and North-western provinces.
 
Showers or thundershowers may occur at few places in the Batticaloa and Ampara districts after 2 pm.
 
Fairly strong gusty winds up to 40-50 kmph can be expected in North-Central province and in Puttalam, Matale, Monaragala and Hambantota districts.

heading: Postal strike continues
content:
The Joint Postal Workers' Union says that they have decided to continue their strike.
 
They said that the decision was taken as the authorities are not paying attention to address their issues.
 
It is reported that more than 1.3 million letters and parcels have piled up at the Central Mail Exchange and other post offices in the country.
 
The postal workers began their strike on 11th of this month.
 
Meanwhile, the members of Sri Lanka Administrative Services Union have taken sick leave as a mark of protest against government's failure to pay an agreed allowance to them.

heading: A mother and infant die in Nugawela accident
content:
Motorbike collides with bus”A 24-year-old mother and her little daughter died when the motorcycle she was traveling on collided with a bus at Nugawela in Kandy at around 7.50 this morning.
Our correspondent said that their motorcycle had first collided with another motorcycle from behind throwing the victims to the other side of the road.
Then an oncoming private bus had run over them.Police said that the husband was in a critical condition.The small girl was 2 years and 3 months old.

heading: Fire in Passara kills 3 of same family
content:
Three women from the same family were killed in a fire that broke out in a shop in Passara, Mahiyanganaya early morning today (Jun 14).
 
Police said the victims were the mother (62 y), sister (23 y) and aunty (61 y) of the shop owner.
 
Investigations revealed that there was only one door for both entry and exit at the shop.

heading: “Kirivehera Thera is recovering” – hospital sources
content:
The hospital sources say that the chief incumbent of Kirivehera Ven. Kobawaka Dhamminda Thera who was admitted to a private hospital in Colombo with gunshot injuries is now recovering.
 
A hospital spokesperson said that necessary treatments have already been given to the injured Thera.
 
The Thera had received gunshots in his abdomen and a hand.
 
Police have identified the main suspect connected to the shooting as a former custodian of the Mahasen Devalaya, Bopegedara Asela Lakshman Bandara.
 
Police Media Spokesperson SP Ruwan Gunasekera noted that the suspect had fled the area.
 
The Special Task Force has recovered a sword, 2 daggers and 10 live bullets from the suspect’s residence.
 
The Ven. Dhamminda Thera and the resident monk Ven. Veedapola Sobhitha Thera were shot at while coming down from the upper compound to the lower compound of the Kirivehera, last Tuesday night.
 
Three unidentified individuals had fled in a red jeep parked near the Kirivehera, following the shooting.
 
The red colour jeep, with the registration number UP CAG 8531 which was parked in Gaminipura at the main suspect’s residence was found last evening.
 
Police said that the 2 other accomplices have also identified and the probe is underway to arrest the suspects.

heading: National Economic Council convenes
content:
President Maithripala Sirisena has instructed the National Economic Council to take steps to protect the local entrepreneurs.
 
He gave this directive when the NEC met at the Presidential Secretariat last afternoon with President at the chair.
 
The President's Media Unit said that 6 issues encountered by the local business community were discussed here.
 
It was highlighted here as a result of the removal of CESS on imported ceramic sanitary ware, the local industrialists are facing the danger of extinction.
 
Then it was decided to impose an import duty which was similar to the CESS.
 
The President said that the state-owned banks should lend to the local industrialists for concessionary rates in order to improve the domestic manufacturing sector.

heading: PTL owner and CEO further remanded
content:
Perpetual Treasuries’ owner Arjun Aloysius and its CEO Kasun Palisena were further remanded until 5th of July 5.
 
The PTL Chairman Jeffrey Aloysius was also summoned for the next hearing.
 
The case was taken up before Colombo Fort Magistrate, Lanka Jayaratne.

heading: Police identify main suspect in Kirivehera shooting
content: The main suspect in the shooting of Kataragama Kirivehera chief incumbent has been identified as Asela Bandara who worked at Mahasen Devala.

heading: “Group of 16” says ‘they are even prepared to form a new party’
content:
Former Minister Susil Premajayantha says that the majority of the people wish to hand over the country again to former President Mahinda Rajapaksa.
 
The MP said this expressing his views to media at the Colombo High Court premises yesterday (Jun 13).
 
Meanwhile, some members of the “Group of 16” who left the Unity Government recently, held a discussion last afternoon.
 
The discussion was held at the residence of former Deputy Speaker Thilanga Sumathipala.
 
Responding to journalists following the meeting MP S. B. Dissanayake said they are even prepared to form a new party.

heading: Two bodies washed ashore in Punkudithiv, Jaffna
content:
Kayts Police say that two bodies were found from the coast of Punkudithiv, Jaffna yesterday (Jun 13).
 
It is believed that the two men were fishermen from Mannar who were reported missing since last week.
 
The relatives had identified the bodies.

heading: Ven. Gnanasara to be sentenced today
content:
The Homagama Magistrate will sentence the General Secretary of the Bodu Bala Sena, Ven. Galagodaatte Gnanasara Thera today.
 
He was found guilty of making death threats to the wife of missing journalist Prageeth Eknaligoda, Sandhya Eknaligoda inside the Homagama Magistrate Court.
 
The Thera was found guilty after a lengthy hearing and the Magistrate fixed the date of today (Jun 14) for sentencing.

heading: CID finds more evidence to prove Senasinghe received money from PTL
content:
The Attorney General’s Department informed Court today that it has received another proof to confirm that State Minister Sujeewa Senasinghe has accepted 3 million rupees from a subsidiary that belonged to Arjun Aloysius, W.M. Mendis company.
The CID submitted a brief of the evidence provided by the Election Campaign Manager Senasinghe, Amal Ravindranath before the court today (Jun 21).
Two of the security guards of Senasinghe who were interrogated by the CID had provided details of the Election Campaign Manager.
Meanwhile, Perpetual Treasuries owner, Arjun Aloysius and his CEO, Kasun Palisena were further remanded until 5th of July, when the case on the Central Bank bond scam was taken up before Colombo Fort Magistrate.
In addition, the Magistrate ordered Arjun Aloysius’s father, Jeffrey Aloysius to appear before the court on that day.
Earlier, the court ordered Jeffrey Aloysius to provide the pin number of the company secret data store to the CID but he had defied doing so as yet.
The Attorney General's Department further informed the court that company’s former Technical Executive Sachithra Madushanka Devatantri knows the pin number to access the secret data store.
Accordingly, Magistrate Lanka Jayarathna ordered Jeffrey Aloysius to release necessary data to the CID from June 25 to July 6th through the technical executive.
The Senior Solicitor General, Haripriya Jayasundara informed Court that an extensive investigation is underway to ascertain how the ill-gotten money has been circulated by Perpetual Treasuries Company.
He further said that necessary information from 31 banks has already been gathered and the progress of the investigations would be informed to court soon.

heading: Two die in Aranayake, falling into cesspit
content:
A 70-year-old person and another 34-year-old person have died after falling into a cesspit in Arama Heenna at Aranayake.
 
The incident had occurred at around 9.30 am today (Jun 21).
 
According to police, the elderly person had fallen into a cesspit nearby his house and then a neighbour had attempted to rescue him.
 
In the process, he too had fallen into the pit and died.
 
Bodies are kept at Aranayake Hospital.

heading: Professionals seek Presidential Commission to probe Singapore-Lanka FTA
content:
The National Front of Professionals says that they are planning to request President Maithripala Sirisena to appoint a Commission to probe the Singapore-Sri Lanka Free Trade Agreement.
 
The Chairman of the Front and the President of the Government Medical Officers’ Association, Dr. Anuruddha Padeniya said this in Kandy after responding to questions posed by the journalists this morning (Jun 21).
 
Dr. Padeniya called on the chief prelate of the Asgiri Chapter, Ven. Warakagoda Sri Gnanarathana Thera to make the Thera aware of the issue.

heading: A message to households in Colombo City limits
content:
Water supply to the Colombo City limits will be on low pressure for 12 hours from 12 noon on Saturday.
The National Water Supply and Drainage Board says the pressure will be lowered due to repairs.

heading: Talks fail, postal strike continues
content:
The postal trade unions say they will continue their strike action as the talks with the Minister of Posts were unsuccessful.
 
Meanwhile, the Post Master General says that the postal workers who continue to engage in strike action will only receive the salary calculating for the period from 1st to June to 11th of June.

heading: Protests curtail traffic in Sooriyawewa
content:
Traffic halted on Sooriyawewa - Hambantota 100ft road from Sooriyawewa town due to two protests.
 
The protests are conducted by the area residents.
 
They alleged that the authorities are delaying the payment of compensation for their lands acquired for the extension/expansion of the road stretch.

heading: 14 LTTE supporters barred from entering to Sri Lanka
content: A Gazette notification has been issued barring the entry of 14 Tamil persons who are allegedly connected to the LTTE.

heading: Leopard attack injures 10 persons in Kilinochchi (Photos)
content:
10 persons had sustained injuries when a leopard attacked them in Ambalkulam in Kilinochchi today (Jun 21).
 
Thereafter, the residents of the area caught the animal and killed it.
 
Recently, the villagers had informed the wildlife officials of leopard attacks.
 
Although an operation was launched to catch it, they could not trace the leopard.
 
The injured persons were admitted to Kilinochchi Hospital.

heading: Development restricted to signboards, MP Amunugama says
content:
Parliamentarian Dilum Amunugama says the present government's development programme is restricted to signboards.
 
He said this addressing the media in Colombo today (Jun 21).
 
Meanwhile, the National Freedom Front said the names of the COPE members who obtained money from Arjun Aloysius will be exposed in near future.
 
The NFF MP Jayantha Samaraweera said this addressing the media in Colombo.

heading: Postal strikers gather near Parliament
content:
Minister Posts, M.H.A Haleem requested the striking postal employees to return to their places of employment as steps have been taken to have the demands put forward by them are addressed.
 
He made this request in response to MP Dallas Alahapperuma’s query in Parliament today (Jun 21).
 
The postal workers have launched their strike 11 days ago.
 
Meanwhile, Assistant Director of the Office for Elder Persons P.D.R. Kulatunga said steps have been taken to have monthly grants paid to the elders in the community via district and divisional secretariats.
 
Treasurer of the All Ceylon postal and Telegram Union, Rohitha Jayasinghe said that the discussion with the Ministry Secretary was unsuccessful and therefore they decided to continue their trade union action.

heading: Main suspect in Kirivehera shooting in Colombo
content:
It has been revealed that the main suspect in the shooting of the chief incumbent of Kataragama Kirivehera, Venerable Kobowaka Dhamminda Thera, is in hiding in Colombo.
The suspect has been identified as Bopegedara Asela Lakshman Bandara who is a former custodian of Mahesen Devala.
A senior officer at the Police Special Task Force stated that the suspect, who had previously been in hiding in several areas, is currently in Colombo.
The senior officer also stated that it will be possible to arrest the suspect soon.
Meanwhile, the chief incumbent of Kirivehera, Venerable Kobowaka Dhamminda Thera continues to receive treatment at a private hospital in Colombo.
Three armed persons carried out the shooting on 12th night where the chief incumbent sustained injuries to the arm and the abdomen.
Another monk who was present at the scene and sustained injuries was admitted to Hambantota General Hospital and was later discharged.

heading: Boat tragedy : Body of missing foreign woman found
content:
The body of the foreign woman who had drowned in the Mahaweli River in Gohagoda, Katugastota, has found.
 
Our correspondent said that the body was found from a caving nearby the 'Seemamalakaya' in Gannoruwa.
 
The 24-year-old woman was reported missing after a boat carrying a group of foreigners capsized in the Mahaweli River last afternoon (Jun 20).
 
The tourists were from Saudi Arabia and Qatar.
 
The area residents rescued 6 others after the boat was capsized.

heading: More letters and parcels piling up, strike continues
content:
The Joint Postal Trade Union Front says that they would be continuing their strike until they get a proper response from the authorities.
The Convenor of the Front Chinthaka Bandara said that no discussion had been offered by authorities to resolve the matter.The postal workers began this strike on 11th of this month.

heading: Baby elephant rescued from agri-well
content:
A baby elephant that has fallen into an unprotected agri-well in Nikawewa, Horowpathana was rescued by wildlife officials and area residents this morning (Jun 21).
 
The baby elephant was aged around 1 and 1/2 years.

heading: Exam candidates urged to apply for NIC's without delay
content:
The Department of Registration of Persons is requesting the candidates for this year's A/L and O/L examinations to apply for national identity cards without delay.
 
Issuing a communique, the Commissioner-General Viyani Gunatilleke said that the department has only received 60% of applications so far this year.
 
He also said certain applications are full of mistakes as those candidates had not referred the relevant circular properly when filling the applications.

heading: Rajarata University closed until further notice
content:
The administration of Rajarata University has decided to close down the university indefinitely.
Vice-Chancellor, Professor Ranjith  Wijewardhana said that this step was taken as a group of Rajarata University Students forcefully entered the administration building last evening and occupied it.
Thereafter, the administration has decided to ask the undergraduates to leave the university before 10 am today (Jun 22).

heading: President says dictatorship will not be allowed
content:
President Maithripala Sirisena stresses that he will not allow dictatorship and autocracy to resurface in the country.
 
He said that the people of Sri Lanka contributed to a change in 8th of January in 2015, as the country's administration was leaning towards a dictatorship.
 
The President added that although the people who have forgotten the past are talking about of a dictatorship, he would not allow the aspirations of the January 8th change to be diminished.
 
The President said this addressing an event held in Nikawaratiya today (Jun 21).

heading: Boat tragedy : Search underway to find missing foreign woman
content:
Search operations are underway to find the foreign woman who had drowned in the Mahaweli River in Gohagoda, Katugastota.
 
A woman is reported missing after the boat a group of foreigners was onboard capsized in the Mahaweli River last afternoon (Jun 20).
 
The tourists were from Saudi Arabia and Qatar.
 
The missing woman was aged 24 and the area residents rescued 6 others.

heading: VAT charged from private hospitals to be removed
content:
Finance Minister Mangala Samaraweera says that the Value Added Tax imposed on private hospitals will be removed next week.
The Minister said it will be done as a part of extending concessions to the public.
Minister Mangala said this addressing an event in Matara which was held to distribute compensation to the people who were affected by floods in 2017.

heading: Former President’s message to SLFP
content:
Former President, Mahinda Rajapaksa says that the Sri Lanka Freedom Party should take an urgent decision to quit the current government.
 
Addressing the media in Kandy, he said that discussions between the two factions could be held thereafter.
 
Meanwhile, Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna member and former Minister, Basil Rajapaksa said that he is committed to pressurize the government to hold provincial council election.

heading: Kirivehera Thera shot at while having police protection ?
content:
Police Media spokesman, SP, Ruwan Gunesekera said that investigations have been initiated to ascertain how Kirivehera Chief incumbent Ven. Kobawaka Dhamminda Thera was shot at while he was under police protection.
Addressing a media conference held in Colombo, SP Gunasekera further said a separate investigation will be carried out on that.
Meanwhile, hospital sources stated that the chief incumbent of Kirivehera, Ven. Dhamminda Thera is recovering from gunshot injuries.

heading: Kirivehera shooting suspects remanded
content:
All seven suspects who were arrested over the shooting of Kataragama Kirivehera chief incumbent Ven. Kobawaka Dhamminda Thera were further remanded till 4th of July.
 
The suspects were produced before Tissamaharama Magistrate today (Jun 20).

heading: Woman drowns in Welikanda (Photos)
content:
A 38-year-old had died in Welikanda, Polonnaruwa, after drowning in a canal this morning (Jun 16).
The victim was W. A. Nalika.
She had left the home this morning to have a bath in a canal, which was nearby her house.
However, she had drowned in it.
The inquest has revealed that the reason for her death was drowning.

heading: A statement from prison on Ven. Gnanasara
content:
Prisons Media Spokesperson, Thushara Upuldeniya says that Venerable Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thera has been provided with the clothing normally given to prisoners.
He said this addressing a media briefing in Colombo today (Jun 16).
However, Chief Incumbent of Pepiliyana Sunethra Devi Pirivena, Professor Medagoda Abayathissa Thera convening a media briefing in Colombo noted that Gnanasara Thera is facing a risk of losing his ordainment.
Meanwhile, the Bodu Bala Sena and Sinhala Ravaya made a plea to gods at the Seenigama Devala against the imprisonment of Venerable Galagoda Aththe Gnanasaara Thera.

heading: Provincial Council election in December
content:
Co-Cabinet Spokesperson, Minister Rajitha Senaratne says that the steps are being taken to conduct the Provincial Council Election in December under the preferential vote system.
 
The Minister said this at the weekly Cabinet media briefing in response to a question posed by a journalist.

heading: Medical students to fight against transfer of SAITM students to KDU
content:
Government Medical Students' Action Committee says they will take actions against the Kotelawala Defence University (Special Provisions) Bill which was passed in Parliament yesterday (Jun 20).
 
It allows the KDU to absorb 980 SAITM medical students into their fold.
 
The Government Medical Students' Action Committee staged a silent protest at the Parliament roundabout against the move yesterday.

heading: Strong winds and showers predicted
content:
Met Department says that showers or thundershowers will occur in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central and North-western provinces and Galle and Matara districts, particularly in the morning.
 
Fairly heavy falls about 50mm can be expected at some places in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central, and North-Western provinces.
 
Showers or thundershowers may occur at few places in the Batticaloa and Ampara districts after 2 pm.
 
Fairly strong gusty winds up to 40-50 kmph can be expected in North-Central province and in Monaragala, Jaffna, Mannar and Hambantota districts.

heading: Parliament’s deed presented to Speaker
content: Minister of Lands and Parliamentary Affairs, Gayantha Karunatilake has handed over the deed of Parliament, confirming the ownership to the Speaker Karu Jayasuriya.

heading: Bill to transfer SAITM medical students to KDU passed
content: The draft bill to integrate SAITM medical students to the Kotelawala Defence University has been passed in parliament with amendments.

heading: 1st Special High Court to hear corruption cases to be set up next month
content:
State Minister Ajith P. Perera says that the first proposed special high court to hear cases of corruption and fraud would be established in the second week of July.
 
The State Minister made this announcement to media at the conclusion of a function held in Panadura yesterday (Jun 20).

heading: Gnanasara Thera refuses to meet certain visitors
content:
The Bodu Bala Sena General Secretary, Ven. Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thera has filed an appeal requesting to annul his rigorous imprisonment and acquit him from all charges.
His lawyers stated that the appeal was handed over to Homagama Magistrate Court to be forwarded to Homagama High Court.
The Thera was sentenced to 6 months rigorous imprisonment yesterday for threatening the wife of a missing journalist, Prageeth Eknaligoda, Sandhya Eknaligoda.
Meanwhile, Prison Media Spokesperson, Thushara Upuldeniya said that Ven. Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thera rejected to see some of his visitors to Welikada prison today (Jun 15).
Among them were Iththekande Saddhathissa Thera, MPs Dayasiri Jayasekera, and Jayantha Samaraweera.

heading: Deputy principal arrested for trying to molest schoolgirls
content: A Deputy Principal who had attempted to molest few girls in the Galenbindunu Wewa area has been arrested and remanded till the 18th of this month.Police stated that the Deputy Principal had attempted to abuse 3 Grade 5 students and a Grade 13 student.The suspect was arrested after the parents had made a complaint of his unexpected acts.The 29-year-old suspect is a resident of Mihintale.

heading: Chinese woman arrested for theft
content:
Police have arrested a 25-year-old Chinese woman for stealing Rs. 168,000 and foreign currencies from another Chinese woman.
 
It was reported that a group of Chinese tourists had come to Sigiriya and those women have stayed in the same hotel room.
 
Then one of those women had complained to the hotel management that her money was stolen.
 
Then police arrested the other women in suspicion.

heading: Muslims of Sri Lanka to celebrate Ramazan tomorrow
content: Muslims of Sri Lanka will celebrate Ramazan festival tomorrow as the new moon has been sighted, Colombo Grand Mosque said.

heading: Showers to enhance from today onward
content:
Met Department says that a slight enhancement in the prevailing showery condition in the south-western part of the island is expected from today (Jun 21).
 
Showers or thundershowers will occur in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central and North-Western provinces and in Galle and Matara districts.
 
Fairly heavy falls above 50 mm can be expected at some places particularly in
Sabaragamuwa and Central provinces.
 
Light showers will occur in the Anuradhapura, Vavuniya and Hambantota districts.
 
Fairly strong gusty winds (up to 40-50 kmph) are likely over Northern, North-Central, North-Western, and Uva provinces and in Matale, Trincomalee and Hambantota districts.

heading: President stops operation to capture Sinharaja elephants
content:
The operation which was launched this morning (Jun 15) to capture the two wild elephants in Sinharaja forest was suspended as the two air force veterinarians were recalled.
Wildlife Minister, Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka said that the two veterinarians were recalled by the President.
Several environment activists earlier disclosed the move by the Wildlife Department to relocate the two elephants from Sinharaja to an elephant detention camp in Horowpatana, will not augur well for those animals.
Later, the President advised Environment Ministry Secretary and Director General of the Wildlife Department to leave the two elephants further in the forest until a proper mechanism is arranged to relocate them.
However, Minister Fonseka while inspecting a house destroyed by wild elephants in Galgamuwa said that the President gave the approval to relocate the two elephants to Horowpatana.
Later, the Minister who inspected a cultivation destroyed by wild elephants in Wetakoluwagama in Galgamuwa said that the operation to capture the two elephants in Sinharaja was suspended after the President had recalled the two air force veterinarians.

heading: US assures Sri Lanka of continued support in HR improvements
content:
US ambassador Atul Keshap assures that despite the US quitting the United Nations Human Rights Council, they will continue to assist and engage with Sri Lanka help it meets its continuing and standing commitments to the international community to advance the cause of reconciliation and lasting peace for all Sri Lankans.
US Ambassador to the United Nations Nikki Haley announced the Trump administration's decision on Tuesday, accusing the UN Human Rights Council of bias against US ally Israel and a failure to hold human rights abusers accountable.

heading: Group of 16 SLFP’ers to support Flower Bud at future elections
content:
Senior Vice President of the SLFP Parliamentarian W. D. J. Senevirathna says that the 16 SLFP MP’s who left the government would contest future parliamentary elections under the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna.
He stated that Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa had assured that they would be given nominations through the Flower Bud.Meanwhile, the Policy Framework of the Group of 16 is to be unveiled at a seminar in Matale today.

heading: Case against Mahindananda to be transferred to another judge
content:
The Court of Appeal today (Jun 20) ruled that the case being heard against former Minister Mahindananda Aluthgamage at the Colombo High Court should be transferred to another judge.
 
The ruling was issued after a petition filed by the defendant was taken up at the Court of Appeal.
 
Justices Kumudini Wickremesinghe and S. Thurairajah heard the petition.
 
The petitioner requested the Court of Appeal in his petition to transfer the case from Colombo High Court Judge Gihan Kulatunga to another judge.
 
In this case, Aluthgamage is accused of purchasing a house in Kinsey Road, Borella spending Rs. 270 million that was allegedly earned fraudulently when he was a minister.

heading: Another first by Hiru TV - Hiru TV gives out a car everyday on Hiru tele perahara (Photos)
content:
Hiru is celebrating its 20th anniversary this year.
To coincide with this unique occasion, Hiru TV is offering 20 brand new cars worth over Rs. 50 million to its loyal viewers.
The car, Mahindra “REVAe20” is worth over Rs 2.5 million and by watching Hiru TV’s teledramas from 7.30pm to 9.55pm, a car will be given every day to its viewers.
For more details, watch Hiru TV.

heading: Two students drown in sea
content:
A search operation is underway after 2 schoolboys were reported missing while they were bathing in the sea in Porathota, Ettukala in Kochchikade.
 
The students were from a school in Kochchikade.
 
It was reported that 5 grade 11 students had gone to the beach at around 11.30 am and 4 of them had ventured into the sea to have a bath.
 
They had drowned and the onlookers were able to rescue 2 of them and admit them to Negombo General Hospital.
 
The other 2 are still missing.

heading: Bike accident kills one person in Padukka
content:
A motorcyclist was killed in an accident occurred at Angampitiya in Padukka at around 7 pm yesterday (Jun 20).
It was reported that the bike had hit a stationary lorry.
The victim had died after being admitted to Padukka Hospital.
He was aged 42 and was a resident of Bope, Padukka.

heading: President says Ramazan carries a message of peace
content:
Muslims in Sri Lanka would celebrate Ramazan festival today (Jun 16) as the new moon has been sighted.
Meanwhile, President Maithripala Sirisena in a message issued in view of Ramazan said that the salvation and betterment of the human being could only be attained in an environment of good thoughts where moral values are strengthened.
He added, "It is the noble message of giving priority for peace conveyed to humanity by Islam devotees when they celebrate Ramazan after observing fast for a month, and making sacrifices".
Meanwhile, Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe in his Ramazan message said that this is an important religious festival celebrated by Muslims across the globe to mark equality, purity, and devotion.
This period of fasting functions as a means of reassessment for Muslims, as they strive to lead a life of cooperation and compassion with spiritual purity, the PM said.

heading: BBS to make a plea in Seenigama
content:
The Bodu Bala Sena is scheduled to make a plea to gods at the Seenigama Devala this evening over the imprisonment of Venerable Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thera.
 
The General Secretary of Sinhala Ravaya, Venerable Magalkande Sudaththa Thera stated that laymen of Bodu Bala Sena have organized the plea to gods.Meanwhile, Sinhala Ravaya Organization is scheduled to meet the chief prelates of Asgiri, Malwathu and Ramagngna chapters regarding the imprisonment of Venerable Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thera.

heading: Police misfire injures suspected drug smuggler
content: A drug smuggling suspect travelling in a bus injured by police misfire and another arrested along with him at Badiwewa in Polonnaruwa.The injured person is being treated at Polonnaruwa under police protection.Police have checked the bus after they were off of the two heroin smugglers travelling in the bus which was plying from Colombo to Kaduruwela.

heading: STF launch island-wide raids to arrest underworld members
content:
The Police Special Task Force has commenced a special operation to apprehend underworld members who have left Colombo to other areas.
Previously, operations were carried out in Western and Southern provinces to arrest underworld members whereas, from today, it is reported that STF officers will be deployed for operations covering the whole island.

heading: Fisherman reported missing in Chilaw Sea
content:
A fisherman is reported missing after having fallen into the sea in Chilaw early this morning (Jun 20).
 
The victim was aged 46 and was a resident of Sandunwatte in Ambakandawila, Chilaw.
 
He had fallen into the sea while sailing with another person onboard a boat and police said it has been difficult to carry out search operations due to the roughness of the sea.

heading: Gnanasara Thera's lawyers submit appeal
content:
The lawyers of Venerable Galagoda Atte Gnanasara Thera have filed an appeal to be forwarded to High Court requesting the Thera to be acquitted and released.
 
The General Secretary of the Bodu Bala Sena was sentenced yesterday (Jun 14) for threatening the wife of missing journalist Prageeth Eknaligoda, Sandhya Eknaligoda at the Homagama Court premises on 25th of January in 2016.
 
The Thera was sentenced to a one-year rigorous imprisonment, to be ended in 6 months.
 
The Homagama Magistrate also imposed a fine of Rs. 3,000 on the Thera and also ordered to pay Rs. 50,000 to the aggrieved party.Meanwhile, the Sihala Ravaya has made a request from President Maithripala Sirisena to extend the general pardon to Galagoda Atte Gnanasara Thera.

heading: New Competent Authority appointed to South Eastern University
content:
Professor Uma Kumaraswamy has been appointed the Competent Authority of the South Eastern University to replace the Vice Chancellor.
 
The Minister of Higher Education, Dr. Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe had made the appointment yesterday (Jun 20), using the powers vested in him.
 
The appointment has been made after the administration had failed to address the university's issues.

heading: Samurdhi officer remanded for obtaining a bribe
content:
The officers of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption have arrested a Samurdhi officer for soliciting a bribe of Rs. 2,000.
 
He was from Kolonna, Ratnapura.
 
The suspect had demanded the bribe from a Samurdhi recipient, to help him to obtain a loan of Rs. 100,000 from Samudhi Bank.
 
The suspect had first collected Rs. 10,000 and he was arrested yesterday (Jun 14) while collecting Rs. 2,000.
 
He was remanded until 20th of this month after he was produced before Embilipitiya Magistrate.

heading: Drug dealer “Peliyagoda Gihan” arrested
content:
Special Task Force has arrested Gihan Sandaruwan who has been carrying out drug dealing in the Peliyagoda area.
 
The STF found 5 g of heroin and a hand grenade from him at the time of his arrest.
 
It was found that the suspect was the leader of the opposing gang of D. Manju who was killed during a firefight with the STF recently.
 
Gihan is also the brother of the murdered Peliyagoda Urban Councillor Shaymal Sandaruwan.

heading: Protest disrupts traffic on Sooriyawewa – Hambantota road
content:
Traffic halted on Sooriyawewa - Hambantota (100ft) road due to a protest near Sooriyawewa Divisional Secretariat.
 
The protestors say they haven't been compensated for the acquisition of lands to extend the 100ft road.They said that the authorities have been dragging on this issue for the last five years, giving various promises.

heading: Residents oppose Chinese factory to be set up in Mundalama
content:
Plans are underway to establish a ceramic factory in Mundalama, which will use the coal dust emitted from Norochcholai Coal Plant as a raw material.
 
However, area residents are opposing this move.
 
They say that the factory would be set up in a highly crowded area, which will threaten their lives.
 
The coal power plant is situated about 100 metres from the shore close to Narakkalli and Penaiyadi on the Kalpititya peninsula in the Puttalam District.

heading: Hiru celebrates 20th year anniversary, listeners to be awarded
content:
Sri Lanka's premier radio channel Hiru FM is celebrating the 20th anniversary this year.
 
In line with that, the committed Hiru listeners will get a chance to win Rs. 35 million worth 20 trucks of "Mahindra SUPRO".
 
Hiru will give away one truck each for 20 weeks for loyal listeners.
 
Each truck is worth than Rs. 1.75 million.
 
More details could be known by listening to FM 96.1 and FM 96.3.

heading: Maharagama UC convenes under police protection
content:
The Maharagama Urban Council has convened today (Jun 20) for the first time after 6 Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna councillors were taken oaths.
 
Our correspondent said a special police protection has been given for the session.

heading: Airmail service badly hit by postal strike
content:
The striking postal workers warn that there is a risk that the airmail services might be collapsed as a result of the ongoing strike action.
 
The Times of Oman newspaper reported that freight and postal services from Oman to Sri Lanka have been suspended.
 
The postal strike began 10 days ago, and now the postal workers have launched a continuous sit-in protest in front of the Central Mail Exchange, Colombo today.
 
Meanwhile, Postmaster General, Rohana Abeyrathna told that he is prepared to carry out talks if the workers call off the strike and return for duty.
 
However, Joint Postal Trade Union Front’s convener Chinthaka Bandara said that his union is not ready to call off the strike and discuss the issue if authorities are not willing to meet their demands.

heading: Medical students launch a protest at Parliament roundabout
content:
A traffic congestion is building up in and around parliament round-about as a result of a protest being carried out by the medical students.
 
They are protesting against the government's move to transfer SAITM students to the Kotelawala Defence University.

heading: Rs. 257,000 robbed in Athurugiriya
content:
Two persons on a motorcycle had robbed Rs. 257,000 from an employee of a finance firm, while he was collecting loan installments.
The employee was riding a motorcycle and he was stopped by two robbers at Wijaya Mawatha in Athurugiriya, before fleeing with the money.
